Parking was cheap and we felt safe leaving our car in the park long lot. The hotel is located in the middle of Angels stadium and the Honda center. If you are lucky with your room, you might be able to see the fireworks from Angels stadium or even Disneyland. (We were not so lucky).  The breakfast was nice, they had a hot, cooked to order breakfast with fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal and bagels. Coffee, milk and juice, of course, were included. We did not visit the pool but it looked very nice.  Our room was nice, nothing special, but try e added sink in the room was a nice touch. The bathroom nice with a tall shower head. Being 6'4" this is

Absolutely wonderful service, fantastic breakfast, great location. Very friendly staff. I definitely would stay at this hotel again.I‚Äôve stayed at lot of hotels this past summer and this one has surpassed them all.

We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Everything was great from the check in to check out. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel property was clean and in a safe location. The room was clean and updated. This hotel offers a complimentary breakfast which contains eggs, potatoes, meat (bacon or sausage depends on the day) and pancakes. There was a variety of juice, tea and coffees as well as cereal, fruit and pastries. This hotel is located close to Disneyland. We will definitely stay here again.

Ayres Hotel was great, the room was clean and had a lot of amenities in the room that I didn‚Äôt expect like a kitchenette, split bathroom where the vanity was separate from the toilet/ shower so it made it easier for us to get ready in the morning. Breakfast was included too! Tasted great and was made fresh every morning. Overall I‚Äôd definitely recommend Ayres and will be staying again next time we visit Disneyland!

Summary Heading: GREAT hotel perfect for a concert/event stay
Summary: We really enjoyed our short stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim, and would definitely stay at an Ayres Hotel again.  The room was comfortable and clean, the employees friendly and helpful, and we loved the pool and jacuzzi.  The nice breakfast was a bonus! The only issue we had was trying to get out of the parking lot, which was partly our fault; we couldn't find the little paper.   The location of the hotel is literally across the street from the Honda Center, and less than 10 minutes from the Outlet Mall (used to be the Block of Orange).

best place to stay for the money , comfortable beds, good food very nice employees and clean, make sure you book through the hotel a lot of times it is cheaper and or they will give you a better rate ,this place is awesome

Overall we had a good stay, we did an early check in, the check in clerk was friendly but seemed to get agitated easily when asked some questions, (one of the reasons for the four stars and not five overall) we did the Disneyland package and we were trying to figure out the art shuttle service to Disneyland, it is not real hard but takes a few minutes to figure out and we did have questions.   The room was very clean, a bit warm when we entered but clean and very comfortable. The water to the sink in the room was turned off, so the in room sink did not work but overall the room was clean and very comfortable.   Breakfast was good, all the basic breakfast items from cereal to bacon and eggs, the person serving was very nice and helpful.  Overall this is a very nice clean hotel, I

Great place to stay, very clean and comfortable. I will keep coming back! very good breakfast and hotel staff were all great! convenient and comfortable for my trip! the rooms were very clean and the staff are always friendly!

Definitely not worth the money i paid, breakfast was horrible ran out of pancakes, moldy muffins, not much food. Room was okay, window had no screen, and only had 1 soap. Only booked this hotel because it was walking distance to the angels stadium. No point in paying parking twice.

We loved everything here. No complaints, breakfast was good, employees were nice and bed was comfortable. Will stay again next year for sure. The only thing I‚Äôd like is more restaurants to chose from that are walking distance.

The front desk staff was awesome!  I needed help with transportation to the airport for a motorized chair and oxygen-using passenger.   Not only did they secure the transportation they took time to notify me that they had made arrangements and then again when the van arrived.  I couldn't have had better service - and all of it with a friendly smile and happy attitude.  It was clear they like where they work and enjoy their job.  Thanks again for a very, very pleasant stay.

We had a wonderful experience at the Ayres Hotel. Checking was a great experience with Mr. Johnson. He assured me that I would be able to check in as soon as a double queen bed room has been cleaned.  And true to his word, it did.  The room and beds were very comfortable.  We would certainly stay here again in the future.

I have no complaints, except I was surprised to see styrofoam being used in the breakfast room. And no chance to recycle in the rooms. BUT, the room was clean, large, quiet; the bed was comfy. Staff was friendly. Location was not so appealing, but very convenient -- and surprisingly quiet, given how close it was to the highway. Didn't hear it at all, and we were on the highway side of the building.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a wedding block. The location is convenient, and a surprise bonus upon arriving is that breakfast is provided daily and the fresh food available changes slightly.  We stayed here with our 4 month old, and they provided us with a pack and play.  We also stayed with our dog, and they have a small designated "dog area" outside. We went outside to check it out- it is not maintained. I mentioned to a hotel staff member soon after that there were no more doggy bags and there was old waste scattered about. We stayed at the hotel for 4 days, and there was never any change.  The parking lot is confusing at first upon arrival, and there is no way to park the car up front since they close the area off, which does make unloading a little more of a hassle.

Summary Heading: great location. friendly service. nice room.
Summary: location of hotel is close to all touristy places. i did not eat breakfast, but my friends did and all liked the food. room is large and clean. staff were friendly. i drive an all electric SUV and there are 3 tesla and one generic outlets for guests located in the self parking lot. in short, you cannot go wrong with booking this hotel.

Wonderful! Will be back. The staff was nice and the service was great when acquired. Me and my family stayed the weekend and they were very welcoming and helpful during the whole stay. Gabby stood out the most, she was pleasant and personable. The rest of the staff was great too but she stood out the most in my opinion. Thank you all!!

The staff at the front desk were excellent. They anticipated our needs, were super helpful and made our stay so enjoyable. Friendly, upbeat staff in the breakfast room as well.  We will stay here again.

The hotel is in  a  very convenient location. Rooms are clean and felt safe. Staff is friendly and helpful. We would stay here again and recommend this hotel to friends and family.  The breakfast buffet,  was good with an option to take it to go.

Clean and reasonably priced hotel. Breakfast is included which is a bonus.    Beware,  hotels in this area all have parking fees and you have to use the hotel key to get in and out.  So don‚Äôt put away your room key.  I am short so I have to get out of the car to do this every time.    After you check out and turn in the room key.  You have to press the buttons and have someone open the gate for you.

The room was great. Breakfast was very good. The biggest surprise was how quiet the room was. We were on the second story right up against the street, but heard hardly any road noise.  Using a key card to access lights took a little getting used to - keep this in mind if you are planning on charging electronics while you are not in the room or at night.  My only issue was with the surrounding area; there weren't many options for getting food available withing walking distance.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It has become my choice when ever I have to go there.  As far as the breakfast buffet, it's great that the hotel has someone "managing" & serving that area. I avoids the mess that us, as guests, always do around the eating area.

We stayed here for a week to go Disneyland. It was close to the park, without being super expensive. It was clean. The breakfast was good. My one complaint was that my 2 year old spilled muffin crumbs on the carpet in our room. I asked for housekeeping to clean it up and they never did. Not a huge deal though. We will still be staying there in the future for every Disneyland trip.

We were very happy with the room cleanliness, size, and amenities. Loved the closeness to Angels stadium which was why we chose there. Good breakfast included with chef present. Check in and out was easy.

service was terrible, dirty room,  they don't clean the room at all  we stay for three days they did not clean our room not evens one time even we call front desk to have them send some one to clean our room or change our bad no one came, at all ( bad hospitality)we have to call three time to get some towels and toilet paper, and we pay $650.00 for three days

The rooms were nice as always, clean and the hotel was very clean, We have stayed at several of your locations in Southern California, and have enjoyed all of them! The only thing we miss lately is the "cooked to order" breakfast's they were always amazing and your chefs were always eager to please! We understand that the circumstances don't allow that and we will live with that, for now, however when this stupid thing is over! We look forward to going back for the Full Grand Treat!!!

This is a very convenient place to stay. It's and easy hotel to access right off the highway, especially great for Disneyland, the Ducks hockey or Angels ball games. The bed and bedding was incredibly comfortable, too, and the breakfast was good.

Summary Heading: Wedding Block with about 14 rooms, about 50 room nights over 3-6 nights.
Summary: Everyone had a pleasant stay. Staff were courteous and friendly; special mention for Deanna (worked with us on the Group booking, including cancelations due to the pandemic, and rebooking, special payment arrangements); and Jason at Reception - he was always patient with Qs, dealt with miscellaneous questions, early check-ins, room extensions, billing / refunds, ... etc. A couple of issues our Guests had were addressed to our satisfaction.  It would have been great if they did linen change on schedule rather than on demand; they did meet our requests though. I hope they upgrade the property to make it even more attractive and cosy.  Will definitely stay at an Ayers Hotel. While the location is at the confluence of 3 roads, it was easy to get in and out. Good value for money.

Hotel was super clean and all of the staff were extremely friendly. Perfect location for attending an event at the City of National Grove Anaheim venue (~10 minute walk). Good amenities in the room. Overall great quality for the price.

Summary Heading: Great location, great breakfast and great value!
Summary: For me the location was perfect. I brought my bike so I was able to hop on the Santa Ana river trail r right in front of the hotel. Also JT Smith's brewery was right next door so I was able to walk over and meet friends for happy hour. If there's either an Angel or a Ducks game it's also a fabulous location because you don't have to worry about parking. Room was immaculate and very comfortable. Just a good value and great location....

I've been staying here for off and on for the past 9 weeks for business, the service and rooms are just incredible. Checking in and out was easy. They even changed my room when I got there to the room type I prefer, since it wasn't available when I originally booked my room. I will definitely be staying there for personal trips as well as future business trips

Had a great stay. Came in to help my daughter move into her home for college. They were great when I needed to add an additional night. And if you mention Chapman College you get great pricing, free parking and a warm breakfast.

Very nice hotel. Rooms and front were Clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Parking was safe and getting the items out of my car at 10 pm with my kids alone I felt safe. Hot Breakfast included and wasn‚Äôt a bag of snacks. Chef for kitchen was very nice.

Location made it an easy commute to visit neighboring colleges as well as places to enjoy such as: Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farms and shopping. The friendly staff and comfortable accommodations were heavenly after our long days out. The free breakfast was a welcome wake up when we were in a rush to head out and didn‚Äôt have time to stop somewhere else to grab a bite.

every thing was great as it has been in past visits. great location, nice hotel.  The room had realy worn out carpet. We have stayed at this hotel for several years when attending hockey or baseball games.  We normally stay in a suite and have never been disapointed. they have a small store for drinks and snacks. walking distance to Angels stadium and just across the street from the Ducks Honda Center.

I had a great stay at this hotel. Everything from booking, to checking in to checking out was easy. Gabi was especially helpful in finding us the best rate for our stay. The room was clean and comfortable.

Hotel lack variety for breakfast. They just have egg sausage and potatoes and a couple cold cereals. So if you‚Äôre staying for multiple nights you well quickly get bored of the breakfast. Other than that the hotel is just fine. Location is good. Need some updating in the bathrooms.

By far the best hotel we have stayed at in SoCal. Easy to get to, next to the Honda Center and train station. Great staff, very accommodating, and always willing to go the extra mile. Breakfast they provided was great each day. Will continue to stay here for work and for getaways.

Summary Heading: Ayers Anaheim is clean and convenient at a good price.
Summary: I have stayed here 3 times and is hasn't disappointed. Close to stadiums, Disney, restaurants, and is easily accessible. Staff is friendly, rooms are clean, plus free breakfast every morning. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for many local attractions.
Summary: Great location for the activities with friends I had plans with.  Really good breakfast.  Great place to stay if you are going to an event scheduled at the Honda Center or at Angel Stadium.  Close to Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland and Old Towne Orange.

Great hotel next to Angels stadium. Easy to get to and close to Disneyland. Quite rooms and very clean. Breakfast cook was great and friendly. Served up a hot meal and tasted good. I would recommend staying here for  the Angels game and the short drive to Disneyland.

You need to inform potential travelers about your $10.00/nightly parking fee that IS NOT INCLUDED In the entire hotel stay. That's unethical business practices and deceiving. When you tell a customer you place $100 deposit that we will get at the end of our stay then only receive half that's not right. I had to call and speak to the manager after I left to get some of the remaining deposit not returned to me. Crappy business practices!  ' hotel was clean, staff nice

We stayed here for 1 night with our 2 teenage kids the day before going to Disneyland.  It was quiet enough, considering that it is close to the freeway and our room was on the freeway side.  It was white noise and we didn't have trouble sleeping.  Parking was $10 in the self-parking lot right next to the hotel.  We decided to drive to Disneyland and pay to park there rather than use the ART shuttle, which would have cost us $6 each for day passes.  The room was clean and comfortable, a good size with a mini fridge and microwave.  The wifi was fine.  The hot breakfast included eggs, hash browns and sausage and they will make you pancakes if you want.  Like other reviewers said, though, some fresh fruit would have been nice.  The staff were all nice and friendly and we were happy

The staff was friendly, helpful, and courteous. The room was spacious, clean, and perfect for our family. The breakfast and breakfast staff were wonderful. The location was convenient to get to our destinations. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Great staff and rooms were large.
Summary: love the area but they really needa shuttle to serv cutomers to disneyland. I would sty there in the future.Great continetal Breakfast.Paid for early check in ,I highly recomend it. Kids enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi,plus the bbq.

We love this hotel!! The staff is always extremely helpful and kind. Every time we take a trip to visit Disneyland we HAVE to stay at the Ayres. There's no other hotel that accommodates us better than the Ayres.

We were going to two Angels games. The location was perfect, in walking distance. We also took an Uber ride to the beach which was not far as well.  The room was clean and beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious!

We stayed here for 3 nights for a Disneyland/Angels trip. *Very* comfy beds, nice size room, great hot breakfast and very friendly staff. The mini fridge, microwave a d seating area were nice. I also enjoyed the gym. The only thing I wish was that it was walking distance to Disneyland.

We were very happy with our stay here.  Clean, friendly, quiet.  Rooms were modern and well equipped. This is THE place to stay if you are going to an Angels game.  In fact, I think we'll stay here next time we visit Disney. Also, you're near local brew pubs and the Packing District.

It was a great stay, clean rooms, good breakfast and nice staff. The only downfall was if there‚Äôs a game going on traffic to get in to the hotel is a little much! But ended stay with fireworks! Would definitely stay again in a heartbeat!

This place will nickel and dime you. They charge you for parking. The water pressure in the shower was awful. Checking in was inconvenient because I had to go out to my car twice. One was to get my license plate number, and the other was to put my parking receipt on my dashboard. There isn‚Äôt a walkway to the accessible portion of the parking lot, so you need to climb over bushes to get there. The bathtub was in need of repair. The comforter on the bed was very hot.
Manager Response: Dear Cody P,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to our parking, bathtub, and bedding throughout your time at our hotel. We strive to provide the most exceptional experiences and are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around. If you are ever facing any issues throughout your stay, please let our team know as we would love to assist you in getting it resolved in a timely manner. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved stay sometime soon.  Sincerely,  Amanda Drost General Manager

Summary: love this hotel chain.  super convenient location next to highway, great restaurants and shopping.   Staff was friendly.  Quiet rooms.     While I was here for vacation and visiting family, the location was convenient that I got a few extra errands done too

I booked a family suite using their Disney Magic package which included breakfast and parking. The hotel and rooms were extremely clean. Front staff had great customer service and the bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in at a hotel. Breakfast was ok. There was bacon and eggs and potatoes. It would've been nice if there was a sign that said what was offered. When I walked up to the breakfast counter the chef asked what I would like and everything was covered up. He seemed a little irritated that he had to explain what was covered up and inside the chafing dishes. I guess there is also pancakes, fruit bowls and cereal but you have to ask specifically for it. It was a hot breakfast so I can't really complain. The pool was little disappointing. We thought it was

Summary Heading: Would do it all over again!
Summary: I can't say enough good things about our stay. Rooms were clean, comfortable, and all necessity at hand. The pool was big enough but not crowded. The breakfast was amazing and had a large selection for my picky eaters even during COVID. The staff was friendly and helpful. It's not close to Disneyland but we felt it was well worth it. Thank you Ayres staff!

We had the best nights sleep and a Fresh cooked hot breakfast in the morning.  JT Schmitz walking distance had excellent food. The Pool is small but it‚Äôs clean. Disneyland is close by.  I will return soon

Love the hotel, the 1st class front desk help lead by Leslie. and Deena. Amanda the manager is the prototype for what a manager should be. Great breakfast. Very clean hotel. Pool and jacuzzi are both open. And easy access to highway. A little drive for some good food. They need more restaurants around the hotel. But overall it's a quality stay üôèüá∫üá∏

Summary Heading: Nice place, good location, $10 parking, free hot breakfast
Summary: I‚Äôve stayed at this hotel twice because of the great value for what you pay. It‚Äôs easy to get in and out of the parking lot and the parking is cheap! The rooms are pretty large (4th floor street facing have partially vaulted ceilings) and have kitchenettes with fridge, microwave, coffee maker, sink and a table with two chairs. The free breakfast was decent with eggs, a breakfast meat, pancakes, and potatoes with cold breakfast options as well.   Cons: My first visit there were people smoking weed and cigarettes in the rooms but the last visit I smelled neither. Also, the toilet paper is the thinnest one-ply known to man so BYOTP! Lastly, if you purchase through Priceline they don‚Äôt add Anaheim tax so you pay more at the hotel (not a ton more but irritating that it‚Äôs more than

Summary Heading: This hotel should be used as the gold standard for other hotels to aspire too.
Summary: This hotel is the best,the staff is accommodating and they really go above and beyond. Even the security was polite and engaging,they really make you feel welcome. Room was spotless and very nice and breakfast was A+ I could go on and on about this hotel but I'm going to tell you that you will be happy you chose this property. They get it right.

great place to stay! very convenient and clean and comfortable hotel, breakfast was great! I've stayed here before and will definitely stay here again! would definitely recommend! staff was very friendly and helpful :)

great hotel and staff! breakfast was great and hotel and room was clean! A+ hotel! I will definitely stay here again! great location and convenient for my trip! there was plenty of restaurants/fast food near hotel.

Wonderful experience! The entire time we were there we were helped with whatever we needed. They helped me get a room next to my mom and they even went above and beyond and helped me coordinate a small mother's day surprise for her. I was so impressed with their amazing customer service!

This was a great hotel with nice, helpful staff. Our King room was clean, spacious, and comfortable. Great location with easy access. Short, safe walk to Angels Stadium. First time stay and very satisfied.

I am recovering from 2 Back surgeries, and this location was perfect for me. Quiet and comfortable. Tub is very deep for those who like to soak and not just take a quick shower.  Complimentary breakfast was an added plus.

Hotel was OK. The hallways smell of old food and garbage. They don't pick up garbage frequently enough. Front staff either rude or ignorant. Almost trying to be too nice in a sickly manner. The pet and parking charges are not listed on Priceline so we won't stay here again. Pets and parking cost us an extra $120 for 3 days! Ridiculous. When discused with front staff they are Rude!
Manager Response: Dear danhalt,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the service you received from our team and our current cleaning schedule. We strive to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests and appreciate your feedback as we can use it as a tool to better improve. Rest assured, we checked the Priceline website and are able to verify that the fees for parking and pets are noted under the Guest Policies section. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an improved stay.   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Definitely stayed in worst hotels, but also stayed in better. However, for the price, I have no complaints! Breakfast was good. Room's were basic, but pretty clean. Fridge had a small leak, but nothing crazy. Trash near the elevators need to be emptied more, but these are all just little nitpicky-things. Overall a positive experience!

We stayed at Ayres Anaheim for our wedding weekend. Deanna helped.me with the reservation and she was great. My parents and in laws and matron of honor stayed there too. The bed was comfy, the room was spacious and it was quiet. They even brought us a champaign toast the night of our wedding.   Our only complaint which we meant to mention when we checked out was that our room had a funky smell. Kind of musty. We couldn't figure ouy where it was coming from but weren't in the room all that much so didn't ateess about it. We had so much going on anyway. Also, none of our guests staying in the hotel  had this issue.  Overall it was a great stay!

Best hotel in the area and I liked that they have a guard walking around at night and a hot breakfast.  The pool and jacuzzi are open again.  But they do have some shady characters that stay here that hang out outside even

Staff was friendly upon arrival and departure. Great location for surrounding amenities. Parking was a little tight even for a midsized car. Only negative was the room had leftover trash from previous guest

Summary Heading: This hotel is housing people on parole.
Summary: I want to first say this hotel isn‚Äôt bad but they are letting people that are just out of prison stay here. I would not stay here with a family or a single female. You will know who they are( face tattoos, a motorcycle gang(vagos) wearing his vest, drug addicts with track marks and I saw a drug deal in the parking lot. Be aware.

Just A Great Experience, would recomend for anyone wanting to receive a special treatment. This Hotel has an amazing location with easy access to Freeways going in every direction makes this Hotel the must stay for all Southern California has to offer.

I enjoyed this stay very much. Very comfortable beds. The room was larger than expected and I was very excited about that. The price was great. I look forward to staying here again. It is very close to Disneyland too.

Hotel room was fine with the exception of a loose toilet seat. We reported it to main desk, along with a request to have room freshened. When we returned late that night, we found that nothing had been done. We were not pleased. That also meant we had no in-room coffee the next morning.   Parking is very tight but we were able to find spots. Lots of traffic noise came through the windows.... Bed was comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear LynneG109,  Thank you for your rating and review! We are pleased to see that you found the bed in our guest room to be comfortable and you had an overall great stay. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have encountered in regards to the surrounding noise and your room getting serviced. We strive to provide exceptional experiences and are disappointed to see that we did not successfully do that for you this time around.   We would love to have the opportunity to welcome you back the next time you're in the area for an improved stay!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: It was a blessing as we ended up at Ayres!!  We are Hilton Honors members and arrived late into town and Hilton could NOT check us in due to audit.  So we ended up at AYRES, and could not have been happier. It was a great checkin and the staff , from front desk to breakfast ( hot delicious breakfast , eggs / bacon/ hash browns, juice , coffee ) to housekeeping all excellent. So focused on friendly & excellent service! This is RARE !  We will always stay here now and we‚Äôre happy to see they now have a location in Carlsbad as well.   And I‚Äôve never really been the type to care about service, just give me a comfortable bed and I‚Äôm good. However , it‚Äôs so great to stay at a hotel that is not only hassle free, extremely clean and very comfortable , the bonus is the friendly ,

With everything going on lately it was a breath of fresh air dealing with any of the employees i bumped into. I wish I would of took down some names but truthfully I would of ran out of paper because they were all great

Summary Heading: Gabi Lanphere & Ayres Hotel offer hospitality and chill vibes
Summary: Stayed a night to catch the Laserface show at the Drive-In and definitely the place to stay was the Ayres. Amazing location for all of the major travel destinations in Anaheim and currently employs Gabi who is just an all-around gem. She was hospitable, charming, and humorous. If there is another reason to come to Anaheim definitely will stay at the Ayres for the service, location, and decent kitchenettes.

Summary Heading: NO PRICE GOUGING FROM AYRES ANAHEIM HOTEL!!!
Summary: HOW TO FIGHT HOTEL PRICE GOUGING: STAY AT THE AYRES HOTEL!!!!! EVACUATED from our HOME twice in 5 weeks due to CA fires!!! Received PRICE GOUGING from our regular HOTELS, who listed rooms under $200 a night, were quoting $499 a night, $799 a night, $1,799 a night (3 hours drive away). We arrived at the AYRES HOTEL, angry... exhausted, cynical. We met Bo at the Front Desk who welcomed us, asked, business or pleasure?  Response:  "We are running from a fire."  Bo said, "We have a room for you at a special rate of $89 a night, a special rate for Fire Evacuations."  AYRES moved to the TOP of our HOTEL list. 5 Five weeks later, we were evacuated.... AGAIN! We called AYRES immediately. PUT AYRES IN YOUR CONTACTS TODAY! You will never know when you will need them, for emergency,

Summary Heading: What a delight to find this treasure!
Summary: I was expecting the normal room and gloom during the COVID-19 but this was such a treasure! The staff was friendly and helpful. I appreciated their kindness and professionalism. The Christmas decorations were wonderful!

Summary Heading: Best hotel I've been in for a good while now
Summary: Well, let's start off by saying that the standard room is a glorified Motel-6. The thing that makes it glorified is that it's way more presentable, has a fridge, microwave and a big screen TV, but if you're looking for size, go to their suite. It's nice. I checked it out before I left. It's only 20 bucks more too, but the guy claims that the king suite is only available directly from them. Anyway, the thing that also makes it better than a Motel-6, or most hotels I've been in anyway, is that it has THE MOST comfortable bed. You can tell the bed underneath the pillowtop is medium firm and the pillowtop makes one feel like they're in Heaven. I love it. Many hotel beds hurt my back from being too hard. Not this one. Also, the extra added bonus is the breakfast. I've stayed in all

Ayres hotel is the best place to go too, Whether for me and my spouse or even just my whole family, Staff at Aryes are very accommodating with awesome, very friendly and kind attitudes/personalities. I have gotten to know the employees since I go every month. They have been very  helpful I‚Äôve never had a place where all employees are the best!! Great breakfast!! Warm pool and ice done BBQ‚Äôs there as well which they provide all utensils to cook.  The Medina‚Äôs

We always stay here and love the people and hospitality.  It's clean and we were served a hot breakfast to take to our rooms!  It has quite a selection of restaurants within 1 mile for a quick bite  It's my go to!

Decided to take a solo trip from Phoenix Arizona. Received a text the day before asking for my room preference and when I checked in, it was ready. The front desk had a recommendation for dinner which was very nice. Not too many people around, very clean and spacious. Highly recommend!

Check in was quick, easy and friendly. Rooms was clean and nice.  Walked across the street to TJ Schmid‚Äôs for dinner and felt safe. Had to leave before  7 am, so not sure how the breakfast was.  But it looked like they were setting up for a nice buffet style breakfast.

I loved the room I had very spacious and best part over the bed the ceiling was raised feeling very homely. The front desk was very helpful with wake up calls and having a couple packages delivered there. Will be returning there.

at 2:30 am the smoke alarm went off after talking to the front desk they offered to send someone @8 lol  I ended up buying a battery and replacing it myself . Maintenance never did show to fix the smoke alarm    kinda unacceptable

The hotel is conveniently located close to Disney and the convention center. The area is nice, clean and we feel safe there. The beds were comfortable and the in room air conditioner was very quiet, so sleep quality was good.  There are many shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel room is clean and spacious. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was scale back due to covid-19, but they still served hot food such as scramble eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, coffee and juices. Overall we have a nice stay and will stay there again in the future.

I enjoyed my little getaway in Anaheim.  From the minute I walked into the lobby (without a reservation) I felt welcome and for a small deposit my dog was also welcome.   There are a few spots around the property set aside for "doggie care" which is a plus for me.  The room was very nice, the AC worked great,  and I felt safe at all times. Thank you -

Summary Heading: Would‚Äôve been a great stay, but...
Summary: We flew in from the East Coast to drop off our oldest for College. The hotel is lovely, the room was nice except the sofa was hard vinyl, which we thought odd. The breakfast was excellent, even though far more limited since COVID than I had experienced last fall at the Ayers Corona. The staff was thoughtful and kind. It was Labor Day weekend.   Really nothing much to complain about. Except, our final night... we stayed 3 nights. We were tired from moving our oldest in to the dorm, and shopping for all the dorm room things needed. Thought we‚Äôd go enjoy the pool/hot tub before turning in. It was packed with people, families, children, which is not a bad thing, but it‚Äôs a very small pool. The water was cloudy due to over chlorination. So rather than trying to find a place to

The room was  very clean, and had in room coffee, refrigerator and the beds were very comfy room size was plenty. I would have liked more cream and sugar packets for the coffee. Very quiet. I really enjoyed the fact that I didn't hear kids running up and down the hall. I would have liked it if the people that stayed and walked through the halls had masks on. They do offer a buffet but they packed up a small breakfast for you to take back to the room and that was nice.

Summary Heading: The Management Of This Hotel Endangered The Life Of My Child!
Summary: The management at this hotel endangered the life of my child, my wife, and myself.    Six automobiles were permitted to block the fire lane directly in front of the hotel--all night and an hour past my check-7out time.  Our automobile was blocked-in--and unable to leave; we were affectively held against-our-will for an hour! My civil liberties were accordingly violated!  THIS is not how you treat customers whom you value!  Ayres Hotel did not take care of me and my family!   If there had been a fire--this circumstance could have cost us our lives!  No manager was on duty when I arrived for check out.  Platitudes and condescension's all around.   The woman with red hair wore a jacket labeled "Gabby" on the lapel but her coworker told me Gabby wasn't in today.   When I asked for a
Manager Response: Dear allanbO4779YE,   Thank you for taking the time to share your candid insight. I would like to extend my most sincere apologies for the inconveniences you experienced. While there‚Äôs no excuse for the lapse in service, our team did their best to remedy the situation given the extreme circumstances between the heatwave and last-minute surge in occupancy. Please be assured, the health and safety of our guests are our top priority. The owners of said vehicles arrived in the early hours of the morning whom our team was actively trying to locate. Once found, fines were imposed for the potential safety hazard and all cars were moved as quickly as possible. Since this incident, we have addressed the security company that oversees our parking to ensure situations like this are handled appropriately.  While we wish you had a much more enjoyable stay, we appreciate your insightful feedback and allowing us the opportunity to serve you.

Summary: From the minute I checked in till I checked out the service was amazing and the Room was beautiful. My family and I had an amazing relaxing staycation at the Ayres in Anaheim. I would like to thank all the staff and the general manager for the great weekend that we had. I will definitely  stay there again.

The rooms were very clean and accommodating.  Love the partition of the sleep area  and living area. The concept of having the room key to activate the lighting in the room is efficient and smart. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Nice quiet place.  We came to Southern California forbSun and the beach.. This Hotel is close enough for all that. Right down the way from Newport Beach and not to far from the California family we have.. Staff was superb. VERY friendly. Breakfast was very good too and coffee is piping hot! If this hotel has room on our next visit, we will definitely stay again!!

My GF and I were in town celebrating her Birthday.  We had dinner at Morton‚Äôs Steak House and were looking for a nice hotel near by.  The Ayres was great, directly across the street from the Honda Center.  The room was very clean and nicely furnished.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  All of the staff was very polite and helpful.  I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are in the Anaheim/Disneyland area.  Greg & Bella. Fontana, CA

Such kind and hospitable associates, upon entering to my departure. The associate who checked me in was the same who checked me out and she remembered details from from the previous day confirming that all was okay. The room was clean and spacious, breakfast (to go) was great. I will be back. Outstanding job!

The Ayres hotel is by far my favorite place to stay, Great service, positive vibes, quiet, clean, and a very convenient location right off the freeway. The manager Allen really knows how to run a hotel. Thank you for the hospitality.

This hotel is wonderful...  the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff really goes above and beyond. The location is very convenient as well for most attractions in Anaheim.  I‚Äôve stayed in several hotels in Anaheim/Orange County over the years but now I will always try to stay here.

Summary Heading: Room is nice, could be better
Summary: The room was nice and comfy. I really liked the book lights attached to the headboard since I like to read before bed. However the stopper to the tub wasn‚Äôt working, but I‚Äôm glad that someone came up to fix it right away. I wish there was a lotion included in the toiletries. Also I was spooked since there was a spider near the window.

Excellent customer service very friendly. Superb House keeping. Beds are super comfy the staff serving the breakfast make it great! Location is ideal. Swimming pool open = kids happy! Property well maintained!

Stay here each trip to Anaheim.  The rooms are always very clean, helpful and friendly staff, easy access to freeway.  Have requested first floor a few times and do not get it.  Breakfast needs more variety.

Great location in between Honda center and Angel stadium. Walking distance from restaurants. Freeway is nearby. Staff was friendly. Rooms were clean with wide, plus big bathrooms! Great stay. Would definitely book again in the near future.

We stayed at the Aryes Anaheim for four nights, while quickly moving our daughter out of her college dorm/apartment at Chapman University May 29th- June 2nd 2020. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay extremely comfortable. Dealing with a pandemic is no easy task, so we were extremely happy to see the measures taken for staff/client safety with face masks and the cleaning procedures we witnessed on a daily basis. The rooms are very comfortable, staff extremely helpful and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to stay in the Anaheim area.

We stayed for 2 nights.  The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.  The front staff was welcoming and very helpful.  This stay is during Coronavirus quarantine, so we were thrilled they were open.  They still offered a hot, free breakfast which we really appreciated.  The chef was super friendly and appreciative that we were there as well.  We would definitely stay here again.

Definitely will be returning definitely a quiet and peaceful get away wonderful food guest service and etc was amazing ice machine coffee fully stocked and etc air conditioning and heater was in good condition the food was amazing and fresh and feeling

Best place ever Excellent service the room was pure paradise clean and beautiful I can‚Äôt wait to come back quiet just beautiful I want to give thanks to all the essential workers They provided all the services that make you want to come back perfect

Excellent customer service at the front desk, the cook was also very friendly and kind. The room was very very clean, the front desk brought extra pillows and towels when we asked. Would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling and staying in the area.

I absolutely loved staying at this hotel - the staff were so incredibly friendly and attentive, the room was spacious and clean and the restaurant is SO good! Stayed here for 4 nights during a trip to Disneyland and it was so nice to be away from the crowds, yet so close to the park. An easy bus ride away from Disney with hardly anyone else on there. Definitely have dinner at Spoons Bar & Grill (located inside the hotel), I'm still dreaming of the day when I can come back for the crispy tacos!

We recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for 4 nights while attending 2 Anaheim ducks games at Honda Center across the street!  We had a king bed suite which was awesome and very roomy!!!  Hotel front desk staff is amazing, was super impressed by the check in and everything!  We managed to get to one of the happy hours and had some nice wine and met some other nice people there.    Only downside we encountered was housekeeping......We didn't get any cleaning or supplies until day 3 and that was because I called and asked the front desk to please arrange it as we had run out of coffee and shampoo and towels etc.....so I was disappointed in that....  Other than the housekeeping, the hotel and staff were fantastic.  The breakfast was really great and the chef was so nice and
Manager Response: Dear leahb,   Thank you for your 5-star rating and review! We are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us while attending games at the Honda Center and you were satisfied with the service you received from our front desk team.   I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you may have experienced in regards to getting supplies replenished and having service done to your room. We strive to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests and wish we were able to successfully to that for you throughout your stay.   We hope to welcome you back the next time you're in the area!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: Very nice and clean hotel and for a great price.   Conveniently located across the street from the Honda center and restaurants.  I would definitely choose this hotel again if I were to stay in the area again
Manager Response: Dear G8524OSmeganl,   Thank you for your 5-star rating and review! We are thrilled you found our hotel to be in a convenient location while attending events at the Honda Center and that you had an overall exceptional stay. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: We stay there for four nights and we‚Äôre totally satisfied.  It was conveniently located the breakfast each day was delicious as well as the happy hour wine and snacks.  I‚Äôd definitely stay there again. The accommodations were very clean as was the entire hotel.

Summary Heading: Need a Really Convenient Hotel When You Visit Disneyland?
Summary: Location convenient for all the local tourist attractions like Disneyland. Excellent restaurant across the street from the hotel.  Their morning free breakfasts are far and above significantly better than most hotels offering free breakfasts.

Summary Heading: Went to the one near San Clemnte
Summary: Bad service and they have 2 hotels building and different in every way and not the good way. One is supreme-clean and a great breakfast-the other building not so much-terrible breakfast and not clean at all

We stayed as a family of four, during a trip to Disneyland. The hotel was clean and staff were friendly. The location to Disney was about 10 to 15 minute drive, but the ART busses were perfect for getting us to and from Disney parks. They pick up right outside of hotel lobby and drop off in front of the bag check area- couldn't have been more convenient! We also really enjoyed the daily breakfast, which included pancakes, hash browns, eggs, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, coffee, juice. We tried to go swimming one evening, but it was too cold and I don't think the pool was heated well enough. Although it would probably be better in the summer. We will definitely come back and would recommend to any families going to Disney.
Manager Response: Dear S8345MUelizabetht,   Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay with us. We are thrilled to see that you and your family had an overall exceptional experience with us while visiting the Disneyland Resort. It is a pleasure to see that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and the service you received from our team. We look forward to welcoming you back sometime soon!   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: The staff and the hotel were so nice.  It made going to the Honda center so enjoyable.  The beds are very comfy and the rooms are huge.  We truly enjoyed staying here and we will continue to stay here when we are in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear katiepC901UG,   Thank you for your stellar rating and review based on your recent stay! We are delighted you found our beds comfortable and our hotel to be in a stellar location for visiting the Honda Center. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you're in the area!   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: This is our second time staying at this hotel, and I don‚Äôt think we will ever choose another hotel in Anaheim. The breakfast every morning is really good and they have options, not just waffles and cereal. The social hour they have during weeknights is great, who doesn‚Äôt like free drinks? The hotel is so so clean and the bathtubs are huge! Perfect for kids, or couples or business.

Summary Heading: Great Experience, Great Location, Great Value, Bring your own Shampoo and Soap
Summary: Stayed 2 nights on a business trip.  Will stay again because it was a very good value, room was more than nice enough, hotel was quiet and location was fantastic.  I enjoyed the breakfast both mornings, happy hour free beer, wine and chips with guac was fantastic.  Really, my only complaint was the soap, and "Conditioning Shampoo" were terrible.  When traveling from Chicago on a 2 days business trip I don't travel with shampoo or a bar of soap.  But if I know I am staying at this hotel I certainly will.

The staff was very friendly, from the easy check-in to the staff serving breakfast.  The room was not awesome, just ok.  The bed was comfy, but the bathroom sink hot water knob was not working correctly, the whole component moved when you tried to turn it.  The mini "kitchen area"  had visible water damage along the paneling.  The big window opened on the 4th floor, though had no screen or any barrier. Very dangerous if you wanted a bit of fresh air.  Breakfast had extremely limited options, very very basic. (though, breakfast staff super nice).    I called down to the front desk once, was left on hold for several minutes, enough so that I hung up and figured they would call my room back when they could, but they never did.  This hotel I am sure was great early on, though it

One of the best things about staying at here is breakfast. The cook remembered me from a prior stay two months ago. Beyond that, I was given a room location that suited my needs as a smoker (a room that was on the ground floor close to a door.)  The staff never failed to greet me when I entered through the main door.

My son and I were going to a hockey game at the Honda Center.  This hotel is across the street.  It is also within walking distance to the train station, the baseball park and restaurants.  Breakfast with a chef is included.  The room was clean and room and spacious.  The bed was very comfortable.

Summary Heading: Great room but be aware what weekend you‚Äôre in town for....
Summary: Checked into this hotel with no problems. Customer service was quick and to the point. Booked a king size room very last minute and it‚Äôs SO roomy! There is a living area with a fridge, microwave, and separate sink (away from bathroom too) in the living area. There‚Äôs a divider from the living area from the bed so it‚Äôs great and private.  MY ONLY PROBLEM, and it doesn‚Äôt have anything to do with the hotel at all, is that I advise everyone to check what weekend they‚Äôre coming into town so you avoid certain crowds and price spikes (I did not do this). I‚Äôm staying when Monster Jam is in town but I‚Äôm here for a quick Disneyland trip. Attached is a photo of a gentleman that made himself at home. I walked out of the hotel to go to dinner and drinks with my husband to see this guy with

We were in town for a couple of days and needed a place that was close to the Freeway and with Eateries closely. The rooms were comfortable and extremely roomy. Plenty of space for a family of 4 to move around conformably. Breakfast was great with a variety of choices. We were a little disappointed that parking was not included in the price of the stay.

Very clean and very modern.  Close to Honda Ctr, Angel Stadium and Disneyland.  The room were clean and spacious.  Nice employees.  Free breakfast buffet was great and chef very friendly. Ample parking and shuttles to nearby events.

We have stayed at this hotel twice and both times have had an enjoyable stay. The rooms are always clean, and beds and pillows are SUPER comfortable. The customer service is great too, you are always greeted with a smile. The breakfast is always fresh and delicious!!! The hotel is also conveniently located and has access to many attractions. This is our Anaheim Hotel of Choice.

Great staff - very helpful and friendly. Social hour is nice. Location is convenient and restaurant within walking distance is good. Rooms are quiet and clean. Good WiFi and breakfast. Would definitely stay here again.

We had the best experience at the ‚ÄúAyers Hotel‚Äù of Anaheim CA. The staff was friendly and welcoming, the hotel was beautiful, clean and comfortable. The Hotel manager welcomed us and made us feel at home and was very accommodating for our entire stay. I would highly recommend this Ayers Hotel to everyone. I give a perfect 10 and a two thumbs up.   Hats off to Allen the general manger for training his employees the correct way.   Sincerely  Robert A.Velasco Sanger CA

The hotel was great! the service was wonderful and the breakfast was wonderful to!!  The only problem I had was the bed wasnt flat??  It had a dent in it like if you sleep on your mattress on one spot it gets a dent well this one was like that!!  Time for new mattresses for sure!!  I didnt have problems sleeping though by the time we were made it back from our day at Disneyland to tired to really care!! It was comfortable except for that!  The bathroom and bathtub and shower were great and very big!! We will definitely stay again!!
Manager Response: Dear Jet23948,   Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review based on your recent experience with us! We are thrilled you had an overall exceptional stay and you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast. We look forward to welcoming you back the next time you're in the area.   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location if you're in town to see Disney and some hockey!
Summary: Very very clean hotel, easy to find just off the 57 if you're coming down from LA. I stayed here mainly because I was going to a few hockey games at Honda Centre and this is located directly opposite. Check-in was relatively quick and we were given a deluxe queen room which we didn't complain about after we had only requested a standard queen. Rooms were spacious and clean. Although room service wasn't available, Ayres did provide menus for JT Schmids which was opposite and you could call directly from your room and they would call your room back when your food was ready for collection so this was a nice alternative to a room service provided directly through the hotel. Basic breakfast included with the room fee, each morning the breakfast hall was packed with guests, but not to
Manager Response: Dear Decj0791,   Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are thrilled you found our hotel to be the perfect place to stay while attending events at the Honda Center and visiting the Disneyland Resort. We strive to provide exceptional experiences for our valued guests and pleased to see that we have successfully done that for you. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future!   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: Having stayed at the perfect Diamond Bar Ayres Suites last year, we had high hopes for this one. The price was good for the area which is what caught our attention plus the benefits of being close to Disneyland and breakfast included.   Check in was quick and pleasant. The room was as expected, but not as good as the Ayres Diamond Bar. It was large but a bit dusty round the corners and a few hairs could be seen around the room and bathroom. The AC was too noisy to use at night and we had 1 night where the room above us decided to shout and sing till 3am. The toilet blocked 3 times during our week, the flush just didnt work properly. The shower sometimes took 10 minutes to get warm, such a waste of water!   The one thing that did bug us is that the front desk staff did not once
Manager Response: Dear rich210uk,   Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review. We are pleased to see that you have chosen to continue staying within our collection and you had an overall great time with us. Your feedback on our guestrooms and the service you experienced is appreciated as we are always open to hearing of ways in which we can better improve for our valued guests. We will use this as a learning tool to better improve for the future as we strive to provide the best stays. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright  General Manager

Summary: Due to I5 closure, from a 5 1/2 hr trip it became a 12 hr trip.  I called and informed Ayres Hotel about our delay and they were very understanding. When we finally arrived Ayres Hotel attended us quickly, staff was very friendly and helpful at around 3:30am. We stayed for 3 days 4 nights and everything about the Hotel was great! The breakfast was on point (I have a family of 5 and everybody was satisfied) and the ART shuttle bus was always about 5min away when leaving to Disney.  We didn‚Äôt have to wait long which was very nice (the hotel informs you how to txt a num so u can find out what time another bus will arrive). Housekeeping was great, felt nice to come back to a clean room after being at the parks all day. I have no complaints.  We will definitely stay here again. Hope

stayed in the hotel on Saturday and sunday,,room very clean and service very good...breakfast room is nice and clean good food...room very clean..clean sheets and clean bed...no issues to report..frendly staff and great facility..thank you for great service...

Place was in a great location, room was great EXCEPT that it loses a star for the heating/AC unit that wouldn't shut off, until I unplugged it. Breakfast was fantastic. Parking was ample. Close to everything. All in all a great place to stay. üòä

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for Disneyland visit, every time.
Summary: Our 3rd time staying at Ayres Anaheim and was yet again a great choice. The problem with many hotels closer to Disneyland is that they are crowded, noisy and far more expensive - some of them still not even being walking distance and they are nowhere near as nice as Ayres for the price you pay. We enjoy staying at Ayres because it's not far from Disneyland via ART shuttle or Uber, while being away from the hustle and bustle. A peaceful and cosy hotel, comfortable and spacious rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Some tips for travellers - request a room facing away from the freeway. Also request top floor if you are very sensitive to overhead noise. I've never experienced it though as we always request top floor facing away from the freeway and our requests are met. Note that the

The food is very good and tasty. The beds are cozy and warm. Room service is very fast and good. The also give out free cookies at four o'clock. The people are friendly and nice. The pool is clean and they provide towels.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel to stay at if going to Hockey Game at Honda Center or even Disneyland
Summary: We were going to be in LA a couple of days before catching our cruise ship so decided to stay in Anaheim and go to a hockey game.  The location of this hotel is great - right across the street from the Honda Centre.  Our room had a King size bed, sofa and table and chairs.  It is an older hotel but clean and nice decor.  The hotel includes breakfast.  They have a nice big breakfast room.  Staff were pleasant and helpful.  We met a couple that stay here every year and go to Disneyland.  There is a shuttle and will take you there for a cost.  Cheaper to stay here than at Disneyland Hotels.

Room was modern and large. Outlets in all the right places. Clean and sanitary. Pleasant staff. Easy to be comfortable. Well insulated walls so even if there are any ignorant, rude, and obnoxious guests you won't hear them or their garbage TV shows.

Great hotel! We stay every time we go to Disney and catch the ART to Disney! It‚Äôs a great benefit to have the fridge with little ones! Rooms are spacious and clean. Breakfast has lots of options! Some of the breakfast staff will make Mickey pancakes if you ask! However; some don‚Äôt know how to make the Mickey pancakes, which I was really hoping they would make for this last trip. Would be nice if they would train all their cooks to make them as its a special treat to get excited for before seeing the big mouse himself!   You can catch the ART to Disney right off the hotel lobby! The ART is so convenient and a quick ride and it‚Äôs never too full!

We had the pleasure to enjoy two nights at this hotel, the hotel has nice big sized rooms, very friendly and helpful staff, extremely comfy beds and is very clean.  They offer complementary breakfast everyday to all guests which is a plus and was pretty decent with a nice selection.   Definitely worth staying at this family run hotel as the tick all the boxes.
Manager Response: Dear JIHAD40,  Thank you for your kind rating and review! We are pleased to see that you found our team members to be helpful and that you had an overall comfortable stay. If you are ever in the area again, we hope to be able to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: We went to Disneyland for a week during Halloween with a toddler and a seven year old. We had originally booked a hotel across from Disneyland. However, a friend suggested the Ayres boutique chain after staying at the Ayres Orange a week prior. We hesitantly cancelled our hotel and decided to stay at the Ayres Anaheim Hotel. The Ayres hotel costs hundreds less, and breakfast was included - which justified the risk.  So here is my impression. The hotel staff was accommodating and friendly right from the moment we walked into the lobby. Our room was very large and clean. During our stay the staff was constantly bustling about cleaning and touching up the hotel to keep it in pristine condition. The lobby had offerings throughout the week that included; cookies, happy hour beverages

It was a clean and friendly place. The few things I didn‚Äôt like was one, that you had to haul your own suitcases from the car to your room. Two, the chef at the all you can eat complimentary breakfast was friendly but made unnecessary comments about how people were not waking up early enough to eat breakfast. I mean people are on vacation and even if they get to breakfast at 10 min to 10am, he should comply with the guest request and do his job and serve. Not complain.
Manager Response: Dear venzugrl77,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay. We are pleased you found our team members friendly and you had an overall great experience. I would like to extend my sincere apology for any inconvenience you encountered with getting luggage to your room and interactions with our team at breakfast. We strive to provide our valued guests with exceptional experiences and will use your feedback as a tool to better improve. We hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Still a nice and personable place to stay
Summary: This was our second time back here since 2013. We brought our 10yr old granddaughter with us this time. We chose here again because we enjoyed our last trip. Close to Disneyland and 10min on the ART bus that comes direct to the hotel. Not a big style resort or hotel and the better for it. Ayres Anaheim is as we mostly remembered it. Very friendly and helpful staff from the front desk, thanks Leslie, Christian and others. To the room staff and not least the breakfast staff. Jose, we still think you guys make the best pancakes and it hasn‚Äôt changed. The one and only thing that changed for us was the $10 per day parking. It was free last time. Didn‚Äôt like it but get why you‚Äôre doing it.   Otherwise I still recommend Ayres Anaheim for a more personable touch.   Thanks again.
Manager Response: Dear 647brianl,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see that we were able to welcome you back to stay with us and that you had an overall exceptional experience. It's delightful to see that you were happy with the service you received from Leslie, Christina, Jose, and the rest of the team as we strive to provide the best experiences for all of our valued guests. We hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: room was comfortable.  breakfast was above average.  staff was wonderful.  this was a last minute reservation and the hotel couldn't have been more accommodating.  parking was easy and access to stuff we needed was perfect.
Manager Response: Dear beckfamilyof5,  Thank you for your 5-star rating and review! We are pleased you had a comfortable stay and found our team members to be wonderful. It was a pleasure to welcome you for your last minute stay and we hope to see you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Wonderful. Outstanding. What suite sweet! Just unbelievable! I‚Äôll be staying more frequently! Oh - and Kraz at the desk was a great gentleman! 3 layers on the curtains - total darkness. Quiet, comfortable, relaxing and a HUGE tub!

My husband and I came with our 2 grown daughters and my grand daughter. The hotel staff was so accommodating. I would like to say the chef at breakfast was very friendly and nice. I work in food service myself so I try to clean up after myself, some of the guests just left the dirty dishes on the table like a restaurant and maybe that is the norm but I didnt feel right about doing that so my family cleared their own plates. Ok, done with my rant... the beds were very comfortable and I slept great, I like the idea af the energy saving light card. We were thankful to have a small fridge and microwave. The pool was clean and soaked in the hot tub a couple times. Great trip together would highly recommend

Stayed at Ayres Hotel a week ago. The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was plentiful and offered a variety, Mr. Llamas the assistant manager was personable and welcoming. Despite the hotel being located off a busy street/intersection we did not hear traffic nor encounter any issues during travel.

Summary Heading: Stay here. The people and management are exceptional.
Summary: I have never had a more enjoyable and pleasant hotel experience. We stayed here for 3 weeks involving a medical trip to CHOC hospital involving our son. The staff here was exceptional. I repeat exceptional. From room attendants to front decks, to GM the quality of the service was on different and truly authentic level. I would simply say this, I would not stay anywhere else given the option.

Nice hotel. Great room. Huge tub. Breakast food was just okay. Eggs were terrible. Fruit was overripe. Smaller selection than some hotels. Front desk staff were super nice. This hotel was the farthest I've ever stayed from Disneyland, but there is an ART shuttle.  Appreciated the shuttle to car rental place. Thanks! Most annoying this is how do you say this hotel's name- everyone says it different. Not sure where I actually stayed name wise- üòÜ.

Only stayed one night but was happy with the room (big, comfy king bed, nice pillows, seating area). Hotel location was is convenient to Honda Center and Angels Stadium (walking distance) and short drive to Disney. Parking charge was a little annoying but not too expensive ($11) compared to other hotels. Room price was good for the area.
Manager Response: Dear Anne G,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent experience! We are thrilled to know that you found our guestrooms to be spacious and our hotel to be in a great location. We hope to welcome you back sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice place at a reasonable price
Summary: I stayed one night at Ayres for business.  Check-in was easy.  It is not a place for beautiful views, but the room was spacious and very clean.  The linens and towels seemed to be of high quality.  The shower was large.  There was plenty of desk space to work and plenty of plugs.  The bed was comfortable as well.    Breakfast was also tasty, with a broad range of choices and friendly staff and a clean layout.  I had to iron a shirt, and the board was solid with a decent iron.  I booked this on booking.com and I felt I got a great price.
Manager Response: Dear J P,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you found our guestrooms to be spacious and that you had an overall comfortable experience. If you are ever in the area again, it would be a pleasure to welcome you back for another great stay!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: The room was awesome, very clean, comfy beds and plenty of hot water no matter what time of the day! The staff was helpful and answered all our questions and made sure our stay was wonderful. The only thing I would change is scrambled eggs, not so runny, although the chef was soooo friendly and made amazing pancakes. We are already planning our next Disney trip and Ayres will be the hotel we stay at...this time with several families! Thanks again!
Manager Response: Dear disneyfreaky,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see you were satisfied with the exceptional service you received from our team and that you enjoyed the fresh pancakes made by our chef at breakfast. We hope to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Our recent stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim was excellent.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The location to the Honda Center was perfect!  The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable.  The breakfast was freshly prepared and very good. I highly recommend this hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Wicked1970,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay with us. We are pleased to see that you found our hotel to be in the perfect location while visiting the Honda Center and you had an overall comfortable stay. It is a pleasure to be chosen as your new favorite hotel and we look forward to welcoming you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: The hotel was super close to all of the places were were interested to visit in Anaheim. The room was clean, the shower was huge with great water pressure (helps wash out the shampoo when you have long hair) and the staff was friendly. Parking was easy and the fresh hot pancake breakfast was a pleasant surprise.  One thing that should be addressed was the elephant in the room, while guests were waiting in line for their rooms. The line got long, many rooms weren't ready and nobody behind the desk, addressed it with the guests. I can only assume, the hotel should know of current events in the area, bringing large crowds, and should schedule the staff, accordingly.   All in all, we would definitely stay here again!!!

I had my 45th class reunion across the street; My friend and I got in early, they told us it would take a few minutes to check; Now keep in mind that the Honda Center that is also across the street was having a huge concert. Within 10 minutes we got a text saying the status of the room;. they had some. The line move's real fast, and what I liked is that if you wanted to set while you got checked in the seating was so nice everything was nice would stay in that Hotel again. Rooms with a huge TV that works; I felt like a lot of care went into cleaning the rooms; it had a personal touch.

This Ayers is across the street from the Honda Center and a few miles away from Disneyland. I understand that shuttle service is available. There are many restaurants within walking distance and a movie theater too. No too mention that they also have a free full breakfast and wifi.
Manager Response: Dear Joseph K,  Thank you for your 5-star rating and review! We are pleased you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and found our hotel to be in a stellar location. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: We were in Anaheim for a concert at the Honda center, and live a couple hours away so we knew we wouldn‚Äôt want to fight traffic and drive home after the show. The location of this hotel is AMAZING, since it is right across the street from the Honda Center, as well as close to other attractions. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating from check-in to checkout. I was surprised when we got into the room, I wasn‚Äôt expecting it to be so fancy! I booked a what I was thinking was a basic room, but exceeded my expectations! It was incredibly clean and felt home-y. The beds were so comfortable, I had no problem going right to sleep and sleeping a full night. The room also had a mini fridge, which is a HUGE plus for me since I‚Äôm diabetic and usually have to make routine trips

Went to the Jonas Brothers concert and stayed at the Ayres Hotel across the street.  It worked out great.  The room and check in went smoothly.  The room was clean and comfortable.   I'm 18 and thought there might be a problem with my age, but everything went great.   I'd definately recommend, especially if you are seeing a concert at the Honda Center.
Manager Response: Dear tircle2,  Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review based on your recent stay! We are pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay with us while attending a concert at the Honda Center. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres is all about your stay experience!!
Summary: I have been a long standing regular patron of the Ayres in Anaheim!  My stays are always business as a guest and as such I depend on an atmosphere that allows me the opportunity rest and recharge between shows.  Checkin/out is ALWAYS smooth and the staff are always courteous!  Rooms are cleaned with great attention to detail and MOST OF ALL the beds are very comfortable.  I also value the secure parking!!  Just as simple as that.
Manager Response: Dear Jurgen S,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your experiences with us at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim! We are thrilled to see that each of your stays has been exceptional and that you were able to get the ample rest you needed. It has been a pleasure to provide you with remarkable stays and we look forward to welcoming you again!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Not a Marriott? Not a problem!
Summary: I do a lot of traveling and I stay at many Marriotts and their sub-brands. I love the Marriott chain, and I was somewhat reluctant to stay at the Ayres Suites. Not because I had any negative impressions, but only because it wasn‚Äôt a Marriott. We were traveling with a few couples for a high school reunion and someone in the group picked this property. I had reservations at the Westin South Coast Plaza (Marriott property) for free, but my wife really wanted to stay with the group, so I ended spending $210 for my one night weekend stay. And it was worth every penny! Nice big room. Extraordinarily clean. Fantastic mattress and bedding. Even the breakfast was really good! Well done Ayres!
Manager Response: Dear CaliKlines,  Thank you for taking the time to write a thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you enjoyed your first visit to an Ayres Hotel and that you had an extraordinary experience. We strive to provide our valued guests with exceptional experiences and hope to be able to welcome you back for another stellar stay sometime soon!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Love this boutique hotel! The rooms are spacious, sparkling clean and very comfortable. The free breakfast is served to perfection with a friendly smile by Jose.  Bo welcomed us back to the hotel every night after a busy day at Disneyland. Whenever I stay there, I always find myself referring to the hotel as "home" - because that's the way the staff makes you feel.  The only negative is that the prices have increased quite a bit since I first visited in 2015.

Love this hotel! The rooms are always sparkling clean, fresh and very comfortable. The morning breakfast is served to perfection with a friendly smile by Jose. Bo welcomes you back to the hotel after a day at Disneyland. When I stay there, I find myself referring to the hotel as "home" - because that's the way the staff makes you feel.

The hotel was great! Perfect location for event at Honda Center. Staff was kind, friendly and helpful. Room was clean. Enjoyed amenities: the breakfast and jacuzzi. As Tesla owner it was nice to know they had a Tesla charger on premises.
Manager Response: Dear mrsjharts,  Thank you for your kind rating and review! We are thrilled to see you found our hotel to be in a stellar location while attending events at the Honda Center and that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: My stay was very nice. The room was clean and the staff was nice and professional. Extremely convenient being located across the street from the Honda center. I will definitely stay there again in the future.
Manager Response: Dear jodigarris,  Thank you for your stellar rating and review based on your recent stay. We are pleased you found our hotel to be in a convenient location while attending an event at the Honda Center and that you had an overall great experience. We look forward to welcoming you back in the near future!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Going to Honda Center, be sure to stay here!!
Summary: Great Hotel just walking distance from Honda Center! Nice friendly Staff, clean rooms, nice pool and gym! Rooms are well appointed with comfortable beds, microwave, refrigerator, large screen tv and safe. Free Hot Breakfast served every morning and ending at 9:30AM. Parking is just $10 a night, so if you are going to Honda Center you can just walk across the street and save the parking fee and the parking hassle.
Manager Response: Dear ronbR7652TH,  Thank you for taking the time to rate and review your recent stay! We are delighted to see that you found our hotel to be a stellar place to stay while attending events at the Honda Center. If you are ever in the area again, we would love to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Very clean hotel.  Great free breakfast, hot eggs, bacon, hash browns and pancakes. Beds and pillows are comfy.  If you are heading to a Ducks or Angels game, it's perfect.  Walk to game.  Nice restaurant / bar next door.
Manager Response: Dear lbracing88,  Thank you for your thoughtful review based on your recent stay! We are delighted that you enjoyed our complimentary breakfast and found our hotel to be in the perfect location while visiting the area for a Ducks or Angels Game. We hope to welcome you back for another comfortable stay the next time you're in the area.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: This was our second time staying at the Ayres. The suite we had was very nice. We always enjoy the hot cooked breakfast, the 2 chefs that manned the station were AWESOME and always very friendly! Our room was spacious and comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear JPS1116,  Thank you for taking the time to write a kind review! We are thrilled to see that you have returned to stay with us and that you've enjoyed our complimentary breakfast time and time again.
