It was a pleasure providing you with the exceptional service you deserve. Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: Really enjoyed our one night stay here. Drove up from San Diego to see a a comedian at City National Grove (less than a 15 minute walk). The staff was super friendly and accommodating. We had a room on the top floor...so it had a raised ceiling making it feel like a loft. Big room, very comfortable, nicely furnished and the window even opened all the way! Last but not least...the bed was absolutely wonderful!  Front desk said they get a lot of comments on their beds.  Must find out the make and model...!
Manager Response: Dear ChicoBaldo,  Thank you so much for writing a review of our hotel. I am ecstatic to see that you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim. We strive to provide an exceptional guest experience and I am happy to see that we did just that during your stay. Your compliments regarding our optimal location, attentive team, and comfortable accommodations are greatly appreciated. I hope you choose to stay with us next time you are in Anaheim.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect location, welcoming staff and clean Hotel.
Summary: I was warmly welcomed at the front desk and check-in was made easy. Parking is also a breeze while getting to the location for the first time. I was gifted a complimentary goodies bag that had popcorn and two water bottles because I had booked with my Expedia Rewards points. The room itself was very spacious and clean. Safe, fridge, mulitples plugs, TV were all part of the amenities of the room. I also got a complimentary breakfast, it was tasty. Eggs, diced potatoes and sausage. There are also a wide vareity of fruit selections, as well as bread. Overall, I truly enjoyed my stay, as I was there for a networking event taking place at Angel Stadium, which was a 10 minute walk from the hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Hovifi,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review informing others of your recent stay. Providing an exceptional guest experience is our top priority and I am thrilled we were able to do just that during your stay. The compliments you have shared regarding our accommodations, premium amenities, and our attentive service are greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Well run hotel, great team members, amazing location!
Summary: We stayed with family in 3 rooms to go to a show at the Honda Center. This is the best-located hotel to the center, literally just across the street! I stayed here a few times and always very pleased with the way the place is run. Great team and very helpful. Check in was fast and the rooms are neat and clean. Always a great stay.
Manager Response: Dear eltooth1,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you for the feedback you have provided and for choosing Ayres Hotels time and time again. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: From the kind and efficient reception to the spacious, comfortable, clean room to the tasty complimentary breakfast; this place delivers.  My only suggestion for improvement would be to replace the disposable cups in the room with real mugs, cups, wineglasses(?) I look forward to returning when I am in the area next.
Manager Response: Dear sudaki2016,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim. We truly appreciate your compliments regarding our attentive team members, comfortable accommodations, and premium amenities. The concerns and the suggestions you have shared are greatly appreciated and I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Hotel We‚Äôve Ever Stayed At!
Summary: We stayed here over Labor Day Weekend. Let me just say, everything about this hotel exceeded our expectations. From the friendly Front Desk staff to the beautiful decor. Our room was very clean and spacious. We definitely recommend everyone to stay at this beautiful hotel. Whether you‚Äôre  attending an event at the Honda Center or just in the area visiting. The Ayres Hotel will out do any hotel you‚Äôve ever stayed at. We will definitely be returning here next time we need a hotel in Anaheim.
Manager Response: Dear Alessandra G,  Thank you for the fantastic review of our hotel! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your time with us and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members, comfortable accommodations, and cleanliness. Your recommendations regarding our hotel are greatly appreciated and I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: Second time stay and still great!
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and it's great to see that everything is the same. Customer service is great and the rooms are clean and spacious. Laundry in hotel is very handy. Great location with the ART bus stopping right at the hotel, you can take this to Disneyland. Train station also within walking distance. We also walked to Century Cinemas, less than 15 minutes walk. Few food options around, but not a lot. Wifi is free and good. We love the breakfast buffet and the chef is great. Only downside is that staff were not able to give us a proper schedule for the ART bus, we ended up waiting an hour for the bus. Overall, we had a good stay.
Manager Response: Dear Kraz2013,  Thank you kindly for your amazing rating and review of our hotel! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your time at Ayres Hotel Anaheim. We strive to provide an exceptional guest experience and I am proud to see that we did just that during your stay. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members, comfortable accommodations, and our premium amenities.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The room was great and the complimentary breakfast was better than most others. The front desk staff was always friendly. They treated us as if they had known us for years.

Summary Heading: Parking was Awful, Breakfast was available, First room was awful!
Summary: We have stayed at a number of Ayres hotels so I thought I would give this location a try. Because it is across from the Stadiums (Honda Center and Angels Stadium) the parking situation is awful. the parking lot is smaller than many locations and the spots are closer together. Also, the parking lot and the Port-coch√É¬®re at the front entrance have toll gates. So not only do they charge $10 a day for parking, you can't even unload in the front of the hotel because of the tool gates and signage that state "Buses Only".  Regarding breakfast. Usually, Ayres has the best breakfast, but for some reason, they decided to wax the floors on the weekend and close the kitchen. I thought it may have been a better idea to do that type of work mid-week when it is less busy. Because if this they

We booked through one of the common travel sights, which usually means you get a room on the first floor.  Guess what?  That's what happened again.  However, the staff at the front desk offered a room on the top floor without us having to beg for it! For those of you with a child and book the suite with the hopes of a door between the bedroom and the rest of the room, forget it.   There will be no adult time!!  It's all open. I only gave 4 stars instead of 5 because the fold out had no sheets on it, and our carpet had a candy wrapper in the middle of it, making us wonder how often it gets vacuumed.

Great location, especially if you are attending an event at the Honda Center! Rooms were clean, check in was fast and easy. Price was good! Food within walking distance too. I will definitely stay there again!

We spent our time at Ayers while going to see a show at the Honda Center. Nice, close, easy walk. Great servicr, friendly staff. Felt very safe and secure. Comfortable room and amenities. Will deffinately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Clean room with great amenities, friendly staff, close to Honda Center
Summary: Our room was clean and had a fridge/microwave, which was great. The breakfast in the morning was well served and all of staff were friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. The pool area was simple but well kept. The location near Honda Center was a plus.

I appreciate the Ayres culture and properties. The staff is always happy, helpful and positive. The Anaheim property is in need of better attention, probably due to the location. I suspect the visitors may be attendees of the local sports/concert venues. The rooms appear more dirty and worn than the other properties we visit. A better job can be done in the bathrooms especially. I still prefer Ayres over the other national hotel brands.

My wife and I were looking for a hotel in Anaheim that had a pool, continental breakfast, and was fairly inexpensive. The Ayres hotel was a perfect fit! We arrived unexpectedly early in the morning at 9am and they immediately sent someone to prepare a room for us while we had enjoyed their breakfast.  The breakfast was delicious every morning and the chef was very friendly. The outdoor pool and hot tub were the perfect size and weren't busy or crowded. The room was fairly large for the price we paid. There was a very cheap shuttle that took us to and from Disneyland every day which I would highly recommend.  Instead of spending 20 minutes parking and another 40 getting to the actual park, we were just dropped right at the front gate.  It was a huge game changer. We also had to

This is a really great hotel in Anaheim. The staff are really friendly and helpful and our is spotlessly clean. The rooms are very spacious. The bed and pillows are really comfortable. The breakfast is very nice with a really good choice of hot and cold food. The hotel has parking facilities at a cost of $10 per day. We have stayed in many Ayres Hotels and the service has always been excellent. The Ayres Anaheim is no different. Would definitely stay here again!

This is probably or sixth time staying at Ayres Anaheim. We love it here. This hotel is very near Disneyland but not next to Disneyland, which we like. It is quiet, charm, nice and clean. All personnel is nice, especially Andrew(front desk).

Stayed for 2 x nights to visit Disneyland. We wish we had stayed here for our whole LA trip instead of moving on to West Hollywood. Staff were so incredibly nice and helpful. Handy to restaurant/bar across the road that served tasty good value meals. Transport to Disneyland, although not close, was easy on low cost shuttle bus or a cheap uber fare under $10. Rooms were large and very clean. Would stay here again without a doubt üòÄ

I came here to visit my 17th different ballpark.  When I called about shuttles I was told within 3 miles.  When I got there, now NO to ballpark and Disney.  Luckily the park was only about a 5-7 min walk.  When I checked in the man behind the counter was great at finding me transportation to Newport beach.  I was upgraded to a suite.  Huge area in the room. My problem was that my tablet would not connect to wifi and nobody there could help me.  Also the clock in the room was impossible to figure out to put on the correct time.  The breakfast was great.  They have a grill to cook eggs, pancakes, sausage, and chunk potatoes.  They also had bread, cereal, fruit and bev.

Great hotel- clean and super comfy with daily bus 15 on route to Disneyland. Good free breakfast with cooked and continental choices as well !!!! Definitely coming back on our return to DisneylandüòÅ. Polite and helpful staff

We had not previously stayed at this hotel. I would definitely stay there again. It was clean, the staff was courteous and helpful, and the bed/room were comfortable. The fitness room has some basic equipment. It was also very clean. All in all, a nice hotel.

Summary Heading: Great stay for concert at the Honda Center!
Summary: Our stay at Ayers was incredible. Great attentiveness by the staff. The room was very nice and comfortable. The best thing is that it was literally across the street from the Honda Center and some restaurants which made my concert and stay experience great! Will definitely stay again!

Spent two nights at another hotel/motel and did not sleep a wink. Upon arrival to the Ayres Hotel the grounds were clean, lobby was inviting and the front desk staff was friendly and welcoming.  The room was clean and very comfortable, RELIEVED! Close to shopping, eateries, and major freeways for travel. Complimentary breakfast was decent. Will definitely stay here again and again!

The front desk staff were extremely courteous and friendly. They were attentive and made us laugh during our check in. Same goes with rest of the hotel crew; the chef at the breakfast bar was welcoming and made my morning. The rooms are spacious and well kept. They even have a small happy hour from 5:30 pm - 6:30 pm!! It was so awesome!

I was in town last week for a small getaway with my husband and I must say that this hotel stay exceeded my expectations! For starters we were greeted by a gentleman named Anthony and he went above and beyond to make sure that our check-in process went smoothly. My husband has a bad back and really shouldn't be carrying any luggage so Anthony personally delivered our bags to our room and he was just a delightful gentleman. Our room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the hotel is close to everything. Will definitely be back!

This is the second time we‚Äôve stayed here. We absolutely love it because the staff is so amazing.  I did not encounter one person who wasn‚Äôt top notch. They were all so nice and accommodating. The rooms are standard. The pillows are soft. The breakfast is great. Eggs, bacon, sausage, Mickey Mouse pancakes, bagels, etc. there is a shuttle that takes you do Disneyland for $5 something a person round trip. We found that it was an easy Uber ride. We will keep choosing Ayres Anaheim because of their excellent staff and customer service.

Hi we are one night into a three night stay after being on the road for three weeks. I don‚Äôt normally write reviews but feel the warmth and hospitality that has been shown so far warrants it. When we first checked in we were welcomed by Jordan whom went above and beyond his duties. He not only engaged with our children warmly as they had there own room he gladly explained all the benefits of the area and offered to download any relevant directions and maps of the area. It is employees like Jordan that make a good hotel GREAT..... PS the nightly happy hour is also a winner

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel at a good price
Summary: Nice room, good service. Can walk to Anaheim Angels ballpark. Nice pool and hot tub. We also enjoyed a full buffet breakfast which was included in the room cost. Parking was easy and secure. We visited Downtown Disney which was not far.

We stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for four nights. We had stayed at Ayres Moreno Valley so we were pretty sure this hotel wouldn't disappoint - and it didn't. We enjoyed our stay. What made our stay most enjoyable was the staff - especially Anthony and Jordan at the reservation and reception desk. They were professional and friendly and made us feel glad to be there. My husband and I spent several hours in the lobby working at a huge work table they had (lots of outlets - and big comfy chairs) and as we worked we couldn't help notice how great these guys were - how nicely they treated everyone. Whoever hires staff for this hotel is doing an excellent job.  While we were there we took in an Angels game. The Angels stadium is a 7-minute walk (ask for best walking directions at the

Ayers' hotels are always spotless, the cleanest rooms consistently. The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) shuttle to Disneyland was perfect for multiple trips back and forth to the theme parks. Someone in our party lost their cell phone on a shuttle and after asking a driver about this he was able to locate it and was delivered to us in 15 minutes.  The happy hour M-F at the hotel is a very nice touch too!!

This is a perfect mid-price hotel in an ideal location for events. The front desk staff were professional and polite. My room was comfortable, clean and bright. There are a number of dining options in the area. A great stay!

Summary Heading: Great Location for Honda Center Events
Summary: Visited for a second year to attend Brad Paisley concert! The Honda Center is right across the street, couldn‚Äôt be easier. JT Schmid‚Äôs restaurant is across the street also for dinner before or after your concert. Lots of other restaurants are nearby. Hotel room is comfortable, nice pool area and nice free breakfast. Ideal location for Disneyland/California Adventure as well. Thank you for another great stay!

Summary Heading: I will absolutely stay here again!
Summary: The hotel room was perfect. I even had plenty of space for my morning yoga practicesüòä That hasn't been the case in a lot of places I've stayed. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. No question where I'm staying when I return!

Not fancy, but this hotel hits on all points.  The house staff is really friendly.  Good breakfast in the morning with bacon, eggs, etc.  The ART bus stops right in front of the  hotel.  Very clean, very quiet, comfy beds.

We had a very pleasant and relaxing experience with Ayres Hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. The beds are very comfortable too. Their free breakfast is yummy.  Kudos also to the  staff who are very helpful when we asked about the shuttle to Knots Berry Farm. We would definitely stay here again on our next visit.

After our 5th visit in 2012 I reviewed this hotel (see link at the end of this review), then again in 2017.  We recently completed our 8th visit this July and we are still extremely happy with this hotel, the perfect place for our family trip to Disneyland.  We miss Marcus, now that he has moved on, but the new manager, Allen, treated us very well and seems to fit in with the Ayres team.  I'll also mention that Anthony at the front desk was very friendly, courteous, and helpful.  The icing on the cake is always Jose, the friendly chef in the kitchen who makes awesome breakfasts for us every visit (still the best hotel breakfast we've had), having served us for 11 years now.  Once again, clearly a lot of effort is put into keeping this hotel clean and up-to-date.  I will continue

5 stars for your staff. Very helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was great. We stayed for 5 nights and loved everything about it. The bus up to Disneyland is so handy and the kids just loved the pool. Would definitely recommend.

Great place to stay for Angel games, easy walk to stadium and save on parking. Staff was awesome and helpful, room was very clean, and breakfast was top notch. Could not have has asked for an better place.

Friendly Staff, shuttle bus to Disneyland (10-12 minute ride), and clean rooms. Free breakfast which is quite decent and super close to Anaheim Ducks Arena (It's across the street from the Hotel!   Would stay again!

I would just like to recommend Ayres Hotel in Anaheim. They were all do helpful and friendly, especially Jordan at the front desk. He was always extra courteous and took a personal interest in us! He went out of his way to help us out. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: A beautiful hotel on the ART route
Summary: This hotel was beautiful! It was clean and had everything that my mum and I needed. The staff were incredibly helpful and made sure we had a parking spot when we told them we had rented a car. The hotel is on the ART route - Anaheim Resort Transport - and got us to Disneyland and back multiple times a day. We were able to buy discount ART passes from the hotel. We enjoyed the social that they had on in the lobby when we arrived and loved being able to swap Disneyland tips with our fellow park-goers!

Here‚Äôs why you might consider staying here: Ayers Anaheim is within walking distance to Angels and the Honda Center. The rooms are quiet, spacious, clean, and have super comfortable beds.  Here‚Äôs why I won‚Äôt be staying again: It‚Äôs a sign of the times that young staff will entertain themselves by deactivating your room keys which also happen to be the parking key. We stayed here a few nights to go to a few events and each time we left and came back to both the parking lot and our room it required us to go to the front desk and reactivare our cards. We specifically kept the keys in a separate pocket away from our phones and other cards as we know they can get ‚Äòdemagnetized‚Äô.  We were patient and polite the first 4 times but at the 5th and forward I was not happy and it seemed at
Manager Response: Dear Alexa W,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience and it is apparent that, in this case, we fell short simply due to an issue with the card reader or the key cards themselves. Nevertheless, I can assure you that we will look into this matter further in order to avoid similar complications in the future. Thank you again for your insightful review and rating.  Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary Heading: High quality at a reasonable price
Summary: Quality hotel quietly tucked in the trees near Anaheim stadium. It featured great service, quality rooms, and a convenient location. I highly recommend this hotel to any traveler to the area. It is also close enough to Disney Land to see the fireworks.

Stayed 5 nights for a family vacation everyone was overly friendly and helpful. Free breakfast was awesome hot and fresh daily. Location was very well maintained and clean would highly recommend to anyone planning a family vacation to Disney

For the past 5 times we've come to Anaheim (over the past 15 years), we've stayed only here! We love that it's close to Disney, but not in the immediate surrounding area. The rates are wonderful. The rooms are always clean. And the breakfast is amazing! (Shout out to Jose Llamas!!!) I've recommended this hotel to so many people, and we will most definitely be coming back!
Manager Response: Dear tidymills,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We appreciate your loyalty over many years. I recently took over as General Manager and have been extremely impressed with our staff. Jose is a hotel manager's dream. He loves his job and makes our guest's day start out on an upbeat note. We are truly fortunate to have him as part of the team for so many years. We hope to see you for your next trip, whenever that may be.   Sincerely,  Allen Boganwright General Manager

Summary: My husband and I made an emergency trip for a family funeral. My son was moving that same weekend, and his bed moved without him, so we arranged for him to join us at the Ayres. My sister managed a last minute flight from Seattle for the funeral; we fit her in too! Enough electrical outlets for everyone‚Äôs phones, conveniently located. Enough towels and places to put them. Sink conveniently located outside commode, so even with 4 people trying to get ready, we were fine. Breakfast downstairs so we didn‚Äôt need to make an extra stop. Staff are friendly and professional. A tough weekend was made easier because of the accommodations.

We chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisors. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Hotel was clean and the bed was so comfortable. Complimentary breakfast was hot and fresh every morning. This was by far the best hotel experience we've had. We will stay here every time we come to Anaheim.

Enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Anahiem hotel. Excellent service, friendly and supportive staff, great location. We Highly recommend everyone to stay at the hotel. Rooms very spacious and clean. Breakfast was wonderful and the chef was great with nice welcoming smile .

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disney
Summary: The staff are really friendly. They gave us a warm welcome. The rooms are clean. Great location close to disney. The complimentary breakfast was good too. They were kind to extend our checkout time by 2 hours.

Staff are very accommodating. Beds slept good. Rooms are clean. Amenities abound here. Breakfast goes above and beyond with hot, freshly made eggs, bacon, hash potatoes, etc. fresh baked cookies at night. My stay was very quiet, no peep heard from neighbors. So glad we used ART for our transportation to Disney. Download the ART app and you will know the exact time the bus is arriving.

This place delivers everything it says, and more than you expected. The breakfast is amazing. The rooms are beautiful, the beds are comfortable and the pillows are top notch. Daily parking fee (yuck, I'd prefer free of course) but it's much more reasonable than other lesser hotels. I'd pay it again because of everything else that is so steller. I love this place. I go to Disneyland often and I'd stay here again for sure!

This hotel was great! The room was super quiet and clean and the beds were very comfortable. The location was perfect for a quick 10-12 minute drive to Disney. The free breakfast was extra good. We had bacon or sausage with eggs, hash browns and pancakes every day. The thing that stood out most about this hotel was the customer service. Everybody we came across was polite, helpful, and just super friendly.  I don‚Äôt usually take the time to write reviews, but wanted to do so because the people at this hotel went above and beyond to make our stay amazing! We will be back!

We loved our stay at the Ayres Hotel on Katella.  We stayed for four nights and five days. The pool was fun and guests were inviting.The staff was terrific, continental breakfast was good, and rooms were very clean. We specifically enjoyed the grill chef Jose, night security Rollands, And front desk staff. Jason was especially nice. We will be staying here again next family trip to Anaheim!  -Ramirez Family

The hotel was very clean. The workers were friendly and seemed to like their job. The price was not too expensive. The hotel is close to disneyland the ball park, and across the street from the honda center.The free breakfast was very good. I highly recommend this hotel. The only thing negative is that they don"t have a bar or restaurant at the hotel. You have to walk across the street. You can get 10% off if you show your room key.

We were in Anaheim to attend Toronto Blue Jay games when they played the Angels. We chose the Ayres Hotel because of it's proximity to Angles Stadium and we're pleasantly surprised. Not only is it a short walk from the stadium but very welcoming and very clean. The morning breakfast was one of the best we have had. It is also across the street from the Honda Centre and offers a free shuttle to Disneyland. I will definitely stay here my next stop in Anaheim.

This is a beautiful quaint hotel in a wonderful location. The hotel is clean and the staff at the hotel are wonderful. We had an issue, not with our room, and Anthony from the front desk went above and beyond to help us. Thanks Anthony for all your help, it's greatly appreciated!

Summary Heading: Great location, close to Angel Stadium and Honda Center
Summary: Just spent a couple of days in Anaheim to watch the Toronto Blue Jays play the LA Angels. Great hotel, 10 minute easy walk to the stadium. Room was clean and well equipped. Great free breakfast. Hotel staff very friendly and accommodating.

This was our 24th MLB stadium. Such a great hotel within easy walking distance. Feels like an older European hotel ambiance with modern amenities and excellent customer service from check in to check out.

I booked this hotel last minute to spend a few nights during our Disney trip and was glad I did. The rooms were huge and the Ayers bed was the most comfortable I've experienced at a hotel. We were close to Disney and many dining options. The complimentary breakfast included made-to-order cook who made pancakes and could fry an egg exactly as you wish. The one negative I had was the in-room coffee is undrinkable and I'd love to have a Keurig. I'll be sure to consider Ayers again above other hotels.

Summary Heading: Great room, great staff, great complimentary breakfast! Perfect for ART, train and Greyhound...
Summary: One of the best stays i have had at a hotel in this price bracket, given the price of ¬£100 a night that i managed to find on Agoda.  The King room was one of the biggest you will find anywhere and was spotless.  Staff were ultra friendly, the guy who i think was the manager and the security man were particulary fun to talk to. The breakfast was really good in comparison to other 'free breakfasts' this type of accommodation offers. They have a chef who gives you the hot food, which ensures its fresh and the scrambled eggs were particulary good. If you are a lover of fruit in the morning, im sure you will be delighted with the selection of strawberrys, melon, grapes, apple etc. We never had a problem with it being busy, always half full when we went at different times.   I had to

Great hotel! The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. The staff was super friendly and the complimentary breakfast had a great selection. It's located in walking distance of the Honda Center, Angels Stadium, the Grove and the Metrolink. We'll definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Quiet hotel conveniently located to Anaheim attractions
Summary: Ayres has friendly, professional staff all around ‚Äî from the front desk employees, to the chef, to the maintenance staff to housekeeping to other employees.   The rooms are quiet with comfortable beds and sheets.The walls block out noise unlike the giant big name hotels.  The hotel is right across the street from the Honda Center, the Anaheim Angels Stafium and restaurants. Disneyland, movies, grocery shopping and tons of other great restaurants are within a couple miles, and major freeway access is right there.  The room rates are a little pricey, and there is a $10 parking fee, plus tax per night.

Summary Heading: My "Home Away From Home" in Anaheim!
Summary: I have been booking rooms consistently at this hotel for the past 8 years. I have daughters who were Chapman University students and a son who had multiple water polo tournaments in the Orange County vicinity, so I was in this area often. Throughout it all this hotel was always my first choice. It is the absolute best "bang for your buck!!" I always knew that I'd have a clean, comfortable room. I knew I'd have breakfast available to start my day; And I knew that I would be greeted by a competent, friendly staff that I could trust. This place operates with integrity. We recently booked rooms for all of our out of town guests for our final Chapman graduation. I couldn't help but feel a little nostalgic as we left. Thank you, Ayres Anaheim for creating a "home away from home!" I

This was our first time staying at an Ayres Hotel and my family and I loved it. From the time we were greeted at check in to the time at check out we had nothing but friendly service from staff. I would like to give a thank you to Anthony, Jason, Dee and I was not able to get the young gentlemen's name but he worked with Jason in the afternoon. They were all very gracious and helpful. I was not aware that your stay came with a free breakfast. The dining area was very nice and clean, they had a great selection,  and the service was great. The cook (Jose) was very nice and friendly, he made my daughter a little Mickey Mouse pancake. It is the small details that made our stay that much more wonderful. The room and the overall building was very clean. The location was great, very

Summary Heading: 5th stay at this hotel, Great service, nice rooms
Summary: This is the 5th time in 6yrs that we have stayed at this Ayre's hotel.  This hotel has a very friendly staff, very nice rooms, and a very good breakfast buffet.  There is a free "Happy Hour" from 5:30pm to 6:30pm, free beer, wine, chips.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks at 9:15pm from "Even" numbered rooms.  The hotel was our base for Disneyland, Universal Studios, Knott's Berry Farm, Angels Stadium and the beach.  They are all close by.  There is a shuttle to Disneyland for $5.50 round-trip per day, unlimited use during day.  It comes by every 20-30mins, front desk has up to date arrival times.  The Anaheim bus/train station is a 5 min walk, you CAN NOT hear any trains or train horns as it is a "Quiet Zone".  You can go to LA or San Diego on day trips as Amtrak runs plenty

We were attracted by a very good value room price for a family of 4, the service was prompt and respectful of privacy, the free hot breakfast was unexpectedly plentiful and diverse--eggs and meat and pancakes and fresh fruits and breads and cereals and juices and hot beverages--and the location was across the street from the Angels stadium, down the street from Disneyland/California Resort, around the corner from Anaheim Walk Garden and next door to a major transit station (beautifully designed and lit, by the way. I have no complaints. the $10 per night fee was lower than most. I stayed 2 days rather than my usual overnight stay for a Disney trip. And the family LOVED the Jacuzzi and pool time. A great early summer SoCal vacation.

Summary Heading: Loved how this hotel used to be with European styling...the new updates make it look average
Summary: Now this location you have to Pay for Park $10 a day & the main hall to our 4th floor smelled musty like they cleaned the carpets with dirty water...unlike the other floors that didnt smell.  We stayed for there for 9 nights and though we booked through a different agent, it would of been nice to know that we could cancel within the usual 24-36 hrs of most hotels instead of 5 days before your arrival otherwise you'd be charged the entire length of stay....then and then there was construction our last 4 days which was under our window and heard concrete being busted up and tossed into a dump truck.  Though signs were posted and apologized for the convenience, it would of been nice if they could offer a discounted rate (especially being there for 9 days), or discount for another

Room is very nice, clean and updated with electronic device chargers.  Customer service was exceptional.  We had guests come and visit.  They were welcomed to park in the lot and did not get charged.  Perfect location to see the Angels or Ducks play.

We just returned from spending a week at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim and loved it. The public areas are well-maintained, the rooms are very clean and well-appointed, the breakfast provides a variety of foods, and the service is top-notch. There is even a small commissary that is open around the clock. There was a concert at the Honda Center and, thankfully, this hotel is so soundproof we didn't hear a peep. Andrew at the Front Desk was especially helpful.

Nice and clean rooms. Clean rooms, Clean Rooms.     Friendly staff.   My choice of hotel if I'm staying there again.   I even made a mistake in my reservation and they promptly helped me switching my room as necessary.

Front staff are very friendly, helpful and did I mention helpful. The hotel is clean and conveniently located. There is also a bus service, for a minimal cost, to take you to Anaheim destinations that might not be in walking distance.

We have stayed at 4 of The Ayres establishments.  We keep going back as we prefer not going to a big chain of hotels unless we are doing "spa" days.  The Ayres has friendly staff, rooms are decent size (many with mini fridge and microwave) and always clean. They also serve a great breakfast included in the reservation. It is our "hotel of choice"

Recently we stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim because of its proximity to the Los Angeles Angels.  The reviews on TripAdvisor were excellent. As it turned out the Ayres was better than excellent. Finding the hotel was easy with GPS. When we entered the hotel it was Happy Hour with free wine, beer and sodas on ice, chips, guacamole and salsa. All welcome after 3 hours of brutal L.A. freeway traffic. The front desk was manned by Jordan a delightful, courteous young man. We were soon in our room (after 2 glasses of decent wine). The room was large, clean, and very very quiet. Though near the freeway, the room was dead silent. We  walked to the stadium.  (If you're going to a night game, make sure to remember what gate you entered, it looks different at night and we almost got

Summary Heading: Take Me Out To The Ballgame
Summary: This hotel is literally within minutes of walking distance to Angel Stadium. It's great to just park your car, check in the hotel, then walk to the game. The hotel is very comfortable with a breakfast buffet included.

This is a truly great hotel.  We stayed here for 3 nights during a recent trip to Disneyland.  The hotel is very clean - our room, the lobby, dining area, pool area, everything is maintained and kept to the highest standards of cleanliness.  All the staff we encountered were so welcoming and helpful.  The breakfast was great and included in the stay.  We arrived on a Tuesday evening and there was a manager's reception in the lobby which was very nice after a long day of traveling.  We can't wait to come back!

Summary Heading: Great location and a really courteous staff.
Summary: My husband and I stayed in a king suite on the 4th floor (King bed/half wall with couch on the other side). The room was large, the bed was comfortable and there was a coffee maker/coffee and a refrigerator in the room. There was a little noise from the freeway near by, but the noise wasn't bad. What we liked: 1. The front desk folks were really helpful, 2. The location -- its right next to the Amtrak and Angels stadiums, 3. The breakfast was awesome and 4. it had a nice pool/hot tub

Booked two rooms for a girl's trip to Disneyland. This was my second stay at this hotel. The room are large and the bed, bedding and pillows were super comfortable. I did have an issue with my key card for two of my four night stay, but I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Chef Jose is the best! He makes a fresh, hot breakfast every morning with a smile. Can't wait to visit again soon.

Very clean, nice, cozy, well located (close to the parks),  quiet, good breakfast, kind personnel, wifi , available parking (US$10.- per day). Los Angeles is a huge city, this hotel is in Anaheim which is apron 1 hour from hollywood, but is 5 minutes away from Disneyland , 1 hour from Six Flags Magic Mountain, 1 hour from airport . We absolutely recommend it .

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with a great location!
Summary: Staff was very friendly and helpful, room was clean and updated.  Breakfast was included and the food was a little nicer than standard continental fair.  All day parking costs $10 dollars a day which may be a change for some, but given the location's proximity to other venues, I'd day it's worth it.

Booked three rooms for this one night family business trip. Rooms were clean, comfortable, frig and coffee pot etc., exactly as reserved. Easy check in. Light happy hour served in the late afternoon is welcomed at check-in as were the warm cookies!   Free breakfast is a nice start to the day.  Parking for guest is 10.00. The hotel is a ‚Äústones‚Äù throw from Angel Stadum, Honda Center, Disneyland, restaurants, shopping and many other things to see and do in Anaheim. Staff are EXCELLENT!!  In every area customer service was exceptional.  We requested a late check out and ran into a slight problem and didn‚Äôt have a problem.   Would definite stay here again

Summary Heading: Smells bad and bed size not as advertised
Summary: We picked this hotel because it was well reviewed and close to the Honda Center. Weird parking situation and charging ten dollars for parking at a motel is ridiculous. Next, the place smells disgusting, like mold and dust. And I‚Äôm incredibly irritated that they lie on the website and say the beds are queen size. They are clearly full size so I don‚Äôt know if we were just given a terrible room or all the rooms are falsely advertised as having queen size beds. I should have stayed at a Hilton. They state truthfully when their rooms have full size beds. Won‚Äôt stay at an Ayres property again.
Manager Response: Dear Cindy,   I am sorry to read that you had such an unpleasant experience. I know that paying for parking at a hotel can be frustrating. We do offer the best value hotel parking of any hotel next to an arena however. All arena hotels do charge for overnight parking. I am so sorry you found a bad smell. I am having my engineer look into it. I was also concerned that you found the beds small. I can give you complete assurance that they are indeed Queen Sized Beds, perhaps appearing smaller due to being next to a large headboard in a large room.  I hope you will reconsider staying with us again. If you do, please feel free to contact me directly so I can make sure that your stay is more enjoyable.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: I WISH ALL hotels were like this!!
Summary: Initially we were skeptical about the hotel, given the pictures on trip advisor from awhile ago. The hotel has most definitely been renovated recently. (The pictures on the hotel‚Äôs website accurately portray the guest rooms). Do not be alarmed by the ‚Äú$40 Special Event Parking‚Äù upon entry to the parking lot. This hotel is quite literally located across the street from Angel Stadium and is an attractive place to park for Angels game attendees. The $40 price tag is to deter non-hotel guests from parking in the hotels lot. Parking is quite reasonable at $10 a day. As an Expedia VIP we were greeted with a welcome gift and had an extended checkout time of 3:00pm. The staff were EXCEPTIONAL. We can‚Äôt stress this enough. Each staff member including housekeeping, front desk and

We were in Anaheim attending the Train - Hall & Oates concert across the street at the Honda Center. The close proximity to the venue was our reason for staying at the Ayres Hotel. We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. From check in to check out everything was lovely. The front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and extremely clean. Also very close proximity to the Disneyland Resort. Will definitely return to the Ayres on our next visit.

This hotel is great. The room was new and very well appointed. Everything from check in to checkout was first rate. It was an easy walk to the Honda Center. Perfect place e to stay to take in a Ducks game or o lynch e few blocks to Angels game.

Summary Heading: It was a quick trip to visit our granddaughter in Southern California.
Summary: The hotel staff are all very helpful and friendly.  We'd asked for a room away from the elevator and it was ready when we got there at noon.  They were also kind enough to extend our check-out by an hour.  We will definitely return!

Enjoyed our 2 nights stay in this hotel during our Disney trip. First of, it‚Äôs not close to Disney but there is shuttle service for $5.50/person/day. The facility is clean, has a gym (with a few basics like treadmill, elliptical, weights) and pool, and they have decent breakfast options. Stayed in a king suite equipped with a mini ref, microwave & coffee maker.  Bed is comfortable and room feels clean. We will definitely come back.

We stayed at this hotel over spring break 2018.    It is so convenient to the Angel Anaheim Standium, the Ducks Hockey rink at the Honda Center and also the Disney and Knotts Berry Farm.    They have 4 Tesla Super Chargers that are for their guests.   I was the only car that used them....it was such a convenience to recharge overnight at the hotel with no worry about moving the car from the parking spot.  We walked to the Angels baseball game in the afternoon.  Went back to the hotel for a break and change clothes. Walked to the Honda Center for a Ducks hockey game.  The next day we drove a few miles to go to Knotts Berry Farm.   It is very clean, comfortable and terrific staff.   They are so very helpful and accommodating to whatever special request you may have.   This was our

We have been staying here every year for four years with the tour company. The bedding and rooms are kept up to date for the most part. Very clean, they are very helpful and polite. There breakfast is a real breakfast and not just Continental style. They also have a shuttle service with three great stops! We will be back.

Across the road from Ducks arena and 10 minute walk to Angels stadium. Nice comfortable and clean room. Good breakfast. Would recommend to all. Nice resterant across the street as well. All staff very friendly and helpful

Summary Heading: Nice place, but far away from the action
Summary: The Ayres Hotel is very comfortable and pleasant enough, but if you are looking for a place to stay to visit Disneyland, this probably isn't the best choice.  This is why we were in Anaheim but we had to take an Uber to get to and from the park every day as it's too far to walk to, and the hotel is located by a busy freeway.  What I would recommend the hotel for is if you are on business.  It is also near a couple of the sports arenas, so this might be a plus for some guests too.  Also, the pool is tiny and not the kind where you're going to spend an afternoon relaxing around.

The hotel is awesome.  The staff are extremely friendly and inviting. The location is perfect. Close to a lot of eateries, gas stations and freeways.   The breakfast is so delicious and the chef is awesome. The parking is conviently located out front for 10 dollars a day.  The rooms are spacious and comforting however the bed was not comfortable at all.  That is the only downside to this hotel.   Everything else was great.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for a baseball game for the Anaheim Angels
Summary: We happened upon this hotel by checking trip advisor.  It was a very nice, clean, quiet and safe location.  The staff was awesome.  The gentleman I talked with was so helpful and answered all my questions about the location.  In fact, traveling back through the area the following week, we decided to stay at the Ayres Hotel again.   Breakfast was great.  It is also located near Disneyland with bus transportation to and from park through the city.   We attended an Angels game and was able to take a short walk to and from the stadium without any safety concerns.  Highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Another Successful Angels weekend at Ayres
Summary: Breakfast is quite an experience with fresh cooked dishes from the chef.  The room was spacious, comfortable, quiet, just delightful.  Walking to the stadium provided for some much needed exercise.  Walking across the street to JT Schmid's provided for wonderful atmosphere and delish food.  A beautiful setting for a fun filled weekend.

The hotel was nice , wish they would tell you they will hold $60-$125 for cleaning fees before you book your room and I wish the jacuzzi was open later . Breakfast was not that great , loved the bacon ,eggs were a little watery , there could be more coffee creamer options, coffee could be better. I was told there were omelettes but I found out that was not true . Loved the bathroom and tub , not sure why but the room temperature could not be neutral it was either too cold or too hot , even though we changed the thermostat nothing helped . Loved the cookies

Super comfortable bedding and pillows, fabulous breakfast, and excellent helpful staff. Wifi reception great. Has a hot tub and pool outdoors we didn't get to use (too unseasonably cold that night for us). I would definitely recommend it and go again.  You do have to pay for parking. Rooms large and clean.

the rooms are super nice, quite, and comfortable. The wifi and free breakfast are another wonderful addition. We have visited for the past 4 years and never incured a problem.  The staff is super friendly and they do have security so you feel safe.  If your ever in need of a great hotel, then this is your place.

I was very happy staying at the Anaheim location due to the close proximity to Chapman University as we were doing college tours for my daughter. The hotel had the most incredible friendly chef with delicious breakfasts!! We always started our days on a positive note and full tummy.

We stay at this hotel when we go and see the Ducks play! It right across the street and we just walk over and back. There is a restaurant next door that gives you 10% off if you show them your room key. It is a very nice hotel and a great hot breakfast! We will stay again!

What a fabulous find in a great location!! The suite is perfect with a small divider between the bed and living space. A small fridge, microwave and sink make for a great set up. The breakfast in the morning is better than any free hotel breakfast I‚Äôve ever had. Lots of choices and a personable cook right there making it fresh!! All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful‚Äîa true gem of a place.

The hotel is very clean and comfortable. Close to Disneyland. Very friendly staff's. You can take bus 15 to Disneyland. Breakfast was ok and very sample. The hotel is near Honda center. It was a nice hotel.

We have stayed at this hotel before and loved our experience previously. This time we stayed for 5 nights. The staff are friendly and helpful; they helped resolve a check in issue in advance so that when we arrived there wouldn't be any sort of delay. The breakfast is more than sufficient, the cooks are very friendly and it outdoes many hotel breakfasts. The rooms are comfortable (some issues with controlling the temperature of the room). The value is really good given proximity to Disneyland, The Honda Center and Angel Stadium. My only negatives are that the hotel needs a bit of a makeover; it feels old and that the shuttle bus (NOT operated by the hotel and therefore not under their control) has really lost its impressiveness (which we experienced during our last visit) with

We stayed at this hotel for 1 night, hotel is right across the street from the Honda Center , we were going to a hockey game so this hotel was the perfect stay, we just walked across the street for the game, hotel over all is pretty clean, clean rooms and really friendly staff. Only thing is , the hotel does need some remodeling. The hallways and the rooms have a stinky smell to them, some of the linen could use an upgrade  also ,this hotel is not new by any means and you can tell that when you pull up to the parking lot, which by the way ,  they will charge you for parking on their premises, even though you are already paying for a room and are a guest at their hotel! Not to happy about that. Would I stay here again? Maybe. It‚Äôs not a bad hotel it is kind of expensive and could

We stayed four nights and the Ayers hotel in Anaheim and I can‚Äôt say enough about this hotel! The staff was so kind and accommodating, the hotel is clean and beautiful, I actually miss my hotel bed and pillows.  Soooooo comfortable. The breakfast in the morning is made to order and the best I‚Äôve ever had. I would recommend this hotel over and over. They made our stay wonderful!!!

We stayed as a family of four for 3 nights and found the stay very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and accommodating . We had issues with our room on arrival due to clearing plumbing from a floor above  but they were happy to move us immediately to  another room. The breakfast was adequate and set us up for a good day at Disneyland and Disneyland Adventure Park. The Disney bus pickup was at the front door and ran every 40mins at $5.50 per person it is the only way to go. Our family was very happy with the stay. Thank you Ayres.

Stay at this hotel whenever I take my boys to Ducks games. It is located across the street from the Honda Center and parking is only $10.00 nightly. It is also in walking distance to other restaurants,  bus/train station, and Angels Stadium.  The rooms are large, clean, and modern. Staff is always very accommodating. The breakfast served is included in stay and very good:  cook serves hot items like eggs, bacon, and potatoes, and will cook pancakes if desired. The pool and jacuzzi are big enough for fun in the sun. I will continue to stay at the Ayres whenever I travel from Oceanside to Orange County to see the Ducks and Angels.

The location is outstanding if you want to visit the many attractions in the area like Disneyland, the Honda Center or Angels Stadium.  Every employee of the hotel I encountered during my stay was more than helpful, courteous, friendly and wanted to ensure my stay was a positive experience.  The hotel is located between a busy freeway and a busy city street, but I did not hear any noise during the night.  The property is clean and well kept.  The only down side was the parking fee, but I assume the fee is common practice for the area.  Anthony at the front counter was AWESOME!  Overall it was one of the best hotels I have stayed at.

We frequent the Anaheim area often and many times take early flights out of John Wayne Airport and we stay at either location - Chapman or Katella.  Both are always clean and have easy access to other area attractions.  We are always greeted like long lost relatives.  Check in is a breeze.  Nice touches with happy hour and cookies as well.  Rooms are spacious and clean and the full breakfast options are above the standard.  Definitely our go to place when we are in the area.

We recently stayed at Ayres for a midweek escape. The staff was super friendly and accommodating, the room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was delicious! We will definitely be back and refer our friends and family.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and hope that you will have an opportunity to escape and see us again some time soon.  All the best,  Marcus Collins  General manager

Summary: Firstly, this is a superb hotel. Checkin was swift and friendly, staff is professional, the morning breakfast was fresh and varied, and the room was clean and large.   This hotel has the Honda Centre right across the street for Ducks games and concerts. The shuttle will put you at Disneyland in 20 minutes and the striking Amtrak station will take you wherever you wish. The remarkable grill brewpub Tj Schmidt I'd across the road for great food and a cold one. Enjoy!
Manager Response: Dear Al,  Thank you so much for your glowing review. I am glad that we did all we could to make you comfortable, but you are right, the location is ideal and with the train station walking distance from the hotel it really does make a difference.  Thanks again,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This is a wonderful hotel right on the main drag near all things Disney.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  The breakfast is wonderful.  Easy to get in and out and the major highways to anywhere are nearby.  On a personal note - I accidentally left my diamond earrings in the room one day.  We were gone all day, and when we returned they were exactly where I had left them.  Very impressed with the honesty and integrity of this establishment

My family and I have stayed at this hotel a few times. It‚Äôs always clean, the staff is friendly, the location is ideal, the breakfast is delicious, and the prices are reasonable. We try to stay he for our trips into Anaheim. I would recommend to family and friends.

Summary Heading: What you‚Äôd expect from this type of hotel
Summary: Stayed here one night after attending a concert at the Honda center. We chose this one for the ability to walk right across the street to the venue. Rooms were clean, noise level was well maintained once in our room and the breakfast was free. Staff was friendly and we had no issues with parking, especially considering the front desk did say rooms were sold out due to the concert. It‚Äôs kind of a no-frills hotel but we would frequent again if the situation warranted.

We were a group of singers in town for a Saengerfest. Check-in was courteous and easy. They keep a plate of cookies at the counter--a nice touch. Room was very pleasant, clean and spacious. They offer a generous breakfast of which we happily took advantage. I am told they offer a Thursday afternoon get-together, snacks and drinks, for guests. Those in our group who were there on Thursday enjoyed it. They even offered a free shuttle to the Phoenix Club, venue of our singing. Everything about our stay was great. Traffic noise could be a problem but I quickly adjusted to it. The air conditioning/heating unit creates a white noise which masked traffic noise for me.

Summary Heading: Outstanding hotel for business or family holiday travel
Summary: Quiet, friendly, comfortable.  Extremely accommodating staff.  Already have reservations for next year.  Hotel is close to many event centers including Disney in Anaheim.  Easy to reach from airport - its a quick trip.

This was my first stay with an Ayres.  I rode the train to Anaheim and was planning to call for a ride when I realized that Ayers is just a block away from the station.  Angel Stadium and The Honda Center are also a short walk away.  Every member of the staff that I encountered was very friendly and attentive.  The rooms are clean and comfortable with plenty of towels.  Their fresh hot breakfast offers something for everyone.  The property is safe and easy to find.  I gave the location a 4 because I usually prefer something closer to Disneyland.  It was easy and economical to call for a ride to the park, but the ART bus is another option to consider.

I have stayed here on every trip to Anaheim.  The staff are easy to work with and happy to assist--including printing directions.  The beds are comfortable, rooms are clean and include a refrigerator--very convenient.  It's walking distance to the stadium and has a nice restaurant across the street.  Does get a little noisy if you're staying on the first floor on the side nearest the restaurant on weekend nights, but I'm able to sleep through it anyway.  Highly recommended.

Great romm and comfortable beds Nice bathroom. Excellent value for the price. Staff was great and welcoming.  Breakfast could have more variety but is very good, tasty. We'll come there if we go back to Anaheim

Summary Heading: Absolutely Pleased and will stay there again.
Summary: The convenience of parking, the parking rate and the ability to use your car any time seamlessly without additional cost.  The beds were beyond comfortable, the rooms were super clean, the staff was so kind and accommodating.  Best at any price, and I have stayed at very expensive hotels. Can't say enough about the abundance of phone and computer charges in the room.  Only suggestion is put wall plugs closer to the full-length mirror.  The breakfast was excellent and the happy hour of wine and chips by the fireplace all complimentary was awesome.  Thanks, I will be back.

Stay here every time we visit LA and have never been disappointed. Hotel is some distance from Disneyland (opposite the Honda Stadium) but not a problem with a car, or can catch the bus which stops at the property. Stayed in the deluxe king room, bed was comfortable and got a good nights sleep. Room was clean and tidy with good facilities. Breakfast was included and always find this to be excellent. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

If you are going to an event at the Honda Center, you couldn‚Äôt ask for a closer hotel. It‚Äôs so close that you have to enter a special gate to access the hotel parking lot because fans have tried to park in it before attending sporting events. Even though it‚Äôs right off the 57 Fwy, you never hear the traffic.  Ayers offers good rates while providing clean, modern, and attractive rooms and amenities. The friendly staff was very helpful. If you are looking for a hotel near Disneyland, this isn‚Äôt in walking distance but you can hop on the local shuttle to get there. In some ways the distance provides a bit of respite from the Disney hyped up energy.  I would stay at the hotel again in the future.

Summary Heading: Huge rooms, fantastic breakfast, just miles to DISNEY!
Summary: We were so pleasantly surprise to see the size of our room. It is quite large with sink area/closet separate from the toilet/shower and had the largest/widest shower I have ever experienced in a hotel, had plenty of space in the shower for foot rest, shampoo, soaps, razor, etc. There is a separate living room area with couch, kitchen sink/microwave, dresser then we had a divider wall to the bedroom, nice king bed, tv, nightstands each side with electric outlet. Quiet rooms too. Breakfast was FANTASTIC, made to order pancakes, scr. eggs, bacon or sausages, juices, pastries, cereals, etc. Staff was very nice. We were at Disney with 15 minutes. Close to highway and shopping/restaurants. Would stay again! Only negative: $10 a day parking fee.

This place is an Uber or bus away from the convention centre  \Disneyland and in an unprepossessing neighbourhood but worth it. Buses are easy, Uber to the main drag is about $7.50.  Small gym, smallish but nice pool and best hotel breakfasts in Anaheim.  My only complaint is that I chose it for the proximity to the Santa Ana river trail but that has become a no-go area because it is a city of homeless people and no longer safe unfortunately.

We visited Anaheim to support our hockey team, the Winnipeg Jets.  We chose the Ayres hotel because of walking distance to the Honda Centre. The price was higher than we normally pay but we factored in all other costs if we stayed further away and figured it was worth it.  We walked to and from the game within minutes and dined at the restaurant right next to the hotel.  The pool area was ok, there is a small gym and nice breakfast area.  It's adjacent to the freeway so can be noisy on that side, but the nightly fireworks from Disneyland are offered as an incentive.  There were a few street people milling around so beware of your surroundings.

I travel to Anaheim frequently for business and always stay at the Ayres.  The staff is very friendly and make you feel like you are at home.  The morning breakfast is very good.  Chef Jose always greets you with a smiling face.  The evening reception is a good chance to meet the staff.  It is not unusual to see Marie interacting with the guests. I enjoy her conversations.  It is like visiting family.

Our daughter goes to Chapman University, and the Ayres offers a discounted rate for Chapman family so we have stayed here numerous times. This last time I made the reservation over the phone and the clerk asked if I had AAA (which I do) and he said that actually would be a better rate than the Chapman one. That was so nice of him and I really appreciated it. The staff here (especially the front desk) are all really nice and helpful. I checked in earlier than anticipated this last time and my room wasn't quite ready, so the manager changed my room to one that was already prepared so I wouldn't have to wait. Great breakfast, wine reception in the evening, and fresh cookies before bed.  Can't recommend this place more highly!

Service: Great!!! Everyone was very nice.. Easy check in and check out.  Room: Great!!! Clean Fresh Quiet  Comfortable  Location: Great!!! Located Literally across the street from Anaheim Regional Transportation Intermodal Center, within three hundred yards from Anaheim Stadium, and three hundred yards from the Honda Center. This hotel is worth it for any overnight stay if are attending events at either venue. Disneyland is about a ten minute drive.   Parking: Great!!! Hotel is $12 a day  Disney/ stadium / Honda is around $20 each a day  Food: Good Hotel breakfast is "good for free with room"  Hot/ potato, bacon, eggs, oatmeal, and fresh pancakes(pancakes were really good) Cold/ cereal, muffins, fresh fruit, Danishes off site food/ pub across the street that also delivers to

Great room, great location, accessibility, parking, breakfast and staff. Some very nice touches like giving you an opportunity to state room preference location in the building, and have wine available for you upon arrival. Perfect place to stay for Honda Center events. Would definitely go back to Ayres when in Anaheim again.

Summary Heading: Super friendly staff, super clean and great transport to Disneyland!!
Summary: Our stay at the Ayres hotel, Anaheim was amazing! The staff at the front desk were some of the nicest people we met while being in America and were able to help us with anything we needed. The transport shuttle that was available from the hotel to Disneyland was great, easy to catch and only a quick trip. It was our first trip to the USA and we would definitely stay at the hotel again. I recommend this hotel for anyone planning on going to Disneyland or wanting to stay in Anaheim.

Great experience close to the Honda Center and Angels Stadium.  Room very clean excellent service.  Room was very spacious, Served breakfast which was very good.  Dinning is close by and very good. Transportation to Disneyland if needed.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay if attending an event the Honda Centre
Summary: Once only visit as we were attending a Hockey game across the road. Room was very good. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast was good. Staff were friendly. Getting to and from LAX was easy - were where checked into and waiting for our flight within an hour of leaving the hotel (we had minimal traffic though)

We have stayed here during a business trip to Los Angels. The hotel looks very well maintained and the ambience is warm and friendly. The rooms are very spacious. The breakfast is a bit limited, but all that is served, is tasty. I would definitely go back for the next visit.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Super Clean and Great Service!
Summary: This was my first time in Anaheim and this hotel was lovely. It was about 30-45 mins away from LAX (depending on traffic). The staff were very friendly and welcoming. We had a king sized room with a pull out couch. The room was large and comfortable. The bathroom and bed were clean. The very best parts of the hotel were 1. breakfast and 2. location next to the Honda Center. We were going to the Ducks game and it was so convenient to simply walk across the street. If you stay here you have to have breakfast. I had some of the best pancakes ever. Each morning the cooks were very kind and provided fresh made eggs and pancakes, along with sausage or bacon. Overall, I thought this hotel was a lovely place to stay if you were visiting Anaheim for any reason.

Staff is always Great. I come in town almost every week & everyone is always very accommodating &  friendly.  Great breakfast, clean rooms, very safe.. Great location, walking distance to Honda Center to catch a Hockey Game or Angel Stadium for  Baseball game!!

Only a short drive from Disneyland, we stayed here to visit disney and it was perfect! Also super handy to the Angel Stadium, we were able to walk and didn't have to worry about parking! This hotel was very quiet, considering it is mostly families staying and the breakfast had a good selection including hot foods! The staff were very helpful and very kindly upgraded us as we were on honeymoon! Definitely recommend the Ayres!

I really enjoyed this hotel!!! Big, nice, and beautiful room! The staff was really nice! Everything was clean and no sign of bed bugs! I really Recommend this hotel and I will be coming back! The shuttle service was good as well

In town for a photo session with PB Inc. great place to stay at in North Orange Co. ONLY neg. is I would like a later check out time. As I photograph late nights or midday and need to catch a few ZZZZ's before driving back to my home base of Las Vegas! A 2pm or 3pm would be awesome!

Room was spacious and clean and nicely appointed. Bed was very comfortable. Hot tub and exercise room were convenient and utilized by myself. All staff are friendly and helpful. Expensive room rate, but the location to Anaheim Stadium and freeways helps justify the price.

Summary Heading: Swanky, Clean and Comfortable. Friendly staff
Summary: Swanky & Clean. Great breakfast! The room was clean and bed was comfortable.  It had a mini kitchenette with microwave, sink, refrigerator, coffee maker, ice, coffee & coffee condiments. There was also a TV, dining table for 2, desk, sofa with pull out bed, safe, iron & ironing board, blow dryer, and plenty of charging areas. I loved the tub and that the room was clean. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. The complimentary breakfast was really good. It surprised me a lot. Pancakes, eggs, sausage, and perfectly cooked cubed potatoes (crispy outside and soft inside). There was also oatmeal and a variety of fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, yogurt, and a variety of morning drinks (coffees, juices, milks). I liked that they also have security guards that do their job. I

I assumed that all the Ayres properties were to the standards of Manhattan Beach and wine country but unfortunately I found out the hard way. The hotel looked run down and old. If was very dated with no flares. Unfortunately I spent my New Year‚Äôs Eve there.

My husband, daughter, and granddaughter decided at the last minute to celebrate the New Year at Disneyland.  I was very happy to find this beautiful hotel at a very reasonable price for the days needed.  The breakfast was very filling and delicious. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Most of all the King Bedroom Suite was the perfect accommodation.  The bed, linens, towels, and room was very clean.  We had a great experience there and will return there next time.

Staff is friendly and helpful, and always ready to meet your needs.  Delicious full breakfast, great location near everything we wanted, airport within 20 minutes, also Newport Beach, and Knott‚Äôs Berry Farm.

I like the room , the bed was so comfy, staff was very helpful, food was great especially I can make hot chocolate. It's walking distance to catch the bus wherever we go, theirs shuttles right through the door if you go to disneyland. I recommend this place.

Summary Heading: Would not recommend for overseas travellers
Summary: We booked this hotel because it was cheaper than others near Disneyland and the great review from lonely planet.    There is a very rude cook in the kitchen/dining room where you eat breakfast and he doesn't know how to communicate with people who are not from the US.  He does not seem to care about customer service at all.  The rooms were old and needed some maintenance in the bathroom.  Blankets and bedsheets with holes in it.  Parking was reasonable price.  There was a clothes washer and dryer for guests at reasonable cost too.  If you are looking for an hotel near Disneyland please choose another one closer to it.

Hotel staff was very kind and very quick to greet us every time. The hot breakfast that is included is a great value and a great selection to choose from. Room was very modern and upto date but needs a bigger television set.

Staff very friendly and room was clean and quiet.  Parking and breakfast and hi speed internet included.  Easy on and off freeway and centrally located. Would highly recommend to all. Very close to Disneyland and other sports arenas.

Summary Heading: Convenient location, nice facility, good breakfast
Summary: We came to bring our daughter home from Chapman, and the hotel was conveniently located to the school and other Anaheim locations.  The air conditioning didn't work in the room, and we were quickly provided with another room by the front desk staff.  They were very helpful. The breakfast was really good too with a wide variety of food selections.  Would definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Fantastic service in a great location
Summary: My wife and I stayed here on our way through LA. We absolutely loved how close the location was to all the local attractions. The service since arriving has been fantastic and we have been made to feel warm and welcome by all the members of staff.  Would definitely recommend to friends travelling the area!

My husband and I stayed just one night but were very pleased with our accommodations. Very reasonably priced King suite. Spacious corner room with mini fridge, microwave, sink in kitchenette. All staff were very friendly. The Continental breakfast had a wide array of items including prepared hot scrambled eggs with potatoes and bacon.  We will definitely stay in any Ayres Hotel in the future.

We stayed over on a Saturday night to attend an event at the Honda Center (just across the street). We got there via Amtrak and it was just a very short walk from the station to the hotel. Made it very convenient for us. The four story hotel is very nice and our third floor room had a king bed with night stands, a comfortable couch with coffee table, a desk/computer table with chair, a fair-size flat screen TV, a dresser, a small round table with two chairs, a microwave, mini-fridge and a single-cup coffeemaker. The bathroom area featured a nice closet, single sink with adequate counter space, a commode room with combo tub/shower. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was among the best we've had with scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon,

The Ayers Hotel is a favorite stay. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. We didn‚Äôt hear noises or traffic although near the freeway. Although we almost slept through breakfast, they were gracious to accommodate us. Easy check in and out. Great Hotel!

It's a nice place to stay, reasonably priced and close to Disneyland. We had a good stay, bed was a little creaky but the room was clean and comfortable. I would recommend the hotel to people looking for a place to stay while visiting Disneyland.

Family stay during trip to Disneyland.  Hotel was easy to locate and ample parking. Staff were friendly and helpful. Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) stops at hotel, 10 minute trip to Disney. Get ART day pass for multiple rides. Cheaper and easier than parking at Disney. Took ART from Disney to restaurant for early dinner, then back to park until close.   Breakfast was included in stay and was above average for what you'd expect from a hotel.  Cook made Mickey Mouse pancakes for kids without asking.  Pool was disappointment, debris in water and poor location off parking lot.  Good place to stay for Disney if you don't mind using ART and pool isn't important.  Similar hotels close to Disney are twice the price when you include their parking, resort, and WiFi fees.

First time I ever had an issue here, so hate to mention, but my first room had a strange sound coming rom the bathroom. I think it might have been a light bulb but it still made sound with light off too.  only every once in a while and not when the guy cam up of course.  They were very nice and moved down the hall.  Then that room had a flickering light bulb in the bathroom.  I just stayed.  Let them know in the morning so they could fix for the next guest. I stay here a lot and never had a problem before and the people are always great.

Summary Heading: The Best Hotel and Service in Anaheim
Summary: I had a block of 15 rooms for my sons wedding.  I could not have asked for a nicer hotel. The staff was above amazing. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast was great.  I highly recommend this hotel.

We have stayed at the Ayers before, I feel safe there the rooms are big it‚Äôs only 4 floors night the breakfast if great. Most of all the employees a very helpful & nice, you are by a lot of places. Hope to see them soon.

Filled all my request for my room at no extra charge.  Everyone was great to work with.  Very professional!!!  Very convenient location for all my Business in the Orange County area.  Great restaurants and a Starbucks near.

Very nice hotel and great, helpful staff.  Wanted an extra blanket and the front desk brought me one within 5 minutes of my call to request one.  Very close to Disneyland and a shuttle service stops right at the hotel entrance to take you to and return you from the park (only had to pay $5.50 for round trip).  Noticed security guard in parking lot constantly, so it was nice to know my car was safe there during my stay.  Would definitely recommend Ayers Anaheim!

We like our beds soft and these were quite possibly the best beds of any hotel we have ever stayed at. Staff was courteous even if the morning chef gave me grief for being a 49ers fan. Short drive to Disney. We didnt use the shuttles because they were timed and didnt fit with our schedule.

I enjoyed staying at The Ayers. I had a really nice experience. I loved how I was able to still have breakfast when I was late to attend it. Thank you so much for a great experience. I hope to stay there here again and have the same experience.

We decided to go to Anaheim for Thanksgiving and we are glad that we did. The hotel was very nice and the check-in went smoothly. They have a great American breakfast each morning, with enough room to seat several families.  The pool was a little bit small but it was nice to take a dip and then warm up in the hot-tub.  We did notice the noise from the road and highway but we turned on the fan to drown out the noise at night when it was time to get some sleep. (This is the only reason I did not give this hotel and excellent rating.)  The bed was very comfortable, which was awesome! We were happy to get a good night(s) sleep.   We also went to Disneyland and it was a quick drive over there but yet the hotel was far enough away from all the hub-bub, which we liked.  We would

Very happy IÔ∏è found this hotel nice and clean,convenient, 15 min from Disneyland, by little Saigon 15 min. Closed to most of the Vietnamese restaurants. Plans to stay here in the future visit.  Just like the picture my room decent size love it.

Disabled persons who cannot use stairs are placed on upper floors.  Incredible.  The reservation was made six months prior as part of my daughter's wedding party.  Handicapped room was requested and confirmed prior to travel.  The room did not have handicapped toilet or shower.  There were handrails in the shower and hand held shower head.  Pathetic fold out seat that was impossible to use.

Very clean, comfortable and extremely friendly staff.  Great breakfast. Cheap parking and fantastic location.  Couldn‚Äôt of asked for a better hotel for the price.  5 stars all the way. I will be coming back!

Summary Heading: Walk to Honda center across the street!
Summary: This is a nice place. We booked it because it is the only hotel super near Honda center. Turned out to be also just a nice hotel. Helpful and friendly at the front desk too. Decent eating options within short walking. Would also be a good place for seeing Disneyland if you wanted something lower key but still near by. I noticed they have regular shuttles ball day to the theme park.
Manager Response: Dear jrichter82,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience.
