Your compliments regarding our attentive team members and optimal location are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but myheater didn't work
Summary: The hotel is very nice. The location is PERFECT for going to an event at the Honda Center. Fastest walk/arrival to a concert ever. The free breakfast was much, much better than I was expecting. Lots of choices, made to order pancakes, plenty of seating. BUT, the heater in my room (202) didn't work. I turned the AC on before I left for the concert because the room felt stuffy. The AC must have run the entire time I was gone, because the room was an ice box when I returned. I tried to turn on the heater to warm up the room, but it only blew cold air. Someone from the front desk came up and tried to get the heater to work, but couldn't. She brought me extra blankets, which was nice. But it would have been nicer to have a warm room. Also, in the morning, I heard a dog barking in one
Manager Response: Dear maggie3661,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you liked our accommodations as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you kindly for your feedback regarding our complimentary breakfast as well as the in room utilities. Your insight is greatly appreciate and i truly hope you choose to stay with us next time you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The hotel has every ameneties and is comfortable like a big downtown hotel. You feel the excellence of it and you can relax, because its smaller than downtown and its less crowded. What can you say about the location. I knew it was across the street of the Honda center, but from hotel door to Honda center, it take about 2 minutes of walk ( I dont include the traffic light :P but thats the bet of the draw about it)   Schmidt brewery is doing great food and having great beer (according to my dad). It was my #2 restaurant that we tried. I would highly recommand to walk 10 minutes to try the Chili's Grill&Bar, which serve great hamburger and big club sandwich on a really nice toasted bun. Both are good. If you dont wanna walk, Schmidt is good too.  I was really impatient to taste
Manager Response: Dear Dominic21345,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the accommodations and premium amenities we offer. We strive to provide an exceptional guest experience and I am pleased we did just that during your stay. Your insight is greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The Chef was really nice. Over all the hotel was nice and clean. It just too far to walk and sight see other business. There was a miss communication with the shuttle and city transit. But a was all work out when the hotel explain that the hotel do not have hotel shuttle for customers;

We were there for a skating competition.  Staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful.  Wonderful breakfast too!  Rooms spacious and clean.  Close to restaurants and Honda Center.  Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great Staff, Location, and Very Clean!
Summary: We had a very nice experience, from the minute we entered the Hotel. The staff was very courteous, and efficient. The hotel was very clean and the parking lot was secured by a gate, which made me feel safer leaving my vehicle out overnight. The sunset from our room was absolutely beautiful! We were in town for a concert at House of Blues down the street, and the Uber driver had easy access picking us up. Over all, we had a wonderful stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming into Anaheim, for a Ducks game, Disney or Gardenwalk event. Our stay came with a breakfast that we thoroughly enjoyed in the morning. Thank you very much for your hospitality, and an overall great experience!

I came to stay one night at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim, the front desk staff very friendly and helpful. They allow me to early check in at 1:30 instead of 3pm, it helps a lot after a 13 hour long flight. The breakfast had a variety of choices. Overall all very pleasant stay, would definitely come again.

The room was very clean and comfortable.  stayed here for a quick disney getaway.  My family loved this place!  they were kind enough to upgrade us to a 2 king bed suite for free.  Definitely a bonus we weren't expecting.  Very nice and friendly staff.

Visiting the Ducks?  This location is directly across the road from the Honda Center.  Rooms are well maintained and the staff very accommodating.  Not luxurious, but great for a night or two.  No restaurants.  Would stay here again.

The Hotel staff was fantastic. They were very helpful and friendly. This is a very nice place to stay! It's near to Disney and many other OC attractions. Bus transportation was easy to access, as well.

Summary Heading: One night stay at the Ayres Hotel on Katella, Anaheim, CA
Summary: I travel to Anaheim and Santa Ana, CA quite often. Whenever possible, I stay at the Ayres Hotel on Katella, which has been ongoing for me for over 15 years. Last week I spent one night at the Ayres and it was thoroughly enjoyable, as always. The rooms are spacious, the beds are soooo comfortable and nice roomy showers. And the caveot of the trip is the morning buffet breakfast served by the mighty Chef, Jose. He does such a great job with his eggs, meat dishes of bacon, sausage or ham, along with the great hash browns and the hot pancakes or french toast, with maple syrup. Ice cold milk and ice cold juices add to the breakfast, along with toast, breakfast rolls, yogurt, fresh fruit and cereals.Whether you are by yourself or with your spouse or significant other, or with your
Manager Response: Dear Gary T,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am thrilled to see that we are your hotel of choice whenever you are in the Anaheim area. We greatly appreciate your loyalty as well as the insight you provided. Thank you for your compliments regarding our accommodations, premium amenities, and our attentive team members. I look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel stay was so great, clean rooms, great customer service, we will be staying again in the future, breakfast was also great and the location of the hotel was safe and close to many restaurants so much to choose from

We had a comfortable, quiet room on the 4th floor.  Liked that I was contacted via text before our arrival to ask our room preferences.  Very enjoyable, a bit pricey.  Front desk staff was very helpful and courteous.  Nice breakfast (included).

The hotel was comfortable and welcoming.  The beds excellent. The location for us was excellent, it was between the Honda Centre which hosts the ice hockey, and Angels baseball stadium. All of these a few minutes walk from the hotel.  We were lucky to see both an Angels game and minor ice hockey game, how thrilling for a couple of Aussies.  If we get to  Anaheim again this will be our Hotel if choice.  Also, brekkie was an added bonus to fuel up before a day of exploring.  Overall a supberb location, and great value for money.

Been a while since I've bothered to review anything but felt I had to.  From the staff, to the facilities, to the large, well appointed rooms I couldn't fault this place. Great hot breakfast included also.  Perfect proximity for Honda Center (and Angel Stadium) - even a printer in the lobby for your tickets  Easy walking distance from Anaheim station, even with bags

Check in was quick and easy.  The young lady with the pretty red hair made my wife and I feel very welcomed.  I am a light sleeper when on vacation.  We requested a room away from the elevator and ice machine.  She accommodated us.  Our room was very clean and large.  It had a fridge and a microwave.  The bed was comfortable.  We were close to shopping, the freeway and restaurants.  We were in a very safe location. We only stayed for one night.  And the morning  breakfast was tasty.  Parking was FREE.

This is by far the best hotel I've ever stayed at! We were greeted with friendly faces and warm chocolate chip cookies. The staff was very welcoming and the rooms are spacious and very up to date. The complimentary breakfast was way more then what I expected! Such an accommodating hotel, I definitely will be a returning customer for future trips

Great location, next to Honda Centre and Anaheim Train Station and also the Disneyland shuttle bus picks you up and drops you off at the front of the hotel. Great size rooms and very clean and accommodating and reception was very helpful, defiantly recommend!

I thought the hotel was great.  They have a social hour M-Th, from 5:30-6:30 PM.  Free beer, wine, etc... I was unable to attend, because I was out and about.  The room was nice and clean, and housekeeping (Alma) did a great job.  The ART bus picks up and drops off right in front of the lobby.  Do this if you are going to Disneyland.

We LOVE the Ayres hotel!  We have stayed there a number of times not only because of the awesome location (right across from Honda Centre - we come to watch hockey games) but also because the staff is beyond friendly, professional and accommodating.  One visit, my daughter was given a hockey stick at the hockey game and the staff went out of their way to find boxes and packing tape so we could get it home on the plane!  And every time we come to the Ayres they remember us and our love of hockey!  The rooms are nice and clean and the breakfast is just great!  We would stay at this hotel again!  We can't wait to return to the Ayres!

Check in quick, informative and easy. Room large, comfy and clean. Bed also comfortable. Shower was good although not very powerful. Breakfast nice - friendly chef - could be a little bit cramped and noisy. Good Wi-Fi (you did need to sign in each day) and computers could be used in reception. Parking was extra - $10 dollars per day. We found all staff to be friendly. Pool area clean. Small but hardly used during our stay. Microwave in room but no cutlery. Would definitely stay here again. Close to the freeway. Across the road from the Honda Centre where the Anaheim Ducks play ice hockey also near the Angel Stadium

I stayed here with my family last year and it was nice, so I made a reservation for this year. It was difficult to make the reservation -- took three attempts. The rate I was given seemed reasonable, so I went ahead and made the reservation.   My family and I noticed things had changed quite a bit since last year. The beds weren't as comfortable; they were way too soft, as in they felt broken down, the firmness was gone. The hallways had a strange odor, not as clean as they were last year. At least our room was very clean, which was good. The bed linens were actually crunchy, though, from an excessive amount of bleach. The smell of bleach was extremely strong and it made it difficult to sleep.  At checkout, I noticed we were charged $40 more than stated in our pre-arrival
Manager Response: Dear Cardinal R,  I am so sorry that your stay was not as it should been, that you were not comfortable and had some concerns regarding the smell of bleach. I have addressed that with the housekeeping staff. I did look into your rate concerns and I appreciate your responding to my email. I found the rate did not change from the point of reservation to the time of check out. I also noticed that we do not quote a rate $40 lower than the rate for a similar booking. I am sorry that our staff member did not convey the appropriate amount of concern in response to your complaint about the rate. I have spoken with him.  I am disappointed that you will not be staying with us again. I do hope that you reconsider.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed here while visiting Disneyland. Our family travels a lot and this hotel really impressed us! Very clean rooms, nice and helpful front desk, and delicious breakfast cooked by Jose. We highly recommend and would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here after a whole day spent in the airport, broken plane, ,5 missed connections, lost luggage, this hotel gave us everything needed to get thru the night with nothing! Razors, shaving crm, deoderant, toothbrushes, toothpaste and some amazing spa creams left on the bed :) great service!

My family recently stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for our Disneyland vacation and we were impressed with the service. The day we arrived was a bit of a nightmare, it took us 3 hours to travel from LAX. The on duty manager was very kind and ensured we were able to get something to eat before the kitchen closed at the restaurant across the street.  Pros: + friendly staff that were helpful & professional + Clean rooms & common areas + Full breakfast was very nice with a range of items; oatmeal, cereal, bagels, fruit, eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, pancakes, yogurt & more. + ART shuttle picks up/drops off right at the front door. The #15 was never crowded  + Beds were comfy  + Rooms had free wireless, Microwave, fridge, coffee maker  Cons: - Not much in the way of stores or restaurants

Comfy beds and cozy rooms. Staff is very friendly and breakfast was delicious, and  The cook makes Mickey mouse pancakes! We have stayed here multiple times and have always found the rooms to be clean and quiet. The hotel is a transit stop so it is easy to get to Disneyland.

We found the Ayres Hotel Anaheim to be very clean, well kept and had a great full breakfast, with chef. It is ideally located a block from the Honda Center, and the Anaheim Regional Transportation (bus) center. A bit of a drive to Disneyland, but they do have a shuttle, and the price is way lower than any D'land area hotels

We enjoyed our overnight at this hotel and look forward to staying at other Ayers properties in the future. The lobby and guest room decor were pleasing, the room was clean, bed was comfortable (so important!) and there was nice attention to detail. The executive studio with a king bed had an attractive divider, microwave and mini frig. But bring your own coffee. The little coffeemaker does not produce a satisfying cup.  The option to choose your location in the hotel before check-in was helpful. We chose the top floor away from the elevator and it was very quiet.   The full breakfast was very good and the dining room was comfortable.  One suggestion for the hotel: The cookies offered in the late afternoon is a nice touch, but having good brewed coffee available in the lobby

Summary Heading: the place was very clean and the staff was very curtious
Summary: My room was very clean and well maintain. the house keeping staff was on point in performing there duties. I love the breakfast. Jos√© the chef prepared all the food and it was not over cooked and the presentation was outstanding. And also the food was great.

My family and I love the Ayres Hotel; when we travel we typically look for an Ayres Hotel. Our stay was brief but nice.  Not fond of the per day parking, but hotel is clean, quiet and comfortable.  Staff is always pleasant.

Honestly this place delivered in spades again. It doesn't disappoint. It is worth the every penny. I highly recommend this hotel over the closer hotels to Disney. The service is exceptional. Thanks again for a great experience for my son and I.

This was our second time staying at the hotel, but it‚Äôs been quite a few years since the first stay. The staff was very helpful, the room was spotless, and there was plenty of parking. I like the location of the hotel, but some might not like how close it is to the freeway.

Summary Heading: I am happy I found this Hotel
Summary: It was the first time I stayed in a Ayres Hotel and i am impresst with the service and the professional handling. I signed up for the award program and I intent to use it more frequently. The rooms were clean and it was nice to have courtesy  breakfast. The special treat was the cookies at night.

Unfortunately we arrived late to our hotel and barely spent 12 hours there. The bed was excellent truly comfortable. The room and facilities wonderful. Breakfast superb. Bathroom clean and spacious. I want to live there. Across the road is the Honda Centre and the hockey. I hope to get back.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you want something on a budget
Summary: We stayed at this hotel during our recent trip to Disneyland. This hotel is priced very competetively to other places near Disneyland & that is for a reason, it is 2-3 miles from Disneyland which means you have to take the shuttle to/from hotel to Disneyland which can take time & money. We had breakfast included in the room rate but we were not impressed with the food, they were using all frozen food and cooking it in front of us. Even with a chef there were no cooked omlettes etc. Coffee was from a machine & so was the juice/beverages. In other words breakfast was crap to our standards. Pool was outdoor and not heated, so only usable in the sun. Sauna was so hot, we could not sit in it for more than 5 minutes. Sink is outside the bathroom in most of the rooms and room sizes are

Summary Heading: Good hotel but underperformed for its rating.
Summary: The hotel was clean but at 4.5 stars the comforters are thin and cheap.  The AC in the room worked like a champ.  The morning breakfast was way over hyped.  I‚Äôm in the airline industry and I stay at hotels weekly.  This is one of the first times were you have to stand in line and wait for the chef/server to give you premade eggs and sausages like you‚Äôre in elementary school.  It took us 15-20 min to get our food because the lady was cooking French toast and keeping the potatoes hot at the same time.  There was only about 6-8 people ahead of us.  To avoid this they can easily just do what most hotels do and just let the customer serve themselves.  They also had one guy to clean the tables but he was really slow and left the tables unattended.  When we got our food there was only
Manager Response: Dear Dan,  I am sorry that your experience at the hotel was not as it should have been. I would like to address your concerns in the order provided. I can assure you, as the person responsible for controlling expenses, that our down comforters are far from cheap! They are slim, but that is the beauty of a real down comforter. We have considered self service for breakfast but when doing research have noticed that the food is often not warm, and the food is often prone to drying up. We do our best to ensure the best quality, cooking our pancakes or french toast to order and ensuring the food is kept warm. We cook our scrambled eggs that morning and top up through the morning, as we do for all the breakfast items. I am sorry that you caught us at a busy time when we got  behind and I am sorry that you had to wait.   All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I really enjoyed my stay here. The room had all the amenities needed but it had that small hotel feel--quaint and sweet and perfect for my 3 day business trip. The spacious room had microwave, fridge, sitting area, coffee/tea. Every afternoon we were greeted with warm freshly baked chocolate cookies and happy hour (enjoyed carafes of wines and chips). Every morning we enjoyed a full breakfast.  For dinner, we walked across the street to the nice restaurant with a varied menu.  This hotel was close to many places.  I enjoyed our stay there.

Summary Heading: Made me feel like they wanted my business
Summary: From booking with them on the phone to check in, etc, Andrew was perfect. He made sure everything was perfect for my stay! The room was clean, the staff was very accommodating to any extras i needed for the room. Breakfast was great too.. not the stuff you get at Holiday inn express üòú

Excellent location in the heart of Anaheim. The service was also excellent from the moment I made my reservation to the point that we checked out, and beyond. Clean comfortable rooms and walking distance to the Honda Center, train station, restaurants and more, it was perfect. The price was right, too!

From the moment we got out of the taxi in from of the Ayres we knew this was going to be good.  We were only there for 1 night to see a concert at the Honda Center and I am glad we picked this place to stay.  Staff at the front desk as soon as we walked in were great, friendly, efficient and had us to our room quickly. The room was comfortable and the bed was like sleeping on clouds....I need to find the same pillows for at my place! TJ Schmidt's across the street IS the place for food and drinks....free poured drinks meant we only needed 2, and the food was delicious. Super convenient to the concert across the street, and I hear Disney is not that far. We had to leave at 5am the next day to get our plane so we didnt get to enjoy the complimentary breakfast but the AM staff was

The Anaheim Ayers hotel is a quality find that is very conveniently located near several Anaheim area attractions including Disneyland.  The hotel is in very good condition, clean and offers the convenience of a complimentary hot breakfast.  The staff was very friendly and helpful when needed.  My wife and I were visiting a friend in town and we were pleased to find a reasonably-priced quality hotel such a short distance from our destination.  For California Angels fans, the hotel is just down the street from Angels stadium and it is across the street from the Honda arena for hockey fans. I would be happy to recommend this hotel.

I stayed on the fourth floor Monday through Friday. The room was clean, and had everything I needed for my stay.   The breakfast was above average compared to the typical banana and a muffin. They had cut fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, bacon, cereal selection, hot coco and coffee machine.  I worked out in the small gym which had free weights, a cable machine, a treadmill, and bike.  The pool was enjoyable.  The negatives were there was mild freeway noise which I only noticed when I looked out the window, and that the hot tub smelled like feet.

/we spent wo night at this hotel. We have season passes to Disneyland and thought this would be a good time to do a visit. The hotel is not right next door to the park. It is about 15 to 29 minutes away, but there is a shuttle that runs on a schedule of between 25 and 40 minutes. The hotel has 1 and 3 day passes you can buy for the shuttle. One word of warning is that we found the shuttles to be unreliable. One night we had to wait nearly and hour to get back to the hotel. An alternative in Uber which costs about $5 each way for a couple.  The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are many in the area including a grill within easy walking distance. It is best to check the Ducks schedule as the stadium is directly across the street and Angel Stadium is just down the road.

A great place to stay. Excellent location for Disneyland and a good base for all LA visitor attractions. Front desk staff smiling and friendly throughout our visit and never too busy to stop and chat or answer any questions. Always greeted on our return back to the hotel which was a lovely experience. A decent complementary breakfast daily consisting of a hot buffet and pastries, fruit and cereal. Great staff in the restaurant too. Room/Suite which we had for our stay - 402 was very comfortable and we had no issues whatsoever during our 18 night stay. Serviced daily, it contained a small fridge/microwave kitchenette area at one side of the room where coffee could be made (replenished daily). King size very comfortable bed. Fully air-conditioned room. Hotel provides happy hour

I loved everything about the hotel except the pool. It's size seemed inadequate for such a beautiful hotel.   The room was clean and spacious. The complimentary breakfast was amazing compared to ones I've experienced at other hotels.

We enjoyed our stay. The room had a fridge, microwave and was clean and comfortable. Great location too, right across the street from the Honda Center. The beds were very comfortable. The breakfast the following morning was delicious and well prepared.

My family and I were headed to Knotts. We were celebrating my daughter's 9th birthday.  In my reservation through the Arye's website I added in the comments if it would be possible to purchase balloons for our stay so we could surprise my daughter when we walked in the room. Upon arrival there were some balloons in our room with a birthday card for her.  she was elated!  So let it be known that the balloon request was very short notice- so the hotel had gathered up some Disney balloons that I'm pretty sure were left by another traveler and put them in our room. So they did their best to accommodate my request on such short notice :)

Our stay was fantastic. Polite intelligent staff checked us in.  The rooms were spacious.  Bed was very comfortable. Everything was clean.  The location was perfect. We were able to walk to everything.  Next time we will take the train

my one and only issues. There was a event at the Pond across the street. The Ayers was now selling parking spaces to the public. Making guest of the hotel to park in the back side of the hotel. It is alot darker and farther away from entrance to hotel. This did not sit well with the family.

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay close to Disney parks
Summary: Comfortable room, decent breakfast, close drive to Disneyland. Also, shuttle bus to Disney available. The sink is outside the bathroom. Could not hear noise from the adjacent highways. Friendly staff.

The Ayers Hotel is my new favorite hotel the front desk staff were amazing, and kind. Everyone who helped us gave us individual attention and made us feel like we were very important to them. This is a rare quality in this day and age. The internet WiFi  worked great, the room was beautiful and clean. I felt secure and comfortable. The breakfast was amazing too. This is how guest should be treated. Not like we are bother but as special guest. All my family and friends know how wonderful my stay was. The air conditioner was the best part of my stay. I like it cold  and the ac worked like a dream it was like Antarctica in the room. I slept like a baby.  Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

Hotel website says Disneyland is 2 miles away, we found it closer to a4-5 mile  drive. The hotel staff were all very nice and friendly. The breakfast was better than expected. Scrambled eggs, potatoes, pancakes, toast, bagels,cereal, fruit,yogurt. We were very happy with this hotel and will definitely stay here again. Only thing I would change is I wish it was closer to Disneyland. Other than that it was perfect! Comfy beds, clean rooms. We travel with a 10 and 13 year old. They loved the room!

The site states that they have complementary shuttle, we found that the shuttle is not available for going to Disneyland, but they promote a shuttle for $5.50 each way. This was an issue for our group of 13.

Large room with fridge and microwave.  Room and bathroom were extremely clean and bedding and towels were very good quality.  Breakfast was first class with generous portions and choice.  All staff were very helpful and friendly.  Complimentary reception in the evening (wine/beer/soft drinks and snacks) as well.  There is a guest laundry, gym and pool.  This is an excellent hotel.
Manager Response: Dear vfrtom,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to provide some feedback. I am happy to see that you were pleased with the accommodations we provided, as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members and for sharing your experience. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Treated like family at the Ayres
Summary: I stay at the Ayres Anaheim on the average of 12 nights a month, so I have a good perspective on good days and not-so-good days. The front desk staff, especially Ashley and Leslie, are always friendly & efficient, and take the time to make sure each guest is taken care of. The beds and pillows are super comfortable, and the rooms have plenty of space to stretch out. Parking is secure and easy. Angels Stadium is right next door - the perfect place to take a safe early morning run! Jose in the breakfast room is great, and the selection of food is good.  I've had small issues on occasion - air conditioning, plumbing, coffee makers - and these problems are ALWAYS handled right away. After more than 120 nights at this place, I can say without a doubt I would not want to stay anywhere
Manager Response: Dear KLIB2014,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided, as well as your continued loyalty to our hotel. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated, along with the kind compliments you have shared regarding our team and spacious accommodations. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Ayres is our go to Hotel locally...
Summary: We usually stay at Ayres when either we have work done at the house and etc... We had a major brush from on 10/9/17 and had to find a hotel. I was fortunate enough to get a last minute room. We we got the room the Owners of Ayres waived additional parking fees and discounted the rooms for all of the Fire evacuees that night. That is the advantage of family own business   We will try continue to stay at Ayres and recommend it to family and friends.

Overall a really great experience. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself was very nice. My only critique is that it seemed like there was only one shot at maid service, and if it was missed, that was it.

The room was spacious and had enough towels and pillows to accommodate our family of four.   The beds are comfortable and despite the proximity of the freeway we could not hear the freeway noise.  Breakfast was very good, cook was friendly and accommodating.

My daughters and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim during our visit to Disneyland. The staff was friendly and helpful. The cookies in the evening were a fun extra! And the breakfast in the morning was fabulous! We will definitely stay there again.

The customer service was the best. Andrew up front was awesome and he remembered us and our event the next day. And night manager complimented us on our way in and asked to be of service. Great service!!!

Summary Heading: Right across the street from Amtrak train station  - Excellent place to stay if you‚Äôre traveling with Amtrak
Summary: Excellent place to stay if you are traveling from Seattle via Amtrak !   Safe, clean and hot breakfast included - and moderately priced .   I am in a 55-year-old lady that was traveling by myself and was very comfortable staying there and also it was close enough to the train station that I easily walked with my luggage .

We absolutely love this hotel ! The rooms are great and the staff is superb. I‚Äôve been staying at this hotel often over the last year and a half and it‚Äôs always consistent, I‚Äôve never been disappointed. We never stay anywhere else in the area .

I stay here all the time for the Anaheim Ducks Hockey Games and have been for years.  We also stay for special occasions and events.  The location is prime and the staff and service is top notch.  Marcus the Manager is so accommodating and sensitive to our requests always.  The breakfast is amazing and Jose the Chef is wonderful.They all work very hard to keep you happy. They have happy hour and homemade cookies during that time to during the week.  We just always feel at home here and only stay here.  Candy Feliz

Beautiful hotel, clean rooms, attentive and helpful staff. Shuttle takes you right to Disney for $5.50 for an adult but you can always Uber and get dropped right off. Shuttle ride is very bumpy. I definitely would stay at any of the Ayres Hotels in the future.

We had an awesome time staying here during our trip, we booked the ayres hotel after reading all the great reviews and the hotel lived up to all of them. The hotel is located in a great location mins from disneyland and a short walk to the Honda center and Angels stadium. The weekday breakfast cook was amazing. We will definitely stay here again.

very nice hotel good staff and excellent breakfast shuttle service for Disney only took 10 mins and ran every 20 mns, offered an upgrade on room at arrival at a good price very impressed overall. room was very clean hotel was well situated for disney

We stayed two nights to re-visit Disneyland, a ten minute easy drive, although the hotel also has a $5 shuttle. The Honda Center is just across the street.  The hotel is clean, comfortable, friendly and quiet. Includes a full breakfast with delicious hot/cold food. Also a very affordable laundry facility, great for travellers to recharge their suitcases. We would stay there again. Half the price of D'land area hotels.
Manager Response: Dear clive m,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am happy to see that you enjoyed your experience. Thank you for your compliments regarding our great value, optimal location, and the accommodations we offer. Thank you again for your wonderful feedback. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: It was a great hotel. Breakfast was great. In a great location. They worked with our family to keep us together. We had access to great restaurants  and a quick trip to Disney.   All in all a great choice..
Manager Response: Dear bell 427,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast, as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you again for your feedback. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: The Ayres Hotel a Pleasant stay.
Summary: The services were excellent the staff were very respectful and kind Best beds I ever sleept in, the rooms were very clean, big and very comfortable. The Breakfast was delicious.  I look forward to my next stay at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim  This Hotel is in a perfect locate with Metrolink and Amtrak trains and Angel Stadium are just in walking distance.

My family has been staying at this particular Ayres for a number of years now.  Always clean, friendly.  I appreciate the fact that they have had consistent main staff there for a considerable time, it makes me feel that they are fair to their employees.  I have never had a bad experience here

Great place to go, especially if your attending events at Honda center or Anaheim Stadium,( both within walking distance) The free breakfast is OK, just go early to beat the crowd. The basis are there, eggs, potatoes, and a breakfast meat. They also have fresh fruit, cereals, and pastries.

Great stay. Friendly staff and excellent breakfast included. Easy access from I5 and good location for nearby sports event in Honda Center or Angel Stadion. Free use of outdoor Jacuzzi, swimmingpool and exercise room.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay perfect location
Summary: Whether you. are you going to the Honda Center, the stadium or in the area for business this place is great. This hotel has always come through for me. Very clean and great service. There are many great restaurants within 2 miles

Deanna was great! Planning a wedding from across the country is not easy, but Deanna helped us with our unique requests and great rates. Super helpful staff and everything went flawlessly! Thank you!!

The rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. Ample parking and the breakfast is a much better quality than the competition. Clean is most important to me. I have been so pleased with the Ayres culture.

Second time around at the Ayers Anaheim and it was another great stay.  Super close to the train station, Honda Center and Anaheim Stadium.  Small challenge with the AC, spoke to Andrew at the front desk and it was taken care of when we returned from lunch.  Speaking of food, great breakfast in the morning, my daughter loves the pancakes.  We'll be back.
Manager Response: Dear dat827,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent experience. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel and our complimentary full American breakfast. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Perfect Accommodations for High School Reunions
Summary: ‚Ä¢Describe the service you experienced My wife and I recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim to attend my high school reunion held across the street from JT Schmid's Restaurant & Brewery, which is a popular location for such reunions in Southern Caiifornia.  The rates were reasonable given its location across the street from the Honda Center.  Our room was clean and nicely appointed, and the free breakfast was delicious and fresh!  But best of all were the hotel staff who greeted you each day and made every effort to ensure your comfort.  I would definitely stay at the Ayres Hotel again!
Manager Response: Dear Chris K,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the accommodations we offer. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our hotel, optimal location, and attentive team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your feedback and I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Went for an impromptu parents' night off. Grounds were well kept and staff helpful. Bed was so comfy. Hot breakfast offerings were very yummy. Skip the coffee though. Also, wish they had HBO, but at least there's free Wifi.
Manager Response: Dear jomia32,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the accommodations provided as well as the attentive service our team members offer. Thank you again for your feedback, I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim was terrific. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Everyone that works in the hotel is very friendly....from the front desk to the security guard. The hotel is right across the street from the Honda Center and within walking distance of Anaheim Angeles Stadium. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Dear viper4113,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the spacious accommodations we offer. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our hotel, optimal location, and attentive team members are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the feedback and I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days. We enjoyed it and will stay again. Walking distance to Angels stadium and the Honda Center. Short ride to Disneyland. A shuttle comes to the hotel about every 40 minutes for Disney. Cost $6 per person. A restaurant across the street delivers and most pizza places do as well. Other fast food is a .5 mile up the road. Close to the interstate. Didn't hear a lot of traffic. LA tourist attractions including Universal are an hour away due to heavy LA traffic. John Wayne Airport is 20 minutes away. Breakfast every morning serving eggs, bacon, sausage, cereal and pancakes. Housekeeping came early and did a fabulous job. Pool and hot tub are outdoors. Pay to park. We did not have a car so I can't speak to this. Free WIFI. Plenty of outlets for

Very nice hotel, convenient location from Disney with a shuttle that brings you there. Room are nice and they have upgraded us to an executive room for free. Very pleasant employees, very clean rooms.

Excellent service and very nice ambiance.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The daily free breakfast was delicious!  Large room with extra comfy bed made it very relaxing. Will for sure stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear MgRead,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members, spacious accommodations, and our inviting atmosphere are warmly welcomed. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and a great location
Summary: The hotel was clean, great breakfast and friendly staff. It's across from Honda center and in front of Anaheim Stadium. Parking was limited, although it was only $10 for hotel guests instead of $40 for the public. There is also a laundry room.

As always their customer service is second to none! The entire staff pays great attention to detail.The newly remodeled rooms are comfortable and meticulous. Beds are extremely comfortable.  We always look forward to our stay at the Ayres Hotel.

We stayed in this hotel only for one night. Very convenient location in walking distance to the Honda Center where we went for a concert.  The front desk was friendly and welcoming. Rooms are big and very clean. Nice decor, beds comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was included and delicious.

Really like the place. Nice that we didn't need to anywhere to catch breakfast. Didn't have to drive far to any of our destinations. Have stayed here twice already. So many characters. Don't have that much to say..

Summary Heading: Employees and Breakfast make this place
Summary: All the employees I had contact with (Front Desk, Housekeeping, Cook) were great. Breakfast very good especially fresh cooked pancakes. Room > plenty of space especially for one person. Short safe walk to Angels Stadium.
Manager Response: Dear atruesag,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am ecstatic to read of your experience at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim. As a team, we strive to provide excellent service and redefine hospitality. I am pleased to see that we did just that during your visit. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I absolutely loved the stay here, from the time of check-in to check-out. The staff is extremely friendly, no matter what time it is. The hotel is very clean, everything is pretty much updated. The tram fare from this hotel for one day to Disneyland is only about 6 bucks per person. This hotel also has complimentary full breakfast that is so delicious, they serve Mickey pancakes and French toast depending on the day, with bacon and sausage, eggs and potatoes. Their coffee was so good! I honestly can't say enough good things about this place!

Sadly, I didn't take any pics of this place.  It was a last min booking. Got a great rate on a king room.  Had sofa sleeper w/nice partition btw sofa & bed.  Bed was comfortable & it came with breakfast - fresh cooked pancakes, scrambled eggs, hash browns...  Very close to frwy. Made it extremely easy to get to Whittier the next day.  Would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Dear Joanne R,  Thank you so much for the candid review of our hotel. I am thrilled to read of your pleasant experience. Your compliments regarding the value we provide, spacious accommodations, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My family stayed here, for several weeks, due to a medical procedure at a local hospital for one of my family members.  Stressful as this was, the Ayres Hotel Anaheim staff was extraordinary and made us feel welcome from the time we checked in to our departure.  They became like a family to us.  Huge thanks to everyone, and especially, Jordan, who was caring, kind, helpful and always had a smile on his face.    The room was lovely, serene and quiet, with a side street view of the local restaurant and Honda Center.  A daily shuttle made it easy for us to get to the hospital or local restaurants and stores.  Every evening there is a Happy Hour in the lobby where wine and non-alcoholic beverages and snacks can be enjoyed.  Perfect!  Oh, and the warm, freshly-baked sugar cookies

I have to come to Orange county for business, sometime at the last minute. The Ayres Hotel Anaheim always has a nice clean room for me at a reasonable rate. This is why I don't even bother to look at other hotels trying to find cheaper rates.

After our 5th visit in 2012 I reviewed this hotel (see link at the end of this review) and after our 7th visit in August of 2017 I think another update is warranted.  Once again they have updated the interior of the hotel, new decor inside and outside the rooms, an improvement in both cases.  Our room was like new inside, very clean, perfect for our extended family trip to Disneyland.  Clearly a lot of effort is put into keeping this hotel clean and up-to-date.  Once again, the same chef we had 10 years ago at Ayres made excellent breakfasts and is very friendly to the guests, with special mickey mouse pancakes for our kids.  The new parking fee is a little annoying, but we were given a discount because of the extended stay, so a relatively minor issue.  I will continue to

Very classy hotel. Part of the 22 location Ayres family group of hotels. I have stayed at several locations. Staff is very friendly and professional. Very good hot breakfast in Anaheim. Hotel accommodations are very comfortable and up to date. Lots of stone work at the hotels.  Soundproofing is excellent.

We just stayed 1 night for CHOC walk but had great customer service and clean room. We had a 1 queen bed and Ada room. Bathroom was large for my daughters wheelchair and in bath tub a bench for her to shower. We weren't able to eat breakfast there since we had to leave 4am. Looking forward to staying again in October.

The Ayres in Anaheim offers all that you need for your trip to the Anaheim area. The hotel is close to many things such as Disneyland, Anaheim Stadium and Chapman University. I have stayed there many times in the past and will continue to do so!

Summary Heading: The Ayres Hotel is clean, comfortable and staff is very friendly
Summary: Our room was very comfortable with great beds, refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. We stayed there to go to the Angel stadium. You can walk from the hotel to the stadium. Very convenient. We enjoyed our stay very much
Manager Response: Dear Don T,  Thank you kindly for your review. I am thrilled to read about your pleasant experience at the Ayres Hotel Anahiem. It is a delight to see that you enjoyed our well-appointed accommodations. Your compliments regarding our optimal location and premium amenities are warmly welcomed and I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The Ayres Hotel offers everything you will need for your trip to Anaheim. We stayed there recently because the hotel is close to Chapman University. Many folks were there to take advantage of the close proximity to Disneyland along with all of the amenities offered by the hotel such as shuttle service, complimentary breakfast and happy hour. Parking is also easy and secure.

Summary Heading: Look out, established mid-to-upper range hotel chains! Ayres has raised the bar!
Summary: First of all, please remember that this is in southern California near the Disney resorts, so you have to accept that EVERYTHING you might normally pay low to mid $100s for per night in other parts of the country is going to be considerably higher here.  That said, we were not the least bit disappointed with what we got for what we paid - probably a reasonable rate compared to other more established hotel brands in the area. We had never heard of Ayres before this visit, so we were cautiously optimistic based on the reviews we had read. From the moment we pulled into the parking lot to the moment we left, we were most pleased with the quality and value.  Let's start with the staff - everyone we encountered was very courteous, engaging and professional - from the desk clerks, to

Ayres Family Hotel. We stayed on the fourth, top floor facing away from highway was great. Inexpensive, they don't ding you for parking, family-equipped rooms, close to Chapman University, Disneyland and if you are so inclined walking access to Angels stadium! Very friendly and gracious staff. Not fancy, but comfortable for short stays and not much more to be said!
Manager Response: Dear Traveller97215,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review informing others of your recent experience at Ayres Hotel Anaheim. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members, optimal location, and comfortable accommodations are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight. I look forward to serving you shortly in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Front Desk, shuttle bus driver, breakfast crew....everyone friendly and available to make sure all of my needs were met. This hotel is easy access to the theme parks and walking distance to Angels Stadium. Loved the gym and the hot tub and pool....sparkling and clean! The grounds were perfectly groomed. The nightly price of these rooms is VERY affordable for all of what it includes....even a little happy hour in the lobby! I've been referring this hotel to my Orange County friends as a great place for their guests to stay.
Manager Response: Dear Christine S,  Thank you so much for the great review of our hotel. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members are greatly appreciated. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our optimal location as well as the premium amenities we offer. I am thrilled to know that you enjoyed your experience and I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Awesome hotel!  I can't say enough good things about the staff.  They went WELL above and beyond!  They did everything they could to make our stay wonderful.  This helped us during a very stressful week of competition.  The cook was great.  However, the choices of breakfast wasn't as broad as I prefer.  The location really can't be beat.  Across the street from the Honda Center.  Angle Stadium was almost next door.  Convention Center was only a few minutes away.  My only complaint was the rooms would freeze you out.  There wasn't a happy medium.  I like to sleep in a cold room though.  Just be prepared if you stay in the room a lot.

This was the 3rd hotel  we stayed at during our trip to California.  And by far, it was the best one!  We rented the 2 room suite, which was very spacious, giving our family of 5 plenty of room to spread out.  The breakfast each morning was very good and fresh.  Having a chef actually prepare your eggs, potatoes, sausage (or bacon), and pancakes fresh for you was a nice added touch.  We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear kdpics77,  I am pleased to see that our accommodations were by far the best during your getaway. Your compliments regarding our spacious suites and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Very convenient to the HONDA CENTER.  Staff was extremely helpful and nice.  I would stay again.  Hot tub and pool well maintained.  Breakfast included. Bed was very comfortable and the maid service was excellent.
Manager Response: Dear Liz T,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel and the premium amenities we offer. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Awesome place to stay for events at the Honda Center!  The hotel was very nice, short walk across the street to our concert.  Very nice evening reception and morning breakfast- our whole family loved our stay!
Manager Response: Deat bbmmmw,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you for your insight, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The Hotel staff mad check in very easy.  They staff was very accommodating when we needed to upgrade to a larger room.  The rooms were clean and nice and comfortable.  The wine selection was also quite nice.
Manager Response: Dear eric s,  I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel as well as the service our attentive team members consistently provide. Thank you for your compliments regarding our spotless accommodations and premium amenities. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: After a mix-up on the reservation when we arrived, (be SURE to keep your confirmation), we were assigned a room. The air conditioning was not working, so the staff gave us the room next door. The front desk was friendly and the room was clean. It was less than a 10 minute walk to the Angels game, just down the street. I would stay there again.  If not for the reservation error (their mistake) I would give this a 5 star rating.
Manager Response: Dear cynthia m,  Thank you kindly for your review. Please accept my sincere apologies for the confusion upon check-in. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed a pleasant experience with the exception of the slight mix up. Thank you again for your insight. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Across the street from Amtrak - Anaheim & AWESOME!
Summary: We stayed here for our last night in Anaheim so we could wake up next door to the Amtrak - Anaheim station. The hotel was super responsive and gave us connecting room, had a pack-n-play set up in our room and it was gorgeous! Also, we could see fireworks out of our window at 9:30 pm, so that was a bonus! We might stay here next time for our entire Disney visit!!!
Manager Response: Dear signup_quote,  I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members, as well as our optimal location. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Very nice hotel, clean rooms and respectful staff. The location is on point as well, right across the street from the Honda center. Couldn‚Äôt have had a better stay anywhere else. I would recommend Ayres to all of my friends and family
Manager Response: Dear 353jordan,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and our optimal location. Your compliments regarding our attentive and professional team members are greatly appreciated. We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Large room, excellent location, great value!
Summary: The room is larger than I expected for the area. Our room had a very comfy king bed with a dividing wall (with cute shutters) between the bed and the sitting area.  There's a dresser with a swivel tv between the two areas.  We easily viewed the tv from the sofa, and from the bed at night.  The sitting area had a very comfy leather loveseat and a large coffee table.  There's also a small dining table with 2 chairs, and desk with a  leather chair. There's also a wet bar (small counter area with a sink), including a fridge, microwave, coffee maker (and coffee/creamer/sugar/cups). The vanity area is well lit with room to set my toiletries and makeup. The shower/tub combo isn't fancy (it's fiberglass), but it is so much larger than most hotel shower/tub combos!  The rooms was very

Summary Heading: Comfortable and Quiet Hotel Away From The Bustle!
Summary: My family of 4 stayed at the Ayres Hotel for 5 nights in August. The hotel is located near Anaheim Stadium about a mile from Disneyland. The neighborhood is quiet and modern. Check-in was fast and very smooth. We had a 2 Queen Bedroom on the 4th floor. The room was much larger than I expected. It had a corner desk, large dresser, a good size closet with a safe, and a sink/counter with microwave and mini-fridge. The shower/tub/toilet and the bathroom sink are not connected. There was plenty of counter space and a salon size pistol hair dryer. I believe the TV was a 32" model. The beds were firm and comfortable with extra pillows. The AC worked flawlessly. The WIFI connection was a bit inconsistent at times. Our reservation included breakfast. The breakfast menu was extensive and

Summary Heading: What a Lovely Hotel & Fab Staff
Summary: We spent 7 nights in this lovely hotel. You could not get a friendlier hotel . From the moment we checked in we were met with lovely friendly smiles and this continued throughout our stay .  Rooms very clean , high quality bed linen and towels and house keeping was to a very high standard .  Breakfast - this was included in our stay and while we did not avail of it everyday when we did the quality was very good and again met with a lovely warm greeting from the chefs working there .  To us this hotel offered us value for money , a short direct drive from Disneyland in a safe area with a fantastic group of staff working in it .  Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to stay in Anaheim .  M

Summary Heading: More Than I Usually Spend, But Worth It for Its Proximity to Angels Stadium
Summary: I booked this hotel because it is walking distance to Angels Stadium.  From the moment I arrived, staff were pleasant and helpful.  The lobby is lovely, and the rooms spacious.  The room was much too cold when I entered it, delaying my being able to take the shower I was longing for, but it was nice to have a real thermostat to control the temperature.  The bed was perfect, but the sofa was uncomfortably hard.  There were many options for breakfast, and ample table seating (something I do not always encounter when I travel).  The gift shop had several snack choices and sundries.  I especially liked the cold drink fridge with the automated voice that thanked me for my purchase.

Marcus is an exceptional General Manager. I've known him for years, and not once has he failed to deliver with Ritz Carlton equivalent service. I highly recommend Ayres Hotel in Anaheim, based on the Five Star service of Marcus, and his leadership, which is evident via his staff!
Manager Response: Dear Jim,  Thanks so much for your kind comments and your loyalty over so many years. It is always a pleasure to host you, long may it continue!.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: We have stayed at this Ayres hotel several times. This time around there was a new person at the front desk. Jordan was very helpful, prompt, and friendly. He took the time to mention to us about a baseball game the evening of our check-in, which was appreciated because of the impact on traffic in the area. Andrew, standing next to Jordan, was his usual friendly self, and also took the time to talk to us briefly. We appreciate the familiar feeling of the staff at this hotel. The parking security guard even said hello. The rooms are quiet, clean, and comfortable. The included breakfast is fantastic, fresh, and varied. Parking is reasonably priced too. We are fans of the Ayres and they continue to impress!

This hotel has wonderful beds.  I think that's one of the most important things at any hotel.  And they are triple sheeted so you are not laying on yucky bedspreads like you do at other hotels.  Other than that it has great qualities:  full breakfast, big rooms, very clean, super nice staff.  The location couldn't be better for our needs.  We were going to the Angels baseball stadium and it's literally right down the street.  Easy to get to off highway 55 from the Santa Ana airport.  About a 15 minute drive.  There is a computer in the lobby to print boarding passes if you need to.    The only negative I have is they usually only had one person at the front desk.  That person also had to answer the hotel phone.  So sometimes there might be two or three people checking in or out

Summary Heading: Perfect Place to Stay for a Baseball Weekend
Summary: I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel several years now when visiting Anaheim for an Angels game. The location is perfect - a short walk into the stadium parking lot. If you ask for a view room, you will have a great view of the fireworks.   The rooms are big and clean. There is no room service, but there is a restaurant/bar next door that will deliver.   The staff is definitely another plus. Everyone I come in contact with is  helpful and friendly.

First of all I paid for this room with my United Airline miles that were about to expire. So the cost was minimal (just tax)! Upon arrival at 5:00 pm on a Monday evening I was informed that they have an hour from (5:30p-6:30p) that they offer complimentary chips, salsa, wine, beer and soda! FREE CHIPS AND ALCOHOL! WHAT?!?   The room was very clean as well as the stairway. I was on the 4th floor so I saw it all.  They are a smoke free Hotel but they allow you to smoke in designated areas and they don't make you feel like a scumbag while doing it.   The next morning I had to leave very early but not so early that I missed the continental breakfast. I was very excited to have coffee and food, FOR FREE (sort of)!!

Loved this hotel!  We were in town to see the Phillies play the Angels and we were able to WALK to the stadium from the hotel.  The bed was AMAZING!!!  I want to buy one just like it for my home; we never slept so well!  The breakfast was the usual eggs, pancakes, bacon, etc. which was served directly by the chef.  I did have some trouble with the Wi-Fi; there were meetings at the hotel and the bandwidth was used up so couldn't hook up to their Wi-Fi.
Manager Response: Dear TeriLovesBob,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you so much for your compliments regarding our accommodations as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you again for your feedback, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great property with excellent customer service!
Summary: We have stayed here several times with our team and it never disappoints!  The air conditioning rocks!  Breakfast is hot with many choices.  Beds are comfy and rooms are spacious.  The front desk is helpful!

The Hotel staff was excellent and friendly. The breakfast was delicious and the location was great! Will definitely stay again sometime in the near future. Close to restaurants as well. Walked to Honda Center for our concert.

We stayed for four nights during a Waterpolo tournament. We were given a great rate and encountered very friendly staff each time we needed something or a friendly hello as we arrived back. The hotel is located right off the freeway and within walking distance to the Angels Stadium, Honda Center and the Metrolink. It is not walking distance to Disneyland, however there is a shuttle for a nominal fee. The free breakfast was hearty and even had a small happy hour on weekdays, bonus! I will definitely be staying at this Ayres location again. I liked this more than other Ayres locations. Easy check in via text message.
Manager Response: Dear DJCCalifornia,  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel as well as the attentive service our team strives to provide. Thank you so much for the great feedback you have shared as well as the kind compliments regarding our premium amenities and optimal location. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel within walking distance of Angel's stadium
Summary: My husband and I stayed here to see the Red Sox play the Angels. The hotel was spacious, very clean and the free breakfast was awesome! It's a full breakfast not just the usual stale pastries. They have a small pool that we didn't go in but it looked well maintained. You can walk to the Angels stadium and the Honda Center is right across the street. There is a nice resturant/brewery next to the hotel and if you show your room key you get 10% off.  The reason that I didn't get the hotel an excellent rating is they never told us they were charging us for parking. We only found out when we looked at our credit card statement.

Summary Heading: My go-to hotel for Honda Center concerts!
Summary: You can't beat this location if going to a concert at the Honda Center (right across the street!). A super friendly and helpful front desk person checked me in, and the check out person was friendly as well. The chef at breakfast was very pleasant and upbeat. Breakfast was okay. I had oatmeal and would have preferred homemade as opposed to the powdered variety that they offered.

No easy access to Lobby. Parkin arm guards don't allow for parking near Lobby for check in or loading unloading. No walk way to roll luggage from parking lot. Had to Roll through bushes and bark. Room had wet spots on the floor. Customer convenient store was a joke!! Only good thing about the hotel is the free evening reception and hot breakfast. Everything else pretty much sucked. Won't stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your stay. I do apologize that your experience was not as it should have been and that you found the parking lot inconvenient. There is a divider that separates one part of the lot from the other. Guests typically walk around the divider rather than through it. There are many parking spots that are close to the front door, both inside the gated parking and outside, that are available to make checking in easier for our guests, and I apologize if these were not more clearly marked. I am also sorry that we had run out of the product that you needed in our gift shop. I am quite proud of our little shop, which offers more than you might expect for a small hotel, including, souvenirs, postcards, a decent selection of wine, beer, soft drinks, ice creams, basic pharmaceuticals, candy and snacks. We do not get a huge amount of demand for the product you were in need of, so our stock level is kept fairly low, but I will review and revisit this for possible adjustments to inventory. Again, I am very sorry if your stay was anything less than exceptional and do hope you will reconsider staying with us again.

Summary: We took an 10 day vacation to Orange County for water polo Junior Olympics.  The hotel made the long family trip really enjoyable.  The breakfast is excellent and the staff was always very helpful.  Our family also made good use of the pool and spa.

Hotel is clean, friendly staff, close to Disney parks but not short walking distance so we used the bus service. Room was clean and  comfortable, we had a good rest after bussy day, enjoyed not hearing noise from outside and then kids liked the pool. I could rate hotel service higher but had good expectation about breakfast which was just average.

We stayed at this hotel for a four day sports tournament,  and we had easy access to the multiple locations.  The hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly, and affordable. I would definitely stay again.

The Ayres Hotel has courteous & competent Staff on all levels. My rooms have always been exceptionally clean and are very spacious. My friends & I live in different areas of California & we look forward to meeting & staying at The Ayres.  The amenities & service are excellent & we greatly enjoy our time together.

Went to an Angels game for the first time and never stayed at an Ayers Hotel. What a wonderful experience, the place is very clean and the rooms are big with comfortable beds. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice boutique hotel in a great location.
Summary: Location was great for our family vacation to Disneyland, Anaheim Angels game and the beach.  The rooms are nice, we really liked the pool & spa, the staff is very friendly, and the free breakfast is great.  Whenever we're in the area, we try to stay there.
Manager Response: Dear wolfgang702,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you and your family enjoyed your experience as well as the optimal location of the Ayres Hotel Anaheim. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Very Nice Hotel and People with one problem
Summary: 5 stars for service, friendly staff, nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, good breakfast with an excellent gentleman who serves you; great location (we went to an Angels game one night, and just a few minutes walk away). However 1 star for their parking situation - not the $10 charge per night, OK with that, also OK that it is secured. The problem is that the use of the room key to get the gate open doesnt work. Of the 7 or 8 times we left the hotel in our vehicle during our 3 day stay, we had problems with the room key opening the gate every time, and always with another vehicle behind us having to wait for us. On 2 occasions, we were the vehicle behind waiting for another guest who couldnt get their key to work. You guys have have got to fix that. Didnt ruin our otherwise very

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when seeing an Angel Game or going to the Honda Center
Summary: We always stay here when we see the Angels or something at the Honda Center you can walk back and forth so no problem enjoying an adult beverage at the event!!! I don't like the bathroom set up it is the one with the sink outside and the toilet and shower/tub inside the door...but I am sure it is an older hotel and some people like that set up. We got a king room so it has a king size bed and then a little half wall with shutters partition and then a sofa and tables....I think it is a pull out couch so if you have little ones that would work for them...but it is always clean and the beds are quite comfy!!

We have stayed at this hotel before. It is in a great location for The Honda Center (across the street) and Angels Stadium (about 10 minute walk), Disneyland is about a 10 minute drive. The hotel is easy to find right off the freeway. They offer a good fresh/hot breakfast. The rooms and bathrooms are kind of small compared to newer hotels, but the beds/furnishings have been updated and are nice. They do offer early check in for a $35 fee. We do plan on staying here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Convenient to the Anaheim Regional Transportation Intermodal Center
Summary: This place is a really nice property conveniently located within walking distance from the ARTIC. The room was nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Transportation to Disneyland is available from this hotel.
Manager Response: Dear alan_fsu,  Thank you so much for your candid review. Your compliments regarding our optimal location and our comfortable accommodations are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your feedback. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This gem of a hotel is located in the heart of the Anaheim recreational area. It is just steps away from Anaheim Stadium and the home of the Anaheim Ducks. Disneyland is only a stone's throw away.  Even before arrival the hotel sends out an email confirming the reservation. Guests are asked their room location preference, and told it would be assigned to them if at all possible. I was not disappointed with my room assignment.  Let's begin with the arrival. Grounds are immaculately groomed. The parking lot is clean and well maintained. All guests are guaranteed a parking spot. Even the gardeners greet the guests. There is a fenced pool near the entrance, and with the fencing and trees it affords privacy.  Guests are greeted promptly and courteously by the staff. The hotel is well

Summary Heading: Great hotel even if you aren't going to Disney!
Summary: We were probably one of the few people staying here they was not going to Disneyland! Loved the hotel, we received an upgrade to a king suite which was very spacious. Breakfast was much more that your usual "free" hotel breakfast.   Only one thing I could even mention - parking was $10 per night. I'm not used to that with a suburban hotel.

Loved it: check in, free upgrade, staff, breakfast, pool, cleanliness...just a fantastic experience.  People with children, the suite we stayed in was perfect. We loved it.  Will definitely book with Ayers Hotels again.  Thanks, Expedia, for the VIP Treatment!
Manager Response: Dear Kristin T,  Thank you so much for providing some insight regarding your recent stay. Your compliments regarding the attentive service provided, premium amenities, and accommodations are warmly welcomed. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Really enjoyed staying at the Ayres Hotel the manager's reception from 5:15 to 6:30 was a very nice touch Monday through Thursday they should really consider having it on the weekends as the occupancy does not seem to be much different the staff was very nice and helpful the prices at the Tuck Shop were reasonable the airport shuttle was somewhat inaccessible but I didn't ask it would be a nice touch if they would take you to nearby restaurants in their shuttle as the only restaurant close by is JT Schmid's I eI walking distance again I did not ask them if they would consider taking us to a restaurant the security was nice the breakfast was pretty good although I wish they would add just a little more maybe some sort of McMuffin or granola yogurt hippie Bowl mixture just missing

Great Rates, Close to everything, Clean, Staff is amazing!  The breakfast is made to order, happy hour in the lobby during the week is great - makes you feel right at home!  I would recommend this hotel to all!
Manager Response: Dear sandycY5551MB,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you for your compliments regarding our accommodations, premium amenities and the service our attentive team provides. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was the first time our family had stayed in an Ayres hotel. We had a week stay and loved the delicious buffet breakfast! It was such a great value. I had called ahead to make sure our two rooms were next door and were adjoining. When we arrived the rooms were just as promised. This arrangement was great for the 5 of us. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly during the entire week stay. Checkout was a breeze!
Manager Response: Dear sharonv743,  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your first visit at an Ayres Hotels. We strive to redefine hospitality and I am thrilled that we were able to do just that during your visit. Thank you kindly for your compliments regarding our attentive team members as well as our well-appointed accommodations.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel is very nice. Room clean and well maintained.Pool small but adequate. Very good breakfast.. Convienant to Convention Center. Parking fee a bit much considering we had to pay at the Convention center. Located in a very nice area of town.
Manager Response: Dear D7208ODrobertm,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent experience. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the cleanliness of our accommodations as well as the premium amenities we offer. Your insight is greatly appreciated and I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Rooms were clean and roomy, staff was friendly, breakfast was awesome. It was walking distance to the baseball Angels home stadium so we also took in a night game.  I will be staying here again. Thank you

This is the best hotel out of 4 we stayed in during our USA trip.Neat and clean rooms .comfortable beds.Friendly customer service. Delicious breakfast. We'll definitely stay here in future.Easy to go Disney through bus.
Manager Response: Dear Vijay T,  I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your experience and flattered to see that our hotel was the best hotel during your trip! Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members as well as the premium amenities we offer. I look forward serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Very clean hotel and pool, friendly and helpful front desk staff, delicious, fresh breakfast. We paid for an early (10 a.m.) check in and it was well worth it. The bonus was a discount with Lyft since we didn't have a car. I would stay in another Ayres hotel without hesitation.
Manager Response: Deat mms805,  Thank you kindly for your review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the attentive service our team proves. Your compliments regarding our premium amenities and the cleanliness of our hotel are warmly welcomed. Thank you again for your insight. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was our first time staying at an Ayers and although our trip only consisted of one night, it was the best hotel out of 3 we stayed in during our whole trip. Clean, well appointed & super comfortable! It has definitely become my new favorite hotel!
Manager Response: Dear Vivian D,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel - will definitely stay here again!
Summary: My husband, two kids (21 & 18), and I stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for 5 nights over the long Fourth of July weekend and I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Not sure if it is newly built or newly remodeled, but everything is very clean and new feeling. Our room was cleaned well everyday of our stay. The decor is up to date with clean, fresh-smelling carpet, bedding, and towels. Super comfy beds and the room was very quiet (our room was on the ground floor, west side of the hotel). Delicious hot breakfast buffet every morning was prepared by super friendly staff. Everyday there was juice, coffee, fresh fruit, toast, bagels, donuts, danishes, cereal, scrambled eggs, and either bacon or sausage. The front desk staff was also friendly & helpful - we were able to purchase

I was a little nervous to book this hotel because it was not in walking distance to Disney. However, I'm glad I did! This hotel is so clean. The beds were so comfortable. I did not realize as I slept that I was not in my own bed. The staff was amazing! Extremely friendly and helpful! The shuttle to Disney picked us up in front of the hotel, it was a breeze to use. We will definitely stay at Ayres again.
Manager Response: Dear Logan J,  Thank you so much for your insight and for choosing Ayres Hotel Anaheim.
