I am pleased to see that you were satisfied with the cleanliness of our accommodations and the attentive service our team provides. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Excellent customer service! Very welcoming and accommodating! Made our stay extremely special. Helped us with all of our needs. Very nice room and wonderful space. Would be back again! Recommend to all
Manager Response: Dear simplychanelle,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Thank you again for the review and the recommendations of our hotel. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel for Trip to Disneyland
Summary: I visited the hotel for a 3 night stay over the 4th of July break. The hotel was a quick7 minute drive to Disneyland. There Is a shuttle but I have a annual pass with free parking so I chose to drive. The room I stayed in 305 was really nice, comfy bed, and clean. The pool is a perfect temperature. I didn't try the complimentary breakfast since but it was available. Staff was nice. I will be staying here in the future due to the rooms, price, and location.
Manager Response: Dear Joshua B,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our optimal location as well as the comfortable accommodations we offer. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Very clean and the sales manager was fantastic! Accommodated all our needs (we can as a team). I would definitely recommend this place to everyone. Only downside - need a bigger pool :) breakfast was great and so was happy hour! Love this place
Manager Response: Dear avmorente,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and truly appreciate the feedback you have provided. Your compliments regarding our comfortable accommodations and premium amenities are warmly welcomed. Thank you again for the review and the recommendations of our hotel. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great night prior to start of DL vacation
Summary: We had a great stay here!  Great location, excellent parking, clean and comfortable.  The breakfast was awesome- the chef made Mickey pancakes for our daughters, which they loved!  Wonderful start to our trip to DL!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel and the premium amenities we offer. Thank you so much for your candid feedback. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel except for workout facility
Summary: Beautiful room, comfortable beds,stylish furnishings, decent morning breakfast. The only fly in the ointment was the workout facility: a/c didn't work, dispenser for wipe down towels empty, old equipment not properly maintained, poor tv integration while exercising. Unlike the rest of the hotel this room is dated, poorly maintained and quite small. Needs a remodel/redo for sure.

5 minutes walk to Honda. 1p.minutes walk to Angels Stadium. 5 minutes walk to ARTIC train station, access for all train s in Southern California. And of course, a ten minutes drive to Disneyland. Shuttle service provided. It's the hotel you want when you want a good breakfast, a good sleep, but have a full day elsewhere.

We were in Anaheim for an Angels game and this location cannot be beat!!  Easy walk to the stadium, no parking hassles, PERFECT!!! The staff was great. My son loved the Mickey Mouse pancakes that were made for him every morning. The beds were amazing!!

Summary Heading: An exceptional hotel at a great price.
Summary: We stayed here on our trip to Disneyland. We were very satisfied with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is very clean and appealing, with something you would expect from a more expensive hotel. A very good value. The rooms were very clean and quiet, even with ours facing the freeway. Our room had a very large bathroom, which was nice. They have a very nice breakfast with a very nice variety and a   chief serving the food This hotel is very easy to find, being right off of the freeway. It is close to the Honda center and Angel's stadium. There are shuttle buses, which take you to and from  Disneyland at regular intervals. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to visit this area. An exceptional hotel.

Summary Heading: This hotel just ruined my Roadtrip
Summary: It was a horrible night for us, opened the door of our room at 9pm and basically it was like a sauna. The AC had been running in a full hot temp for hours before we came in. I called the receptionist and he always said "it is Ok, you just adjust the temp and it is going to be cool for 10-15 minutes"; so I waited and it was the same, I called the front desk again and telling him to fix this issue promptly as I was bringing my family from the long road trip and they needed sleep right away, the front desk guy said it is Okay and we will send someone to fix it up for you. So I waited again for 10-15 minutes and no one showed up! So I came down to front desk and they just did nothing. So I dragged one of them to check the room and he said "well you are right, the ac is broken so we
Manager Response: Dear Yonas D,  Thank you for taking the time to post your feedback. I am sorry that your first impression of the hotel was not as it should have been.  Thank you for bringing the broken air conditioner to our attention and please accept my apologies for any inconvenience it may have caused. Upon investigation I was pleased to note that we were able to resolve the issue and relocate your room within half an hour of your arrival. I was also pleased to see that you liked the beds and that the rest of your stay went well. We hope you will allow us the opportunity to welcome you again.   All the best,  Marcus Collins  General Manager

Summary: Spent a couple days on a roadtrip honeymoon. Did Disneyland and Angels game. Perfect walking distance to angels stadium. Shuttle to Disney was clutch as it isnt walking distance.  The breakfast was very good, and the staff was more than friendly. I wasnt sure if they had gotten my request for champaign, but after coming back the first night it was there!

I rented 2 rooms for my grandaughters birthday.  We were given agoining rooms and that worked really well.  The rooms were clean and nice, the service was good,  the staff was easy to work with. Breakfast was good and the pool was clean and very nice.   Shuttle to Disneyland was easy and convienent.

Summary Heading: Average rooms, highway noise, sloppy housekeeping, pleasant front desk staff
Summary: We stayed here for 3 days with the family as we were visiting Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park. Having stayed at the Ayres in Mission Viejo previously I had high expectations but this property was a let down. The location maybe convenient for Honda Center, it is NOT for Disney. On the 2 days we were there the ART shuttle was running at 40-50 minute intervals so we drove to the theme parks. The hotel being next to the highway it is noisy throughout the night. The rooms are in urgent need of an upgrade. The beds are comfortable. The staff are pleasant but housekeeping is sloppy. They did not leave fresh toiletries. We had to ask for them. One day the housekeeping staff left some of their cleaning supplies in our room!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I was pleased to read that you found the beds comfortable and the staff pleasant. We completed a renovation of the entire hotel last year, so it was disappointing to read that the rooms did not meet your expectations. I am sorry that our housekeeping team let you down with regards to forgetting their supplies and omitting to replace your toiletries. They are typically excellent and, but I will be sure to discuss this with the team to insure against it in the future. The Ayres Hotel is around 3 miles from Disneyland so certainly not walking distance, however many of our guests appreciate the easy access of a short drive combined with the ability to get away from the crowds. I am sorry your stay was not more exceptional, but we hope you will give us the opportunity to welcome you in the future.    All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Keep this short and sweet! Clean Bed was amazing Close to and nightlife/restaurants  Shuttles available  Great safe parking  Amazing breakfast Ac kept us cool! Friendly knowledgeable staff  We came a long way from Canada and we're not dissatisfied at all can't seem to think of anything bad  Would definitely recommend!

Summary Heading: Great location, breakfast, and comfy rooms
Summary: Very conveniently located for games, concerts, and Disneyland with a shuttle and right next to the train station. Very clean rooms and secure parking. The breakfast had eggs, bacon, potatoes, and pancakes all made fresh. I suggest when you check out to keep a room key as that is how you exit the parking lot and pull your car out to the front then go drop the key off. If staff is on the phone the n you have to wait til they are off the phone so they can let you out. Also the Wifi was kind of a pain the way it is set up but I would definetely stay here again

We could walk to the Angels game and back, safely. It was a short Uber ride to Disneyland. The room was clean and comfortable. There was a lot of space for us to spread out. The staff was friendly and helpful. We couldn't ask for more.
Manager Response: Dear Debra M,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have shared. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience, the accommodations we offer, as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team as well as your insight. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great Location Good staff Nice facility
Summary: Great location for Angels baseball games and Anaheim Ducks games. Breakfast very good, large area to eat. Staff extremely helpful with tour information and any other information required like shopping where to eat. Able to take tours of Los Angeles, you were picked up and dropped off at your hotel. No need to rent vehicle.

Stayed on a Friday to watch Angels play the Royals.  The hotel is clean, front desk customer service was good, but internet was very slow.  So slow, we didn't use it.  My boys loved the cookies that were available at check in, and the breakfast was better than usual.  My boys had an opportunity to use the pool, which was nice as well.  If looking for other places to eat, there was various places down the road about 5 minutes away.  Overall, if planning to watch another Royals game, we'd stay again.  There is a $10 parking fee, but if you drove to Angels stadium, you'd have to pay the same.

Beautiful hotel in a great location close to every thing but is still accessible.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was good.  I will be staying again when I'm in the area.
Manager Response: Dear mjmullis79,  Thank you so much for the candid review. I am thrilled that you enjoyed your experience as well as the location of our hotel. Thank you for your feedback regarding our accommodations, premium amenities, and our attentive team members. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Love staying here!! Friendly staff and conveniently located near Angels Stadium!! We also like staying here when we visit Disneyland and take the hotel shuttle. Great breakfast included and they even made Mickey Mouse pancakes for my son. We would definitely recommend staying here!
Manager Response: Deat faiths98,  Thank you so much for the great review and for your continued loyalty to our hotel. Your compliments regarding our attentive team, optimal location, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight and the great recommendation of our hotel. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Good location for an angels game but the hotel is nothing special
Summary: Decent and clean room.  Friendly check in and out.  Great location for walking to the game.  Our room (302) was a corner room overlooking Katella Ave and the highway.  Because the room was so close to the road it was a noisy (road noise).  Forth floor would have been better but the other side of hotel would be best.  The air conditioning is old fashioned so that didn't help with "noise" either.  The biggest fall down of the hotel is not having enough tables or service in the breakfast room.  Their was a continuous line out the door into the lobby yielding around  a 15-20minute wait for food.  Breakfast was average to above.    On game weekends etc. they need to be better prepared in both capacity and staffing.  Tables were dirty because their simply were not enough staff.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Ayers Hotel in Anaheim.  It was an ideal location for us (walking distance to Angels Stadium).  The rooms were very clean, comfortable, and affordable.  A really nice warm freshly cooked breakfast was included, and the staff was friendly and helpful.  We will come back.
Manager Response: Dear Lance T,  We strive to provide a personalized guest experience and it pleases me to see that we were able to do just that during your visit. The feedback you have provided and the compliments you have shared regarding our attentive team and clean accommodations are greatly appreciated. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at a different Ayers Hotel in Orange, and decided to try the Anaheim location to compare.  Both hotels are clean and comfortable, but I think we prefer the Orange location.  The staff at Anaheim was not as friendly and responsive as we have experienced at Orange, and we had a few problems with maintenance issues of which some were resolved, and some were not.  However, I did report everything to the manager of the hotel who stated that they were addressing the issues and they offered a refund of one night's stay for our troubles.  Overall we like the Ayers brand hotels and we will come back to the Orange location.

Warm cookies in the lobby. Clean and comfortable room. Great breakfast included in room price. Walk to Angels Ballpark. Friendly staff. Nice pool and hot tub. Walk to nearby restaurant and brewery. Thanks Marcus and Andrew for your hospitality.

Upon arrival, we were greeted by a VERY friendly staff and extremely professional.  They made sure our special request was met and that our stay was very comfortable.  The chef for breakfast was so welcoming and made the BEST pancakes...seriously!!!  He kept professional and on top of the high demand of so many guests coming in.  We always stay at an Ayres and love their staff/hotel, but this time seemed even better than usual.  We HIGHLY recommend Ayres for their clean hotel, professional staff and conveniently located!

I slept much better here than at home. Such a comfy bed and pillows.  I only wish I had brought my bathing suit to visit the spa! Breakfast was great.  No complaints for this hotel. They even had some cookies at check in.
Manager Response: Dear Christa D,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided. I am thrilled that you enjoyed the accommodations we offer as well as our signature Celestial Sleeper bed. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I think it was a flowless check-in, stay and check out. The breakfast serves the purpose, the rooms are clean and neat. The little kitchen with microwave, sink, fridge and coffeemaker are useful. A kettle might have been great, too. The parking lot, overall secutity, neighbourhood and location are excellent. Thank you Ayres !
Manager Response: Dear muge853,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided. It pleases me to see that you had a pleasant experience and enjoyed the accommodations provided as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you again for your review. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My friends and I stayed here when we went to an event at the Honda center. The staff was very friendly in person and on he phone when I needed information. Our room was clean with plenty of room for 4 friends. Very nice hotel. So convenient too.
Manager Response: Dear sharontI9184YR,  Thank you for candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed a pleasant experience. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members, clean accommodations, and the optimal location of our hotel are warmly welcomed. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The two bed/bath suites are really convenient. The chocolate chip cookies are not to be missed. Pancakes made to order were hot and yummy. Staff were all friendly and helpful.  We used the shuttle to/from Disneyland. It was perfect!!
Manager Response: Dear agkeiper,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review informing others of your recent stay. Your compliments regarding our accommodations and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great stay at a great location
Summary: Stayed there with my son to attend a music festival at the Honda center. Room was spacious and nice. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great location if you plan on visiting an event at the Honda center across the street.
Manager Response: Dear z0rr0lf,  Thank you for the taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and enjoyed the optimal location of our hotel. I truly appreciate the feedback you have provided and hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed at this nice hotel while in the area for my high school reunion. Our room was perfectly clean, the bed comfy, and the pillows were generous and fluffy. Breakfast items were fresh and plentiful. But most importantly, the staff was so helpful after I accidentally dropped an earring down the bathroom sink. In particular "Tony" is to be commended for fishing out the earring for me. He was a godsend as were the front desk personnel for helping me figure out what to do! I can't thank them enough. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.

The facility was clean, and even though it is on the side of a freeway it is very quiet. The breakfast served was very good especially the coffee. The desk clerk(s) as well as other staff members were very nice and accommodating. There is also a lot to see and do  in the immediate vicinity,
Manager Response: Dear robertsU8641AA,  Thank you for the taking the time to write a review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and truly appreciate the feedback you have shared. Your compliments regarding our premium amenities, the cleanliness of our accommodations and our attentive team members are warmly welcomed. We hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed in a two bedroom suite with two king beds. The room was clean, looked new, and the beds were very comfortable. It had an above average complimentary hot breakfast. Social hour could have offered a little more variety, but since it was minimal it would have been nice if they kept the chips and dips filled for the one hour each evening it was offered. The hot tub was a good size and nice. Great location to go to the baseball stadium and Disney.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel For Angel Stadium/ Honda Center
Summary: Stayed at hotel for Angels games and California Adventure.  Walked to games, easy drive to California Adventure. Room was clean. Staff was great and breakfast was surprisingly good. I would recommend this hotel for anyone attending an event at Angel Stadium or the Honda Center.
Manager Response: Dear Lawrence B,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for the candid review, I hope to welcome you back again soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed with my husband at this hotel on a stopover for disney. Hotel was nice, rooms were clean, staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also very good. Drive time to disney is about 15 minutes; got the sensation from the description that was shorter. Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Mieugenin,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review informing others of your recent stay. Your compliments regarding our accommodations, attentive team, and premium amenities are greatly appreciated. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great room, Beautiful modern room, most comfortable bed and pillows I've ever slept on!! Great breakfast, loved that it was complimentary and hot and vatiety of choices. Professional front desk attendant, very nice. The gentleman i spoke with from 241 miles away and finally met in person, was Ken. He definitely helped me with a professional and efficient mannerism. Conveniently near Disneyland. Good area & neighborhood. We planned a trip to Disneyland for memorial day weekend, to celebrate my oldest daughter being excepted into Kindergarten and my youngest daughter's early 3rd birthday. Loved our stay!! I would definitely come back when my kids and I came to the area again next year!!

Great experience. We stayed here for a baseball game and the location was extremely convenient to both the baseball park and the train station. The beds were soft and comfortable, the rooms were big and well appointed, and the complimentary breakfast was one of the better hotel hot buffets I've ever experienced. It was a nice touch to have a fridge and microwave in the room, too.  Would definitely stay here again.

As always Marcus & his staff were wonderful. Andrew was waiting for us with his usual smile & greeting. Breakfast was great as always. Marcus came out & greeted us as well welcoming us. Being his sweet self as always.
Manager Response: Dear Shirl29101,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel and for your continued loyalty! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the personalized service we strive to offer. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Traveled to Disneyland for my son's 4th birthday. This hotel offers free wifi, free breakfast and cheap parking! Room was very clean and comfy! The staff was extremely friendly as well. We will be back in the future!
Manager Response: Dear Alexa B,  Thank you for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the premium amenities we offer. Your compliments regarding our accommodations and attentive team members are warmly welcomed. I look forward to welcoming you and your family back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Everyone was really friendly. I loved how clean everything was. My family has worked in the hotel business for over 25 years and enjoyed their stay. The breakfast was real good I just don't know about having to wait to be served at the other Ayers it's buffet style I like that better.
Manager Response: Dear Danna M,  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience as well as the attentive service our team provides. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our hotel, premium amenities, and our team members are greatly appreciated.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: First of all it's not close to Disney. We have to take shuttle which comes every 40 mins and that's not Free.  Parking is not included and the rooms are small. The room we stayed had a broken thermostat.  Breakfast was good. Not a great hotel but for the price it's manageable for 1 night.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I was very disappointed to see that you had not enjoyed your stay although pleased to see that you liked the service, the value and the breakfast. I am sorry that you found the thermostat to not be working. We do have a competent maintenance crew who are quick to make repairs and I hope that they were able to provide assistance. Our rooms are 338 square feet which is considered reasonably spacious for our price point and style of hotel. I am sorry that they did not meet your needs. Should you require a suite in future (450 -675 sq. ft.), they can be booked directly with the hotel. The ART shuttle times do vary, with shuttles going every 40 minutes on quiet days and every 20 minutes during busy days. We do charge for parking, but our charge of $10 plus tax per night is lower than most of the local area hotels that charge. Our parking is gated and supported by overnight security. I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations but hope that you would consider staying again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins  General Manager

Summary: We booked this room after a horrific experience with Airbnb. When we arrived, we could not have been happier! The beds were comfortable, the room was well laid out, We will gladly stay here again! Thank you for a great first time experience!!

Great place to stay. Rooms were clean and bed was so comfortable. Front desk was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was delicious, eggs, sausage and hashbrowns were made fresh every morning. The bus service picks you up right in front every 20 minutes. Will definitely stay there again. It's on the top of my list.

If your looking to catch a Ball game or a major sporting event at the Honda center. This is the hotel for you. Walking distance to either venue. The Hotel is older yet very clean and quiet. The customer service was excellent. Overall it was a nice place to stay. Just off the freeway.

Summary Heading: Always a wonderful experience at Ayres Hotels.
Summary: Our son is a student at Chapman University.  We always book at Ayres Hotel when we're in town to visit.  The rooms are never less than expected. Clean, Comfortable and 1st rate.  The breakfast is incredible and every single employee at the hotel is hard working,  especially Carlos and the young lady who serves breakfast.  She is so polite and energetic.  I was really impressed.  Thanks again for the perfect visit.

Have stayed there numerous times and always have been satisfied.  On the minus side, our son slept on the pull out bed and it was like sleeping on steel, essentially the mattress was very thin(there have been better pull outs with better mattresses).  Our bed was fine.  The room we initially had was on the "traffic" side of the hotel so be prepared.  We moved our room and got two queen beds and was great from there on out.  Good breakfast in morning as well

I read some of the reviews and disagree with the negativity. I found the room to be quite comfortable, roomy and quite, despite the NHL semi finals being played at the Honda Center. It was close to Disney and other attractions and it had REAL home cooked style breakfast, as well as yogurt, fruit, juice, milk and coffee! I would definitely stay there again. It's a jewel and a little out of the way; close to a theatre and some shops/restaurants as well! Staff was friendly and helpful. FREE wifi was a plus as well.

Had stayed previously for a two night stay, this time for just an overnight and Disney Day trip. Sure, it costs a bit more but is well worth it for the peace of mind, comfort & convenience and breakfast. Highly recommended.

This is the third time we have stayed here and it is a great stay. The room is always clean and comfortable. The staff is always pleasant and helpful. The facility is clean and well kept. The location is convenient to the area activities.

We picked Ayres Hotel because it was right across the street from the Honda Center (we had tickets for an event), plus we were able to have dinner across the street from the hotel (and never had to move our car - walked to dinner, and walked over to the Honda Center).  Cheerful and helpful people at check-in - beautiful lobby area.  Really nice breakfast room and delicious breakfast.  Large yet cozy room (sink, microwave, refrigerator, sitting area).  Spotless room, very nicely finished (loved the l tiles in sink area).  We would absolutely stay there again!

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, the property was nice, clean and most staff was friendly. The breakfast the first morning was great and the staff was doing a great job. However the second day breakfast was okay, it was hard to find a table, some had dirty dishes and the staff wasn't clearing them quick enough for the guest. The second day when we left the room and came back several hours later, our room wasn't clean so we had to get housekeeping and sit in the hotel lobby and wait for out room to be cleaned, which then made us late in getting ready for our night out.
Manager Response: Dear Msmarygirl,  Thank you for your review. I am sorry that you encountered some frustration with our service at the hotel. We do have busier times at breakfast depending on when customers choose to come down. Typically we are able to keep up with the demand. I am sorry that we were not keeping up when you came to breakfast on the second morning. I am also sorry that your room was not cleaned when you needed it. Our staff clean the rooms between 8.30 and 5 on the weekends. Should a guest request that their room be cleaned by a certain time we make every effort to meet that need.  I hope that we will have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Not the 4 star hotel people say it is.
Summary: I stayed at this hotel about 2 weeks ago for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland with my family. The property is clean and the staff are friendly but there are several negative issues we encountered which is why I'm giving this property a rating of "3".  Check-in was a disaster. My family and I got to the hotel around 8pm the day we checked in. I had used their online check-in feature to notify the hotel about our late arrival. Despite our late check-in, we were assured that we would have the same room type that we had booked during the reservation. When we got the room, not only was it a different configuration, but the room was in the process of being renovated. The bed was dismantled, the lights didn't work, and the tv and cabinets had all been moved away from the walls to the
Manager Response: Dear travelrascel,  Thank you for the candid review. I truly appreciate you taking the time to write a review, nevertheless, I do regret to see that your experience was anything less than exceptional. Please accept my most sincere apologies for any and all inconveniences that you experienced during your visit. Rest assured that we will make improvements wherever necessary and that training protocols will be reiterated to our entire team. I kindly encourage you to allow us a second opportunity in the future, it would be my pleasure to provide you with the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed at The Aryes in Anahiem. I booked it for a night after a day at Disneyland. It is approximately 15 minute drive from the park. It is right across the street from The Grove if you are going to a concert it is the perfect location. Plenty of resturants near by as well.  Angels Stadium is a few blocks away. The rooms were spacious and clean.  They include a decent breakfast in your stay. I would return.
Manager Response: Dear Kfries111,  Thank you so much for the kind words you have shared with us. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience and truly appreciate the insight you have provided. I hope to welcome you back in the future so that we may provide the 5-star experience you deserve.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel must be a happy place to work with because  I saw a few employees still there especially Jose the Chef ,happy to see him after 6 years!Lax traffic is getting worst,took us 13/4 hours getting  here and to Universal Studio was 13/4 hours too!Hotel is still well-kept,staffs were very friendly and helpful Afternoon high tea hour was wonderful!.Pillows quality in our room  needs to improve.We had a view room but no  disney firework during our stay. Hotel near busy highway and  street but room soundproof very well.

This was a clean hotel right across from The Honda Center.  We attended an Ice Show so was nice to just walk across the street.  We also took the shuttle the next day to Disneyland, very convenient!!  Rooms were clean, it was quiet and staff was polite and helpful.  If I had robkist any negatives, the beds could be updated and we could skip the breakfast but that wasn't priority to us. Would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: ADA RI shower standard room attending  Fasching @ the Phoenix Club
Summary: The Staff was wonderful in helping with any of my room needs, I had a few challenges with smells in the room and needed to move to the third floor ADA room. They helped me with any of my needs and took care of my breakfast needs too. My maintenance needs were taken care of for ADA shower hose leaking/ squirting  directly into my eyes. Much appreciated their maintenance guy for taking care of me. Sorry I forgot his name to give him his much to do props. I do remember he was on call lived close to the property and was able to be dispatched upon my needs Thank you.   My first room some one had smoked in and their was confusion on the cleaning to move to another room it was taken care of too.  The masking spray they used to cover the smoke is worse some times than the actual smoke

The location is great! We had an event at the Honda Center. We walked across the street for dinner at J.T. Schmid's, and then across the street to the Honda Center. So convenient! From our seats to our room took all of about 5 minutes.  Room was spacious. Beds were very comfortable. Very nice to have a fridge and micro in the room. There was a dresser, desk AND table with 2 chairs. Plus to have full length mirror in the bedroom and on the closet doors by vanity. I also liked that the vanity was separated by a door from the shower/toilet.  A/C was inconsistent. It only had 1 fan speed (no high/low). Sometimes, it did not turn on or stay on. That could be an energy saver feature, but it made for a HOT room at times. I wish I had a little fan to stay cool.  Breakfast: Pancakes were

We spent the night at Ayres Hotel Anaheim and loved it, rooms, lobby and the staff were all excellent!  Front desk was super helpful and friendly, nice breakfast room with a large selection.  Will defiantly look for Ayres Hotels when we travel.

I've stayed at the Ayres Hotel twice now and I have always enjoyed my stay. It is so convenient to everything, the rooms are nice and comfortable and the staff is friendly and helpfull. Looking forward for more stays in the future.

Hotel was very convenient to The Grove where our event was being held, and to the freeway.  I wasn't expecting as great of a breakfast the next day, so it was a nice surprise, good food and service, I would stay there again.

The facility is clean and nice but the pool was cold and our room smelled like mildew.    The staff were all very nice and helpful and we had a shuttle to wherever we needed to go, which was great.  The complimentary breakfast was good - fresh fruit, coffee bar, self-serve cereal, etc but the best part was a full egg, potatoes, pancake, and sausage meal made right there in front of us, not heat lamped and not a cold bagel.

Summary Heading: Very restful and peaceful night's sleep!
Summary: I am familiar with the Ayres properties so decided to try this hotel, as Anaheim's new tax structure is onerous to say the least! I was pleasantly surprised at the accommodations here, the friendly service and ease of booking. I received a discount for booking my one night stay 14 days in advance. I will definitely stay here again when my N. Cal family comes down again for their continuing treks to Disneyland.!

Summary Heading: First Stay in Anaheim and will absolutely come back next year!
Summary: We took our 5 year old daughter to Disneyland for her birthday.  We called the hotel to ask a question about our reservation prior to our arrival and ended up speaking with the manager, Derrick.  We mentioned we were coming to Disneyland for the first time to celebrate our daughter's birthday.  When we arrived, he had upgraded our room and left our daughter a care package.  She was so excited (and my husband and were also).  Before we left, she told us she wanted to live at the hotel forever.  Derrick made not only us but our daughter very so special and really went above and beyond on the personal service.  For that reason, we'll definitely stay here next time, and we plan on making this an annual trip to Disneyland.    Aside from our experience with the staff, our room was

Great location - walking distance to ARTIC if you want to take the train, walk to baseball. Good restaurant on the corner - JT Scmidts. There are handy shops at ARTIC too. If you walk to either side of East Katella Ave, there are fast foods places on the way. Bus stops are close by if you want to visit Block at Orange. The ART bus stops at the hotel to go to Disneyland, which is great if you are only visiting Disneyland for one or two days and away from all the main hotels near it. You can easily buy ART tickets from the reception. I loved the room, spacious and clean, has a mini fridge and microwave which is handy. The pool and hot tub was nice too. Good customer service, happy to help with anything. Coin laundry also available which I liked, you only need to buy the laundry

We stayed here for one night to attend a hockey game at the Honda centre.  Check in was great, room was nice and beds comfortable. The full breakfast was served cafeteria style with a chef on site to make fresh pancakes.
Manager Response: Dear MarcoExplorer,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review informing others about your recent stay. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience as well as the accommodations we offer and our premium amenities. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel Anaheim is located in a great location and has very friendly staff!  The room was spacious, quiet, and clean.  Wonderful amenities including breakfast and a hotel shuttle.  I would highly recommend staying here when in Anaheim!
Manager Response: Dear Jennifer S,  Thank you so much for your candid review. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience as well as the optimal location of our hotel and the premium amenities we offer. Thank you kindly for your recommendation of our hotel! I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel was overall a great stay.. great looking room plenty of space close to everything.. but best of all good nights sleep. Got a king size bed and I did not want to get up very comfortable.. complementary breakfast can't beat that just the parking could be better figured it would come with the room but ehh 10 bucks isn't anything ..I would definitely come back and give this a good thumbs up!! Cheers

Summary Heading: Great place at a great price.
Summary: The hotel was very clean and convenient. The staff was friendly. Our room setup was perfect and very comfortable.  We will definitely stay at this location in the future. Price of room was quite competitive with hotels that aren't as nice.

We stayed at the hotel for just one night - just to attend an Angel's game.  The location is ideal for the Angels and even closer for the Honda Center (Ducks).  Truly excellent staff at this hotel.  I will definitely go back.

The ART shuttle pulls right up to the front doors of this hotel making it very convenient for a Disneyland visit. It is also right across the street from where the Anaheim Ducks play. The onsite breakfast is decent as each morning they offer pancakes made to order along with either bacon or sausage and a potato side dish of some sort.I would choose to stay here again if we get to go back.

We first stayed here 2 years ago and loved it. When we had the opportunity to return to Disneyland, we couldn't resist booking again and we weren't disappointed. We travelled with our 2 teens. We all loved the location. The shuttles were there for the disney visits, but we also watched a Ducks Ice hockey game- which was just a quick walk over the road to the Honda Centre. A great experience for us New Zealanders! Less restaurants in this area within walking distance but JD Schmits over the road is great if you time it right (ie. very busy on game nights). But the best thing about this place is the awesome beds (never had a better one), the lovely staff (we noted a few familiar faces from a few years ago, so they must be doing something right) and the free breakfasts which saved

Summary Heading: Happy quiet evening at your hotel.
Summary: Very pleased with the clerks at the desk, enjoyed the main lobby for a visit with others. Can`t find fault with the hotel, we will visit again. Good location, we used the Amtrak to get there. Breakfast was good.

Nice hotel to stay in if you're going to a baseball or hockey game. Easy to walk to either venue. Hotel is clean and comfortable although I don't understand the " pay to park" if you are a hotel guest.

My son and I have gone down to watch the Anaheim Ducks play twice and this hotel is in a great location - right across the street! Staff were friendly and helpful, and hotel was clean. Definitely recommend and will stay again.

This hotel is where I always stay while visiting the area. The staff is wonderful! The hotel is clean, safe and walking distance to restaurants and events. I will definitely continue to stay here in the future!
Manager Response: Dear Boerner820,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I truly appreciate your loyalty to our hotel and the great feedback you have provided. Thank you for your compliments regarding my attentive team members as well as the accommodations we offer. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My friend and I were going to see Cesar Millan at the City National Theater nearby, so we chose the Ayres Hotel because of the location and the good reviews. The location was perfect because I took Amtrak which stopped right across the street. The room was nice and comfortable, and very clean which is most important in any hotel room. They offer a discount at the restaurant across the street, the sports bar/restaurant which had excellent food.  The room price was very reasonable and included a very good breakfast with made to order pancakes, hash browns and many other breakfast items. The hotel is also right near to Angel Stadium for our future trips to Anaheim. I will definitely choose the Ayres again.

We just returned from a six night stay from our trip to Disneyland. We were very pleased with this hotel. It was easy to find. Our room was clean, spacious & updated. The beds were comfortable. This hotel is quiet compared to others I have stayed at near Disney. Rarely would we hear other guests. All of the staff was friendly & helpful. Never seeming bothered or put off to help or answer a question. They have a full breakfast. Which was a perfect way to start our busy day. The hotel is about 2 miles from Disney. We took the art to the park. Which was convenient & consistent. Arriving every 20 or 40 minutes depending on the day. Picking us up at the entrance of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again & recommend this hotel to others. Thank you to all the staff for making

Easy check-in with hotel.  Very clean room and facing the Honda Arena.  We stayed only a single night but it was the perfect location for the Ducks game.  We crossed the street and were at the stadium.  Large rooms.  Bathrooms were nothing special but still nice. Free breakfast was extraordinary!

The staff at the Ayers - Anaheim Hotel consistently provide great personable service - always looking to ensure your stay there is a very positive experience. The hotel and rooms are always very clean, the morning breakfast delicious and the evening manager reception a nice touch to let you unwind at the end of the day.  Great location.  Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.
Manager Response: Dear wgmiii,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review. I am glad you enjoyed your experience as well as the attentive service our team provides. Your compliments regarding our accommodations and the premium amenities we offer are greatly appreciated. Thank you for the review and the recommendations of our hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: In town for the Oilers vs Ducks playoff series. Took in an Angels game Thursday and Disney Land all day Friday before the Friday night game. Ayres Hotel is very central to both Honda Centre (Hockey) and the angels Stadium. Easy walk to both venues. It's also a short drive or shuttle to Disney Land. Easy access to Hotel as it sits right next to Interstate 5 (no noise though). The pool area is quaint and the hotel itself is very clean and staff are all friendly. The complimentary breakfast is one of the best I've had in a hotel. We had a decent size room for which I believe to be a standard room with 2 queen beds and a wall that demises the beds for a bit of privacy. Good design, I've never seen that before. Our room had a bar fridge, microwave and coffee maker.

It's never good to be away for 12 days straight. But this hotel and their staff made it possible. The hotel is within walking distance of some wonderful eateries. You can order from across the street and the hotel has a great breakfast everyday. And for us east coasters, they open early!

Summary Heading: Whole place has a weird smell
Summary: Been to this Ayres now and then since it opened.  Live about an hour away, but like to stay in Anaheim area sometimes when staying late at Disneyland and not deal with driving home tired.  This time, we checked in, got to the elevator, and noticed a smell...worse in the room, and the same on each floor.  Kind of a nasty, wet carpet smell that was mixed with chemicals, sweat, and retirement home stank...horrible.  After 5 minutes of the malodorous assault, we checked out, and received a full refund (staff is always professional and helpful there).  Maybe I'm sensitive, maybe you'll like the fragrance...it's a nice property otherwise, good breakfast, and very nice rooms...but until it gets a deep cleaning, I'm not going back...
Manager Response: Dear John F,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review informing others of your recent experience. I truly appreciate the insight you have provided and can assure you that improvements will be made wherever necessary. Thank you again for sharing this information with us. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff treat you like Family, the chef is fantastic, he knows what you want (we were here 6 days) he would have it ready when he saw you. The front desk staff also are fantastic, they always greet you and help you out.The pool is fantastic also, it was not used much so I had it to myself. The rooms are great, very comfortable and very quiet. We attended the Blue Jays vs LA Angels baseball games and it is a short 15 minute walk to the ball park. You won't be disappointed staying here

The service was excellent!  Both the night and the morning staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was spotlessly clean and very spacious. The shuttle to Disneyland (not the purpose of my trip) picks up right in front of the hotel. The breakfast was very tasty, there were plenty of choices, and the cook serving was very friendly.
Manager Response: Dear ctkelley2,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the compliments you have shared regarding the cleanliness of our hotel as well as the premium amenities we provide. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: We have stayed here the past 5 years and every time find it a great experience
Summary: Rooms are  quite large and very clean with comfortable beds.  Easy access to Angels ball park, Honda Centre and Arctic train and bus terminal.  Excellent hot  breakfast every morning with lots of choices.  Happy hour in the evening.  Lots of good restaurants within walking distance.  Bus service around the city is very good with pick up and drop off at the door.  Front desk always pleasant and helpful.

I used to stay at the Anaheim Ayres 2-4 nights a week for 3-4 years, rooms are well kept, breakfast alone worth the price when you get the amenities.  The staff are exceptional, consistent and caring...excellent as always.  Highly recommend !!
Manager Response: Dear johnfF4972ZT,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay as well as the accommodations we provide. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive team members, I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Good value hotel, close to freeway and ballparks
Summary: Great value and comfortable hotel near the freeway and ballparks.  Even getting to Disney via public transport shuttle worked out well.  Decent complementary breakfast too.  A few items to improve: coffee was very mediocre, hot tub was not warm, pool and hot tub in parking lot wasn't too pleasant.

Summary Heading: First time, definitely not the last!
Summary: Great first experience at this hotel. Was recommended to me by a coworker, and the Ayres did not disappoint! Excellent beds, pillows, breakfast, staff... Everything was great! One negative which really has nothing to do with the hotel, but the resort shuttle service to Disneyland was very inconsistent. Never knew when they were coming by... 20 minutes, 40 minutes? Waited 65 minutes one time. I guess that's what you get for $3 or so each way. It US cheaper than driving over to the park and paying for parking.  Still, excellent hotel, highly recommend!!

We're recently spent a night at Ayres in Anaheim while attending a couple of MLB games. The stay was excellent, right from booking our room to check in and check out. The room was spacious and well furnished. It was a 10 minute walk to the ball park. If you are a NHL fan, the rink is an even closer walk. We will definitely stay there on future trips to Anaheim.

We love staying at the Ayres when visiting Disneyland or going to events at the Honda Center. Very friendly staff, good breakfast, and comfy rooms. The staff overheard it was my daughter's birthday and left her a sweet gift basket in the room. She was overjoyed!

Great rooms, decent view of the sunrise.   Good breakfast option with friendly chef.   I am dinging one star for disconnected ac when we entered the room when it was 75f inside. Maybe earlier patron did it but wished they checked it.

Ayres was a great place to stay for our Disney vacation. The shuttle is no more than 10 minutes away and runs every 20 minutes. Room was clean and spacious. We had an issue with our A/C and it was promptly corrected. Breakfast is excellent! Great value.

Summary Heading: close to disneyland, cozy hotel, would stay again!
Summary: Nice hotel lobby, spacious yet cozy.  Room had great beds! very comfortable beds, quiet room, great A/c controls, love having a microwave and fridge...love having the free breakfast but it closed too early! we stayed out late at disneyland, etc and had a hard time waking up to make it to breakfast on time after an exhausting day out! especially monday morning it closed at 930am!  The front desk was understaffed and at times there were long lines to check in or ask for help with only one person working the front desk! and they did not tell us about any amenities or services other than breakfast and wifi, and as an Ayres hotel new member, they didn't know if there were any benefits provided to me.  No hotel bar or restaurant, other than the breakfast restaurant which is only open

Very friendly staff, a great full breakfast buffet every morning with the brilliant and lovely chef Jose cooking it all up in front of you including pancakes. He really made my family feel welcome. The little pool and gym are well kept as well. The location isn't great for restaurants in terms of walking distance but it is if you want to go to the surrounding sports arenas or transport hub where trains and buses go from. A shuttle bus that costs $5.50 a day will take you from the hotel doorstep to the Disney complex every day. The drivers are great although the times are irregular. A really good value hotel though on the whole and the room was great.

Excellent service- (customer service, room service and excellent food). Recommend this hotel to everyone requiring location to Freeways, eating places and entertainment. The room service is to be commended as well as the excellent breakfasts.

Great Stay!  Super clean, great staff, enjoyed the breakfast and you can't beat the location for a trip to Anaheim that involves the Honda Center or Anaheim Stadium.  Looking forward to our next stay at the Ayres.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay For Disneyland!
Summary: Booked this place for a 1 day Disney trip. Extremely convenient location with shuttle bus to Disneyland ($5.50 per person). Bus runs before the park opens and after it closes. We enjoyed the spacious deluxe king bedroom and the overall hotel decor. Parking is $10 per night. We especially enjoyed the complimentary breakfast.  Overall speaking, we enjoyed the convenient location, the shuttle bus to and from Disney, the friendly hotel staff, our room, and the breakfast! Will definitely come back next time when we visit Disney!

Good value for your money; includes a good breakfast in the morning with your room.  Front desk check in was easy and staff was great. Room is very comfortable with a small refrigerator, microwave, sink and coffee.

Nice hotel with great amenities. Jose, the chef even cooks breakfast in front of you (not your typical continental breakfast), and prepares his special pancake mix the night before. Very convenient & close to Angels stadium too. The staff was even nice enough to shuttle us somewhere close by. Best of all, they prepared a cute little birthday basket for my son who was celebrating his birthday. Will stay here again!

This is a nice hotel that is located near the Angel Stadium, and the Honda Center.  If you're into sports, this is the place to say.  That being said, it is VERY close to the freeway, which is why it probably doesn't have any balconies on that side because the noise would drive you crazy. The nearby restaurants are very crowded if there is a game anywhere, which is inconvenient.  One thing that bothered me was that I purchased a small bottle of wine for $15.  Two minutes later they had set up an afternoon cocktail hour in the front lounge with free wine.  Would have been nice if the front desk personnel would have told me that, but then again, they are there to make money,.
Manager Response: Dear denisekB9313KB,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. I am contented that you enjoyed the optimal location of our hotel. Please accept my sincere apologies for the lack of information provided. I hope this experience does not deter you from staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Stayed one night for a Ducks game. Desk staff were great, room well appointed if a little dated. Bathroom was very clean. Big bonus was that the windows open! We were able to sleep with fresh air, although opening the window did mean a fair bit of freeway noise. Across the street from the Honda Center, and a great restaurant as well. Bit of a jaunt in the morning for a decent coffee, otherwise a great spot. Free internet!

This hotel has everything you need and is very charming, clean and comfortable.  The beds are comfy with good linens and large rooms.  The free breakfast is delicious with a nice selection for even picky eaters. The staff, especially Marcus, the manager, were exceptionally hospitable and made us feel welcome.  The location is perfect for a variety of activities in the heart of So Cal.

We stayed at the Ayres hotel in  Anaheim across from the Honda Centre for our Disneyland adventure. We were very pleased with the hotel. Ths room was great, spacious and clean. The hotel staff were fantastic and helpful. We also enjoyed the daily breakfast, included with the room rate. Will definitely stay here again if we are in the area.

Has a great location.  Right between Honda centre and Angels Stadium. Two block walks.  Beds are very comfortable.  Asked for a room away from the elevator so they put us in one right by it and on the Main Street. Lol. But the city is celebrating and I expected the noise. Ducks are in the playoffs so I expect no less.   Just can't beat the location if you are a sports fan. Incredible.  I heard they also have a cheap shuttle to Disneyland.  Only $10 for parking a day. Sure can't beat that.

I like this hotel because it's clean, quiet, and comfortable.  Breakfast is cooked daily & complimentary.  It was good, but a bit limited as the choice of what was cooked:  Scrambled eggs, sausages, potatoes, & pancakes of what had been cooked.  There were 3 types of oatmeal, pastries, white & wheat toast, 1 type of bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice, & coffee.  The staff is very kind and helpful.

Enjoyed our stay. Big clean comfortable room. Excellent breakfast and easy walk to Anaheim Stadium where we watched the Angels play. Staff very friendly and helpful. We will stay here again next chance we get. Highly recommended.

We have stayed at the Ayres Anaheim many times and have NEVER had a bad stay.  Staff is friendly and helpful and the morning breakfast is of top quality.  The rooms are clean and perfectly appointed.  My only objection has been the addition of a parking fee.

This place is awesome....None better for Honda center events..... the breakfast is terrific and the accomodations are great .. Thier pillows are extraordinary..Staff goes way out of their way for you.... Clean and roomy....will definitely be back

Came to this hotel simply by chance. My family are diehard Angel fans and we had tickets for the opening weekend. We found the Ayres on Expedia and it looked like a close spot for the games. It turned out to be the best spot ever for a sports fan. Not only is Angels stadium a few block down the street, the Honda Center, where the Ducks play, is just across the street! We ended up getting tickets for the Ducks/Kings season finale because it was so close! The hotel is very "upscale" looking and the rooms are clean. The breakfast is beyond your typical continental style as there is a cook on site making eggs, pancakes, and hash browns. I normally shy away from anything but toast and coffee from hotel breakfast but I was all in here. We had a late check out for being Expedia VIP and

Happy with the overall service and the room. Conterble clean. Top floor was nice had good view of the honda center. No problems and the breakfast was good. Will continue to stay any time we attent a hockey or baseball game and both veinues are walking distance.

Summary Heading: Nice place for a couple of nights~
Summary: We were in town for family wedding, most of the out of town guest stayed here, it was nice & close to our venue and had a great restaurant next door. JT Schmidt's. The complimentary breakfast was a bonus, as was having Champagne in the little market.
Manager Response: Dear cbatesrhoades,  Thank you for the candid feedback you have provided. I am pleased that you enjoyed our optimal location as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you again for your insight. I hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I recently decided to do a pro sports "double dip" on a Sunday ‚Äì attend an Angels game in the afternoon at The Big A, then cross the street to see the Ducks take on the Kings at Honda Center that evening.  To help make this day even more enjoyable ‚Äì and less stressful ‚Äì I decided to book a short stay at Ayres Hotel, which is located right across the street from Honda Center.   I was extremely impressed with this hotel. On many levels.   The Ayres' location is obviously great, especially if you're an Anaheim sports fan. I had the good fortune to stay in a third-floor room on the Northeast corner, with a direct view of Honda Center. I went to bed looking at the illuminated, webbed "D" on Honda Center following an OT win over the Kings to clinch the Pacific Division title. Pretty

The hotel is very nice, rooms exceptionally large and comfortable.  Hot, made to order breakfast was wonderful.  Very clean and nice.  However, we requested a NON-smoking room and when we entered, it reeked of cigarette smoke.  We had to run the air conditioner and fan for several hours to get rid of the awful odor.  The internet connection was very poor.  We had to sit outside in the hallway to get better and faster reception.  This made working and conducting business very difficult.  That said, the hotel is also in a great location!  Walking distance to Honda Center, the Amtrak station, as well as several restaurants.  Evening Happy Hour was very pleasant too.  I would stay again, but specify a NON smoking room.  If we get a smoking room next time, I will complain loudly!

This may have been the best hotel i have ever stayed at. Nice new rooms, clean everywhere. Very attentive staff, helpful, informative. Breakfast which was included was amazing. Also a short walk to Angels Stadium. If in the area again i will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great rooms but hallway had musty odor.
Summary: Room, staff, pillows and bed were A1! 2nd floor hallway was slightly warm, humid and a bit musty. I would stay again! (Just because the room was top notch). I did not have a chance to use any other amenities.

The hotel is very clean and the staff is accommodating and nice.  My first night was disrupted by my neighbors upstairs but after waking up to complain at least 4 times, the front desk finally sent security to ask then to quiet down. I was very grouchy the next day but made the most of it. The breakfast is pretty good with several options. I don't eat pork or beef so I was unable to partake in the breakfast meats. I enjoyed the fruit, hash browns and eggs. The batter for the pancakes was not so good. Even when I asked them to be overlooked they were still gooey in the center.  Great tea and coffee bar.  Happy hour was a nice touch. Overall I would stay again.   If I had children I probably would not stay this far away to go to Disneyland. But this friend's the distance was

Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room was clean and quiet.  Will be back in the future.  Right by the Honda Center where my daughter and I saw BTS two nights in a row.  Best vacation ever.  Thank you everyone for making the stay fabulous.

I was going to a concert at the Honda Center and saw that this was close by. Little did I know how close. It's right across the street from the Honda Center and close to different places to eat. The inside of the hotel was clean and cozy and the staff was very friendly. The room was great. There was a microwave and fridge for convenience and the room was very clean.

This place was really great to stay in. It was in front of the Honda Center and I went for a weekend to see my fave band and they were so helpful and everything was excellent and they are nice people.

We stayed 3 nights and customer service was great! Other than having to rekey our room key every day after returning from our outing it was a nice stay.  We will return if we have another family function.

I took my daughter to a concert for her 16th birthday and wanted a hotel close enough to walk to the Honda Center.  Booking was extremely easy, check-in was fast and friendly. I was a bit surprised there was a parking pass fee of $10 but then again, it is L.A. We traveled over 9 hours to Anaheim and our room was ready upon arrival, so nice not to wait. The Hotel was super clean and surprisingly quiet for how many other people were there for the concert. Breakfast was great with plenty of cold and hot meal choices. The staff again, was friendly and efficient. Our experience with this hotel helped make this trip a wonderful one, for both myself and my daughter. When we return to the area, we will definitely consider Ayres Hotel again.

Absolutely great hotel, beautiful clean great breakfast ,right across the street from Honda Center you can literally walk out the door and there it is , which was the reason for choosing this hotel .  They had something new that I've never seen and I work in the hotel business,  as soon as you walk in the room you stick your room key in the little holder to make the lights and the AC work (energy-efficient)  pretty cool .

One of you supervisor derek. Talk to me in a bad way when i call for reservatio i was told it will be a suite with two king beds at time of my arrival my suprise was they give a room with one bed and price was over $200.00 for room i believe charge was extremely high..
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience. I would like to clarify, for the benefit of other people reading the review. We had opted to give you a surprise treat of a complimentary upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite when you stayed previously on a quiet night. This was in order to provide you with a more comfortable stay. That night was quiet, you had booked a standard room at a lower price. The stay you have posted about was on a very busy night when we had a concert across the road at the Honda Center. The price was $60 more that night and we did not provide you with a complimentary upgrade. You received the standard room with one king bed which was the room you had booked. We did explain this to you when you checked in and held an additional room for you at a discounted price until 6pm in case you wished to take it. I have instructed my staff to be sure and let the guest know when we do provide them with a complimentary upgrade, so that there is no confusion. I am sorry for the misunderstanding.

Summary: This hotel was the best one we've stayed at in the Anaheim area in multiple trips over the last 3 years.  Excellent location, close to everything with exceptionally clean rooms and amenities. Generous room sizes, breakfast is definitely better than the average "free" hotel breakfast and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.  This is not a resort hotel, but a wonderful place to come back to at the end of the day after you've enjoyed everything CA has to offer!
Manager Response: Dear Erica,  Thank you so much for your kind words. I was pleased to read that you have found the rooms exceptionally clean and that you enjoyed our big breakfasts. I also very much appreciate your adding that lovely sunset picture. Thank you for your loyalty over the past 3 years and we look forward to hosting you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I stayed for one night at the Ayres Anahem as I had to be at an event at Angel stadium early the next morning.  The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable but nothing luxurious about them at all.  I had a first floor room and it was a little noisy from all the foot and vehicle traffic outside.

Summary Heading: The best family hotel with a great location!!!
Summary: The service was amazing and everyone was very friendly!!  You get a complimentary breakfast every morning which is delicious!!  The rooms are very clean and spacious with very comfortable beds.  We came here with our whole family (it was my son's first visit to Disneyland) and the hotel is in a great location, just far enough from all of the craziness but still only about a 5 minute shuttle ride to Disney, convention center and the garden walk.  You can use the shuttle that picks you up right in front of the hotel so you don't have to drive around and worry about parking!! :) I love everything about this hotel and will definitely be staying here during my next visit :)

This is our go to hotel when we visit Disneyland.  We know what we like and this hotel always delivers. We have stayed here many times and the staff is very courteous.  Last time we visited we came back to the hotel late and there were no more chocolate chip cookies.  The night managers baked more and called our room to tell my husband they were ready.  Now that is service.

What a lovely hotel, complete with complimentary breakfast, pool and other guest services. Perfect for families or couples. Even though it is in a busy area, the hotel itself is quiet and peaceful. Amazing and friendly staff. Will definitely be staying here again!

Summary Heading: Great hotel away from Disney crowds
Summary: This is our second year staying at the Ayres while in town for the USA Cheerleading Nationals.  The location is great -- close to the ARTIC to catch the shuttle to the Convention Center, within walking distance of several restaurants that are of much higher quality than the ones by Disney, and far enough away from the Disney crowds.  The entire hotel is well-kept and the staff friendly and efficient.  Also the price is very reasonable compared to the properties closer to the park.
Manager Response: Dear Julie,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I am delighted we provided a convenient option for you and that we took care of you. I hope we will host for many more years to come.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: The Best Little Big Hotel in OC
Summary: I love the Ayres chain. Every hotel is just awesome.  The property on Katella is  supberb. This was a one night stay. The room was excellent, the staff professional.  The breakfast is the best. Cook to order pancakes. Scrambled eggs are the best. Highly recommended.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Ayres. I will definitely go back. It's in a great location. So clean and ready for your visit. All personal was very helpful and nice. The beds were good and the room comfortable.

This was a last minute booking as we were travelling through Anaheim on a road trip. We have stayed at Ayres locations before and have always been very happy and this trip was no different. The rooms and property are clean and fresh, and in great condition. The beds are comfortable. And we love the included breakfast!!! We have decided to make Ayres our primary choice when we travel in the future.

Good location Free parking Cute spacious room   Pleasant staff  Clean room with good vibe  Comfortable bed, fridge and little sitting area.  Breakfast was good but a little bit hectic,  Honda centre was across the street.. prefect location for the venue

Found this property while looking for hotels near the Honda Center.  Nice European inspired hotel across the street from the arena.  Upon entering lobby you feel like you are checking into a hotel in Southern France or Italy - cozy lobby with a couple of seating area's as well as a communal table for a game of cards or what have you.  We reserved a queen/queen room - room was spacious and included a good sized work desk, bistro table and chairs for small meals, compact kitchenette with good size mini fridge, sink, microwave, and coffee maker.  Bathroom contained toilet and full size tub/shower.  Dressing area contained a sink and closet that housed iron and board, along with a full size safe.  Pleasant, bright, updated room decor.  Room faced road but not much noise during

We stayed for one night March 2 nd and were pleasantly surprised . We went to a hockey game at Honda center and the location of the hotel is only a 5 minute walk away. Room was clean and hotel was quiet . The free breakfast was excellent - bacon, eggs , pancakes , fresh fruit and yoghurt or cereal available . I highly recommend this hotel .

Hotel was nice. Staff was pleasant. Close to the freeway and Angels Stadium; across the street from the Honda Center. Shopping within 10 minutes. A bit pricey for the area but if need be I would stay here again.

The best place to stay away from the madness!!  We always stay every year for our supplement show over at the convention center.  It's nice to stay somewhere that is away from the hustle and bustle of the show area at the convention.  Being able to decompress after a long day a the show is a plus since we are there for 3-4 days.  It's a very clean and comfortable hotel with a very nice staff!

The room was great - roomy, nicely furnished, and good amenities. The staff was also very agreeable. We appreciated the great HOT breakfast! We liked the location with T.J. Schmit's (?) across the street. We also liked the secure parking lot features.

We really loved this hotel! We arrived 2 hours earlier than our check in time and they graciously let us get our room that early. The room was lovely and the bedding comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had great variety each day. We will definitely go back if we get the opportunity.

Great location close to stadiums and offices it is overall clean and decent breakfast. The halls smell and could use renovation, also rooms smell like mold and need renovation. But overall a OK hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Honda Center
Summary: Ayers hotel with its great staff and pleasant American breakfast were a wonderful compliment to the fantastic location adjacent to the Honda Center. Parking was a breeze as we entered the property and were able to easily find a stall which was conveniently outside the from to door of the hotel.

The entire hotel was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Our room was very spacious. Breakfast is included and excellent.  Staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay again! Very conveniently located to many attractions and venues.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. We look forward to hosting you again.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The room and bathroom were clean. Along with some delicious breakfast it was a great stay. One thing you can not lose is your key cards (obviously) but they also control your lighting and A/C in the room.

Stayed at the Ayres to go to a Ducks game. Super easy, with the Honda Ctr just across the street. Well apportioned room. Quiet and spacious. Would definitely stay at the Ayres again the next time I go to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review. I hope that we will host you deep, deep, deep into the post season!   All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: It doesn't get any better than this for live sports events.  Take Amtrak or a bus to the Anaheim Transit Center, which is literally a 4 minute walk from the hotel.  The hotel is literally a 4 minute walk from the Honda Center, where we saw an Anaheim Ducks hockey game.  Just across the street is a local brewpub that had excellent food and their own craft beer.  The hotel was excellent.  European-inspired rooms, an excellent breakfast (with real cooks), and the place was clean and comfortable.  The staff members were very friendly.

It is a nice and clean hotel. I reserved a king suite and the price is amazing. Close to Disneyland and they have a shuttle. The breakfast is ok.  Free parking Free breakfast  Free internet  Business center

Summary Heading: Took Daughter to Disneyland for the first time to celebrate her Birthday.
Summary: The hotel was very clean. (A Must for us) The staff was very friendly and very professional. They had a very nice Birthday basket and a little decoration in our room when we arrived. That was so thoughtful and sweet. The beds are so comfortable. We recommend this hotel
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your recommendation and kind words. I am glad that we were able to make the stay a little more special.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Another pleasant visit to Anaheim Ayres Hotel
Summary: We visit the Anaheim area from Boston to see the Boston Bruins play the Ducks and in the summer to see the Red Sox play the Angels.  The Ayres hotel is convenient to the Honda Center and the Angels Stadium  We always enjoy our visit to this hotel.  Everyone is helpful and friendly.  Until our next trip many thanks for a wonderful stay.

Summary Heading: No Longer a Charming, Superb Hotel
Summary: Our family have been going to this hotel for the last 5-6 years during the Christmas holidays because we enjoyed the warm, cozy Victorian atmosphere.  The lobby used to have a huge Christmas tree next to a fireplace.  The dining room was huge and the food was excellent.  The rooms had a lot of character with Victorian decor.  It just felt like Christmas there! Then they decided to renovate.  This last time staying there, it was totally different. They now charge for parking when it used to be free.  The lobby shrunk with a tiny tree.  The breakfast was similar to a Marriot Residence Inn type of breakfast.  The selection was drastically reduced.  Gone is the Victorian decor in the rooms.  They became very generic and bland similar to a Holiday Inn type room. The worst part is the
Manager Response: I am so sorry to read that you no longer found the hotel charming and particularly concerned to read that we did not provide you with warm and friendly customer service at the front desk. Interior design is, of course, a subjective opinion and we have had mixed reviews.The feedback has been overwhelmingly positive but some guests preferred the old style. We have not changed the size of our lobby. We have added a community table which has been very popular and also has outlets for charging. We have also just completed an expansion of our breakfast room. We have increased the number of choices by adding an oatmeal machine. I am not sure why you found that we reduced our food choices, as the addition of the oatmeal machine is really the only major change. Our 2 chefs who have been serving in the same style for the past 15 years, cook in front of the guests and make cooked to order pancakes for our guests and even Mickey Mouse pancakes for our younger guests. If I am the substitute chef, they look like koalas, so I leave that to the professionals. We have been charging for parking since 2014.
