We do charge $10 plus tax per night which has certainly not been a welcome addition to those guests that have not had to pay in the past. Some guests have welcomed the additional security provided by the gates. We have also staffed an overnight security guard to patrol the parking lot and hotel. I am very sorry that you will not return. I think you may have caught our desk staff in a slump. If you check some other reviews, you will see that they have been doing quite well for the most part. I hope you will reconsider and that we will have a chance to change your mind about the hotel.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great full breakfast, location and staff
Summary: Couldn't say enough about the quality and cleanliness of the rooms. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, including the managers (Who jumped in to help cook when things got super busy) and the kitchen staff had big smile's. Its about a mile away from Disneyland, and all the shopping you could want in between. It's pretty much a one stop shop, including a minimal fee transportation (shuttle) to the park.

My family and I stayed for 5 nights at the AYRES hotel in Anaheim. We visited Universal Studios (a bit of a distance with MASSIVE traffic - prepare) and the Disney Parks (about 10 mins from Disney) The hotel is located right on Katella across from the Honda Center so if there is an event there, which there was when we arrived it can get a little congested but we didn't have a problem getting in at all. There is a parking fee of $10 per day which I wasn't aware about (not their fault - but would've made a difference in choice possibly)   You use your key card to get in and out of the parking lot. If you have kids in strollers park closer to the entrance side of the hotel or on the back side, there is a side entrance as well, otherwise you have to walk around with the stroller

No issues.  Well, we normally sleep on king beds and found that a queen was not big enough for us.  They kindly switched rooms with two queens.  King size beds did not seem to be available. Breakfast was good, though the line for hot food was long. There was an oatmeal dispenser.  The oatmeal was comically awful.  Coffee was good.  Breakfast buffet was okay, not great, not bad.  Staff was very pleasant.  Sheet smelled a bit like bleach.  Fitness room had good modern equipment, better than most. They could use at least a weight bench and a soft pad for situps and floor exercises.  Weirdly, there was no garbage can in the fitness room, but there was a garbage can in the adjoining male/female bathroom.  There was no basket for used towels, so I just threw mine on the floor near the

Summary Heading: Our time at the Ducks Game
Summary: We've stayed here before on a business and personal trip. We're never disappointed staying here which is why we always return and will continue to return. Great staff and great accommodations. Love this place!!!

They staff at Ayres Anaheim accommodated our wedding party block of rooms perfectly. All of our guest were taken care of wonderfully. Everyone came in very late from the wedding. The staff accommodated us and assisted many of the guest as well.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Service
Summary: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Service. I really like how the staff treats their customers, they are consistent in their delivery of customer service for a diverse clientele.  There is a microwave in my room! Yay! 10 stars for that because I can warm up my baby's food! Ayres Hotel will be on top of my hotel listing from now on.

love  the breakfast, clean and friendly. front desk sometimes had too much fun talking to each other but otherwise no complaints.  Misplaced item but is sending it home to me without charge.  liked the wine and guacamole too

As far as the hotel location , it was excellent. I took the train in from San Diego and loved that the hotel was literally right across the street. Not to mention walking distance from the Honda center and JT Schmids where we had dinner and watched the Ducks game.  The room itself was clean and roomy. Not a lot of light. I had to turn on all of the 4 bed lights just for light. I didn't like that the window to the room was right on the street so I kept my curtains closed. It was really loud on the street which made it almost impossible to sleep. In the morning I was woken up by loud thumping coming from upstairs. I thought it might be kids but it sounded more like stomping which started around 5a and didn't stop until I checked out at 10am. Also my AC didn't work so I was

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Families Visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is a reasonably priced boutique hotel chain that is perfect for families. It's located 5 minutes from the park and has a frequent shuttle that will save you from paying Disneyland parking prices. The staff is very friendly and accommodating and there's free full breakfast: eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc. Jose Llamas makes the fluffiest, most delicious pancakes in Mickey shapes for the kids. He is super nice and goes above and beyond to make guests happy. It's the extras like this that make it our hotel of choice when visiting Disneyland!

My teenage daughter and I stayed here on a trip to Disneyland, wanting a quieter place to stay away from the Disney madness.  It was actually quite convenient to Disneyland with an Anaheim shuttle service (the ART) going door to door for $5.50/adult. The ART delivered our passes to the hotel, so we parked our car, picked up the passes, hopped on the shuttle and were on our first Disneyland ride 30 minutes later.  The hotel would be an especially good location for someone coming in to attend an event at either the Honda Center (directly across street) or the Angels stadium an easy walk from the Area.  The room was comfortable, quiet, clean. Nice bed.  We enjoyed the complimentary free full breakfast. The chef was very friendly as he served up pancakes, eggs, potatoes and sausage.

My 2 sons and I stayed at the Aryes Hotel in Anaheim while we attended a nearby event.  When we arrived we were greeted by the nice and helpful front desk staff and was informed we had been upgraded to a king - two bedroom suite...nice!  The room was clean and had a fresh scent (like most of the hotel) and was nicely appointed with up-to-date furnishings.  The beds are heavenly...like sleeping on a cloud.  We all had the best nights sleep, and wished we could have taken the bed and pillows home with us! The free breakfast in the morning was the prefect way to start the day with a chef preparing FRESH pancakes.  The boys sure loved that one! We were able to receive a 1 hour extension on our check-out and the morning staff was just as pleasant as the night staff! Overall our stay

Very clean and convenient location for attending an event at the Honda Center. We ate dinner at the restaurant next door then walked across the street to the concert. I would definitely stay here again!

Very nice room. They put us on side opposite freeway, so was relatively quiet. Right across from Honda Center which was perfect for us as we went to a concert that night there. Breakfast was okay. Didn't really have any vegan choices other than fruit. But otherwise good. Nice pool and spa, small but nice exercise room. Easy access to everything. Close to highway. Close to food places. Nice restaurant across the street. Very nice staff, answered questions and quick with their service requests.

My family loved this hotel. Staff were so friendly and th chef mad my kids Mickey Mouse pancakes that they adored. My wife was a little worried about distance to Disneyland but she learned it was close and appreciated the quiet

We do not have a single complaint about this hotel.  The staff was very friendly, the entire property was clean, including the rooms, parking was convenient and reasonable, and the complimentary breakfast was fantastic.  The best we have ever had.  The location was perfect.  The arenas and stadium are within walking distance, as is dining.  It really couldn't be more convenient.

Very nice clean hotel  Received an excellent hot breakfast daily and rooms were very clean.  Very close to Angels stadium and Honda Center. Great restaurant across the street  and it's right off the interstate. Also close to Disneyland.  Highly recommend !

We stayed at this hotel twice once in 2015 for out babymoon where we fell in love with this hotel. It is super clean, close to a 24 hour fitness (there is also a gym), close drive to downtown disney (prob a good option if you aren't actually planning to go into the Disney parks but maybe want to hang out in downtown Disney.) Then we stayed again with a 10 month old baby and again everything was wonderful and smooth. This hotel is clean, inviting, nice staff, warm cookies in the afternoon, free breakfast, easy parking. We are taking a trip to Anaheim to bring our now 19 month old to Disneyland but we will be staying somewhere walkable to the parks this time. But if ever we are in orange and not planning to go into Disneyland then I would totally stay here again!

This hotel was such a pleasant surprise! When we walked in we were so excited to see the two separate sections within the room. The king size bed, which was unbelievably comfortable, was in the main section of the room and a couch was at the foot of the bed. Then, on the left side of the room there was an alcove that contained a queen size bed, which was perfect for kids.  It allowed us to have our own space, but still be together. If that wasn't enough, the hotel is located just a short distance from Disneyland. Overall, we were very happy with this hotel, the breakfast was delicious, and will definitely be going back.

Very great place to stay always friendly and always so clean and professional I love staying here. Morning breakfast is always amazing and rooms were always fresh and perfect. I couldn't ask for a better place.

The room was amazingly clean, the beds were comfy and the staff was wonderful. We needed an early check in and had reserved the family suite, as we have 3 kids. On the way down there we learned that the family prior to us had left late and the room was not going to be ready. I about had a heart attack, as we needed to be dressed for formal event before the room was ready. The staff worked with me to get us two adjoining rooms so that we could get in early and get ready for our event. They even discounted the rooms for us for our inconvenience. My kids, 13, 11 and 9 years old, thought having their own adjoining room was awesome.   Besides the great service, the continental breakfast was outstanding! There was food ready to go and someone there to make fresh food. We all agreed

First time traveling with a 5 month old baby for a business trip. We cannot say anything negative about the hotel or its staff. They were very accommodating and helpful. The room was very clean and with plenty of room for all our baby's needs and equipment. From a play pen to a bathtub we had it all and plenty of room for everyone to be comfortable. The ART shuttle service was very convenient as well.
Manager Response: Dear Artin M,  Thank you so much for the great review. I am pleased that you enjoyed your experience at our hotel. Making travel arrangements with the little ones can certainly be challenging, I am ecstatic to see that we made it easier for you. Thank you so much for the feedback. I look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Clean, comfortable, and the staff were helpful. Gorgeous huge baths! The breakfast was OK, but you know - it's just breakfast. Pool and hot tub appeared to be working. Decent coffee in the rooms. Good value!
Manager Response: Dear Madeleine M,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and the exceptional service our attentive team strives to provide. Thank you kindly for your feedback. I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Had never been to this hotel but since there was some sort of convention going on all local hotels were full and this was the only one available.  Pleasantly surprised. Very clean, nice looking lobby and rooms. Breakfast was good. Only down side was the location. It's on a corner near a light and freeway exit. So attempting to exit the establishment was a task. Other then that it was a good value for the money and we would stay there again if our first options were not open to us.
Manager Response: Dear 81artmonk,  Thank you so much for the great review. I am contented that you were pleasantly surprised by the service and accommodations we strive to provide. Thank you kindly for the feedback you have provided and the kind compliments you have shared. I look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: A HOTEL THAT MISREPRESENTS THEIR LEVEL
Summary: This was a deplorable experience. The hotel promotes itself as a 4.5 star hotel and it does not deserve 1. The smell of the carpet was filled with harsh chemicals that are dangerous to human health. The hotel should be closed until an overall inspection is carried out.
Manager Response: Dear Paul L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review and provide some insight concerning your recent experience. Though I wish your experience would have been a more enjoyable one, I do appreciate the feedback you have provided as it allows us to improve wherever necessary. We require periodic quality assurance checks collection-wide to ensure our accommodations and grounds are more than exceptional for our valued guests. Nevertheless, thank you for your insight.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel is a great place to stay.  We only stayed for the one night but all their staff were great and friendly.  The room was very clean, layout was nice, many extra small touches gave this hotel a 5-star rating.  Furnishings were nice throughout the hotel and different (nicer) than the usual hotels.  Very comfortable bed and chairs.  Breakfast dining was cooked to order and again the Chef was great and the food tasted delicious.  I highly recommend this hotel and not that far from Disneyland either.  Even Disney recommended them.
Manager Response: Carl V,  Thank you so much for writing a review to let others know about your recent experience. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the accommodations and the services that our attentive team provides. Thank you kindly for the compliments you have shared concerning the cleanliness and decor of our hotel. I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the ayres last minutes for a surprise trip to Disneyland. Thehotel was perfect! We felt it almost too nice for our two year old. But we weren't the only ones there with children so it's fine. The parking was free which is awesome bc every other hotel we've stayed at around Disney always had a high parking fee. Breakfast in the morning was good. Staff very polite and accommodating! We were able to grab the shuttle to Disneyland and it was perfect. Will definitely be staying again!

We stayed here one night during the week and were very happy with the accommodations. This is our 2nd stay at this Ayers. The area has a lot too offer with the Honda Center, Angels Stadium, and Disneyland a few miles away. When checking in we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite and it was wonderful for my family of 3 and my parents. 1 king and full bathroom in one room and 2 queens, mini kitchenette, small table/chairs and full bathroom in main room. The room was updated and clean. The morning breakfast was perfect for a quick bite with pancakes, eggs, potatoes, yogurt, cereal, and pastries.
Manager Response: Dear SLNeil,  Thank you for the candid review. I am glad that you enjoyed your experience and the accommodations we offer. Your compliments regarding our premium amenities are greatly appreciated. Thank you for your insight and I hope to see you again soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel was a great and convenient location as we were participating at an event at the Honda Center.  It was 5 min walk to the center.  Staff  was friendly.  My only problem was that there were not enough front desk personnel to assist with check-out. Excellent breakfast as well.
Manager Response: Dear Val J,  Thank you for the review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your experience and the optimal location of our hotel. I hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: the first day tthrough the my last night stay the housekeeping was top notch. a very good job during housekeeping . the daily breakfast was over the top every day. will be staying there again when every available.
Manager Response: Dear levelleb,  Thank you so much for your review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed the distinctive service that our housekeeping team strives to offer. Your insight is greatly appreciated and I hope you to welcome you back in the near future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I recently stayed here for a week while I was in the area for business. The hotel was nice. It was clean and the staff was very friendly. They even had a hospitality hour every evening in the lobby from 5:30-6:30 with free drinks and snacks. I think the biggest perk for this hotel was the fresh free breakfast every morning. And I mean a real breakfast. Not powdered things. They even made me fresh hot made to order pancakes twice while I was there. For the money this place is really worth the stay.

The window frame was pulled away from the glass so far I could stick my pinky finger through to the outside, I used the provided pen jamming it into the locking rail to squeeze the frame tighter. The entire site looked tired in need of re-fresh.
Manager Response: Dear Thaddeus L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review and provide some insight concerning your recent experience. Though I wish your experience would have been a more memorable one, I do appreciate the candid feedback you have provided us. Rest assured that the necessary improvements will be made. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel was awesome, clean and inviting. The employees were all very helpful and knew everything about the hotel. Our room was nice and the  bed was comfy, decor was up to date. Free breakfast buffet which was pretty good

This was our first time at this hotel, but it definatly wont be our last. The hotel was everything we wanted and more, and every staff member we encountered was outstanding! It was clean, very comfortable, convenient to everything and most of all, extremely friendly!

Summary Heading: Exceptional experience from start to finish
Summary: I chose The Ayres Hotel in Anaheim to be the meeting place for all of my wedding guests. I had started my communications with Marie who was extremely well organized and provided me with all of the information I needed to reserve a block of rooms for my guests and my wedding party. She suggested very fair prices and addressed all of my concerns including parking, transportation, etc. Even though this department of the hotel was transitioning a new member in to this department, the switch from Marie to Lesley was seamless. They did a great job of confirming my reservations (which admittedly were a bit complicated) and disseminating any information I might need to make this process smooth.   As far as the hotel is concerned, the windows are double and triple paned and completely

My husband and I stayed for one night and we were both impressed with the size of the room and the amenities. The furnishings and decor were new and in excellent condition. We had a king bed plus a full size sofa, desk, table and two chairs, and a dresser.  There is a mini bar with sink, microwave and fridge.  We also enjoyed complimentary happy hour in the lobby with wine, beer, soft drinks and nachos. There was also an excellent selection of both hot and cold foods for breakfast.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. The also offered a guest laundry.  I would stay here again and it would be a good choice for a longer stay. Excellent location for the hockey game!

We recently returned for our third time to stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim, and it never disappoints! The beds are extremely comfortable and the staff are so friendly!  This hotel will continue to be our first pick when we visit Disneyland!

On the Disneyland bus route to the "happiest place on Earth", rooms are well appointed with everything you need. The buffet breakfast has a good variety, and the chef will make you a Mickey Mouse pancake that will put a smile on your little ones face. There's a small shop next to reception which is great for snack supplies prior to heading out to Disneyland.  There's also a great bar across the road that does open late, good if you're coming in late and you want a decent dinner. The staff are very helpful and can provide good advice.  Make sure you get the shuttle to and from the airport if you're wanting to save on taxi fare.

Close to Disneyland courtesy of a regular shuttle bus where you pay $5 for unlimited daily use.  Lovely front desk staff who really seem to enjoy their work.  Rooms are cleaned perfectly and the complimentary cooked breakfast is tasty.  Really enjoyed my time here and I highly recommend this property.

Summary Heading: Clean, pretty, and located right by Angels Stadium
Summary: We arrived at the hotel earlier than expected, and they had our room ready for us.  The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with giving directions on walking to the baseball game.    The room was clean and had a good view of the stadium, as well.  The pool was warm enough to use, so that was fun.  There is also a hot tub.  The hotel has a small sundries store in case you forgot anything.  We were also able to buy some wine and champagne there to pregame it.  :)  We also received free breakfast with our stay, which is provided in a room on the first floor.  The breakfast was excellent with several hot and cold options.  There were four of us on this trip, and we were all quite pleased.  Upon check-in, I was given a VIP bag from Expedia, which the hotel prepared.  It

Hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was big although the bathroom was very small. Staff were friendly and effecient. The shuttle is not affiliated with the hotel, but nevertheless is a bit sporadic. The breakfast is quite good as far as hotel breakfasts go. The brewpub across the road is huge and more than a decent place to spend some time. The only annoying thing was that my room key stopped working three times in the 24 period that I was there and I had to go downstairs to fix it. I'd stay here again for sure.

Ayers never disappoints. Super Clean hotel, staff excellent. Chef in breakfast room friendly and the dining room were my husband and I ate breakfast was very clean. Staff groundsmen , definitely take pride in hotel, if trash on ground, then 1 min later, gone! Clean, friendly, safe, cookies in evening. You can't go wrong staying here. A big plus was also conveniently located to the Anaheim Stadium and Honda center.

I enjoy my stay every time with the Ayres hotel. It's very clean, and the beds are very comfortable. I feel that when designing the hotel rooms, they took into account all the things that would make someone's stay comfortable and convenient. I also love the complimentary chips , salsa , and wine every night. Very nice touch.

everything is great . breakfast is great and the dining area is always clean. checked in and out with no fuss. would recommend to anyone. send all my techs there for local training. close to Disneyland , the train and the ice hockey arena.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Anaheim and Disneyland stay!
Summary: We stayed here for a short 4 day Disneyland/Birthday trip for my fiance. Upon check in, we were told that we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite. Amazing! Everything was clearly explained to us.. from how to use the ART shuttle (side note... just take UBER. it's a lot cheaper and more convenient) to where to eat to where to get the best deals for Disney stuff. The room was gigantic. There was a living room with a full couch, arm chair, a dining table by the kitchen and all the amenities needed for a small family. The bathroom was clean and we had no problems. The bedroom was ginormous (bigger than a single bedroom apartment in downtown Vancouver haha)The beds were dream beds. We fell asleep instantly, our backs didn't hurt the morning after and it was very clean. The breakfast

Stayed for 3 nights, the bed was so comfy. The room was large and the breakfast was a good way to start the day. Shuttle to Disneyland was quick. Great place to stay with both the Amtrak and Ice Hockey close by. Happy to return and stay again.
Manager Response: Dear Les C,  It is wonderful to see that you enjoyed the accommodations we provide. Thank you kindly for your compliments regarding our spacious guestrooms and our premium amenities. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Good hotel.  Good location.     Staff was helpful when asked about the area.    Easy to get around.  Parks. Restaurants.  Outlet mall nearby. Room was clean and comfortable. Need to change breakfast menu a bit. Will consider for next trip.
Manager Response: Dear tonylS527DX,  Thank you for the great review. It is great that you enjoyed your time with us as well as the service our attentive team continually offers. Thank you kindly for your feedback, I hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: It is good and quiet. clean rooms and staff are friendly. Morning buffet is nice too. They provide shuttle to Disneyland and $5 per person for round trip. No dinner served from the hotel. You can order food from nearby restaurants, not bad at all.
Manager Response: Dear Jingya G,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent experience. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our hotel and our welcoming team members are warmly welcomed. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We were looking for a low-cost alternative to our usual Embassy Suites and was pleasantly surprised by the Ayres. "Basic" in the sense of amenities, bathroom accessories and general layout, but a notch above in terms of cleanliness, very comfortable bed/pillows, warm front desk, room size and general intimacy and coziness.
Manager Response: Dear VacationFundingDad,  I am pleased that we were able to offer the best value. However, I do regret that our premium amenities such as a complimentary full American breakfast and complimentary wifi did not necessarily meet your standards. Thank you kindly for your insight.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The staff was super friendly - particularly the manager Marcus.  We had a wonderful room - very spacious and comfortable.  Breakfast was terrific - pancakes made to order.  Fast and tasty.  Lots of options.  They made things easy for us.  The shuttle to Disneyland was right out the front door.  It worked well for us as we didn't plan on leaving mid day and coming back in the evening.
Manager Response: Dear MJM_KT,  Thank you for your candid review and the compliments you have shared regarding the exceptional service we strive to provide. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay as well as the premium amenities we offer. Thank you again for your feedback, I look forward to serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The hotel was nice, had great breakfast. I was so impressed by the chef, he had a line out the door and he still managed to handle all the food area, said jokes, he was in a great mood the 3 days we were there. Thank you for being great. The rooms that was a different expierence, the rooms smelled old, the caulking in the bathroom looked dirty, not impressed with the bathroom at all. Aside from that we had a good time.
Manager Response: Dear Lourdes A,  Thank you kindly for reviewing our hotel. I am pleased to see that you were impressed by our breakfast team, however, I do regret to see that our accommodations left much to be desired. Nevertheless, your feedback is greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this beautiful hotel! The front desk and housekeeping staff was very nice. It was clean and the beds were soo comfortable! The breakfast was yummy with a very patient and hard working Jose ( and a female server this morning) cooking up the hot feast. We would stay here again in a heart beat!

Summary Heading: Loved the high ceiling & spacious room.
Summary: Stayed here for one night to attend an event at the Honda Center. The location was ideal for our visit.  We will definitely return- hotel is walking distance to train station, baseball stadium & Honda Civic.  Staff was very friendly & welcoming. Paid parking wasn't too bad. I probably would have spent the same amount to Uber to the Honda Center. There's also a shuttle that takes you to local attractions like Disney. Only issue was the breakfast area was under renovation & a very small room was being used instead. It was very cramped- basically run in, grab some food & exit so the next group of guest can get in. Overall we enjoyed our stay & will return next time we are in Anaheim.

I like this hotel and will definitely visit again. My 2 children and I were here last  week to visit Disneyland. The free breakfast is very satisfying, the chef and his helpers are friendly, the front desk employees are excellent , our room was clean and quite considering that it's at the first floor. I also took advantage to hangout with my friends who lives nearby and enjoyed the Christmas eve around town. This hotel is located comfortably close by the freeways, restaurants/bars, main parks, etc. It looks very presentable to my friends who picked me up to enjoy the night around town. I gave only 4 stars because I needed to pay extra $10 each night of stay.

I found the rooms to be clean and we could open the window to bring the fresh Christmas air in the room. The morning breakfast was busy the day after Christmas and the chef on duty was able to serve delicious food and I was impressed how he kept his cool.

We booked this hotel as a budget friendly option for our Christmas Day at Disneyland and we were very pleased. The room was large and perfect for our family of four. The hotel was clean and staff was friendly. The breakfast was VERY impressive for being included in the price of the room. The chef even made my little ones Mickey Mouse pancakes. We would definitely stay here again!

We've stayed at the Ayres hotel in other cities in California and have always had a pleasant experience. The hotel is always nice and clean and staff is professional and courteous. We always prefer Ayres over other chain hotels. They have a personal touch others just don't provide.

Ayres Hotel always goes above and beyond for us. Their rooms are the best I've seen. The fact that they offer a Disneyland special is also a bonus! I highly recommend Ayres if anyone is looking for a room and has a location near them!

Beautiful Hotel, Clean, comfortable, conveniently located, great free breakfast. Friendly, helpful staff overall a very nice place to stay. However I do object to having to pay for parking when I'm already paying for the room, I understand they allow event parking that they charge for but we weren't there for an event at the Honda Center or the Stadium we were staying in their hotel and feel that parking should be included. The only other drawback was that you had to insert your door key into the card reader on the wall in the room and either leave it there or place the do not disturb sign in the slot or all the overhead lights would go off.

The whole hotel is immaculate in design, cleanliness and comfort. The rooms are spacious and extremely comfortable. Hotel Lobby is beautiful. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is wonderful, a chef is there to serve, help with any food issues (I am Gluten free) and cook your breakfast however you want it. Real china coffee cups. We did not go to Disney on this visit as we were just visiting friends, but intend to use this hotel as a base for a future Disney trip. Disney is approx 1.5 miles away. Reasonably priced for the area.

When I booked the hotel room a month ago, they didn't have any more room with king bed.  I like that they sent me an email prior to my visit to see if they can make additional accomodations.  I requested my king bed. When I arrived, my room was upgrade to a king bed suite. A+++  The free breakfast was great.  One recommendation: don't buy the bus ticket at the hotel.  Just purchase them when getting on the bus, it was cheaper.
Manager Response: Dear Munica L,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am pleased that we were able to provide the accommodations you desired. Thank you so much for your feedback!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Travelling with 2 little kids, we got two queen beds in a room. Room was recently renovated. Hot breakfast with eggs, pancakes and french toast was excellent. We had to pay for parking though. WIFI was excellent quality and it was free. Pretty safe hotel and next to Honda Centre. You can even see Disney Fireworks from your room.
Manager Response: Dear NeoCanada,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay as well as our newly renovated accommodations. We truly appreciate the feedback you have provided and welcome you to stay with us again when you are in the area.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great hotel right across the street from Honda Center, home of the Anaheim Ducks.   Plus just a short walk to Anaheim Stadium.   Comfortable, nicely appointed rooms with microwave and fridge.    Friendly staff too.
Manager Response: Dear Ron B,  I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as the optimal location of our hotel. Thank you so much for your compliments regarding our team and the accommodations we offer. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Breakfast room was being remodeled so it was stuffed in a guest room.  They had no food that was good for nutrition minded guests.  Grips missing on the weight room equipment and the water cooler did not work.
Manager Response: Dear pmissirlian,  Thank you kindly for the feedback you have provided. Please accept my sincere apologies for any and all inconveniences you may have experienced. Nevertheless, I do thank you for sharing your concerns. Hopefully, you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Not what it used to be
Summary: Well this is written with a degree of sorrow. Having previously had extended stays at this hotel over the last eight or nine years it saddens us to note that things have changed for the worse.  It is certainly not the hotel it was.  Whilst it is still a quality hotel the things that made it special have slowly been eroded. Always used to be described as a European Boutique Hotel - well the European part has been well swept away and I am not sure what now makes it a Boutique Hotel either.  In Europe this expression is used to express that the rooms have many differing aspects rather then the monotone rooms now at Ayres.   With one exception the reception/office staff have changed and the happy smiling faces you used to get when entering the lobby have gone (again with the

Summary Heading: The Ayres Hotel has lost two stars
Summary: We have stayed at this hotel several times in the last seven years - sometimes multiple times a year for our Disneyland trips.  This last stay was not the same experience.  We did not visit Disneyland in 2015 so 2014 was the last time we were at the hotel and were saddened that the hotel has lost its charm for us.  The biggest complaint: when we made the reservation, we should have been told that construction was taking place in the dining area.  The cook to order breakfast and the chef are the two main reasons why we loved this hotel so.  But, with the construction, they did not exist.  Also, the construction made my allergies flare up due to the dust.  The hotel was clean, mind you, but the microscopic dust that is inevitable during construction was still there.  Another
Manager Response: Dear Kim,  I am so sorry that your recent stay was a disappointment compared to your previous wonderful visits with us. The construction will be over by the time my response posts (around the 10th of December). We did make every effort to warn upcoming guests with notices in red on our website, our confirmation letters and our pre-arrival letters, but we are very sorry if this information was not better communicated to you during booking. The online travel agents unfortunately did not have the flexibility to post on their websites so there is definitely a gap we were unable to fill there was well. Our chef is still here, and the breakfast room will be bigger and better laid out, which will lead to an even better breakfast dining experience for our guests. We have also just received a few thousand new keys to replace the faulty ones that you may have used. It would be an awful shame to lose you as a guest, given that the chef and his pancakes are still here along with the cleanliness and quietness of the hotel.  Again, I apologize if your stay was anything less than exceptional, and I hope that we will have the opportunity to host you again under better circumstances.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice room, but how do you offer bagels and "toast" without a toaster
Summary: Everything was nice, but how do you not send someone to Walmart to buy a toaster for your hot breakfast.  I know the regular room is under construction, but to offer bagels and bread without a toaster is ridiculous.  That is like offering cereal with no milk
Manager Response: Dear aswierk2016,  Thank you kindly for your review. Though I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your overall experience, I regret to see that our breakfast options left much to be desired. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was our second stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim having also stayed last Christmas. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was excellent again.  The rooms are lovely and spacious, the beds very comfortable, the breakfast selection is great and the staff are lovely and friendly. The kids loved this hotel and asked to go back.  The only bad part (which is obviously in no way the hotels fault) is again (as it was last year), the ART shuttle which is totally unreliable and never comes when it is meant to. One night we were waiting in the freezing cold wind at the park for over an hour for a bus to finally turn up (they were meant to be every 20 minutes that night). I discovered Uber on the last night and found that it is much faster and more reliable, and only $7 each way, so if there

We stayed with a group for a week at this hotel. The rooms were clean and a good size. The beds were amazingly comfortable. The air conditioning was nice especially because it was 33 degrees (Celsius) while we were there. The breakfast at the hotel was amazing. There was a large selection of different hot and cold food and they also cooked pancakes to order. The pancakes were amazing! They will even do a Mickey Mouse pancake if you ask them to. There seemed to be plenty of parking while we were there and I think $10 per night per car was a reasonable price. Some of our group used the pool and found it very relaxing. The managers hour at night was a nice touch with some snacks and drinks and the fresh baked cookies at night were yum. There is a sports bar restaurant across the

We stay at this hotel often . The staff are above and beyond friendly and courteous. The rooms are superb . Best hotel ever . They are doing some renovations for the breakfast area at this time , they have however set up areas for you to eat in . Most hotels would just not serve . I'm completely impressed with every aspect of this hotel from , staff to room , to service and location . The highest rating is not high enough in my opinion
Manager Response: Dear Kt10177,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to write a review letting others know about your experience at our hotel. Your commitment of continually choosing our hotel is greatly appreciated and nothing pleases me more than to see that you had another pleasant experience. Thank you again for the compliments you have shared regarding our team and the distinctive service they strive to provide for each of our guests. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Right across the street from the Honda Center
Summary: When I booked this hotel I did so in error...I was trying to be close to Disneyland but must have chosen the wrong one!  It is about 2-3 miles away and we took the shuttle for $5 pp.  It is however a nice hotel.  They have a great breakfast...bacon one morning and sausage the next.  There was construction to the breakfast room going on but i'm sure that will be short lived.  Rooms are nice, beds super comfy, but the sofa bed was horrible and when I asked that they do something to make it more comfortable for my son on the 2nd night, we came back to find the couch cushions under the sheet (vinyl)!  The night manager promptly did something to make it more sleepable.  I wouldn't recommend the KING room if you have more than 2 people.  Not too many restaurants nearby...a 10 minute

my mother and I stayed here for one night to see a show across the street at honda center.  It was a great hotel.  very comfy, big, and had a wonderful breakfast with all the likings like pancake, eggs, bacon, fruits, bread, coffee and tea. The staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.

We took the train in from Ventura county. Then took it into Los Angeles to watch a football game. Very convenient to be in Anaheim away from Los Angeles get to the game and enjoy an evening at the restaurant it's in downtown Disney.

Stayed for one night to see a Ducks game. Hotel was quite expensive but the location is very good and the rooms and very high quality. The whole room was very clean and nicely decorated, and everything worked well. The hotel was nice, but it was a shame that due to renovations we had to eat breakfast in one of several guest rooms. I would have appreciated a small discount on account of the renovations (it was odd eating in a guest room), but can't really complain as the free breakfast was good.  Overall a high quality hotel with a great location.

Summary Heading: excellent hotel, delicious breakfast, helpful staff
Summary: Ayres is close to the places I needed to go when I was in Orange: Santa Ana and Chapman U. Very nice accommodations and helpful staff. The breakfast is very complete. Although small, the fitness room had just enough space for me to practice a few dance moves!
Manager Response: Dear Yuki205,  Thank you for your excellent review and rating. I am delighted to know that we exceeded your expectations and hope you will return very soon!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Our room on the 4th floor was clean, comfortable, spaces, quiet, and nicely decorated. The room also had a mini fridge and microwave. Breakfast area is well stocked with fruit, breads, juices, coffee, eggs, pancakes, and sausage with plenty of room to eat during the 9am hour. Parking overnight fee was $10 per night. The staff was nice and helpful I would highly recommend this location.
Manager Response: Dear ItalianFestival,  Thank you so much for writing a review to let others know about your experience. The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. Your compliments regarding our attentive team members, the cleanliness, and comfort of our accommodations are warmly welcomed. Thank you for your recommendation, I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This is a really great hotel and very clean.  We visited Disney for a long weekend and had a great experience with staying at this hotel.  It was very clean, service was very good and the breakfast was fantastic.  The one critique I have is that the shuttle to Disney was always late.  Albeit, not sure or fair to blame Ayres, but I would highly recommend they figure something our here because it can delay families up to an hour on getting transportation to Disney given delays in traffic, marathons,etc. Other than that small complaint, highly recommend this hotel and would stay again!  Thanks- Chris
Manager Response: Dear ctbills,  Thank you for your great recommendation of our hotel! I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your stay and that our optimal location met your needs. Though the shuttle to Disneyland is not operated by Ayres, but rather by the city of Anaheim, the feedback you provided is appreciated. Your insight is greatly appreciated and I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent Value Family Hotel - First rate service
Summary: Our family (three generations) chose the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim for a long weekend excursion to Disneyland and environs.  We were pleasantly surprised by the warm welcome and level of accommodation, for the price-point.   The included breakfast buffet was fantastic and a hit with all generations - particularly the custom-made Mickey Mouse pancakes fresh from the griddle!  Convenient shuttle service to Anaheim attractions and guest service was impeccable.  We would go back!

Our stay at the Ayres Hotel was excellent. The staff at check in were friendly and helpful. The hotel is located across the road from from JT Schmidt's Bar and Restaurant. This was very convenient for a relaxing beer and a meal. The buses to Disneyland made visiting easy. The rooms were clean, tidy and comfortable. I would use the hotel again next time I visit.
Manager Response: Dear Gerard111966,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed an excellent experience at our hotel. Our team constantly strives to deliver distinct service and nothing pleases me more than to see that we did just that during your visit. Thank you for your feedback. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Room very comfortable - breakfast was adequate, location to Honda Centre, Disney land and the Freeway are great. There are some local eateries meaning you don't have to get in your car and travel. The Manager was very friendly and the staff very helpful. I would definitely stay here again - a pleasant surprise after the typical stays at your Holiday Inns etc.
Manager Response: Dear MATTHEW D,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel and sharing your experience with others. It pleases me to see that you enjoyed our accommodations and our optimal location. Your compliments regarding our team members and our distinctive service are greatly appreciated. Thank you again for your insight. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Close to Disneyland but not at the resort and it was so pleasant. Quiet, comfortable & upsacale. Staff was great! The shuttles to Disneyland were convenient which made the day easy and relaxing. Definitely choosing them again!
Manager Response: Dear christieh101,  Thank you for so much for sharing your experience with us. I am happy to see that you enjoyed the optimal location of our hotel and well as the ambiance we strive to create. Thank you kindly for your compliments regarding our team and the attentive service we strive to provide. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Everything was great! Customer service, room cleanliness and check-in was great! Beds were extremely comfortable  to rhe point where we slept through our alarms. Nproblems. No complaints!  We will be staying here again.
Manager Response: Dear tanyat844,  Thank you so much for the insight you have shared. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your experience and the service we strive to provide. Thank you again for sharing, I look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Ayers is always one of my favorite hotels and first choices when I stay. I love these hotels and can always count on them for comfort, and safety.  The rooms are always clean and the staff is always polite and helpful. I have never had any problems and always try to stay at an Ayers hotel. The food is great! Plentiful parking! and cozy rooms with comfortable beds and nice decor.
Manager Response: Dear Lisa L.,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review letting others know about your recent experience. Your loyalty to our brand as truly appreciated as are the kind compliments you have shared regarding our exceptional team and our accommodations. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We enjoyed our stay at Ayers Hotel in Anaheim. The daily breakfast that was included was very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is right next to the Honda Center which would be convenient for people attending functions there. The restaurant next door is a little pricey but the food was good. The hotel is a little away from Disney parks but the transit bus to get there is reasonable in price and picks up right outside the door to the hotel. Only bad thing really was that the room smelled musty or maybe like a mildew smell. Bathroom was very clean. Bed was comfortable. Would stay there again if in the area again.

We were looking to stay close to Disneyland and main attractions around LA.  This place was just great!!!  Very clean, well maintained, friendly staff and excellent service!!  Well exceeded our expectations.  Staff was very accommodating and genuinely tried to help and make our stay great.  Many attractions were literally within 10-15 min away.  This place should be top of the list on anyone's option.  Just to note, I did not see this brand in other places, so this must be California only brand, but beats other national name brand hotel for sure!!!
Manager Response: Dear Soung-Phoenix,  Thank you kindly for taking the time to share your experience with us and fellow TripAdvisor travelers. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed our optimal location and the attentive service our team strives to offer. Thank you so much for your compliments and the feedback you have shared. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Far above what I expected from the pictures! Very pleased with my entire stay!
Summary: From the moment walking into the front lobby I noticed it was well updated and very clean. The staff were very courteous and friendly. They actually seemed to enjoy their job and be very efficient with it. Our room was not ready as per our online request but the desk clerk immediately gave us a better room and instructions on internet, parking (the huge concert across the street at the Honda Center), and their full breakfast in the a.m.  The entire hotel is amazingly clean, their rooms are updated and spacious and quiet! Once again, the hotel was one of the main hotels across from the Honda Center where a heavy metal concert was held and even though it let out at close to midnight and people were in the parking lot, we could not hear them. It is that quiet. Everything worked

Great room!  It was clean, comfortable and roomy.  The staff was welcoming and very helpful.  Very good breakfast as well.  The hotel is conveniently located to Disney and other area attractions.  We will definitely stay here again whenever we are in the area.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca S,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. I am pleased to see that you enjoyed your accommodations and the cleanliness of our hotel. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our attentive team and premium amenities. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Returning again to Ayres Hotel Anaheim. Our favourite hotel when visiting Anaheim for Ducks hockey game. Honda Center where Anaheim Ducks plays their NHL games is just across the street.  Got great room, breakfast is way above average. Fresh made warm food and pancakes for you. We'll stay here next time also.
Manager Response: Dear Frode R,  Thank you kindly for your insight and your continued loyalty to our hotel. It pleases me to see that we are your first choice for hotels in the Anaheim area. The feedback you have shared is greatly appreciated and the compliments you have shared are warmly welcomed. I look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We recently took a quick trip to Disneyland, thinking October would be quiet.  Well it wasn't.  All of the hotels close to the park were sold out.  The Ayres Hotel is a bit of a drive from Disneyland but well worth it.  It has a lovely atmosphere and caters a lot to the business community.  But there were still plenty of families.  The staff was wonderful and very accommodating.  They have freshly baked cookies in the evening and a little happy hour in the afternoon.  The breakfast is not the ordinary "free breakfast"  It was hot and wonderful.  The chef even made Mickey pancakes for our grandson.  The hotel is right on the ART route and the bus goes right through the property.  The rooms were nice, clean and spacious.  We will definitely return!
Manager Response: Dear SunDancer1,  Thank you kindly for the candid review. I am happy to see that you had a pleasant experience at our hotel. Our team constantly strives to provide distinctive service and it is great to see that we were able to do just that during your stay! Thank you so much for your compliments regarding our premium amenities and our attentive team members. We look forward to welcoming you back.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel located in very close vicinity for those who's coming to see anything at a Honda Center. Room are perfectly clean and comfortable. I would say bed mattresses And bedding just amazingly soft I wouldn't leave this bed if I could . Highly recommend this hotel to anyone
Manager Response: Dear Irina S,  Thank you for sharing your experience. I was pleased to see that you were satisfied with the optimal location of our hotel as well as the accommodations we have to offer. Thank you so much for your recommendations of our hotel. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I loved the room we were in. The bed was super comfortable. It was located within walking distance of Amtrak and the Honda Center. The only bad thing was there was no fan option on the ac unit. It was either on and freezing or off and stuffy. The breakfast was great. Hot and freshly cooked. Will stay again but maybe open a window if possible.
Manager Response: Dear carriec5150,  Thank you for sharing your experience. I am pleased to see that you were satisfied with the accommodations we offer and the optimal location of our hotel. Your insight and the concerns you have raised are greatly appreciated. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Although the free bfast buffet was amazing, our stay was not. So I give the bfast a big thumbs up! However, upon check in, I saw that our room was across the noisy dining room, I asked to be moved but was told by the front desk clerk that I couldn't. It was horribly noisy right outside my door and the loud talking, laughing and noises kept us awake til past midnight and so tired for Disney the next morning. Waited outside for the shuttle and when it came, was told that we needed tickets and was never informed by the front desk clerk that we needed to buy some, even though we asked extensively about the shuttle when we checked in. So, we missed the shuttle. Fast forward to our return back from Disney. We're exhausted and just want to sleep. Again, loud laughing, talking and
Manager Response: Dear christinal830,  Though it is great to see that you enjoyed our complimentary full American breakfast, I regret that your overall experience left much to be desired. Nevertheless, the feedback you have provided is truly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. The lack of exceptional service you recieved is certainly something that will be addressed with our entire team. In regards to the shuttle service for Disneyland Resort, it is actually an outside service called Anaheim Resort Transit who negotiates the rates. We do not control the pricing unfortunately. Disneyland Resort then informs each hotel shuttle, Disneyland Resort shuttle, and Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle where they are to drop off and pick up guests. This is a safety concern for Disneyland Resort and their guests to ensure each guest is safe and all shuttle transfers are as efficient as possible. Unfortunately, we also do not control where Disneyland Resort directs Anaheim Resort Transit, or any other shuttle service, to drop off and pick up guests. We hope these items do not deter you from returning to the Anaheim Resort area or our hotel. Thank you for your thorough feedback.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: 3 weeks in America and Canada and this was the stand out helpful, friendly staff nothing was too much trouble. Full breakfast included in the very reasonable rate. 15 minutes from Disney and directly across the road from a major intercity rail and bus station
Manager Response: Dear Ramsay H,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am pleased to see that we were able to provide the attentive service you deserve. Thank you so much for the feedback. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I am reluctant to write a review because 1) this hotel is so small and quaint and adorable, 2) the staff was friendly & accommodating, 3) there was plenty of room availability, and 4) the rooms were reasonably priced. My fear is that the secret will get out & staying here will become more difficult. ;) We were in town for college dance auditions and wanted to be close to campus (Chapman), but also close to freeways for access to seeing the sights & getting other places. This was the perfect location. Free breakfast, coffee in the room (a deal maker/breaker for me), clean rooms, friendly staff (especially the sweet man running the kitchen at breakfast), all fantastic. There is a pool, however we did not have the opportunity or time to use it, and things can get a bit chaotic if

Summary Heading: Another Great Stay At The Ayres
Summary: My husband and I had another very pleasant stay at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim!  We went to Disneyland for the Halloween party and stayed at our usual Anaheim choice.  And though it is not in walking distance of the parks, we don't hesitate to stay here at all.  For transportation, we utilize the ART (Anaheim Rapid Transit) bus so we don't have to pay the $19 for parking at Disney.  You can get your ART passes at the front desk. I think we paid $12 per person for a 3 day pass. The bus picks you up right outside of the lobby and deposits you in the bus queue area in front of Disneyland which is then only a very short walk to the entrance booths to the parks. We find it easier and usually quicker than parking in the Disney lot and taking their tram.  Back to the hotel review...

Our family of 4 stayed in one room with two, very comfortable queen beds. The hotel was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The breakfast was really good, and wasn't typical to the free breakfasts that you get at some hotels. If we are back in the area, this is where we will stay.

The hotel is conveniently located and was excellent overall.  Across the street from the Honda Center, and next to Angels Stadium parking lot.  You will need to drive if you need to run to the store for anything, but the lobby does have a small "market" with snacks and such.  The room I had was equipped with a kitchenette (microwave and fridge) so this was great for stocking up on food.  The morning breakfast is great (there's an actual cook for special orders) and cookies and drinks in the evening.  Great hotel for business or families in town for any reason.  It is a little drive from Disneyland, especially if you plan on going in the afternoon with the mess of traffic, but otherwise...perfect.

Easy check in, very friendly staff, very good breakfast, very clean hotel, close to lots of restaurants, across the street from the Honda Centre, down the street from angel Stadium, I would definitely stay here again.

The room was clean and well maintained. The shower head had some blockages that caused high pressure. The bed was to my liking. Docking stars for $10 a night parking. Shame on them for charging extra  for parking.
Manager Response: Dear Anthony H,  Thank you for the feedback you have provided us with. I am pleased to read that you were content with our accommodations. Nevertheless, I regret to know that you were unhappy with our parking policy. I hope the small fee, when compared to other hotel's value in the area, does not deter you from returning to our hotel.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly and well situated hotel.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here on the last two nights of our two-week holiday driving around the United States. We found the check-in process to be simple and the staff friendly. When we attempted to proceed through the boom gate to park, we experienced significant problems, as neither of the two key cards would work to open the boom gate. This necessitated a trip back to the front desk, and after many more swipes of both cards, we eventually got through. We were given a third key card to use, which was also problematic at the boom gate. The room itself was very clean, well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. We were a bit disappointed with the pillows - all were thick and a bit lumpy, with one having lumps the size of golf balls. A bit of variety in the pillows available

This hotel is very nice.  The rooms are nice and spacious and they serve a nice hot breakfast. Nice restaurants close by and just a few minutes drive to Disneyland.  We have stayed at Ayers Hotels before and we would certainly stay there again.

Arrived Oct 17th for a quick getaway.  Never stayed at a Ayres Hotel but decided to try based on trip advisor reviews.  Staff was amazing, hotel was really well done and super clean!  Very clean and comfortable room.  Bonus:  breakfast and cocktail reception (pinot was nice).  Highly recommend and will be back.

Ayres Hotel is directly across the street from The Honda Center.  We went to Anaheim for the opening pre-season Lakers game and it was so convenient.  The hotel was within walking distance which made the evening more enjoyable as we did not have to hassle parking.  The hotel is clean, centrally located for our little trip and the staff was excellent. We were only 10 minutes away (driving time) from old town Orange and Chapman University so we walked 1/2 of the antique stores one day and the other 1/2 the next day.

The bed was very comfortable.  The room was neat and clean and was maintained throughout our stay. The breakfast was more than adequate and the staff in the breakfast room were welcoming and accommodating. Having a shuttle to take all 3 of us to Disney cost less than if we had driven and parked in the parking garage.

The lobby was small and not like the other Ayres Hotels I've stayed at. The breakfast area needs to be more spacious. Moving tables and chairs will do the trick! Possible coffee spills on others because there is no room to walk. All the tables are near the serving area. The back is wide open for tables and chairs. Staff were brilliant and very helpful. Room was clean and very comfortable.

Ayres Hotel from Sales Office Staff, Front Desk, Breakfast Room Folks, Shuttle, and cleaning personnel did an totally amazing job! We had 22 rooms reserved for our son's wedding! Thank you again Lesley and Marie for the outstanding coordination.

This hotel is exactly what we were looking for. Close to Disney, but not so close that the price skyrockets. The rooms were spacious and clean and the free(!!) breakfast was fantastic! The shuttle to Disney was only $5 per person and it ran every 40-50 minutes or so. The only recommendation I have is that the toiletries include conditioner...other than that, we could absolutely stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

the hotel was nice the service was good the food was the best and the location worked out for us we were attending wedding and going to Daisny Land the problem i had was missing of personal property out of my room

Good hotel, 15 mins away from Disney, front desk were very helpful with any questions we had and were happy to recommend and organise us a tour of LA with a local company which included pick up from the hotel. Breakfast was good every morning and the room was a very nice size.  Parking is good, although a little steep and $10+tax a day, for those who are on longer stays (we did 9 nights) this can add up and could really do with being waived for guests that stay more than a night or so seeing as it's pretty hard to stay there without a car. You can understand the charge though being so close to the Honda Centre it stops them being used as an unofficial overflow car park.  Car park has two entrances/exits although some reviews on here didn't seem to notice that, you just need to

I called front desk to get room service for coffee and cups they said we didn't do room service I got upset I had to go down by front desk to get coffee and they had no cups but everything was good thanks
Manager Response: Dear muhannadh624,  Please accept my sincere apologies for any incorrect information that led you to believe we offered room service at our hotel. Nevertheless, thank you for the feedback you have provided, I hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Quiet, Clean & Friendly Hotel 2 Miles from Disneyland
Summary: Ayres Hotel is 2 miles from Disneyland, so far enough that it is quiet.  The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. Morning breakfast was a full cooked breakfast, but if you want something quick there is cereal, toast, rolls, etc. The beds were very comfortable and room was modern and clean.  We would stay here again

Stayed here for our recent trip and found hotel to be very busy and very suitable for what we needed. Only thing that stopped me scoring excellent was the wifi which was free but a bit difficult to connect at time on floor 4. The inclusive breakfast was very nice and staff really friendly. Only thing missing would be a coffee point in reception which is a great thing to have for people meeting and visitors to hotel. We used the pool facilities and was very quiet and they also supplied clean towels for the pool area. If you are a ice hockey or baseball fan this location is top spot as very close and they also have Disney shuttle for reasonable cost $5 per person. If we returned to area would definitely consider the Ayres Hotel again.

The front desk service was great, they had a little gift shop there and there were people at any time,  I think staying here is really expensive from what they offer compared with other hotels, it's really far from Disneyland if that's your destination, they offer shuttles but it's cheaper to go park your car at the resort unless you're going alone with 1 child ($18 usd all day < $5 per adult $2 per kid each way), and you won't have to worry about shuttle times, the rooms were clean except for a big gum spot in the carpet that I suppose it will be really hard to remove but it was kind of gross and sticky when i step on it, I was glad i was using shoes. Tap water at the room tasted gross, and the room cards didn't always open the parking entrance and it was really annoying trying
Manager Response: Dear washumow,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your experience. I regret to see that our optimal location, just about 3 miles out from Disneyland Resort, did not meet your needs. Please note that we utilize the city's transportation system which offers services to and from the park. Anaheim Resort Transit (ART for short) charges per day for their passes rather than per trip. The rate is $5 per adult and $2 for those under the age of 10. Thank you once again for the insight you have shared with us. I hope you consider staying with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Too many little annoying issues that turned me off
Summary: I travel to the Anaheim 2-3 times a month,and was searching for a new clean, reasonable hotel to stay at in the future, so this week I booked a stay at this Ayres property to give it a try. The bottom line, there were too many small issues that makes me want to keep searching. First, the room that they gave me at check in, only had one side nightstand. I prefer out of habit, and due to a bad back, tend to sleep on the lest side of the bed. So, I asked for a room with two nightstands and was move to a room that had a broken window. I could hear road noise as if the window was open. So, after moving to the 3rd room, I got my desired left side nightstand, but here was no lamp on it. Its nice to have a lamp on a night stand in case needing to wake up in the wee hours. I remedied
Manager Response: Dear WolfeelDiver,  We kindly encourage our guests to voice any and all requests while making their reservations so that way we are able to make the necessary accommodations and adjustments prior to arrival, rather than during the stay. Thank you kindly for sharing, I hope that your future accommodations are both comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We loves staying here when we are going to hockey games or concerts at the Honda Center. The rooms are spacious and clean. We love the complimentary breakfast and the pool :) Our fav place to stay in Anaheim
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and that our optimal location, as well as our premium amenities, met your needs. I hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel is clean and comfortable. It is close to the road. But as a light sleeper, the noise from road doesn't bother me at all. The breakfast was good. The hotel has a shuttle service to Disneyland, which is handy. We don't like parking at Disneyland. We can go to Disney during the daytime and coming back for dinner and go to Disney at night again!
Manager Response: Dear JC_Auckland,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel and for the kind compliments you have shared regarding our clean and comfortable accommodations. I look forward to welcoming you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My husband and I got a room here for my birthday weekend and really enjoyed our stay. It's fairly priced, the rooms were nice and clean, and the breakfast buffet was amazing. It's also a 10 minute drive to Disneyland, which is the reason we chose to stay there.  We were really impressed with the breakfast. That was probably the best hotel breakfast I've ever had. It was a buffet, but rather than being self-serve, you tell the chef what you like, and he prepares a plate for you. If you want pancakes or hash browns, he makes them fresh on request!  The only MINOR COMPLAINTS I have are 1) They don't have conditioner. I actually like to use hotel shampoo, soap, conditioner, and lotion when I travel because that's less to worry about packing, so for them to not have any is a minor

Best experience ever staying at a Hotel!!  We recently stayed at the Ayres whilst my daughter went to minecon at the Anaheim convention centre for a wish given to her by the childrens charity starlight.  Every single person there was extremely friendly and went above and beyond to ensure we had the best possible time!!  The rooms were lovely, the breakfast was awesome and the pool and hot tub were a welcomed bonus.  The complimentary drinks and biscuits on a weekday afternoon were a nice little touch too!!  I couldn't recommend this hotel any more!!  A special thanks and mention goes to Marcus (The manager), Ken (gained legend status for his pizza ordering efforts), Andrew, Derek, Jason, Romy and all the other staff I may not have mentioned!  Thanks for everything guys :)  Joe
Manager Response: Dear, Joe D,  I am so happy to see that we were able to provide the best hotel experience. We strive to go above and beyond for our guests and it is great that we were able to do just that during your stay. Thank you so much for your warm compliments regarding our team, premium amenities, and our accommodations. It was a pleasure serving you and we look forward to doing so again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel was clean, comfortable and quiet, away from the Disney hype. A shuttle is available at $5/person per day.  Breakfast is included and a little underwhelming. I would have liked more fresh fruit options (sorry, I think I was suffering after 2 weeks of USA diet- eek!). The front counter staff on the first afternoon and next morning seemed hard to extract information from. I believe it was Graham who helped us with transport information and booking to get to Santa Monica was fabulous.
Manager Response: Dear ViperAustralia,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. Your compliments regarding the cleanliness of our accommodations and our optimal location are greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided and the concerns you have raised. Rest assured that we will work on making improvements wherever necessary. Thank you once again for your insight we hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Friendly staff, ,comfortable rooms, easy access to local attractions, John Wayne Airport etc. walking distance to ball park, Honda Center and several restaurants. Overall a great family and or business hotel.
Manager Response: Dear James W,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! The feedback you have provided is greatly appreciated. I am thrilled to read that you enjoyed your experience and the attentive service our team provided. We hope to see you again very soon!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: this is the second time I have been to hotel and had to wait at least 15 min to check in.  U need to have more than one desk clerk.  Also breakfast is declining, not as big of a selection as previous visits
Manager Response: Dear fastfosters,  Thank you so much for your candid feedback. Your input and your concerns are greatly appreciated as it will allow us to make improvements wherever necessary. I hope this does not deter you from staying with us in the future as we would love the opportunity to welcome you back!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: From the minute we walked through the front doors we were impressed.  We can't say enough great things about this property.  The rooms were really nice, quite and a great value.  The location is perfect.  the Front Dest was very helpful in directing us to a great place for Dinner too.
Manager Response: Dear DnATru,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am happy that you enjoyed your accommodations and truly flattered by the kind compliments you have shared regarding our value and optimal location. We hope to welcome you back very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Highly recommend the joined family rooms.  Lots of room, privacy and very comfortable beds.  Team servicing the hotel was excellent and shuttles ran from the door to Disney regularly. Great little shop in the foyer to get get essentials without normal hotel markups like wine/beer/water/choc/icecream. Great value versus staying right in Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear Matthew H,  Thank you so much for your kind review. Though adjoining rooms cannot be guaranteed, I am happy to see that we were able to accommodate your requests. Thank you so much for the insight provided as well as the kind compliments. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Ayres Hotel was a perfect choice! Great breakfast, large rooms and a perfect King size bed, very peaceful, good location near Disneyland and even to LA If you have a car. Parking is not included in the fare, but not expensive - USD10/day. Worth every penny!

This place is nothing short of amazing. We went for our anniversary and Jason Johann is the man,very nice, very helpful and didn't hesitate to help us with whatever we needed. If your looking for an awesome hotel and good staff you wanna stay at the Ayres Hotel. Thank you again Jason Johann!

We had a great stay. We always stay here when we visit. It's so clean and comfortabe. Great service too!  Especially Andrew at the front desk. Very accommodating!   We lovw the breakfast very much too! Thank you!

Never heard of the Ayres chain of hotels being from Hawaii but tried it out and was pleasantly surprised by the stay.  The front desk was pleasant, the room was clean, the breakfast the next morning was great (as was the chef behind the grill) and I would definitely stay here again.  We came for a last minute Disneyland trip (won some money on the craps table while away on business in Chicago) and the only reason we didn't stay for our entire 3 nights there is that it was a little farther than we thought we wanted.  Looking at thinga after the fact, it probably would've suited us just fine as we decided to stay at Disney the entire day once we arrived by the ART shuttle van (which they had access too as well).

We recently stayed at the Ayres Anaheim, and this is not our first visit. This is our hotel of choice for trips to Disneyland. We appreciate the very clean rooms, which always smell fresh and are immaculate in our experience. The staff is generally friendly, the hotel serves a fantastic breakfast, and staff is responsive. Andrew in particular is a staff member we genuinely look forward to seeing. He is personable, accommodating, and responsive. An asset to the hotel for sure. Otherwise, Ayres does an excellent job of creating a positive atmosphere.
