Regarding its proximity to Disney, it is a short drive to the Buzz Lightyear parking lot, and a straight shot down Katella, so that really works well for getting to the park easily.  We noticed this time in particular that the room

Stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, great space. Beds we very comfortable, fast Wi-Fi, and the complimentary breakfast we very good.  Through in the new shuttle and you have a home run. They do not have a very large snack and beverage area for sale, but the wine is actually pretty good.

my wife and I visited from new Zealand for a week in mid august.Great service from Jason, ken and Lesley. Great location with transit station and baseball stadium a stone throw away. Try the bunch of eating places about a ten minute walk away especially the tilted kilt. Happy hour was top notch and nice breakfasts.
Manager Response: Dear hitchy2016,  Thank you for your review. It is great to read that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and the service our team provided. Thank you for your kind words and the feedback you have shared. I look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best service, staff, property and pancakes!!!
Summary: This hotel is awesome!!!  From the rooms, beds, pillows, and of course Chef Jose and his awesome pancakes!!!  The hotel's exterior and interior is very charming!!!  The food is excellent, especially the pancakes!!!  Please stay at this location!!!  You will love it!!!

I checked in online the day prior to my arrival.  As I was driving to the hotel, I received an email that told me my rooms would be ready at 2:30PM.  When we arrived at 3PM we were told by the man at the front desk both rooms were still not ready.  He told us we had to wait so long because we requested adjoining rooms.  I have no idea how they got this request as it did not come from me.  In fact the day prior I requested a first floor room.  They told me they could only get us one of the rooms on the first floor and the other room would be on the second floor.  This wasn't a big issue for me, but then the adjoining rooms I allegedly requested were both on the third floor.  When were were finally allowed to enter our rooms (about 3:30PM), I noticed a strong odor in one of the

Checked in on our last night on Hols so any review is likely to be  a bit subdued!! Large room, friendly staff. Particularly liked the parking garage around the back to leave the car nice and cool. Right next to the Freeway but traffic noise wasn't an issue. It wasn't the easiest hotel to get to so get used to Uturning around it! Lots of space in the room; would stay here again but could also be won over by others!

Everyone was so helpful and kind....Andrew and Derek are awesome! Was clean and quiet and a beautiful and big room! Checking in and out was fast and easy. Very welcoming with cookies. Overall exceeded my expectations.

I reserved the room several months ago due to having tickets to the Angel game on the night on September 17th. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by the clerk who stated let me check and see if I have any rooms as we are booked and it is 5:00. I stated I have a reservation for a room with 2 queen beds and another statement was made I don't think I have any 2 queen bed rooms. I realized they were booked because of the Garth Brooks concert at the Honda Center and the Angel game but this has nothing to due with my reservation. And if the hotel was overbooked that again is not my problem. We have stayed at the hotel for the last 4 years we have come down for the Angel game. Luckily they still had a room but we should NOT have had to go through the BS of arguing about a room

This is a stunning hotel in the middle of a really busy tourist hub not far from Disneyland. It's top quality all the way. Check in was easy, warm cookies on the counter, parking right near the door and that was before we even got to our room!  It was a very warm day in LA when we arrived and when we first walked into our room it was quite hot but the air conditioning was surprisingly powerful and had it cooled down to the point of needing a jumper in no time. The bed was unbelievably comfortable, there were USB and power points in each lamp next to the bed for easy charging of our devices and the room and bathroom was extremely spacious. It was very quiet from both hotel and outside noise and was like a little relaxing bubble away from the rush of Disneyland.  We spent 4 nights

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel many times and with each visit we love this place even more!  The staff are super friendly, professional and helpful.  The hotel itself is lovely with lots of charming details.  Every guestroom we have ever stayed in has been very clean and comfortable.  Everything is just great about this hotel but what really puts this hotel above all expectations is the free breakfast in the morning.  The breakfast has a variety of foods and has a lot to offer.  In addition, the chef, Jose makes breakfast that much better with his warm personality and great hospitality.  He even made mickey mouse pancakes for our toddler!  We absolutely enjoy seeing his smile first thing in the morning and we thank him for his great service!  We will continue to

Stayed here 2 nights while at Disneyland.  We had a king bed with a sofa bed. The King bed was very comfy. The kind of bed that's hard to get out of in the morning because it's so comfy. Pillows were just as comfortable and I'm picky about my pillows. On the other hand, the mattress on the sofa bed was just the opposite ( our 20 year old son slept here) You could feel every metal spring with just the light touch of your hand so you can imagine sleeping on it. (I informed them of this upon checkout) The hot breakfast was delicious and filling. We always enjoy the comfort of Ayres Hotels, but beware of sofa beds.

Summary Heading: One of our favorite area hotels.
Summary: Amenities, location, condition of hotel and rooms, everything is excellent. A pleasant, clean and quiet room (stayed on first floor facing parking lot) with lots of space and comfy bed. We walked to the Angel game and could do the same for Honda Center events. Lots of entertainment, dining, shopping nearby for walking or taking the bus system. $10/night parking allows for in and out privileges on the off chance you need it. Pool and fitness area are small but that's not what you're there for. Free breakfast in morning is better than average. My ONLY complaint is that they did not acknowledge our anniversary in any way regardless of the fact that we noted it on our reservation and when we checked in. Missed opportunity for exceptional customer service (it's the little touches

Good location.nice staff.nice room.fair price. Need car.nice breakfast. Easy shuttle to Disney. Good outlet nearby. Would stay again. Near highway but room was silent.near angel stadium for Those who likes baseball. Near Honda Center if you like hockei.very near bus/ train station if you are not with car

This is an exceptional hotel!  Have stayed here numerous times for business, so decided to bring the family for a weekend get away to Disney.  Hotel staff was courteous upon arrival until departure.  Hotel has many conveniences that fit into our lifestyle; fridge, microwave, comp breakfast, and close to so many attractions, shopping, and dining!  Will definitely be back for both business and pleasure.  Highly recommend!

Summary Heading: My stay at Ayres, Anaheim, from 4th to 8th August 2016
Summary: Top class/top of the line hotel. Very good for families & families with kids. Very clean and very well maintained hotel. Special mention must be made of Mr. Marcus Collins the General Manager who is a thorough gentleman and most gracious host. He helped us on our arrival there and dropped me and my wife (indian vegetarian's) off at an Indian Restaurant and picked us back from there, once we had finished. Mr. Marcus might remember me as the Indian who works on a ship as Chief Engineer. Very, very, spacious rooms & very, very, clean rooms. Everything about this hotel is to be liked. Our stay was just so wonderful & pleasant here. Front desk staff were very helpful. There is a coin operated laundry on one of the floors (I think 4th floor), which is very convenient for the guests.
Manager Response: Dear HariJayanthi,  Thank you so much for the candid feedback you have provided and for letting others know about your recent experience at our hotel. It was an honor serving you and going above and beyond to provide you with a personalized experience. Thank you so much for the kind words you have shared regarding our attentive team as well the comfortable accommodations and premium amenities we have to offer. I look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Room was very clean and serviced daily. Breakfast was good with many items to choose from, including pancake on order and bacon or sausage. I was very impress with the friendly staff also. I have stayed there multiple times already without any issues. The Wi-fi can be slow but it's free so don't expect to be streaming videos or playing games on the Ipad. I didn't have any issue with parking even when coming back very late from Disneyland. The pool was also nice and clean. The free premium "movie" channels did not work but all the basic channel did for some reason. I was too tired to really watch TV so I didn't bother to ask them to fix it. I would recommended it.

Excellent place to stay as it's close to the ARTIC/Anaheim Train Station, Disneyland and Angels Stadium.  Mainly chose this place because of the excellent Annual Passholder rate (20% off rack I believe) and there's a late checkout option you can reserve for $30 (which I needed after doing the Half Marathon on Sunday).  Room is clean, modern and large space wise.  The fridge and microwave are a plus.  The free cook to order breakfast is one of the better ones I've had.   We did have a problem with the tub not draining very quickly, took a shower and would be ankle deep in water in a few minutes.  We called the front desk and this was fixed within minutes by maintenance, so excellent customer service there.   I'm only docking a star off because Housekeeping knocked on the door
Manager Response: Dear lrenzdg,  Thank you very much for reviewing our hotel. I am pleased that you enjoyed your stay and the optimal location of our hotel. Our team strives to provide prompt and distinctive service, I am contented to see that we did just that. Nevertheless, please accept my sincere apology regarding the miscommunication between our housekeeping team. Thank you kindly for your feedback, we look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Rooms were clean and super comfortable, and I had a very quiet experience. Close to everything I needed. Complimentary breakfast was great! Friendly staff! I even stayed an extra night, since I didn't want to travel back to San Diego in the heavy traffic. Will definitely stay again!!
Manager Response: Dear Beautyfrmashes,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review based on your experience at our hotel. I am delighted that you had a pleasant experience. Thank you so much for your kind compliments regarding our accommodations, exclusive amenities, and our attentive team members. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We had high expectations for the ayres hotel as we'd done our research through T.A . overall we had a good stay we checked in 6.30pm but the twin we booked wasnt available as the check in was late?there was a managers reception on when we got there few nibbles with beers and wine.we then where told theres a $10 a day parking charge seemed a bit harsh as its 10 mins drive to disney and theres a lot of hotels nearer that dont charge .The rooms and hotel where spotlessly clean and large too.the fridge in the room was handy but a bit on the small side.Breakfast was good hot and tasty.The location is ideal for honda centre and the angels stadium and theres a nice j.d.smitz next to it.other than that its a drive to everywhere.I would maybe look elsewhere next visit to anahiem purely
Manager Response: Dear 1705gary66,  Thank you for your candid feedback. I am happy that you had a pleasant stay. Your concerns and the feedback you have provided are greatly appreciated. Thank you for the kind compliments regarding our complimentary breakfast, the cleanliness of our hotel and the optimal location.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We have Disney passes and love the Anaheim Angels. We walk to the game and take the ART to Disneyland. The staff is so polite, especially Jason. The rooms are great and the beds are so comfortable. Great breakfast.  First choice over any hotel in town.
Manager Response: Dear lovemybri57,  Thank you kindly for sharing a review about your experience at our hotel. Your loyalty to our hotel is greatly appreciated as well as your kind compliments regarding our attentive team. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel south of the orange curtain
Summary: The Ayres Hotel Anahein is the "Best hotel south of the Orange Curtain!"  The staff is always accommodating and professional and The accommodations are white glove clean.  I've stayed in most of the various room sizes and they're always spacious as well as inviting.
Manager Response: Dear Jurgen S,  Thank you for review of our hotel. I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate the kind compliments you have shared with us and fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Our team strives to provide a distinctive experience for our guests and I am glad that we were able to do just that for you! I hope you choose to stay with us again soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was a great hotel and I would love to stay here again. The rooms were modern, smelled good and the staff was friendly.It was a little over priced for the area paying $185 for one night. Check in process was a little slow. I am disappointed that I have not received my $100 back from the deposit. Overall a good hotel

Summary Heading: A Clean, quite, restful place to stay. Service is excellent.
Summary: We were pleasantly happy with our stay. Similar to the quality to a Hyatt Place. The beds were very comfortable,  and the rooms were large and modern. The customer service is quick and friendly.  We stayed in a room with two queens. The room had a sink, small refrigerator, and coffee maker. The daily morning full breakfast was delicious and some of the items were gluten free. Our son did the Disney 13.1 half marathon on Sunday and there was a free shuttle for him to the park at 4 AM . We will definitely return.
Manager Response: Dear MariefromSFBay,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am thrilled that you enjoyed your stay and had a pleasant experience. Thank you for the feedback you have provided us with and the kind compliments regarding our team and comfortable accommodations. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Room was spacious and the bed was comfortable.  One problem was a noisy refrigerator that literally froze our food and beverages.  Had to dispose of all our vegetables.  Also, the toothpaste in the sink left over from the previous guest made us wonder about the overall cleanliness of the room.  Makes the stay somewhat creepy and uncomfortable.  I'd give the breakfast a 7.5/10.  Not bad, but I've had better at less expensive hotels.  A server prepares your plate cafeteria-style instead of having a buffet, so you have to wait in a long line even though you may only want another sausage.  Each day the choices were scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes and pancakes.  Also offered dry cereal, instant oatmeal, some fruit, toast, bagels and powder donuts.  I know the website states that

Summary Heading: Nicest hotel in the Chapman University area
Summary: As a parent of the Chapman student I visit the City of Orange as frequently as I can.  To avoid renting a car many times I will stay at a hotel that has taxis readily available.  This time I stayed at the Ayers because I did have a car with me.  The rooms were beyond my expectations and I received a Chapman rate.  I have been told this hotel books quickly so I am trying to make my travel arrangements sooner.  I will always stay at the Ayers when I plan a visit to Chapman, as long as they have a room.  The beds are extremely comfortable and I find the rooms to be spacious.
Manager Response: Dear Lynnae B,  Thank you kindly for choosing Ayres Hotels. I am ecstatic that our accommodations exceeded your expectations. Your kind compliments are greatly appreciated and we would be honored to have you back whenever possible!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but could be better for the price
Summary: Stayed for the Angels game because it's right across from the stadium with a short walk.  Rooms small but comfy.  Service was ok could be better.  A bit noisy but overall functional to sleep.  We would stay again because hotel his a clean hotel. Could use some upgrades.

Was a great experience everyone was nice and very helpful . Rooms were clean nice breakfast was good as well . Family friendly kids loved it pool was nice as well . Our room view was nice well organized very welcoming
Manager Response: Dear Jazmin L,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and the accommodations we provide. Additionally, thank you for your kind compliments regarding our attentive team members and the cleanliness of our hotel. We hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Walking distance to angel stadium- Rooms were clean and well kept. Fridge and microwave were nice also had a coffee maker. Beds and pillows amazing. Breakfast well they had eggs potatoes bacons and pancakes. Toast fruit coffee juice hot coco- and to go cups very handy!
Manager Response: Dear dgarcez,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. It is great to read that your enjoyed your stay and the overall value that our hotel offers. Thank you for your kind compliments regarding our accommodations and exclusive amenities. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I spent a week at Ayers and it was great. The staff was really helpful and the room was very nice. I would stay here again. I would also recommend this hotel to anyone. It's located near the freeway and there were plenty of amenities near by.

We visited Disney last year and decided to stay again at the Ayres Hotel on this return visit.  I think that they have made some improvements such as new carpet.  Our room was nearly overlooking the main entrance, but we weren't disturbed by noise.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The staff were kind and helpful.    My only minor criticism is that the yoghurt at breakfast is served in a large dish, from which you help yourself. Yuk!  Individual sealed pots please.  If we visit Disney again, I am certain we would choose the Ayres Hotel.

Summary Heading: Practical option for an overnight stay
Summary: The hotel was clean and efficient. Parking was a little confusing, but the front dest personnel was very helpful. The location is directly across from the Honda Center and Angel Stadium. No restaurant on premises, but they provide a 24-hour mini mart for a drink or snack. There is a restaurant right across the street, as well. The room had a refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave and breakfast was great. They also provided free internet and a AAA discount. They had fresh pancakes and many other options in the spacious dining room. Very friendly staff. Good option for the price.

Family of five stayed for 6 nights in two rooms, one on freeway side, one main road/ car park side of hotel.  Rooms ok and clean but really really noisy especially freeway side.  Staff said all rooms were noisy due to Anaheim being built up which is fair enough but still not what you expect.  Also disappointed by pool, very small and located in car park which is not what we expected from photos and hotel description, we booked hotel because it had a pool but disappointed.  Breakfast was a bit frenetic but good, staff in their especially helpful,more at pancakes!

This is an area that does not have great hotels. I think this is the best around. The rooms are clean and fine. Nothing high end like a good moderate priced hotel. There is an adequate breakfast included and they do have a small gym and weight room. Overall just fine.

Awesome ! Walked to the game 5 min great breakfast clean rooms awesome staff great customer service ! Great location for the game !cheap safe parking ! Great restaurants all around ! Even a movie theater down the street ! Would stay again for sure !

Summary Heading: Loved staying here. Everything exceeded expectations
Summary: Everything was like brand new and very clean, from the lobby to the pool/hot tub to the room. The beds were very comfortable, and service very friendly. Look forward to our next stay. The breakfast was the best we have had at a hotel. Loved the guava juice.

Summary Heading: Faux heritage vibe fun but needs some upgrades
Summary: My partner and I stayed at the Ayres hotel in Anaheim for 2 nights at the end of August during which time we had a pleasant and comfortable stay with easy access (by shuttle bus) to Disneyland - the point of our visit. Our room was spacious and very clean with  a comfortable bed, coffee maker, TV, microwave and desk. The only minus was the large and INCREDIBLY noisy air conditioning unit that seemed to have two settings - off and full-glacial-blast. Without it going all night the room was a furnace so we had to put up with the noise in order to be comfortable. Perhaps an upgrade for the units to bring them into this century is required? Also - we received great service the evening we arrived and checked in but on the day we left not so much...the two early 20-somethings manning
Manager Response: Dear Naturescandy,  Thank you for posting a review. I am glad that you had a pleasant and comfortable stay and were able to get to and from Disneyland easily. I am sorry that the air-conditioner was not functioning as it should. We are able to repair or replace these units if they do not operate properly which we have been doing over the past couple of years. We have replaced most of our units now.  I was very disappointed to read about our staff members' behaviour. I have addressed the issue and am confident of an improvement.   I hope we will have an opportunity to host you again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: All that you want or need
Summary: Clean and well presented. Good size room.  Friendly staff. Great location for Angel Stadium and Honda Centre. Easy to get anywhere else. Excellent breakfast. Didn't like having to pay $10 a day for parking.

I traveled by Amtrak and greatly appreciate the hotel staff's consideration In my check-in & check-out times.  I love staying at the Ayres Hotel - Anaheim. I enjoy the jacuzzi & amenities & always leave feeling pampered & satisfied.  Just signed up for rewards program - this is great incentive/reward -  look forward to accumulating points.

Great customer service from the moment I stepped in to the moment I walked out. First time staying there and I can say I wouldn't mind staying there once more. Comfortable bedding and pillows. I enjoyed my stay

Ok, on the surface, I would give them 4+ stars. The front desk was friendly and attentive, the hotel is convenient to Disney Land (well, three miles away, but, if you have to drive there, what is the big difference between 1 mile or three?). The room was nice. I liked that they had breakfast...however, it is severely understaffed. One cook, and one busboy= long line, and a stack of hundreds of dirty dishes all around the room, and no clean tables. I had to 'bus' my own table, and try to balance the dirty dishes on top of the other dirty dishes.  The room seemed clean. HOWEVER, we did need the pull out couch for our kids. There were no sheets or blankets, or pillows. And, no one in housekeeping. So I had to go downstairs to get these things....and the blankets were GROSS. Like

Good priced hotels clean good food Nice pool.  Another tourist gave me a beer in the pool.  Well 2 beers. Good atmosphere Close to the beaches and Disneyland without paying the high cost of staying a few blocks  from the ocean. It's a five or 6 mile drive. Worth it.

Spacious room, free wifi, friendly staff. Loved the complimentary breakfast. Great location off the freeway and directly across the Honda center. Extremely close to Disneyland. Parking spaces were large and in abundance. Overall an enjoyable stay.

The Ayers was one of the nearby hotels recommend on the Chapman website. Stayed one night with my daughter and we were not disappointed. Pleasant staff, rooms were clean and well appointed. Our room included breakfast, which was a welcome surprise.

This hotel is small, clean, and a good value if you are visiting Disneyland. Although they are a chain hotel it doesn't feel that way. They recently remodeled and everything looks fresh and clean. There are 2 reasons I won't give this hotel 5 stars. One reason is that the breakfast is just OK. The lines can get long bc they now require you to show your receipt with how many people are in your party before you can get food. Not a huge deal but during peak periods it slows everything down. The breakfast is average with options of scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, and pancakes along with the regular yogurt, cereal, etc. One other point of concern was an impression I got from someone at the front desk. While I was checking in he answered the phone and apparently the person on the

The hotel is lovely and in a great locale. We came to see the Yankees play at Angel Stadium and this was the prime location for us to stay. We walked across the street for dinner and then walk to the ball game and had a great time later we came back to our room with dessert from the restaurant across the way . Nothing could have been more perfect for our weekend getaway. We look forward to staying at another Ayers property in the near future! Thanks for a great weekend!

Summary Heading: Great choice for a family stay
Summary: Ideal choice for families visiting Los Angeles; location is beautiful & in vicinity of Disneyland.  Excellent rooms, great customer service, good food.  Ample parking space & superior complimentary Wi-Fi service.  They have an innovative rewards program too.

The room was clean the beds were so comfortable.  Having the little kitchenette was perfect.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone in the area.  We able to take a break from Disneyland for a quick swim and break before heading back for the evening.

I enjoyed my stay here. Staff was friendly, room was clean and breakfast was good. Close to many things in the area. I was in town to visit family, but was also able to hit outlet mall and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Heavenly stay at Ayres in Anaheim
Summary: This was our first time at an Ayres Hotel, but won't be the last.  From check-in to check-out, the staff was friendly, helpful and efficient.  The on-duty manager told the staff at check-in to give us a room with a view of the Angels Stadium when he overheard us telling them that we were attending the game that night.  Room was large, clean, quiet, and bed was very comfortable.  The evening drinks and snacks, and the complimentary hot breakfast were better than many other chains provide.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay (despite the Angels losing that night).

Summary Heading: Very good value and nice room
Summary: Pros: -What you get for the money -Reasonable $30 fee for early checkin or late checkout -Room was spacious, clean, and kitchenette was very handy -Family friendly -Mattress and bedding were comfortable  Cons: -Location; not much is walkable except Honda Center, but it is 10 min to Disneyland -Pool is small and a bit dirty -$10/day parking fee -wifi was a bit slow (but free)
Manager Response: Dear Ttttttttttttt7,  Thank you so much for your candid review. We truly appreciate the valuable insight you have provided and would like to assure you that your concerns regarding the pool and the internet will be addressed immediately. We hope you choose to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We went to Anaheim to watch baseball in Anaheim and LA. The hotel is walking distance to Angels stadium and right next to the 57 and 5 Freeways. Though it was by the freeways, no road noise could be heard inside the room. The room was clean and had the usual amenities. They have a public shuttle that goes to Disney at $5 round trip per adult. This is a public shuttle and makes several stops along the way. The staff was friendly and helpful and will definitely stay here next visit.
Manager Response: Dear stlcty08,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay at our hotel. I am happy to see that you enjoyed our optimal location and had an overall pleasant experience. Your kind compliments regarding our attentive team are greatly appreciated. We hope you choose to stay with us again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I travel a lot.  This hotel is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at.  No grime to be found anywhere. The beds smelled clean, I was so impressed.  And a free cooked breakfast (scrambled eggs, pork sausage, French toast, a variety of juices, cerels, donuts, bagels, fruit, yogurt, home potatoes). .. that is practically imposible to find.  The manager was incredibly kind and accommodating.  I can't believe how impressed I was with this brand.   We stayed here for an event at the Honda center and I couldn't have planned it better.  It is a super short and easy walk there. The Ayers hotel staff made this trip a success and I say thank you.  As a So. Cal resident that has stayed at many "Disneyland good neighbor hotels" this will be the ONLY one I stay at in the future.
Manager Response: Dear RachelDH,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am honored and truly humbled by your kind words regarding the cleanliness of our hotel and the attentive service my team provided. Thank you again for your review and the great recommendation of our hotel. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Excellent even though the rates were a bit high because of events scheduled nearby. Free breakfast is true buffet style and plentiful. Staff are top notch and facility is clean. The 3rd floor hallway had an extremely bad odor but our room was perfect. The smell did not extend inside. Great stay thank you.
Manager Response: Dear Tracy M,  Thank you so much for choosing our hotel and sharing your input! I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and the attentive service our team provided. Thank you for you compliments regarding our complimentary breakfast. I also appreciate the concerns you have voiced, please rest assured that this will be addressed immediately. We hope you choose to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Ayres hotel is a clean, tidy hotel. The breakfast is actually one of the highest quality and there is also a pool and a spa. I would reccomend going there. It is very nice and very comfortable. ......
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay as well as the amenities we provided. Thank you so much for your kind recommendation and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Small Hotel amenities, like 1) a fully stocked beverage fridge in the lobby with reasonable prices.2) friendly, competent staff  who anticipate needs and tend to them. 3) comfortable beds and lots of towels 4) full breakfast made to order. Freeway accessible, close to Disneyland and Angel Stadium. A very pleasant stay at a very reasonable price.
Manager Response: Dear SteveL_SD,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review. I am ecstatic that you enjoyed our hotel and the value it offers. Thank you so much for the positive feedback and your kind compliments. We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The perfect place to stay for the Anaheim experience.  The staff was pleasant, friendly and available to meet our every needs.  The rooms were clean and linens were fresh  The breakfast was wonderful every morning and our whole family enjoyed it.  The hotel is within walking distance of Angels stadium and close to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Dear karols599,  Thank you so much for providing your valuable input. Your compliments regarding our team members, accommodations, and cleanliness are greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you and you family back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Beautiful European hotel, without the hefty price. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast that is INCLUDED, is one of the best hearty and delicious breakfasts I've had at a hotel. The chef takes great pride in his food and went above and beyond to make sure all guests enjoy their breakfast. The chef transcends any language barrier with a huge smile and a wonderful display of breakfast options. They have everything you could want for breakfast, except waffles. As far as the room goes, it was clean and comfortable. There's a refrigerator, microwave, and small coffee pot for your convenience. Wi-if is provided at no extra charge and there's plenty of hot water to go around when you take a shower, especially in the morning. I can't say enough great things about

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel - great price, great people and great breakfast lady!!
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Ayres as a group for a youth basketball tournament. We worked with Marie and Lesley in Group Sales who were ABSOLUTELY amazing!  I've worked with lots of different hotels as I'm the team manager but these two definitely took the prize!  They were accommodating with all our changes along the way, super responsive, super nice, and treated us like kings!  I liked them and the hotel so much that when my daughter and I decided to stay in Cali a couple more days and head to the beach, we booked the Ayres Manhatten (which was also great!)!  I can't say enough about this hotel in Anaheim and would recommend it to anyone.  The location is great - minutes to Disneyland (they have a shuttle) and great cost! The Manhatten location also great as it's right off the

Summary Heading: Great Location For Angels Game or Disneyland
Summary: We stayed on night here as a stopover to go to an Angels game. Great location, only 10mins walk from the stadium. Excellent breakfast included as well. Also close to Disneyland (not walking distance), but if I was going I would certainly consider. Hotel is modern, clean and in excellent condition. Rooms were very comfy. It is not the most scenic location, but is close to the main attractions. Also right next door to the train/transit center if you plan to get here by train (Surfrider etc).

Summary Heading: The best hotel in the OC!
Summary: Wow! This boutique hotel blew my mind! It's absolutely stunning with an old world European vibe. It's very high class and reasonably priced. The beds are super comfortable and the staff is very friendly and professional. We will definitely come back here again! 5 stars all the way!
Manager Response: Dear Lollydrop,  It is an honor to read that we left such a lasting impression with you! Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. We strive to redefine hospitality and I am pleased to see that we did just that during your stay. We look forward to your next visit!  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Far enough away to be spectacular
Summary: We were here for Disney... the hotel is most excellent. The free buffet breakfast is a nice touch. The ART shuttle is always on time and cheap. We saved a lot of walking and a lot of money by staying here. The hotel has wine and snacks every night.

The hotel was nice but expensive for the limited amenities it offered. It did not have a restaurant on site which was a,drawback and the breakfast was very limited. The one restaurant whose menu they provided for in room dining was too busy to deliver
Manager Response: Dear Nancy S,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us and fellow TripAdvisor travelers. Though I regret to read that your stay was anything less than exceptional, your insight is truly valuable. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel is in the perfect location.  We had a five minute walk to Anaheim Stadium.  Eating places and bars within walking distance also.  Hotel was very very clean and the staff was attentive and polite.  Def would stay again.  Thanks for a PERFECT trip!
Manager Response: Dear chrisk1616,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your kind compliments. We hope you choose to stay with us again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was a very nice hotel.  The breakfast was consistently good and prepared in front of you (real eggs and fresh pancakes).  The coffee was also consistently tasty.  The rooms were cool and the temperature was well controlled.  Nice laundry facility available on each floor.  Well stocked snack stand with some nice varieties of beer and wine and snacks available.  The pool was small, but kids still had fun.  The location was easily accessible to the various highways and there is a wonderful outlet mall within walking distance.  We had a wonderful time staying here!

Have stayed here numerous times and I am never disappointed. Marcus and his staff are very good at what they do. It is more expensive now than it used to be, I started staying here in the late '90's but I love this place. Close to Angel's Stadium and the Honda Center.

We stayed here for the first part of our honeymoon. It's s lovely hotel with lovely staff. The rooms are very spacious and very nicely kept. The hotel is a few miles away from Anaheim centre which is densely populated with the chain hotels. The breakfasts were lovely and I must mention how wonderful chef Jose and his pancakes are. The only thing we were slightly disappointed in was the pool facilities but don't let that put you off.

My family and I stayed at Ayres for 2 days and enjoyed our stay very much.The room was clean and the staff (Jason) was friendly and helpful. The complimentary hot breakfast was good. There is a $10 a day parking fee. I was able to get a free late checkout after checking in on Yelp.  My only complaint would be that the water pressure in the shower was really weak. Other then my family and I loved the hotel. I will definitely stay here the next time I'm in town, which is quite often.

Coming from busy Hawai'i, Ayres Anaheim was peaceful and pleasant. The shuttle that ran every 20min was ideal for our family of 12 to commute around. Will definitely be returning as well as searching for The Ayres hotel chain in future places we go to.

Hotel was surprisingly modern, comfortable and convenient.  I was there for one night to attend a meeting and I had a great nights sleep.  The front desk staff is incredibly friendly, the location is easy access to restaurants, the ball park and other local amenities.  The rooms are comfortable and I did not experience any noise whatsoever.  Will definitely stay here again when I am back int the area.  15 minutes to John Wayne airport.

Summary Heading: nice hotel in a very handy area
Summary: Really nice hotel stayed for 6 nights with my wife and Daughter the staff at reception and at breakfast were very helpful. Room was a good size, with fridge and microwave, and kept spotless throughout our stay

Summary Heading: A good hotel for your money. Location location location!
Summary: My friend and I went to Anaheim for Spocom (car show) at the Anaheim Convention center. If Tripadvisor has a rating for "good", I would have pick that. Here's what we like and dislike about our stay:  Likes - centrally located (Disneyland, Anaheim Convention Center, Angel Stadium, Honda Center, Anaheim Regional Transportation Intermodal Center) - customer service (friendly and smiling) - relatively cheap parking ($10/day) - microwave! (although we didn't use it) - continental breakfast   Dislikes - super super slow internet (can't facetime or watch youtube) - mini-fridge wasn't working (maybe it wasn't plug in? too lazy to care)
Manager Response: Dear Trung D,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others on TripAdvisor know about your recent experience. I am contented to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as our accommodations. Your insight regarding our internet service is greatly appreciated and will be addressed immediately. Thank you again for your review, we hope you choose to stay with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great location for Angels or Ducks games.  It is an easy walk to both stadiums.  There are plenty of brew pubs in walking distance.  The rooms are clean and well laid out.  The breakfast was average with eggs, hash browns, sausage and pancakes as well as continental options.  The safe was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear vfdow,  Thank you for your wonderful review of our hotel and your recent experience. I am delighted to hear that our optimal location and accommodations met your needs. Thank you again for your review and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Our only regret is that we were unable to order room service from a restaurant in the hotel.  We always look forward to this treat after we have motored from another city.  We are too exhausted to go out to a restaurant.  Otherwise, it was great!
Manager Response: Dear Alfred J,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your recent stay. I apologize for any confusion, but unfortunately, our hotel does not have a restaurant onsite. However, there are restaurants within walking distance. Thank you again for your review.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great hotel with super friendly staff.  Very good breakfast included.  Parking a little confusing unless you've stayed there before.  Hotel internet site or welcoming email should explain how the parking works and fee.

Love the hotel have stayed several times on business.  Good breakfast, and cookies in the evening.  Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Parking is included and you always are parking close.  There is great restaurants within walking distance.
Manager Response: Dear gfwtx,  Thank you for the wonderful review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and greatly appreciate your loyalty. Please note that some accounts still include parking, however, generally parking is a small fee of $10 per night plus tax. Thank you again for reviewing our hotel and we hope to see you again very soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I always stay here when doing business in Orange county.  Take advantage of the happy hour , fresh cookies at night and the free breakfasts.  Gym is small but has some work out machines. The location is very central and they have shuttles.  Good value!
Manager Response: Dear Msmitchell4,  Thank you so much for your great review. Your loyalty to our hotel is greatly appreciated and your insight is truly valued. Thank you for your warm compliments regarding the value of our accommodations and your genuine concerns. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Maybe nice 10 years ago, but not so much now.
Summary: The hotel was probably really nice back in the day. But it is looking pretty run down. The beds are old and uncomfortable and the linens are old and dingy. The housekeepers knock before 8 am to try and clean the room. The A/C is a noisy old wall unit. It seems like this hotel was converted from an old roadside inn or something from the 60s.   Also, it is cheap to charge for parking when you are already paying a full rate for breakfast and wifi.
Manager Response: Dear rachsticle,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review to let others know about your stay. I regret to read that your recent experience at our hotel left much to be desired. Your valuable insight is greatly appreciated as it will be used to make improvements wherever necessary. I hope your future accommodations are comfortable and satisfying.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Best Bed ever!  Wonderful, friendly staff.  Wonderful experience! The food was good. Andrew at the front desk took great care of us and went the extra mile to help us with transportation when our other transportation fell through.
Manager Response: Dear 103kathrynk,  Thank you for your candid feedback. I am delighted to see that you enjoyed our distinctive accommodations. Your kind compliments regarding our team and amenities are greatly appreciated. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: From start to finish our stay at the Ayres was excellent in every way- from the hospitable welcome and the clean and comfortable room to the delicious morning breakfast. We were in town to attend a funeral but our accommodations helped us to smile. Thank you

Summary Heading: Would be perfect if wifi worked better and parking was free
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the past year.  This hotel is comfortable, conveniently located, and has a great hot breakfast buffet.  As a business traveler wifi is important for me to keep up with communications.  The wifi is inconsistent, slow at best and sometimes just locks up. Parking can also be an issue. especially if there is an event at Honda Center.  Great place to stay if on vacation but will not be using for business travel anymore.
Manager Response: Dear jjwa2016,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review informing others about your experience at our hotel. I regret to hear that our complimentary Wi-Fi was not up to your standards. Please rest assured that we will look into this issue if it persists. Your candid insight is greatly appreciated and we hope we are able to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: You Don't Get The Full Benefit Of What You Paid For
Summary: Need a more pleasant desk personnel.  Need to keep voucher for free breakfast (whether they ask or not) at the dining area or you'll be embarrassed by their rude cook ( George)  Hotel personnel does not provide a brochure about services being rendered or does not reveal their services (maybe it was just the personnel on duty) --ie.,  shuttle services to Disney or bus transport to tourist areas.  There are extra charges beside the actual hotel per day charge: - $10 per day for parking  -Anaheim tourism assessment fee 2% (per day) - Long distance (even if it is a local call) -Occupancy tax 15% (per day) -California trade tax 0.25%  (per day)  - Kind of tricky to find the pool area if you go all the way down the hallway to your right from entrance. There is no actual signage that
Manager Response: Dear Carmelita V,  Thank you so much for the great insight you have provided. I regret to read that your experience during check-in and breakfast fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that the level of service provided during your stay is completely out of character for our team members. We will use the feedback you have provided to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you once again for your review. We hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Nice hotel, has everything you need. Is clean and tidy with a decent American breakfast buffet. Easy access to Disneyland with a shuttle for only $5 a day. Not many shops around but there is a nice restaurant across the road which gives a 10% discount to hotel guests. Overall was good for what we paid.
Manager Response: Dear sarahstew4rd555,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel. It is a delight to see that you had a pleasant experience. Your candid feedback is greatly appreciated and we hope you return to our hotel soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Will return!  Not a Disney GNH, but don't let that stop you from booking!
Summary: I would definitely stay at Ayres again!  It is not a Disney "Good Neighbor Hotel," therefore you cannot get a Disney package for this hotel.  But this would not deter me from staying here again.  The room was extremely spacious, clean and that bed was super comfy!  We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, however it was not quite what I had expected considering other reviews.  There was fruit, yogurt, a selection bread and pastries, as well as scrambled eggs, potatoes, pancakes and either bacon or sausage.  Of course, there was coffee, tea, juice, milk and hot chocolate.  Again, this was good a filling.    The ART shuttle was very convenient and ran buses a few times per hour.  You can even text to see when the next one is coming.  As of earlier this week, you could text the
Manager Response: Dear hpscarpignato,  I am delighted to hear that your experience at our hotel was exceptional. Thank you kindly for your warm compliments regarding our accommodations and optimal location. Thank you once again for your feedback and your genuine concerns. We look forward to serving you again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: The hotel overall was fine, the room was large and comfortable. My only two complaints are the window air conditioner sounded like a 747 was in the room and the door swings in such a way that the bathroom privacy is compromised when opened.  It could seeing the opposite way and resolve that issue.
Manager Response: Dear phily699,  Thank you kindly for your candid review. I am contented to see that you had a pleasant stay. We kindly encourage our guests to voice any and all issues immediately so that we are able to remedy the situation at once. Oftentimes we are more than willing to provide different accommodations if necessary. Thank you again for your feedback, we hope to see you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I chose this hotel because of its rating as a 3.5 star and a special deal $ 129 + more ( not revealed on TripAdvisor) for July 4th weekend. Desk personnel were just not as excited as I was to see the place. Even did not offer the cookies ( was hungry :( )  just in front of the desk but I did not bother with it. Here are some comments I have:   --Given a voucher for the free breakfast they have. Didn't even ask for it the first day of breakfast and I had it with me and then the next day I didnt have it because I thought it was not neded and I already threw it away. So the next guy looks like the cook and as I lined up for breakfast and he made me wait because he was filling in the sausage container and then people lined up next to me. He then asked me ( no good morning greeting
Manager Response: Dear BulacanMom,  Thank you so much for the great insight you have provided. I regret to hear that your experience during check-in and breakfast fell short of your expectations. Please rest assured that the level of service provided during your stay is completely out of character for our team members. We will use the feedback you have provided to make improvements wherever necessary. Thank you once again for your review. We hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Had some stains on my sheets.  Overall its a decent place.  Breakfast lines were very long but good.  Wifi couldve been better.  The pool and jacuzzi were nice.  Didnt know i had to pay extra $10 for parking
Manager Response: Dear asanchez27,  We kindly encourage our guests to voice any and all concerns to a team member so that we can remedy the situation immediately. Oftentimes, we are more than willing to provide different accommodations if necessary. Nevertheless, we appreciate the feedback provided and hope you chose to stay with us again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Will recommend the location loved it will always stay at ayers breakfast fantastic front desk friendly courteous and prompt rooms spacious and very clean had enough towels local restaurants that would deliver promptly

What a beautiful hotel!!!  I was in town to attend the LA Angels baseball game and wanted a hotel that was close to the stadium.  It was about a 10 minute walk to the stadium.  The area was very nice & safe and since I had traveled alone this was very important to me.  The rooms were very spacious and comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable.  There was free Wi-Fi and breakfast included both of which were great.  The front desk was very friendly and helpful with any and all questions.  Would definitely stay here again if I am in the Anaheim area!!

We stayed for a week in a king suite and this hotel fit our needs perfectly.  The pull out bed was perfect for our toddler, and it's nice for the parents to have their own room.  The room had a fridge and a microwave, so we bought some extra snacks to keep everyone happy.    The breakfast is good, with enough options for everyone.  Scrambled eggs, pancakes, potatoes, and bacon or sausage every day, with cereal, toast, yogurt and donuts.  It is very impressive to watch one cook keep that all going!    The evening happy hour is nice too: beer and wine, sodas, chips and salsa, and warm cookies.  My daughter loved the cookies! ;)  The distance to Disneyland is good.  We chose to drive, and it takes about 10 minutes.  There is a shuttle also that we saw lots of people using, but we

Summary Heading: Above average for this price range but needs to work on housekeeping service
Summary: This hotel is above average for the price range ($160/night). This property is not very large so this translates to a quieter stay with nicer amenities for families staying in the area for a Disneyland visit. It is difficult to find "quiet" hotels in the Disneyland area since so many modern parents do not discipline their kids and that means loud and obnoxious kids running up and down the hallways at all hours in the larger hotels, so being smaller this place is quieter.  Includes full breakfast, "traditional" decor rooms and common areas.  The downsides are that it is not in a "walkable" area; you must drive to Disneyland and decent restaurants. Another downside: poor housekeeping service. Housekeeping had not cleaned our room by 5pm, even though we were gone the entire day.
Manager Response: Dear Loveta T,  Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review to let others on TripAdvisor know about your recent experience. I am contented to see that you enjoyed your stay as well as our accommodations. Your insight regarding our housekeeping service is greatly appreciated and will be addressed immediately. Thank you again for your review, we look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed at ALO hotel in 2015 and loved it.  So,  we tried it again in June 2016 and loved it even more. Nice clean rooms, excellent breakfast everyday,  nice staff,  excellent service. We are fans of ALO for sure.

They have a very good breakfast  and the staff were courteous. After a tiring day it was always nice to just relax in your room..I was just a little disappointed with the pool,it was not what i expected from the photos.

Based on TripAdvisor reviews we selected this hotel and we made the right choice. The location was great and a simple shuttle bus to Disneyland. We had a hire car and we were able to park this at the hotel for $10 a day. Parking at Disneyland is $18 and the shuttle return cost $12 and was hassle free dropping us like 100m from the entry. The car park is said to be like 1.5km. We didn't have to worry about traffic etc!  The hotel was very very clean and the rooms large and spacious. The front desk staff were so helpful with any question we asked. We also decided on a day in Hollywood so it was a 200m walk to the train station and for 2 adults and 1 child it was $48 US dollars return. That tciket also got us on the local trains to get to the Holloywood Walk of Fame. The Hollywood

Convenient to all Anaheim attractions...we were in town for Angels' games...could have walked to stadium if we didn't have little children with us.  Staff was very friendly and accomodating...quick checkin/checkout...clean rooms, comfy beds...asked for room with view of Disneyland fireworks and we were not disappointed!!!  Would highly recommend this hotel!!!

We stayed one night here. Would stay again if traveling to Anaheim. The front desk staff was very welcoming. The room was very comfortable and clean. The little wet bar in the room was a nice addition. Coin operated laundry. Great Wifi. Free breakfast was good. Thumbs up all the way around. Not very close to Disney but so far the nicest we have stayed at for a Disney visit.

This hotel was disappointing. No early check-in, long checkin line, uncomfortable lumpy beds, small TV, noisy ac unit, noisy bathroom fan, dirty carpet, elevator out of service, stupid breakfast system, and limited parking availability.
Manager Response: Dear ghostlydesigns,  Thank you so much for the feedback you have provided. Our hotel check -in time is 3pm, however, we do offer an early check-in option (subject to availability) at 11am for a nominal fee of $30 dollars. I regret to hear that you found our complimentary full American breakfast buffet "system" confusing or irritating. Nevertheless, your feedback is greatly appreciated.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This is a great place to stay for your trip to Anaheim. It's about 1.5 miles from Disney giving you a piece full place to rest. Shuttle to Disney leaves every 20 minutes. Hot breakfast in the morning provides everything you could want. We stayed for 6 nights and never had a bad day!

In Anaheim for 5 days with my son, who was attending event at Convention Center.  Straight shot down Katella to the Center and all Disney activities.  Hotel was clean, very comfortable.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  I was left hanging out by myself during one of the days and didn't mind it one bit.  Complementary breakfast was very tasty

Everyone was so nice.  Check in and check out was one of the easiest processes.  They delivered stuff to my room very quickly.  They let me use their fax machine late at night.  Very great customer service.  One down side - the coffee was like dark tea.  Other than that, the hot breakfast pretty yummy!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. I am delighted you received excellent service and enjoyed your stay. I am sorry that you did not like the coffee. Some people love it, and others respond as you have. I am glad you enjoyed the rest of the breakfast.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: When we first got there the check in was very quick and efficient. We got to our room and got settled  in then tried to connect to the WIFI after trying countless times to connect was finally able to connect it took forever to download anything and the connect would disconnect then reconnect without any warning. I went to the front desk to see if there was anything I was doing wrong and the front desk person said I needed to use Firefox or chrome  I had mentioned that I use Firefox and he asked me if he could look at my computer he connected me with no issues but once I got back to my room it was spotty again. I had purchased some tickets for the wax museum on my phone cause the 4g on my phone was more reliable than the WIFI I  went to the front desk to see if I could print out
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I do apologize that our wifi system did not operate as it should. We do have tickets out for localized repairs on a couple of the routers. However your experience is rare, so I am wondering whether there was more than one factor affecting the system. I will remind the front desk that they are to direct our guests to the tech firm who provides our guest wifi system with support. They are able to identify localized issues. Please be assured that I am working on this and expect to see improvements in the near future.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed at Ayers for an LA Angels baseball game. Excellent property only 2 blocks from the Stadium. Very quick walk. Extremely helpful staff and the bed was like sleeping on a cloud. No kidding the best night's sleep I have had in a hotel in years!

Great hotel. Clean, shuttles to Disney, transportation to the airport, amazing breakfast and nice staff! The king suite room was impressive. Like a 1 bed apt. Couch, dining table, sink, refrigerator, closet space, the works.

nice place, fair price, great staff...wife and I arrived with our grandkids, was very surprised as we had heard that a lot of the hotels near Disneyland were dumpy. we stayed 7 days and had a great time...

It was 108 today and without air I needed a local hotel with air to get a good night's sleep.  We checked in and they were having happy hour...read free wine and food.  I grabbed a glass and went to our room. We walked across the street for dinner and when we returned our room was a welcome sight!  The staff was friendly, efficient and so pleasant!!! In the morning we had an amazing breakfast!  Better than any I have had at any their hotel!  Eggs, sausage, potatoes, and pancakes were the hot items available.  They also had cereal, the usual breakfast breads, yogurt and fresh fruit... Delicious.

You have to wait for long time to check in or out  and they try to find any thing to charge  you for  ,paid a hefty price to book the room and was surprised  to find they charge $10 per night for parking ....who on earth want to park in your parking lot but your guests you are more than 10 minutes away from Disney and if there is traffic forget it it is so far away from every thing we need to get to ,I asked for room with the view I was surprised the view is the highway's ...every one who is hoping to get  breakfast on the go don't it's impossible and the place very crowded....if it is hot the air conditioning will work after you sweet to death it take time the staff said.....The pool was very basics  and exposed  no one want to use ...renovation to the elevator took us hours to
Manager Response: Dear Alzeneh-  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. We do apologize if you found your stay anything less than exceptional. Guests are informed of the $10 per night parking charge in all confirmation letters and over the phone and, when the hotel was under renovation previously this year, the construction was noted on the website and confirmation letters. We are very sorry if this information did not reach you and that the quality of your stay was impeded as a result. We also do our utmost to try to meet the requests of all guests, who are all very important to us, whenever possible. Unfortunately, it does seem that the upgraded room provided did not meet expectations and we do apologize for this. Guests will be pleased to note that the breakfast room will soon be expanding, so, during busy times at the hotel, everyone will be more than comfortable. We thank you again for your candid review.   Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and close to Attractions!
Summary: First time at this hotel chain and very impressed.  It was clean, the staff was attentive , nice large room with 2 comfortable queen beds and the location is excellent if you're going to Disney or the surrounding area attractions.  Angels stadium is right across the interstate.

I took my daughter and friends to Disneyland to celebrate her 16th. The hotel was very nice and very convenient. In fact the Disney shuttle pulled right up to the front door and barely had anyone onboard. We've stayed at other Disneyland hotels where you were lucky to get on the first shuttle. Also had a good hot breakfast each morning included, and a very friendly staff. Would definitely come here again.

If you're traveling to Anaheim for a short weekend getaway, I recommend staying here at Ayres. This hotel is clean, tidy, service is great and at your service. The rooms are large with great ventilation and quality sheets. They also have microwaves and a mini fridge in each room which provides a sense of comfort. There is a pool and mini gym for a short workout. Complimentary breakfast is also on point! Ayres will not disappoint; it's price cannot be beaten in the area and the experience is a great one!

This is a well appointed hotel, well maintained and cleaned.  The restaurant next door, JT Schmidt is convenient and the food was very good.   They gave a discount for hotel guests.  The breakfast at the hotel was excellent.   Nice crispy potatoes,  scrambled eggs and sausage plus other selections.  Very sure to bring tip money for the jar!

The hotel was beautiful, clean, staff very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast included each morning and the food is excellent.  Gated parking ensures there's a spot for your car, also a plus.  However, we stayed here while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure, and all 3 days we visited the ART shuttle from the hotel to the parks ran fine; the return trip from the parks to the hotel was spotty.  The shuttle says they run every 40 minutes during the mid-day, and every 20 minutes morning and late afternoon/evening, but every time we left the park around 7pm the shuttle was easily 1+ hour behind schedule, often times the shuttle was just parked at the park for 30+ minutes while the driver took a break.  I know this is public transportation and certainly not the hotel's fault

We stayed in room 310 which was right off the elevator which was wonderful! The room was clean and fresh, there was a mini fridge, coffee maker and and a microwave. The bathroom was clean and had all the personal necessities one could need. I loved the fact the hotel is big on conservation of energy. The pool and Spa were lovely. The morning breakfast was the best complimentary breakfast I ever had. THE COOKIES AT DUSK ARE AAAAAMMMMMMAAAAAAZZZZZIIIIINNNNNGGGGG! I wish I had eaten more! Please take more than one! The $5 a day shuttle for Disney was perfect! The hotel Staff were very kind and accommodating to my wife for her birthday. They had laundry facilities on site which could be helpful. The only items we would change are the size of the TV to be bigger to fit the King room

Summary Heading: Worth it if you want to walk to Angel Stadium
Summary: We chose the Ayres Hotel because it is easy walking distance to Angel Stadium (about a half-mile). It was a $116 price on booking.com, but then there were all the fees and taxes and a $10 fee for parking, so expect to pay, at best, just over $150. Next time we might come by Metrolink and save the $10 parking. We enjoyed the hot tub after our late-afternoon game, but there was some grit in the water that I made me itchy and I had to shower it off. The room was great--very quiet, just as we'd requested. It had a small empty fridge (I hate when they crowd it with stuff they expect you to buy). No freezer part, though. The breakfast is fine, with decent selection, but not a treat. You can eat healthy if you want, which we like, especially that there was fresh fruit.
Manager Response: Dear camelSP,  Thank you kindly for reviewing our hotel. I am happy to read you enjoyed your stay and that our optimal location was perfect for your needs. Your valuable feedback and kind compliments are greatly appreciated. We hope to welcome you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Motel is very close to Angels baseball stadium. Shuttles to Disney were good and regular. The staff on check in could have provided more general information but all others were good. Room was spacious and clean. Motel is undergoing maint but this did not affect our stay. Breakfast was included but on one day we had to line up for over 30 minutes ! I do think that was due to it being a holiday weekend and they should have had more staff. Would stay there again as the price was good and it included free wi fi.
Manager Response: Dear austoutist,  Thank you for reviewing our hotel. It is a delight to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our and that your found our staff was courteous. Nevertheless, please accept my sincerest apologies for any inconveniences you encountered during breakfast. I hope you consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great, friendly staff and the remodeled rooms are really comfortable and clean. Room was large and the bathtub was amazing. Well-maintained rooms with is a HUGE plus. Manager was very accommodating and helpful.
Manager Response: Dear sherri878,  Thank you so much for your candid review. Your warm compliments regarding our friendly team and recent renovations are greatly appreciated. We look forward to serving you again in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Clean beatiful rooms,friendly staff, free breakfast every morning and late welcome drinks. Close to Dinneyland and next door to Angels Stadium. There are also conference rooms.  When I arrived the gentleman at the front desk checked me in real fast.
Manager Response: Dear raulcY2547FN,  Thank you for your great review of our hotel. I am contented to see that you enjoyed our accommodations, complimentary full American breakfast, and the exceptional service our team offered. Thank you again for your feedback. We look forward to your next visit.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was actually my 4th time staying at this hotel. As always my stay was wonderful. My room was ready early and I was able to check in early. The room was clean and had all the things I needed. The bed was very comfortable. The free breakfast is better than most hotels that I have stayed at. But above all the staff is very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be coming back.

Found this hotel for my parents stay down here, for Disneyland. It was very accommodating! The tram also was nice and good price. The breakfast was amazing! My partner and I met them up in the morning and the hotel staff was so nice and inviting for us to go enjoy breakfast with them even though we did not stay in the hotel for the night. My parents said they would prefer to always stay here.
Manager Response: Dear wesley1987hb,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review informing others about your recent stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim. I am thrilled to read that your parents also enjoyed their stay. Thank you so much for your warm compliments regarding our services and accommodations. We look forward to serving your parents again.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great place, perfect location to the Honda Center literally across the street. Staff friendly, room was great and price was reasonable. Would very much recommend Ayres to anyone who is attending a event in Anaheim.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. They gave us a room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks. My children really enjoyed watching them from our room. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable.

Had problems with the A/C called the front desk they sent someone up right away and took care of it. The brides maid was coming up to the bridal suite to get ready there was going to be a $10.00 parking fee per car :(  hotel waived it :)  Breakfast was really good many options, cook was amazing kept line moving quickly! My car was hit in the parking lot after one hour of being there. There were no camera's in that side of the parking lot. Otherwise my review would have been perfect!!

The hotel is small, very busy. More staff are needed at the front desk. I paid cash for our three day stay, over 600.00 dollars and the clerk charged 600.00 to my credit card also! Pool is outdoors and very small. The rooms however are very clean and the breakfast was good. There was also a hit and run in the parking lot. The attendant was notified and did nothing.
Manager Response: Dear Treena,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I am delighted that you liked the rooms and the breakfast. I am sorry that there were some other concerning aspects to your stay and I have sent you a private message regarding that. I certainly appreciate your feedback and we will use it to improve future performance.  I do hope we will host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel was recommended by a coworker who stayed at Ayres Anahaiem before. The room is nice and the hotel overall is very decent. We love the breakfast Buffett and last until 10am. Most hotel buffet breakfast last until 9am only. We are travelers and have stayed in many many different hotels, and by far, Ayres is one of the nice hotels that we'd come back and stay again in the future. The reason for this trip was to have fun at Disneyland and Disney California Adventures, and we did have fun. One thing that bothered us was the lady shuttle bus driver that took us from Disneyland to the hotel wasn't friendly and took us around and around that it should've been only 10 minutes from Disneyland to the hotel, but it was more than 30 minutes! It was late almost midnight and we were
Manager Response: Dear BudiBuckner,  Thank you so much for the positive review. Please pass on my thanks to your co-worker also. I am so sorry for your experience on the shuttle. I have passed on your review to the management at the ART and hopefully they will be able to find out what happened.  I very much hope that we will host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff, and great location
Summary: Parking and check in were flawless.  Clean, modern facility, spacious and tidy room, comfortable beds, very quiet in the rooms, made sleeping perfect.  Nice hotel provided breakfast in morning. Good location to the Honda Center and Angel's stadium.
Manager Response: Dear szabdr,  Thank you for providing valuable insight based on your most recent stay. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and our optimal location. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great hotel in an awesome location. We arrived on Amtrak and walked the 100 yards to the hotel.  Went to la kiss and Angels games and never needed a car. Nice clean comfortable.  The beds were terrific. We will definitely be back. Thanks so much for a great weekend
Manager Response: Dear emerbyan ,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a review. I was delighted that you took advantage of our ideal location at the center of the Angels/Honda Center/Artic train station triangle. I hope that you were able to use the Go Green Promotion on our website. I look forward to hosting you here again.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Clean rooms and friendly staff: Michelle at the Front Desk, Pablo, Chef Llamas to name a few. Stayed here for 4 days for a conference. Smooth check-in. They accommodated by late check in and check out. Enjoyed the daily breakfast. Across from the Honda Center. Down the street from the Intermodal Transportation Center so if you are adventurous, you can catch a variety of buses, shuttles, metro link and Amtrak. Had a great view of the Disney Fireworks.   They were in the remodel mode, which was disclosed upfront and before I booked. New lobby furniture arrived during my stay. Loved the free Wi-Fi.
Manager Response: Dear elt52016,  Thank so much for taking the time to provide your candid feedback. I am delighted to see that our valued team members Michelle, Pablo, and Chef Llamas provided the exceptional service you deserve. Thank you again for your review and your kind compliments and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great place to come home from Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are spacious and clean.  The beds there is no other hotel that has better mattress, maybe more expensive but not better.  The staff, house keepers, maintenance, cooks and management treat you as best friends. We did have a sink back up.  After a short period of time of not being able to correct the problem, we were moved to an upgraded room. We have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times and this is the first time there has ever been a problem.  It was nice to see how fast they reacted and resolved the problem for us.
Manager Response: Dear Cameron R,  Thank you so much for your great review and for choosing our hotel time and time again. I am contented to hear that we were successful in resolving any and all issues you experience during your stay. Providing exceptional service is our top priority and I am ecstatic that we are able to do just that during your visits. Thank you again and we hope to welcome you back soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed here for the dance competition, and really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is beautiful, well appointed large rooms, with great bed and pull-out couch. Everything looks brand new, all very clean and nice.
Manager Response: Dear Irina N,  Thank you so much for reviewing our hotel based on your most recent experience. I am thrilled to see that you enjoyed your time with us. Your kind compliments concerning our accommodations and the cleanliness of our hotel are greatly appreciated. We hope to serve you again in the near future.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Fabulous week to end our California adventure
Summary: Clean spacious rooms with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. It's close to the main freeway but the sound proofing meant you couldn't hear a thing and you're straight on the main road to where ever you want to go. The staff were friendly, helpful and polite and the complimentary afternoon cookies a big hit with our daughter. We liked the fact Disney was a 15 minute bus trip as we could get right away. The buses were frequent and the bus drivers went out of their way to be helpful. We left our car at the hotel when going to Disney as the buses were so much easier - dropping you right at the gate. Hope to get back some day.
Manager Response: Dear ljm_65,  Thank you kindly for your candid feedback. I am happy to see that your stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim was fabulous. You warm compliments are greatly appreciated and your feedback is greatly valued. We hope to see you soon.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager
