Summary: Quiet stay, and great breakfast make this a good place to visit if going to angel stadium.  Also right across the street is the Honda center, so the location is perfect.  It's about 10-15 minute walk to angel stadium.   If you're a Disney passholder u get 20% off.  We will definitely come back again!

I hadn't stayed at the Ayres Hotel for several months... I am in the area on business a few times a year. I was pleasantly surprised at the beautifully updated rooms - fabrics, furniture. Very comfortable and spacious and clean. Desk staff are all friendly and professional. Great pricing for location and services. Breakfast options are great. So close to the Santa Ana river trail - great for a morning run!

Super nice and a great staff.  We stay here every time we go to an Angles games.  Perfect location.  The breakfast is alway good.  Had time to workout nice little area.  The remodel of the rooms look so much better.

Summary Heading: Great hotel easy drive away from Disney madness
Summary: Or 2nd time staying at the hotel.  Rooms are clean and spacious. Staff is friendly and professional. Breakfast is a step above the usual hotel breakfast. Nice, quick drive from disneyland - be sure to park at the woody lot on harbor for an easy in and out o the park.

The hotel and room were very clean.  The room was well furnished.  It had both a small table and desk to work on and comfortable beds.  I did have one problem the bathroom sink was clogged and they did not have anyone to clean out the drain line.  The front desk said that they would have the maintenance person clean out the drain when he came in.

Making the reservation on line was quite easy. We were unaware of the extra $10 per day parking charge and the girl who checked us in was quite snotty, stating "it's on the web site".  No apology at all. No apologies when we checked out either, even though we mentioned her behavior. The place was clean, minimal street noise. However, the walls are quite thin. We could hear the water running through the pipes and toilet seats being closed day and night.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle N,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review informing others about your recent experience. Please accept my most sincere apologies regarding the service, or lack thereof, that our team provided as well as the miscommunication concerning our parking policy. Rest assured that this level of service is out of character for our team. I would like to kindly encourage you to return in the future so that we are able to provide the service you deserve.  Sincerely,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I  stayed at this hotel for one night, and if the price was more in my budget I would have stayed my entire trip. I had four people in my group, and we fit comfortably in a 2 bedroom suite. The room was large, and the bed was a cloud. The bed was so comfortable we just stay in bed till a minute before check out because we enjoyed it so much. Romy made check in a breeze, and breakfast was free and hot. Beware you do get charged for parking and also another fee for being so close to the stadiums. I will say I wish the hot tub was hotter, and cleaner. There was bunch of what felt like sand in the bottom. Overall, I would stay here again just plan for a bigger tab!

We stayed one night as a mini getaway as we were in the area to visit family and I saw the opportunity for my husband and I to escape for some alone time. We both liked the hotel very much. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and very nice. The bed was amazing! The location isn't ideal if you're looking for a view, but for our outing to dinner it was perfect! The only negative I have is the $10/night parking fee, but you'd be lucky to find any hotel/motel in that area that doesn't charge for that. I also loved that I could choose a bottle of wine for the room. It was very nice to have that waiting for us!

My boyfriend and I are Disneyland annual  passholders so we spend a lot of weekends in Anaheim. We ended up staying here because they have a Disney AP discount. This is far and away my favorite hotel to stay in when going to Disneyland. The king room we stayed in came with a fridge, microwave, and coffee maker and we had a sofa in the room separated from the bed by a 3/4 wall partition.  The bathroom was nice with a very large bathtub in the tub/shower combo. Their breakfast is surprisingly good for being free. If you stay on the weekend, most of the pastries, donuts, and bagels are gone by 10am but they also give you eggs, sausage, and your choice of pancakes or hash browns.   We decided at the last minute to opt for a late check out at 3pm which they state on their site is $30

Summary Heading: Beautiful.. well priced.. liiiiiiittle far from Disneyland
Summary: Our main purpose of staying at this beautiful hotel was for an event at the Honda Center.  It's right across the street and it was nice to be able to walk to it.  Disneyland is quite a bit away from the hotel, however.  That all comes into the realization of the great pricing for the amazing hotel.  The Deluxe King is 348 sq ft. and it seems much more spacious because of the high ceiling.  There's a sofa, microwave and mini fridge.  PROS: Well priced Spacious room Clean Across the street from the Honda Center  CONS: ART Transit/car for Disneyland traveling.. too far to walk (not much else)  Summary: Great place to stay if you don't mind the traveling distance to Disneyland.  Spacious, clean, accommodating staff and great pricing.  Will be more than happy to stay here again -

Summary Heading: Excellent option, beautiful building, and huge rooms!
Summary: We really enjoyed staying here. The staff was really helpful and very polite. We arrived by AMTRAK (coming from LA), and walked to the hotel, just crossing the street. Best option ever if you're arriving and departing by train. They offer a 5$ ticket to use transportation to Disneyland (which was the purpose of our trip) and it picks you up from the door of the hotel and returns you to the same spot (last bus 10:30 pm) It couldn't be more comfortable. The room was huge and everything was on spot and shining. The breakfast was very good and with lots of options. I definitely recommend this hotel to everybody!

Summary Heading: Not as good as other Ayres Hotel I've stayed in
Summary: Poor location right next to a Freeway and difficult to locate the car park entrance.  Rooms are variable in standard as we stayed there twice in 9 nights.  Different size TVs in the rooms, very noisy, antiquated air conditioning.  Charge for car parking - not something experienced previously at Ayres.  Expensive now compared to other hotel chains.  Complimentary breakfast very basic.  They don't have 24 hour coffee service like other Ayres hotels.

Summary Heading: One night stay to take in an Anaheim Angels baseball game
Summary: We stayed for one night only to take in an Anaheim Angels and Kansas City Royals baseball game.  We chose the hotel because of its proximity to the Stadium (easy walking distance).  We were not familiar with this hotel chain before so did not have any expectations one way or the other.  We were very pleased with our brief stay.  The room was clean and roomy and the water pressure was excellent in the shower.  Our room was on the first floor and in front of a fairly busy road, but we were not bothered by traffic sounds at all.  The bed was exceptionally comfortable.  The complimentary breakfast was very good and the staff were friendly.  The hotel room rate was very reasonable based on the size of the room, proximity to both the Stadium and the Arena, and the complimentary

My husband and I stayed at the Ayres Inn for one night while we were in Anaheim. As soon as we walked into the lobby, we were immediately greeted and felt very welcome. The check-in process was quick and easy, and everyone was very friendly. Our room was very very clean and gorgeous. Room service was quicker than expected, and we had no problems whatsoever. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, especially since you're getting a lot for your money.

This hotel is fantastic the rooms are amazing. The location is great if you try to catch a baseball game or going to Disney super close. People is great and glad to provide any assistance the guest might need. Also there a shuttle that take you to Disney every 45 min which is great

My friends and I stayed here during our holiday, and loved every minute of it. The staff were so friendly and the maid service was excellent. My ONLY criticism for this hotel was that there should have been more variety at breakfast. It alternated between sausages and bacon with scrambled eggs and hash browns. Coming from England we missed our sausages and baked beans. The fruit salad definitely needs attention. However, the donuts and pancakes were to die for, and our chef was lovely. We would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Very clean and comfortable! Great breakfast and staff!
Summary: Excellent! Clean and very comfortable room with great view of Disney fireworks! Very helpful and professional stakk always willing to help! great breakfast! Would stay again and again at a Ayers Hotel!

Summary Heading: Do some research, and decide if this place will work for you.
Summary: I stayed here for just one night, as I took my son to Disney. This was a last minute trip, (as in I booked it the day of our stay.) I didn't have time to research thoroughly like I usually do. I read the excellent TripAdvisor reviews, saw it was somewhat close to D-Land with a free shuttle, and it was, well, cheaper than other mid-range hotels.  This hotel did not work well for us. First, it's RIGHT next to the Interstate. So yes, we heard the freeway noise, even with the TV on. Second, aside from this little pizza place next door, there is literally nothing around here. Nowhere to walk, get some food, drinks, etc...NOTHING. The hotel offers "room service", but it actually comes from the little pizza place next door. They do NOT deliver any wine, beer or cocktails. I didn't

We have stayed here twice and the experience was the same both times, exceptional. When in Anaheim we will never stay anywhere else. The beds are the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept on, even compared to high-priced luxury hotels. After a long day at Disneyland it was nice to come "home" to a soft bed and a great night's sleep, refreshed for another day on our feet. Breakfast is always great and the fresh-baked cookies in the evening are delicious. Just a couple of miles from Disneyland, Convention Center and just across the freeway from Angel Stadium. Clean and beautiful. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Felt like a european retreat in the middle of Los Angeles area
Summary: We booked this hotel because of the rating from Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed.  From the moment we arrived until we left, we felt we had made the best choice.  There is a shuttle to disney and back, along with well appointed rooms, and a great breakfast served every morning.  We also enjoyed the wine and snacks the afternoon we arrived.  Over all, a great place to stay and we would go back again in a heartbeat.

Summary Heading: Further from Disney than expected but good place.
Summary: We stayed with our three young children. Perfectly nice hotel for the price but further from Disneyland than I'd thought. The shuttle bus was frequent enough ($5.00USD each for the day from memory) but took 20 minutes plus depending on pick-ups. We had two queen size beds and all three little ones slept in one bed just fine. The room itself was spacious and the large bath tub a bonus!  Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. The usual: waffles, scrambled eggs and pancakes made on the spot for you, fruit, cereal, yoghurt, toast, bagels, danishes etc.  The carpet was being re-laid and I do believe notice of this should be available when booking. I wasn't going to sleep in due to my kids but if i'd been there child-free I would NOT have been happy being woken up at 8:00 by hammers and

This was our third time at the Ayres and the hotel and staff did not disappoint (and never have!).  Rooms are clean, baths are clean and the place is clean.  Even the hallways have pictures on the walls instead of plain wallpaper or paint.  the breakfast is great and the staff is wonderful.  They are on the Disneyland route ARTIC.  I had some knee surgery and used an ice pack at nights to bring down any swelling.  I would give them my icepack in the morning when we left to go to the park and it would be nice and frozen in the evening for iceing my knee.   Just asked and the staff said no problem.  We go down twice to three times a year and the Ayres is where we now stay.

I've stayed at this property a couple of times.  Each time I go back I'm reminded of what a great property it is.  I highly recommend it if you are going to take in an event at the Honda Center or Angel's Stadium.  My room was large and had a "bar" area with a sink, microwave and mini-fridge.  All items that are so convenient to have.  There are a lot of outlets and USB ports to charge devices.  The bed and pillows are super comfy.  I slept like a rock!  The room was VERY quiet.  The only thing I heard was a child running down the hall and fireworks from the Angel's game.  Other than that it was peace and quiet.  The thermostat kept my room at a very comfortable temperature the entire night.  The biggest bummer was that the wifi didn't work too well and the TV kept losing

My husband and I stayed 1 night and the people were very friendly and the room was beautiful and clean. Also we were there for a concert at the honda center and it was just steps from our room. Defiantly would stay here again. Also the breakfast was great, alot of food to choose from.

Summary Heading: Loved it, perfect for a family going to Disney Land.
Summary: This place is very nice, great breakfast and rooms are updated. I liked that the breakfast was included. ...  The staff went out their way to help me when I had to get my tire repaired. Great experience.

The room was comfortable and clean. Nice bed, bath worthy bath. Front service desk was respectful and helpful. Breakfast was fresh made and delicious. I would easily recommend and return to Ayres Hotel.

Great location for attending sporting events and concerts.  If arriving by train Amtrak station across the street.  Area transportation to Disneyland and other area attractions available at the front door at the cost of $2 a day for seniors.  Rooms were very clean and area very safe.  Excellent restaurant across the street and if staying at the hotel tell them and they will give you a 10% discount on meals.  Full breakfast served every morning at the hotel with many choices.  Everyone very accommodating to your requests.  We have stayed here four years in a row and would highly recommend as a choice place to stay also room rates are excellent for the services provided.

Summary Heading: Classy hotel near Honda Center and Angel Stadium
Summary: We have stayed at this Ayers Hotel several times.  It is very well appointed and in a convenient location if you are going to an event at the Honda Center or Angel Stadium.  We enjoyed the nice free breakfast and free wifi. It is just down the road from Disneyland and close to the 5 freeway. They have a heated pool and spa but I did not use it. This Hotel Chain is family owned and has the feel of a boutique hotel with special amenities. I would highly recommend it.  It is in a busy area and Katella Ave. can be busy as well.  However you will be very comfortable there. There are numerous restaurants nearby.

Across from Honda Center. I had a very nice room. Third Floor with two big windows, with differing views. very spacious room. With big desk area. and Wet Bar. Nice furnished bathroom, and plesant decorations. I stayed here once before in 2003. I would for sure stay hereagain. Altgough I'm not wild about extra fees for parking, and the night I was there? $189 ($211 with tax) The room is nice & hotel very thoughtfully decorated, But that price is steep.

We reserved 2 suites so we could attend an Alan Jackson concert at the Honda Center. It is located right across the street. This makes it perfect for walking took about 5 mins. to get there. Staff was really nice. Rooms clean and Tidy.

The Ayers hotel is outstanding!  We have stayed here before and will continue to return.  The staff is helpful, friendly and truly there for their customers.  The breakfast, including , including Mickey pancakes for the kids, was wonderful.  When we needed anything, the staff was there for us.  Our go to place when visiting Disneyland, going to a baseball or hockey game.  You can take a shuttle to Disneyland , take a short walk to Angels Stadium or walk across the street to the Honda center.

The only positive thing I can say about this location is that it's quiet.   Parking is not included in the cost. You take a ticket as you enter. I inadvertently left my ticket in my room once on my way to a meeting. I rang the "help" button for AT LEAST 10 minutes and no one picked up. With only 15 minutes to get to my meeting at this point, I drove my car into the driveway right in front of the entrance to the hotel thinking a hotel worker would take my room number, charge me accordingly and let me out. The guy at the front desk, Jason, told me to hit the "help" button. I told him I had done so, gave him my room number and I apologized for being an inconvenience. He begrudgingly walked out from behind the counter and said, "and you're not allowed to park there."

Summary Heading: BEST location for Angels or Ducks or Amtrak( ARTIC)
Summary: I chose this hotel to be close to the Angels Stadium for a single night in Anaheim while attending a game. It turned out to be the best choice - this hotel is a short ( 0.5 mile) safe, well lit walk to the stadium - no need to get a car or fuss w/ parking. Our check in was great - fast and pleasant and the manager so helpful with information for us non-locals. The room was spacious/ clean and well outfitted with a small fridge, safe, microwave, dining table and chairs for 2 + the nicest hotel beds I have experienced in a non 5 star place. The TV was great and bathroom serviceable - not spa-ish but at this price just fine. Across the street is a brew-pub  that had very good pizza/ craft beer and sandwiches and the next AM the hotel offered a hot, homemade full breakfast (

Convenient location, friendly staff, and clean, comfortable rooms.  What more could you want from a hotel.  The rooms were reasonably priced and the shuttle/bus ride to Disneyland was really helpful and easy to use.

Stayed here overnight for a game at Angels Stadium and had a fabulous stay. It is right across from Honda Stadium and a fairly quick walk down to Angels stadium. It's in a great area and has a very cool bar with outdoor patio across the street too. The room was very big and clean with a comfortable bed that was semi separate from the living area. Room also had a mini fridge which was much appreciated, too! Parking is $10 with in and out privileges, which I would have liked to be free... but you can't get everything you want! We tried out the pool and it is my only complaint about our stay here. It was filthy! Bugs and leaves and dirt galore. I recommend a new filter system, perhaps. Breakfast in the morning was phenomenal and there is a chef who makes fresh pancakes and serves

Great hotel for the money. Right across from the Honda Center, very near the Angel's Stadium, and ARTIC - Anaheim Regional Transportation Intermodal Center - Amtrak and buses. Great-sized room with fridge and microwave too. Outdoor spa and pool. Free internet, but not very fast at times. Breakfast included.

I've stayed here many times and honestly, I don't know what is going on. I stayed for two days this month and the place is a mess. The room we had smelled horrible. It was hot even with the air turned low. The beds and pillows were uncomfortable and the pool was filthy cloudy one night and backed up the next day. Water was all over the parking lot. It was just gross. Plus, if you stay on a game day, you better enjoy being trapped because you are going NOWHERE if you want to leave from 6-730 or 930-1030. Just felt like it was run down a bit.

Good hotel for disney.  Transportation to and from the park provided at reasonable cost.  Also very convenient for Ducks and Angels games.    Comfortable beds Only negative I could find is the fitness room was very small and had limited choices for exercise.   Breakfast is included and is above average for a hotel hot breakfast.

Always a great experience. I come to this hotel every year with my son to see a Ducks hockey game. The rooms are always clean and ready (and relatively quiet), the staff is friendly, and the rates are reasonable. The breakfast on the day we leave is always a nice bonus and my son always looks froward to it.  Only negative is that the dark curtains don't close all the way, so we wake up with the sun when it streams into the room. This is the only hotel I've ever stayed at that has this problem. If it's the air conditioning unit that is the reason for this, I'm sure curtains with a cut-out could be had.  I will be be back next year.  Larry

Summary Heading: Not for Disney.  Not a "Boutique Hotel".
Summary: I reserved three rooms at the Ayres Anaheim for a family vacation to Disneyland.  My reservation was based on so many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and other sites - I consider myself an informed traveler.  If I was staying for an event at the Honda Center I would have probably given this 3.5 stars, but I was there for Disneyland.  Anaheim Resort Transit is unpredictable.  The front desk staff were unaware of a schedule for transportation to Disneyland and we often found ourselves waiting around for the shuttle.  The ride was a solid 10 minutes.  After day two we relied on Uber even after pre-paying for ART passes - our time was far more valuable than that.  Staff: The ladies at the front desk were absurd at best.  One young lady kept repeating "gimme a sec" in place of "I'll
Manager Response: Dear Marnie,  Thank you for your review and for choosing to stay with us. While I am pleased to read that you found the cleanliness of the hotel acceptable and some of the Front Desk staff personable, I am so sorry that you had a disappointing experience overall.  I would like to address some of your comments. We are a hotel in transition from a more traditional ‚Äúboutique‚Äù feel to a more modern feel. Our lobby and corridors still remain under renovation, but, by the end of May, the corridors will be done and hopefully we will have the lobby finished shortly after that. This involves some rebranding and the use of the term ‚Äúboutique‚Äù is being revisited by our marketing department. I am also sorry that you received accessible rooms. Those rooms are typically our last rooms to sell, but the closet is legally required to have no door. We did have another guest complain about a noise from our elevator so it was repaired immediately. I was also concerned to hear about your sheets and am currently looking into this issue.   Please allow me to extend my apologies for the Front Desk service you received. We have passed on your feedback to our staff to ensure against this in the future. We are working with the ART to improve the reliability of the service. During the busy part of the year it is the best way to get to Disneyland as the shuttles arrive/go every 20 minutes.  Again, our apologies for these issues. We sincerely hope you will allow us another opportunity to welcome you and show you how remarkable a stay with us can be.   Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel for an event at the Honda Center!
Summary: We always stay at the Ayres on Katella when we go to the Ducks games. It is the nicest, cleanest and most convenient by far! We've stayed at several others in the area, but have stuck with the Ayres for several years now.

Very nice hotel. Full breakfast with a chef cooking to order; they also have a social hour with free drinks in the lobby. ART bus stops at the door ( bus #15, pay attention if you ever want to get back). Very pleasant stay.  This hotel is located a short drive away from Koreatown with a multitude of authentic Korean, Vietnamese and Japanese restaurants. Don't eat at another chain, check out some real food that can only be had here.

The location is a couple of miles from the craziness of the Disneyland area. You can drive yourself and pay for parking at Disney, take the Area Transit for a fee, taxi, uber, your choice. This hotel is right across from the Honda Center and there is a restaurant/brewery across the street with a great outdoor dinning area with fire pit that also delivers to the hotel. I love the art work hanging on all the walls of this hotel. The room was clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable. A full breakfast is also provided. There is a $10/night parking charge. The staff is very nice and hard working. The only reason I didn't rate this hotel as excellent is because of what happened at check out. The man at the desk was taking a phone reservation when I went to check out. He was

Stayed at the hotel for the location and it exceeded our expectations. The room feeling is comfortable with a bed that made us forget jetlag. Breakfast better than any hotel chain on its range. We took the shuttle to Disneyland and left our rental car at the parking lot after checkout with no extra charge! Would definitely stay there again.

The bridesmaid  swe all stayed here the night before the wedding we were so happy with the service we received  at  this hotel Beau and Andrew where amaing they gave us all the attention  we needed to make the brides day less stressful  . They made sure that our make up artist and hairdresser  had no problems  with anything

Our family stayed here during our Disney visit.  It wasn't far (15 minutes away). Also bus (TRA) runs the distance for just $5 per person per day. Breakfast was very good (cooked fresh by chef).  Room was very very clean (better than other 3-4 star hotels) and bed was amazingly comfortable. AC was little noisy but it kept the room very cool.

Summary Heading: BEWARE OF PET POLICY and TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!
Summary: TRULY A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE.  PLEASE look at the website of this hotel CAREFULLY before you book if you have a pet.  This property comes up in searches under Pet Friendly or Dog Friendly hotels in Anaheim.  There is even a PHOTO in their gallery of a gentleman with a dog at the hotel.  The hotel web site for this location states PET FRIENDLY LOCATIONS when you bring it up.   How do you equate an area on your site of Ayres Hotel Anaheim that says pet friendly locations to really mean:  EXCEPT THIS ONE??  FIX THIS AYRES!!!  It is not fair to consumers to have any grey area here.  AND THEN on top of it the management staff on Friday evening was so INCREDIBLY CONDESENDING and stated "IF YOU HAD BOTHERED TO SCROLL DOWN YOU WOULD HAVE SEEN we don't allow pets" - SERIOUSLY???? No -
Manager Response: Dear Karenjo G -  Thank you very much for your candid review of our hotel and for taking the time to review our hotel on TripAdvisor. We are very sorry to hear your stay was anything less than remarkable. We do understand that many guests enjoy travelling with their pets, but, unfortunately, we do not accept pets at this hotel with the exception of service animals as required by law.   Our own website does list 6 locations as pet friendly but our particular location is not on this list. While we did do our utmost to locate any and all websites during this stay that may showcase our hotel as accepting pets, we were unsuccessful in locating any mention of our hotel as being pet friendly and this was also not listed on the website where the reservation was booked. The photo included in this review does show a gentleman with a dog, but, if one were to examine it closer, this photo was not taken in our hotel but in someone's home and included in a guest's review as a thank you for a wonderful stay. We do sincerely apologize if this caused any sort of confusion and have passed all of this information on to the corporate office so they can further investigate and ensure all websites accurately reflect our non pet friendly status.   We did understand that it was late and that it would be difficult to secure a new hotel so did agree to accept the pet along with the application of a guestroom cleaning fee. Pet fees are standard at most pet-friendly hotels and, although we are not pet-friendly, we did require a fee application as the guestroom would then need to be specially cleaned in order to prepare it for the next guest. We are sorry if this information was not better communicated and caused any inconvenience.   We do wish your stay had been more exceptional and hope you will allow us another opportunity to show you how comfortable a visit with us can be.   Sincerely,   Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This is a best kept secret in Anaheim.  Right across from the Honda Stadium, this small gem is quiet and somewhat quaint.  Great place to take the kids.  Service is great and they have a super happy hour for the whole family.  Ayres Anaheim is extremely clean and one of your less complicated hotels.  I recommend it!

Summary Heading: A very enjoyable stay in Anaheim..we will return
Summary: We mainly chose the Ayres Hotel Anaheim based on reviews we read.  This was our first time staying there.  The service was top-notch with friendly smiles and hellos greeting us from all of the staff.  The morning breakfast was always great and each area including our room was maintained very well and was very clean.  We will call Aryes again when we return.  The pool was heated and clean.

This is such a nice hotel!!! The room was gorgeous and spacious. Breakfast was SUPER!! There is a shuttle that takes you to and from Disney, very easy to navigate and very convenient. I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Pleasantly Surprised! Highly recommend this one!
Summary: The staff was the best! They were friendly and attentive. It felt like we were staying with family. The location was great. It was close to so many attractions, and we took full advantage of that. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best we've experienced. The rooms were clean and well maintained. I highly recommend this hotel, and will definitely stay here again.

great location for a hockey game, went to watch Montreal and the Ducks, for a $5 bus pass you can travel to and fro to DL, approx. a 15 min ride, staff were great room was very comfortable and clean, $40 taxi ride from JW airport, took a town car back to the  airport flat rate $45 which was much more comfortable than the taxi, they do sell beer in the hotel but only imported and a limited selection, wine is also sold but also limited, breakfast had a good variety of cereals and fruit also some sort of potatoes, eggs, pancakes and sausages or bacon, go early or the bacon is really really crunchy not to my liking, if you do not have vehicle you are limited to the brewery restaurant across the street which has a good variety of choices, we did not have a bad meal there, went three

My boyfriend and I were visiting California for a vacation and to catch a couple of Washington Capitals games on their California swing. We stayed in the Ayres Hotel for two nights. Although our room was at the end of the hall, it was worth it, as we had a  view on two sides of our room. The hotel itself seems older--with photos of local history and an aura of being old-fashioned. But like many hotels nowadays, they offer breakfast in the morning and drinks and cookies in the afternoon. Our room was large and very comfortable. The staff we interacted with was very nice.   The hotel also has an unusual way of saving energy; you need to put your room card in a small pocket near the thermostat to get power to the lights. I guess it's a way of ensuring people turn their lights off

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, except for the Futon
Summary: We really liked staying the night at this hotel, everything seems very nice, clean and organized. Front desk staff was very polite, helpful and answered all my questions. Our only concerned was that we have reserved a two queen bedroom, but we ended up getting a one king bed and a futon. After a full day at Disneyland we wanted to have a good night rest but we saw the futon, things really changed.  We were so tired and had to arrange the futon for my son to sleep on which was not what we wanted not have paid for. That futon was the most uncomfortable bed I had seen, anyone could have gotten a better sleep by laying on the floor. My son was extremely sore was that darn futon. I really don't think the futon should count as a bed.

What a great place. I booked it for two reasons, reviews on trip advisor and free breakfast!  Figured that would save one meal at Disney. Well that was turns out to be a great reason along with everything else. I did early check in and asked for a room with a view. Well I got a text they had taken care of that and boy did they. I watched the fireworks from Disney every night from my room. The ART stops in the parking lot, literally. And it's right by the Amtrak station. Staff was unreal. Had all my answers and helped me so much. Can't recommend it enough. Free wifi too!!

We stayed overnight at this hotel for a hockey game at Honda Center. The price was very reasonable and the room was clean and updated. The breakfast buffet was good as well. We have stayed at the Ayres before and will stay again on our next visit to Anaheim. They even have a shuttle to Disneyland if you have time to visit. Unfortunately we did not.

Summary Heading: Great if you're going to a Sporting event....too far from Disneyland
Summary: This property is wonderful if you are attending a Sporting event!  It is located across the street from Honda Centre, but we were there for a Disney adventure with family and kids.  There is not much within walking distance from the hotel other than JT Schmid's restaurant.  Check in went quick and our rooms were ready early which was a plus.  Our room was clean but we were putin an accessable wheelchair room and we didn't have a bathtub, closet door or mirror other than the bathroom.  Queen bed was comfy.  Complimentary breakfast was really good and the breakfast staff were great.  There was always lots of big tables to accomodate our large family.  The cook, Jose, made Mickey Mouse pancakes if you asked him, and always had a friendly smile.  Breakfast consisted of scrambled

Our family of 4 (2 adults + 2 kids age 4 and 3) stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as a part of our 1 week holiday during Thanksgiving holidays.  First impression - very nice hotel, fire place was lit up in reception area, no queue at check in, cookies for kids. I asked for higher floor room and that's exactly what we got. As it was Thanksgiving week - Disneyland had fireworks twice every night so on our first night we saw fireworks twice from our room, our girls were delighted :)  There is no restaurant or bar on site, for European travelers it might be a surprise as it was for us as we haven't stayed in many American hotels but there is a nice place around the corner, it is a brewery but kids friendly and we ate there twice, never too busy with nice menu and options for our

I came to the Ayers Hotel on business.  I stayed for 4 days and 3 nights.  I was very impressed with their service.  The breakfast was great.  They had pancakes made to order.  I had a light that went out in the bathroom and the maintenance rep was there in a matter of minutes to fix it.  They had a happy hour in the evening and their cookies were amazing =).  The location was perfect.  It was right across the street from the Honda Center.  The only thing that I wish they had was a shuttle from the nearest airport or to Disneyland. That is the final touch that is needed.

Clean, friendly, great breakfast! Really enjoyed our stay here and will come back! Nice accommodations, comfortable beds, free wi-fi, and we were impressed by the level of cleanliness. Very comfortable stay.

We stayed here for just one night to visit Disneyland. Every staff member we me was friendly and helpful. They checked our luggage and put a note in the system we would be checking in after Disneyland closed. We were also able to park our car there while we were at the park, which was nice so we could take an uber ride to the park. Definitely too far to walk to the park especially after a long day walking the park. But many transportation options available. The hotel was clean and the bed/ bedding so comfortable we all woke the next morning saying it was the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in, especially in a hotel. The free breakfast was just right.. Nothing fancy but hot cooked selections as well as many other standard items. I would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: The best Hotel for Disneyland without the crowds...
Summary: This was our second stay at the Ayers Hotel. This Hotel is one of the best Hotels we have stayed at. The Manager operates this Hotel extremely well,  he is very helpful as are all his staff. The Hotel has a social hour on Monday-Thursday 5.30-6.30pm. This is held in the foyer area and the comfortable seats are placed so well that you can mix with other guests or just enjoy the social hour as a couple. The beds are extremely comfortable ,rooms are very clean and staff very helpful. Wifi is fast and reliable. If you plan going to Disneyland, stay here away from the crowds and you can catch a shuttle to Dinseyland and back to the Hotel so easy for a small  cost. Across the road from the Hotel is a Bistro which sells drinks and great food for a good price. If you show the Bistro

My family and I stayed at the Ayres Anaheim on 2/19 & 2/20 in room 416 and loved our hotel room. It was clean, spacious, comfortable, and very close to Disneyland. The free breakfast is a great convenience, satisfying, and saves you $$ on your first meal. All the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We also loved the fact the Disneyland shuttle (#15 route; $12 for two adults & one child for an all day pass) stopped right in front of the hotel lobby and you didn't have to walk a block or two to catch it. Our stay would have been perfect if the water pressure was stronger in the shower. Other than that, our family will definitely return when we visit Disneyland again!

We enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were spotless, everything worked wonderfully, from the front desk staff to complimentary car parking! This is a great location of you have business to do locally. The only let down was the breakfast which was free; I'd describe it as cheap & cheerful; more of a cafeteria dining experience than a hotel. Otherwise this is a great location for working holidays on business, great locationand everyone knows it well.

Very nice stay.  Lovely people (yay, Jason!), nice room, good amenities. Nice to have Disney shuttle take us other places. Quiet despite 9 million children there for Disney. Nice lobby.  Fitness room awfully small and somewhat cold but I could still work out as I wanted.  Higher quality breakfast than I expected -- made to order eggs and pancakes. Very good value.

Great price, room was clean and comfy. Loved the warm cookies and the beer & wine reception. Slept soundly even though close to freeway. When my kids were younger, they loved being closer to Disney but for the price and comfort, we found our new home away from home when we visit the Magic Kingdom.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay at the Ayres hotel.
Summary: The hotel served as a great place to hang our hats as we visited Anaheim from Texas.  We decided on this hotel due to its location near Disneyland, and also some of the amenities included (mainly the complimentary breakfast and the shuttle to/from Disneyland).  They rooms were excellent, clean, and up to date.  The breakfast was somewhat hard to obtain, as the hotel was filled with families and the dining area was quite small. But it did provide an area to grab a quick cup of coffee and some fruit before we made our venture. It is also extremely close to the freeway, which makes commuting around the area fairly easy. Overall, great price and quality; would definitely book again.

This is a beautiful hotel with very big rooms and comfie beds.  Parking is free and while it isn't  a budget hotel, it is a great value for the price. The front desk staff wasn't the friendliest but I would choose to go back.

I am always happy to stay at the Ayres Anaheim.  It is like being at home.  A warm greeting, excellent personnel, comfortable beds and rooms and a full breakfast in the morning.  Doesn't get any better than this

This was years ago. I couldn't go that far back when it asked me when I went. Booked a room through a site where you do not know where you are going till you pay... ended up spending one night at the best hotel on our trip!  We had made reservations for the other nights (terrible place) but ended up needing one extra night.  The room was beautiful, clean, and had microwave, refrig., amazing cook to order breakfast, and more.

My husband and I stayed here for a 5 day break.  It was a large room, very clean, fantastic bed / pillows and included a good breakfast each day.  There was also a complimentary happy hour during the week which was a nice addition.  The staff were very helpful each time we needed something and there was not really anything we could fault.  The decor is a little dated in places, particularly the pictures, but in the rooms it has been updated and is very comfortable.  It is positioned well for disneyland or even a drive down to San Diego.  We would definitely recommend this hotel as it really offers excellent value for your dollar. Great Wifi too which was also complimentary.

Summary Heading: Great location staff not so good
Summary: I like the property but what i don't like is the 10.00 parking and when i checked in he did not state i will be in a handicap room.  this has happen twice to me when i have stayed there. location is great there is a bar/restaurant across the street as well as the Honda center.

We stayed at this hotel with 2 children for 16 nights, arriving on 24 December.  The service received was fantastic and so kind. As we were coming from Australia I didn't want to have to carry all the kids presents with us, and the hotel manager, Marcus, was kind enough to allow us to have the deliveries sent to the hotel.   I went a little (read lot!!) overboard and on my arrival early on Christmas Eve morning all of my many parcels were waiting for me in a conference room which the manager was kind enough to let me use to wrap them, away from the prying eyes of the kids!! I also had a little Christmas tree delivered to the hotel which was set up in our room for our arrival.   The room itself was a great size, and the beds were super comfy. We were able to watch the Disney

Stayed for business 2 nights--convenient location near local attractions, and nice rooms & staff. Nice small gym. Didn't have a chance to check out the pool but that would probably be nice in warmer weather and be fun for kids. Breakfast was decent. A brew pub is next door. Couldn't ask for much else!

I love this place. There rooms are a great size and the bed is very comfortable. They have great chefs and excellent customer service. The lady at the front, I believe her name is radwa was very knowledgeable and helpful. Everyone always smiling.

Great hotel to stay for your Disneyland vacation.  Shuttle Bus to Disneyland is provided by the city (bus #15) and arrives every 30 minutes depending on the day and hour.  The shuttle bus comes to right in front of the hotel lobby!  Cost is $5 for a 24 hour pass and $3 for one day.  The 24 hour pass needs to be bought at the hotel, not the bus.  Yes it's 24 hours, so if you start at 12pm, you can use up until 12pm the next day.  During weekdays, it's every 30 mins during peak hours and every hour during off-peak hours.  Bus goes until 12:30am.  Stay on the 4th floor.  Request for it.  It's more quiet and the ceiling is slightly higher.  Wifi is free and speedy.  Parking is free.  Breakfast is free until 9:30am.  They have the basic scrambled eggs, cereal, bacon or sausage,

This hotel is great the people are helpful and friendly.  We have met some interesting people there.  Men from the monster trucks, Cowboys that were bull riding,  We sat in the loby working on our crafts (hooking rugs and crocheting),

The location is great---to freeways, Convention Center, restaurants. Love this hotel. Excellent service from everyone--management, staff! Very clean, comfortable beds, great breakfast and appreciate the chefs--everyone has a smile. I've been coming here for the last 3yrs. and will not stay anywhere else. Love the cookies and beverages that are complimentary on some nights. Please keep up the excellent service and standards--very much appreciated.

My husband and I stated here because we were visiting Disneyland for two days. The hotel is lovely and has some really nice features about it. You can access Disneyland using the ART shuttle service, which picks you up right outside the hotel. The staff were always friendly. We had a room on the fourth floor facing the carpark, it was quite and we slept extremely well. The room is massive and very clean. I used the gym, which is very small but nobody was ever in there when I was and was completely adequate to maintain fitness whilst on holidays. The breakfast was free so I don't really want to fuss over it as a dampener, but if you want a cooked breakfast expect to line up for it so plan early or just opt for toast or bagels. You are not to serve yourself which is why it is

I have never stayed here before and was pleasantly surprised at how amazing this hotel was.  The staff, amenities, food, and cleanliness was perfect.   Jason helped us our first night by providing  helpful information and even offered us a complimentary shuttle ride to an outlet mall! We loved the breakfast and the friendly chef.  The food and service were great. Did I mention the beds..., wow they were super comfortable.  I highly recommend this hotel

This is the second time in the past six months we've stayed here and both times have been great.  The staff is very helpful and professional, the rooms are updated and clean with comfortable beds.  This hotel was a great value for the price.  I have recommended this hotel to any friends and family members who have said they'd be visiting the area.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with discount for arriving by train
Summary: We stayed here to visit Disneyland. The prices are reasonable and the room was very nice. It was next to a street and we heard the cars at night, but it was only background noise and no problem for sleeping. We arrived from Union Station in downtown Los Angeles by train. This is a very convenient ride, and the hotel is only a four minutes walk from the train station. The great thing is that we received a discount of 20% on our room rate, when we showed the train ticket (as it said on their website). The shuttle to Disneyland left every 20 minutes and was only 5 dollars per person for both ways.

This hotel was highly recommended, other than a hiccup that my 10am early check in GUARANTEE was not fulfilled and was told that since I still got to check in early so go charged for early check in anyway, and a rude neighbor my stay was nice. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast is true to the other reviews, a great array of choices for breakfast and friendly chefs that work very hard to deliver fresh pancakes and goodies to diners.  The rooms were clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable and of course all close to the highway for easy access to your amusing park destination.

Excellent room and service.  I've stayed at Ayres Anaheim and enjoy the experience each time.  Love the hot fresh cookies and the breakfast is wonderful.  I will stay here each trip to Orange.  I recommend for those going to Disney.

Good:  Comfortable beds, European decor (including portraits along the hall ways)  friendly staff, clean, quiet  (hotel was sold out and did not hear any noise from hall or adjoining rooms), pool was heated in the winter (added to kids fun).  Challenge:  For a family trip to Disney it is a ways from the park. Bus to park is convenient and reasonable at $5 a day, Ignore the reviews posting view of fireworks as only a few rooms have a view and it is 3 plus miles away.  Our 4th floor room was blocked by palm trees and City National Bank.  Majority of guests were staying there for events at the Big A and Honda Center.  Breakfast was good, but no eggs to order like a couple of reviews posted.  Typical scrambled eggs, bacon, pancakes, cereal, breads.  Overall very nice for moderately

All previous positive reviews were right on . Spent 3 nights and was very happy . Came primarily to watch the Leafs and Ducks play , leafs won and even happier . Staff courteous and friendly . Many dining options nearby . Highly recommend . Special shout out to Jose at the breakfast buffet .  Jim and Pat from Ontario

My wife and two children stayed here while spending 5 days at Disneyland/California Adventure. The hotel was great. They had inexpensive snacks at reception, the ART bus came every 20 minutes, and the all-you-can-eat breakfast had both cooked and continental options and free for hotel guests. Free internet (Disneyland has no free wifi) and laundry facilities.  If you want to see the Disneyland fireworks from your room, ask for a room on the top floor with an even number e.g. 402.  Andrew on reception was awesome and no request was too much.

We had a great time at this hotel.  Parking is complimentary, breakfast was included, the bed was plush.  Free wifi was a nice perk.  We stayed here during a trip to Disneyland.  Although it was a little farther from the park than I would have liked, the value made it a 5/5 in my book!

Summary Heading: Friendly service. Clean Rooms. Breakfast options, great and friendly staff.
Summary: I have stayed at Ayers every time I'm in Anaheim for Disneyland. I have enjoyed my stay and get restful sleep every time. Clean rooms. Rooms are ample. Great breakfast. Friendly and attentive staff. The parking lot is safe. Even though the hotel is not next to Disneyland they provide a shuttle and it is a short distance from Disneyland parking.

During our visit to Disneyland in the New Year Eve of 2016, we stayed at this hotel and we liked it. The hotel has kind of european style. It is quite, clean, and cozy. The staff was friendly and cooperative. They offer a complementary breakfast which was nice. They also offer a free shuttle to Disneyland, and the hotel itself is just 10 min drive to there. We would always consider this hotel an option if I decided to go to Anaheim again.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for 4 nights in mid December and had a fabulous time.  This hotel is a real gem.  It is beautifully maintained, the rooms are to a high standard and spacious.  The breakfast was excellent, and we really liked that fact that food could not be taken out of the breakfast room, which meant that food spills were not evident on any of the carpets in the public areas.  The staff were extremely friendly and efficient and made us feel really special.  Parking was easily accessable and the full in and out priviledges were great.

Spent two nights, was a great location right across from Honda Center, we were there seeing Disney on Ice/Frozen. Room was  handicap friendly, so had a huge bathroom and was clean. Parking was easy and included. We really liked their made to order and fresh breakfast including eggs, pancakes, sausage and bacon. The staff was very accommodating and very pleasant. We drove down to Downtown Disney one night, only took like 10 min.

Summary Heading: You will not be disappointed here 5 Stars across the board
Summary: Our first time staying here was a wonderful experience and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was immaculately maintained, the bed was extremely comfortable and made for a great night's sleep. Awesome full american breakfast served with chef on duty to provide hot fresh food items and a smile every morning. In the early evenings we enjoyed lounging in the lobby by the fireplace socializing with  other guests, enjoying complimentary chips, salsa, guacamole, beer, wine, soft drinks and HOT OUT OF THE OVEN cookies. Free in-room wifi and complimentary guest parking was a nice touch. The staff and management made us feel like we were a guest in their own home, real old world hospitality. Sincerely, The Mike & Marley family

After much searching, I found this hotel as part of a package to the Disneyland parks. It was easy to reach from the John Wayne Airport and the hotel clerk showed us a great deal using ART for the three days we were there. Comfortable room and beds. Quiet and nice amenities. The breakfast room was large and a full meal provided each morning by a wonderful chef....she even made French toast while cooking eggs, bacon or sausage, and potatoes. A great assortment of other foods as well. We used the small food area one evening for snacks and a bottle of wine. Although we did not partake, the complimentary evening drinks and appetizers looked good! This hotel is an excellent location to Disneyland, the Honda center, train depot, and A's stadium. We would definitely stay at the Ayres

I would like to start off with saying that this hotel has the most comfortable beds. I greatly enjoyed my stay because I was able to relax. The breakfast was very delicious. The first morning I was surprised how calm and friendly the cook Benita with such crowded breakfast room. The front desk staff was all friendly and helpful! Thank you Romy, Linda, Andrew and Jason for all your help. Also, I can not forget the management Derrick and Marcus for making sure my family and I have a great stay. I would definitely be coming back when I travel again to California.

It's been over 18mths since we previously stayed at this hotel and it was great to see a few familiar faces and experience the same high level of service as we have in the past.  We stayed at numerous chain motels on this trip and Ayers has the best breakfast offering by far, we couldn't wait to get back to Jose and the delicious hot food he dishes up each morning, hubby was particularly fond of the sausages!   We stayed in a ground floor room looking out to the car park and it was surprisingly quiet as it seemed to be insulated from the road noise that we usually get when staying on a higher floor.  Nice to see that the rooms have been recently refurbished with the foyer and hallways due to be updated in 2016. It is disappointing that there is now a $10/night fee for parking

We stayed at Ayres the weekend after Christmas while visiting Disneyland as it's less than 3 miles away.  Location of the hotel is great with nice restaurants in less than half mile radius.  The customer service Ayres provided was just above & beyond. It was my wife and our little three (under 6).  They didn't have a room available with two double beds.  Mr. Collins was nice enough to upgrade us to a suite with a separate living room with sofa pullout bed.  I believe all their rooms come with microwave & mini fridge but the suite also had a full size dining table along with a 50" ultra slim LED. The hot breakfast was another deal breaker in the cold weather.  Another great thing I noticed was that the chef was not cross contaminating the cooking ware between different food items

Summary Heading: A great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Large, comfortable room that is well-maintained. Plenty of amenities such as refrigerator, microwave, couch, and desk. Both room and common areas are clean. Bed is comfortable, though the sheets were a bit scratchy. Had some difficulty determining how the thermostat worked. There is an iPod docking radio in the room that seems somewhat obsolete, since most people have their music on their phones. Internet was slow. Breakfast was great. Lots of selections, everything fresh, and a cook to make pancakes and omelets. This is not our first time staying at this property, and it won't be our last.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel overall, but it's the little details at times...
Summary: These might be two minor issues, but after verifying by telephone the rate of additional charge for a second vehicle, before even making the online reservation, we arrived and initially was told we couldn't. This was important because we both came from work at different locations to meet for a concert at the Honda Center. After a few back and forth conversations and being told I should've put it on the "notes" in the online reservation, (then acting like they were doing me some "favor"), they ultimately charged the $10 like I was originally told by phone. The second issue was the smoke detector went off in the room in high ceiling and couldn't be reached without a ladder, (a malfunction, we don't smoke). After calling and  requesting someone come with a ladder to reach and shut

Summary Heading: Ayres - Great Location and great breakfast
Summary: what I can add to what it is said already:  1) Great breakfast and great service.  2) Clean and well decorated rooms.  3) Mini happy hour - basically free beer in a basket at the lobby from 5-6PM.  Good for me to grab a couple a of tallboys to the room with TV...  Down:  It is just my personal taste but the theme or decoration of the hotel chain is like a french / french fast food / look at like with a bunch of pictures of that guy Ayres who is the founder of the chain... I find that out of place that kind of theme, specially in Southern California... Again it is just my persona opinion.    And what up with those gates at the parking lot? It was helly difficult to open them with the cards...

Normally I don't do reviews, but I had to put one down because I had a great experience with Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.  My wife and I came down to Anaheim as a part of our honeymoon and it was overall a great experience.  I'll cover just a few of the main points of our trip that I thought was worth mentioning.  The location is fantastic, as we're big hockey fans and the Honda Center was literally a 2 min walk away.  That saved us from extra parking costs associated with going to a game, as well as the headache of finding parking too.  Parking is free for hotel guests and we never had any issues with finding a spot to park our car.  A shuttle travels between Ayres and Disneyland - for a cost of $5 bucks per day, roundtrip.  Another big benefit was that a breakfast buffet was also

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Close to Disneyland Area
Summary: My husband and I really enjoy Disneyland, so we tend to take weekend trips with our baby boys to Anaheim often. This hotel measures up to others I've stayed in, but particularly stands out in the beautiful decor of its lobby and art spreckled throughout its halls. The lobby was very inviting, with its fireplace, Christmas tree and comfy chairs to sit in. Breakfast was the traditional fare of bacon and eggs, and I especially liked the little sundry shop area next to the front desk, as it was stocked with a decent wine selection and array of snacks. The bed was super comfy and having a small microwave and fridge in the room was key for us with our little ones.  I was skeptical as to whether or not this hotel would be suitable for families with young children, but it turned out to

Summary Heading: Very good value and great location for the Honda Center!
Summary: Chose this hotel as across the street from the Honda Center, so super convenient to just walk over. They only charge you $10 for overnight parking, and so no worries about driving to the Hockey game and paying for parking. The hotel price included Wi-Fi and a very good hot breakfast. We were also pleased to find out as we were staying mid-week, they also have a complimentary "happy hour" offering beer/wine! It was held in the lobby, and quite a few of the guest decided to enjoy this perk. We will definitely stay there again when attending an event at the Honda Center.

Attended a hockey game at Honda Center so stayed here overnight. Conveniently just across the street from the arena and many restaurants near by. This property is well maintained and the rooms are clean and spacious. The hot breakfast buffet was delicious. Will stay here again..Hint: easy freeway access and Disneyland is a miles down the road.

We booked this hotel using the Hotel Tonight App.  We booked the same day we stayed.  It was a Saturday night on a holiday weekend (October 10).  First the price was amazing.  It came down to this hotel and another one we previously had stayed at.  This place was $5 more and charged for parking, we decided to try it out.  Wow.  This hotel was beyond our expectations.  I can't even believe we had never stayed here before!  My husband went to check in while we waited in the car.  The staff were amazing.  The room was beautiful.  I couldn't even believe that the room was that nice.  We truly enjoyed our stay here.  We were pretty tired from Disneyland, so I'm not sure if that helped, but we have never slept better on vacation.  Even our daughter slept through the night.  The beds

Had the chance to stay in a 2 bedroom suite. Loved that it was spacious and modern. Great free breakfast and service. Now the bad...the parking sucks! It to tight together and only certain ways out. I also don't like the 2 in 1 shampoo and conditioner. They should always have both!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but great customer service
Summary: The hotel itself was nice. Easy access to Disneyland by bus although not walking distance. The best part of our stay was the customer service. Jose the chef was amazing and made us feel so welcomed and Andrew at the front desk was professional and helpful. Thanks guys for making the stay great.

Summary Heading: Great place for a short trip
Summary: Clean room with standard amenities, friendly / helpful employees, and an OUTSTANDING breakfast offering.  Convenient location.  Smaller hotel without the hustle and bustle of large crowds. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice get away. Ayres in Anaheim
Summary: Beautiful Hotel, when we checked there was a young girl that was working didn't make us feel too welcome. But Very nice clean room, great view, continental breakfast, is really a big breakfast, servers are really fast.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay minus the rude people down the hall
Summary: We were here for five nights visiting Disneyland. The first night we arrived we were in time for the happy hour which included drinks (non-alcoholic punch, wine), tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole and the freshly baked chocolate-chip cookies...a good start to our stay. The hotel is well maintained and the rooms were clean and comfortable. As we were on the 3rd floor (room 318) we were able to view the Disney fireworks from a distance. We did not have any issues with traffic noise.  We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast every morning. The breakfast options were pretty good. It did get busy at times but it didn't impact us too much.   This is a great hotel for a Disneyland visit. Even though we had rented a car, we chose to take the ART which took us right to the

Summary Heading: Very nice but noisy on one side
Summary: We have always stayed at the Ayres in Anaheim when we visit Disneyland.  This was our fourth stay at the property and the first time we've had issues.  The first night we stayed there were some very loud adults laughing, yelling, and closing doors loudly.  Between 12 and 1:30 AM I was awakened several times.  I called the front desk and he said he was aware and was coming upstairs to check on it.  I heard them for about 30 more minutes and they stopped.  The second night, a restaurant / brewery across the street had a DJ bumping music.  I got into bed about 11:30.  The noise continued until close to 2AM.  I called about 1AM and inquired about the loud music and the man said that the only place where music could be coming from was the restaurant across the street.  In the

This was our first time at Ayres Hotel in Anaheim Ca. I would highly recommend it! The rooms are clean, front desk helpful, the shuttle was worth the fee and the breakfast was great!!! We came as a family with my daughter, son in law and granddaughters they were very pleased as well. The price of stay for the rooms was very reasonable. We will stay here always when we visit Anaheim!!!

This hotel is rated no1 in Anaheim and I can see why. We stayed for a trip to Disney. We arrived in the morning and they checked us in without hesitation. The reception desk also arranged transfer tickets to the park which is roughly 15 minutes away by bus. The staff were friendly and welcoming. On entering the hotel it felt like an English country manor! Our room was very large and modern no complaints here. Another bonus is the free breakfast where a chef is on hand to prepare hot food for you.  The WIFI was slow but that was my only gripe. Recommended.

This property is our preferred hotel to stay in for any of us who need to visit our O.C. division.  It is always clean, fresh and accommodating. Really, no issues to report.   We will continue to use this Ayres site into the foreseeable future!

Summary Heading: Great Hotel - Lived up to their reviews
Summary: The Hotel is very welcoming. The staff very friendly and helpful. The room was nicely appointed and spotless, comfortable bed.  The breakfast was a surprise, was not expecting to see the cooks on hand. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would book again when I return to the area.

Love this hotel! So glad we stayed here for Disney. The staff was really friendly. they have a shuttle that takes you to Disneyland. Cost $5 pp. I think they pick up every 30 mins? Hotel location is right off the highway as well. Breakfast was great. We always have our eggs made to order and they also have potatoes, bacon/sausage and waffles/pancakes. Plus muffins, cereal, fruits and juice/milk. The room is also very spacious and it looks like they just remodeled the rooms so the carpet is clean and the bathroom is big. The bed is also very comfortable! Free parking! Would definitely come back and stay at this hotel again!

The Ayers Hotel provided a warm, convenient, friendly environment. The rooms were beautifully decorated and spotless. The staff what really separates this hotel from others. They were accommodating and even made extra cookies for us one night. In a world where everyone is racing from one thing to another, the Ayers hotel staff were in the moment and provided a lovely experience.  Highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Attended a concert at Honda Center and stayed overnight
Summary: I got my husband tickets to a concert at the Honda center right across the street from the hotel and booked a room for us to stay overnight. It was so convenient and close. We did not encounter any problems. Loved the stay the atmosphere. Great service, clean cozy rooms, very close to our destination.

They Ayres Anaheim is a beautiful boutique property with a great staff, excellent amenities including breakfast and individual attention from staff. I definitely recommend for group, social,  or family travel.

Summary Heading: Decent location for a Disney vacation
Summary: We enjoyed our 2-night stay at this hotel while we spent 2 days at Disneyland. Breakfast was above average, with fresh pancakes and eggs plus basic cereal, toast, etc. The staff was friendly. There is a shuttle to the Disney parks that runs every 20 minutes, for a fee. On our second day, we ended up driving because that shuttle hadn't shown for over an hour (probably due to local road construction). Not the hotel's fault. Rooms were clean and spacious enough for our family of four.

We stayed here for 2 nights and would highly recommend this hotel. We went to an Oilers vs. Ducks game right across the street at the Honda Centre. Can't beat that for a convenient location!   Super close to the theme parks, comfortable and reasonable rates. Plus the fresh baked cookies and happy hour can definitely hit the spot after a day at the parks!

This hotel was nice enough. Safe but they charge for parking :-(. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Not a great selection of toiletries so bring your own. The buffet breakfast was great including a fantastic and friendly chef/cook to serve up fresh eggs, bacon, hash browns, and pancakes. The rest of the buffet had a nice selection of the continental sort. Breakfast included with stay. I'd stay there again.

The stay at this hotel was amazing from beginning to end! The front desk could not have been more accommodating to our unexpected situation!!!! The room was comfortable and clean, the breakfast was outstanding but the best part of this hotel is the amazing staff who are so accommodating!!! The quality of this hotel, especially with their staff, is way beyond what you would expect for the price.  I will stay at Ayers Hotels at every opportunity!!! Amazing!!!!!

This was my first stay at an Ayers property and it was extremely favorable from check in to check out! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and kind. The free breakfast was fresh and tasty also, and the Chef was awesome too! The room was updated and had more amenities than I even needed! Kudos to the entire Ayers Anaheim staff!  Randy

Summary Heading: Nice property with some strange guest service issues.
Summary: I really don't understand the concept of online check-in if I still have to go to the desk to present my credit card and id. Having 10 years in front office management experience, I don't really see the benefit of this. Maybe it just wasn't done properly in our case.  I received an e-mail at 7:58 am that our room would be ready at 10 am for us. Not only was it not ready, which is fine as we didn't pay the extra $30, but we were unable to even complete the check-in procedure when we arrived at about 10:30 because we were told that our room hadn't been checked-out of yet by the previous guest. I've never had a check-in experience where I can't do the paperwork and have my credit card processed even if my room isn't ready yet and I have to come back later for the key. In essence,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive review. I am so sorry that the pre-arrival system did not work in your case. This was, I am afraid to say, purely due to human error and not the fault of the system. The system actually helps us provide much better guest service when we use it properly. I do apologize for our handling of it. I am also sorry that you were disturbed by the music next door. I have addressed this with the manager and he is addressing it with his team.  I do hope we will host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in Anaheim is Even Better Now!
Summary: Always are great experience with this hotel. Rooms have been updated and look great. Had a very nice view overlooking the pool area this time. Walked to Honda Center for the show and then walked back after. So nice! Full Breakfast as always is included. This hotel has a lot to offer for a great price.

Just stayed here for a week at Disneyland.  Great hotel. Clean, fabulous staff, nice pool. From arrival to departure, this hotel was very accommodating.  Jose the breakfast room chef was fantastic. Friendly, happy, even made my daughter Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes, without me asking for it.   Do yourself a favour and stay here!

The rates for this hotel were competitive and the hotel itself was great. The room was very clean, the bed and pillows were comfortable, the breakfast was better than most  hotel breakfasts. My only complaint would be that although the bed and pillows were super comfortable the sheets and pillowcases were a little rough. It was kind of itchy on my head. But not so much that it disturbed my sleep. Overall, great place to stay, especially if you're going to Disneyland which is only minutes away.

Just an update from my visit last year to the hotel.  I travel to Anaheim every Fall to spend some time at Disneyland. Several years ago, I gave up on staying at the Disneyland Hotel in lieu of the Ayers. Here's why:   Better rooms. Quiet rooms with fantastic beds so you get a great night's sleep. The property is very clean all around. Capped off with an amazing per night price that will knock you out. All of the rooms have been newly refreshed, going to a more earth toned contemporary style. I think that this is a great improvement and one you will enjoy. (I wish that the lobby would be updated as well to tie the whole look together).  Now staying here comes with some trade offs, but in my view, the Ayers still comes out on top:   You'll have to drive or use the great ART
Manager Response: Dear Kubacks,  Thank you for your kind review. I am glad that you met Andrew and that you like our new style. We will be upgrading the lobby and hallways early next year. All the materials have been ordered already. Can't wait. Sorry about the trash, I have passed on your comments to our maintenance team who are working through the whole hotel replacing the smoke detector batteries. Our renovation offset our testing schedule a bit and we feel it warrants a complete redo.  I look forward to hosting you here again next Fall!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I've stayed here many times because the people here are very helpful and the rooms and beds are so comfortable! My friends were very happy with the accommodations and said they are booking here when they come back to town. There is also a great Brewery/Restaurant across the street.

We originally booked a different hotel then changed before our trip. When we arrived we went to the first hotel by mistake. Boy am I glad we had changed and chose this hotel. It was nice and clean. Rooms were well decorated. We thought it would only be a continental breakfast. Much to our surprise it was a complete breakfast and delicious.  Will definitely stay here next time we go to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A great choice-nice hotel, great location.
Summary: We recently stayed here after MUCH researching for a good place to stay near Disneyland. I chose this place because of the reviews. I am glad we did. The price was right, the location was a short drive to Disney and the room was nice. The staff was overall really great too; the chef every morning (Jose` i think) was wonderful. the food was pretty good, wish the eggs were real instead of that powdered egg mix stuff, but we were all satisfied when we left and that is worth a lot. Room was clean, loved having a micro and fridge. We were disappointed that there were not warm cookies at check in...like all the hype i heard in other reviews. (silly i know, but i do LOVE cookies!)  I checked the night of check in and the next. The girls said it was normally a guy who makes them and he
Manager Response: Thank you so much for posting a kind and informative review. You got the chef's name right and I am glad you enjoyed his company and food. Please believe me when I say that we don't serve powdered eggs. They are the real deal!. There really should have been cookies at the desk. I have reminded the guest service staff to have cookies out every evening. We are working on improving the parking machinery. I hope you will have a much better experience with the system on your next visit.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We had a wonderful stay and the room was beautiful.  The staff went out of their way, to make sure we were taken care of.  The breakfast was delicious! The chef cooked my eggs just the way I liked them and made me a Mickey Mouse pancake! Yes, I am an adult and he still made me one!  I will stay here again!
Manager Response: Dear Suzi,  Thank you so much for taking the time to post a kind and fun review. There are no age limits on Mickey Mouse pancakes and I am pleased that Jose took good care of you. I was very pleased to read that we will have the opportunity to host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Staff was wonderful and helpful with directions, places to eat etc.  Room was large, clean and no surprises.  So close to convention center, Disneyland and Angel Stadium.  Very reasonable price.  This is the only hotel I will stay at when I'm in Anaheim. Good Job Ayres Hotel! Man-of-Harm
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post a glowing review. It is always a relief to be on the good side of someone with a Tripadvisor ID like yours! I was pleased to read that we can expect to host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel is pretty far from Disneyland and right next to the stadium. However it has a bus that you can get to Disneyland in 15 min. Super helpful and easy to use. The hotel is clean!!!!!!! I hate dirty hotel rooms and I felt this room was clean and safe enough to let my toddlers go all over the room! The breakfast in the morning is fast and offers many options. The cook was super nice and friendly. He even made my twins Mickey Mouse pancakes!  Tip- don't stay on the 1st floor- the roads surrounding the hotel are loud! Also the rooms did not have very good temperature control. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who does not care about being close to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. I am glad that you were able to use the ART system and that you found our hotel nice and clean. I have passed on your words to our contacts at the ART and to my Executive Housekeeper.  I hope we will see you again soon.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We have stayed at Ayres many times over the years and it was great to see the rooms nicely upgraded.  New carpets and fresh linens and decor.  The bathrooms are still the same, however are quite functional.  The beds were very comfortable.  The staff were as good as ever.  It was a shame we missed Jose cooking the breakfast - apparently taking some well earned leave.  However, the lady serving breakfast was awesome and did a wonderful job.    Parking is now $10/night which is quite reasonable.  We never had a problem finding a park, even when the Lakers were playing at the Honda Center.  The kids loved the pool and hot tub, always clean and plenty of towels to use.  We highly recommend Ayres Hotel - it is nice to be a little further away from the frantic hotels on Harbor.
Manager Response: Dear Emma,  Thank you so much for your kind review and for giving our new rooms the thumbs up. Few things make me happier than a loyal guest who approves of the upgraded rooms. I am delighted that Benita did a good job hosting you at breakfast and I hope we will host you again some time in the not too distant future.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple of nights during a disneyland trip and we loved it! The hotel is really clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and their complementary breakfast is good. We've stayed at a couple other Ayers hotels too and honestly it's one of my favorite hotel chains.
