Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words and for your loyalty to the Ayres Hotel Group. I am pleased that we were able to provide you with a comfortable and pleasant stay and hope that we will host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Convenient location with clean, comfortable rooms .and an ok breakfast
Summary: It was nice to find a hotel close enough to Disneyland with affordable rates that included breakfast and affordable daily parking (along with an abundance of parking spots). This hotel was easy to find from LAX airport (1-hour drive in traffic) and was righ off of the freeway. Our suite was large enough that we were able to unpack our things in the living room and my wife and I weren't stepping all over each other. The bathroom could do with a few more amenities (shampoo, soaps etc) and it'd be great if the breakfast hours could be extended to at least 10:00AM. Besides thise things, a good experience.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post a positive review on our hotel. I am delighted that you found our rooms spacious and our hotel good value and convenient. I hope we will have the opportunity to host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Second visit to the Ayres and it still has all the great features we liked during our last visit.  Staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and well maintained, the beds are comfortable, the breakfast is fab and it is right on the Disneyland ART bus route.  It's just a really nice hotel and appears to be well run.  We will be coming back.
Manager Response: Dear Jim,  Thank you for both of your reviews, you are so kind. I was pleased to read that we took good care of you and hope we will be able to do so for many years to come.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Great hotel, fantastic staff and just perfect!
Summary: If you are looking for a hotel in the Anaheim area, just stop reading other reviews for other hotels and just book this one! Honestly, I'm one of those people that research the heck out of hotels and such before booking/ buying and I am so glad I went with the Ayres. The staff was just PERFECT (Romy - you are just WONDERFUL!) and the shuttle to Disneyland is a breeze and oh so convenient. The room was super clean (I'm a bit OCD - so that was HUGE!). This hotel was just great for us and our 2 young children. Thank you Ayres...we can't wait to stay with you again! :)
Manager Response: Dear Ayesha,  Thank you so much for your exuberant review. I was so happy to read that you received excellent service and that you were able to meet Romy whom you described so accurately! We look forward to seeing you back here too!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: A nice clean hotel with decent size rooms. It is across the street from the Honda centre for events. The front staff were nice and they were efficient. Quite a good breakfast with a friendly chef to enhance the breakfast experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We very much enjoy the opportunity to host fans from all over the world and I am glad you found our staff friendly. I hope that we will have the opportunity to host you again. Go Ducks Go!  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Quiet, affordable, clean and friendly staff...what more could you want in a hotel?!?
Summary: The price of the room: Amazing value considering the hotel is clean and provides amble parking (with a daily fee) and the breakfast is very good.  The room: The room was renovated and very clean!!  The bed was super comfy and the fridge, microwave, coffee maker and sink in the sleeping area were a nice bonus.  The staff: Everyone seemed very nice.  The pool: The pool area was nice and clean.  The hot tub didn't seem to work properly, but it was still relaxing after walking all over Disneyland.  Breakfast: DELICIOUS! Great variety of food and again, very clean.  The shuttle: The shuttle was very convenient for visiting Disneyland, picked us up right at the front door to the hotel and dropped us off right in front of the entrance to Disney.  Overall we had a very relaxing stay.
Manager Response: Dear Cherelle,  Thank you so much for your kind and informative comments posted here. I love the customer for life comment. That is music to my ears! I look forward to hosting you here for many years to come!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Never heard of Ayres and was pleasantly surprised
Summary: We were there for my conference at another hotel, who wanted to charge $6 more a night for parking and no breakfast.  Finally, the first hotel that used the key card to control electric like they do in Europe.  Not to mention the fabulous comforter that also reminded me of our stay in Germany. Loved having the fridge/microwave/sink because I pack food like a squirrel when I travel. Awesome free Wifi.  Breakfast was the best and had no idea there would be someone there to actually make you fresh pancakes which are a treat for me and they were for some reason so good.  Even saw on request they made Mickey cakes for family from Australia. Eggs, one day bacon, next sausage, some sort of potato and the big bowl of mixed fresh fruit was so delightful.  And the staff, wish I could
Manager Response: Thank you so much for writing a kind and very informative review. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and got to try the pancakes. There is a secret recipe involved that I recommend attempting to drag out of the chef when you next visit! I am also glad that we were able to provide friendly customer service. I hope we will host you again soon.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Will stay here whenever possible.  Most comfortable hotel bed ever!
Summary: We picked this place due to the reviews indicating a comfortable bed.  We were not disappointed!  Not only were the beds super comfortable, but the room was spacious and clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and the location superb.    We took Amtrak to take advantage of the 25% off Eco-Discount which made this really affordable for the Disney area.  It included a pretty good breakfast and happy hour during the week.  To get to the Disney parks, we used a combination of Taxi (~$12) and ART buses.  The ART wasn't the most reliable per it's schedule, but was never crowded and quite affordable.    We could see the Disneyland fireworks from our room.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments. I am always delighted when people take advantage of our Amtrak Go Green discount. I am glad that you found the beds to meet your expectations and hope that we will be able to host you again in the not too distant future.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice place to unwind after a concert
Summary: We spent one night here after seeing a concert at the Honda Center across the street.  Check in was a breeze, and our room was ready at the time promised.  The room itself was very nice with a microwave and refrigerator.  The bed was very comfortable.  Our reservation included breakfast the next morning, and while nothing fancy, it was good and the staff were friendly.  The gentleman who checked us in was the same one that checked us out the next day, and he was very nice and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind words. I was pleased to read that you were comfortable and well fed while here. Thank you for your kind comments regarding our front desk agent who always welcomes a compliment. I hope we will host you again soon.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Great location, great room, but poor front desk customer service.Jason in front desk needs more training and more customer service experience.Hotel is just across from the Honda Center, the location was PERFECT!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your review. I am delighted you found yourself in an ideal location and appreciated our efforts to be green. I hope that we will see you again.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Can we clone the Desk Clerk?
Summary: Hotel offers spacious, clean rooms with really comfy beds, windows that actually open, nice hot breakfast, and a d√©cor that's a bit different from your average hotels. But the best part of our stay was the desk clerk who could not have been friendlier or more helpful, especially is arranging transportation to LAX.   Only downside was having to pay for parking. Not uncommon in this area but it's a recent, unwelcome addition to this particular hotel. Would still definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. I am pleased that Jason provided you with excellent service and will let you know if cloning becomes an option!! I also really appreciate your mentioning the view of the mountains. Sounds quite lovely!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I stayed here for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  I came in late night, tired and grumpy from the trip but the front desk staff was upbeat and quick brightening my mood.   My mood only improved when I got to my room (302) which was nicely appointed and well maintained. I liked the eco friendly factor of having to use your card key to activate the lights and a/c ensuring not a watt wasted. The breakfast was great and cook had a great personality. I really enjoyed the location that was central to Anaheim but gave a little distance between me and the family mecca of Disneyland. I will being staying here again.  P.S.- Make sure you do not lose your key card as you will need it to access the parking lot.  It is a requirement due to the proximity of the hotel to two
Manager Response: Thank you for your delightful review. I was very pleased to read that we improved your mood, you certainly improved mine when I read the review! I hope we have the pleasure of hosting you again.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel - room was surprisingly spacious and room and hotel very clean.  Very centrally located, nice customer service.  Great for any sports fan as the Ducks were across the street and the Angels right behind the hotel.  Great area to walk to supper.  The only down side was paying for parking at $10 a night... just a regular parking lot.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review. I am glad you were pleased and surprised by the size of the room and I appreciate your kind comments on our service and cleanliness. The city's trash service does operate a recycling sorting system that pulls recyclables from regular trash, so we have not felt the need to be too proactive in this area knowing we have a forward thinking city. I take your point regarding parking. It is more the demands of the local area that requires a parking system and we charge as a consequence. I hope that we will have an opportunity to host you again.   All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This hotel was excellent value for money as it was only a five minute drive to disney or you can take the free transport. Much cheaper than the ones next door to disney The room was huge and very clean. The only thing was it was 36 degrees outside and so we had to put the air conditioning on, this was extremely noisy and disturbed our sleep but hey you cant really complain at this price. Would definately return if in the area again
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review. I was very pleased to read that you appreciated the room, location and price. I do apologize that you experienced a noisy air-conditioner. Thank you for providing me with the room number so that we could address the issue. I do hope we will have the opportunity to host you here again.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: Stayed at The Ayres Hotel in November 2014 during our first trip to California (and my first trip to USA), we definitely made the right choice when we booked this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful, the facilities were clean and modern. The room was clean, spacious, lovely decor. The buffet breakfast was fantastic, the one time we managed to wake up for it lol (note though if you are from NZ like us you may find the American food bread quite sweet, as we did...but bacon and eggs are universally good!). The Disneyland shuttle came right to the hotel and it was only a 15 minute commute from there. Hotel staff contacted retaurants and airport shuttles to confirm our booking which was much appreciated. We checked out a few hours late and were not charged a fee for doing so which
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your lovely review. I am so pleased we were able to help you with arrangements during your stay and that you managed to make it to one breakfast at least! I have posted your review for our staff to read. I hope we will be able to welcome you back again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Recently stayed one night as two couples in a room with two queen beds.  *The beds and pillows were comfortable.  *The bed room was spacious and the TV was large and could be seen by all 4 people.   *It was nice that the sink was outside of the toilet/shower room.  However the toilet/shower room was very small and the door opened into the person using the mirror.  It could have been laid out better.  *The room and area outside were both quiet at night which was great.   *It's located within walking distance of the Honda Center (basically across the street) and the Angels Park.  Also pretty close to Disneyland.  It's across the street from a bar (with over-priced but good drinks).   *The area felt very safe.   *Parking was $11 for the night (including tax).   *The free breakfast
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. You have been quite comprehensive, I appreciate that you provided readers many details that guests often ask about such as what the local area is like and how much noise there is. I look forward to hosting you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We wanted to stay out of the Harbor Blvd/Disney Way crowds and hotel parking hassle and Ayres' site further east along Katella was just fine. It's also ideally placed to access all important routes in and out of Anaheim.  The Hotel is everything one expects from Ayres. Pleasant staff, nice rooms and well run. It's that simple and why we like to use this Company's Hotels & Inns when we are in the Greater LA Area.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review and for your loyalty to Ayres Hotels. I was very pleased to read that we provided you an outlet to get away from the crowds and I hope we will be able to host you when you next come to visit Mickey.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary Heading: A three week stay was not bad at all
Summary: So, first know that you are very close to the Honda Center and Anaheim Stadium.  Free beer and appetizers monday through thursday in the lobby is a nice touch.  Comfortable beds and large rooms.  Housekeeping does an excellent job as does the front desk staff.  I had no issues my entire three weeks stay and the private parking is nice and room key actuated.  Rooms are quiet and mine was on the 4th floor and facing away from the freeway (i recommend this if you want it quiet).  I will be staying here again when attending any sporting events at Honda Center or Angels Baseball.
Manager Response: Dear Marc,  Thank you for your kind words. I have passed them on to our staff.  I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and that we will see you back here for the events at the Honda Center and Angel Stadium.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Maybe my title is a little unfair as the hotel looked very nice as we entered. More like a mountain log cabin in the lobby area. We used it as a one night stop over after watching an Angels game at the very near Angels Stadium. We missed the free breakfast as we left in the early morning. We did have to change rooms as we found more and then more bugs crawling up the curtains and then on the pillows in room 434. When we collected some and showed them at reception we got another room straight away. No further problems ensued.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us.  I am so sorry that you had to move rooms and apologize for any inconvenience. We found the source of the problem with the gnats and addressed it immediately, while also training our maintenance staff to ensure that it certainly won't happen again. I hope you will try us again when you are next in town.   All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: You really can't ask for a better room at a better price.  We have stayed at this location four times in the past year and have never been disappointed.  From the helpful staff, to the cleanliness of the room, we recommend this hotel to all of out friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and for your loyalty, four times in one year is a lot. I am glad that we have been able to serve you with some consistency and hope we are able to do so for many visits to come.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: I love that they upgrade us into a nice suite... It was so beautiful
Summary: The rooms are so clean, beautiful and the breakfast is awesome... My first time at Ayres and it was a wonderful experience.  I plan staying there again for a romantic weekend for my husbands birthday..
Manager Response: Dear Roxanne,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I am so pleased that we were able to upgrade you and that your stay was enjoyable. I hope that we have the pleasure of hosting you again.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins

Summary: Very helpful and courteous staff . The dining room cook/server Jose was extremely personable and outgoing. (He made a Mickey Mouse-shaped pancake for my daughter and chatted with us about Disneyland).   The free breakfast is plentiful and delicious.  The rooms are gorgeous, spacious, and comfortable. They feature granite counter tops, a mini-fridge, coffee maker, and free Wifi.   Disneyland is a short (15 minute ) ART (bus) trip away and pick up/drop off is at the hotel door! You can purchase ART passes at the front desk. Since we stay at the park all day, we didn't mind taking the ART.  We did not have time to enjoy the pool or fitness room. There is also a happy hour with complimentary drinks which we missed. They also offer a discounted rate for Annual Passholders!
Manager Response: Dear Karen,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I am delighted we have become your favorite and that you had a chance to spend some time with Jose. I look forward to hosting you here again.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: Everything about this hotel is AWESOME but the customer service is second to none! We were visiting Disneyland for our daughters 16th birthday and the staff made it even more special!! My daughter walked into a hotel room filled with balloons, happy birthday sign, a basket of fresh cookies, a card from the staff wishing her happy birthday and even a tiara!! Thank you to the fabulous ladies who took the time and care to decorate our room!  Leslie at the front desk was super helpful, she greeted us with her big beautiful smile every night and gave our daughter a special bear from the hotel!  I wasn't sure if a little boutique hotel would decorate our room for her but they did and they did an amazing job!!  I can't thank the staff enough for making her sweet 16th so special!! The

We have stayed at this property many times.  We are never disappointed.  From the comfortable and clean rooms, the excellent staff, readily available shuttle service, closeness to Angels Stadium - the Honda Center - and the new transportation center, plus a terrific restaurant right next door, why stay anywhere else?  Never to be ignored, is the terrific complimentary breakfast they serve each morning.  We love this place!

We usually stay at a different hotel in Anaheim but based on recent reviews decided to book the Ayres Hotel.  We were not disappointed.  It has recently been refurbished to a very high standard.  The room we had was a suite consisting of bedroom, sitting area/kitchen and bathroom.  The breakfast  was amazing.  There is something for everyone.  The room does get busy at times but we never had to wait for a seat. Highly recommended.  There is also a pool and fitness centre.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. I was delighted to read that we did not disappoint and that you enjoyed the room and breakfast. I hope that we will have the opportunity to host you the next time you are in Anaheim.  Best Regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: AWESOME.... I look at sanitation as #1 for my family, our room was very clean to say the least for the 2 night stay. The beds were very comfortable as we woke up refreshed and ready for the days activities. The hotel overall is kept up very nicely for the 4 years I have been visiting this property and hasn't skipped a beat! THANK YOU Ayers Hotel for making our stay another memorable one.... I would recommend this hotel to anyone as you also can't beat the $$$....  :)
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review and your loyalty over the past 4 years. I hope that we will host you for many years to come!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Elegant European style hotel in the heart of Anaheim
Summary: The Ayres is a secret little gem just minutes from Disneyland.  I consider myself well traveled, having visited more than 50 countries. The staff at the Ayres is knowledgeable and friendly.  The rooms are large and the beds are as comfortable as in any hotel I've ever stayed. The ART bus provides easy transportation to Disneyland at a very reasonable price and the ARTIC transportation center is directly across the street.  From that station you can get a train or bus to just about anywhere in Southern California, including the beach. My grown daughters stayed at the hotel with their families and none of us will stay anywhere else when visiting Disneyland.  They did just institute a $10 per day parking fee.  Last year it was free.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review and for your your family's loyalty. I particularly appreciate your noting the details on our fabulous new neighbour, the ARTIC transportation center. I look forward to hosting you here again.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I was here for the annual NAMM show, and had the most comfortable, easy-going, classy stay out of all my friends that chose to stay at other hotels. The breakfast is great, and the hotel concierge is very attentive. The room was super comfortable and was well tidied up and cleaned every time I came back from a long day on the tradeshow floor. My only negative has nothing to do with the hotel, but the fact that there is not much to do that is a walk away. There is another hotel across the street that has a nice bar, but that's about it.  I'm definitely going to stay here again and will be glad to recommend it to anyone, including families that want to head over to Disney, since it's super close.

I will start this review as I start all of my reviews. I stay at over 100 hotels annually and have stayed at well over 1,000 hotels in total. Everything from high end boutiques to mid range brands.I have a good feel for what a hotel should be.   You know those people that just can't edit themselves... this is one of those places. It's like they were trying too hard to impress you with fancy furniture and paintings. I've never seen a property that has had more artwork than this hotel. And not in a good way. Everywhere you look was a painting, or some sort of artwork. The kind of stuff that is meant to look fancy, but you can buy for $10. The same thing with the oversized and fancy "looking furniture." The problem with all that stuff... is it's hard to keep clean and inspection of
Manager Response: Dear Mr. Zito,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. I am very sorry that the stay did not meet your expectations. However, I am sure you will pleased to hear that we have recently renovated our guestrooms, taking on a whole new style and  one that I am confident will be more to your liking. Please do have a look at our website to see the new rooms. We are also going to be renovating the corridors and lobby soon so we should have a brand new hotel by the end of the year. I do also apologize for the mix up at the front desk. This should not have happened and your group was very unfortunate in this regard. We have made sure to train the staff involved to prevent a recurrence. I hope that you will consider visiting us again once the renovations are completed so we have the opportunity to show you how comfortable a stay with us can be.   Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Excellent stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim
Summary: This was a wonderful place to stay.  It was a great value for our money - especially since it included breakfast.  The room is larger than a normal hotel room and extremely clean.  I would stay at an Ayres Hotel again.  We had baseball tickets, and it was a short walk to the stadium, which was another plus for this great hotel!

My family and I stayed here in June and I found everything to be "o.k" I only booked this hotel because it's rated #1 on tripadvisor. There was no view but of the streets. The eggs are not good they taste like powdered scramble eggs but I guess that's what all the hotels that offer free breakfast are doing now. I found everything to be just o.k. However the lobby and hallways do look very nice. The rooms are average.
Manager Response: Dear Rebecca,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us. I am sorry that you were underwhelmed by your experience. Sometimes that #1 rating does raise expectations and I am sorry that we were not able to meet yours. We do not use powdered eggs but do have some guests who, for heart reasons, prefer that we do not add salt, so we offer peppers, salsa and cheese to season the eggs. The eggs are therefore not seasoned but there is no water added. I am very sorry, however, if they were not to your liking. As to the comments regarding the views, we do have a very pretty train station that is multi-coloured at night, and Disney fireworks visible too, but I can certainly understand your disappointment if you were hoping for a nice view. We appreciate your feedback and hope you will allow us the opportunity to welcome you again.   All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayres hotel for three nights with our three children. The room was very clean, updated and large. Breakfast was wonderful, filling and the chef cooked my 5 year old mickey mouse pancakes every morning. The staff was very accommodating and our room was cleaned beautifully every night when we came back to the hotel. My children said there was a magic cleaning fairy :). I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family! Thank you!

We stayed at the Ayres because it was right next to Angels Stadium and we would be able to walk to the game. We had a problem with the air conditioner in the room, it didn't work so the room was hot. Other than that the room and hotel was very nice, the breakfast was great, made fresh right in front of us.
Manager Response: Dear Timothy,  Thank you for choosing to stay with us and for taking the time to share your feedback with fellow travelers. I am glad that you found the room comfortable and the breakfast enjoyable. I am so sorry, however, that you had an uncomfortable night‚Äôs sleep. We are typically able to repair air conditioners or address the issue to the guest‚Äôs satisfaction very quickly if alerted to the problem, and I am so sorry that we were unable to do this for you. We hope you will still allow us the opportunity to welcome you again.   Best regards,  Marcus Collins  General Manager

Summary: The hotel was very pretty, we visited Disneyland and California Adventure Parks while we were in Anaheim and this location was perfect. The shuttles were really affordable and the times were frequent and convenient for travelling between the park and the hotel. The staff were helpful and polite, the room was large and clean.   Loved our stay, and would stay here again!

We stayed at Ayres when we took our daughter to Chapman. They have a great Chapman student discount. The room was very nice. After staying at the Travel Lodge in Long Beach it seemed like the Ritz. WE had a standard king room. It had a couch, desk, little sitting table, microwave, and a mini fridge. The hotel was very clean. They offered a free breakfast that was terrific! A real person cooking eggs, pancakes or French toast, sausages, or bacon. Plus cereals, yogurt muffins ,donuts .It was really a great way to start the day. There was also a free happy hour in the evening with wine, beer, and chips. It was close to the college.  The staff was super nice. We will definitely be staying there again.

We were going to an event at The Honda Center. This hotel is directly across the street. Super Convenient! Breakfast was fresh and pleasant. A great restaurant next door for lunch and dinner. Great night sleep on an extremely comfortable bed. The only negative-very limited parking. One car per room!

Even when the hotel is full, (which it was for the Women of Faith Conference) the service, kindness and helpfulness of all the employees is wonderful.  The breakfast (which is included) was amazing as always.  I highly recommend this place to stay anytime.

My husband and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim twice within two months.  The biggest draw for us was the #1 rating on TripAdvisor and the discount for Disneyland Annual Passholders.    For our first stay was in July and we had a very nice king room.  Though the decor was a little dated, the hotel had nice amenities.  It was very clean and we enjoyed our 1 night stay.  The free breakfast is a major plus!  There was a sign in the lobby stating that they were currently undergoing renovations to several areas of the hotel, including guest rooms.  I mention this because our next stay was already booked, so I looked forward to seeing updates when we arrived for our second stay.  I left feeling that I'd really gotten great value for my money.    Fast forward to our next stay.  The

We booked this hotel for an overnight stay after spending a day at Disneyland based on tripadvisor reviews. I can honestly say that the room we stayed at was recently renovated, clean and the beds and pillows very comfortable. There was a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Bathroom was very clean. Parking was $10.00 per day. The ART shuttle stops in front of the resort entrance. Honda Center next door and another stadium close by makes this hotel a perfect choice after attending a game or concerts as well. Wifi was free.  Free breakfast was really good with freshly prepared cut fruits, whole bananas, bagels, doughnuts, mini muffins and a hot selections of cooked cube potatoes, scrambled eggs, sausage and pancakes freshly prepared while you wait to be served one guest at a

We did the run Disney and although it is a mile or more from Disneyland it was nice and quiet. Breakfast included and it can get overcrowded there sometimes is the only negative. Good customer service. Can recommend

Summary Heading: Friendly, clean, roomy and the best cookies!
Summary: We stayed here for a couple of days in summer and it was fantastic. The staff were very helpful and kind especially the chef in the kitchen. The breakfast was included and had a large selection. The hot food was really tasty. The rooms were spacious and clean. They even had cookies and wine in the afternoon in the lobby which were delicious. The only downside was the location. It was good if you had a car but not much to walk to.

I stayed at the Ayres for five nights at the start of Sept. It was our first on a California Rd trip. The hotel was nice, clean and had friendly staff. I selected an upgrade to two room suite. It was big and the beds super comfy. There was a funky smell in the room when the aircon was off. The hotel is located right off the freeway, next to Angel Stadium & across from the Honda center.   While it is not walking distance to Disney there is access to the local shuttle for $5 per day, this goes to Disney and surrounds.  We had our own car so found it a great base for exploring SoCal. The daily breakfast is good with great service.

We stayed here for one night ...after staying in the Grand Californian at Disney..and it didn't disappoint. Large rooms , with everything you needed..fridge, microwave, safe, shampoo (no conditioner) and coffee and tea (although the coffee is a bit weak ..so don't put too much water in!).  The safe in the room didn't work..but they sorted it out straight away after i mentioned it at check out. Staff were friendly and the breakfast had loads of choice..from hot food and pancakes to fruit and toast. I would definitely recommend as a base to explore from.

We booked this hotel purely based upon other Trip Advisor reviews for our 4-day stay in Anaheim.  Our check-in was quick and the front desk staff were very friendly.  Our room was very comfortable and large enough for our needs. Bed and pillows very comfortable and we slept well.  We purchased 2x3-day shuttle pass from the front desk for $24 and found this to be a great mode of transport to and from Disneyland.  Don't be put off that this hotel is a little further away from Disneyland than others as the shuttle is so easy and only takes 10-minutes and it stops right outside the hotel door. Complimentary breakfast was very good and there is a good variety of cooked and continental breakfast available. There is a JT Schmidt restaurant across the road and you can get 10% discount

Quiet with friendly and helpful staff.  Enjoyed cooked breakfast each morning and free wifi during our stay.  Used $5 return daily bus to Disney each day for the two of us as $15 parking at the park and no hassle finding a park and walking. .. which is something you do all day at Disneyland or California adventure. Lovely soft bed and pillows.  Restaurant next door has nice food with generous portions at fair pricing. Nice to enjoy a beer and nor worry about driving home afterwards.  Pool was warm and easy to get into in September.  Plan on returning to ayres again soon.

We had a pleasant and comfortable stay at this hotel.  The Reception staff were very efficient and helpful.  The shuttle to Disneyland was excellent.  The one thing we did not like was the breakfast.  Would have liked to have seen individual pots of yoghurt, instead you had to help yourself from a large bowl of yoghurt by using a ladle (Yuk!). Same for the cereal - why don't they just offer individual small packets, instead of help yourself to a serving from a large container.

We loved this place.  Rooms; stunning,  bed; luxurious,  staff; beyond helpful. Easy getting to Disneyland with the art on the front door.  Breakfast basic but fresh with all the accompaniments you'd expect.  It was my partners birthday and they arranged a lovely hamper free of charge.  Didn't use the gym,  but it looked well equipped.  The perfect place for a couple to stay after big days at Disneyland and shopping.

This hotel is good value. Staff is friendly and Rooms are spacious and clean, beds are good overall, we had a lovely stay at this hotel. Secure parking $5 shuttle to Disney. Breakfast is average, however 2 mornings in a row between 830 and 900 with only 1 cook it got pretty hectic with at least 25 lined up to get pancakes or something hot, i found this annoying. My opinion is that something should be done re this.

Summary Heading: Location was excellent for commuting all over the OC.
Summary: Clean, conveniently located and average breakfast included.  Rooms are spacious, beds are perfect and AC worked well.  Being ever cost conscious, this hotel was a good value for the area.  Abundant amenities and secure parking included made the experience will worth the price. Internet Wifi connection was overwhelmed during peak usage times. Not uncommon for any hotel, but something that could be improved on.

Booked through Booking.com and the hotel didn't have my reservation. They did eventually find it. I had booked for three people in a two queen room and they had down four people in a 1 king room (how was that going to work?!). Anyhow, they happily fixed everything to be as it should be. We were visiting Chapman and they did inform me that they had a reduced rate for visitors but that is was too late. It's a great rate so if you're visiting the university book directly with the hotel. Rooms were spacious, beds were comfortable, breakfast was decent as was the pool. Disney shuttle is convenient if you want that and you can also walk to the Honda Center and Angels Stadium.

Lovely modern hotel where the staff are welcoming and made you feel special.  We stayed in one of those rooms where the first thing you want to do is take a photograph.  They had left us an aniversary card and gift which was lovely.  Breakfast was fresh and plentiful. It was a good base for us to explore LA andthe beaches of Orange County.   I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel.

This is a beautiful hotel, close to everything, very comfortable. The only downside is their Wi-Fi. It's not just slow - at certain times of day (morning and evening, when everyone is trying to use it) the Wi-Fi just stops. It is completely useless. We're using up our cell data to connect at all. I love this hotel, but that's a deal breaker for me.
Manager Response: Dear Spurfy,  Thank you for taking the time to highlight this issue of internet speed. The wifi was actually recently upgraded (about a year ago) using top of the line hardware and we have also expanded our bandwidth to 100mb. The challenge is that it is secure, so that every time you leave the hotel, you need to log back in to the system. A device may show as connected to ayres but when the device leaves the hotel and then comes back, our security requires another login using the code. This is the main reason that our guests feel the system is not working. The system shows that it is connected to ayres, but they have not logged in so they are actually using data and not the wifi. We have double checked the system and it is working as it should. This was actually just brought to my attention so we have also spoken to our guest service agents to make sure they are able to address the issue head on. Once logged in the system does require another login after 24 hours, so this may also create a loss of connection. I hope this addresses your concerns. If it doesn't then maybe we can talk and look at whether there is another issue involved. Either way, I am confident that we have a very strong wifi system and hope that you will return to reap the benefits of it on your return. Thank you for your kind comments regarding the hotel and I look forward to hosting you again.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary Heading: The place to stay for Honda Center or Angels stadium
Summary: We booked a room here as we were going to a concert.  It is a shorter walk to the stadium than some of the parking lots.  We enjoyed the room and the bed was great.  The breakfast in the AM was included and was OK.  We will stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Perfect to see the Angels/Mighty Ducks
Summary: Excellent location for both the Honda Center and Angles stadium. Rooms are nice and clean with an affordable nightly price. The hotel provides a hearty breakfast with a Chef cooking and dishing up scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, and Pancakes. Parking is controlled by gates and you will need your room card to enter/exit after you check in. Just a heads up, the picture at the gate shows the stripe on your room card/key side going into the slot on the left, when in reality, it's on the right of the card/key. I hope they fix that. It can be a bit of a pain on your first night trying to get in or out. All in all, I can't wait to come back again next season for more Angels baseball.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim for four nights.  Location is perfect, just off the I5 and only a few minutes from Disneyland.  Our room was lovely, with comfy beds and all the amenities you'd expect.  Our girls loved breakfast with pancakes cooked to order each morning by Jose - great guy!  Plenty of parking, nice sized pool and spa and easy access to main routes make the Ayres a great choice.

Summary Heading: Walking distance to stadium or arena.
Summary: The rooms are spacious and contemporary at the Ayres chain. They are all equipped with a refrigerator, and each room has plenty of square footage. The walk to the Honda Center is literally across the street, while the Angels Stadium is just over a half mile away.   Parking at the hotel is a measly $10, which is considerably less than the aforementioned venues would charge you for the privilege.

Summary Heading: Great location to Honda Center & Angels Stadium
Summary: Entire hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating.  Better breakfast fare than your typical free breakfast.  Free snacks and drinks offered Monday-Thursday early evenings. Clean and newly redecorated rooms. Walking distance to Honda Center and Angels Stadium.  Inexpensive shuttle available to Disneyland.  Walking distance to several restaurants in the area.

Summary Heading: Worked better than perfectly for us-we'll be back
Summary: Short Review: Very clean room. Still had the odor of fresh paint from being renovated (not a bad thing.) Sofa bed was comfortable as was the king bed. The blanket for the sofa bed was dirty like someone stepped on it. Bath tub was wide, a very nice surprise. No hair dryer! (Maybe they forgot to put one in after renovating?) Tons of accessible electrical receptacles & USB to charge gadgets. Excellent wi-fi. Super excellent breakfast. Charged extra for parking (per day) but just about every hotel close to Disney does that.   More Details:  Breakfast was included and they cook your eggs to order. They also cook pancakes if your order them, so they are fresh and hot. All the hot food (bacon, sausage, potatoes) is dished out by the egg chef, which keeps other guests from touching

Summary Heading: Best Hotel near Honda Center and Angel Stadium
Summary: Had tickets to see Shania Twain and wanted a hotel near Honda Center.  Due to past experiences in the area I really wasn't expecting much. I am so glad we picked Ayres!  Talk about convenient, the Honda Center is a short walk across Katella and Angel Stadium is behind the hotel about 2-3 blocks, still in walking distance.   Staff were very friendly, polite and professional. Even though they are doing remodeling the hotel was quiet and clean. Room was large and comfortable.   We didn't go to the free breakfast but it sure smelled good. Will definitely make time on our next visit.   This was our first visit but won't be our last. Ayres became my go to hotel when visiting the OC for events at the Honda Center or Angel Stadium.

This is a great value hotel that is very close to Disneyland. The room was very comfortable with plenty of plugs and usb charges! (Which I always REALLY appreciate). The hotel breakfast was nice with plenty of options and really nice staff. I would definitely stay in this hotel again!

I love the Ayres chain of hotels and the Ayres Hotel Anaheim was no exception. The accomodations were excellent and clean. Nice decor and the location was convenient and close to Disneyland. I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Perfect for an Angels game or Honda Center event.....
Summary: I was in town with family and needed a place to stay near the BIg A. I can only echo previous reviewers and how perfect this worked out for us. Aside from the traffic on the 5, it was all we expected & more. Great location, really nice big rooms, friendly staff and , by far, the best free breakfast of any hotel in the USA. I was amazed. My sons and I made the easy walk to the stadium for the game and enjoyed a cool breeze on the way back. Its a shame that the Ayres chain is only in California. They would do well anywhere. Perhaps someday they'll work their way east. In the meantime, my review says 'you should stay here!'  Great location, rate, room, breakfast, and btw, I left our rental car in the hotel parking lot and saved the parking fee at the Big A.  Does life get any

I booked through Expedia.  I called hotel and asked for a couple special things for the room and location of the room. They were helpful and friendly.  The room was large. Very clean. Clean is my number one requirement. They have "happy hour" from 2-5 I think.  They serve chips, salsa, cookies, wine and beer. They also have free hot breakfast. Great coffee.  We will stay here again.

Really nice, comfortable hotel with a shuttle bus every half hour or so to Disneyland that takes about 15 mins and costs $5 return, drops you right at the park entrance. Large bedrooms, good choice at breakfast and complimentary wine, beer, soda, nibbles and cookies between 5-7pm. There is also a guest laundry $2 per wash or dry cycle. Only downside is that we arrived at 9pm on a Monday night after a long journey and there was nowhere open to eat locally (there is no restaurant in the hotel). After driving around for a while we found a McDs that was open.

We stayed at this hotel for a business trip. It was an awesome experience. I stayed in a king size room with my wife and son. The room was very spacious which was very nice with a small child. The pool was very nice and well kept. The staff was very courteous. I would recommend this Hotel highly.

The main purpose of this overnight stay was to go to the Los Angeles Angels baseball game.  I had no idea of what to expect as I booked this hotel on the hotel website trusting that the reviews on Tripadvisor were accurate.  We were not disappointed!  I would certainly return to this hotel for a baseball game or hockey game.  Only a 10 minute easy walk to both stadiums.  The staff were very welcoming and the rooms were clean and comfortable.  Beds were comfy.  Could see the baseball stadium from our room.  :)  Easy access to the main highway for continuing on with your travels.  A very important point is the free breakfast here was GREAT!  We have stayed in many hotels that included breakfast and tend to just grab a banana on the way out due to the rest of the selection...but

great room and location  great breakfast   good restaurants within walking distance  easy access to major highways  close proximity to Honda center and Anaheim angels stadium  very nice comfy rooms comfortable beds

What always draws us back to the Ayres every time we visit OC are the people working there.  They have the same friendly staff working there every time we visit.  Even the same friendly cook making breakfast each day.  You'd be hard pressed to find another hotel like the Ayres that also has the same staff working there year after year.    The hotel is under first-class management.  They really know how to treat their guests well.

This is a very comfortable hotel to stay. The front counter workers were friendly as has been the service staff. Our room was very large (2 doubles) and came with a half mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker, small round dining table, large desk, iron and board, and a safe. The room is slightly dated but new enough where you won't feel the difference. The bathroom comes with plentiful towels and toiletries. The room felt clean and well maintained.  The breakfast buffet includes pastries, fresh cut fruit, strawberry yogurt, cereal, breads, and milk and juices. The hot section has scrambled and boiled eggs, potatoes, sausages, and pancakes. The chef serves the hot section so it's a little time consuming.  There is free WiFi throughout with great speed. Parking is gated but that's

very nice hotel clean very friendly and helpful staff breakfest was good great location would stay there again bed was very comfotable would recomend to anyone also liked that they had a shuttle that fan to disneyland for a small fee

I know to expect crowds and noise at Disney but I didn't want to deal with it at the hotel. All other hotels have major parking issues. We have a giant SUV and plenty of parking was available.  The hotel was relaxing. Very luxurious room and the free breakfast was like a mini-Denny's. Best yet on our cross country travels. No noise from elevators, guests or ice machine heard! Cons:  It is 2 miles from Disney but there's transportation. (See other reviewers about that) We were on the ground floor so traffic could be heard in the morning, but keep the AC fan on and it is drowned out.

Coming to this hotel from the Encore in Vegas I was prepared to be disappointed. Boy was I wrong, this hotel had everything that was missing from the Encore. Free refrigerator use, icemaker right outside the door, easy parking, microwave, free HBO and Cinemax, laundry room, Best Buy and other stores very close to hotel. You never realize how much Vegas nickle and dimes you until you leave. I was actually sad to leave this place.  If i could do it over I would've stayed here for another night. The only slight problem was that breakfast wasn't good to us.  I didn't use the wifi much but it worked fine when i did. If you're staying anywhere in Anaheim or close choose this place.

The hotel staff took note of all my requests and fulfilled them without me having to ask twice. So nice! The ART shuttle picks up right at the hotel's front door making transportation to and from Disneyland a cinch. The freshly prepared breakfast (including Mickey Mouse pancakes) was yummy and served with a smile by Chef Jose.  The room was very large and the bed was super comfy, especially the big fluffy down feather pillows I requested. All of the bed linens and towels were sparkling white and impeccably clean. I can't wait to visit again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel! I would go back!
Summary: This hotel was much nicer than I thought it would be. The common areas, halls, pool area and rooms were extremely clean. A full, hot, served breakfast in the morning was a great addition to the stay. I am giving this 4 start beacuse our room smelled like they were trying to cover up the smell of cigarette smoke (even though its a smoking-free hotel).  We got used to it after a few minutes, but every time we re-entered the room it stunk. Also, the pool area was nice, but it's surrounded by the parking lot, so I didn't feel much privacy when swimming and laying out. Other than that, it was a really nice hotel.

The air conditioning in the room  (310) we had, could not be controlled or shut off.  Several reports  to the management did not correct the issue.  The security gate cards needed to enter and leave the hotel had to be replaced each day when the previous card would not work.  All in all this hotel was a miserable experience.

We were on a family trip through California and debated where to stay because we wanted to be together and stay in the same place. I look at other reservations sites until a friend recommended the Ayres Hotel. If you are going to a baseball game, this is the place to stay, you are within walking distance of the LA Angeles stadium. The staff is super friendly! The breakfast staff are also very nice and accomodating. I loved their decor and the rooms were so comfortable. We will definitely return to this hotel and search for other properties elsewhere.

Still enjoy staying here better than any other hotel in the area. However I dont understand why they changed the old world decor the rooms used to have. The new decor feels almost "clinical", "Ikeash". The rooms now look nothing like the way they used to set Ayres apart from the run of the mill, all look the same plastic and vinyl hotels. Used to feel like yu were in Paris or Italy and if you opened the curtains you coudl see the Eiffel tower or the Italian countryside. Terrible management decision to remodel. The staff is always friendly and they also agree the liked the old style.

Booked a room here last minute in order to attended a company meeting. The staff here was absolutely friendly and helpful. Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff were outstanding.  My room was very large, super clean and very comfortable. This location offers free breakfast each morning, unfortunately I wasn't able to take advantage of it due to time. There's no doubt I will be staying here again. Walking distance to Angel stadium and directly across the street from the Honda Center.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for two quick nights in mid-July and loved it! It's close enough to Disneyland, but not close enough to walk (of course), but perfect for being out of the fray. Highlights include the social hour each night at the hotel, the delicious breakfast and the comfy beds. You can tell the hotel has been recently renovated and it shows. I admit we really only used the hotel for a quick sleep between Disney days, but it was more than enough for our needs. Would consider staying here again.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel for an Angels baseball overnighter!
Summary: The Ayers Hotel Anaheim is located on the entrance road to Angel Stadium parking!  It doesn't get better than that.  But wait, it does!  This marvelous small hotel has excellent staff and marvelous amenities, including a great restaurant with a free cooked to order breakfast. Since we found this special place about 10 years ago we have been back several times to enjoy Angels baseball, and win or lose the hotel makes it a worthwhile visit everytime.

Summary Heading: I can't wait to stay here again!
Summary: I was very cautious about staying here.  It was far from Disneyland and being right across from the Pond, I was skeptical.  I am SO GLAD I stayed here!  The rooms are HUGE, the bed was the most comfortable bed I've slept on at a hotel.  The bed linens were comfortable, but the pillows were way too soft for my taste.   I love the fact that there was a ceiling fan in the room and a wet bar.  There was plenty of space to spread out. Outlets were not plentiful. Our room was on the first floor, and was still SO QUIET!!  The breakfast buffet was great! The staff was making eggs-REAL EGGS- and pancakes constantly so everyone was getting fresh food without having to wait.  There was also staff cleaning up and restocking very quickly.  ART literally stops right outside the lobby door and

We loved the location of this hotel. We went to Disneyland and wanted to be close but not so close that we were near all the crowds. Excellent customer service and very clean rooms. Breakfast was perfect! We also loved that they had laundry facilities for guests to use.

This was our 5th stay at this hotel. We arrived around 11:30 AM and was able to check into our room. We were given one of the remodeled rooms and it's GORGEOUS! The rooms look more modern. We also noticed they were in the middle of remodeling some rooms on the first floor. Even though they are in the process of remodeling, we heard NO noise whatsoever. We stayed here for a week and felt so relaxed. The bed is EXTREMELY comfy, breakfast is AMAZING, water pressure in the shower was perfect. The mini fridge and microwave really came in handy. The downtown Disney district and Disneyland is only a 5-10 min drive away. The chef who makes the breakfasts is super friendly and always has a smile on his face. Even though we have been to this hotel many times, the front desk staff still

We stayed recently for an Angels game and had a lovely stay! The stadium is about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is clean and the rooms are a great size. There were warm chocolate chip cookies when we checked in which was a nice touch! Complimentary breakfast was very good. Lots to choose from and Jose the Chef was so warm and friendly! I would recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay here again!

Summary Heading: Its got The good, The bad, and The better.
Summary: 1st. The Bad  Location: Is not convenient for Disneyland California Adventure Park, but there is a Anaheim resorts transport Shuttle and its convenient almost better than driving and paying for parking. It drops you off right at the main entrance.   The hotel is close to the California Angels Baseball field, across the street, and close to free way access, walking distances to one restaurant   Ambiance: Its nice classic boutique , no bar, small pool, small exercise room.   They offer a social hour 'aka' managers special witch should include a verity of cocktails but beware this hotel only served beer cans on ice and warm house wine. Its by far the least appealing cocktail hour in the industry   The Breakfast is not full service. There is no cooked to order eggs and  they offer

Excellent hotel, clean, nice decor, comfy beds and friendly, helpful staff. Complimentary breakfast with freshly prepared choices with friendly chef. Quality was more than expected for the price. Would definitely come again!  And, right across the street from Honda Center for our Imagine Dragons concert.   Town car was sent out to airport to pick us up. So convenient!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, very convenient location!
Summary: Attended an event at the Honda Center, couldn't be more convenient, also convenient to the mass transit center, loved the European decor and feel, adequate breakfast and attentive staff.  Would allow us to leave our luggage behind the front desk for the day,  after we checked out so we could attend the event and then pick up after. That little service was much appreciated...

I have wanted to visit the US for years and years, The Ayres Hotel made my trip special and better than I'd ever imagined. All the staff were so helpful and kind. My room was spacious and had a very comfy bed. The breakfast was delicious, I give gratitude to the chefs for always having a smile on their face from early hours in the morning. Another fantastic thing about The Ayres Hotel is that the staff had great knowledge about the surrounding attractions including the cinema down the road, directions of how to get to Walmart and Target etc. And finally, as I just had to visit Disneyland, there was a bus service that went from the doors of the hotel, straight to the doors of Disneyland, it was so easy!

Summary Heading: Clean, good breakfast, easy and smooth check-in/check-out
Summary: I loved this hotel. They had everything we needed, very clean, and the best beds ever. Easy access to Disney land. Did I mention the beds? This was a really nice experience to not have a complaint for once. The Ayres Hotel met and exceeded our expectations.

Summary Heading: Very nice looking boutique hotel for not a ton of money.
Summary: When you walk inside the d√©cor is pretty impressive.  I didn't go to Disney but I understand there is a shuttle as well.  Being as close as it was to Disney I was amazed that it was a lot quieter than the hotel I stayed in San Diego. The breakfast was great and the person we had making French toast/omelets and what not was very customer friendly. He made everybody feel welcome and was always smiling. I was only here a night but I would come back.

This hotel is located very close to Angel stadium, the metro station, a nice bike path and  just a few minutes drive to several good restaurants.  The hotel itself is very nice, great staff,  and extra nice breakfast.

First time we stayed here. Five of us - family and friends, 3 rooms. From making the reservation on the phone to the time we checked out, I had nothing but friendly, helpful experiences. I called a number of times with questions about details of our stay. I spoke with Andrew who was friendly, knowledgeable and willing to go the extra distance. All of us loved our beds (age range 25-65) and thought they were among the most comfortable that we have experienced. Breakfast was also a treat - delicious and something for everyone, even those on special diets. The rooms are really CLEAN and the maids are unobtrusive, respectful and VERY good. All of the front desk staff was helpful and friendly and handled all of our requests quickly. We were there for events at the Honda Center (right

Summary Heading: Great value for an excellent hotel, awesome beds!
Summary: Doing the typical family Disneyland trip we found this accommodation to be fantastic. Handy distance to also take in a baseball game, this hotel was very very comfortable and I cannot fault the service. Clean and surprisingly luxurious whilst also good value.

very convenient to Disneyland, John Wayne airport, downtown Orange and other local attractions.  Easy highway access and  shuttle to Disneyland stops at the front door.  Staff very accommodating and friendly.  Nice breakfast.  Honda Center across the street and Angel's stadium in walking distance.  Dining option - the brewery/restaurant across the street is pretty good.

My sister and I stayed here during our trip to Disneyland.  We chose this hotel because I had once stayed here  two years ago and I had loved, loved, loved it.  Friendly staff, good breakfast, super nice room.  Fast forward to today: My sister and I stayed in one of their upgraded, "Deluxe 2 Queens" rooms.  The room was clean and, for the most part, quiet. I found a curly black hair in one of the towels, but didn't mention it to housekeeping...because I figure these things just happen sometimes.  I also found the updated decor ugly and awkward, with a bizarre half-wall separating the beds and the TV stuck in the dead center, right in front of the half-wall.  Again: really bizarre.  My main issues, however, are with the front desk staff and the tasteless breakfast.  Front Desk:

We stayed one week in May and had a nice time...the free buffet breakfast was good...the rooms were clean...no noise, very close to the stadium. Very good outlet shopping right across the street. Close to freeway.

This hotel had really good reviews and the close proximity to Disneyland is what drew me in. We just needed a hotel for one night, but would have stayed longer if we were in the area. The room was VERY nice! The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was nice (although I didn't enjoy it). The free wifi stunk, which was frustrating, but that being one of my biggest complaints-then it's not horrible.   I would definitely stay here again!

stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, Caught the red eye and arrived at the hotel at 630 am dropped off our bags as check in was 'nt until the afternoon. Asked them were was the closest place to eat and they said we could eat at the buffet . The breakfast buffet was great, every thing you could want ,pancakes and french toast cooked to order and the best part was its free. Did I say it was free . Bought some ART tickets from the front desk and the ART stops right at the front door of this hotel. we were off to disneyland by 7:45.  Check in was fast, and the family suite was large. the room smelled like it was freshly painted. They have chargers built in to the lamps which was great for the phones and ipods. Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. Pool was nice after a day at

First time staying at a non-Disneyland hotel to visit the parks. I'm absolutely convinced and will be returning to the Ayres Anaheim for future trips.  A+ Pros: comp breakfast buffet          staff attention          room: space, cleanliness          Ayres Dream sleep bed! and pillows          5:30 pm Social Hour - snacks :)          location and access to ART          ambience and quiet!

This hotel is right off the freeway so expect busy roads and traffic. Check-in  and checkout was easy and Jason at the front desk was pleasant. The hotel was clean, well decorated, and the room sizes are generous. We couldn't get our a/c to operate well. It's pretty loud and it was freezing, after the first night we requested extra blankets. We found that setting out to the highest temperature (80s) made the room comfortable, the room was still cool, so I think that was a problem with the thermostat and of course it was still loud. There was also an odor upon entering our room, but I guess we adjusted and once the room cooled down it was unnoticeable.  Overall, I felt it was a good value. Our family would visit Ayres again at the right price.

This hotel has high quality staff and service. The breakfast is not your standard continental breakfast it was amazing. They even had options for my son who is gluten free that were hot which is difficult to find often when we stay at hotels. The rooms are very clean and well kept. The beds are amazingly comfortable. Great place to stay!

Our stay was really good, the breakfast is complete, the location was perfect for our Dinseyland vacations. The shuttle service (ART) was very convinient and the rooms were clean and confortable. I definitely recommend this hotel.

We found this place on yelp and if you checked in with yelp the room was only $99 a night with an amazing breakfast. Pancakes, eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, OJ the works. We loved this hotel!  Every year when we went to an angels game this is where we were! Then one day it changed, we checked in late & they gave us the very last room. When I went to take a shower the water was backing up, I called them to fix it and they told me it was fine. When I told him it wasn't fine he got a plunger for the toilet to work on the shower. Gross!!! Finally he realized there was something wrong and told me there was nothing he could do. I told him I wanted another room I needed a shower. He told me they didn't have any rooms available and I would just have to deal with it.  Are you kidding
Manager Response: Dear Kimberlie,  Thank you for your review. I am so sorry that you received such awful service at the desk. Please be assured that we are addressing this with the parties concerned in order to eradicate a repeat of your experience.  I hope that you will stay with us again as I am confident that your next visit will not be met by a similar experience.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: We travel a lot and stay at many types of hotels. We chose this hotel because it was near the Angels Stadium (a five minute walk). We normally do not write reviews, but I must in this case.  The staff: From the start, it was what made the stay! I needed to call down before our arrival and ask some questions. The gentleman on the phone (Andrew?) was upbeat in answering my questions about shuttle and their construction. When he found out I was arriving the next morning, He noted it and put me in a new room on the 4th floor so we can see the fireworks. I did not even ask for this to happen. On our early arrival, I checked in to the front desk and asked if they could text me when our room was ready. They stored our stuff and we wondered around town. Our desk guy personally called me

This hotel was booked at the last minute on booking.com!!!!  It turned out to be one of the cleanest, friendliest and most affordable hotels of our 10 day family vacation to California!!!!  Conveniently located in relation to disney land.... One word FANTASTIC!!!!  The room was spacious and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, the location was ideal; close to grocery stores, restaurants and much more!!!!

First stay and an Ayers property.  Great place.  Friendly staff, beautiful decor, good breakfast.   Under some construction right now, but no noise or activity at night, so no issues at all.  Saw some guys with some furniture, that was all.  No real construcition apparant.  Will definately be back!

We stayed here for first time, and were impressed with courteous service and it was actually very quiet! For being right next to the highway, I wasn't looking forward to hearing LA traffic all night, but I could barely hear it! Not bothersome at all.   Easy to get to. Front desk check in efficient and very friendly. Only drawback was the pool wasn't inviting - right in the middle of the parking lot - so never used it.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disneyland trip!
Summary: My family and I reserved a room with two queen beds.  The room was very clean and the room had a modern decorating style to it.  We didn't spend much time in the room during the day, as we did the sun up to sun down Disneyland Park fun-time crucible, but there were plenty of cable channels to watch on TV in the evening, free WiFi, and a heated pool and hot tub that my daughter and niece enjoyed playing in.  Also, there's a great restaurant just across the street from the hotel (we ordered the 12 inch, 6 pound burger because, hey, why not?) that is within easy walking distance and offers room service. There was some remodeling work being done at the hotel, but we didn't notice much of it because they did the work from 8 am to 5 pm and we were at Disneyland.  The staff was very

Everything would've been good until they messed up on my check out transaction. Firstly, when I checked in they told me since I was paying in cash that I will not be charged on my debit card. They said they only needed my debit card for information and a card holder was required. BUT they said nothing will be charged at all. The next day, I told the worker that I'll be paying 10$ on the card and $138 with cash. She said not a problem and went on with the transaction, folded up my receipt and handed it to me. I had left the hotel and later discovered on my bank statement that I owe hundreds. Not only did they charge me $148 for the hotel from the check in night, they also charged me $138 from the check out. I called the hotel and the worker said she noticed she messed up my

Summary Heading: terrible customer service - no bell service
Summary: i arrived and asked for bell service - was told the woman behind the counter would be able to help me but she had to wait for a cart as there are only 2 in the hotel. after a cart was returned - the woman behind the desk did not help me and i had to haul in 3 loads from my car by myself.   the morning breakfast was also terrible. with a line of about 15 people - there was one woman working by herself and serving. the food was mediocre.   i would recommend to anyone to spend the extra $20 and stay at an Embassy Suites.
Manager Response: I was very concerned to hear of your experience at the hotel and the distress that it caused. We are a select service hotel and the hotel is staffed accordingly, so our guests do typically bring their carts to the room themselves. We do try, however, to make every effort to assist with guests needs and I do apologize if we were unable to do so in this case.  I wish that we had had the flexibility on that day to provide the further assistance that was needed. I am ordering new carts, and will also be keeping the existing carts for those particularly busy days to hopefully avoid any future inconvenience to guests.   I am very sorry that you also found our breakfast to be below expectations. It can certainly get busy and the line can build up. We are currently looking at a couple of options regarding the layout of the breakfast room to help alleviate this issue. A new layout would give us the freedom to change the menu also. While I cannot guarantee short lines, I have identified why our staff member was working alone when the line was long and the issue will be resolved.  Please accept my apologies for your frustrating stay. I hope that we will be able to host you here at a future date and provide you with a much better experience.  Best Regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Hotel in good location and rooms clean and comfy, checking in and checkout could be better, very little and sometimes incorrect  info offered to questions. Also room not serviced on second day  even though we were out until 3.15. Breakfast very hectic and busy as expected with hotel near Disney.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay but limited food options
Summary: Ayers was a good hotel to stay. It proved very convenient as we could manage Disney / Universal and LA tours staying at one place. It was very clean and laundry facility was very useful.   My only discomfort with the hotel was the restaurant. Only dinner was available and that too same menu. As we stayed there for 8 nights we really got bored. Plus the restaurant does not serve dinners so you are dependent on outside options.

We came here because of the good reviews, and it was definitely worth it.  Be aware that there is a fee for the shuttle ($5 a person for unlimited rides back and forth all day). We ended up taking Uber back and forth to Disneyland.  The room was huge, extremely clean, the pool was quiet and had a hot tub, and the breakfast was amazing. The eggs were incredible and the pancakes were great. There were other things like hashbrowns, cereal, fruits, coffee, etc.  They make the hot stuff for you fresh in front of you.  The hotel staff were very friendly.  The hotel also had a social hour where there is free alcohol, snacks, and hot cookies. It was bud light and regular bud, then some wine that wasn't great, but ... free alcohol...   Overall a great stay, and the hotel was also right

We stayed here two nights while visiting the two Disney parks in Anaheim. The hotel was great, staff very helpful and friendly, breakfast included which was great. The room was very nice and clean. For $5 each per day you can get a shuttle bus ticket from the front desk and this allows unlimited travel for the whole day, the buses run every 20 min and take you from right outside the hotel to Disneyland, there are also stops along the way where there are plenty of restaurants, a very good deal.

The hotel is very clean and have great breakfast. Frontdesk service staff are great. Comfortable beds. Really enjoyable. The hotel is not very near to disneyland would need transport to the disneyland. Would like to stay in this hotel again in future.

Met our kids and grandchildren.  Two families stayed here.  I could not go to Disneyland so stayed at the hotel for two days.  It was comfortable and relaxing.  Breakfast was very good.  Service was excellent.Will think of this S. Cal. chain on next visit to the area.

The hotel allowed us to check in early at 1:30pm instead of the usual 3 pm.  I had requested a high floor room with views of the Disney fireworks and that's exactly what I got.  The room is spacious, the beds are comfortable and the breakfast was good.  We got a discount for being Disney Annual Pass holders which is a plus.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: A Great and Convenient place to Stay.
Summary: My family and I (parents and 3 boys aged 24, 21 & 16) recently traveled to the US.  Our first stop was California where we stayed at the Ayres Hotel, 2550 E. Katella Ave, in Anaheim 92806 for 7 nights.  This hotel has a pool and relax area, gym, parking on site for a small fee and is close to main attractions shopping centers and Theme parks.  The rooms are gracious in space and very well kept.  The beds are also very comfortable and believe me that helps a lot after a tiring day.  In our stay breakfast was included and you also have complimentary Internet Access.  Up to this point, my review of the hotel was very good but it doesn't stop there.  The service we received was nothing short of excellent.  Any assistance required was death with utmost precision and professionalism.

I have been staying at this Ayres property for 12 years now.  This time I was fortunate enough to stay in one of the newly renovated rooms.  While it was nice to have new furniture, carpet, etc.  I was sad to see the charm and ambiance of the original property tag line of a "European Boutique" to be lost.  The new decor was now just like any other post modern designed property from Hilton, Hyatt, Marriott, etc.  While nice, did not give me that special feeling like I was someplace unique.  I missed having the ceiling fan in the room, however I did like that all the lamps in the room had a USB plug to charge the many devices we carry around, that was very nice.  The people and location still make this one of the best in Anaheim, I will definitely return as I have in the past!

My husband and I came here for a baby moon and we absolutely loved the newly renovated clean feeling this hotel has. It's close to the freeways and close enough to Disney. There was a complimentary breakfast that was just okay but they had fresh cookies in the lobby which I found to be inviting. We also walked to the 24 hour fitness one night when we felt like getting a workout. Really enjoyed our stay here. Plenty of parking and easy access.

Summary Heading: Always a great place to stay!
Summary: Clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast, and far enough away from the Disneyland traffic, makes this hotel a great place to stay.  Right across the street from the Honda Center makes the location convenient to everything.

Stayed over for business at this property for a few nights recently, and although I've stayed at many business-oriented hotels I still have a certain level of expectation.  This property worked quite well. Clean, convenient and reasonably priced.  Didn't participate in their Happy Hour, but it didn't look too great. Very basic. However, the breakfast (included) was quite good (for what it's supposed to be). Coffee is mediocre. Again, no surprises.

The hotel was clean and spacious,  very good location for the park, it did everthing very well and the breakfast was included.   Staff were polite and we had no issues, the shuttle bus was easy to use to the park  Well done for a good stay

This was our second stay at the Ayres Anaheim hotel so we did have a point of comparison and the staff, as well as the environment, was excellent. The hotel was very clean, no marks, stains, or any other signs of abuse present anywhere. On our way up to our room, the cleaning staff greeted us which was nice, it felt like we were welcome guests. The breakfast was also varied, fresh, and delicious. We stayed here to visit Disneyland and it was a short drive which was easy and direct, a real plus for us. A great place to stay and we will return.

Helpful staff, full of information. Breakfast is good with the best pancakes we had on our trip. Parking is also reasonably priced. Perfect location for Disneyland as the shuttle stops by the front door.

Nice hotel, very close to highway. Rooms facing highway can get noisy. No warm cookie at check in that app we booked on promised. Breakfast included was very basic and done on cheap, but it was free so should complain but it has a " boarding school" atmosphere . Watery juices, coffee tea etc. Small bowl of fruit salad and a bowl of yogurt. The chef will slop some pre-made scrambled eggs on your plate as a favor. It's no 5 star but it does the job.

Great value hotel.  Stayed here at the end of our route 66 journey so that we could have a day relaxing in Disneyland before returning home.  Good breakfast and free wi-fi.  Shuttle bus took us to Disneyland and was still running to get us back late at night.

To put it more bluntly:  Real bang for the buck!  We were on a So Cal college tour this last week, working our way down through L.A. to San Diego.  While we enjoyed all of the hotels, Ayres was definitely the best value  - just as nice as the pricier places.  It was refreshing to look at the bill at check-out with a smile and nod instead of a groan.  Although there is no actual onsite restaurant, there are many options nearby.
