We had requested a 4th floor renovated room and were very happy with the design, decor and amenities.  I must confess that I am partial to the faux-European look and found the Ayres' interpretation quite charming.  Not having stayed here before, I do not know what the pre-renovation rooms were/are like, but they have apparently done a nice job with the

We only stayed one night because we came for the hockey game and had to work the next day We did not spend a lot of time at the hotel, but what we saw was comfortable and clean. The check in was fast and friendly. The room was nice sized, clean and the bed was comfortable. We like the fact that you had to insert your key card to turn on the electricity. It is very "green". We received a discount since we are Disneyland passholders. This made the hotel a very good value.

Beautiful, clean, wonderful staff, spacious rooms, across the street from Honda Center, five mins walk ARTIC train station, ten mins walk to Angels stadium (well lit and safe after a night game), pool and exercise room. Warm cookies in the afternoon. Maybe only 90% perfect for Disney unless you have a car. Shuttle is $5/adult, $2/kids for a full day. Runs every 20-40 mins so once you're at Disney, not really practical to go back for a nap or to drop packages. Hated having to leave and next night's hotel in San Diego paled in comparison. Wish we had a reason to go back or to another Ayres property.

Summary Heading: Spent 5 nights here for a Disneyland & surrounds trip with adult daughter and 2 adult granddaughters.
Summary: Rooms were clean and bright - great beds -- AC worked well - very good breakfast offerings in a nice dining room, and the staff at desk as well as in the dining room couldn't have been more friendly!  The shuttle to the park was a piece of cake and so convenient.  I would stay here again for sure.  Very convenient to everything.

Loved the comfortable room and bedding. Close walking distance to the Bus, Train, and Sport venues. Morning breakfast was really good with a great selection of foods. Forgot to bring my notes from my phone reservation to convince the staff that an additional $10.00 off would be forth coming by showing my Amtrak tickets. (She declared it was already figured in but the price was $10.00 more than quoted on the phone.)

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while we went to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm. We got a renovated room with a view of the disney fireworks, and breakfast was really good with the ability to order pancakes and eggs, etc. My complaints are with the staff. They just didn't seem to care. We were never greeted when we came in - even when we checked in - and even though they said they would do something special for my husband's birthday there was nothing there when we arrived. After e-mailing a manager they brought a bottle of sparkling cider and some truffles. Overall we enjoyed the room, but the staff could have been more friendly and attentive.

I fully recommend this hotel. We went to an Angel game and Disneyland and it was the perfect location to do all this. We arrived early so we could park in the parking lot and take the ART to Disneyland. They were able to get us a room early and we were able to leave our luggage in the air condition room instead of our hot car. Worked wonderfully. ART picks up right at the hotel. The rooms are very clean and decorated quite nicely. We stay every time we go to an Angel game or see a concert at the Honda center which is across the street. We will be back in October to see the Foo Fighters. See you soon.

I thought the property was very average at best.  The hallways had a bad smell.  The front desk service was decent but not great.  The beds were very soft and not that comfortable. The rooms were outdated
Manager Response: Dear Jeffrey L,  I am so sorry to read that your stay was not as it should have been. We are in the middle of renovating the rooms in our hotel and the paint and wallpaper do create a smell, but we have found it to be fairly short-lived. While the pre-renovation rooms are a traditional style, the new rooms have a completely new feel, and I think you will find they are brighter and definitely up to date.   I do apologize that your interaction with the Guest Service staff was not as it should have been and hope that your experience will be better on a future stay.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This property is in the process of updating the decor of their guest rooms. The updated rooms are much more attractive with lighter carpets and curtains. The beds are very comfortable. The full breakfast is still outstanding. Everything is very clean.The staff is  welcoming and always willing to help.The rates are great for Chapman University families. We will be back.

This was our second stay at Ayers. It has become our home away from home when we visit Disneyland. The staff at this hotel is top notch. The amenities make traveling with kids a breeze. This last time we booked a two room suite. The front desk always has fresh baked cookies (a favorite for the kids), they also have complimentary happy hour (a favorite for stressed out mom and dad). Ayers also has a continental breakfast with a chef who will make you a fresh omelet or pancakes, waffles, fresh breakfast meats etc. they also offer cold breakfast options if you want to eat lite. The pool keeps the kids busy when we're not at Disney, which btw is right down the street. The room is comfy and clean and has a fridge, microwave and wet bar area perfect for mixing baby bottles  and

This was our second stay at the hotel and we were still happy with all aspects. Our first stay was just my husband and I and this time it was with our daughter and her three children. They all enjoyed the breakfast and the two boys made the most of the specially made pancakes with the chef making them feel very welcome and not a nuisance as in some hotels. The reception staff were again very friendly and helpful and handled any queries or requests in a pleasant and prompt manner. We did have a few issues with housekeeping not emptying our rubbish or replenishing all used items but this would not put us of staying at the hotel again and the kids felt right at home enjoying the atmosphere of the boutique hotel. There were renovations going on but these did not affect us at all.The

Summary Heading: Not the place it used to be.
Summary: Early check in extra $30, 1 hour later check out=extra $30, Parking=extra$10, I felt every step of the way was no common courtesy of a traveler coming from a long distance and time zones. Instead of let me see what I can do to accommodate you, I felt it was like; how can I get more money out of you. Don't put people in the area of construction, block it off-don't make me pay in lack of sleep and then rude front desk after I complain about it.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that you had such a disappointing experience staying with us. Please let me address the issues that were brought to light. We do offer our guest's the opportunity to guarantee a room for early check-in at a fee and the opportunity to stay longer as well. We have many guests who check-in early and do not pay a fee, understanding of course that there is no guarantee of the room being available. In the past, late check-out was restricted to around 1pm depending on how busy the hotel is. The guarantee fee gives us the resources to be more flexible in housekeeping, but I do apologize if this in any way impeded your stay. We do charge for parking now following a trend in the area. Surprisingly, given our location next to the Honda Center and Angel Stadium, we are one of the last hotels to do so. I certainly understand that it is frustrating to see a charge where before there was none. Please note however that our parking charge of $10 plus tax is between 3 and 5 times less than charges found at similarly located hotels. I am also so sorry that you were disturbed by the refurbishment project. Our refurbishment hours of operation are between 8 and 5 with the heavier work typically being scheduled after 10am. We have been largely successful in meeting requests for guests who wanted to sleep in and would therefore need a room away from the refurbishment. I am sorry that this was not arranged for you. I would welcome the opportunity to address your concerns via the phone or email and hope that I will have the opportunity to speak with you some time soon.

Summary: A bit old fashioned in d√©cor. The reception staff in particular were super helpful. Value for money herewith breakfast included and wifi in the room. The maid missed our room one day but otherwise service was fine and the room clean.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Orange County
Summary: This is a friendly, smaller, clean, comfortable hotel.  Full breakfast is included in price. Convenient to the Honda Center, Anaheim Stadium, Disneyland and all other fun places in OC.  Just off the 57 Freeway so it's easy to get to.   The people who work here are all so nice.  My very favorite hotel.  Try it and you will go back.

The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and a good TV. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The complementary breakfast was good. Close to the new ARTIC transport Centre. A short drive to Disneyland. Close Crystal Cathedral.

We had 4 nights in the Ayres and found many positives and a few negatives. Check-in was quick. The room was very nice with a comfortable bed and a good TV. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The complementary breakfast was quite good. During the stay we experienced some noise from other guests above our room. We rang reception and they dealt with it. We had noise coming from a function at the Honda Centre across the road on another night although this ended around 10.30. The Wi Fi was very slow at times. The hotel is on a busy junction and can be difficult to get out of the drive at busy times. All in all I think that this is a decent hotel considering it is in Los Angeles. I would maybe stay there again.

Huge rooms, great staff, fantastic location, free cooked breakfast price was amazing! They are renovating and we cannot wait to see the new look when finished. As annual Disney pass holders we visit Anaheim at least 3 times a year and we have stayed at a wide range of hotels including the Disneyland hotels. Ayers by far exceeds all of the others we have stayed at. The Disneyland hotel is the only one I would stay at if not Ayers when I want to spend an arm and a leg that is. Willdefinitely stay here again and would recommend this gem!

Great hotel & lovely & helpful reception staff. Food staff need to be more informed regarding food they are serving, particularly around food allergies. Did not even know what gluten was. ARC bus is unreliable, so if you are short for time, consider a taxi to Disneyland. Good complimentary business centre facilities, laundry & wifi. Would recommend.

This hotel is ideally placed if you want to stay by the Angels stadium, Ducks stadium and is also close to the new ARTIC transport Centre. A short drive to Disneyland. So many good places to eat nearby.  The real stars here are the reception staff who were extremely professional and a credit to the hotel

Summary Heading: Great location for seeing the best of the area
Summary: My wife and I spent three nights here and had a fantastic time.  The staff were great and efficient,  check in and check out were easy, and the breakfast was really good each morning with a good variety choices.  The room was spacious and comfortable. Bed was very good with plenty of good pillows as well. This was our first stop after a long haul flight so it was great to have such a comfortable and quiet room to adjust to the new time zone.  The best feature of the hotel is the location. First night, we took a 10 min walk to angels stadium to the baseball. Next day the ART bus was waiting out front to take us to Disney right on time. And the following day we turned right on to the freeway and went straight to the beaches of Newport and Laguna.  Fantastic.

The Ayres was perfect for our trip to watch baseball at Angels Stadium for a couple nights.  The staff were friendly, the room was clean and quiet, and the Angels stadium was an easy walk down the street.  The full hot breakfast was excellent.  Jose was very busy serving breakfast, but he took time to be friendly to everyone.  He was one of the nicest hotel employees we have ever met!

We were in Anaheim for the Dusney Tinkerbell 1/2 Marathon weekend.   Bus picked us up front. We were able to get back and forth from the park.  Beds were comfy. Not too much noise. Even after an Angels and Ducks game.

Summary Heading: Great location for a game or a short bus ride to Disneyland.
Summary: The room was spacious and clean.  The complimentary breakfast was great.  Fresh fruit, hot pancakes, eggs, potatoes and sausage.  The staff were very friendly.  Checkout at noon makes for an easy morning.  The hotel is directly across from the Honda Center.  A block from Amtrack and you can see Angels stadium.  The ART bus stops at the hotel for easy trips to Disneyland.

I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. It was spotless,  which is very important for me when visiting a hotel.  Staff was super friendly and attentive. They had a breakfast,  which was good, but not for the price of the hotel. I have stayed in cheaper hotels that had better breakfasts. The pool and hot tub areas were spotless as well and very relaxing.  It is in a convenient location, not too far from main attractions. I would definitely stay here again.

We are a N.Z family of 3 - Mum, Dad and a 4 yr old boy. We chose this hotel due to other T.A reviews for having a bath, cleanliness and proximity to Disneyland.  It was a good choice, we were given a warm welcome on arrival and as we were early we asked directions for shopping and reception helped us out with no trouble. The rooms are comfortable and the bed divine. Parking was easy and driving to Disneyland very straight forward. We debated whether to catch the bus to Disneyland as this is just outside the hotel but drove ourselves instead each day. There were games on at the stadium across the road but the hotel ensured that guests only parked in their car park

A great hotel within walking distance to Angels Stadium. Full hot breakfast and very friendly staff make this place a winner. Rooms are comfortable and well equipped .with fridge and microwave. Beds were comfortable and rooms were large and clean

all the staff were very attentive ,this is a great location for visiting the Disney parks. the rooms were spotlessly clean and had the most comfortable beds ever and a good breakfast included (always a bonus in the states).

Summary Heading: GREAT LOCATION, GREAT VALUE, FRIENDLY STAFF
Summary: We stayed one night at the Anaheim Ayres for a concert at the Honda Center.  The hotel is literally across the street from the venue.  It took us about 5 minutes to walk there.  It is also very convenient to the Anaheim Amtrak station (7 min walk) which was how we arrived.  The hotel itself is very nicely decorated and clean.  The rooms were also nice and clean and the staff was fantastic.  They have a basic pool/spa area (nothing fancy) and small fitness room but that was fine for us.  The included hot breakfast was average.

Nice and clean rooms. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast was decent. Bo was great at the front desk, very friendly. Very close to Angels Stadium and The Honda Center. Short drive to Disneyland. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and great breakfasts
Summary: The Ayres Hotel has large spacious rooms in a great location, close to Disney and across the road from the Honda centre.  The breakfasts served at the hotel are great, the kids loved the Mickey Mouse pancakes.  A convenient shuttle runs to the parks every 20 mins.

We recently stayed there for 4 nights with our 2 kids and the room was plenty big enough and well layed out to suit our needs, the hotel is close to all the local attractions and far enough away from Disneyland that you can get away from it all, the bar and restaurant across the road is also really good and more than makes up for the lack of an onsite eatery.  I would defiantly recommend and we will be back.

We had booked a regular room with a king bed.  When we checked in, we discovered we had been upgraded to a suite!  We were celebrating our 28th wedding anniversary, and the upgrade was a very pleasant surprise.    The room was perfect, the breakfast the next morning was delicious, the staff was friendly, the location was convenient--I really can't think of any negatives.    Thank you for a fantastic stay!

Summary Heading: Nice property but beware of traffic noise...
Summary: This was our second stay at an Ayres Hotel property and these hotels are family owned.  The lobby and room decor looks upscale, as they market themselves as a European boutique hotel.  Breakfast was typical, although they have a cook who prepares and serves hot food.  Seating was plentiful.  More variety would have made the breakfast top notch - only one type of yogurt (not Greek) - and pastries were average.  The check-in process was painless, even though we had booked through Expedia.  Unfortunately, when we booked through Expedia (because there were no rooms available on the Ayres Hotel site during our stay), we booked the only room available, which was an accessible room.  This put us on the ground floor and the traffic noise at night made it difficult to sleep.  The air

Let me start by stating that the hotel appearance is accurately portrayed by the photos. I did not include the same 7 pictures everyone else has already taken.  Upon arrival our smoke detector was malfunctioning, the staff immediately corrected the issue after I called the desk. This service was only the precursor to which we would receive over our 3-day Disney visit.   Our party consisted of 4 adults and 4 children under 3-years old. The manager and staff helped us with our bags, provided a free shuttle service to McDonalds so the kids could play, assisted us with breakfast (which is great and free), and assisted us with corralling the kids outside while we waited for the Disney shuttle (which was free for all the kids).   My wife and I have traveled through 20+ countries and

Ayres Hotel Anaheim has everything you need for a comfortable stay! I would highly recommend staying here.   The front desk staff were always professional, friendly and welcoming. The room itself was spotlessly clean and spacious. Breakfast was fantastic, breads, bagels, cereals and hot foods. Having a washer and dryer within the hotel was great too.   Location wise, if you're visiting just for Disneyland, it may be a little far away. We liked being a little away from all the hubbub though! There is a convenient shuttle (with very helpful drivers). We never had a problem catching the shuttle bus though. Honda Center is literally just across the road. There aren't too many shops around, but the reception area has a little area with essentials.  Overall, a great stay and couldn't

We had the King Suite and the room was larger then expected. Clean and neat, though a little dated. Nice large sitting area with TV, desk, dinning table, and we still had room to move around. The service was great, the morning breakfast was good. For dinner on night the staff recommended Riccardo's Mexican restaurant down the street is was super. Great easy pick-up for Disneyland right out the door. I would come again

The room was very comfortable, very clean and beautifully decorated. Full breakfast not just cereal and sweets. Great value for the money. Will definitely stay at one of the Ayres Hotels again when visiting California.

I'm going to get this hotel five stars because the staff was so nice to me. The hotel itself was fine - I'll get to that - but the first night, I missed the free wine reception by several hours, but the check-in clerk saw that I was frazzled beyond reason, so he brought me a nice glass of wine anyway. The second night, the night clerk (Bo), was the friendliest guy ever and didn't treat me like a work obligation. So the great staff, plus the price point (under $200), earns good ratings. The rooms are also great - clean, comfortable, no flaws.   There are downsides, so be aware of them and just expect them. This is on the par of a Hilton Garden Inn or similar. Breakfast is cursory and not tasty, though they do make it to order, and it's fast and free. I was annoyed that their

The hotel has a more traditional interior with beautiful art work and furnishings. Located across from the Honda Center and 3 miles from Disneyland.  For the price it was fantastic.  If you stay closer to Disneyland you still have to drive in to the park and the prices are much higher for much less quality. The afternoon we arrived they served a low key guest reception in the front lobby with wine and chips and guacamole which really took the edge off our hunger. The rooms are spacious and clean and beautiful. Rooms are quiet too.  Free breakfast in the morning that is top notch.  Staff is very friendly and make you feel really welcome. This is a fairly large hotel (4 stories) with a boutique feel. We travel a lot and this place is a winner!  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great value hotel - everything you need
Summary: I liked this hotel because of the location which was walking distance to the Angel Stadium and it also had everything we needed at the same price other hotels which weren't as nice. One disappointment was they were painting the walls in the hallway so there was plastic all on the ground and the smell of paint. I understand though they are just trying to improve the look but it was bad timing for us.  Other disappointment was although it had free wi-Fi, we could not get any reception in the hotel at all.  The best bonus was the free breakfast included!

From the moment my daughter and I walked thru the doors, we were impressed. Friendly staff, good food, and pretty rooms with a microwave, and refrigerator. Thank you so much for the great hospitality!!

Deserves its #1 status. We stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of April, Room was huge and had plenty of amenities within the room! Breakfast at this hotel is very Good so thank you Chef. Staff at front desk couldn't do enough for us as we booked a few things through them. We stayed here as we didn't want to stay in the centre of LA but also wanted to see some of the sporting events around the area. Brilliant Location if you're here for Disney.  Would stay here again.

Very comfortable. Right across from Honda Center. Very close to Angel Stadium. Transportation from hotel to Disney Land very good.  Breakfast cooked by chefs each morning.  Good and clean and comfortable.

I love the Ayres Hotels.  They are a small family owned chain, I believe.  We had a great stay in their Costa Mesa location last summer, and decided to stay at their Anaheim property this week during for an overnight trip to Disneyland.  The Ayres Hotels are primarily in Southern California.  Since we live in Southern California, we don't get to stay at them very often.  However, I would definitely recommend them to anyone traveling to Orange County and Los Angeles County.  I think they have a location in Paso Robles that is more resort-like, but I haven't had the opportunity to stay there yet.  Ayres Anaheim:  They sent me an email the morning of my stay that allowed me to check in.  Since we were spending the entire day at Disneyland, I thought this was terrific.  The email

Summary Heading: Stayed at this hotel for the convenience of an event at the Honda Center
Summary: Welcome by front desk agent was ok.  Had requested a room with 2 beds.  Upon check in was told there was a couch sofa that pulled out into a bed.  Got to the room and there was no sofa.  I called the FD about  half hr later and was extended a room with a sofa.  I was so tired, I didn't want to move.  The room was nice and bed was comfortable.  Upon check out, I did stop by the FD to let the agent know that numerous long black hair was found on the bedding (pillows), in the towels and in the bath tub.  If in the area again, I would consider staying there but look around first.  Not very sanitary with hair all over.

What a fabulous welcome to the USA!  Our family of 4 stayed 4 nights at the Ayres Anaheim while we immersed ourselves in Disneyland and the California Adventure park.  I love the boutique style of this hotel. Its lobby is French-inspired with framed artwork, a warming fire place, plush lounges and old furniture pieces. Our 3rd floor room at the front of the building was surprisingly quiet given the hotel's freeway location and its vicinity to 2 major convention centres.  The room was spacious, beds were super comfortable, the bathroom was basic but all we needed, and the in-room coffee maker was a welcome touch.  Service: attentive and helpful. Reception staff knowledgable and keen to help.  Buffet breakfast room is busy and casual. If you want donuts for breakfast, you'll find

Our family stayed here from 3/20 - 3/23. Hotel's located near a freeway, so expect some noise if you get a room facing it. It's close to the Honda Center, Angels stadium, and also a train station. Our room was clean upon checking in, everything looks to be in good shape. Bed and pillow was too soft to my liking. Hotel provided free wifi and free breakfast every morning which was just below average quality, but the little ones sure enjoyed it. There's also a small pool in the back that the little ones also enjoyed.

This hotel had so many great reviews on Trip Advisor and it deserves every one of them them.  Yes the beds are comfortable, pillows great, large rooms.  Great breakfast.  Our main purpose on the trip was to go to Disneyland, and it is very close.  The only negative for me which is a great positive for others is the close proximity to the Honda Center and Angel's Stadium.  With games going on it took a bit of time to get to the hotel with so much traffic.  I can't imagine how bad the traffic would be if there were events at both locations.    Again I can't say enough good things about the hotel.  It really is a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Well located hotel for Ducks, Angels & Disney
Summary: Friendly staff, excellent location for local sports & the frequent Disney shuttle bus is really handy.  The hotel has a social hour with wine & cookies during the week & the decor is interesting & classic in its styling.   JT Schmids over the road is a great restaurant/sports bar as well.   Can't fault this place for any visits to Anaheim & I found the room rates very reasonable also.

Summary Heading: Yearly Ayres and the Ducks Excursion
Summary: I see a late-season Ducks game with my son yearly, who's now 10.  This is my 4th stay.  Free breakfast,wifi, very friendly staff, clean, frig & microwave, across the street from Honda Center.   1 negative; the room darkening curtain is way too small..no "sleeping in". Need to install wider curtains.

I enjoyed my stay because the hotel met my expectations - cleanliness (daily room service),   comfortable bed, friendly staff (everyone I encountered had great customer service skills), clean swimming pool, and of course the convenience of the hotel location. The one and only thing I wasn't very pleased with was the noise of the people from the room above mine. Other than that, I really enjoyed my stay!

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed. Very reasonable price & excellent service .Especially the staff are very helpful . The location is so convenient to go to Disney world . You have the option of going either by own transport or there is a shuttle service from the hotel which cost hardly 5 $ per head

We had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. It was very quiet, and the staff were friendly. The bed was super comfy, and the room was quite large. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to families and couples.

This family run hotel shows the care and consideration of the owners.   The staff are very helpful, the public areas are well done and the rooms comfortable.  Nice breakfast too.  If you are staying in Anaheim Ayers is a good choice.  You do pay for parking though.

WE LOVED OUR LIL WEEKEND GET-A-WAY @THE AYRES!!!!!! Stood here for a weekend get-a-way to attend a concert across the street at the Honda Center.  Ayres Hotel and rooms are very nice, SPACIOUS, clean, and comfortable inside and out from the lobby, eating area, workout room, and swimming pool, very quiet, and smells good too from the moment you walk in. Walked across the street to JT Schmid's for dinner and drinks before the concert.  Next day walked across the street to the Anaheim Amtrak Station to check that out.....really neat building. Walked under the bridge to Angel Stadium to check out the RV show they were having.  We live so close, yet we felt as if we were far away from home.  Very nice stay and will definitely stay here again!!! PLUS, the staff was very, Very, VERY

We were heading to southern California for a vacation and needed a place to stay in Anaheim as we were going to see a Ducks NHL game on our fist night. We chose the Ayres Anaheim primarily due to the great tripadvisor reviews as well as the location in respect to the Honda Center, home of the Ducks [literally across the street, although the traffic lights are very, very slow so it did take about ten minutes to walk across the street to the game].  The rate we received directly from the hotel was fantastic, the cheapest of the three hotels we stayed in on our trip. The room as wonderful. We booked two queens and asked for a fourth floor room with a view of the Disneyland fireworks. Our requests were granted and room #404 was large, extremely clean, quiet and had a great view of

Summary Heading: This hotel blows away ALL the competition in Anaheim! Don't go anywhere else!
Summary: I am a frequent traveler into Anaheim, for personal and work reasons. I recently stayed at this property for the first time, because they had the best rate for a hotel with a hot continental breakfast (and the rate was low!!). And since the rate was so low, and not being familiar with this hotel brand, I didn't have high expectations.  Everything about this property BLEW ME AWAY!  Best highlights:  they had the BEST hotel bed I have ever slept in, hands-down (and I'm a very frequent traveler). A good nights sleep is worth every penny, and they prove their value in this aspect alone!  The room size was VERY generous - lots of space; desk and chair, entertainment center, coffee table and couch, dresser, bar area, good sized bathroom, and the decor was upscale and just lovely. They

This place is fantastic all around, service, cleanliness, comfort, location. It's a little further from Disney than the other hotels in the area but with shuttles running all day it hardly matters.  There's a great restaurant right next door, some kind of ale house (?) I forget the name, but it's got a great bar, outdoor area and is family friendly.

Really don't have any complaints on this hotel. Nice location, good amenities. Great free breakfast. The bathrooms in our room could have been a little cleaner but certainly nothing that would prevent me from staying here again. There's a reason they are #1.

This is our second stay here and we came back because of our great experience the first time. The front desk staff is awesome, great breakfast, parking is ample, free wi-fi, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, quiet atmosphere. We stay here during our Disneyland visits as it is only a few minutes away from the hustle and bustle. The housekeeping staff had our rooms done when we came back in the afternoon to rest. We had breakfast with the friendly chefs who make Mickey Mouse pancakes for our children and have a great selection of hot and cold breakfast selections each morning. Did not attend the evening receptions but the children loved the cookies as we were on our way out and it looked like people there were enjoying the other refreshments provided. We also like that there is

Beautiful hotel and rooms. Exceptional hotel staff. I was there with my father last night on our way to a wedding. My 80 year old father tripped on a curb and fell, causing his nose to bleed all over his nice clothes. The staff helped us very quickly and bent over backwards to help us remedy the situation. Within an hour he was all clean and off to his grandsons wedding. We could not have done it if it weren't for the awesome hosts at Ayres Hotel. Thank you to all. Dad is doing fine and we had a great evening. We will be back to your hotels again.

Spent 2 nights here. Bed was comfortable. All the stuff needed to feel at home. wifi,couch and TV... Got up in the morning and had a pleasant and yet filling breakfast. Spent the entire time visiting relatives so I can't comment on anything more. I would stay there again.

I was traveling to Anaheim to see my son play with his school band at California Adventure and did not want to be in the middle of the Disney madness.  I booked a last minute room at the Ayres and am thrilled that I did.  Beautiful Boutique hotel, well maintained, clean, friendly atmosphere.  Front desk staff were friendly and attentive.  Parking was adequate at an additional $10 per night.  I forget the name, but the sports bar next door was walking distance for great meals.  Honda Center across the street if that is your thing.  Beds were extremely comfy.  Shuttle to Disney was running every 20 minutes for the 2 mile ride to the entrance.  Breakfast was awesome.  Fresh and tasty.  Not too crowded.  Highly recommend this hotel.  I will be returning next time we play Disney!

We were visiting disneyland and decided to pick this hotel based on the reviews and stayed for three nights. The prices were also good than the ones that were closer to disneyland alongwith free wifi and breakfast. We were little worried about the commute to disneyland as it was not close enough for walking. We used shuttle servies and it was on time, took around 15-20 mins (offpeak hours) and we did not had to stress about parking at disneyland. Overall the hotel was nice, rooms with good decor and comfortable. It was also closer to few restaurants (JT Schmidt offer discount for folks staying here) and morning breakfast was really good, lots of choices.

Stayed for 3 nights in Feb...great place to stay when in Anaheim.  Was about a 10-15 min drive to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm.  Walked across the road to the Honda Centre to watch a NHL game (awesome!).  Breakfast was included...continental plus a couple of hot items (eggs, hash brown, sausages). Will definitely stay here again.

Each year for the past five or six years I have stayed at this hotel.  It is convenient to the Angels Stadium, Honda Center, and new Amtrak station (all pretty much across the street one way or the other.)  The magic word is convenient.  The staff is friendly -- but more importantly -- helpful.  They seem to have been there a while and know the area and the hotel.  Nothing goes unattended to.  Parking (for those who come by car) is immediately adjacent and easy on and off Katella.  These folks are effective, thoughtful, and convenient.

I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Katella, Anaheim, CA overnight, picking the location for it's convenient location to my early appointment the next day. I was ready for a glass of wine and nice dinner at the hotel restaurant, then quiet night reading and relaxing until bedtime after a 14 hour day, 5 appointments and over 300 miles logged. What a disappointment! There is no restaurant for dinner on the premises, the nearest one was not within walking, and since the hotel is located in one of the busiest intersections, there was no way I was driving again that day. I ordered a delivered meal which arrived on time and piping hot, and was edible, but was stuck with Italian which was not really what I was in the mood for that night. No wine of course. The room was the noisiest I've ever

Just got home from a three day stay at the Ayres.  Second time here and it is the best. All staff is great but MAJOR props to Jose for making the free breakfast that much more enjoyable before the long days at Disneyland.  Great location away from the hustle and bustle, perfect price, clean comfortable rooms and did i mention the great breakfast.  Jose made my two kids Mickey Mouse pancakes without being asked.  Will definitely be staying here again and again.

This hotel was easily accessible from the freeway. Beautiful and tasteful Victorian like decor. Extremely clean. (I am hard to please;))  Free Wifi, free hot breakfast which includes Chef Jose cooking made to order pancakes (if you ask he'll do Mickey pancakes for the kids too!!), eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, cold cereals, fresh fruit, yogurts, toast, bagels, donuts, pastries, etc., plus a variety of hot beverages and juices! The staff was simply amazing. Very helpful and accomidating! So refreshing to meet an entire staff that enjoys being in the hospitality service industry. (I am too!) You do have to pay like $10 a day for parking. Which I'll gladly pay for free wifi and free hot breakfast! There is the ART shuttle that takes you to Disneyland for a small fee. They pick up

A very pleasant find in this hotel. The decor is beautiful, clean rooms, comfortable beds and great breakfast. Andrew at the front desk was extremely helpful, but then again, so we're all the staff.  I would highly recommend this hotel to all.

Summary Heading: Number One in Anaheim for a Good Reason
Summary: We followed Trip Advisor and booked our Presidents' Day/Valentines' Weekend Hockey Trip for here at the Ayres.  I am so glad that we took everyone's advice on what a great place this is to stay.  The rooms are large, airy, bright, and perfectly clean.  The frig and coffee machine were great.  We enjoyed the wine and beer reception on the weekdays - what a great way to start the evening! The full breakfast was fantastic! Two things make this hotel a stand out though - the staff and the location.  The staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay.  Everyone that stays here seem to be tourists, so the staff seems to appreciate that we all need a pleasant vacation!  As far as location, this could not have been more perfect.  We flew into John Wayne Airport, Orange County,

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel for Honda Center Event!
Summary: Great hotel, worked perfectly for an overnight stay after a hockey game! Freshly baked cookies in the evening, and great service at the front desk. Room was very clean, and the hotel is close to Honda Center and JD Schmid's for a drink/bite before a game.

Summary Heading: We stay here always and only stay at this Ayers-best service, courtesy and it's like home to us.
Summary: Love this Ayers-all the staff are so pleasant, helpful and accommodating. We stay here always and it is our favorite-best location and service always. Rooms always clean and neat and just our home away from home üòÉüòÉüòÉüòÉ

Great hotel if attending event at Honda Center.  Staff very friendly. Only one glitch, didn't honor my request on advance check in. But, did give me a different room when we were given a room facing freeway. They do not offer evening reception on weekends, so , coffee and water service would be nice in lobby, which is quite common in 'boutique' hotels. I would stay here again for sure.

We have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past couple of years. We stay here whenever we come to Anaheim, whether for a hockey game, concert, or for Disneyland. Angels' Stadium is also very close by.  The hotel staff is very friendly, and goes above and beyond expectations. There is a fitness center and a pool, although we haven't used those much in our many stays.   Breakfast is provided daily (check the hours), and consists of scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage (alternating days), home fries or hash browns (alternating days), and either pancakes or French toast, (alternating days). They also have a variety of cereals, toast, fruit, yogurt, milk, juice, and coffee.  The location works out very well if you're going to an event at Honda Center. There is a city bus (ART)

Having to be away from home and travel for business. Ayres gave me a great experience of feeling relaxed and very pleasant. I must add the complimentary breakfast was impressive. The variety of foods and a chef on hand making the eggs, bacon and hash browns was greatly appreciative. Then coming in after work to relax with complimentary wine was very pleasing. thank you again for making my business experience feeling like I was on a vacation!

Booked this hotel for a one night stay due to the location being across from the Honda Center where we planned to attend a hockey game.  Location is great for any event at the Honda Center.  You don't have to worry about parking, just walk across the street.   Asked for a top floor and quiet room and received a room on the third floor, you can hear noise from the room above and from the street. Not good for a light sleeper.  Breakfast was good, fresh and hot.  However, the lovely lady working the counter could have used more help as it was consistently busy.    Room is a good size, however, the d√©cor is slightly dated, could use a face lift.  The small refrigerator in the room started making a loud humming noise at 1:00 a.m. which  was slightly annoying.

Best value near Disneyland!  The hotel is not the newest, but the rooms were meticulously clean and spacious.  The staff were sensational at the front desk.  And best of all, the hotel doesn't nickel and dime you for everything.  The free-wifi and hot breakfast were icing on the cake.  The bus to Disneyland cost $12 for a 3-day pass.  It leaves every 20 minutes on the spot.  I would stay at this hotel again in an instant.

We took our granddaughter to Universal Studios, California Adventure and Disneyland and this Hotel was in the perfect location.  They offer a FULL breakfast in the mornings and shuttle to the Theme parks for $5.00 all day.  The rooms are very clean and spacious.  The only thing that was a disappointment was asking for extra pillows, as there were no pillows for the hideabed and only one on the King bed.  The gal I spoke with was very hesitant in giving me extra pillows......questioning me about how many adults in the room and why I needed them.

This hotel has a rather grand and up-market feel to it.  On arrival at the lobby we were warmly greeted, and a plate of freshly-baked cookies was sitting there for us to pick at.  There were more freebies later, with free wine, beer, tortilla chips and dips served 4:30-5:30pm.  Decor seems to be trying to be 1900s European, which mostly means some gilt-framed prints of old paintings being hung about the place and a nice open fire in the lobby.  Not 100% convincing, but pleasant and smart enough. The bedroom was very spacious.  It was described as "vaulted", which seems to mean it was double-height in the bed area (normal height elsewhere).  The view to the front would have been good, and could see the Disneyland fireworks, other than being rather blocked by a palm tree. The bath

Went to Southern California for an Anaheim Ducks hockey game. This hotel is located across the street from the Honda Center. Everything about this hotel is First Class! We are going to stay there next month for sure after our great first experience here this stay!

We arrived at happy hour ( offered on weekdays) with the smell of fresh cookies filled the air.  We had our choice of rooms (one to watch the fireworks out our window, if we had gone back that early) and the beds were like clouds to dream on.  Our older teenagers enjoyed the spa and the work out room both were pleased.  The breakfast offered hot scrabbled eggs (that can be topped with cheese and a very mild salsa) hot potatoes and alternated between bacon and sausage in the mornings with fresh sweet pancakes made by the chief "Mickey Mouse" shape for the little ones.  Other cold items were available, the Danish were moist, tasty and a nice treat, so was the hot chocolate!   At first the location was in questioned Next to the freeway there was very little road noise.  also the

What is good? The rooms were very nice, clean, and well stocked.  The Happy hour in the evening was well done.  The breakfast was fair.  It appears that it is the same each day.  Canned fruit was boring.  What need improvement?The fitness  center smelled.  It needs some fresh air.  The air is foul.  The equipment needs to be upgraded, if you want a 5 star rating.  The stationary bike was not working properly.  The room is very expensive.  For these prices, we expect that everything is 5 *. I joined their club.  The brochure said I would get points for my stay, if I joined before I checked out.  I did not get points because they said I booked through a 3rd party.  I did not know this at the time I booked the room.  I suggested that the purpose of an awards program is to make
Manager Response: Dear Sir,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I am pleased you found the rooms appealing and the happy hour well done. Although the fruit selection is a fruit salad vs. canned food, I am very sorry you found it boring. The breakfast is similar each day, but we do swap out the type of meat (bacon/sausage) and we try to offer either  pancakes or French Toast, although the pancakes are very popular so we tend to make those more often.  Thank you for letting us know about the fitness room. We will be looking into it immediately.   I believe there may have been some confusion regarding the points. The manager you spoke with did not contact me but contacted the Rewards Manager directly and the Rewards Manager was very prompt in response and awarded points immediately. The manager on property did advise you of this, but I apologize if this information could have been  better communicated. The aim of a loyalty program is to reward loyalty and often times third party sites maintain their own rewards programs to encourage bookings and loyalty to their own sites, so only awarding points for bookings directly with the hotel is standard industry practice. We are essentially rewarding members for going directly to us, either via our website or by calling us directly. I will definitely work with my team to ensure this is being more accurately explained to our guests upon enrollment.   Finally the price. Rates can vary by day depending on events in the area and demand, and this rate was higher than a guest might have paid on another day. The Ducks were playing (and sadly losing against) the Lightning across the road from us which draws a lot of demand and drives the rate up, but there was also a large convention in town so the city was sold out. A report for that week showed competitors were selling rooms at a higher rate than us, but I apologize if our rate was not ideal for you.   I hope you will reconsider staying with us again. Our website often showcases special offers.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Just one night at this hotel for a quick visit to Disneyland.  Very close to the Honda Center and to the new transportation center.  The shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient, although you did have to pay for the tickets.  The pool and hot tub were fine.  The room itself was beautiful.  I did not have the breakfast, but my family enjoyed it.  Front desk people were all nice.

We recently stayed at the Ayres in Anaheim for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  The hotel was clean and the staff friendly.  They have a complimentary breakfast that includes hot and cold items. They offered cereal, fruit, bagels, toast, yogurt, etc. but also had eggs, pancakes,  hash browns, homefries, bacon & sausage.  The breakfast room is one of the largest I have seen and we never had any trouble getting a table.  Our room was a nice size and the beds were very comfortable.  There was also a small fridge and microwave in our room as well as free wifi.  The only downside to this hotel is that they now charge for parking, $10/night.  At the time I booked our room, it was free parking so I didn't have to pay and that was one of the features I liked about this hotel.  It's

Summary Heading: Great stay in a good location.
Summary: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Ayers Anaheim. I couldn't find one thing to fault with the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and the breakfast was better than others we've had. The staff were always friendly and helpful. The traffic noise was a bit loud at times but I'm not sure where you could get away from that anyways.   Though the hotel isn't the closest to Disneyland, we actually liked that. It was great to be able to get away from the crowds and activity with a quick shuttle ride on the ART. There was a nice restaurant and bar across the street and the Honda Centre kitty corner.   We would absolutely return to this hotel in the future.

The rooms were extremely clean and spacious for this area, and the price ratio here is great for what you get. Free hot breakfast, free wifi, clean and big rooms, laundry.  What more can you ask or?  The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.  We stayed here (family w two toddlers) in a suite, and coudn't be happier.  The happy hour reception serves beer for the grown ups and warm cookies for the kids. There are restaurants right across the street too.

The good: - proximity to Disneyland (which is why we were there) - very clean. It smelled nice. - good size in the king suite - very polite staff - free cookie - accommodated floor request  The "meh:"  - breakfast was free but flavorless. I've had better, but I've also had worse.  - our bed and pillows were way too soft and fluffy for me. If you like a soft bed and a soft pillow, here's your hotel.

Took family to Disney for long weekend. Usual hotels were way overpriced. Ayers is very nice. Breakfast is ok in morning but does the trick. Right across street from Honda center/big A. With shuttle, you are at Disney in a snap.

Stayed here for one week with family in February. Had a beautiful 2 bedroom suite with 2 king beds and a sofa bed and two washrooms - which were extremely clean. Suite was very roomy for 2 adult and 2 teenage children. Very friendly staff and helpful. There were fresh cookies and wine/beer every afternoon in the lounge. The ART (Shuttle) bus stops in front of hotel every 20 minutes and takes you to Disneyland and is $5/person and a very convenient 15 minute ride. The hotel is across the street from the Honda Center and a 5 minute walk to Angel Stadium. There is also a movie theatre and a complex of restaurants which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel for cleanliness, friendly staff and location.

Summary Heading: We will be back thanks for a wonderful stay
Summary: Our family of four called into to LA for the mandatory Disneyland visit and we found the jewel in the crown when staying in Anaheim. This property was little known to our travel agent but I would say it would be her number one choice for future clients travelling to this area. The rooms are beautifully appointed with the old world charm of green and antique gold - the beds were super comfy which made the end of day rest from our busy holiday park adventures blissful. The bath/shower cleanliness was impeccable with not a spot of mould in sight which is not often these days. The staff were very friendly and helpful, Jose the chef was lovely - the cookies in the afternoon and house wine/beer was a lovely touch which I have not seen before. We did have a plumbing issue which was

Summary Heading: Holiday At The Ayres in Anaheim
Summary: I just recently spent 5 nights at the Ayres Hotel on Katella Ave in Anaheim. I have to say that it was one of the Best hotel experiences I have had in a long time. The hotel staff is wonderful, the shuttle service was delightful and it is conveniently located. There is a wonderful breakfast served every morning that will satisfy anyone's needs. In every way this is, hands down, the best place to stay.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: This is a nicely decorated small hotel that doesn't look like every child that is going to the happiest place on earth has stayed. Everyone at the hotel was very gracious and helpful. Plus the convenient bus/shuttle will not only take you to Disneyland but everywhere else nearby for $5 daily (get a better deal for a multiple day pass). This is the second time I have stayed here. It's still the same...a nice convenient place at a good price for this area.

I stayed here for the Anaheim Convention event.  Is about 3.3 miles away from the Convention Center. The Hotel, close by restaurant, near the main freeway, close to Disney, Honda Stadium and also there is a Public Transportation Station near by. The Hotel is very well accomodated and maintained. Is like home away home. By the way, they serve complimentary breakfast.

My husband, our 9 year-old daughter and I stayed at Ayres for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was free breakfast and wifi. Parking was only 10 USD per night. The room was clean and spacious. We also enjoyed the chocolate chip cookies in the lobby. Plus, the drive to Disneyland was just 15 minutes.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for our Disneyland trip. Clean rooms, free wifi and delicious breakfast were all good features of the hotel. 10 usd/day parking rate was the best in our California trip. Staff was really friendly and helpful

The staff was fantastic, the breakfast was great and the bed - wish I could have brought it home... As we arrived back at the hotel after dinner, our grandson said - Look at the fire works! We watched from the parking lot, it was the Disneyland Fireworks.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for our Disneyland trip based on the fact that it was the #1 rated hotel in Anaheim.  And how!!  We loved it there.  Why?  1.  The FREE breakfast - SO delicious.  Come on, a free breakfast with eggs, potatoes, French toast or pancakes, coffee, juice, hot chocolate, yogurt, fresh fruit...?  Our pre-park breakfast every morning in the sunny dining room was one of our favorite parts of the trip.  Jose made Mickey Mouse pancakes for the kiddo and that was a hit!  Paying for a similar breakfast each morning at a restaurant would probably have cost us a total of about $120 - $180, so that was a pretty nice $$ savings.  2.  The room - Comfortable, spacious, supersuper clean, and QUIET.  We could see the freeway from our window, but we couldn't hear it.  We

I selected this hotel since we were going to a hockey game at the Honda Center and this is right across the street.  Everything was excellent.  Rooms are beautiful, huge and comfortable.   The full breakfast buffet was fantastic and very fresh.  Nice restaurant next door where we enjoyed drinks before the game.  Will look for Ayres Hotels whenever we travel to southern California.

Friendly staff, easy check in.  Quiet room nicely appointed.  Comfortable bed and bedding.  Mini kitchen, setting area with couch, small table and desk.  Creative decor and lighting.  Wifi in room included as well as breakfast the next morning.

Summary Heading: Front desk baked cookies at 8pm so my toddler can give to Santa!!
Summary: We stayed here for christmas, after a long day at disneyland I forgot to buy cookies for my toddler to leave for Santa Claus. When we arrived to the hotel we asked if there were any cookies we could purchase for Santa, unfortunately there were none. The young lady at the front desk said she would try and go make some, I didn't expect her to have time because the hotel seemed busy. An hour later we had a knock at our door and there was the young lady with a plate of warm cookies! Santa enjoyed them! Their customer service is beyond great! We will always stay there for our disney trips! And for disney pass holders they offer great discounts on their website!

We stayed here on our way to Phoenix and caught a Ducks game across the street.  I had booked this hotel through Expedia and they had trouble finding my reservation.  After some maneuvering, they found it (lots of work by the front desk clerk!) and they gave us a nicer room to compensate for "our" inconvenience.  We thought that was funny because THEY were the one inconvenienced by having to go through some reservation systems to locate the booking.  The room was great, the breakfast included in the room was really good, and its close to Disneyland.   We will definitely be staying there again.  We couldn't have liked the hotel more.

Would never stay anywhere else! Front desk Fred was amazing! Booked us every night for a tour for the next day, hooked us up with the hotel shuttle for evening activities, directed us to the ART shuttle, which stops outside the door, and called a car to take us to the airport which didn't cost much more than the airport shuttle and we were the only passengers and guaranteed to arrive at airport on time. Paulo the hotel shuttle driver was friendly and greeted us whenever we saw him around the hotel. Jason, also at the front desk answered any questions we had promptly and always with a smile. Coming back from a long day of tours we were always welcomed with fresh baked cookies, smiles and asked how our day was. Room was spacious and clean. This hotel made our holiday that much

Summary Heading: lovely decor, helpful staff, good breakfast, good rate
Summary: The d√©cor is a step above the moderate chain hotels and the rates are competitive.   One in the group really loved the bed and we all enjoyed the breakfast included.  The room was a good size.  We stayed because it was near Disneyland. (10 min drive)

Summary Heading: Very nice, comfortable, and great reception.
Summary: The rooms were a nice size as someone staying there alone. Very close to where I needed to go for business training near the Honda Center, but a cab is definitely needed to go anywhere closer to town. I was impressed however when I asked the reception desk where a good place to shop was and they had the hotel's driver take me there free of charge. Overall, great experience and would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: So near to Disney! yet peacefull and away from the crowds
Summary: We picked this hotel because of its high ratings, we were not disappointed. Nice and peaceful, away from the crowds, yet so near to Disney.  It was ten minutes from The convention centre, where we needed to be for 5 days, then ten minutes to DisneyLand on our day off. Buy an Art return bus pass for $10 dollars from the hotel reception, which will take you to Disney the buses turn up every 20 mins from 6.20 am. When returning from Disney the Art buses are right outside the entrances, wait for the number 15 to get you back to this hotel.    Breakfast is Free and is served from 6.30 to 9.30 Monday to Friday, a little later weekends.   Breakfast is served in a lovely comfortable TV dinning room right by the reception,...just find yourself a table, no table service,just clear your

I can't say enough great stuff about our stay.   This hotel is VERY clean and all the staff are very wecoming and helpful.  It was about a 15 minute drive to disneyland which is very nice.  We also went to a hockey game at the Honda Center which is right across the street.   One day we drove out to Newport Beach and it was about a 40 minute drive.  The location is very central to everything we were doing.   There is an outlet mall about 20 minutes drive away.  Rooms are large and have a fridge and microwave.  Beds are quite comfortable and it was quiet. The breakfast in the morning is great with both hot and cold choices.  They also have a social hour in the evening with drinks and snacks.  This was quite nice on the night of the hockey game as it was full of fans from the

Summary Heading: Comfortable, quiet stay in Disneyland Resort Area
Summary: Great stay in the Disneyland area. We decided to park our car at the hotel and take the shuttle to the park, which was super convenient. The staff was helpful and courteous, the room was clean and quiet, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The one thing that was amiss was the tub drain which was clogged, but we didn't mind it too much. Overall it was a great value stay very close to the park.

Friendly front desk staff; quiet, clean, spacious room: microwave, fridge, wet bar, sofa, desk; free wi-fi; free breakfast; a stone's throw from Angel Stadium; fairly close to Disneyland (on the shuttle route). There is a Fresh & Easy down the street with a good wine and cheese selection.

Had a wonderful time. Will definitely be back all was perfect. Only one recommendation if you like firm pillows then bring your own. Other than that it was so  clean and not a single complaint. Thanks Ayres for making our trip perfect.

We often stay at a hotel in Anaheim as our daughter works at a nearby theme park and cannot get away at holiday time.  We've stayed at many over the years, and Ayres Hotel meets or beats the standard of them all so far.  Beautifully clean, quiet, super helpful staff- they do it all well.

Great hotel in a great location.  We flew down from Canada to watch our hockey team so the location is perfect.  The d√©cor is a bit old for me but I guess that's what a boutique hotel is like. The staff were great and the breakfast was good.  Our room was a king suite (two king beds) and it is a perfect layout.  Worked really well for us and the price was excellent.  Quiet hotel as well, we didn't hear anything all night and there were a lot of rowdy hockey fans staying there!  :)

This hotel is perfect for the traveler coming into town for an Angels game, or a trip to Disneyland. It is located in between the new Metrolink Station, and Angel's Stadium. Quiet; clean; friendly desk staff. The beds here are extremely comfortable. The WiFi is free, and very fast. The decor is very nice, and the breakfast room is huge, adequate seating for the entire hotel. It is a bit of a drive to Disneyland, about 2 miles, but certainly away from the bustle of that area. You definitely need a car to get around. The downfall is that there is no real place to go for a breakfast/lunch if you miss the breakfast at the hotel. Again, you would need a car to drive out of the immediate area. JT Schmidt's next door had an excellent lunch menu, moderately priced.

Summary Heading: Excellent quality for the price; too far from Dland
Summary: I never would've known about this hotel if it weren't for Tripadvisor. Tripadvisor ranked it the #1 property near Disneyland at the time.   HOTEL: Overall it has a nice, newer feel to it, especially compared to other hotels in the area. It felt like a cross between a Marriott and a Hampton.   ROOMS - very comfortable bed and pillows - spacious with a wall divider for a small living room area of sorts - bathroom was quite nice and spacious, upscale  PARKING - $10 fee per night which I think is a joke for a hotel so far from Disneyland but maybe they have a good reason for it that I can't think of. Still I was quite annoyed as they just instituted this policy a few weeks before my arrival. Personally I think this is just a way for them to look like they have lower rates when
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review and for choosing us for your stay. I was pleased to read that you found our guestrooms to be of excellent quality.  I was, of course, concerned that you found the breakfast disappointing. We do pay attention to guest feedback and where possible make adjustments. Our feedback for breakfast is predominantly positive, but we are constantly looking for ways to improve it and please know that your comments are not falling on deaf ears. I do believe you caught the juice just as it ran out and I do apologize for this. I will also pass on your comments to our supplier regarding the pastries.  I also apologize if we were unyielding regarding breakfast on your arrival. We do not offer it for free if a guest happens to arrive very early, but we certainly should have happily offered the option to purchase it.  I am sorry that you found the location relative to Disney inconvenient. Many of our guests enjoy being away from the busyness of Disney. We do have a shuttle running to Disney every 20 minutes during the mornings now, and with the ARTIC a short walk away offering rides to Disney every 10 minutes, we are even more convenient than before. I am truly sorry that you would choose not return. Should we make any significant changes to our breakfast, I will be sure to let you know in the hope that we might have the opportunity to welcome you once more.   All the best,  Marcus Collins

Summary: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights for the Jets/Ducks game & Teemu Selanne tribute night. The hotel's decor is very nice, the breakfast is incredible and the staff are amazing! Special call out to Jason Johann - thank you so much for all the help you provided me prior to our arrival.  I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat, and my husband & I can't wait to go back. Oh yeah, about the beds...... sleeping on those beds must be what it would feel like to sleep on the clouds... it doesn't get much better than that!  Also, kudos to the hotel for their energy saving - the lights and tv don't work unless the key card is inserted into a special device on the wall - brilliant!

We had the king suite, it was a lovely room. We were there for the A1 Supercross, so the location was brilliant, just 10mins walk to the stadium. Also great location for seeing the sights of LA and surrounding areas. Clean, tidy and the breakfast was absolutely gorgeous.

THis hotel , truly, exceeded my expectations. The rooms were beautiful. Food was fantastic. That has to be the best "included" breakfast I have ever had and I stay at close to 75 hotels per year. The only complaint I would have is the bed. It was so damn comfortable, I didn't want to leave it and could not wait to get back to it. Would, and have, recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!!!

Stayed here for one night for Jets/Ducks hockey game. Hotel was clean and good. All the staff were great. Had some partiers in room 427 and one call to front desk after 11 pm and problem solved. Thanks Bo I think his name was. Would stay again. Checked out at 4:30 am so we never got to try the breakfast but heard from others it was good.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, and eat.
Summary: We stayed here for two nights while visiting the nearby Disney parks. Friendly staff, and a clean and tidy hotel. We liked our double queen room which was clean, well equipped and quiet. A highlight of our stay was the breakfast which included hot items prepared for you by the chef. We also utilised the guest laundry, and in spite of the bracing winter weather my kids enjoyed the outdoor pool while we enjoyed the happy hour wines and cookies. The Disney shuttle service was very convenient but remember to buy your tickets at reception as they don't sell them on the bus.  My only criticism was the carparking charge which seems unecessarily greedy.

This hotel was amazing, especially for its price.  Everyone we met at reception was incredibly friendly and helpful.  We were met upon arrival with freshly baked cookies and joined the other guests for happy hour by the fireplace with complementary beer, wine, guacamole, salsa and corn chips. My husband commented that it was probably the nicest hotel room he has ever seen and we have stayed in a number of 5 star places in the past.  The only thing was that we went specifically to visit Disneyland and it was 15-20 minutes away and the ART wasn't always on time. It was however right next door to the Honda Centre where my husband got cheap last minute tickets for a hockey game and the restaurant next door was really nice as well. We were really impressed with this hotel.

Beautiful, clean hotel right by Disneyland. Wonderful, helpful staff and huge breakfast. Take shuttle to Disney bc it's way easier than driving. Pool not in a great location (by parking lot) but we barely used it bc our purpose of trip was Disneyland.

Immediately across from the Honda Center for our Anaheim Ducks game, Ayres had lots of modern amenities without sacrificing its traditional California hotel ambience.  Our room did not have a spectacular view but we did get to see the Disneyland fireworks from our window at night.  Our room was a King suite with a sofa bed for our son.  It also had a kitchenette which really suited us during our 3 night stay and a beautiful soaking tub for nighttime bubble baths.  Breakfast was cafeteria style with some low-grade hot food options.  The pool area was very nice but the temperature of the pool was not warm enough, even for us Canadians.  The hotel staff were very helpful trying to get us around L.A. and Anaheim.  All major shuttles stopped directly in front of the lobby.  Also

What a wonderful stay at the Ayres Anaheim for a Disneyland trip. Andrew at the front desk greeted us warmly at check-in and could not have been more helpful. He answered every question. The ART bus was fantastic as we never had to move our vehicle, and the shuttle picked us up at the front door of the hotel and dropped was off at the entrance to the parks. The rooms and lobby were beautiful. Breakfast is a notch above the ordinary hotel breakfast with scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, toast, bagels, and an array of juices and coffee. We missed the evening reception as we were at the park, but what a nice touch to meet fellow guests in the lobby. I will absolutely stay at Ayres in the future.

Summary Heading: If you book though a third party, ie: hotels Tonight expect a downgrade
Summary: If you book though a third party, ie: hotels Tonight expect a downgrade  We were told since we booked through a third party - hotels tonight, they were out of King Beds and were put in a disabled persons "Queen" sized room where mattress looked more like a "full" as it didn't even come close to fitting across the queen size headboard. The bath tub has great features for a disabled person it seemed but we are both able bodied people.  Again when I called down saying We were not going to fit in such a small bed was told well you booked through Hotels Tonight so you have to take what we give you.  Not sure what happens to customer service this stay but we definitely won't be back.
Manager Response: Dear Sir,  I was disappointed to read your review. I am sorry that you were unhappy with the room type that you were allocated. At the time that you booked we did not have any rooms with a king bed available. I am sorry there was a miscommunication regarding Hotel Tonight. On the app we offer a run of house room. As you know from your previous stays using Hotel Tonight, we do book Hotel Tonight and other OTA run of house rooms into room with a king-sized bed when they are available. When those rooms are not available we have booked Hotel Tonight guests into everything from an accessible room to a one bedroom suite. Please be assured that our queen beds are indeed queen sized beds, but the large ornate headboards and spacious room size conspire to make the beds look smaller. You are not the first to mention this, so we have measured the beds ourselves just to be sure!  I was disappointed that you would no longer wish to stay again, but hope that you will reconsider and take me up on the offer I sent the morning after your stay. We have certainly valued your business over the past few years and would not wish to lose you as a loyal customer due to this experience.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I am picky. There was not one negative thing to say about this hotel. Rooms are very nice with beautiful wood framed beds. Space was nice. We had a two befroom suite and the price was very reasonable. Shuttle to Disney comes to the front door. Daily freshly made breakfast puts them over the top. Scrambled eggs with bacon or sausage and freshly made pancakes or french toast. With of course the usual cereals and fruit. I will stay at an Ayres hotel everytime if I have that option.

This was our first experience staying at an Ayres Hotel.  Fresh cookies were awaiting us upon check-in.  The lobby was beautifully decorated.  The halls have art work and moldings as do the rooms.  Breakfast was great too.  Definitely will return to the Ayres Hotel.

I wanted to take my family to Disneyland and the rose parade and game.  We had 11 people in our group with 6 adults and 5 children, 5 to 11.  The d√©cor was beautiful, the breakfast was super.  We enjoyed our stay and wished we could have stayed longer.  The shuttle was a life saver also.  Thanks to you and your staff.  Cindy Reynolds

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, will be visiting again
Summary: This year for Christmas the family took a vacation to Disneyland and we stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.  When booking the reservations it was a tough choice because of all the options of places to stay in that area.  What sold me on the Ayres were the reviews.  Each review that I read gushed about the great service and cleanliness of this hotel.  So even though I never heard of the Ayres I booked a 2 queen room for the four of us.  Upon arriving and checking in I am glad I decided to book this hotel!!    Everything was just as advertised; from the superb customer service, the look of hotel, fast wifi connection, the great full breakfast (A definite plus) and the great room!!  Big shout out to Fred at the Front desk for his infectious smile that never seemed to leave his

Summary Heading: Clean, nice location, and friendly staff
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim one night before staying at the Disneyland Hotel. It was super clean, with large well-appointed rooms. It would have been too far from the park for us over the full trip, but it was a great one-night option. The price may be appealing for larger families, as the shuttle to Disneyland in the morning was easy and convenient. Breakfast was delicious, even at 6:30 AM, with an assortment of hot and cold items. The decor is a little old fashioned, but I think the company is going for an old-school European theme.

Everything from booking our rooms to our entire stay was excellent. The manager I worked with to book our rooms was very accommodating and worked hard to make the Ayers an affordable option for our vacation. We brought 4 young adults my husband and myself, we had a two bedroom suite and a King suite and it was excellent! The shuttle service that runs to Disney is very reasonable and handy. Breakfast was very good each day and the reception on Monday was nice. Would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed the convenience and nice accomodations
Summary: Stayed here because we won 4 Disneyland passes and a hotel night here in a charity raffle. I don't think we would have picked this hotel, or even stayed at a hotel at all, since we are about 90 minutes from Disneyland and this property seems a bit out of the immediate Disneyland area. But it was a great experience. The hotel is lovely, great service, very nice rooms with upgraded bedding, free internet, good hot breakfast and ---most important -- on the ART Disney shuttle. We had the opportunity to wake up early, get to Disneyland before the Christmas rush. The hotel graciously lets you park as long as you want, so we were able to leave the car in the hotel lot and shuttle back late that night. We noted that it is very close to the Honda Center and the new gorgeous ARTIC

Summary Heading: It is awesome.   Service and hotel exceeded our expectations
Summary: Everyone working with the Ayres Hotel were efficient, helpful, kind and generous with their time.   Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back.  The inhouse shuttle service was an added unexpected bonus   A big thanks to everyone for helping make our trip fun

Summary Heading: Across the street from the Hoda Centre - 5 min walk!
Summary: Great location if you are going to the Honda Centre. Next door to JT Smidts for a bite to eat. However you are on the freeway and the sound of traffic is loud on a monday morning!!!  Only complaint is we left hot water running for 10 minutes and still was only warm.  Clean rooms, good bed and pillows.
Manager Response: Dear Jayson,  Thank you for your positive review. I am sorry that you found the hotel noisy. We are fortunate to receive few noise complaints, but if we do, it is during these quieter months when we are not assisted by the  white noise of air-conditioners. I am sorry that you found found Monday morning to be noisy. I also apologize that you had troubles with the hot water. That is remarkably frustrating. It is easily fixed by replacing the shower head, so I do hope that you were able to get the issue addressed by our maintenance department. I also hope that we will see you here again.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Stood 1 night at the Ayres for an event at the Honda center. The Honda center is right across the street, also if you want to enjoy some drinks before the show JT Shmids restaurant & brewery is across the street. The hotel it self was very clean,staff was friendly, beds were so comfy my wife and I had a great nights sleep and to top it off the hotel has a Chef which for the breakfast buffet made delicious pancakes with eggs,potatoes and sausage. I will definitely be back!

I have stayed at Ayers properties and have always enjoyed them. So disappointed in this property charging a $10 parking fee. What is that all about. I am a paying customer in your hotel, why should I have to pay to park my vehicle. In case you forgot, this is Anaheim, not Chicago.
Manager Response: Dear Peter,  I am so sorry that you were disappointed by our new parking charge. The completion of the construction of the new train station and the ever increasing demand for parking from local events has certainly created a greater need for better parking control. Most local area hotels also charge for parking. Our nominal charge of $10 plus tax is typically lower than others in the area which range between $15 and $24.   With best regards,  Marcus Collins  General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel to stay at Anaheim
Summary: Very nice hotel, friendly stuff, nice breakfast, clean rooms, shuttle to disneyland stops just front of the gate....enjoyed our stay... For hotel managements, only thing to consider is the parking charge...

Rate all aspects of our stay excellent.  The only thing that is difficult is finding an entirely quiet room since freeway is on one side and transportation center and restaurant with outdoor patio on the other. However, staff gave us a nice room in the quietest area and even put adults without children in the same area. This was a terrific plus with hotel being so close to Disneyland. Staff was really great. Breakfast fine too and the cleanliness of entire facility extremely good. Five star rating deserved.

Wonderful hotel with great customer service! Rooms wereour  comfortable, clean, and beautifully decorated (especially wall decor). The shuttle to and from Disney was easy to use, and the drivers were personable and friendly. The hotel had a nice social hour with beer, wine, and chips which added a nice touch to our stay. And the breakfast was filling - a full breakfast, not one filled with junk that leaves everyone hungry in an hour. Love this hotel and the staff!
