Reading the history informed me that it has been family owned and passed down within the family for years. You can definitely feel the family touch while still having all the amenities of a large hotel. I highly recommend Ayres Hotels! Too bad there are none in Texas!

Summary Heading: Good Hotel, just not perfect for us this trip
Summary: First, this would be the only place I would stay if I was going to an event at the Honda Center, The Ayres is right across the street. It is also close to the Angels stadium, although I don't know if you would want to walk it.     The Ayres rooms are very nice, well appropriated with a European flair.  The staff is excellent, very friendly no matter what time of day you come in.   Breakfast was good, not great, seems to be the same thing everyday.     This was a Disneyland trip for us, and would not be our first choice as a Disneyland Hotel.  Its a little farther then most of the other Disneyland hotels and not as easy to get to or from Disneyland. It also does not have a family vibe, that other hotels have.  They have also joined most other Hotels and now charge for parking.

From Jose at Breakfast, to Estela who cleans the room, and the amazing front desk staff - the Ayres Hotel aims to make the stay pleasant for everyone. They continually bend over backwards to make it a great stay.  I highly recommend.

After spending hours researching motels and resorts near Disneyland and being severely disappointed I found Ayres Anaheim. The ratings looked to good to be true. After my families stay I think they are underrated. The local motels averaged a 1 to a 3.3 star rating from customers, Ayres had a 3.9, I would rate them 5 out of 5. European style motel, friendly service, immaculately clean and detailed rooms, great wifi. A heated pool and Jacuzzi to relax the muscles after 17 miles of hiking Disney. The hotel is 2 miles away from Disney but the shuttles arrive about every 20 minutes, and passes can be purchased for cheaply at the concierge. I saved the best for last. They have a full breakfast eggs, bacon or sausage, pancakes, cereals, donuts, etc every day, all to be eaten in a very

Ayres became one of my favorite hotels this last weekend. We stayed there while my daughter danced in the Disney Land Parade. We liked everything about Ayres, starting from the d√©cor to the comfortable bedding and the convenient breakfast. We liked the evening social hour with the wine, chips and salsa, and met some interesting people. Ayres is located close to everything. The shuttle ride to Disney Land was a bit longer than I expected and bumpy, but worth not to have to drive there. The shuttle is not free and you also have to pay for parking at the hotel ($10/night). All in all we really enjoyed our stay and will go back.

Summary Heading: Our Favorite place to stay when we visit Disney
Summary: Me and my husband live in SD and have Disneyland annual passes. This is the only hotel we like to stay in. You got great breakfast the rooms are so clean the location is perfect. I'm one of those people that the first thing I do is pull the sheets off my bed to  make sure there's no hair or anything gross in my bed and every time I stay here the sheets are crisp. I sleep like a baby! I could stay at a Disney hotel if I want to but I save over $250 a night plus  I get great full breakfast included. What more can I ask for!!

This was a fabulous hotel.  The rooms were very comfortable, spacious and clean.  The breakfast was very good, the cook during the week was very friendly.  Cookies in the evening were delicious.  Definitely would stay here again.  Ride on the ART bus was a little longer than I had hoped but other than that a perfect stay.  We got delivery one night from an Italian/Pizza joint that had a menu in the room and the food was very good.

This is my second time time in Ayres in 2 years. Whenever I visit Disneyland in Anaheim, my family always stay there. It is very friendly for families with small kids, like mine. The complimentary breakfast is awesome! The chef is friendly and cooks the best pancakes and French toasts!

Very nice! Clean, quiet, nice amenities and friendly staff. Breakfast is very good! Happy hour is very nice touch with good atmosphere. Very close to Honda Center and Anaheim Angels Stadium. Disneyland only a few miles away.

Summary Heading: Great value, nice room - just down the street from Disneyland - take shuttle rather than park - drops off at entrance.
Summary: Hotel was excellent - only compliant was a little noisy as my room faced the Honda stadium and game got out with cars leaving, honking .... Great value and nice breakfast included. Also free wifi and free parking - would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great nights sleep, location not bad either
Summary: We stayed here last Sunday and not one complaint.  Place was packed because of Fleetwood Mac concert. Entire family slept through the night. For a hotel bathroom was super nice with large tub. Complimentary breakfast, had cook on hand actually making food there not microwave. Staff all pleasant

Summary Heading: Great hotel away from Disney but close enough
Summary: Great spot with clean rooms, friendly staff, easy parking and a free breakfast. The beds are good but the room was messy when we arrived. Just a few things out of place.   The brekfast is simple and filling. Basic egg, potato and bacon.   A nice place to stay and get some rest for your adventures at the Honda center or Disney. Art 15 heads straight there.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel convenient to all activities in Anaheim.
Summary: Great hotel. Using Anaheim Irapid transit to Disney was very convenient. Hotel beds are wonderful. Just right for my back. Hot tub is great also. Friendly staff. Very close to Honda Center.  Don't confuse with other Ayre's hotels nearby.

Summary Heading: Repeat of last year...Great stay but lost the game.
Summary: This is another enjoyable experience for a centrally located hotel. Except for the final few minutes of the hockey game everything was just perfect. My team lost again. Darn shootouts! I really can't add too much more than the other reviewers have said. But I would like to mention the Ayres reward program. We visit SoCal quite a bit and try to locate the closest Ayres hotels for us to stay. We accumulate points for our stay and use them to receive free nights. We have stayed at various Ayres properties throughout the state and each one has an excellent staff, quality rooms and delicious full breakfast to start you off in the morning. Don't hesitate to sign up for this program. It is well worth it.

I was very pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Ayers of Anaheim. From the web site, it looked like a nice hotel, but when I actually arrived it was beautiful, clean and comfortable. Further, this hotel is strategically located within walking distance of the just-opened Anaheim Intermodal Transportation Station, the Honda Center (where I attended a Fleetwood Mac concert), and numerous restaurants and shopping centers. Also, the 57 Freeway is just a block away giving easy access to LA's extensive freeway system. Finally, Disneyland is close with the hotel providing shuttle service to that world-famous amusement park and it's sister park California Adventure. In the Anaheim area, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Right across the street from the Honda Center and up the street is the Train Station just around the corner Angels Stadium and just a few miles away Disneyland ......... Such a great place to stay the evening, beds were very comfortable and the room was spotless when we arrived in ours - will defintely give them another opprotunity to earn my business. Breakfast was great as well....could'nt of asked for more ! Thank you Ayres Hotel Anaheim -

Very cozy hotel & a great location - we attended the Fleetwood Mac concert at the Honda center and it's directly across the street within easy walking distance.  Very reasonably priced and much less than taking a towne car with driver.

We stayed here for our recent trip to Disneyland. We were concerned about the it being two miles from the park. But the city of Anaheim runs a bus service that picks you up right at the hotel that runs every half hour same way coming back. This was very painless to use. The rooms are large and very clean and well appointed. Staff is great and the morning breakfast is a great way to start things off. I would stay here again far and above much better than the places right across from the park.

This is my second stay and an Ayers hotel. 10 min from Disneyland and right next to highway 57.The room, amenities and the service and staff were fabulous just as our first stat in Ontario. I would definitely recommend staying there.

Summary Heading: Found a great hotel to stay at and not expensive either!
Summary: Close to Disneyland by ART bus, walk across the street to Honda Center, Walk to Angels stadium, close to freeway.   Entire staff was very friendly and accommodating. I really felt like a guest in someones home. I would recommend to anyone going to this area. We will return to this hotel when traveling to this area every time. No need to look elsewhere.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, close to Honda Center and Disney
Summary: This was our first stay in an Ayres property, and it was just like described, personable and small-ish.  It is easy to get to Disneyland by car or shuttle (ART), the Honda center is just across the road and Angels stadium is walking distance.   Service at the Ayres was consistently great.  The room (executive studio with 2 queen beds) was a more like a large average double queen room than an executive studio, but it was enough room for a family of four to spend a night comfortably.  The furnishings in the room and in the lobby were a little tired, but were clean and comfortable.  The price was midrange and included breakfast, but since it was a holiday weekend, that was a good value.  Note that parking costs $10.  I would consider the Ayres for future stays in Anaheim.

Clean, comfortable room with a soft bed and lots of pillows ! TV controller that actually works ! More than just a continental breakfast. Big bathroom . Only thing that concerned me was that there was no screens on the window. Potential safety issue for children ! Our family would definitely stay there again !

This hotel was booked upon high recommendations from family friends who regularly travel to Anaheim / Disneyland.   The rooms were extremely large. Fitted with a half kitchen and spacious bathroom. Plenty of room for a family with kids, or in my situation sharing with my sister. The rooms were very clean as housekeeping do a thorough job.  The price per night was excellent, considering that breakfast was included.   Location - probably a 15/20 bus ride to Disneyland and chain food outlets. But we did not encounter any issues with this and actually preferred it as it was quieter. We were lucky enough to go to a NHL  game and it was only a short distance, as the stadium is directly opposite the hotel.   Check in - we encountered an issue approximately 24 hours after we checked in.

Nice clean and fresh smelling rooms with comfy beds. Rooms are very well priced for what you get. The fridge, microwave and coffee maker and wifi were all included.  You will be glad you stayed here. I can't say enough about the service. Have to pay for parking. Parking is not FREE.

Our family spent two nights at this hotel while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure the week of Thanksgiving. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. There were a lot of families at the hotel but while in our room there wasn't any noticeable noise.Our room was located on the second floor. There was a nice selection of hot and cold food choices for breakfast. My husband was happy to find some gluten-free options. For those of you visiting the Disneyland Resort, there is a paid shuttle that runs to the park. If you are there for a hockey game, the stadium is a block away. We found a few good places to eat that took us about 15 minutes to walk to. Also, there is a fee to park at the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

It is a great value! We were able to easily take a shuttle to Disneyland which was great. We at breakfast before we went and got back late but beds were comfortable. I would recommend this to anyone. It was clean and safe.

Second stay at Ayres Anaheim. Its across the street for Honda Center where Anaheim Ducks play their home games. No traffic chaos getting to and from the arena, just walk to your bed.  Its a really nice warm hotel, with nice rooms. Had connections rooms, and it worked perfect for us. Breakfast is well above average. If you got kids with you, ask them to make Mickey-Pancake for you. Really cool for the kids.

Summary Heading: This will be where I stay from now on when visiting the area!
Summary: Staff was always helpful, friendly and accommodating! Lovely rooms, excellent breakfast, great hot tub. Loved that we were so close to major highways, yet could not hear any traffic noise in our room.  Enjoyed being with such a diverse group of ages and nationalities.  I have already started recommending the hotel to friends.

We spent 2 nights here and it was fantastic. The front desk staff were excellent and made us feel welcome. They have a happy hour in the lobby each day which really appreciated. The hotel is between the Honda Center and Angel stadium. It is a fair way from Disneyland but they have shuttle that runs twice an hour - door to door. Next to the hotel is a great hotel/brewery that serves great meals and a large selection of beers. The rooms were spacious with a separate lounge area and were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. I would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it.

I stayed with Ayres Hotel Anaheim 2 times already and it is BEYOND amazing!   What I love: - Beautiful decoration during Christmas - Reasonable Price - Convenient (ART) to Disneyland - DELICIOUS breakfast!  - Comfortable bed- very clean  - Two sinks and separate from Toilet/Tub.... with 3 other female friends, this saved us A LOT of time.   What I didn't like - I am a Canucks fan so.......seeing the Ducks celebrating across the street during the playoff! :P

Just returned from 4 nights @ Ayers Anaheim. Our purpose to Anaheim was strictly to do Disney Land/California Adventure. Our room was ready early which was much appreciated. Check in was informative -the procedure for ART shuttle bus was quickly explained to us so we could get going to Disney. Our room (King bed plus pull out) was very roomy and clean. The front desk agent saw us heading out and had housekeeping make the pull out for our child as he knew we would be tired when we returned (very thoughtful). We took advantage of the manger special(not available on Friday) a few times. Basic snack's with Wine and Beer, it is a nice extra. Also the American breakfast in the am. We noticed it can get pretty crazy in there after the 8:00am on rush, so if you are a earlier riser it

Four ladies stayed here for 3 nights.  Nice comfortable room. Staff was welcoming from the beginning, clean room, nice breakfast, more than the normal hotel fare. Andrew was a life saver, he shuttled us as close as he could to the Disneyland property when all the roads were closed for the 1/2 marathon trying to get us to the finish line!  The ART failed us ...not the hotel! The negatives of our stay bathroom exhaust fan extremely loud!  Clean bath towel had a wad of hair inside of it.

The room was beautiful, clean and the bed was so comfortable, just heavenly! The inclusive breakfast was fantastic, delicious bacon, among several other choices. For the price, I would not prefer to stay anywhere else!

This hotel was perfect! Beautiful rooms, beautiful lobby, delicious free breakfast! I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. Will definitely stay at Ayres hotels when possible. check in was very easy and quick.

Great room and location to the hockey arena. Staff very helpful.  Will definitely stay there again.  Room was clean and great comfortable bed.  The full breakfast was good.  Cook present to cook the food and serve it

Lovely hotel, staff wonderful, their shuttle very accommodating took us to pick up our car and to catch another shuttle to south coast plaza. Rooms were lovely and very big, hotel was near Angel stadium and Honda centre, would recommend.

Summary Heading: Ayres, one of the better places we've stayed
Summary: A couple of miles from Disneyland but a regular shuttle gets you there for very little money. ($5 full day use on any or all of the numerous shuttle destinations).  Helpful staff, knowledgable and friendly. Helped me with booking online the super shuttle LAX service ($17 each one way).   Online  hotel check in allows you to select rooms and extras - special requests before you get there. Rooms were quiet and a good size. They are double glazed so any traffic noise was muted and no problem.  Outdoor pool & spa, not the strongest jets but still relaxing.  Parking was free, they give you a note to place on the dashboard.  We thought the rooms looking at the Honda Center would be a bit droll, why look at a car service area.  It turned out to be the name of the stadium that houses

We normally stay at a hotel within walking distance to Disneyland, but decided to try something new. Based on the reviews on Trip Advisor - we decided to try the Ayres hotel.  We booked months in advance, so we got a great rate.  Here are my thoughts on the hotel.  Location - Across the street from the Honda Centre and right off the highway which was very convenient. It was about a 12 minute shuttle ride to Disneyland.  Room - We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds on the 3rd floor and had a view of the Honda Centre.  The room was very spacious and clean and the beds were comfortable.  They also have a mini fridge and microwave - which was very handy since we had our baby with us.  Staff - Everyone was very pleasant and helpful!    Food - The free breakfast in the mornings were

Initially booked on line from Australia using mainly the Trip Advisor ratings as our guide.  First thoughts where that we were a long way from the Disney area but quickly found that the local ART shuttle system was convenient and easy to use for a small fee.  The hotel accommodations where very comfortable and clean with good quality d√©cor.  The staff were very attentive and helpful and where possible would be only too happy to do short trips on the hotel bus.    The afternoon 'sundowner/happy hour' was a pleasant and a surprisingly free touch.  The included breakfast was adequate but for any stays over 2 or 3 days the same variety of offerings became very tired. All in all, after our first reservations about the location, we found the hotel to be totally adequate and lives up

Summary Heading: Close enough to Disneyland Resort without all the riff-raff
Summary: Pros: ‚Ä¢ Conveniently located to the stadiums and a 10-minute drive to Disneyland. ‚Ä¢ Breakfast buffet ‚Ä¢ Lower rates than hotels near Disneyland Resort. ‚Ä¢ A little musty when you first walk in, but it's a pleasant & spotless hotel otherwise. ‚Ä¢ Very friendly staff (which they should normally be, right?) ‚Ä¢ Comfortable bed and decent pillows.  Cons: ‚Ä¢ Having to pay $10 (PLUS TAX!) for parking.  Really.  You're already spending $$$ to stay there.  A lot of other hotels charge, but still.  They made a big deal about keeping stadia event parkers out of their parking lot.  All they have to do is give check-ins a pass to place on their dashboard. ‚Ä¢ The maid service pulled the card from the room's eco-friendly thermostat, so each day I returned to a slightly uncomfortable room.  Not a
Manager Response: Dear Robert,  Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I was pleased to read that you enjoyed your stay and appreciated the service, breakfast, d√©cor and cleanliness. I am sorry that you came across some noise issues. Your recommendation of the bathroom fan was wise. Typically the air-conditioners provide adequate cover, but this time of year requires less cooling. I was also sorry to hear that the odor of breakfast was an unpleasant feature of your stay. You stayed in the closest room to our breakfast room, however we do want to address the issue and will review options with our maintenance and housekeeping department.   We are investing in a material for the room you used and its neighbor to prevent slippage so we are confident that danger will be taken care of before long. I am sorry that you found the floor slippery.  I was pleased to read that you would stay again and hope that we will be able to provide you with a room that would better suit you. Please do let us know your requests at the time of booking to give us the best opportunity to meet your needs.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This was our first time staying at Ayres Anaheim as we previously stayed at Ayres Orange on three occasions.  We were always impressed with Ayres Orange but Ayres Anaheim was even better.  The rooms are nicely appointed and the AC ran smoothly and was not too loud. Great selection of channels on the TV.  The breakfast in the morning was fantastic and the staff were so pleasant and hospitable.  We watched the Ducks play on Sunday and the Honda Centre was right across the street.  Driving the DL was easy as we driver straight on Katella to get to the Toy Story Lot.  We used the pool and found it to be great also.    The only way this hotel is amazing is because of its great staff and management.

Stayed 10 nights at this wonderful hotel and I can see why it's rated so highly on Trip Advisor.  Even before travelling I contacted the hotel with some questions and Marcus Collins provided immediate helpful responses.  The room was a good size given there was 4 our us sharing (2 aduts/2 kids), and the decor was superb.  Staff were so friendly and helpful and everything was lovely and clean.  Jose, the breakfast chef, was a lovely chap and the kids adored both him and his mickey mouse pancakes.  I cannot speak highly enough of this Hotel and would most definitely stay again

For events at the Honda Center this hotel is literally across the road, and offers a very clean and upscale hotel at a moderate cost. For Disney attractions, it offers a shuttle. The Breakfast was excellent for the hotel class.

Summary Heading: Just what I was looking for.
Summary: I've stayed here before and decided to return when I was looking for a spot near Disneyland. It's 2 miles away. The staff was very friendly. The rooms are a good size and well-kept and up-to-date. The beds are amazingly comfortable, which made it hard to leave in the morning. We had a complimentary breakfast of eggs, hash browns, sausage, and pancakes - cooked to order. The hotel coffee was even pretty good (I was surprised by that one). The only downside was that the wifi connection was unstable. Luckily, I didn't really need to be online so it wasn't too big of a deal. Without a doubt, I would return to this location. Oh, and the rates were reasonable. I am a Disney annual passholder and got an additional discount.

Good room with great breakfast (including fun cook). A bit far from the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland, but the ART bus (every 30min) makes it easy to get there. People at desk were always cheerful and social hour is a great idea. In my opinion, the only improvement would be the bathroom, that from the price standard I thought would be bigger. Would totally recommend it to anyone.

The Ayres is located across the street from the Honda Center, within walking distance of Angels stadium and a short shuttle bus ride to Disneyland. This trip to Anaheim was a visit to Disneyland. We've stayed at this property before and have always enjoyed our stay. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The breakfast menu is freshly cooked throughout the morning with ample seating for hotel guests.They have decent bottles of wine at a reasonable price for purchase if you choose to unwind at the end of your day in the room. JT Scmid's Restaurant and Brewery is also across the street for good food and drink options. I would recommend using the Disney shuttle service since it is cheaper than paying for parking and you have to take a

A beautiful Hotel with great hospitality and location. Clean large rooms, hot full breakfast and for a minimal fee a shuttle to DisneyLand all day until the park closes at midnight. We were very happy with our choice, it exceeded our expectations and we will definitely be choosing other Ayer hotels on our travels. We rented a car but still chose to take shuttle because of its convenience and it was only a 10-15 min shuttle right to the main gate of DisneyLand. We did not want to stay in the hotel zone across from DisneyLand, very busy and we spoke to a couple of people that were staying along that strip and they were not pleased with the cleanliness of the rooms. Every evening they have snacks and beverages both alcoholic and non for the guests, they called our room about 30 min

Summary Heading: Great hotel in a convenient location
Summary: My son and I were in the area for a tour of a nearby college and were looking for a nice hotel in the area that would not be too expensive. We were so happy and lucky to have discovered Ayres Hotel Anaheim! Beautiful accommodations with extremely nice and helpful staff and a free breakfast that was incredible. We wish we had more time to stay and relax and explore all that the area has to offer.

Summary Heading: Great Proximity to sporting venues, Disneyland
Summary: Our HS marching band chose to stay at the Ayres Hotel and I am glad that we did.  They had a great hot breakfast each morning served up by Jose, the head chef.  The rooms were energy efficient and beds were comfortable.  Rooms have both a fridge and a microwave.  You are within a half a block of the Honda Center and driving distance of Anaheim stadium.  A new transit hub is being built a block away as well so access to trains will be nice as well..The hotel offers shuttle service to Disneyland for $5 per person per day or there is parking at the hotel if you want to take your own car to Disneyland as well.  The hotel has 2 conference rooms that can be reserved for having a place for your group to have devotionals or just someplace to play board games.  We are glad we picked

We were very impressed with the hotel and would highly recommend it to friends and family.  The staff was friendly and helpful, the location was perfect for visiting Disneyland and traveling to other Los Angeles area attractions.  My wife, three-year-old son, and myself would love to come back very soon!

This hotel is awesome for people of all ages. It has an awesome resturant that serves a variety of food that everyone in your party will love. Also, everyone will have a great time sleeping in the clean and bed bug free enviroment. Finally, the decor is beautiful. It helps the hotel look stunning.

If I could give this hotel 10 stars I would.  I highly recommend this hotel.  I took a group of 50 high school students to the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim for 4 days.  This hotel was AMAZING!!  The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. They had all of our student's room keys organized in envelopes with their names on the envelope, and a color coded master list which was so very helpful to me as a tour host.  The furniture and decor were absolutely beautiful!  I spent time in the lobby each day admiring the paintings and the very ornate and beautiful frames as well.  The rooms were wonderful and the beds were so comfortable.  The breakfast was changed each morning for a variety and they use real silverware in the dining room.  The children were thanking me the whole time for

We stayed here for our 5 day trip to disneyland and it was great! The staff is so friendly and really go out of their way to make sure you're taken care of! Everything about this hotel was amazing. The rooms are nice and very well kept.  The hot breakfast was delicious and the fruit was fresh and tasted better than I expected. The chef was also super friendly and even made our son Mickey pancakes. I can keep going but overall we have nothing negative to say... We will definitely be staying there again next time we go to disneyland!

I stayed at this hotel for a week for leisure whilst visiting L.A. It was recommended to me and I always believe personal recommendations beat reviews. I was not disappointing. In fact, my expectations for this hotel where exceeded. The hotel on first look seems old, however it is more a charming quaint design when it is all seen.   The hotel is less then 5 minutes by car to Disney, a 30-45 minute drive (traffic dependent) to LAX airport, an hour to Six Flags amusement park and 30 minutes to "downtown" L.A.  The hotel has a large car park at the front and side of the property and is free to use for guests. The car park is easy to get into and a welcome break for the manic L.A traffic! (if you have driven in L.A you will know what I mean, if you have yet to have this pleasure,

Good hotel with friendly staff. Generous breakfast and reasonable speed internet. No safe in room, which is wired. Not good sound insulation between rooms. No facility for tea, but just it was for coffee.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel very close to disney.
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and I really liked this place. The rooms were very clean and nicely appointed my only advice would be to get to breakfast early it gets busy in there. We got a pretty good deal on our rooms which made this a cheaper alternative to the disney hotels and we found it to be a nicer and larger room. Also would be a great spot if going to a ducks game it's across the street from the arena.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel we Stayed at while in California
Summary: Stayed here for four days, while vacationing in L.A. We started our California tour in San Francisco and ended in LA., Out of the four hotels we stayed, the Ayres in Anaheim was by far the best. There were four of us staying in the room, and we were not crowded at all in the double room. The room was very clean and quiet. The decorations were upscale. The queen beds were very comfortable. and the bathroom very roomy. There was a chef on duty each morning for the complimentary breakfast.  Speaking of complimentary, there is also a snack, and wine tasting time each evening. We were late checking in and missed the first evenings wine tasting, and were given a complimentary bottle of wine for the first night. Everyone working at the Ayres was very helpful. I can highly recommend

Love staying here when I'm in the area.  It's close to everything, is super clean and all at a great price... The rooms are nice and quiet so you are sure to get a peaceful night's sleep.   Can't miss with this one...

The hotel is nice, clean and generally the room was good with all of the basics such as tv, mini fridge, air con, coffee maker etc. A very special mention to their beds. They are superb, comfortable, fluffy and made our stay so much better. My whole review could be about the lovely beds! There is a guest laundry if you need to do washing. They have a safety deposit box system at the desk. The breakfast was varied with lots of hot & cold options and the chefs were really friendly. There is an ART bus which comes to the hotel for Disneyland & the Anaheim areas. The hotel is a small drive from Disneyland but no problem due to the transport options available. It has guest parking and was quiet. We would stay here again.

Stayed here for one night before transit to the other hotel. First impression, it was a lovely hotel and have a sense of Europe / British decoration. The room was spacious and clean (personally I think it can be better). One think, personally I would recommend them, is to put the bottle drinking water in the room, which I don't find any in my room.  Breakfast was alright and love the scramble eggs. And on the other hand, not much for me to comment since I don't have enough time to use other facilities in the hotel, but overall it was a good and peaceful stay after the long haul flight i had from my country.  The hotel also quite near to Honda Center, which is great and some other restaurant around the hotel which I found it quite convenience.  The only thing traveling in US, you

Summary Heading: The Ayres Hotel in Anaheim - A lovely choice in Southern California
Summary: The Ayres is a lovely European style hotel with outstanding service that goes above and beyond for every guest.  Conveniently located, upscale, comfortable with breakfast included for the busy business traveler or family visiting Southern California.  I have been a guest at the Ayres for business travel and pleasure travel for past several years and find the hotel and service to be consistently professional and charming.  Marcus, the quintessential GM, and his entire staff run the hotel like conscientious innkeepers.  I give the Ayres the highest possible rating.

Loved the location as there for one night to catch a Anaheim ducks game. Hotel amenities were fine but a little old fashion but otherwise clean. The free breakfast was excellent with a cook/chef making hot meals and in room WiFi was a bonus. All and all good stay no complaints.

We stayed here for our recent trip to Disneyland. The staff were fantastic & SUPER friendly and helpful!! Disneyland is about 2 1/2 miles from this location, but one may take the shuttle that comes every half hour.   We will def stay here again :)

We stayed for 4 nights and just loved everything about this place ,super clean friendly staff can't fault the place can't wait to come back,enjoyed ordering food from restaurant from across the rd which was delivered to our room

The hotel is really nice.  Clean and comfy rooms.  I love the ceiling fans!  We had a room facing the freeway and pool and it was quiet.  The breakfast is one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had.  Jose was making Mickey pancakes for the kids and we got bacon, sausage, potatoes and scrambled eggs as well as all the Continental things like cereal and donuts.  My biggest con was we were there to go to Disneyland with my 3 year old and found the ART bus to be a pain.  It wasn't on time and here I was with a sleeping, heavy kid on my shoulder with no place to sit down for a long time.  Our bus #15 never showed up one night so my husband went to talk to the #14 bus and the guy gave us a ride.  We normally stay right outside the main gate and find walking back to our room

Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who will be staying in the Anaheim area.  The staff are very helpful and professional. Sumptuous and spacious hotel rooms that feel as though they were transported from Italy.  Yummy hot breakfasts.    Away from the busyness of downtown Disney but just a 5-10 minute shuttle away from Disneyland/California Adventure. The ART arrives on the hour and half hour at the hotel and returns from the #15 stop at Disneyland at quarter after and quarter to.   Really enjoyed the early evening fresh cookies, chips and salsa, juice and beer... made us feel at home.    Only negatives would be the lack of grocery stores & restaurants within walking distance and noise from the Honda Center across the street (before 9:30p.m.) when there is the

This hotel is great, we arrived after a 12 hour flight from New Zealand.  Rooms were lovely and clean, the staff were amazing and really friendly and helpful. It is a little distance from Disneyland but there is a great transport system that picks you up outside every half hour and brings you back. The breakfast was included and good quality.  The staff really made it for us, they went out of their way to help us, and even gave us a lift to the Outlets at Orange shopping area. It is quiet and the rooms are really large.  We will definitely stay here again next time we visit.  Andrew on the front desk was excellent.

We recently stayed at this Ayres for 3 nights on vacation.  I can't say enough about how nice the room was, how friendly and helpful the staff, the good location, the great breakfast, the terrific afternoon hospitality with free wine, cookies, etc.  We would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend it to others. Because of its proximity to Disneyland, the hotel has many hyper-excited small children as guests; this leads to the loud patter of little feet running across your room ceiling, and a sometimes very noisy breakfast room.  To address these issues, I would recommend a) get a room on the upper floor, and b)go to breakfast either very early or very late. But these are small and controllable issues, and the hotel is so good that I do not hesitate to recommend it

This was our first time at this Hotel.  We were attracted by the reviews and the discount available for Disneyland Season Pass Holders.  Our overall opinion was excellent.  It was clean (it even smelled clean), friendly staff and well appointed room.  We normally stay at either the Town Place suites or the Holiday Inn nearby.  Breakfast was great with a chef actually cooking and serving the main dish.  Easy access and being on the ARTS route are pluses.  We did eveything on line and it was easy even to the opportunity to choose the location of the room.  Free Wi-Fi, etc make this a place we will stay at again.

This hotel is great.  The beds are extremely comfortable.  The breakfast was very satisfying.  I found the staff to be quite accommodating.  The hotel was extremely clean.  I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

The staff were more than friendly and helpful. The hotel is going green so you have to use a card to turn on lights and a/c so the room was warm at first but quickly cooled off. Will definitely be back

Outstanding service. The rooms are huge with very comfortable bed and pillows. Plenty of soft clean towels.  Microwave and fridge is a plus Morning breakfast was good and the chef was awesome, greeted us every morning and gave generous portions- best example of service with a smile :-) Free wi-fi also a plus.  Really much better stay than in any big chain hotel. Helps to have free parking, so really sad that they will start charging now as it does not seem to be other options for parking near by.  In conclusion we love our stay and will definitely come back here in our next trip to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Most bang for your buck here!
Summary: Great location. Better price.  We've stayed many places here, on & off Disney.  Much nicer room & amenities for the price.  Trade off is the 15' bus journey to & fro the parks (with stops etc). Great breakfast.  Nice rooms.  Small workout room(treadmill/bike/weights). Outdoor pool (no time to use).  Got the job done in much nicer fashion than some other "good neighbor" hotels w/ 10-15' walks.  Try it!  It's worth the wait (just don't close the park down;)

First trip to usa! Excellent service from staff, we arrived at 6am and by 11am they had a room ready for us. Great location for Disney land, 5 $5 shuttle return. If your looking to do things in LA I would suggest staying in LA as anaheim is not very close to LA. They have a great happy hour here, cookies are delicious! Free wine,beer and cookies. Only suggestion I could make is that they provide washing detergent for customers staying long term. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

The staff is great...always feels like coming home!  Breakfast is the best!  Marcus (the manager) is friendly and responsive.  The location is great for us...half way between Disneyland and Chapman University.

I only stayed 1 night. I was attending a conference at the City National Grove of Anaheim and this hotel location is right up the street, less than 10 minutes away. It's also right across the street from the Honda Center. The furnisings are a little dated, but the bed was very confortable, the room was quiet, and the staff were courteous. There is another Ayers hotel on City Drive Brand new), so make sure you know which one you are staying at and which location works better for you. I didn't get to have breakfast because I left the hotel at 5:30am.

Summary Heading: Great vacation to Disneyland in Anaheim
Summary: The hotel is great. I arrived late at the hotel on a Saturday evening and it was very busy, but Fred (Front Counter) was able to  help me check  in with no problems. He gave a room on the other side of the hotel away from the crowd attending the baseball game at Anaheim Stadium. I'm so glad he did!    I liked the free breakfast early in the morning for the seven days we stayed at this hotel (Sausages/Bacon, scrambled eggs and hash browns, in addition to fruits, cereal, doughnuts, hot chocolate, milk, fruit juices and lemonade. I could be any happier with the great selection of items!). We had to Queen/Full size beds and they were both very comfortable. Nothing like a very comfortable bed where you can put your body on and rest after spending a crazy day at Disneyland.  The hotel

This is a lovely hotel with nice amenities.  My room was like a suite, sitting area plus sleeping room.  The breakfast is very good.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Walk to the Honda Center.  Thanks for a very nice stay!

Summary Heading: Disneyland vacation,  BEYOND happy with this hotel and experience! !!!
Summary: So many great things about this hotel where to start?  The complementary breakfast...WOW! Best I've ever had. Eggs, potatoes,  bacon, sausage, pancakes, French toast hot and freshly made. Of course there was also cereal bagels fresh fruit juices coffee. This was a Disneyland vacation,  Ayres has the ART, aneheim resort transit, so easy and affordable.  It picks u up in front of hotel and drops u off right in front of Disneyland. Runs every 30 minutes. We took a lunch break everyday and ate right across the street at the brewery, great happy hour and excellent food. Then while waiting for the ART to go back to the park we enjoyed complimentary happy hour in the lobby of hotel :) The room was great.  We stayed in the studio king suit, got an amazing deal on expedia. Bed was

Summary Heading: Perfect Hotel for Honda Center Concerts and Events
Summary: So this hotel was perfect in so many ways! First the staff was so friendly and helpful++. They have a welcome reception with beer, wine, chips and fresh cookies! The rooms are BIG and the Beds were so comfortable! Ayers is also so close to Honda Center that you just walked across the street and your there and no $20.00 parking and crazy waiting to get in n out of the venue! Oh yeah and a great breakfast buffet the next morning with pancakes, eggs, bacon and hash-browns plus more! So don't be afraid to book this hotel when you plan a concert, game or Disney (even saw a Disney shuttle outside)! It rocks!

I stayed at the Ayres for almost a month.  I couldn't be happier with my visit, the staff was helpful and polite, the hotel was clean inside and out, and the happy hour every evening was a welcome home while I was away from home.  I slept well every night and never worried once about my valuables disappearing.  I was there for 26 days and never even had to ask for a towel, soap, nothing.  The location can't be beat.  Walking distance to Honda Center and Angel Stadium, and a free shuttle to Disney.  I would definitely stay again if I was traveling for pleasure.

Summary Heading: It's All Been Said - What A Surprise!
Summary: TripAdvisor comes through again. This hotel is #1 in Anaheim for a reason. Actually, you could place it in almost any city, and it would be right up there on top. I have to agree with every positive comment made by my fellow travelers. This hotel does not have the extreme luxury of the Fairmont, but it does not have the price tag either. At every turn there are little touches that make it better than the average chain hotel. A complimentary hot breakfast is freshly prepared, and served by a professional chef. Unexpectedly, on the mornings we were there, serving hours were actually extended to accommodate several guests they knew would be late risers. Staff is extremely well-trained, and pleasant. We were welcomed and assisted by Fred when arriving, and taken care of by Andrew

Summary Heading: Not too bad, but not that good
Summary: Let me start by saying I stayed here for business and not for Disney stuff, as most of the other guests I saw appeared to be in town for Disneyland.  Pros: - Rate includes a breakfast buffet with hot food - Good location for Anaheim attractions - Clean room - Friendly staff  Cons: - Furnishings and overall look of hotel seemed very dated - A/C units are loud and seemed to run non-stop even on "auto" setting - Conference room was terrible (almost no outlets to charge laptops/phones, uncomfortable chairs, impossible to keep a comfortable & constant temperature) - Crappy toiletries, no conditioner - Bad wifi signal in some rooms - Lots of shrieking kids around the hotel

Our stay at the Ayers was just great. The hotel is clean, convenient to attractions and well appointed. The staff is friendly and informative. Our room was large, clean and nicely decorated. The price included a breakfast buffet that was better than some restaurants. The food was good. The service was fast and efficient. We would definitely stay there again.

This hotel has been our "go to" hotel in Anaheim for several years.  The location is convenient for what we need when in the area.  The rooms are large, clean and well maintained.  The staff is very efficient, friendly and competent.  The breakfast offers a great selection and the cook has a great way of interacting with guests and helping them start their day.  The desk staff (Andrew, Sherry, Fred and others) go out of their way to be helpful.

If you plan on staying in Anaheim and are going to an Angels game or the Honda Center, this is the place.  You can walk to either venue and be thankful you don't have to deal with the crazy traffic.  Very nice rooms.

Summary Heading: The Eagles concert and the Ayres
Summary: We love staying at the Ayres.  It's so convenient for going to the Honda Center.  This is one of our two favorite hotels.  The rooms are so elegant and we feel pampered staying here.  The rooms are large and the layout is perfect.  The breakfast is the best we've had.  They served pancakes, sausage, scrambled eggs and the best potato tots as well as the usual cold cereals, fruit, yogurt and danish.  J.T. Schmidt is the only eatery close by and is good.  They have a good beer selection.  You definitely need a car to get around, but we were very happy staying put.

Could not have chosen a more perfect stay for our trip to the Honda Center for an Eagles Concert. Our flight was very late, getting to the concert late.  The staff was amazingly supportive, shuttled us to the concert, set up our transportation for the next day at 6:30 a.m., and our wake-up call was prompt at 5:30 a.m. We were sorry we could not attend the morning breakfast. The room was more than we expected, large, clean with all amenities and a comfy bed for our short sleep.  This trip was a gift to my BFF of 44 years for her 60th birthday to see the Eagles and I wanted a safe hotel close by.  After much research I chose AYRES, it is across the street from the Honda Center.  Thank you everyone for a 24 hr, most enjoyable celebration trip.

We went to a concert at the Honda Center in Anaheim, and rather than drive back home for 1 1/2 hours, we made the plans to stay the night.  We stayed at the Ayres hotel on Oct 3rd 2014.  The hotel is very nice.  The decor is first class.  The room is sufficient, clean, comfortable.  The bed was very comfortable.  I did not expect the hotel to be so nice, and I was pleasantly surprised at the overall quality of the hotel.  It was so great to walk across the street to the concert and dining, avoiding traffic headaches. Breakfast was a sufficient variety -nothing grand, but good. The cost of the room fits the quality.  I highly recommend the Ayres Hotel.

This was our first trip to the area (and to Disney) and truly enjoyed our stay at Ayers!  I had honestly never heard of this hotel, but went based off the wonderful reviews on Trip Advisor.  It was very clean, all of the employees were very friendly, and our room was perfect.  It was right across the street from the Honda Center, super close to the Angels stadium, and there was a timely shuttle that came every day to take us to Disney.  There is a fee for the shuttle, but it's very reasonable and very worth it!  Our room was on the fourth floor and we had a vaulted ceiling, which was a lovely touch.  Breakfast every morning was amazing - the chef (who was very friendly!!) made Mickey pancakes for the kids. We would definitely stay here again!!

Highly recommend the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim. Choosing a good hotel sometimes can be daunting & I read a ton of reviews for many hotels and the Ayres reviews were one of the best & I have to say 100% they lived up to them. Now, not to have favorites...but my niece and I did. Jose made the best breakfasts and greeted us each morning with a smile. Andrew who was  the 1st to greet us upon arrival made us feel welcome and right at home, and Marcus was the most accommodating from picking us up, giving us directions and making a very important phone call so that we were confirmed for our shuttle pickup when I myself couldn't get through on the phone. Thank you so much for an excellent stay & when I get the chance to return to the area this will be my go to hotel!

Rated #1 on trip advisor for a reason! I came here to stay for a family vacation and was immediately drawn into booking the hotel for these following reasons: complimentary parking and breakfast, Disneyland annual pass holder discount, mini-fridge, and microwave. They are a little further out from Disneyland but honestly, it's better that they are.   We checked in around 3ish and Linda was super nice and got us our keys within 10 mins. She was able to check us in (we had two rooms) and had us on our way. We rested a bit before heading out to dinner that night. The room was spacious..enough to fit a little area with a sink, mini fridge, and micorwave, and pull out couch and desk. My 4yr old set up her "desk" and began reading her "book" (aka the bible that was in the room).  We

The staff was wonderful helpful and friendly.  There was a problem with my room and the staff was very helpful to remedie it.    My room was clean and the bed was beyond comfortable.  We stayed there three days and each time we came back the to room it was made up clean and comfortable again.  There was a shuttle ,for a small fee, that we used all the time we were there, even though we had our car with us.  It  convienent, especially when we went to Disneyland.    I defanitly will stay there again.

My wife and I always go to this hotel when we go to Disneyland. It is the perfect hotel for us because it is close to the theme park but far enough so that we can relax from the congestion of people the parks brings. It has the amenities we want that the hotels next to the park does not offer. Such amenities are: free parking, free sit down breakfast in their dining room (which is great because its not just coffee and muffins), a gym, pool with a jacuzzi and even sometimes they have a special happy hour for alcoholic beverages. At times, we are also close to the freeways so that if we decide to go up to LA to visit friends we can do that as well. We love this hotel!!

This hotel looks a bit stuffy, but do not think that the reviews are a fluke, tha many people can't be wrong!  This is def. the hotel you want to take your children to - breakfast is included..and yes, they will do Mickey pancakes.  The rooms are incredibly clean, and they even have a cookie social hour.  The staff is incredibly accommodating, when we missed the shuttle and would have to wait for the next, they graciously took us to Disney in the hotel shuttle, now that's customer service!

Summary Heading: Lovely family friendly boutique hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed for 4 night with young children. Very convenient location for Honda center, Angel Stadium, and for us to Disneyland. We used the ART shuttle bus which cost (per day) $5 for Adult , $2.00 children. For us the cost of Parking would have been the same, but with Shuttle, we didn't have to worry about parking and then making our way from car park to the Park.  The bus dropped us off in front of the gate and pretty much picked us up very close. Breakfast was very average , but it's very convenient option. We didn't use the pool or gym so can't make a comment. I quite liked the nice boutique style, probably stay again.

We stayed here for two nights and booked directly with the hotel, We used the pool and also the shuttle bus to Disneyland. It was comfortable and the staff appeared to be well trained and friendly. I would certainly recommend the hotel and go there again They do not provide evening meals but you can send out for food easily. I went in person to the bar nearby to collect our meal

Summary Heading: Nice hotel for a Disneyland trip (but we had a couple small issues)
Summary: My husband, daughter and I stayed here two nights this week. We were celebrating our daughter's one-year birthday with a trip to Disneyland. We ALMOST stayed at a hotel a lot closer to Disneyland, but decided not to because that hotel did not have cribs. Our daughter is a picky sleeper and she has a much harder time sleeping in the fold-up, pack-and-play type beds. We called the Ayres and they assured us that they had cribs...they even put us on hold to double check when we specifically asked if they had hard cribs (and described the difference) and the lady came back and assured us that they did. We arrived and checked in with no problem, then got to the room and saw the pack-and-play type bed! We asked someone from house keeping, again explained what we wanted, they said they

Summary Heading: Lovely classic hotel with fabulous bed!
Summary: This hotel has an "oldy worldy" feel with patterned carpets, oil paintings and lots of comfy chairs in the reception area and wooden furniture. There is a microwave, fridge and coffee machine plus an iron and ironing board. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was the best so far in our month in the USA. Freshly cooked eggs etc, fresh fruit, baked goods, juices and coffee/tea or hot chocolate. The bed was amazingly comfortable as were the pillows...10/10! There is a reasonably priced shuttle to Disneyland so you don't need to pay for parking ($17!) you can get a day ticket for the bus for $5 and it goes every 30 minutes.

Great place with great staff. Large room, well appointed, quiet, clean, updated, really first class. King bed and sitting area with sofa. Refrigerator. We flew in on a redeye from Hawaii and got there at 8 and by 8:30 they had a room for us. Best of all was the bed. The best I've ever slept in.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel, couldn't ask for a better hotel for the price.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. It was perfect, bed was comfortable and room was very clean. We are both over 6 ft tall so it was great that the shower head was tall enough to stand under, very nice water flow as well. The breakfast was great, we never left hungry or feeling unsatisfied. Was an easy drive to the Disneyland parking lots. Will most likely be using this hotel from now on for our future Disneyland trips.

This hotel is #1 Tripadvisor for good reason, the King room we stayed in had very comfortable bed. We had stayed at a different hotel in San Diego just before coming to Anaheim and their rooms were in need of repair and the beds were hard and creaky. The breakfast here is one of the best I have had. The staff was very friendly and the room was very nice. I would recommend this Ayres hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim. The ART bus is nice and convenient, leaving the trip to D-land in other hands but it's a little rough on the ride.

If you ever get a chance to stay here or any other Ayers do it! It was the best experience, the decor is beautiful has a very home like feel to it, room was huge! Best breakfast, fresh and hot! I did a lot of research on hotels when I planed this trip, it is about 15min from Disney but they have a bus system that takes you right to front gate. Every review was how great their stay was here, so I took a chance, so happy I did!!

Summary Heading: Quality, Comfort and the extra mile
Summary: Staying here for a reunion of friends.  Chose because of location and services, as well as reviews read on TripAdvisor.  Found the rooms to be large, spacious and beautifully furnished.  The rooms are very clean and nicely stocked, really quiet with good insullation.  Staff at front desk very helpful.  When we asked about a shopping center in walking distance, we were driven to and picked up again from a local mall by the hotel staff.  Breakfast was cooked by a very friendly chef.  The afternoon social hour is stocked with snacks and wines and other beverages.  The pool was clean and refreshing.  Over all a great stay.  Really couldn't have asked for more.

Right across the street from the honda centre. Handy to highway and restaurant. Nice pool and gym Great breakfast. Easy parking. Rooms have everything you need- comfy bed and clean. Frig, micro were handy and a real treat to have a washer and dryer right on your floor.

Summary Heading: Great location for the Honda Center
Summary: We recently stayed here while attending a concert at the Honda Center. The location was fantastic for this purpose. The hotel was pleasant, room really spacious, staff generally nice. The only thing I found was the room smelt a little musty or damp. No complaints otherwise! If we were up at the Honda Center again, we would most like return.

I have stayed at the Anaheim Ayres Hotel twice now for business-related training and have found the establishment to be friendly and very accommodating to their guests. the rooms are nice and I appreciate having both a microwave and refrigerator in the room for my convenience. I will be traveling that way again next month for training and will look forward to my stay at this Ayres.

I searched this hotel because my daughter, hubby and kids were going to Disneyland and we have stayed there before with them.  We did not end up going but they all did.  They had a GREAT time - especially because of the shuttle that goes every 30 minutes back and forth, the really lovely decorations the comfortable beds and the really great breakfasts.  We will join them later this year - there really is not a better place in Anaheim near Disney unless you can easily afford the $500.00 plus per night for the Disney California or Disneyland Hotel - which we cannot

Love this hotel!  Very clean, friendly and helpful staff, and reasonably priced.  Far enough away from the awful Disneyland traffic but close enough to drive.  Very convenient for Chapman University parents.

We stayed here because we were attending a two-day event at the Honda Center. The convenience of being directly across the street from the arena, plus the free parking and free breakfast outweighed the two night minimum charge. The staff was great. They allowed us to change one of our rooms from a King Bed suite to a two Queens suite when we checked in. The rooms are big. The insulation is great. We didn't hear any hallway or neighbor noises. We even forgot all about the nearby freeway because it was so quiet in our room. We enjoyed having the ceiling fan considering it was over 100 degrees and unusually humid each day during our stay. The breakfast was typical (under-cooked scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, potatoes, cereal, fruit and yogurt).   I'm a stickler for cleanliness

My sister and I have been coming to this particular Anaheim California Ayres for about 10 years or so.the hotel is very classy and the staff is great. We look forward to staying there in the years to come !!!

Summary Heading: Very nice, luminous and spacious room
Summary: Excellent option in the Anaheim area. Helpful service, with shuttles toward the Disney park. The breakfast is included which is great because this avoids you going out in the morning looking for a place to eat something (with nothing near). The first night the AC did not work, when we reported this the next morning they had it fixed right away and returned the cost for the night because we spent that night without AC. Nice detail. And the coffee for the coffee machine is good.

The staff was pleasent and the rooms were really nice and clean. The only complaint I had it took forever to get hot water which ment that all the water that was waisted was sad. But everything else was very nice.

I have been staying at the Ayres, Anaheim for yard and years now.  It is my home way from home in Orange County.  Wonderful people working there, comfy rooms and beds, quiet, full breakfast in the morning, fresh baked cookies, chips with quad & salsa and beer an wine in the evening. I am so comfortable at this hotel and recommend it highly to anyone. This last trip was business and personal.

The hotel is not great looking. It is next to a highway. The pool in in the parking lot. So, do not stay here if you wish to stay in a resort.  The rooms are very large and clean. The buffet breakfast comes with the room and it is a great breakfast with hot and cold choices, as much as you wish.  The service at the front desk, by phone and even housekeeping are all very friendly and very helpful and very accommodating.  The hotel is located close to convention and events centers, a stadium, Disneyland and to downtown Orange. You can get to those places by car or pay a small fee for a city shuttle service that stops at all of these places.  If I had a need to be in this location again, I would stay here. I will also look for other Ayres properties in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - Always a Pleasant Stay
Summary: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Ayres Hotel on East Katella Avenue after a recent cruise in late August/early September and once again for a one night stay a week later. We have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions in the past and it has always been very pleasant and is within reasonable proximity to most places of interest around Anaheim (it's directly opposite the Honda Centre) and close to Angel Stadium. However, in my opinion a motor vehicle is certainly helpful as the hotel is situated at least 2 miles from Disneyland and the restaurant chains such as the Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gumps, California Pizza Kitchen and P F Changs and the major shopping hub. A shuttle business caters for people without vehicles though making regular pick-ups from the hotel

This is one of four or so in the north Orange County area. It definetly ranks as one of the better hotals near Honda arena and Disnyland. The rooms are good looking the beds are very comfortable ,the staff is helpful and the breakfast buffet is well above the average but not quite what I have seen in Europe and Asia. I wi;; always keep this as opne of the best places to stay whule in OC

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Honda Center event
Summary: I love this place.  It has free parking and is right across from the Honda Center.  Breakfast is included and tastes great, especially the pancakes.  The rooms are good size and very comfortable.  I've stayed here twice now before heading to the Honda Center for events.  You save on the parking fee, get free breakfast the next day and never have any worries about drinking and driving.

My husband, son and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of August. We found the hotel on trip advisor and booked through expedia. The hotel is in an excellent location for the Honda Centre, Angel Stadium and is 2 miles from Disney (our reason for staying). We drove to Disney each day. However, there is a shuttle service (Anaheim Resort Shuttle) that runs from the hotel with varying rates for the days used. On arrival we were allocated a room on the top floor as requested. We arrived during 'Happy Hour' and were offered complimentary  beer, wine, soft drinks, nachos & dips and cookies. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room, deluxe two queens. The room was clean, bright and airy. There was a microwave, refrigerator, separate sink and coffee making facilities, all

We were at the hotel for three nights (two adults + two children) in a room with two double beds. The hotel is located on the outskirts of the city and not within walking distance of Disneyland, but shuttle worked great and was prompt and inexpensive. The hotel staff greeted us with a certain indifference, and answered our questions reluctantly. The room was large and well equipped but not all accessories worked properly and our requests for repair/replacement was not answered. The breakfast was good.

If it wasn't for the different snafus during the reservation and confirmation process I would easily give the Ayres Anaheim a 5 star review.  But first.  The room was as expected, a nice spacious 2 queen room that was perfect for the 3 of us traveling on a short, last minute vacation.  The room included 2 nice, comfortable queen beds, a large dresser with nice sized drawers and a large LCD TV on top.  There was a small dining table with 2 chairs and a desk with a desk chair.  Next to the queen beds were 3 night stands, their only drawback in my opinion was the lack of any drawers.  The room included a wet bar with a coffee maker, microwave and a mini fridge.  The bath area had a nice size bath/shower combo with the toilet in the same room as the shower.  Just outside of the

Summary Heading: Heavenly break from chaos and exhaustion
Summary: Stayed 2 nights here while on a road trip that included a couple of days at Disney. After a long car ride, the friendly, fast, easy check-in was a blessing and the beds and pillows felt like clouds. Honestly, if I could buy these for my home I would be a much better rested and happier woman. Breakfast was great and the price and accomodations were really the best deal going. We will stay here for certain in the future.

Our experience here would have been just fine, were it not for a few problems starting days before check-in. If I had to do it again, I would definitely not book through Priceline and keep my expectations low. Things would have been so much easier if we had just been told upfront what to expect.  A few days before our scheduled check-in I contacted the hotel to request a king size bed. The gentleman I spoke with let me know that the hotel was booked full for the night but he would put in a request. I gave him all of my information so I was assuming he could see that I booked through priceline and I was only guaranteed double occupancy. I wish he had let me know this- I would have brought an inflatable bed for my 2 year old son. On the day of our arrival, I called the hotel to
Manager Response: I was terribly sad to read of your frustrating experience staying with us over the weekend. You have brought up several issues and I would like to provide some feedback. Please accept my apologies for the poor quality of your stay. We did not deliver the experience that we are used to providing and you should have had a much better experience.  I am sorry for the communication breakdown regarding the need for an extra bed for your son. I am glad that we were able to ultimately find you a room that suited your needs. I have provided my Guest Services staff with some clear instructions on handling Priceline and other online travel agent bookings. While I would prefer that guests booked directly with us, Priceline is an excellent business partner and this experience should not dissuade you from using their services.   I am sorry that my maintenance engineer left a fan in the room that we had given you. He had replaced an air-conditioning unit that had frozen over and then consequently melted onto the floor when it was turned off. The fan was there to dry the patch under the air-conditioning unit. Please be assured that the only issues with the room were the open window and the fan. The ac unit was brand new and the room was clean.   Please let me clarify why Priceline was refunded. As you have stated, you wanted to leave. We refunded your card. However it became apparent that there were no more rooms in Anaheim. We did some more investigating and by checking each individual booking we found that we had another room that had been paid for in advance by a mobile channel. Their pre-bought room however was also run of house, and we were therefore able to change their assigned room type to the room with one queen and provide you with a room with one king.  You have been remarkably unfortunate in your experience and I do apologize. Please do read the private message I have sent you.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Too far if you are only doing disney
Summary: The hotel room and buffet are amazing. The only complaint I would have is its location. We did the Disney Half Marathon run and found the distance from Disney quite restriciive especially if you don't have a car. I think it is ideal if you have a car and don't mind being more than the stated 2 miles from Disneyland.

Brought my daughter and son to Disney and stayed here.  We had a grey time. The accommodations were clean and well maintained.  The service was friendly and helpful.  And the price was competitive with other places that were not as nice. I would definitely stay again if opportunity arises.

We've stayed here at least 3 times and each time our expectations are more than fulfilled. It's a great location for anything in Orange and Anaheim. It's only a short drive to Chapman University and Disney.  The rooms are spacious and clean and have great mattresses and pillows. The breakfast is far better than any other hotel that includes breakfast with their stay.  We had fresh pancakes, eggs, bacon, fruit, it's all there.  The hotel is right next to the freeway but you cannot hear it at all and we've stayed on each side and floor of this hotel.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel within walking distance to the Angels Stadium
Summary: The hotel was beautifully decorated with clean, comfortable rooms, and had a nice hot breakfast buffet! Stayed there to go to an Angels game and was pleasantly surprised at the comfortable walking distance. Definitely worth the money and we will visit other Ayres Hotels if given the opportunity

Love staying here every time I'm in Orange. Make sure to book early for Memorial Day weekend, as it is also Chapman University's graduation and move-out weekend. I was disappointed when I could not get a reservation.

Our 7 night booking was based mainly on the overall high ratings given by everyone, and it didn't disappoint. Enjoyed the free hot breakfast every morning.  Disney was an easy 10 minute drive down the street.  Wouldn't hesitate on staying here again.

Summary Heading: Niceish but what's with all the 5 star reviews?
Summary: We stayed for two nights to visit Disneyland.  And we were happy enough to have stayed here.  The price was right (compared to the alternatives), the transfer bus to the theme parks was convenient, and the room was fairly comfortable - albeit the bathroom in particular was pretty dated.  Breakfast was average - despite the cheery charm of the chef the choice was very limited.  But we had nice pancakes, so four stars it is.

Two of my friends just came back from Anaheim and the Ayres Hotel came greatly recommended.  I booked my reservations for 3 rooms because this was our first family vaction since my son's return back from Afghanistan and I wanted to make sure everything went well.  We arrived at the hotel and to our dismay, our first impression was of the night manager being rude and short with our whole party. He made some comments about walking lightly because the floors are made of wood and that the restrooms were for guests only....hellooooo we were paying for 3 rooms for 4 nights.  The redeeming quality to this hotel was the breakfast cook, he was friendly, and personable....the night manager could have taken tips from the cook!  Our  overall experience with our rooms, the cleanliness of the

From the moment we checked in, our stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim was perfect.  The hotel & rooms are absolutely beautiful.  We found it to be a great value.  The staff at Ayres is the most helpful & genuine of any staff we have encountered at a hotel, & that includes Disney hotels we have stayed at.  Particularly, Derrick, Andrew & Jason at the front desk, along with another front desk clerk, whose name we didn't get, but drove us in the Ayres van to a local rental car establishment when we didn't have a way to get there.  Paulo is another employee who seemed like he was busy constantly, just dong whatever needed to be done.  Also, Jose, the cook at the Free full American breakfast, was so cheerful & pleasant in the morning, you always looked forward to seeing him.  Another

Our family stay could not have been any nicer, this hotel went above and beyound in all areas. From customer service to Jose the chef/cook what an awesome bunch.  Our grandchildren didn't want to go home.  Marcus you were the best, the smiles you put on our grandchildren were priceless. We will definitely be back and well highly recommend to family and friends.

We stayed late July for a few days.  Reception staff on the whole friendly (one a little brusque), room exceptional.  A problem with the lavatory was quickly fixed.  Good size, comfortable seating area in the room, fridge (really useful as a constant supply of fluids were needed to combat 87 degree heat).  Breakfast was a fairly manic experience - lots of families desperate to eat a huge variety of food which was abandoned quickly.  Staff coped well!  Baseball stadium close by - Anaheim Angels fans know this but only five minutes walk to the stadium.  Visitors note - do not cross the road on the way to the stadium unless at a traffic light.  The police were overly officious, shouting at pedestrians who were in family units (and the road at those points was quiet as you could see

This hotel was our base for 3 days at Disney. The hotel is beautiful and the room followed suit. The beds were firm and comfortable. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Everything was in good repair. The pool is small but quite nice as is the workout room. The free wifi appeared to be strong everywhere. You do have to login every 24 hours. The included breakfast has a continental portion and a hot portion. The hot portion has limited choices that change daily but done by a friendly and accommodating chef. Their is no on-site lunch or dinner but plenty of choices nearby. The shuttle to Disney is every half hour and is a small additional cost but be sure to check the schedule ahead of time to minimize the wait. I would highly recommend this hotel.

My family and I just recently spent 9 nights at the Ayers Hotel in Anaheim. Check in was very easy, however after getting to our room we found that the air conditioner in the room was not working properly. A call to the front desk and several minutes later a maintenance man was in our room trying to fix it. He made some adjustments but it was still not working properly. A visit to the front desk and the staff on duty were kind enough to change our room. Problem solved and I thought great customer service all around. The hotel room was spacious and suited our family's needs. The breakfast in the morning was above average and the cook Jose was always very pleasant and accommodating. We had a great stay and will absolutely recommend and or return to the Ayers Hotel.   Marty L

Room was beyond expectation.  Bed was so comfortable. Staff was courteous and could not do enough for you. Cocktails & cookies every evening. Breakfast area could be crowded at times but there was a nice eating area in our room.

Summary Heading: Comfy bed with a fan that will stay on all night
Summary: In its price category, you can not beat Ayres.  This location is very clean and has luxury upgrades in the lobby.   My room had a comfy bed with a fan that could stay on all night for white noise, so I slept great.  Most other hotels in this price category have a fan that will only turn on when the A/C or heater turns on, which disturbs my sleep.  Healthy breakfast with lots of fresh fruit and quality coffee.    Nice staff, friendly and professional.  I will definitely stay here again!

We booked this hotel in order to visit Disneyland which is about 5 minutes away.  This beautiful hotel is across the street from the Honda Center (Anaheim Ducks) and at the entrance to Angels Stadium (Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim).  It was a 10 minute (well-lit) walk from our room to the baseball box office.  Enjoy an adult beverage at the ballpark without having to drive afterwards.  Perfect for a weekend get-away to see your favorite team play on the road.

Our stay at this location for 5 days was excellent.  The room clean and well stocked, the beds so comfortable, the day and evening staff courteous and friendly, the breakfast was hot and delicious, and the chef very nice and fun, he offered to make Mickey Mouse pancakes for our daughter, which made us feel right at home.  Offering hors d'oeuvres in the lobby was also nice. The decor was lovely and had a very romantic feel to it.  Definitely no complaints here.  We are in Anaheim every August, so we will definitely stay here the next time.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel at a bargain price!
Summary: We are big Disneyland fans, and we always make a habit of staying within walking distance of the parks--therefore, we'd never really considered a stay here, although we often passed the hotel on our way down Katella to visit our daughter who attends Chapman University.  However, on this particular trip, we were going to be spending more time with our daughter, so we decided to stay a little closer to where she lives.  Ayres had a great deal for about $120/night (using our Disney Annual Pass) with free parking, internet, breakfast and evening wine reception, so we grabbed it.  Although the location of the hotel seems a bit awkward at first, it was actually VERY handy for freeway access, Disney access and Chapman access.  We were fortunate to miss any big events at the Honda

Summary Heading: I stay here and host clients monthly
Summary: I have been using the Ayers Anaheim to host clients that I bring to California. The staff, rooms and breakfasts always exceed expectations. Over the last year, 100% of my clients have been pleased with our choice of accommodations.   I also stay here when I visit our Orange County office and have put my family in the hotel while on vacation. I like the hotel and its staff.

Summary Heading: The second time was even better than the first!
Summary: Upon arrival, Jason at the front desk thought he recognized me (and that was from my last visit just over two months ago)! Upon looking up my record, he proceeded to welcome me back. He also asked me if I'd prefer to be closer to the pool or the breakfast area. I thought that added a touch of class to the process. I chose the breakfast area (and by the way, the pancakes and French toast are a pleasant surprise because they are really good here). I love the eco-friendly environment at the Ayers as well as the general cleanliness of the rooms and the 5:30 PM "Happy Hour" Monday through Thursday.
