The staff really does make you feel at home and welcomed--it's a nice touch to a nice hotel.

This was our third time at Ayres Anaheim in the last 12 months.  Excellent hotel with the best hotel breakfast we've ever had.  It's convientent to visiting Disneyland and all over OC.   This is the best hotel for visiting Anaheim.

This has all of the trappings of a top drawer hotel with the conveniences of a microwave and refrigerator. Full breakfast and an evening reception included in the modest price. I will be staying here again.

Summary Heading: First Time, but not the last
Summary: A great property located to lots of transportation, entertainment and dining options.  Lobby was inviting and open.  Staff was very friendly.  Room was extremely comfortable.  The morning breakfast was perfect.

Rooms are clean and beds very comfortable.  Love the convenience of having a microwave, refrigerator, and bar sink in the room.  We were able to call ahead to let them know we would be arriving early and they had our adjoining rooms with our daughter's family ready for early check-in.  Free hot breakfast in the morning was great!  Loved that we were able to walk to Angel Stadium from the hotel saving the hassle and expense of stadium parking.

We stayed here from the 30th July for one week. The first thing is that reviews are accurate and you can see why this is top of the list. Free Wifi (it's the fastest I've seen at hotel), free breakfast and free parking put simply this represents very good value for the modest room rate.   Breakfast is excellent with the chef making eggs, pancakes and the usual fare. For pancakes they do Mickey Mouse ears shape for the kids, a nice touch.  The staff were really friendly in all areas of the hotel and we liked the chef. He took a while to get to know but he was really nice to our kids.  The room cleaning staff did a great job and coming back to a immaculate room made all the difference. The rooms are spacious and have a fridge with two queen beds perfect for families.  The beds are

I could not have been happier with our stay at the Ayers Hotel.  We decided to stay overnight after the Dodgers-Angels game and not fight sleep on the drive home to the central valley.  From the decor, to the awesome and friendly staff, to the cleanliness of the room, and the awesome evening snacks and beer to the terrific breakfast I was very impressed.  A fantastic value.  I have paid twice as much for a room and gotten half the service and food.   The only problem I had was I had a hard time getting the wifi to work on my smartphone but that's minor.  A short walk to Angel Stadium (or from now on referred to as Dodger Stadium South) and my decision as well as that of several coworkers and friends was complete. Oh and although our room was just feet from Katella we never heard

Overall the hotel is average.  Rooms feel dated.  Breakfast feels very cafeteria like.  Sitting at tables without table cloths.  Breakfast feels like a challenge, rather than a relaxing meal.  Service overall is very good.  Asked for additional linens, got them right away.  Very close to Angels stadium and the duck pond.

Stayed for 5 days. Everything was great. Staff really friendly and helpful, especially enjoyed the breakfast room. The Anaheim Resort shuttle serves the hotel for access to Disney, and the Hotel is also very close to Angels Stadium; we walked to watch baseball.  Beds are really comfortable, the only minor issue we had was the free wi-fi which was not very fast.

Just a few blocks from the madness of Disneyland, and a convenient shuttle to and from there.  Friendly staff, nicely furnished, plenty of parking, and a good breakfast.  Free internet albeit a little slow.

Summary Heading: Some good, some not so good
Summary: I was torn between rating this hotel a 3 or 4 but I will give them the benefit of a 4 as it is a nice hotel chain and customer service does seem important to them. That means a lot. I guess being #1 on Tripadvisor really raised my expectations and this hotel just didn't live up to the hype. Labeling Ayres as a European Boutique hotel is a stretch. I've been to Europe and stayed in many boutique hotels but that is not what this is. It's really more of a traditional style hotel with wall paper, dark wood furnishings, and oil paintings. It also is looking a little worn and tired, could use some refreshing.   The location is great depending on what you are doing. We were there to visit Disneyland and we felt that other hotels would've served our purpose better. Yes, it is on the ART

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families or business - easy access to Disneyland
Summary: I stay at the Ayres for business but would also bring my family.  There is a good mix of business people and vacationing families so you can be very comfortable either way.  The rooms are large, beautiful detailing and always clean.  The beds are incredibly comfortable and they have a four poster bed frame which gives the room a very luxurious feel.  You have very easy access to Disneyland, the baseball stadium and you are right across the street from the Honda Center.  They have a hot complimentary breakfast that is very good and a happy hour each night with wine, beer and chips. I haven't ever used the pool, it looks like it might be a little small, but it has always looked clean when I walk by.   I'm so glad my company uses this hotel because it has been a great find and I

We stayed 5 nights. The room was very nice. The breakfast was amazing well worth the money. The pool was clean and overall the rooms and hotel was clean. The staff were very friendly and willing to help out.

This was my first time to stay at an Ayres Hotel and it was excellent. Everyone was attentive, smiled, said hello when they saw you, either at the front desk, breakfast buffet or walking down the hall.  I would return again to this hotel or another Ayres Hotel.

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting the Los Angeles area!
Summary: Just got home from 6 nights staying at the Ayres Hotel.  Everything about it was great from the filling breakfast each morning to the cool pool to take a dip in after a day of sight-seeing.  It is conveniently located off a major freeway yet it is still quiet.  There are also many restaurants very close by.  If I return to SoCal this will be the place I will stay again.

Very clean.  Breakfast was as good better than most hotels I have stayed in.  Eggs, potatoes, bacon and pancakes are cooked fresh.  Free Wifi too which is a must for me.  Near the freeway but I did not hear cars at night.

Summary Heading: Good value for money, helpful staff and good location for Disneyland
Summary: 7 days stay with family of 3. Our main purpose was visit to Disneyland and hotel has great location for that. Bus transfer to Disneyland works excellently and despite construction work we had no great delays (we went rather early morning). Hotel facilites are good, staff is very helpfull - we had a minor issue with the sink in our room and were given a new room within minutes and even received a reduction on our bill for the inconvenience. Very professionally resoved! Would definately stay there again if in the area!

Beautiful hotel, great distance from Disney so you don't have to be suffocated by it. On the route for Disney shuttles a few dollars a day. Warm cookies and beer served during early evening. Great continental breakfast in mornings! The chef is very flexible and skilled.

Our family had planned a trip to Disneyland, and based on the reviews here, we decided to stay at the Ayres.  It was quite nice.  The front-desk people were extremely helpful and friendly, and our room on the fourth floor was nice.  (Calling it a "king suite" might have been a bit of an exaggeration though, as it consisted of one room plus the bathroom....)  The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) bus stops at the hotel once every half hour, and goes to Disneyland, making a single stop along the way---$5/person/day but for unlimited rides.  This allowed us to come back and collapse at the hotel around dinner time, then return for even more fun and the fireworks.  The breakfast was quite amazing, with a cook dishing up scrambled eggs, french toast, pancakes, etc, etc., etc---and

This hotel was actually our fifth and the last on our three week vacation. It is a very nice and clean hotel. Breakfast was very good as well. The only thing that personally was not "my cup of tea" was the old style look of the hotel. I like more of a retro look, and this was at the opposite spectrum. If you like that type of decor, you will love this place.

Summary Heading: When you can't travel far for a vacation, this is the place for luxury you seek!!!
Summary: When you live where most of the US vacations and need a little get away yourself. But you do not have the time to take a long vacation? This is your place to have a ‚Äúquick‚Äù luxury break from home or the office. Quite‚Ä¶.. CLEAN!!!   (bathroom and tubs  tooo..) friendly nice professional staff. Very comfortable beds. Clean crisp linen..  Its all good here..

We booked this hotel by chance because of its location for a family visit.  It is conveniently located within easy walking distance to Anaheim Stadium and close to Disneyland and other tourist areas in Orange County.  We were pleased with all aspects of the hotel -- very clean rooms, friendly staff, good hot breakfast (although I agree with other review that the drink area could be located farther from the food service to relieve congestion).  Although close to the freeway, we did not notice any noise at all.  Also, the beds were very comfortable--we slept in until 8:30 which is very unusual for us.  We will definitely stay here again and will recommend it to our friends.

We came to visit Disneyland for 4 nights and booked this hotel from the great reviews on TripAdvisor and this hotel did not disappoint!!!! At check in we were met with smiles and wonderful customer service. The hotel is immaculately cleaned and the rooms were spacious. The hot breakfast every morning was delicious and a great budget saver. While the hotel is further away from Disney, the ART bus stops right in the hotel driveway for pick up every half hour and passes can be purchased at the front desk for a cheap price.  Thank you Ayres for a great stay! We will recommend this hotel to all!  K Houseman

We experienced a wonderful time here getting shuttled to Disneyland roundtrip (as many times as needed) for a small fee.  Breakfast was very good; I would suggest more serving help to the management and better placed drink service as everything is in one corner making it very congested.  Other than that we loved our stay; great front desk service!

The closeness to Angel's Stadium made walking to the game quite convenient. In addition the Disney shuttles made visiting Disneyland "happy". The bus makes stops at Disney's Gardenwalk and will then take you to the park. Visiting both places is certainly convenient with this hotel. We will definitely return.

This hotel has kind of everything going for it:  1) JUST accross the street from Honda center (pity tye NHL isn't on right now); 2) JUST around the (brief walk) corner of the Angels' Stadium; 3) Cheap ART (Anaheim Resort Transportation) Disney pick ups (and drop offs) at the lobby every 30 mins from 7:30am ish until 12:15 am ish. Very convenient for our family, we just left our rental parked ! 4) Breakfast included (nothing over fancy but bery convenient and sufficient); 5) Free parking; 6) Longer visitors: 8x25c washer and dryer on 3rd and 4th floor; 7) Great staff, very helpful and friendly (we also had a small crisis and they reacted like lightning); 8) Unique and beautiful European decor all over : you feel like you are staying in a way more expensive hotel !; 9) Good rates

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a couple with children
Summary: Clean rooms and good breakfast. The cookies were great. Guests were enjoying the free happy hour. I saw chips and salsa and cans of beer.  Great rooms for a couple with children since the three bedroom suites have one king and two sofa beds.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Angels games.
Summary: I came to Anaheim to watch the Baltimore Orioles provide baseball lessons to the Angels and I was not disappointed, as the Angels once again laid down, rolled over and lost. The hotel is a short walk from the ballpark, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful and the room was clean and comfortable.  I recommend staying at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim whenever one wished to see the Angels lose; whether it be to the Red Sox, the mighty A's or even the lowly Astros.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with great breakfast, service, and location!
Summary: We have stayed at the Ayres for 2 years in a row now while visiting the Anaheim area. It's not far from Disneyland and right across from Angel stadium. If the Angels play and win, there's an awesome firework show right over the hotel! The hotel is clean and service is friendly and helpful with a yummy breakfast served by chefs. For the area their prices are good too. We plan to stay again if we ever return to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in July while going to Disneyland with our grandkids.  We found it to be a cut above the usual chain hotel.  Very nicely decorated spacious rooms, comfortable beds, quiet, with friendly staff.  Breakfast only so-so (fruit salad made up primarily of unripe melon).  However their restaurant across the street was quite good for lunch and dinner and offers a 10% discount to those staying at the hotel.  Will look for this chain again when visiting Southern California.

The Ayres Hotel is outstanding,  always top notch,  roomy, clean, and the free food is great! The hotel is located off the freeway near local business and leisure activities. The local beaches was within 10 to 15 miles.   We stayed out late one night and was glad to see that someone was at the front desk smiling and ssid goodnight.

We just spent a couple of nights at the Ayres in Anaheim. We had a fantastic stay. The room was very clean and quiet. We were on the Disneyland side and had a great view of the fireworks. The staff was very helpful and kind. The breakfast was better than I expected, was warm and served quickly. The location is great. Just a 3 minute drive from the Disneyland parking lots. There are also plenty of places to eat nearby.   The only problem I could see with this hotel was at times the parking lot filled up fast.   Overall I would say we get a great deal on our stay. Far better than I expected for the price we found. I highly recommend the Ayres Anaheim and will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Anaheim Does not disappoint
Summary: Excellent hotel that is quite charming.  Excellent and friendly staff.  Breakfast was much better than most.  The decor and furniture were superb and I loved all of the paintings displayed.  Sort of like walking through an art gallery.  The only downside is that it is a little more of a drive than I like to Disneyland.

The ayers is clean, classy, and has a great location. Decorated in a euro style, not the usual samo samo hotel junk. The included breakfast was fresh cooked and tasty. Excellent for a free hotel breakfast.  Just became my favorite when attending an angel game in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Wished we could have stayed longer!
Summary: Ayres was the third hotel of our vacation in California. The bed was the most comfortable of all. The room was exceptional; (we had been upgraded to a suite from a king). The breakfast was very, very good with eggs, bacon, french toast, fresh fruit, yogurt and the expected bagels, toast and pastries. The staff was excellent as well. We will definitely stay here again!

I am placing the following paragraph at the top of my review specifically for those who only read the first sentences or maybe just the review titles. I am a pessimist no longer! There truly are great hotels and more importantly great hotel employees. Specifically I want to sing the praises of one extraordinary employee. That would be Linda Tran, at the front desk. In my opinion she was the warmest, most genuine hotel employee we have ever come across. We have stayed on Disney properties in Florida at least 35 times and no front desk staff at WDW has come close. She had a way of making us feel welcome, important, and special. Speaking with Linda gives one the impression that you are the most important person on the property. No matter how many balls she might be juggling at the

Great hotel not far from Disney with regular bus transportation to park. Friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff who will assist you with all matters from breakfast, safety deposit boxes, courtesy shuttle and the usual front of house matters. Laundry and ice machine on every floor. Spacious rooms with fantastically comfortable beds. We have stayed three times and not been disappointed yet.

My son and I recently traveled to Anaheim for a basketball tournament and stayed at this hotel.  It was close to the tournament venue and just far enough from the hustle and bustle of the Disneyland area yet close enough to get to in minutes. I was pleasantly surprised by the friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable beds, and the hot breakfast was a nice plus.  The only complaint is that there is currently construction on katella that may cause delays in traffic due to some lane closures.

I stayed at the Ayres hotel recently on a trip to Disneyland with my son. They have a shuttle bus which comes around regularly to Disneyland and return which was very handy as the hotel is a few miles away from the theme park.  The rooms were very large and clean.  The beds were extremely comfortable, in fact, the beds here were more comfortable than any other hotel I've slept in for many years.  The staff were very helpful and polite.  The breakfast was great with eggs/bacon/pancakes plus all the regular cereal/fruit etc.  The room rates are amazing for what you get, would thoroughly recommend this hotel to families wanting a base near Disneyland.

I've stayed here a number of times over the year and the service,size and condition of the rooms  have always been superb. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the breakfast are excellent. it is conveniently located near the freeways and Disneyland and the parking is free. Would certainly recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

No matter which Ayres hotel I stay in the quality has always been consistently great, this location was no exception!  Fridge and microwave in the room.... the extra room in the living area was wonderful!

We feel like we've found the perfect hotel in a great location in Anaheim.  The Ayres Hotel is beautiful, quiet and comfortable.  The rooms are spacious and well appointed.  The service is friendly and efficient. And the full breakfast in the morning is great!  It is located close to all attractions.  We will definitely stay here every time we visit Southern California.

We decided to go for the weekend at the last minuet to Long Beach. Everything was booked there so we found a room at the Anaheim Ayres. The room was very clean, large, comfortable bed and nice bathroom. The staff here was very friendly and welcoming. The included breakfast was excellent day starter

Very pleasant place to stay, really enjoyed it. Loved the building, rooms are quite and private. The air conditioning wasn't quite the best but at least it had a fan to pair it. Besides that, for a night it was great.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel But Need In-Room Safes
Summary: We stayed here with our two young grandchildren while visiting So. Cal. theme parks. The hotel was convenient right off the 57 FWY and had nice comfortable and clean rooms. Unfortunately, they do not have in-room safes which was a major inconvenience for us as we were not prepared to leave our electronic devices in the room without them being secured. There are safes at the front desk but they are not large enough to hold iPads so each time we left, we had to hand them over to front desk staff who would put everything in the manager's office for safekeeping. Then upon return to the hotel, we presented a receipt and a staff member would go fetch our items. We are accustomed to hotels having in-room safes large enough to hold a few laptops so this was a disappointment. However, on

Summary Heading: This hotel is very convenient to walk to the Angel's stadium.
Summary: Average hotel with all the basics. The breakfast was a nice surprise. Staff is lacking concern & are very casual but are friendly. it may be the lack of training. A nice short brisk walk to the stadium. You really can get any closer if your going to the stadium & you don't have to rely on vehicles.

We spent a wonderful 2 days with the most gracious staff.  They were kind and helpful to all our needs. The breakfast staff was great as well, my boyfriend new all of them by name. He made friends for sure.  Some of us there were attending the Cher concert at the Honda, which is in walking distance from the Ayres, with complementary wine, beer and snacks before the concert...what more could you ask for,  We will be sure to stay here again in the future.

Nice hotel, clean rooms and  friendly staff.  Great place to stay if you are going to any event at the Honda Center. Included is a nice breakfast.  Close to Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm and Angel Stadium.

Accommodating, attentive and friendly staff, comfortable and clean rooms. This is a great spot if you're just looking for a place to stay with the added bonus of having a good breakfast and free parking.

We stayed for one night in a room for 3 people. Our first impressions were fantastic, the hotel looked better than the photos we'd seen on the net. The staff greeted us warmly and were very helpful, We were offered fresh homebaked cookies on arrival and the bar offered happy hour soon after . Our room was immaculate, carpet looked freshly cleaned. I was a bit worried about bedbugs (had read heaps on various sites about problems in the US) but saw no evidence of them. We used the Pool & Gym, both pristine. Breakfast next morning (included in price) was incredible, we ate like kings, a huge variety available. Checkout was quick and easy, the concierge ordered us a taxi and it arrived very soon. All in all a very positive experience, We would highly recommend this hotel.

My husband and I decided to see an  Angel baseball game for the 4th of July and to have a mini vacation. I have stayed at the Ayres hotel before when my favorite band was performing right across the street at the Honda Center and  so we decided to stay there again since the baseball stadium was only a 10 min. walk from there. We arrived on a Thursday and were greeted by the hotel staff with a smile. We were informed there was a happy hour between 5:30-6:30 pm Mon-Thurs.  There is also a shuttle service that will take you to Disneyland for a low fee ( I think it is $5 dollars one way). Disneyland is only about 10-12 minutes away from there.The hotel is really nice and I love the decorations. The room is spacious with extra's like a sofa couch, mini fridge and microwave. There is

We stayed at the Areys hotel from June 28 through July 5th, we loved everything about this hotel. The staff was very friendly, very clean rooms, and an excellent breakfast. We stayed here because we were going to Disneyland, it was close but also helped avoid a lot of the Disney traffic!.... We will be staying there agian..... Wish they had more in other states.

Summary Heading: Love staying here for concerts nearby
Summary: When one of our favorite bands is playing nearby, THIS is the hotel of choice for us.  One time we stayed here when my husband was having surgery around the corner.  We love being able to partake in the fun of a concert and walk back to our room, no driving involved.  We love the amenities, the decor is so beautiful.  The front desk is always friendly and available for whatever needs we have had.  The breakfast is always fresh and delicious.  Definitely recommend.

Great hotel. Large rooms. Bar staff are fantastic. Food is superb. Setting and location is ideal for airports or as a base for holiday makers. Strongly recommend this brilliant friendly hotel. I book here for business and family holidays.

The hotel had beautiful d√©cor and friendly staff, but was licking slightly in the cleanliness department. My room had lots of hairs on the sheets and pillows which tells me that they were not changed between guest. The second thing was the wall had crayon writing on it. Crayon marks on the wall may be normal for some but for me without kids it is not normal and should not be left on the wall. The social hour was a big bonus also, beer, wine, chips/salsa, and cookies were all very tasty.

This hotel was easy to find, right off the freeway. They have very clean, beautiful rooms. The free parking and breakfast are what reeled me in and I'm glad I chose this place. We came here for the Disney parks. They have a shuttle that runs every half hour. We will definitely stay here again

This was the second year that we stayed here for our daughters Volley ball tournament. Check-in is always easy, breakfast is plenty full and has great variety, the rooms are clean and comfortable and have everything you need (and more), parking is great, the Art bus to all attractions is a fabulous feature, pool towels are always on hand and having laundry room available is awesome for these long tournaments with loads of stinky stuff. The staff makes you feel welcome and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome and to help you. I highly recommend it. Also for concert go-ers,,,,,,,Honda center is across the street and a great restaurant is next door. This hotel will not disappoint!

Clean, parking is a problem when busy! Rooms were very nice but had that HOTEL Smell! Don't know why someone can come up with a smell that doesn't smell like a hotel! Otherwise I will stay here again!

Summary Heading: A Trip to DLand with a stay at Ayres Hotel Anaheim
Summary: Recently my family and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim. Overall, it was a nice stay. The check-in went smooth and quick. Our room was on the third floor and next to side street/Pub. The side street was very quiet.  Our room was nice and clean and we slept well on their beds. The only downside of the room was the wall HVAC system. It made a low fan belt noise which was irritating when you had the AC on. Of course to sleep somewhat well, we had to have the AC on at night.  The breakfast buffet was better than I expected. Plenty to eat and it was good. On the downside of breakfast, the coffee was horrible. You're better off drinking coffee outside the hotel.  Their swimming pool is not the grandest of pools. I would compare it to budget motel pool. However, the pool was

Great location in Anaheim. Large, comfortable and well-decorated rooms. Housekeeping did an A+ job. The people who staffed the front desk were always friendly, courteous and helpful. Outstanding full breakfast every day. WiFi and parking were included. I strongly encourage you to consider Ayres Hotel for your next stay in Anaheim.

We checked into the Ayres with a guaranteed early check-in option because we were arriving in Anaheim early to save some money on the flight.  I was concerned that we may not get an excellent room since we were checking in early but the staff happily provided us with one.  Our entire stay was fantastic!  The desk staff was helpful and fun.  We got extra pillows quickly and without issue.  The room was well appointed and clean and all of the amenities worked well and correctly.  Having an ART stop right at the front door of this hotel was a huge plus in that we never needed to worry about parking at Disneyland.  The pool and spa were adequate for our needs.  Our kids needed to burn off some extra energy and the pool was a good temperature for them; the spa a good temperature for

We stayed at Ayres for 5 nights with the family of 4.   Great service, excellent breakfast and clean and comfortable rooms.   Plenty of free parking.   Direct shuttle to Disneyland.   I don't know what else to ask for.  We are going to stay at Ayres wherever they have presence.   Thank you for a great vacation experience.

Summary Heading: BEST ever to stay for Disneyland or Angels game!
Summary: Stayed here twice in the past 3 months and was very impressed with the welcoming, helpful staff and the decor of the hotel and comfort and roominess of the rooms. The breakfast was wonderful, much more than any other place that we have stayed. It was great location for walking to the Angel game and quick to get to Disneyland. We will always stay there when we can go and stay the night. Wonderful experience!

Our family's 3rd time at Ayers.  I actutally don't search for hotels anymore when we go to Disney, I just make sure that there is room available at Ayers when we go.  This hotel maintains the high quality of customer service to their guests from check in to check out.  For a very reasonable price you will get an A+ experience!

Summary Heading: First time to Disneyland and we couldn't have been happier with this hotel!
Summary: Our family was making a trip to Disneyland for the first time from Washington state.  I had reviewed and searched months ago for a hotel and ended up getting a discount for a big popular hotel chain from a friend. The night before we left for Disneyland I did a little research and realized that we didn't have free Wi-Fi free parking or free breakfast at the other hotel that I had made a reservation. I did a quick search on trip advisor and saw that this was the highest rated hotel for the Disney area. I thought that it was too far from Disneyland but then saw that there is a shuttle that goes right to the hotel so we went ahead and made the change and book this hotel. The entire hotel staff is the best year! They are super helpful and super nice all the time. Jose, our morning

This beautiful hotel was a wonderful place to stay.  The reception staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious and beautifully decorated and it included a nice kitchen area that had a fridge  and sink.  The ceiling fan with lights was a nice addition.  The bed was super comfortable.  The bathroom was large and pretty.  The complimentary happy hour was a nice plus.  The most amazing feature was the complimentary breakfast, which was buffet and also featured a chef to prepare hot food as requested.  Fantastic!

We stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 grand daughters,This hotel was wonderful.It was clean the beds are comfy.The breakfast was a full breakfast they even made Mickey Mouse pancakes for the kids. Free parking was a plus also.The shuttle taking you to disney was cheap and very convenient.They have a social hour in the evening with drinks and snacks. we had a great stay everything from check in to check out was wonderful.

Thank you to all the staff at The Ayres Anaheim... My visit with my family was wonderful and my experience was fulfilled being that I work at the Moreno Valley properties and have not had the opportunity to stay on one of our properties before. Like our guests say... We slept so great... I can say, Yes, we did too!!! Thank you and looking forward to visiting other Ayres properties in the future. Amber Rhines                             Lead Esthetician/Massage Therapist Auraspamorenovalley.com

Stayed here for six nights to visit Disney, go to the Angels baseball and generally sightsee in the area. This hotel was perfect for us and I can see why it gets such positive reviews here on Trip Advisor. Check in desk staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was large, clean and comfortable. My only gripe is that the a/c unit wasn't very quiet so we had to try and sleep with it off - then inevitably get up during the night to turn it back on again. Breakfast was excellent quality and an enjoyable start to the day. We didn't make the "happy hour" as we were out and about every single day. We didn't use the Disney shuttle as we had a rental car, was easy to get to Disney. Walking distance to Angels stadium. They also had computers in the lobby which were free to use

Everything was beyond expectations, hotel-beautiful and well kept, staff- attentive and friendly, amenities-breakfast was amazing, happy hour, free parking and free WiFi..with no doubt Ayres made our visit even more memorable

This hotel is very clean, the rooms are well decorated, and the staff was very conscientious in helping our group as we were staying there for a high school reunion.  The breakfast buffet is fresh with a wide variety and well maintained.  I would definitely stay here again.

This was our second stay in this lovely place.  The staff is wonderful, the furnishings are beautiful.  We love the breakfasts, with the assortments of fruit, yogurt, cereals, and the hot offerings of eggs, potatoes, breakfast meats, and pancakes or french toast.  And the breakfast staff is so accommodating.  We took the shuttle to Disneyland each day, because that is so convenient and inexpensive.  The best part, for me, are the beds.  They are so soft and comfy.  Love, love, love this hotel!

The staff is very friendly and helpful.The style and layout of the hotel are exceptional. It is close to Disneyland Resort and the shuttle bus stop in front of the hotel. It runs every 30 minutes. Our room had 2 queen beds, very clean and spacious. There is coffee in the room and excellent WiFi connection. Great housekeeping! There's also a washer & dryer to do your laundry. We will definitely come back!

Arrived LAX from Australia 6.30am and caught shuttle to Anaheim arriving 8am. The very friendly staff advised our room was ready, which we were not expecting as it was only 8am. We unpacked and caught the shuttle bus from Ayres Hotel to Disneyland (US$5 return) spending all day at Disneyland. The hotel was full that night with baseball and hockey supporters attending their respective games and the hotel put on a free happy hour. Breakfast was excellent and the staff arranged transport in their free bus shuttle to the train station for us with luggage. Room & bed were great.

I love everything about this place from the rooms, the staff, the breakfast (awesome in every sense of the word), the location for sporting events (Angel Stadium and the Honda Center) and much more. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

I would stay here again. It was a really good experience! The staff was pleasant to deal with and meet each of my  requests with a positive attitude. The breakfast was perfect, it was a busy breakfast morning but chief perfected multi tasking. She made a mickey mouse shape pancake which my daughter loved.

I picked this hotel by searching the Internet because it was near Angels Stadium, free parking and came with a continental breakfast. We stayed three nights. It was very clean, and the staff was extremely nice.  The beds were the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept on!  The showers also had a lot of power. The "continental breakfast" was more like a regular breakfast.  The cheery chef made you pancakes or eggs and had different types of potatoes.  The breakfast selection was large.  I will definitely stay at a Ayers Hotel in the near future.  Another feature is that they had a free Happy Hour serving wine, beer, chips and salsa.  Unfortunately, due to having an 11-year-old, I was unable to attend.   I will definitely stay at a Ayers Hotel in the near future.

The Ayres hotel located by Angel Stadium is REMARKABLE!!! We walked into the lobby without reservations, hoping to get a room after we decided to spend the night since we had tickets to the LA Angels game for our wedding anniversary. Not only did Fred, the front desk clerk, accommodate our request, he informed us of all the amenities included at the hotel and surprised us with a bottle of champagne in our room upon our return from the stadium!!! We have stayed at many upscale hotels costing much more, but Fred and the Ayres staff was top-notch! Professional, friendly, accommodating, and most of all- excited for us to celebrate our 32nd anniversary at their hotel. I would highly recommend this location to any traveler!!

Summary Heading: Excellent location & really enjoyed our stay!
Summary: We stayed two nights at the Ayres so that we would be near the ball park and Disneyland and wished we had booked more nights at the end of our trip when we returned to LA.  We could easily walk to the ball game and we caught a shuttle to Disney that took about 10-15 minutes.  The hotel did not have a budget feel to it at all -- it was nicely furnished, clean and comfortable with spacious rooms.  A highlight for us was the breakfast -- hot options like eggs and freshly made pancakes as well as fruit, yogurt, toast, bagels, instant oatmeal and cereal.  The breakfast area is nice and spacious so it didn't feel too crowded even when busy.  Hotel staff were friendly and helpful too.  Our ratings are based on value for price.  This stay was the best value of our trip!

Summary Heading: Believe it.. They deserve the top rating in Anaheim
Summary: We stayed here on a 2 day trip to Disneyland. The hotel is located about 1 mile away from the park. The room was very spacious. The hotel is very clean and has an elegant feel. Linda at the front desk was very kind and had a basket of goodies prepared for our arrival being that we were Expedia Elite members. Two reasons to choose this hotel vs other nearby hotel: no parking fee and free breakfast. The parking fee you would otherwise pay at other hotels can be applied to parking at the park. A good thing to note is that there is in-and-out privileges when parking at Disneyland. Breakfast choices included: eggs, pancakes, potatoes, bagels, toast, cereal, oatmeal, juice, sausages, and coffee. They also have a happy hour in the front lobby that includes chips, salsa, and free beer.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel for Sticking to a Budget, Easy to Disneyland
Summary: The purpose of our trip was Disneyland on a budget!  Staying at this hotel definitely helped us to stick to our budget.  Getting to Disneyland: The Anaheim Resort Transportation (ART) picks up at the front door of the hotel.  It picks up on the hour and half-hour and is very prompt.  After pick up at the Ayres, it then stops at the Garden Walk, and then at the Disneyland bus depot.  The drop-off at Disneyland is very convenient and close to the both California Park and Disneyland main gates. Once the ART came, it took no more than 10 min to get Disneyland bus depot.  The hotel is on ART bus route 15. We purchased a 3-day pass from the hotel reception for $12 per adult and $3 per child.  Hotel: While I was aiming to keep to a low budget, I'm was not wiling to compromise safety or

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel across from Honda Center
Summary: What a wonderful place to stay when attending events at Honda Center! Our family was very happy with our Ayres experience. We were delighted to be able to park the car and simply stroll across the street to attend a concert! Waking up to a complimentary full breakfast (with made to order omelettes and pancakes) was a lovely bonus. Rooms were clean and well appointed with mini-fridges and coffee. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone requiring accommodations near Honda Center.

Let me start by saying that I have never taken the time to write a review but I was so impressed that I have to leave a comment. We took our son to Disneyland and we're looking for a nice hotel with interior facing doors, in a safe area, close in proximity to Disney, with free breakfast, parking and wifi for an a really great price. Lol I wanted it all and we got it here at Ayres Anaheim. I read the reviews on tripadvisor and decided to give it a try and I am so glad I did! Hotel is beautiful and very clean. Bathrooms clean and water pressure was perfect. Beds clean and comfortable. My son and husband are allergic to dust and they felt great at this hotel. Breakfast was busy but food was plentiful and the staff amazing! I don't know how that chef does it she was fast and still

Summary Heading: Awesome place to stay after a long day at Disneyland
Summary: 1st time visited disneyland, booked directly from the website with AAA discount.   People: very professional, nice  Location: awesome! The honda center is across the street. The baseball stadium is a short distance as well. The TJ restaurant is also across the street, which by the way had the BEST sea bass. Best part, it is only 10 min away from disneyland,  and we saved over $200 a night for the room :)  Parking: free...can't ask for more! Wifi: free, but didn't work most of the time. So :( Breakfast: awesome,  hot off the stove scrambled eggs, hash brown,  pancakes,  bacons, sausages.  They even had salsa. Yes, salsa! Fresh fruits, juices, cheerios,  milk, Danish,  muffins....the whole nine yards...AND all was included in the room price! Awesome!   Last but BEST features: the

My family and I stayed here for two nights and this is our third time staying at the Ayers Hotel Anaheim.  Like before, this place clean and friendly.  Other hotels in the area charge for WIFI and parking which could make a two-night stay as additional $50-$55 for parking and WIFI.  You also get a a free breakfast which are a variety of hot meal cooked in front of and their pancakes are delicious.  Ask for the Mickey Mouse pancakes if you have kids also.  Unlike other hotels, which do not give breakfast or have a full complimentary breakfast of juice and rolls (who gets full on that?).  Look for the promotional AAA membership or Disney Annual Passholders discounts and you could save on the standard rate.  I saved a good amount using the Disney Annual Passholders discount promo.

We booked this hotel based on rating from Tripadvisor and DID NOT go wrong!  There were 4 of us, so we had a king room with a sleeper sofa. The room had plenty of room. It was close to Disneyland and right by 2 of the major highways, so getting around was very easy. The hot breakfast every morning was fantastic!  They had eggs every day, then alternated bacon and sausage, and French toast and pancakes. The breakfast room was a little small, but who cares!  It was still great!  The Honda center is across the street and there was a Ducks game the last night that we were there. We were concerned that it might get a little loud and congested during the game.  It wasn't. I didn't hear anything.   If we go back, we certainly will stay here again!

We just completed our fourth stay at the Ayres Anaheim, and we are already looking forward to our next chance to visit!  Being Disneyland Annual Passholders, we sometimes book a "mini-vacation" so we can stay in Anaheim instead of driving home...and the Ayres is always our first choice!  Extremely clean rooms with the most comfortable beds ever, friendly staff who go out of their way to make every guest feel welcome, and a full hot breakfast makes ribs the perfect choice for us!

Overall very good service and quality. Will be returning. The location is perfect for my business needs and its proximity to Angel's stadium, the Honda Centre and other attractions made it all the better.

Stayed 3 nights at a Best Western and then the next 2 nights at the Ayers... The Ayers was by far the better of the two stays. Everyone that worked at the Ayers demonstrated excellent customer service. It is the small or simple things that made a difference such as the chef remembering who we were at breakfast and asking how our days activities at Disneyland went. The room was very nice, clean, and comfortable. The shuttle bus for Disneyland picks up right at the front doors!  Through all the good we did have a few complaints. The shower did not drain, and even after making it known at the front desk, the issue was not taken care of for the next days shower. The power in the room shut off unexpectedly in the morning while trying to get ready to leave. And lastly, there is a

Stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim for 2 nights and it was wonderful as usual. This is my 4th stay at this location and I will not stay any place else. The rooms are clean and comfortable, staff is friendly and location is great. The only issue I had this time around was with the construction noise coming from behind the hotel. So ask for a front facing room if possible.

We always choose this hotel when staying in or near Anaheim. It's the only hotel I've found that serves a hot full breakfast and has shuttle that's cheap to travel in. I've considered cheaper places in the area but none of the others offer a great room with all the aminaties you get at Ayres. We are never disappointed. Rooms are clean and beds comfortable. We had a rattle in our A/C unit the first night and let the staff know in the morning. By the time we returned to our room later that day it was all fixed. Can't beat great service all the staff is fabulous.

Summary Heading: Wish we could have stayed longer
Summary: We met family here to spend 2 days at Disney. We had time to spend only one night. Very comfy beds, elegant rooms and wonderful full hot breakfast. The staff was helpful and friendly. We hold annual passes to Disney, so we will make this our hotel of first choice from now on. We were especially impressed with the full hot breakfast that was included.

4 of us stayed at the Ayres Hotel last week for 4 nights and had a wonderful stay, could not speak highly enough about the help and friendliness of all staff, shuttle service for Disneyland, airport and shopping, close to Honda Centre and Angels Stadium, room was large and clean, bed was very comfortable, breakfast was excellent, would have no hesitation in recommending or staying next visit.

As always it was a good stay, took the bus to Disneyland, and had an above average breakfast.  They made my daughter a mickey mouse pancake, which made her day. It was a comfortable room and a cozy bed.

Hotel staff was very friendly & helpful; Marie was absolutely fantastic in helping me get our rooms for our dance competition.  Our room was clean and the free parking & breakfast made this a great value.  The only complaint would be that our pull out sofa bed was very uncomfortable, & seemed broken; so kids didn't like that.  I would recommend this hotel- close to Disneyland & other attractions.

Stayed in this hotel as we had read good reviews about this place and the hotel surely didn't disappoint. Rooms were clean, bright with good breakfast spread in the morning. Close to Disneyland without having to pay exorbitant prices. Overall would recommend this place to anyone who wants to visit Anaheim.

Recently stayed there for 4 nights with my husband and our 8 year old. Room was clean and roomy, the bed was very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. There was a washing machine and drier on our floor which was handy to do a load before we headed off. It is close to everything. Highly recommend this hotel.

We  recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim was great! The accommodations are great and the beds very comfortable. The employees were most helpful in our every question or request. The hotel offers a full hot breakfast that wonderful, very fresh hot and delicious. The location is also great.

We happened on this hotel 2 yrs ago and loved it so much that we convinced our family to change their already booked hotel to the Ayres for our family trip last year. We booked 4 rooms here with my reputation on the line, but I wasn't worried. They were so impressed that now when they come to Disneyland this is where they stay, too.   First of all, Marcus is so helpful and fun to talk to, the staff is great and attentive, breakfast is wonderful, the hotel itself is beautiful, and the location is so convenient! Our family couldn't believe that we paid such a "value" price for such upscale rooms. The hotel is a short distance to Disneyland and is a dedicated stop for the shuttle service - picks up outside the lobby, drops off right at the entrance of the park. Way better than

Summary Heading: Fine but not as good as expected
Summary: Stayed here 2 nights to visit Disneyland and overall the hotel was nice and the staff are friendly but not worth the hype, however I haven't stayed in any other hotels around Disney so it may be much better compared to those. The rooms were very big although slightly oddly designed as the bathroom area is tiny but the sofa area is huge. It was all very clean. My advice would be to shop around and see if you can get better value for money but if you're already staying then its perfectly fine.   Positives - Complimentary Breakfast, it wasn't spectacular but had a pretty good choice and it was free. - Staff are friendly and very accommodating - Happy Hour, they serve wine, beer other drinks and snacks form 5-6pm, although they advertise it when you book.  - Has a little kitchen

This is the best hotel.  The staff was wonderful, the breakfast was wonderful.  The room was spotless.  You do not hear lots of noise from other rooms.  This is a well built hotel and it is extremely clean.    The only problem, was the internet went down Monday and was still down when we left the next day.  They said it was a cox problem, but I think there should have been some sort of back up plan.  We depend on the internet when we travel and it was inconvenience.  The tv was not down, just the internet?    Still a great hotel!

The staff was very nice and friendly, the room was nice and very clean. Maid service was great and breakfast was wonderful! A short walk to Angels Stadium saved us parking fees or a taxi. We kept missing the happy hour but it looked good and people looked relaxed.  Just a really nice place.

My husband and I stay at both the Ayres hotel in Anaheim and the one in Orange.  We typically stay at the Anaheim Ayres, because it is a very short walk to Angels Stadium and offers free parking.  (The $10 savings on parking at Angels Stadium makes the already reasonable room rate even more reasonable.)  Our stays are consistently excellent and the staff at both hotels is stellar.  We have stayed at luxury hotels and not gotten the service and accommodations we get at the Ayres hotels.  I cannot sing their praises enough.  In fact, sometimes we think of planning a trip to Orange county just to be able to be guests at this wonderful boutique hotel.  In addition to everything else, the Ayres offers a full (and delicious) breakfast included in the price of the room.  When we leave

Very friendly , helpful staff. Gave the hotel a family feel. Lovely hotel, cosy. Nice breakfast and a nice touch to have the happy hour with free drinks , including non alcoholic drinks, chips and cookies. Great place to stay, has the feel of a home away from home.

Ayers Anaheim is a great value and wonderful property.  Fred at check-in was very helpful with our questions, as well as, very professional and courteous as a concierge at a 5 star hotel.  All the staff were always professional, friendly, and seem to enjoy working at this property.  The rooms are well appointed, spacious, and very comfortable with excellent bedding and towels.  Breakfast was excellent, as it was fresh and promptly served warm.  It tasted better than most hotel's restaurants.  The lobby is very relaxing and the European motif of the whole property is understated, anesthetically pleasing, and soothing.  It is a great location for Anaheim and would recommend over any of the Disney properties, Hyatt's, or Hilton's in the area as there is a positive, caring, cozy and

I stayed for two days for a business trip.  The customer service was excellent.  The staff was warm and friendly.  I arrived at 2 am after a 4 hour drive.  Even at 2 am, the counter attendant greeted me with a smile and processed me quickly because he knew without me having to tell him, that I was exhausted.  I was assigned a double queen room and it was huge.  More than adequate for my needs.  The bathroom was pretty luxurious for the price.  I've seen worse bathrooms for more expensive rates at other hotels.  Overall, the rooms were clean and comfortable.  As all the other reviews point out, this place really is excellent for the money.  Also, the complementary breakfast was pretty decent, considering that it's included in the rate.   My only complaint, if you can even call it

Across the street from the Honda Center. An easy 10 minute walk to Angel Stadium. Great location right on # 57 exit, no highway noise. Maybe a 10 minute drive to Disney. We stayed 4 days this trip, my second stay at Ayres Anaheim plus once at Ayres Orange. Free breakfast has everything you need. Cookies at check in. We only made it to one evening reception - beer, wine, chips with salsa. Rooms  are spotless, beds are the most comfortable, microwave and fridge in the room. We didn't use the shuttle tho they take you within a 3 mile radius. 2 computers and a printer in the lobby for customer use which was great for printing our boarding passes. I can't wait for my next trip and will absolutely be staying at Ayres.

Having just left Ayers hotel Anaheim we are pleased to say it is a wonderful hotel, staff are brilliant especially Jay behind the front desk who was very helpful and loved to talk about the Anaheim ducks! We learnt a lot! The king room we stayed in was spacious, comfortable and clean with the most comfortable bed ever! The ART bus service picked you up right outside the hotel taking you straight to Disney in just 15 minutes and ran twice an hour and at $5 dollars for all day pass you couldn't fault it. Pool area was clean, we loved the heated jacuzzi! Restaurant right next door was ok or you could take the ART to garden walk for more choice. Overall stay was brilliant would definetly stay again if we were in the area and would recommend to friends.

Summary Heading: Excellent Place to stay in Anaheim.
Summary: We stayed at the Ayers for 3 days in May - This Hotel is Very comfortable and the staff are a pleasure, We had no worries, issues. They would even offer to shuttle you to shopping etc. if you asked. Beds/Rooms/AC/bathrooms were all in terrific shape. And the location of the hotel is central - Your literally in walking distance to the Duck/Angels/restaurants - quick shuttle to Disney or shopping.. - We enjoyed our stay and would go back there in a heartbeat. The only thing that was not excellent was the small pool area - but with all the things to do around the area - there wasn't anyone in the pool.. Last point if you want to go to the beach - you will have to rent a car.. Also included (as with most hotels these days) was a full breakfast buffet which did the trick each

Wonderful Hotel, Great staff, Great location! Would stay here again. Shuttle Service was fantastic, Glad we decided to stay here. Free breakfast was good. Nice and quite room. Great location close to Disneyland and Anaheim Garden walk.

Family went to Anaheim to enjoy the Disney parks as well as day trips to LA and beach.  The Ayres exceeded our expectations!  The accomodations exceeded the rate we paid, with complimentary cocktail hour during the week, complimentary full breakfast every morning, shuttle service to/from the parks, and more!  The staff was extremely accomodating and customer focused.  We would definitely return.  Pool is a bit small, so summertime might get very crowded.  Also, next door is JT Schmidt's restaurant -- very convenient and well priced.

The Ayres Hotel is a very nice hotel with beautiful rooms and friendly staff.  My only fault was telling the front desk clerk that I would take the only room left on first floor, which was facing the intersection on the corner.  Unfortunately, I didn't get much sleep with the sounds of traffic going by at all hours.  I've stayed at the Ayres before and never had this problem.  I should have asked for a different room.  I will know better next time.

This hotel is wonderful! Really nice rooms that were immaculately clean. The meeting rooms were beautiful and the service was outstanding. The breakfast on my last morning was great and was included in the price. I hope to attend many more meetings here.

Even though we arrived late after midnight room we had requested (quiet on the 4th floor) was held for us.  Front desk checked us in quickly.  Our room was clean and beds were comfortable. Breakfast was nice & staff were very friendly.  Coming back for sure.

The best thing about this hotel is its convenient location. Right across the street from the Honda Center to take in a Ducks game. Just a block from Angel Stadium and a short shuttle ride to Disneyland. If you are a runner or biker, it's also right next to a great trail that runs along a dry riverbed. I like that this hotel is trying to stand out in the competitive near-Disneyland area but this is a Holiday Inn Express with Italian art on its facade and walls and nothing more. The rooms are small and just ok. Breakfast was very disappointing - and nothing European about it.

This is a beautiful hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are beautifully decorated. There's free parking. The breakfast was included and was very good by American hotel standards! Eggs, bacon, cereals, bagels, teas, coffees, Fanta instead of orange juice, porridge... Something for most tastes, I would think. The wifi was good. Faintly irritating that the fridge buzzed and the bath was so shallow but apparently that's normal in American hotels. Coffee maker in the room. Restaurant opposite delivers food to your room free of charge, which was very handy. The hotel isn't walking distance to Disneyland but there is a shuttle bus. I think it runs every half an hour for 5 dollars each a day. Probably quite cheap in a taxi but we didn't do this. The pool is quite small

Summary Heading: Business trip - Ayers is outstanding in every way.
Summary: Ayers hotel is truly the best of the best. I can't say enough of how friendly and knowledgeable the staff treats everyone. The rooms are spacious and clean. if your attending an Angels baseball game you are within walking distance. Park your car in the hotel lot and make your way to the ballpark. There isn't any hotels in the area that compares, especially with the reasonable price. I will give them 5 stars. Outstanding in every way. A full breakfast each morning is included in the price. They also have a business center. Couldn't ask for anything more. And they also provide fresh baked cookies from time to time.

Can't compliment the front desk staff enough! Each time we've stayed, I seem to have a special request and they are so great about it. We came up for Anaheim Ducks playoff and some regular season games as well. We arrived early from San Diego and they worked with us for an early check-in. Jay was extremely helpful on our most recent visit last Monday. The room staff was also very pleasant when I requested extra coffee and creamer. It's the little things that can make the biggest difference sometimes.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable, walk to Angels Stadium
Summary: Clean and comfortable, less than 10-minute walk to Angels Stadium.  They had a nice selection of free appetizers (chips and wine!) from 5:30 - 6:30 p.m. Mon-Fri in their well appointed lobby.  Parking was free and plentiful.  A free full breakfast is included.  Room was excellent and, unlike in many other mid-level hotels, there were plenty of washcloths and towels.    One odd thing--we felt a vibration in the room for a few minutes in the afternoon, and the front desk told us it was their large hotel drier on spin cycle on the first floor (we stayed on the third floor).  Other than that, property was quiet.  Would stay there again next time I go to a baseball game in Anaheim.

this is the second time I've been here. nice place to stay.  front desk personnel  (especially Andrew)  friendly and knowledable and helpful.  overall appearance very nice.  nice big room, everything worked.  I would have given 5 stars but two things bothered me.  parking was at a premium. very crowded parking lot across from major sports stadium. I think some of those  people parked in the Ayres lot. not sure if Ayre's can stop them. must be some way.  the second thing was the free breakfast offered by them.  good hours 6 to 9:30 am  but they only offered scrambled eggs and they were kind of runny. I asked the "chef" if he could make me some well done eggs and he said flatly  "NO".  also there was fruit cocktail (cut up pieces of fruit from a can" but no fresh fruit and not

Within walking distance to the Honda Center as well as the Angel's Stadium.  Disneyland is just a short drive away.  We enjoyed the Ducks Hockey game and went to Disneyland the next day. The hotel also offers a bus to and from Disneyland if you don't want to take your car.  Free Parking was great, other hotels hear Disneyland charge you a parking fee in addition to your room fee.  The Ayres also offers a decent full breakfast.  Will definitely be returning. Staff is courteous and friendly.

We had a very pleasant stay.  Came to attend baseball game between Yankees and Angels.  We were able to walk to the stadium down Douglas Ave., it was super convenient.  The hotel is really nice and quiet.  The room was very clean, quiet and bed was comfortable.  Hot breakfast was yummy.  We will stay again our next trip to Disneyland.  They offer a shuttle service to Disneyland, which is about a 10 minute drive away.  Thank you Ayres Hotel!

Clean, quiet property located close to everything.  Approximately 2 miles from Disneyland which is close enough to drive everyday yet far enough away from the crazy travel.  We will definitely stay here again and have already made our reservations for later this month.

First of all, I choose this hotel for our Disney vacation this year due to the reviews in Tripadvisor. It's the #1 hotel in Anaheim, so my expectations were really High, well, I have to say, at first I was kind of heartbroken, when we arrived to the hotel it was late, like 8pm, so we missed the cookies, the wine and everything else... well, we went directly to the pool and it was really, like really dirty, full of leaves and dirt and it was so cold !!! My kids played in the Jacuzzi for a while and then back to our room. Well, second disappointment was no restaurant in the hotel, this I didn't know but it was my fault for not asking about it. Ok. that was our first afternoon/night at the hotel. But I have to say, now, the room was BIG, clean, well appointed, the Beds are amazing,

We will defiantly be staying here again, great service, staff was very friendly and accommodating, room was very quiet, we were right next to the freeway and we didn't hear a sound, had a very rich decor, the breakfast was fantastic, most hotels only give a continental breakfast or no breakfast  but they give you a big breakfast. Staying here actually saved us  money, we almost stayed at one of the hotels next to Disneyland which was more expensive per night but also had resort fees and parking fees and no free breakfast, for my family of three I'm  guessing we saved about a hundred dollars for one day. We went to Disneyland on a two day pass but only stayed one night here, they have a coach bus that picks you up for five dollars a person, so we took the bus and saved twenty two

Stayed two nights with Ayres while going to Disney. Nice place located right next to the freeway. Those driving wouldn't miss it and it gives Complimentary parking! Nice breakfast spread too. Nicely done.

My husband and I like to keep the car at home and travel by bus/train. We live in Palm Springs and boarded the 3:00 pm bus @Palm springs Airport and after transferring @Fullerton arrived @ Anaheim 2+ hours later. We were greeted by the ayres bus which took us directly to the hotel just a few blocks away. The property was very clean and fresh, the front staff were welcoming  and helpful, especially Andrew. The Happy hour was not so happy, but just putting some jarred salsa, guacamole some chips, some carafes of wine and beer in a tub is not a reflection of the hospitality that this property emanates. I suggest a makeshift bar with an attendant serving a choice of a nice red or white Californian wine, and maybe a nice chess and fruit platter. This would encourage visitors to

This hotel did exceed my expectations.  Lovely, homey decor; happy hour wine & snacks provided in late afternoon (never been to a hotel that offers free wine/beer & snacks); clean, comfortable rooms; continental breakfast every morning; close to Disneyland with shuttle service (for reasonable fee) and friendly, helpful staff.  I do have to extend an extra star to this hotel for customer service - we were originally misinformed of the timing of shuttle service and missed the first shuttle of the day.  The hotel desk clearl offered to call is a cab, but it wasn't that easy soft us as we have a 2-yr old that would (by law) require to be in a car seat and traveling by an would then require us to lug around our car seat all day while at Disneyland. However our disappointment was

We wanted to visit Disneyland and found the shuttle service from the hotel door to the park excellent and very reasonable. The room we had was huge, clean, and with everything we needed. The pool was good, the breakfast was fine, and the service was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. I would happily stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great value in a great location
Summary: Just left our 2nd stay at Ayres Anaheim, and found it to again be a great value and a clean, comfortable stay. The morning breakfast is great, and the variety of food options nearby is excellent. We plan to stay here again next time we are in the area.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel in 2003 for business training.  We were there for 2 weeks and loved it.  We just returned this last week and still love it!  Very clean, quiet, and a friendly staff.  Breakfast is great (pancakes, egss, bacon, and much more!) -Thanks Jose!   Within walking distance to Angels Stadium and right across the street from the Ducks.  Hopefully we will get back before another 10 years goes by and will look forward to staying here again!

What a great time at the Ayres Hotel.  The staff is absolutely amazing - super quick, super polite, and most accommodating.  They take the time to answer your questions and are super efficient.  The room was spotless, beds were comfortable, and amenities perfect.  Enjoyed the breakfast buffet - eggs perfectly cooked, coffee hot, and stations were very clean.  The Anaheim shuttle service drivers were polite, on-time, and friendly.  My family and I have stayed at so many different venues, and by far, the Ayres is top notch.  Thanks so much!  Robin

I love this hotel, it was the best I have stayed at in a while. Everything was so clean, beds were the way they should be in a hotel. The free breakfast was better than most hotels. I am already to plan to come back to this hotel in September. THANK YOU ARYES HOTEL, YOU TRULY MADE MY STAY REALLY ENJOYABLE.

I found this hotel when searching for a place to stay that offers good breakfast and what do you know Ayres pulled up! Honestly, the hotel exceeded our expectations.. The rooms were a nice size, the hotel was clean and the staff was nice. Also, their breakfast buffet had a variety of food to choose from: eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, bagels muffins, fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc. The cook even made my girls Mickey pancakes, which I thought was sweet!!! The best part (so my kids say) is that they had baked cookies in the lobby one afternoon!!! The only complaint is that the parking lot is pretty packed and if you have an SUV the parking can be a little right and the beds are really firm. I guess that's good for those with back problems. However, the pillows sort of made up for

We had the most enjoyed stay at the Ayres this last week-end.  The staff is overly accommodating and cheerful.  Meghan had recommended a suite for my husband and I to have as our meeting up space with our four adult children/couples.  We got them 2 kings on the same floor and it worked perfectly.  Our rooms were clean, quiet and very cool.  We took the $5.00 dollar transportation bus to and from Disneyland and that too worked out perfectly, no car to mess with,.  These buses run every half hour.  We also walked across the street to eat the first night we all arrived at JT Schmitts. Very good service and tasty food, again EASY!  We LOVE the AYRES!!!

We recently stayed at this Ayers hotel for a Disneyland trip.  Our check in was super quick and the young lady at the front desk was very nice.  The room was large and clean and the beds were very comfortable.  They have more than enough parking space and the lot is well lit.  The hotel is well maintained and the employees are very friendly.  This will be our go to hotel from now on as long as they continue to have no resort, Wi-Fi, or parking fees.  The only downside for us was the breakfast room not having a tray to take food back to the room.  My son uses a wheelchair and it is much more convenient to take the food back to the room and not have to get him up, dress him and take him.  Aside from that, it was very nice to have a hot breakfast before heading to the parks each

we're disney passholders and out of the many hotels we've stayed at, Ayres is one of our faves. pros: really clean, comfortable, friendly staff, complimentary buffet breakfast + parking.. con: it's a bit of a distance from dland so if you take the shuttle, it takes at least 15-20 mins from what i remember. i'm a bargain shopper so i'll def stay here again when the price is right.

The hotel was wonderful.  The staff was attentive and friendly. The room was beautiful and clean.  Spacious.  Great first visit to Anaheim.  Hotel was located perfect for my needs and walking distance to many local attractions.

What a great hotel. I was expecting something along he best western plus lines but it was so much better. Brilliant location and really good staff, I also got the feeling no one was trying to rip you off or was just interested in selling more services, if in Anaheim, I'd strongly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Excellent base for Los Angeles stay/How to run a hotel
Summary: We have used this Anaheim location twice now over the past two years, each time staying a full week. The Katella Ave. location makes an excellent base being close to major freeways without feeling the stress of the busier downtown LA. It works for us as we took in Anaheim, downtown LA, coastal areas and northern.  In LA you drive but each night we returned to a comfortable, clean room and a welcome from the staff. The building is lovely, clean and humming which makes your stay easy. Our compliments to the manager, who you will find actively involved in the running of the hotel, and to the staff from reception desk to breakfast to household.  The manager is top notch and the week we visited he was involved in serving up breakfast,  covering for our regular great chef who was on

Very good location with easy direct resort bus service (not hotel operated, you must pay for the bus) to Disneyland.  Walking distance to Honda Center (across the street) and Angels Stadium (5-10 minutes, right behind the hotel).  Nice brewpub across the street.  Pool and hot tub are adequate, though nothing fancy.  Breakfast is good, the chef is a super nice guy but it's fairly unvaried.  Nice evening reception Mon-Thurs with beer and wine and cookies for the kiddos.  Service was good, except that housekeeping didn't make up our room until nearly 5:00 on 2/7 days.  I guess someone has to be "last" but it felt weird vacating the room for cleaning during the time we'd typical come back to rest.  Big rooms, comfortable beds, free parking, free internet and free breakfast within 3

The interior and our room is beautiful, spacious, and very clean. There are lots of TV channels for our daughter to watch. Free internet, parking and good breakfast. The bathtub is huge. The bath water are strong. The cooks are very nice. She made mickey head-shape hot cakes for our daughter. The wall arts, and the furniture gave a very classy look which I really love. Last year, we stayed at Holidays Inn suite. The price is about the same but we were so disappointed. We used the shuttle to get to Disney, there is no different as if we stayed at the closer hotels. We will be back. We highly recommend this hotel.

Great location if you want a place near Disneyland, as well as the Honda Center and Anaheim Angels Baseball Stadium.  My Husband and Son are big sports fans, they enjoyed a hockey game as well as a baseball game, both within walking distance.  Breakfast was decent, staff were very welcoming, room was clean and beds comfortable.  Will be returning.

Summary Heading: Great family hotel - perfect for our Disneyland adventure
Summary: We had a great time here. The room was clean, quiet and had a super comfortable bed. Service was quick, even at night, and the breakfast was a terrific bonus. The pool was a hit with my daughter, even after a long day at Disney. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Had a great experience staying in this hotel.Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Room was big, nice and clean. Great room service, our room was cleaned daily and the toiletries were replenished. Free breakfast had lots of variety and had a chef who serves hot breakfast. Breakfast area was big and can seat lot of people.   We stayed here for 3 days with our kids. Great location, close to many restaurants. Had frequent bus service to Disney parks.   About the cons, freeway was close and there was noise. Sinks were too high for kids. No hand shower in the bathtub.  Overall a wondeful hotel to stay. I would recommend this hotel.

We like staying in the hotel. reasonable. comfortable. clean. good breakfast. I would take my bath stuff. they don't have shower cap! or conditioners. the soap stinks. other than that good location and nice city shutle bus.

With two stays under my belt, the Ayres Hotel located just under two miles from Disneyland, a stone's throw from Angel's Stadium, is perfected situated.  It's a family owned boutique hotel that offers a lot for a great value. Fresh baked cookies, beer, wine, chips and guacamole are a delightful treat after a long day spent traveling in the car or waiting in line at Disneyland.  The rooms are spacious, clean complete with fridge and microwave. On a warm day, one can use the pool and hot tub.  And the full breakfast with Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes made to order would brighten up anyone's day.  Value, location and service just off the beaten path make this a great find off hotel row.

Upon arriving at this hotel, we were greeted by the most delightful girl at the front desk. We were in town for a dance classic at Disney and we were exhausted from the day. We checked in Friday afternoon, got the exact room we requested, and free parking never hurt. The chef in the morning was delightful. She made the girls Mickey Mouse pancakes, there was a variety to choose from, and it was all you could eat.  The room was very clean, the bath tub was huge, and it was very spacious.   We did think the hotel was closer to Disney but it was right across the street from the Honda Center and there was an Angels game going on so there was a bit of traffic. Although we didn't have time to explore the hotel thoroughly, I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

We just finished an 8 night stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim, and it was wonderful! We went for Disneyland,the beach and Angels baseball.  The ART shuttle ran every 30 min to Disneyland and only one other hotel on the route (15), so was quick and never overly crowded- perfect. Huntington Beach was an easy 30 min drive so perfect for a day trip, and Angels Stadium is a block away so we easily walked to and from the game. And the next night, we were able to watch the post game fireworks from our bedroom window. Excellent location, price, comfort and amenities (free hot breakfast, WiFi, parking-  all the things you get charged for at other hotels). And this was a QUIET hotel with the most comfortable beds ever. Really. We all slept awesome every night. This is our Anaheim hotel from

We live in Barstow and have season tickets for the Anaheim Ducks and stay here as often as we can.  Front desk staff is very friendly and always helpful, breakfast is fresh, hot and delicious and the cook always remembers us,  beds are very comfortable, wifi is fast, and walking distance to Honda center and Angel stadium.  The  Only hotel in Anaheim for us.

I just stayed at this hotel from 4/5-4-7 with my wife and two children boys 14,12 and loved it. First of all it is a couple of miles away from Disneyland but they do have a shuttle that will cost $5.00 per person to get you there for the day.. I liked it because it dropped you off right at the entrance to the park. (I believe that it was $16.00 to park at Disneyland, so for the extra $4.00 it was worth it.) The beds were extremely comfortable and the complimentary breakfast was great as well. ( I liked the chef so I tipped him everyday for making mickey mouse pancakes for my kids) I would highly recommend this hotel. I felt that the price of the hotel was a very fair price and I was able to take the money I saved by not staying at the Disney hotels and using that savings for

I live in Hawaii and it has been 8 years since I have visited california. I am a single mom travelling with my 4 year old son. I promised him on his birthday to take him to disneyland. We flew to San diego at 8pm. Driving in the dark in unfamiliar territory was a little uncomfortable. We checked in at the Days inn downtown for the night. NO Comment. Front desk was accomadating. I booked on line for $89 by the time I checked out fees, taxes, and parking it was $125. Not happy. Could not wait to get out of the Days Inn. Went to the San Diego Zoo, Scripts Aquarium, ate dinner at the fish house in Del Mar, before Heading to Ayres. I knew things could only get better after the Days Inn. Told my son to sleep and when he wakes well go see Mickey. Ayres was easy to find at night. Just

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel in a nice neighborhood.
Summary: Nice service in a quiet place. Breakfast time are beautiful.- Personel was very kind and willing to help you every time.- Neighborhood very quiet although there is a big baseball stadium very close.- Access to the hotel is Ok and gas stations close.-

Good breakfast. Good rooms. Good hotel. If we carry many suitcases there is no porterage service to the room. That is the only drawback. Other than that it is an excellent hotel. For going to Disney it is  a preferred location.

Any time there is an event at the Honda Center in Anaheim that I am interested in attending, I immediately start to make plans to stay at the Ayres Hotel. Why bother to hassle with traffic and parking when you can book a room and park free in the Ayres parking lot. I like the fact that it is a quick walk across the street and you are there at the Honda Center! The same thing applies if attending something at nearby Angel Stadium.   The Ayres Hotel in Anaheim is right off the freeway and easy to find. The hot breakfasts in the morning are delicious and I always enjoy the wine served at 4:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday.
