Though the pool is on the small side, I managed to get in it twice and take a decent swim. Loved the jacuzzi! The Ayres comes highly recommended in my book.

Check-in was easy, there were nice warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk counter. the front desk staff was very helpful, courteous, and always answered all my questions.   The king-size bed room was large enough for me and my daughter. the room was always kept very clean and spotless. There was 2 different soaps, shampoo, lotion on the bathroom countertop.  The room included a mini fridge and microwave. I did request a shower cap and the front desk staff brought one to me immediately. The bed was extremely comfortable.   Our room was on the non-freeway side, I was told it was quieter than the freeway side. but the first night we stayed there was a game at the Honda center and loud music, I couldn't fall asleep. I called the front desk to ask if they had any ear plugs. So

Summary Heading: Another 5 Star Experience at Our FAVORITE Hotel!
Summary: We stayed here April 6-8 for an early birthday celebration for our son's 10th birthday!  This was our third stay here...and we've already booked a return visit for May!  Our excellent service started from the minute we made our reservation.  Both Meaghan and Jay were extremely kind and helpful, doing their best to ensure that we could reserve our favorite room.  When we checked in, Meaghan even remembered us from our visit last May!  The atmosphere of the hotel is upscale but warm and inviting--perfect for families, business travelers, or even couples looking for a romantic getaway.  The rooms are clean and spacious...and the bed is so incredibly comfortable!  Chef Jose works incredibly hard preparing a full hot breakfast, yet he always makes time to speak with guests so they

Great hotel, friendly staff, above average included breakfast, large, well appointed rooms! The only downside is that they charge for local (across the street even). When so many other hotel chains now offer free local calling, it seemed a bit nickel and diming to charge a $1.00 call a restaurant right across the street.

We stayed at the Anaheim Ayres while attending a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center.  After registering for the conference later than usual, many of the reserved hotel rooms at the adjoining hotels were already booked, so we were forced to look a little further away for lodging.  We saw the positive reviews listed on Trip Advisor and booked three rooms at the Ayres Hotel.  We're very pleased with our stay.  We did drive to the Convention Center (the Ayres is a stop on the ART - public transportation for Anaheim but with our schedule it was easier to drive each morning) and found that traffic was busy - but not so bad that we had trouble making it in time.  It was also nice to "get away" from the crowd during the evening and enjoy the quiet that this Ayres location

This was a wonderful hotel!!  We were not familiar with this chain of hotels, but we were impressed!!    Great location for us as we went to a concert and just had to cross the street!  We also went to Disneyland,  and the shuttle came and picked us up and also brought us back.  The rooms were very nice, too, and we had a great breakfast !!

We came from another hotel, due to horrible loud noises, and un comfortable beds. We stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for 5 nights. I have to say the staff here were extremely friendly. One night we had came back from a long day at Disneyland. Around 7:00. We had noticed hat our room had not been serviced. So we told the front desk on our way out to dinner. When we returned, the woman at the front desk informed us that it had been taken care of. And they took $20 off our bill. They also have a happy hour at 5:30-6:30 when we showed up, there was a little left in the Chardonnay carafe. I poured the rest into my glass, and joked that I wish there was more. But after all it was 6:30. One of the staff asked me if I would like more? I said, why yes! üòä He came back with a half full

A wonderfully convenient location for anyone attending events at either the Honda Arena or the Angels Stadium - walking distance to both! The hotel and our room was well-appointed and tastefully decorated; the front-desk staff very friendly and accommodating. We were invited to a "Manager's Cocktail Party" from 5:30PM to 7PM. We arrived just after 6PM and ALL of the chips, salsa and other snacks were completely GONE, with no apparent expectation of re-stocking. The 3 carafes of wine contained less than one glassful remaining.  There were two beers sitting in a plastic busboy-type grey tub with ice. No staff was to be found anywhere in the vicinity. So, although it was a generous gesture on the Manager's part, that would be ONLY if you arrived at 5:30PM---and not a minute

Summary Heading: We will never stay anywhere else!!!
Summary: I have never written a review online before but this hotel and their staff deserve to be recognized. We were not sure we were going to be able to travel because my daughter has a rare metabolic disorder and I have to cook all of her food daily and have to bring all of her food with us, some of which is frozen. The rooms have a small refrigerator as well as a microwave and the staff went above and beyond to help us with her frozen food. Everything from the moment we arrived was perfect. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We were on the freeway on our way to the hotel and realized our directions were wrong. We called the hotel and they very quickly got online, found out where we were and helped us get to the hotel. I cannot say enough about the staff! The hotel is clean

Summary Heading: The shook and is was not the earthquake.
Summary: Paid $220 for ones night stay. The bed shook due to the construction or the fact the hotel/room is very near to major roads. The room shook enough to wake me several times. I informed the fronts desk and all they said was thats strange, but offered no rebait.

Summary Heading: Perfect place to stay if your a Duck or Angel fan
Summary: The room was very nice, the people were friendly and helpful, the breakfast was a pleasent surprise.  This property is located a short walk from the Big A and right across from the Duck Pond. No parking, no DUI, and the bar across the street was great. I highly reccomend this hotel.

We stayed at this hotel for 5 days while attending a baseball tournament. The hotel was very clean, the breakfast was cooked hot daily, had a good selection and everyone from the front desk to the cleaning crew was very friendly and helpful.

Been coming to health convention for 15yrs stayed at couple of different hotels but this was the best off all. Very clean rooms and the service from esp front desk desk, outstanding . before I left, I already booked for next year.And my friends are going to book from now on too.their comp breakfast was very good actually eggs NO RUBBER EGGS.or PANCAKES. Hot out of the grill.Also dropped ,and picked us up from the convention.

We were with a group in town for a basketball tournament in the Honda Center.  The Ayres Hotel is across the street from the Honda Center, so we chose to stay there.  But it is one of the best hotels our group has stayed at in the 35 years we've attended NCAA basketball tournaments.  The location is perfect.  The rooms are nice and have extremely comfy beds.  And the rooms have excellent lighting, including a ceiling fan with light fixture.    The staff is friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was very good, though it could be crowded at times.  Several good restaurants are within walking distance or a short drive.    We were all on the fourth floor, and it was interesting that the rooms were not identical.  We were in 419, which had a standard height ceiling throughout and a sort of

We stayed for 4 days. What can we say- perfect hotel! Immaculate!!!! Kudos to the cleaning girls!! Breakfast -delicious, hot, tons of choices!! Location perfect. Hotel is gorgeous inside artwork pushes it to extremely classy. Desk staff were polite, prompt delivering pillows and blankets even though hotel was packed. Loooooovvve it. Will be back for sure.

We were with a group of people in town to see the NCAA Men's Basketball games at the Honda Center. This hotel is across the street so the location was perfect for our needs. The property is very clean and well maintained. We found to staff to be very friendly as well. Unlike many hotels I have stayed at (150 nights per year), the breakfast here was very good. Several in our group commented that they found the beds very comfortable. We got good value for our money.  The one negative was that there was a lot of traffic noise in the pool area. This is due to construction going on in the area of the hotel so there is not a lot they can do about that.

The Ayres Hotel was very nice. I stayed overnight, the room was spacious, the bed was comfortable. I had all the amenities I needed, coffee, refrigerator, internet, and quiet. I would happily stay at the Ayres again.

We stayed at this hotel for three nights while visiting Disney. It had all the friendliness of a family run hotel but every comfort you could need. the rooms were spacious, clean and attractive and the beds amazingly comfortable. The staff were friendly and efficient. I wish we could have spent more time relaxing there really but our days were busy. The breakfasts were great too. I would definitely recommend this lovely hotel.

Summary Heading: Really good hotel for the price
Summary: My son and I stayed here for four nights before continuing our vacation to Burbank, CA.   Ayres had a very nice room and was quite spacious.   A free breakfast daily downstairs which included hot breakfast as well as continental.    The ART transportation in Anaheim (not offered by hotel) can take you to most locations in the area but is sparatic and sometimes crowded.   However, it will save you from parking fees at theme parks.    After arriving at our next destination, we truly appreciated the accommodations at the Ayres.  We stayed at a much more expensive hotel in Universal City and the room was much smaller and not nearly as nice.  The hotel itself was much bigger but we still liked the Ayres much better.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in
Summary: About me: world-traveled filmmaker/journalist, about 40 countries and 47 U.S. states. Often on business. Have stayed in the highest-end resorts in the world's great locations (Paris, London, Venice, Barcelona, Rome, Bora Bora, New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Los Angeles, Las Vegas), and in some of the cheapest low-end places imaginable, ranging from jungles to deserts, sleeping on the ground in mosquito nets. I've pretty much seen it all!  Was in Anaheim working on video shoots at Disney Resorts for three long days. I did not want to drive 1-2 hours home and back each day, so decided to stay in the area. The Ayers was only 5 minutes from Disneyland-- plenty close. My wife joined me for 2 days. Our first stay at the Ayers Hotel Anaheim certainly won't be our last.  The entire

Great hotel to stay while visited Disneyland. Away from all the crowded but still in the Disney area. 4 of us stayed for 2 nights. Beds were comfy.Breakfast was superb. Wifi was very important to me to get connect with my work and I found sometime worked but some didn't work. It was very frustrated..Overall, We had a great stay!

Great hotel based near Disneyland. The ART bus runs frequently and is a stress free way to travel to Disney. Very welcoming and helpful staff who are happy to help with anything. Rooms are spacious and clean and breakfast varied.  Also very handy for the Honda Center if you're visiting any events there.

Great pricing due to a spring special and the hotel was a wonderful surprise.  We selected this property based on its ranking in TripAdvisor and were very happy with such decision.  Experience was great from arrival to departure. Breakfast was excellent and rooms were clean, large and very confortable. We loved the european style of the hotel.  Even though there were some construction in the surrounding areas,  Front Desk gave us a wonderful room away for any noise. We felt as VIPs even thought it was the first time in this property. Thanks to all the staff for being so friendly and helpful.  Just keep in mind that if you are planning only going to Disneyland, you may have to decide between having a car rental available or using the ART system. In our case, we used a rental

Its close proximity to Disneyland, free parking, and great bang for the buck make this a no-brainer for my family.  My only complaint might be that the climate control could be ready for an update and there's a lot of construction nearby on Katella Ave, but I find there's a lot of construction everywhere I drive these days.  Also great if you are staying for an event at the Honda Center, which is within walking distance.

We have stayed at the Ayres Anaheim to attend the 2013 & the 2014 Big West Basketball Tournament and highly recommend it. Nice clean rooms with friendly, attentive staff.  It's location makes it convenient to access the Honda Center, Disneyland, shopping, etc.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Chapman University
Summary: I was looking at colleges with my teenage son. When we pulled in and noticed the Honda Center across the street we decided to attend the Ducks game that night. It was great to be able to park at hotel and walk across the street to the game. Hotel was very clean. Rooms were spacious and beds were comfortable. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast the next morning was a bonus. Would stay at a Ayres Hotel again.

We stayed here for 2 days to go to the Disney parks.. The 2 girls at the front desk upon check in were super friendly and attentive with our needs.. The room was really clean and beds were comfy. They do offer breakfast and not your thou at continental. We did not try it since we had plans inside the parks. Thank you for everything. Will be back soon.

We were attending an event at the Honda Center so this hotel came recommended.  We were really happy with everything the hotel had to offer.  The room was very nice, the bed very comfortable.  The staff very friendly and helpful including the staff operating the breakfast on Saturday morning.  We would highly recommend to any future travelers.

Summary Heading: Stayed here due to proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Gonna make this review a quick and dirty one. Stayed here because it got a good rating on Tripadvisor and because it is 5 minutes away from Disneyland. It is a European style hotel and it is across the street from the Honda Center, so if there's an event happening at the Honda Center, there is bound to be more traffic. They have signs that say "No Event Parking" for this reason. You can hear the noise from the hockey games and such. It's close to the freeway.   The room had an awkward entryway that was small. There was no shampoo, the conditioner was half filled and there were no qtips/cotton balls provided. On the plus side, the room was clean and there was free parking. Also, they provide a complimentary breakfast, so that was a plus.

Summary Heading: My New Favorite Place to Stay
Summary: Called the hotel directly when all seemed lost at finding a place to stay while in Anaheim to see a hockey game. (Go Pens!) Travel hotel websites didn't seem to be much help, so don't hesitate to go direct. Very nice, clean hotel. Comfy beds and all the amenities you really need. Free breakfast was great. Quite the variety of fresh cooked samplings. It was great to walk directly across the street to our venue. Was worth putting the extra money (although still a good price) into a great room rather than paying for parking! Highly recommended. Will definitely stay there again.

The toilet was clogged and the front desk brought a pump for me to fix it my self. They did not have maintenance crew onsite. I came back the second time after speaking with Marcus Collins who promised making my staying very pleasant however, my room had no AC and the ceiling fan was not working either.   My father asked the front desk guy if he spoke Spanish. The front desk guy named FRED in a very condescending and sarcastic manner responded to my dad with a question,"Do you speak German?"   When I reported the issue to the night manager, he was very apologetic but wanted us to excused such behavior and talked to us as if we were friends.
Manager Response: Dear Zac R.   I am so sorry that you had such an unpleasant experience staying with us. As we have spoken at length about your experience and I have already apologized profusely, this response is really for the benefit of Tripadvisor readers. I would like to clarify one area. I did discount $50 or around 50% of the nights you and your father were affected by poor service. However I did this 3 times so the refund was not $50 but $150.   It is clear that we should have done better and for that I am truly sorry.  Regards,  Marcus Collins

Summary Heading: Excellent stay I an excellent Hotel
Summary: We have just checked out today from the Ayres Anaheim hotel, I selected this hotel because it was no 1 on the trip advisor and it didn't disappoint.  From the moment we checked in until we left today everything about the hotel was up to standard the rooms were clean and the bed sooooo comfortable I slept like a baby, the breakfast provided every morning was a pleasant surprise with the food adequate & tasty for the day.  The staff were friendly especially Andrew who happily drove us to the supermarket for some supplies.  We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, just a few thing however that would have been nice to know, it is right next door to the Anaheim Ducks we could of easily watched a hockey game had we known it was so close.  Next door is Jt Schmidts Brewery & Restaurant

Summary Heading: Beautiful, clean and a lot space hotel
Summary: Went recently to a business trip to this hotel, the personnel it is very friendly, they also have cookies sometimes at the door (maybe I was lucky to get them before they run off).  The room was very big, very nice with everything that I wanted, a small fridge, coffe maker, and a sink, on the restroom they have a dryer and a mirror that has magnification, for me it is very helpfull.  Also in the closet they have an iron and 2 robes.  Everything was perfectly clean, the bed made very nice, etc, no complains at all to this beautiful place to stay and have a good rest.  It is very close to the freeway and to Disneyland and lots of places. Very higly recomended.  The complimentary breakfast it is top notch, really good with a lot of differente things offered and a very nice chef for

Great service, great rooms (very spacious and clean), and great hotel! PERFECT location if you're seeing a concert at the Honda Center (Literately across the street from the hotel) and free breakfast, parking and wifi! I will definitely be staying their again if I'm ever seeing another event in Anaheim. Overall an amazing experience, thank you Aryes Hotels!

We came for the Anaheim Sulpercross race.  hotel is within walking Distance to Angle Stadium and the Honda Center.  A short drive to Disney and the beach.  Rooms and lobby were very clean.  hotel staff was friendly and helpful.  Excellent breakfast included with stay, not your typical continental breakfast.
got the last minute chance when we were traveling from LA to San Diego. A very nice hotel with clean, classy rooms and lobby and also with decent staffs. just loved to stay here a lot!

We were staying here to go to a concert at the Honda center-location was great & the hotel was really nice! Considering the free parking & proximity to the Honda center plus the included hot breakfast- it really didn't cost us all that much to stay the night!! Free Wifi too! And the Brewery restaurant right next door was great too! Definitely recommend this hotel for concert-goers who don't want to drive home after a concert!!!

Summary Heading: Exceeded my expectations in every way
Summary: Really, really beautiful decor. Very clean. Friendly staff. Yummy cookies  in the evening. Outstanding full american breakfast with meat, eggs, pancakes, pastries, cereal, fruit all freshly made right there. Very good value. The pool and hot tub were being refurbished so I asked if they offered a discount because of that. Got $20 off each night. Cha-ching! 2 1/2 miles from Disneyland.

Our one night stay was good.  There is construction in the area but it did not affect us since it was Saturday night.  The line for the free breakfast in the morning was long and slow (it took me 30 minutes) but the food was delicious and hot.  There should have been more help in serving breakfast instead of just one person who seemed exhausted at the close of breakfast.  She was very pleasant to all the customers though and I commend her.  The room was nice but the bed was too soft for my comfort.  Checkout was especially nice due to Eboni at the front desk  Will we stay here again?  Probably.

This hotel is literally across the street from the Honda Center.  Free parking and hot breakfast. The breakfast was tasty. The cook made fresh eggs, potatoes, and pancakes and was hustling. FYI, you cannot hear freeway noise even if your room is on that side of the hotel. Our room was large, with a sitting area, couch, and small table. Fridge and micro would be nice if you are staying awhile. The hotel is a bit tired, but still nice. The worst part is the wall a/c unit that cycles on and off during the night which can interrupt sleep. We turned the a/c way down while we were out for the evening so the room was cold when we returned which allowed us to turn the a/c unit off. Strongly advise.  Don't get a room by the elevator.

Located right across from the Honda center and about 12 minutes away from the Disneyland parks, this is a great place to stay in Anaheim area.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  I am a stickler when it comes to clean accommodations. With Anaheim being the tourist city that it is, nice clean hotels are somewhat hard to find. This hotel won't disappoint.  The staff is friendly and very helpful.    The hotel offers free continental breakfast but do get there early because there is a line and limited seating.  I usually say at a hotel right next to Disneyland but when that place is booked up (as was the case this weekend), Ayers Hotel is going to be our next top choice!!  Thanks Ayers for a great night stay!!

If your going to a concert or event at the Honda Center this is the prime spot, also the grove is just down the street. The pool and spa area was closed for replastering so can,t say much about it. The water pressure in the shower could have been better. All in all a great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Once Again Ayres Anaheim shows why its #1
Summary: This was my 3rd visit to the Ayres Anaheim hotel.  Booking process was simple and I decided to pay a $30 upcharge for early check in guaranteed by 10:00 AM.  Arrived on a red eye and got to the Ayres at 7:00 AM.  Took our chances to see if maybe a room was ready fully knowing that the upcharge was for a 10:00 AM check in.  I was greeted nicely and asked.  To my surprise they had a room! And I could not have asked for a better room--first floor, adjacent to the front lobby and breakfast room.  I was also attending a Ducks game at the Honda Center and my room was right next to the side entrance which led us close to the intersection we had to cross.  It was perfect.  Thanks to Eboni for being so welcoming and accomodating when we arrived.   The room was your basic queen and has

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel, FAR from Disney, lots of construction going on
Summary: The hotel itself is very nice, staff was friendly, rooms were big and beautiful. Beds were comfy, shower water pressure was just ok.  The free breakfast was cooked right there and delicious, great variety.  The pool and spa were under construction when we were there. The road in front of the hotel was also under construction which made it difficult to enter and exit.  This hotel is not very close to Disneyland-definitely not walking distance.

Stayed here for a Visit to the LA area, great rooms with all modern amenities flat screen, mini fridge and such. It has an  old European style to the  hotel,  comfortable beds, ,super helpful friendly staff,good hot breakfast. Shuttle access to Disney comes every hour or so and you can purchase it through the front desk. Perfect location if your going to see a hockey or basketball game as its right across from Honda center

This property have the best staff, is clean, they have a pool, a terrific breakfast every morning and is a beautiful  and comfortable property. It iw q goo property for person or business use.  The property is across the street from the Honda Center in Anaheim, very close (almost walking distance) to the Angel baseball stadium and they have a shuttle to Disneyland off and on all day and evening.   I would very highly recommend this hotel to my family and friends.

We stayed for just 1 night at the Ayres hotel in Anaheim. We stay in Anaheim pretty often and our last stay at the Greenwood Suites was MORE than unpleasant. So when we walked in the lobby, we were already pleasantly surprised at the set up as well as the greeting from the front desk. We were able to check in early at 11:30, so that was a bonus. We went up to the room and were MORE than happy with the room. It was spacious and had a ceiling fan and was extremely clean. The shower was great and overall everything was just wonderful. The bed is SUPER comfy! The icing on the cake is that they have a "social hour" during the week with snacks and free beer and wine. And freshly baked cookies. Also, in the morning the breakfast was a really good value and the chef was super nice, even

Once again kudos to Ayres for their comfort, convenience and class. Got in at check in time and everything was ready for us. The king size bed with the comfort mattress top meant a great night's sleep. Lots of room to relax and kick back while you get ready for all the events close by. Honda center right across the street. Angel stadium a few blocks away. Disneyland, Knotts berry farm right down the road.   I can't stress enough of the value you get with the Ayres chain. It's our go to place when we travel. I always try to locate the closest Ayres to our destination. The free breakfast was top notch as usual. Great selection and a cook to fix a special order. We had a very quiet night also. Not unusual but we hardly heard any talking down the halls or slamming doors. Hopefully,

We stayed here two nights for my daughter's 21st birthday girl's weekend to Disneyland.  I booked it because it was highly rated on Trip Advisor.  Because of the d√©cor ("Old World Ambience") in the photos, I expected this to be an older property and to be a bit run down and musty. I was totally wrong!  The hotel is not run down in the least.  The staff was extremely cheerful and accommodating.  There were four of us "girls" sharing a room, and upon entering, I was amazed at the spaciousness.  Two queen beds, desk, table with 2 chairs, an easy chair and a mini kitchen with sink, fridge and microwave. The large counter space in the bath area was also a huge plus.  The beds were very comfy and the room was very clean. Breakfast was one of the better hotel breakfasts I've

We stayed here 2 nights at the beginning of our road trip. We drove here straight from LAX - it's situated close to freeways - so you can get to places of interest quickly. Easy parking. Not particularly an area to walk around in - but you can cross the road to the brew pub for a meal in the evening, if you don't feel like driving. What a lovely welcoming place after a long trip or day of Disney (or in my case, trip out to Fender in Corona). The afternoon welcomes you with fresh baked cookies and the early evening with happy hour glass of wine or beer. The rooms are large, very clean and quiet. The beds very comfortable. Even though there was a game on at the nearby stadium, we had an excellent night's sleep. I did some laundry here too - it all works well. Breakfast was very

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Fantastic hotel. I will list the Pros and then the Cons.  Pros: Great prices. We used a discount for Disneyland pass holders and saved an extra 20% on the room. The beds were very comfortable and the room was very clean. Breakfast was great! For some reason I was expecting a cook to make custom ordered omelets (similar to Embassy Suites). The Ayres Anaheim didn't have this, but it had something just as good, if not better. There was a cook making fresh pancakes right in the kitchen. He cooked amazing Mickey Mouse pancakes for our 3 boys. (We were there to visit Disneyland). The boys loved them! The fresh cooked pancakes were much better than Embassy Suites, where the pancakes are pretty rubbery after sitting under the heat lamps. There were also scrambled eggs, sausage, and

Summary Heading: Clean and Comfortable we would recommend!!
Summary: We stayed two nights at The Ayres. It has the most comfortable beds, I ask my daughter what she thought they might be made of and she replied "clouds". The rooms were very clean, the staff were extremely helpful, patient and courteous. We enjoyed the breakfasts. As our visit was to the Supercross at Angel Stadium, we were able to walk. All in all a very nice place to stay and have no hesitations on recommending. We stayed in room 233, it was spacious with 2 queen beds. A separate sink, bathroom was small but adequate.

What a lovely place to stay.  Quiet, and comfortable.  The adjacent room contained 3 young kids, but we never heard a thing from their room !  Our room was very clean, and the a/c was thermostatically controlled.  Nice linens on the bed.  We were very pleased with our stay.

We chose the Anaheim Ayres over others for our first family trip to Disneyland because it came so highly recommended on TripAdvisor.  While our visit to Disneyland/DCA was memorable and magical, the hotel left some things to be desired. Nothing is overtly wrong with the Ayres. It's a good value and a nice hotel, but it wasn't the AMAZING hotel I was expecting based on its reviews.   The staff was friendly-ish (Andrew, however, was a standout -- helpful, warm and very kind), our room was small and tidy -- clean-ish, but not clean -- and the pool was... a pool.   PROS -- We were able to enjoy an affordable Disneyland/DCA vacation without a car from the Ayres. The Route 15 ART shuttle stop is conveniently located right outside the front door, which made traveling to and from

Summary Heading: Went to the hockey game at the Honda Center
Summary: Stayed there a few times. Rooms are nice and spacious with a fridge and microwave. Beds are great and so is the staff. Best place to stay if attending a Ducks game or Angels game. Walking distance to both with JT Schmids brewpub across the street.

Summary Heading: a very nice clean, convenient hotel
Summary: Very nice old world charm...clean! Friendly desk staff was very pleasant. we arrived about 2 p.m. And relaxed in the lobby for about 45 minutes before we were able to check in. When they say 3 p.m. they mean 3 p.m..Lol Negative: ceiling fan didnt spin. No bigee. Oh, and no roll-out beds. We had to get an additional room.

Summary Heading: Very good value; great rooms; great service hotel.
Summary: During a recent vacation in California, this was the top hotel. We booked it to be close to the Duck Pond (Honda Center) but it would be great for Disney, Angels, Convention Center etc.   Great price, great rooms, great service, wifi was strong, nice breakfast included and engaged staff.   I got my hockey jersey autographed by Saku Koivu thanks to the staff loaning me a black marker for the evening. That was the kind of attention to detail that I appreciate.

Summary Heading: Welcoming hotel in a great location
Summary: We don't usually stay at this hotel on our visits to Anaheim but our regular hotel was fully booked between the xmas and new year period.  As our main reason for coming to Anaheim is to go to watch the Ducks play at Honda Center, this hotel is in a perfect location just across the road so we decided to give it a go and we were not disappointed.   The foyer was very welcoming with a cosy common area of a few chairs and couches and complimentary drinks & snacks are served here in the late afternoon during the week.  We spent 3 nights here at the start of our US vacation, and a further 3 nights at the end.  On both occasions we were able to get an early check in and our rooms were clean and spacious and tastefully decorated.  The king size beds were extremely comfortable and there

This was our first time to this hotel and stayed at a different hotel last year while visiting for the NAAM show which was considerably more expensive and did not have the decor nor charm. Boy, do I wish we would have stayed here first. Wonderful hotel--very clean, courteous professional staff, well kept hotel!. Rooms were very spacious, beautifully decorated, comfortable beds and great pillows. Breakfast was also a treat as the cook prepares everything fresh right in front of you--with a smile. I had a problem with the blow dryer and called the front desk and was brought a new one without a problem. We will definately return next year.

My husband and daughter stayed here for 2 nights to kick off our 9 day stay in California.  My husband attended a conference at the convention center so it was the perfect location.  I have nothing negative to say about the hotel.  The rooms were very spacious and clean, the staff was friendly, the location was close to restaurants, shopping and Disneyland.  The only slight criticism I would make is that the breakfast was just ok.  The food was plentiful, however if you are health conscious, it's hard to eat well.  I would recommend this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

We have stayed at the Ayres Anaheim 3 times a year for the past 3 years and have enjoyed the hospitality each time.  The close proximity to the Angel Stadium is what first attracted us, along with the terrific breakfast. The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The staff is consistently pleasant and helpful.  We'll see you again in a few weeks, and again next year! Thank you!

Staff was so friendly -  room was very nice and great full breakfast.   Perfect in every way.   Loved the decor and the elevators were fast......      Good location -  right off the 57 fwy.    Would recommend you go here.    They even have wine in the mini store....

We were situated in Room 101, the face is on the corner and opposite the Honda Stadium. As to be expected, when an event was on you could hear the announcer or the crowd but to be quite honest it wasn't bothersome. A vast portion of the noise is cut out and we slept soundly. The rooms themselvces are huge, with very reliable wi-fi. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The breakfast has a large array of choice, with food constantly being made fresh. The pancakes were delicious. All in all, with it's prime location, knowledgeable and approachable staff as well as the great rooms, this place is definitely worth a stay.

We stayed here in January looking to go to the hockey game and Disneyland.  It is located right across from Honda Center and a convenient shuttle service will take you to Disneyland.  There was a minor hiccup our first night and the staff more than made up for the inconvenience.  Breakfast is great.  Next time in Anaheim this is where I will stay!

We stayed here for three nights over new years.  We had two rooms for our family of five.  I e-mailed beforehand and asked for adjoining rooms.  It wasn't possible the first night, but they managed to work it so we only had to shift one room and had adjoining rooms the next two nights.  One of the rooms smelled a bit yuk when we first arrived, the other was fine.  We opened the window and aired out the smelly room the next day and the smell went away.  The breakfast was fantastic (the best we had in our trip around California).  There was a different cooked option each day.  The hotel is a bit further away from Disneyland than some of the others, but we found it ok.  We had a car and drove most of the time, although we caught the shuttle ART on New Years eve and that worked out

Summary Heading: Excellent boutique hotel with great rates, quick drive to Disney & easy access to stadiums, convention center & expressways
Summary: We stayed two nights in order to visit Disneyland for 1 day. Hotel exceeded expectations (which were already high from previous glowing reviews).   Beautiful decor (loved the artwork along the corridors) and spacious rooms with nice luxury touches you don't see at other chain hotels. Across from convention center and by the stadium - it was a short 5-10 min drive local to Disney parks.   I loved being able to go to Von's (also just 2 miles away) to stock up on juice boxes the day before. It's just off the expressway and within a mile away from two other expressway so very well located. The restaurant across from the hotel was decent for dinner. Breakfast was great - my son loved the Mickey Mouse pancake cooked to order! We enjoyed the hash browns, bacon, sausage, eggs freshly

Practically everything about this hotel is perfect. The front desk service, cleanliness, comfort, noise insulation, rooms, etc.   The breakfast (included in the price per night) is great and the kitchen staff is very friendly. Of course it's not as vast as a full buffet.   I'd definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Great value overall with one minor issue
Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel, the last one being on our first wedding anniversary in July 2013. We decided to choose this hotel again based on our positive experience the last time. We arrived late, around 11pm and were checked in efficiently. Our room (201) was situated on the northeast corner of the hotel facing Katella Ave. The room was clean and temperature fine for the night. However, due to the construction on Katella Ave there was an intermittent clunking sound when traffic drove over some metal plates in the road. This meant that by 6:30am, my wife and I were not able to sleep much. Breakfast was good but there were not any pancakes like the last time (maybe they're only made on the weekends?). Checkout took a bit longer as it appeared the front desk was a

First off...the beds. People had reviewed the comfort of the beds. The NUMBER ONE reason we choose this property was the beds. They were very cozy. Not too hard and not too soft. Slept through the night just fine. Then there was the noise factor. It was right off Katella and Hwy 57. There WASN'T a sound to be heard in our room. We were on the third floor in the front. Seriously there was NO sound from the road or freeway, Breakfast, buffet style situation. A cook was there to assist with the hot items. Then there was the normal hotel fare to round out the breakfast. Never ran out of food. Nightly reception. Nice. Not a big choice of food but it was FREE and welcomed. The staff, well, they were all top notch. Friendly, helpful and polite. Oh yes, if you ever need convenience to

This hotel is more of a boutique type than a regular hotel.  The lobby is French modern with a wonderful fireplace.  Week nights a social hour in the lobby with free wine, beer, and canap√©s.  Our room was large with a poster bed, desk, easy chairs and very clean.  We were ill one day and the maid brought extra towels.  New Year's eve they supplied us with champagne flutes to toast the New Year in our room with friends.

I've rated Ayres Hotel Anaheim before (excellent!) and am pleased to do so again.  I LOVE this hotel!  The room is SO clean!  Clean sheets, clean floors, clean bathroom!  The bed is SO comfortable that I checked into buying one the last time we stayed there.  (It was very expensive, so we didn't end up buying it, but I wish we had.)  Every member of the staff is very friendly and gives you their complete attention.  We will ALWAYS choose this hotel when we come to Disneyland!

Loved our stay. Staff was very accommodating and friendly. Room very clean and well appointed. Bed very comfortable with crisp linens.  Location is directly across from the Honda Center. We booked the room and they are a little pricey but well worth it.

We stayed November 2012 for six nights, five days at Disneyland and DCA. This hotel was perfect, the price awesome. We canned it it Disney...why waste time on buses on vacation. Cab ride around $15 one way. You figure you get entrance drop off and with the awesome rate on this hotel you can afford cabs :) lowest rate for Disney hotel was $399 and we paid $119 here!  Free Breakfast perfect for kids

We stayed there from Dec 26th to 30th, 2013. The hotel is close to the highway but is quiet when you close the window. The room we got is on the fourth floor and has almost everything you need: king size bed, sofa, coffee machine, freezer, microwave, iron, hair dryer, table and chairs. The breakfast start from 6am weekdays and 7am for weekend. If you are planning going to Disneyland early this is a very good place to stay. The first day we arrived there were beers, wines and warm cookies in the lobby. Most staffs are nice and helpful. When we asked for parking in Disneyland, they even printed out the map for us. The only person we found was not so friendly is the male cook, he was actually had an attitude and rude. The female cook was very nice though. Overall is a very good

Love the Ayres hotel! My husband grew up in Anaheim, so we are often there for family events.  For Disneyland access, we often stay at the Grand Californian, but this is a great alternative at 1/3rd the price - and an even better deal if you consider the nice breakfast.  The area directly surrounding Disneyland can be pretty busy, and - while this hotel is best if you have a car - it has more of a "boutique feeling" than hotels closer than the park.  The staff is always extremely friendly and seem generally happy to help - a mark of good management, perhaps.   It is now our "go-to" choice in Anaheim.

stayed here with my family 2 adults and 4 children. great quiet hotel clean and safe. if your planning on using this hotel to go to Disneyland you will need your own vehicle or have to use the anahim shuttle that runs to Disneyland. the rooms were decent size and clean. the swimming pool and hot tub were nice. breakfast is definitely nicer than anything else you will find with warm items such and made to order pancakes eggs and bacon. I have stayed here in the past and will continue to do so

We stayed here over christmas for 4 nights, everything was fantastic. Great room, nice bathroom, complimentary breakfast and a free happy hour. Everyone was very helpful. Especially the hotel manager Marcus who went over and above to help us out. Would go back for sure.

Summary Heading: Stayed to see show across the street
Summary: I stayed here for a night to see the Rolling Stones shows in March (actually stayed 2 nights with a night at home). I have stayed here before when there is an event at the Anaheim Honda Center and have always been very pleased. We got there mid afternoon, used the pool, ate early dinner next door, then walked across the street for the show. Super convenient. Great hotel, great people - the staff even brought out extra beer at closing time of cocktail hour. Will definitely stay next time I get tickets to something at Honda Center!

My husband, my son, and I stayed here for one night so we could watch a Ducks game and the next day we went to SuperCross. This hotel met all of our needs plus some! We were greeted promptly by Fred when we came in. My son grabbed a cookie and off we went to explore our room. The rooms are comfy and decorated very classy. The beds are comfy and the pillows were fluffy. The breakfast in the morning was a serious plus! We are talking a full breakfast, something for everyone.   The Ducks Honda Stadium was less than a 5 min walk and Angel Stadium was about a 10 min safe walk. This was great because we saved money in parking and the hassle of the traffic in and out of the stadiums.   Check out time was noon. I really loved the late check out. Most hotels it seems is a 10 or 11 am

Summary Heading: Nice, friendly but far from Disneyland
Summary: About at 10 minute drive to Disneyland in order to make it early enough for Magic morning and get Fast Passes especially in Holiday times. Overall however the hotel is very nice, clean and staff are friendly.

Summary Heading: Perfect for hockey fans and Disneyland visitors
Summary: We were there only for watching the Ducks and enjoy California. The rooms where clean and very nice. The only thing it's badly soundproofed if you have noisy neighbours. The Breakfast was good. The people were very friendly! We enjoyed the stay very much and we will stay again there when we come back to Anaheim!

Would recommend this hotel to anyone. We were a family of 6 adults and 4 children and stayed for a week. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was exceptional and the rooms were large and comfortable. They also host a happy hour Monday-Thursday from 5:30-6:30, drinks and snacks provided. We also used the dining room in the evening for a meeting place for dinner and cards. There is a shuttle to Disney and other local places that runs every half hour and is always on time. There is a fee for the shuttle $5 a day or $20 for 5 days, we found this very convenient as we had no other transportation. We just can't say enough about how great the hotel is and how wonderful the staff treated us.

We just returned from a 3-night stay at the Ayres.  We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and were not disappointed.  The welcoming lobby with comfortable seating and a large fireplace sets the elegant yet welcoming tone of the hotel.  The rooms were well-appointed and immaculate.  There were 4 groups on our trip and we had requested that the rooms be in close proximity and the request was accommodated.  The breakfast is excellent!  There are 2 staff people on duty and one was constantly busy scrambling eggs, turning potatoes, grilling bacon/sausage and flipping pancakes.  There was a fresh fruit salad on the buffet, yogurt, various breads, pasties, juices, coffee and hot chocolate.  We rode the ART tram to Disneyland and the service was prompt and convenient.  It was

I found this hotel earlier this year because it was close to my son's apartment.  The staff is very friendly and it is a great location. I have visited Ayres twice this year and will definitely stay again.  The breakfast and happy are hour  awesome.

Summary Heading: Excellent value, nice amenities.  Would recommend.
Summary: Visited Anaheim during the Holidays and stayed here.  Its proximity to Disneyland made it a great place for families. Can even see the evening fireworks from some of the rooms. Rooms were clean and well appointed.  Breakfast dining room was large and got quite crowded in the mornings.  Hot breakfast was not gourmet but still quite good.  Staff in dining room were very pleasant and really worked hard to get everyone fed quickly.  Be sure to take a few dollars for their tip jar!

Stayed with my family with two kids for a week and had a great time there. The hotel offers everything a family needs including a nice breakfast and friendly staff. It is also conveniently located near Disneyland and well connect to all major freeways in Southern California.

Our family stayed here over xmas while visiting Disneyland. The rooms were comfy and the bathtub was large. The shuttle was easy to take to Disneyland. They served chips and guacamole in the evening which I enjoyed. Breakfast was very crowded on one of the days and had to stand in line for 15 minutes and the kids still didn't get any mickey pancakes. This is my reason for not giving 5 stars as well as no good coffee within walking distance. I would still recommend this hotel.

The staff are very friendly. Loved the daily happy hour, served with freshly baked cookies, wine and beer. It is within 10-min drive to Disneyland, and conveniently located near freeway. Room is spacious with microwave and fridge. Very suitable for a family with little ones.

Clean, comfortable rooms except for sofa bed. If you need extra bed, be certain to request the two-bed rooms. Breakfast was absolutely delicious, with kudoes to chef Benita. Loved the free parking, but agree that hotel is not within walking distance, so plan on shuttle or rental car. Staff was very courteous and friendly, and really made you feel welcome. We will be back.

Nothing negative to report. This hotel looks nice, it is clean, and the staff is very friendly and attentive. We stayed here for one night and spent two days at Disneyland/ California Adventure. They greeted us when we walked in and allowed us to check in very early in the morning. They also allowed us to leave our car in the lot after checking out the next day. They have a shuttle that leaves every 30 minutes and drops you off very close to the front gate at Disneyland. We had three adults and two children, so it was a few dollars more than self parking and walking to and from the tram, but the convenience was worth it. The included breakfast was freshly cooked and very tasty. The two ladies running the dining room were very efficient and the room was kept clean. The room had a

We came down to Anaheim to go to Disneyland and stayed at Ayres for 3 nights. This property is located about 10 minutes from Disneyland.  Definitely not walking distance. We drove to Disneyland both days for our visit.  Parking is $16 per day at Disneyland.  You can also take the shuttle which I think was $5 pp.   Found this hotel online and relied on the tripadvisor reviews.  We checked in early evening.  The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and holiday music was playing.  There were cookies on the counter which was very welcoming. Checked in the room which was nice and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Woke up early the next morning and had breakfast which we were pleasantly surprised about.  They had scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, danishes,

My boyfriend lived at the hotel for a month last winter, and was invited to return with a gift certificate.  He appreciated the warm welcome, and the staff all remembering him, 9 months later!  We stayed twice and had a lot of presents stored for us, and appreciated the relief of not having to drag extra luggage on our vacation.  The staff also accommodated us with the room type we requested (the king suite with the partition).  We will definitely be back!

Great and friendly service. Everything we needed. We will definitely stay again if we decide to visit anaheim Disney land again. It was helpful havig a bus ti disney land go right past tthe hotel. And having washing  machine and the jacuzzi.

We stayed at this property for one night.  The room was clean, spacious and comfortable.  There was a microwave and refrigerator in the room.  This property is a great value with free parking, Internet and a delicious breakfast.  The staff was top notch also.  I would definitely stay here again.

My family stayed here on the first weekend of December while visiting Disneyland. The property was clean and the staff were friendly. Our room was clean, bed was comfy and we had a quiet good night sleep. The free full breakfast is a big plus. Their free breakfast is way better than other hotels we stayed around the area. The hotel is conveniently located across the Honda center and the bus (ART) which goes to Disneyland stops in front of the hotel.

Summary Heading: Convient to Disney Land, nice rooms
Summary: We stayed here 6 nights and it was convenient to Disney land as there is an ART bus that stops out front and goes to one other hotel and then Disney land. You can buy ART tickets at the front desk. We had a car which is pretty necessary for eating dinner anywhere else as the Hotel serves breakfast but that's it. The breakfast was good, but routine, so if you like scrambled eggs, or premade pancakes/waffles, bacon, or sausage it's a good deal as it's included with the room. It's also across from the Honda center which makes it a little difficult to get into and out of when the traffic is all going to a show. However there are two entrances to parking lot, so just pass the hotel and enter at the light.  It's also within a bit of a walk to the Heavy rail/Amtrack station. So you can

We stayed for two nights; and like the majority of people where there for Disneyland. The hotel is no more than 7-8 minutes drive, and comes with free parking. The rooms are very large and comfortable. The included breakfast is fine the local restaurant delivers for free, which is good when you're exhausted after a long day at the theme parks. Would stay here again for sure. Great value for money.

Stayed two nights at the Katella Ayres and it lived up to its reputation of being number one!  The hotel was directly across from the Honda Center, a 10 minute maximum drive to Disneyland.  The outside is big and awesome, sits by itself.  The lobby was Christmasy and inviting.  Lobby employees very nice.  We got everything we asked for, a  room on top floor overlooking Disneyland fireworks.  A gorgeous sight!  The room was very large, immaculate, a super comfy bed, cathedral ceiling , beautiful soothing ceiling fan, and best of all, all the stations you could ask for on the flatscreen!  Furnishings were rich looking, there was a sofa, desk, fridge, microwave, spotless bathroom with vanity separate from shower/tub area , table & pretty padded chairs.  Does it sound like we loved

Summary Heading: The "only one vehicle per room allowed" Hotel
Summary: Only one car allowed per room. Stayed on 12/13/13.  Friday the 13th.  Should have known something would happen.  What kind of hotel only allows one car per room?   The hotel is across the street from honda center.  Which was nice.
Manager Response: Dear 777562,  I was disappointed to read that the lack of available car parking was an inconvenience to you and I do apologize that it diminished the satisfaction of your stay. Hotels are required to have enough parking spaces to provide one space per room and our parking lot is normal for the size of hotel. However our hotel is right next to a concert venue and a lot of our guests drive in to see the concert and stay the night putting more demand on the lot. We make every effort to allocate spaces made available by guests traveling without a car, but it would appear that those had been taken when you checked in as we give them up on a first come first served basis. The hotel is located in a wonderful location where space is at a premium. We would love to be able to be more flexible, and hope you understand our position.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Marvelous, large, quiet room. Helpful and attentive reception staff. Breakfast was great, freshly cooked items each morning. Some distance from Disneyland but no problem if you have a car. Great find!

This charming Ayres Hotel is one of two properties in Anaheim, the other being the Ayres Inn (soon to have an adjoining hotel now under construction) which is a few miles away on Chapman. Both are about equidistant to the Anaheim Convention Center and Disneyland. This hotel is across Katella from the Honda Center which has events almost every night. Expect noise and traffic which is made worse by ongoing construction nearby for the new Anaheim transportation center (and high speed rail terminal). Anytime during the day or night gunshots could be heard from the police firing range about a quarter mile away across the Santa Ana River. It took me a while to figure out where this noise was coming from. Otherwise this was an enjoyable place to stay with a generous complimentary

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel Anaheim !!! My Go To Hotel
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim while on a business trip after my employer recommended & booked it. It was just perfect!  Coming back to the hotel after a long day's work felt so nice due to the great service, immaculate rooms, and close by exquisite cuisine!  If travelling on holidays, I tend to stay in small boutique hotels to get a flavor of the place. Nevertheless, the Ayres is a perfect destination while on business (or a special trip, such as a honeymoon, or wedding anniversaries!)!!

We really enjoyed our visit to the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.  The location on Katella near Interstates 57 and 5 was very convenient.  The manager checked us in and was quite accommodating in upgrading us to a larger room since our room was not yet ready. The suite was large and very comfortable. Wine and cheese were provided at an evening reception in the lobby. This hotel was the best one of the five that we stayed at during our recent visit to southern California. I would highly recommend it to others.

Upon arriving I was pleasantly greeted by the staff at the ayres Anaheim. The decor in the lobby was warm and inviting. I travel over 220 days per year but when I stepped foot in my room, I felt like I was at home. The fire place in the lobby took me back to my child hood home where I could smell the home made apple pie, cinnamon bread and chocolate chip cookies. Speaking of cookies, the complimentary cookies were just like mom used to make. Whenever I stay in Anaheim, I will stay at my home away from home. Meaghan and Eboni were the nicest, kindest, most polite staff anyone could ask for.  I DEFINITELY will be staying here again!!!

This was my second trip to the Ayres Hotel.  Meagan has been wonderful.  She is always polite and helpful.  I love coming here except when there are events at the Honda Center.  The traffic sucks.  But the hotel is great.  Hopefully, the construction will be done by the next time I have to come here. P.S.  Thanks for the ice cream and cookies!!!

The rooms are clean, breakfast is nice with pancakes, fruit and typical scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage. They have a shuttle to Disney. Its about15min away.No in house reastaruant but have beer and wine during week. My disappointment was that the pool was not heated even though staff indicated it was when I called prior to booking. Its an outdoor pool but a must have for my family. Also it is right across from honda centre there were fights outside hotel room,police, and it was loud pretty much every other night. Ididn't get much sleep even though the bed was comfy. I would stay closer to Disney next time.
Manager Response: Dear Goodtravels_8,  Thank you for your review. I am so sorry that the pool heater shut off during your stay. Please be assured that this was an aberration and not the norm. You were very unfortunate as our pool's heating system stopped working due to the large amount of debris blown in by the high winds during this time. It was down for 1 to 2 days.   You were also very unfortunate to have been disturbed. The noise was related to a Christmas party and we should have handled it better. We have reviewed the parameters with our security company and we are confident that our response to unruly guests will be more satisfactory should it happen again allowing you a good night‚Äôs sleep.  I hope you will reconsider staying with us again, I think you will find a return visit a much different experience.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Very clean and comfortable rooms. Staff at the reception are more than helpful with requirement and any information about getting around Anaheim. A shuttle to Disney is easy to use. Would recommend to anyone.

I stayed in room 131 06 December 2013 and the room smelled of mildew. It was only for one night and I used a "Tree" incense at the door to get me through it. Had I stayed more than one night I would have requested a room change. The staff that I made contact with were wonderful. Being that I was on the first floor, I am positive I crossed middle management a few times, and they do not speak. Thank you for allowing me to share.

Stayed here with the family (5 of us) in a double bed room and we all loved it. I asked for a crib in the room and it was there when we got there. Everything about this hotel was nice and clean. Beds are very comfy and the room was nice and big. I booked it because it had such great reviews on tripadvisor and was glad I did. Location is only a few minutes drive to Disneland and you can see the Honda Center & Angels Baseball field from the hotel. Many places to eat nearby, but they are not within walking distance. They offer a complimentary buffet breakfast which includes eggs, bacon, pancakes, hash brown and your typical continental choices (kids loved the mickey mouse pancakes). If we are ever in need of staying in Anaheim we will definantly stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great service and cleanest hotel ever seen!
Summary: This hotel was awesome.  Cleanest hotel I have ever experienced and the staff was very helpful.   Breakfast was really great fresh cooked eggs, pancakes, waffles instead of the normal.  Great selection for breakfast with great staff.   We will stay here anytime we are in the area of Anaheim CA.  Keep it up Ayres I will now look to your hotels everywhere we stay!

We arrived to Ayres few days ago for three nights.  The staff at the reception was very kind and very helpful and we got the great impression since the very first moment. Our room was very nice and during our stay we enjoyed how quiet it was. Since we travelled from Europe to get the proper sleep is one of the most important things and thanks to Ayres we got the load of energy we needed.  Very nice touch was the happy hour when we could enjoy the wine and beers together with the other occupants. Just the very small minus is the breakfast,but is for free. It would be nice if you could put more variation for those they stay more than one night.  Othervise I strongly recommend this hotel!

Always enjoy staying here. The free hot breakfast alone is worth the distance (3 miles) from Disneyland. The "gym" leaves a little to be desired, but the staff is always helpful and friendly. The shuttle service isn't worth taking if you have kids, because it's over five dollars a person, and parking at the park is $16.  TIP: if you want to hit the park at night, without all of the parking hassles, you can park in Downtown Disney for up to 3 hours for free, and walk into the parks!

Slept at Ayres Hotel for one night to watch a concert at Honda Center. Super friendly staff, with quick check-in/out. Good complimentary breakfast, with eggs, pancakes and potatos freshly cooked. Spacious bedroom, with sofa, microwave and coffee maker. Big and clean bathroom. Very close to Honda Center, avoiding any rush, traffic or trouble on parking lot ($15.00) Would stay again for sure when visiting Honda Center or Disneyland.

Thes staff was helpful and friendly.  The location is great if attending an event at the Honda Center (across the street).  The room and the hotel was clean and comfortable. They have coin laundry facilities, vending machines, and a small number of sundry items and snacks.  Breakfast was included and was very good.  I will defenitely stay again next time I go to the Honda Center.

First time not staying within walking distance of Disney. Beyond worth it. This place is a hidden gem. We drove to Cali so we had a car to park at Disney. $16 for the day was cheaper than ART for 3 adults and 2 kids. Very comfortable beds. High floor, firm pillows, and crib requests I did online were all waiting when we arrived late at night. Breakfast was great and cooked fresh in front of you. Will be our new Disney spot for sure.

Fantastic family hotel! Rooms are large, the breakfast was delicious and the location is perfect! The beds are very comfortable, friendly staff and very helpful. The ART bus stops right out front to take you away to Disneyland. I would stay here or at any of their other properties again.

To accommodate our 3-day visit to the Disneyland Parks, we stayed at this small, lovely European-style boutique hotel, which we learned is referred to as "The Ayres Honda" b/c of it's proximity to to the Honda Center ( where hockey games, entertainment extravaganzas, etc. are booked).  As things turned out, it was a great choice because it allowed us to relax and refresh ourselves for our daily visits to the Parks.  The rooms were clean, really quiet, comfortable and furnished in the manner of a small European hotel.  The Front Desk staff were the type of people you hope would be available to assist at every hotel you've ever stayed at, but rarely find.  ( The result of good hotel management and an emphasis on courteous service to patrons.)  Daily warm plate complimentary

Summary Heading: I don't understand how this place got #1
Summary: Our friends and us have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel as part of our Disneyland vacation. None of us felt happy with the rooms or the hotel. The check in lady was barely nice or helpful, she didn't seem to care much. Then our friends' room had the wires sticking out of the ceiling fan and the ac in their room didn't work. Since there was no maintenance person available (!!) they moved to a different room. In ours the drains were slow, hot water took forever to come on, and worst of all the pillows are so bulky and uncomfortable that all of us had back and neck pain every day. There was no other choice for pillows. For the price, I also expected to get separate shampoo and conditioner bottles, shower cap etc. There was only the bare minimum of toiletries and of
Manager Response: Dear Lirrit166,  I was disappointed to hear that your stay was unsatisfactory. I have addressed the guest service staff that did not appear to care, spoken with the breakfast staff regarding the timing of the start, and passed on your feedback to maintenance. I am sorry that we were not aware of the degree of your dissatisfaction while you were with us as we would have welcomed the opportunity to do more to address the situation. While we do have a choice of feather or foam pillows, I am sorry that we did not make more of an effort to address that concern better. Newer pillows are more robust and it would appear that you may have had newer pillows. We certainly could have made more of an effort to provide you with a more comfortable option.  Please accept my unreserved apologies for your disappointing stay.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Super clean, very nicely decorated and great service!
Summary: Honestly this is the 1st time a hotel was nicer on the inside than their website pictures.  It is small but the decor is very nice lots of beautiful paintings and incredibly clean.  The front desk was friendly too.  We had their complimentary breakfast and it was good and much more food items then we expected. We took our kids to Disney and a shuttle picked us up from the hotel and we were at Disney in 10 minutes.  I would highly recommend this Hotel.

Summary Heading: can see why its ranked number one
Summary: We picked this hotel due to its reviews, we arrived to a very welcoming place, the staff always happy to help and seemed very happy in their work. Nothing was too much trouble. The  room was spacious and very clean and comfortable . The complimentary breakfast was fantastic , the warm cookies and free drinks in the lobby at happy hour were also a very nice touch. We really liked the art bus system $20 for a five day pass which picks you up at the door, cheaper than parking at the parks and very easy and convienient. We felt the only thing letting this place down was the fact of no option for evening meals, we did however find out later in the week that the restaurant next door will deliver to your room. We have just returned from this hotel following a very enjoyable 7 night

Hotel is located across the street from Honda Center, making it a perfect option for an overnight following the Buble concert.  Room was spacious and well-appointed.  Delicious cookie upon check-in.  Complimentary breakfast was delicious.  Overall experience far exceeded my expectations.  Would definitely recommend to others.

We have stayed at this hotel several times while attending events at Honda Center. Location is ideal! Easily walk across the street to the venue and no worries about crazy traffic and parking hassles. The staff at the hotel are great ... very friendly and accommodating. Immaculate rooms, fabulous complimentary breakfast, cozy atmosphere. Love this place and will be back!

We stayed at this hotel when we went to Disneyland. The breakfast was great. The room was quiet. The manager was very kind. Overall we were happy with the hotel. The hotel was small. But it worked for our family. You are not next to Disneyland but it didn't take long to arrive at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Best hotel I have stayed in
Summary: I have to say it's the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff and comfort was 2nd to none, the only flaw was no evening meals or no bar service. The location opposite the Honda centre was ideal and the shuttle bus was great for visiting Disneyland

Summary Heading: Best for and Event at the Honda Center
Summary: Walk to and from event, clean rooms, great staff.  Only minor draw back is the Eco friendly key card to operate the room.  AC/Heater didn't want to work at night. Set thermostat to about 68 showed 75 in room. at around 9am the AC cranked on and then was too cold.

Stayed the night here after attending a concert at the Honda Center across the street. The room was outstanding, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. I didn't eat there, but the complimentary breakfast looked way better than any I have had at other hotels. Being able to walk to the concert instead of dealing with the awful traffic and parking lot was wonderful.

I looked for hotels near the Honda Center and the Ares was right across the street. It was a wonderful experience from the time we checked in and time we left.  I consider it a 5 star hotel.  The rooms were clean and the continental breakfast was excellent.

Summary Heading: Trip Advisor Reviews and Ratings Spot On!
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for six nights and we had a wonderful experience! From the time we were checked in by Mai to the morning we checked out, everything was perfect. Jose in the breakfast room was a real pro and an engaging person; I enjoyed breakfast because of his smile and willingness to service us even when the room got pretty hectic.   Our king suite was wonderful, and housekeeping kept the room spotless. We purchased a five-day ART pass and used the shuttle to get us to and from Disneyland without a problem. The Ayres is the first stop going and coming from Disney; never a problem with crowds or delays.   One suggestion for the hotel would be to space out the tables in the dining room; pretty tight quarters when the room got crowded.  If and when we go

This our fourth stat here at the Ayres. What we like best is when we visit the Honda Center or Angel stadium. Your with in walking distance of both places.  We get great service from the hotel staff and our requests are always taken care of and a great breakfast in the morning is waiting.

I had never heard of the Ayers Hotels before this trip.  After reading reviews on tripadvisor, I checked them out.  They are located in Southern California & consistently ranked #1 in the reviews.  The rooms are beautifully furnished.  Plenty of space in the room, two sinks (both outside of bathroom area), desk, table, 3 chairs--all provided enough separate areas for our family to get ready in a shorter amount of time.  Free parking & internet are a plus. The front desk was very helpful in printing out our boarding passes.  Probably one of the best features--a full American breakfast every day.  Oh, my--delicious bacon, eggs, potatoes, fruit, pancakes, etc. made fresh by a great chef.  Great price, great value!

When we walked into the Ayres Hotel, we found it to be very unique. It was decorated to look historic and rich in history, and I really liked that. When we got to our room, I was even more impressed at the use of space. We had a setting room with a half wall separating the bedroom. The television was in the middle, making it a little hard to see either place.   We were only staying one night, and thought everything was great until we started to notice some housekeeping issues as the evening went on. The microwave wasn't working and we found some sort of homemade narcotic under it. The microwave is about thigh/pelvis level...just high enough for my toddler to look in. I am just happy I found that pill before we did.     Also, in the morning when we got up, we got out of bed to

Loved everything about this hotel! Needed to stay another night, employees could not keep us in the same room. Unknown to us, we finally talked to Marcus, the manager. He solved all of our problems and even matched our Expedia price. THANK YOU, MARCUS!!!

I stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim, CA on 11/20/2013.  It was my first time there.  Since my home is only 33 miles away I never thought that I would be staying there - then necessity intervened.  My car broke down (starter problems) at the nearby Jagerhaus restaurant just prior to an Anaheim Ducks game at the Honda Center.  While at the game I decided that my best course of action would be to spend the night in Anaheim and deal with the car problems the next morning.  When leaving the Honda Center I asked a police officer where the nearest hotel was and he pointed me to the Ayres Hotel which is just across the street.  Since I was on foot it seemed like a good choice.  It turned out even better than I expected.  Given the location of the Ayres Hotel and its beautiful

My wife and I travel a lot and this is one of our favorite hotels!!  The staff is professional, friendly and go the extra mile every time we stay there. The hotel has a great location, exceptionally clean and the rooms are well appointed. You wont be DisAppointed :)

Have always stayed at hotels at or near Disneyland, but this year we opted to try the #1 trip advisor choice and stayed at Ayres Anaheim. Glad we did!  The front staff is very efficient and helpful.  Hotel and room were CLEAN! Fridge and microwave in room. The beds were probably the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept on.  It was one of the best hotels I have stayed at while visiting Disneyland.    Flight, shuttle and Disneyland particulars...  Arrived LAX at 0855 and caught shuttle about a five minute walk from our Southwest gate. Used Disneyland Resort Express (DRE) -dont need reservations or prepay- found under the green sign outside of baggage claim at 0930.    It was actually a bus with Disney characters and very nice, kids cheered when it pulled up.  There are lots of

Summary Heading: Five star hotel at three star price! Lots of extra touches!
Summary: As soon as you walk in you know you made the right choice! The front desk staff are so friendly, cheerful and eager to please. Very efficient too. Room was just what and where we wanted. Spotlessly clean and comfortable bed. Everything worked just fine. Handy to have a fridge in room. Reception on weeknights with complimentary wine and beer(Juice for kids) and chips and fresh salsa. There are warm cookies late every afternoon. Delicious! These extra touches are so nice and make you feel welcome. Now the breakfast! Wow! Chef Jose makes the BEST pancakes ever. There is also cereal, fruit, hot eggs and breakfast meat and hash browns. We would rather eat here than any breakfast restaurant. We have stayed here a few times and always return because it really is the best in Anaheim for

Summary Heading: New, clean, nice staff, and close to Disneyland
Summary: We normally stay at a chain hotel near the park. This time I read reviews of different hotels, and we chose the Ayres. The staff is friendly. The building, rooms, and furnishings are all still new, clean and very nice. Our bed was very soft and there was a fridge and a microwave in the room. Parking was free. Breakfast is served every morning. It is a cross between the Hampton Inn and Embassy Suites. Fresh cooked eggs, bacon or sausage (changes each day), and pancakes. They also have a good fresh fruit salad, cereal and bread products. We did not get any noise that was overly loud. We also enjoyed the baked cookies each evening. For a boutique hotel, the Ayres does everything it can to make your stay enjoyable. We received a "just before you arrive" email confirming our stay. We

Summary Heading: Going to Disneyland - you gotta stay here
Summary: This is Hotel is a wonderful place to stay.  We drove in, we came off the I-5 freeway and found a wonderful surprise, the area is really up and coming with many nice urban living style structures.  Ayres Hotel is by the Angels Stadium and directly across the street from Honda Arena where the Ducks play - the area was clean and felt safe.  Now you cannot walk to Disneyland from Ayres but that doesn't even really matter since they are on route 15 with the Anaheim Resort Transit shuttle system, this made it easy to get to Disneyland and back.  When we drove up to Ayres we were immediately impressed with the structure of the Hotel.  It has an old world charm that is very new, as many of the Hotels around Disneyland are old and dated this was not the case with Ayres.  When we walked

Finally, a hotel around Disneyland that I am not disappointed with!  We have stayed at many many different hotels and I have been disappointed by all of them.  The room are either too small or unclean,uncomfortable beds, unfriendly staff etc.  But not at the Ayres, the staff were ALL friendly.  The rooms were spacious,clean and quiet, we didn't hear a thing and we were on the 1st floor!  The hot breakfast was excellent every morning and there was plenty of food to choose from unlike other places we've stayed.  Yes, it is not within walking distance to Dland but we have found that the hotels that are are not worth the walk after a long day walking in the parks.  It's just as easy to catch the tram to the parking garage or use the ART system.  I can not say enough good things

Summary Heading: Sorry, but poor water flow ruins a stay
Summary: This is a deal breaker for us. I don't care how nice the service is or how clean the room is, if there is not enough water pressure in the shower to rinse off or wash your hair, what am I paying for? The pressure coming out of the tub spout was very strong, but they have misguidedly installed showerheads that severely restrict the flow of water out of the shower to a trickle. It's a miserable experience. My poor wife has to get down on her hands and knees and stick her head under the tub spout to rinse her hair off. Ridiculous. I'd challenge the GM, Marcus Collins, to actually spend the night in a room and try it out for himself.  There are over 100 hotels in the Anaheim area around Disneyland. Pick one where you can feel clean after a long day. Not this one.
Manager Response: Dear betheball,   I am so sorry that your stay was severely affected by the water flow in your shower. Please be assured that we do not install shower heads that intentionally reduce the water flow. On occasion the build up of calcium inside the shower head can restrict water flow.
