The typical remedy is to simply replace the shower head. This does not take more than a couple of minutes and is our first response if this issue is brought to our attention.  I hope you will reconsider using our hotel. If you let us know in advance we will be sure to double check the functionality of everything in your room prior to arrival.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This is a wonderful hotel, big enough to offer the conveniences you need and expect, small enough to make you feel like a guest and not a number. The entire staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are large, very clean, well appointed and comfortable. If you are going to Disneyland the shuttle stops right at the front door and you'll be at the park in 10 minutes.   The only downsides (and they are minor) are the breakfast, which is rather mediocre, and the hotel's location--not many dining options are within walking distance, and being right across the street from Honda Arena could pose some noise and traffic issues on game or concert nights. Again, these are very minor knocks on a great hotel. If we return to Disneyland, we will return to the Ayres!

Beautiful property, a comfortable and quiet room that was like a small suite. Close enough to Disneyland without being in the swarm of Harbor Blvd. Liked that there were no additional charges for basics like breakfast, parking and WiFi.The breakfast was pretty good, but the coffee was so weak. Ayres needs to splurge for better coffee. The few small bumps we encountered were instantly remedied by an alert front desk staff, especially Mia. We will be staying at Ayres Hotels on our next trips to California.

I stayed here with my daughter for one night on November 16th, based on all the great reviews on here. It's a decent hotel, but nothing spectacular.  The location is two or so miles to Disneyland and it's on the wrong side of the road, so everywhere you want to go requires a u- turn.  We got tickets to the ART shuttle at the front desk, but then after waiting nearly 40 minutes I went back to the desk to ask why it hadn't arrived. The girl at the desk called and found out the shuttle was only running once per hour that day. So what seemed like a convenience turned into a huge inconvenience. I got a refund for the ART tickets and we took the car to the Toy Story lot, hopped on the Disney shuttle and were at the park. That entire event only took 15 minutes. The ART shuttle sounds

We chose Ayres because of tripadvisor reviews. Very happy with our choice! It was the perfect place for me, my wife and our daughter (8 years old).We stayed there for 4 nights. The spot is perfect if you have a rental car (5 minutes drive from Disneyland, 40 minutes drive from LA international airport). The Honda center home of NHL hockey team mighty ducks  is in front of the hotel. We had a real breakfast done by a cook with very good food quality included. Free high speed internet and parking free.The room was clean and lot of space. The decoration a bit olddish but when I look at the bill, decoration doesn't matter.  All of this for 130.00 US per night all tax included! I don't recommand this spot if you want to go to Universal Studio or Hollywood Blvd because it's 1 hour and

Our family of 4 stayed for 3 nights while celebrating my birthday and visiting Disneyland.  This is not the first time at Ayres, however our first time in the suites. This is a lovely Hotel with beautiful furnishings. The beds are so comfortable too. The staff is eager to assist with your needs and The Hotel Management makes you feel important.  The breakfast is my husbands favorite part of the trip and there is something for everyone.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to plan a trip back again soon. Thank you

We chose the Ayres because of it's proximity to the Honda Center (we could walk over to the games easily) and were pleased with our stay.  Staff was friendly and helpful, our room was clean and quiet, and the breakfast was convenient.  Better than some free breakfasts we've had, typical fare was served hot each morning.  The room was pretty spacious and had everything we needed, fridge etc. Our only complaint was the in room coffee, it's pretty awful, but when is in room coffee good?  We would stay again.

Summary Heading: The place to stay when in Anaheim!!!
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland. Can't say enough about this place. The atmosphere is like a European boutique hotel. Lots of paintings and antique looking furniture adorn the hotel. Service is excellent from the front desk to the cleaning staff. Rooms are large and well appointed with a little kitchenette. Nice pool area, not overly large but nice. Loved the free breakfast and free parking. You're right across the street from the Honda Centre and just down the street from Angels Stadium. You are only a 10 minute drive to Disneyland or you can take the all day shuttle offered from the hotel for $5 per person. Great place to stay, would definitely stay here again.

I stayed here for a week & it was great.  From the moment I walked into the lobby, I was impressed.  The front desk people were professional, helpful & very friendly.  Even the maintenance worker, who powerwashed the front entrance and added sand to the pavers, was very friendly,  I walked into my room and was surprised how nice the room was, VERY clean and the decor was so inviting & relaxing.  The rooms are energy efficient, and power in your room is monitored by your room key card.  The bed was AMAZING, I want this bed for my room, and the pillows were the best!  I stayed on the 2nd floor & even though the hotel is on Katella (a busy street) & very close to the 57 Freeway AND there was construction outside AND a hockey game at the Honda Center (across the street), I did not

I really can't say enough good things about this hotel.  I stayed three nights recently on a business trip. This is the hotel that my company prefers we use in the Anaheim area and now I see why.  The rooms are large and comfortable, and the entire property is beautifully decorated in a European boutique hotel style.  The hotel is very conveniently located near restaurants, highways, and Disneyland.  The breakfast buffet is the best I've had for a complimentary breakfast -- it included a chef making eggs, sausage, bacon, hash browns, pancakes, etc., as well as the usual things you would expect -- cereal, muffins, rolls, toast, yogurt, etc.  I was so full after breakfast most days that I was able to skip lunch. The front desk staff clearly cares about customer service, as they

My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived they upgraded for free to a suite...so sweet and unexpected :)  We really enjoyed the room.   Very friendly service, the breakfast was really good as well.  Great Hotel!!!!  Atmosphere is very victorian and just a good feel right when you walk in :)

I stayed here for a very short stay in November and will be staying here again in December for 2 week.  This hotel is so Beautiful and Quaint.   It really has that cozy feeling that other Big hotels lack...   From the cozy lobby with oversized comfy furniture and fresh baked cookies in the evening to the fact that they are energy efficient and power in your room is monitored by your room key card.   they have all bases covered.   The rooms were very clean, the Gorgeous large wood post bed was like a DREAM to sleep on!   I would chose this hotel again and again in the future.    My ONLY suggestion, bring your own shampoo...the one there wasn't effective.    You wont be let down by this hotel.

We stayed one night at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim & everything was perfect.  I'm a little hard to please when it comes to hotels but The Ayres went above & beyond my expectations.  It was a great value, clean & very, very comfortable.  The staff - professional, helpful & friendly.  The rooms were clean & looked very inviting & nice.  We stayed on the 2nd floor & even though the hotel is on Katella & very close to the 57 Freeway AND there was construction outside & a hockey game at the Honda Center, we did not have ANY noise issues.  The beds are very, very comfortable - best night's sleep I've had at a hotel in a very long time.  I personally really liked the ceiling fan in the room.   The morning breakfast was excellent - did I mention it was "complimentary" too??  Not a nasty

We had the pleasure of staying at Ayres for two weeks between August and September this year. We chose Ayres based on the great reviews and we have to agree, it's a marvelous hotel! Every staff member at this hotel was a delight! We stayed in room 405 which was spacious and although we were close to the freeway we had no issues with noise. We kicked our jam packed days off with complimentary breakfast which was restaurant quality with a great assortment of hot foods as well as healthy options. Do not miss out on the pancakes!! The best we've had by far! We were able to park on site for free (not all local hotels offer this!) For our days at Disney we chose the ART which stopped right at the door. The shower and bed were a wonderful welcome home after a busy day. We have stayed

Summary Heading: Still A Great Place To Relax After A Day In The Parks
Summary: Second stay at this Ayres property and it still delivers with comfortable, quiet and clean rooms providing an overall value that is jaw dropping.  The staff, as before, is warm and friendly. (Andrew always has a great smile). If you have a question, just ask, they have the information you need to make your stay the best it can be.  While a short distance away from the fun at Disneyland, the ART system stops right at the front door and will get you there in just a few minutes. It's an easy trip and saves on driving and parking hassles.  The bottom line is that if you don't mind the short drive to the parks, you can't go wrong with the Ayres Anaheim as their rooms and service rival ANY of the big names in town, including the Disney properties. I have stayed there too, but I sleep

Great property in Orange county, California. Everything about this property is a cut-above normal hotel fare. The staff is helpful and genuinely friendly, the art work and appointments are beautiful, the rooms are well-appointed and spacious. The complimentary breakfast is restaurant quality, not the typical bagels and coffee affair. it is close to Disney and other attractions. This is my new home away from home in Anaheim.

We went here on our first trip to Disneyland last year (OK, we'd been to Disney World 30+ times). It was a good option for grownups not wanting to spend too much for a hotel. Clean, quiet, even relaxing. No free shuttle to the park, although we had read there was (not in hotel information, however). But there was free parking. It is too far to walk, and we routinely walk a couple miles to dinner at home in Scottsdale. But this is not a walkable setting. We just drove and paid to park. Just required more planning.  We did return a few months later with the extended family, including grandkids, stayed in a park right across from Disney and easily walked in and out throughout our stay. But Ayres was classier. I'm not sure the walking would have been worth it if there weren't 8 of

We stayed here as we were going to a concert. Wonderful choice. Easy transfer service to Disneyland. Right accross street. Clean nice rooms an breakfast is included!!  Right off freeway. Shopping nearby.

It's not far from Disneyland and it's worth the short drive. The hotel is clean everyone there is  very nice and helpful. This is our second time we stayed there and will be the only place in Anaheim that we will stay when we come. Thank you for taking good care of us.

Our family had a great time. We are 6 now all adult size so we rented a 1 bedroom suite for my wife and I as well as a double Queen room. Both rooms were excellent; the beds were comfortable the rooms clean and the desk service outstanding. We were given rooms directly across from each other so it was almost like having connecting rooms. The stay was a surprise for my wife the hotel was aware of this and even allowed my kids into our suite before we arrived so they could "decorate".  Nicely done Ayers!

This was our first time at The Ayres Hotel, even though we have been visiting the area from the UK since 1995. We have always before been within walking distance of Disneyland, however for us The Ayres was a much better option! There is the ART which stops outside the hotel if you wish to take it, or it is an easy 10 minute drive by car.We attended a concert at the Honda Center, which is right across the road and we were close to the freeway entrance for longer journeys. The staff were amongst the best we encountered during our 5 week trip and our room was comfortable,spacious,clean and service by housekeeping excellent! Breakfasts were delicious!! We also had no problem finding a parking space during our October stay, something we found a problem when staying closer to Disney.

Summary Heading: Our home in Anaheim for our annual visit to this area.
Summary: We are always VERY happy with our annual stay at the Ayres. We would never consider staying elsewhere. It is everthing we could ask for. Book early, they are often full. The Ayers family is to be commended for a job well done.

I wish I could move into the Ayres. 1. Breakfast to DIE for (free) 2. 2 miles from Downtown Disney (on shuttle route, 10 mins) 3. A super POOL 4. Friendly staff 5. MASSIVE room 6. Clean and spacious I cannot say enough good things about the Ayres hotel, we have stayed twice and plan a third visit in July, it ticks all my boxes. A convenience store is a few hundred yards away to get water and juice etc etc and the shuttle for Disney departs at regular intervals from the front of the hotel.  Right across from the Honda Centre  and nearby the Angels stadium. LOVE IT

We felt lucky to find this hotel. Super convenient location to visit Disneyland! Great when traveling with kids! Room had a microwave, fridge and free breakfast! Room was spacious, very clean and the staff was very friendly! There is a restaurant right next door, we walked, big screens with games on, and kid friendly (kids menu). I will definitely visit Ayres Anaheim again and recommend it to others!

I stayed recently with my nephew for a visit to Disneyland and while the hotel is very clean and rooms nicely appointed, I did have a few disappointing experiences with guest services.  Upon check-in (very late, past midnight) my nephew and I arrived at the front desk.  We were staying in a suite with a King bed and a full bed pull-out.  We spoke to the front desk agent and were given no information regarding linens or information on the room except how to turn on electricity.  Upon entering the room I could not locate the linens for the pullout bed so naturally I called down to the front desk.  The agent told me that he had some at the desk and that it would be best if I came down to get them because otherwise he would have to lock up and it would take a long time.  (Poor

Summary Heading: No bad just not sure its #1
Summary: Can't really complain about anything except the beds seem to be more full size than queen. Location was nice and short drive to DL was easy. Morning breakfast had choices and was great for the price(free). The decor was a little fo-fo but thats what it looks like on the site.

First time stay at the Ayres .... We come to Disneyland 5 to 6 times per year, decided to stay here as it had been recommended by others.   Nice room..friendly staff....great for kids ... Easy to get to Disneyland.... I would stay again and would recommend to others

This was our 1st time staying at the Ayres Anaheim. While we normally stay at the Disneyland Hotel, we decided to try the  Ayres based on their Tripadvisor ratings. We were very glad we did! We checked in on Oct 22nd and stayed 1 night. The friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms made the hotel stay enjoyable.  During check-in the front desk clerk provided us fresh baked cookies. We were assigned rooms adjoining rooms 425 & 427. The rooms were spacious and extremely clean.  Beds were soooo comfortable, we all slept very well.  Breakfast the following morning was excellent. Fresh scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, bacon and made to order pancakes were available.  I saw the chef making Mickey Mouse pancakes for the younger children which delighted them.  There were also

Summary Heading: Stellar service at an incredible price
Summary: We booked the Ayres hotel for our first family vacation to disneyland. I was a little nervous about bring so far from the park and needing to rely on a shuttle, but the reviews were outstanding, so we took a chance and I'm SO glad we did. The shuttles were extremely prompt, and very clean. The rooms were huge and well decorated. The pool was clean and the kids loved it. And being welcomed after a long day at the park with the happy hour reception sealed the deal. We will definitely be staying here for our next Disney vacation!

The Ayres Hotel certainly lives up to it's number one ranking. We recently traveled to Anaheim to visit Disneyland and stayed at the Ayres for the first time. Although we had a few little issues when we first arrived the General Manager, Marcus Collins, stepped in and made our trip brilliant again. The breakfast is excellent, the amenities comfortable and the proximity to everything is top notch. Only issue was the front desk girl Megan who was dismissive and rude and wouldn't contact the GM when asked. But as mentioned was fixed by 8:00am Monday when he arrived. Great management.

We were here mainly for Disneyland, hence did not really have too much time at the hotel to explore it. I had booked our stay at Ayres online based on Tripadvisor feedback and am glad that it was a good choice.  The room we stayed in (standard) was pretty large and had all the usual amenities.  The one thing I would have liked to see in addition was bottled water. The bed was king size and very comfortable.  Breakfast spread was good including a hot breakfast area where the cook would prepare stuff fresh.   Good place to stay for Disneyland if you don't mind the short 5 minute drive. There are quite a few hotels from which you could walk to the parks but I doubt there are too many that would offer the combination of moderate price and a comfortable stay like Ayres.

My family stayed here for only one night but we are impressed by the service and the cleanliness of the room. The hotel does have that European boutique style to it.  The rooms have an almost elegant decor but are very spacious.  My two kids had room to run around and play after a day at Disneyland.  When we checked in it was about 9pm and the front desk had a ground floor room ready for us as I had requested. The bathroom tub was perfect for parents who want to bathe their kids after a long day at the mouse house.  The beds were exquisite.  They were so comfortable I felt like I slept for two straight days.  To top it off checkout was at noon so we weren't rushed and the breakfast was excellent!  The chef cooked pancakes to order and had a full spread of bacon and scrambled

We stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for 6 nights, we really enjoyed our stay.. Room was really clean, beds comfortable, a mini fridge and a microwave which was very helpful especially when traveling with kids ! The breakfast was discent. Hotel is close to Disneyland and 10 minute drive from Kearny messa street where there are plenty of restaurants. Hotel staff very nice.

Took a side trip to Disneyland from San Diego (our primary destination) and stayed overnight here in order to return to Disney the following day.  Very nice room, elegantly furnished and very friendly staff.  Surprisingly quiet for being on a main thoroughfare.  Full breakfast in the morning is included and really hit the spot and got you going for the day.  Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Great attentive staff, comfortable beds, surprisingly quiet, Disney annual passholder discount, excellent hot breakfast (Mickey pancakes for kids!), definititely gaudy decor, but I was here to sleep, not admire the wallpaper.  Neighborhood between Disneyland and Ayres is SKETCHY, but as soon as you cross under the 57 it is a different world.  I would definitely stay here again.  It is directly across from the Honda Center for those looking for a stay during an event. I was there with my 2 daughters alone and felt very safe and secure.  The families I observed/spoke with during breakfast were like minded, which made me feel even more confident about my choice of this hotel.

Summary Heading: Great option for Disneyland or Honda Center
Summary: Was going to a concert at the Honda Center so I figured why not stay here to be nice and close and save on parking?  It's right across the street and yet, being so close to a freeway and major event center, the hotel was very quiet.  The decor is a bit excessive, just shy of being gaudy.  It really takes the European theme and runs with it.  Check in was easy and they were very helpful and fast. Room was very, very spacious with an extremely comfortable bed. The room could stand to be updated a bit as some of the furniture was a bit worn, sheets not as soft as they once were, and so on. But none of this detracted from the overall stay, which was great. As a Disneyland annual passholder our package included 2 tickets for the Anaheim Rapid Transport (ART) which was a nice shuttle

I always stay here when traveling to Anaheim. Awesome rooms, friendly workers, and great breakfast. Also the beds and pillows are the most comfortable ever, and the room is immaculate! I have recommended this hotels to friends that absolutely love it, and use it also all the time!

Summary Heading: The only place we'll stay for Disneyland trips from now on!
Summary: The room was huge, decorated beautifully, great furniture. The tub is huge, which is great for a nice soak after a long day at Disneyland. The beds were so comfortable. The bedding was so soft and comfy it was hard to get up in the morning.  The staff were very courteous and helpful. The cook in the breakfast room is great! Always a smile and a great attitude. The breakfast is the best we've ever had at a hotel. Made to order pancakes, plus sausage, eggs, hashbrowns. Doughnuts, muffins, a couple cereals, several kinds of juice, milk, decent coffee.  It's a couple miles from Disneyland, which scared us of at first. However, the ART picks up RIGHT in front of the hotel. It takes a 10 minute drive to get there. Not bad at all.  This will be our new go-to hotel for trips to southern

Summary Heading: Gracious and hospitable staff, clean, classy, upscale rooms.
Summary: We just finished a 5 day trip to Disneyland and stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim.  I feel as if it is a secret gem.  Our room was pristine.  The hotel is quiet and intimate.  The staff are kind, professional and dedicated to the guests.  Jose the cook made my son Mickey Mouse pancakes.  The breakfast is generous and plentiful.  I hope this hotel continues to be this wonderful.  The rates should really be in the $300 range, however they are better than competitive, which is unbelievable.  This is our favorite hotel anywhere.  I can't wait to go back...

What a nice hotel! Clean, comfortable and classy, The staff were friendly (it's amazing how a little smile can go a LONG way! :)  )Very good, fresh cooked breakfast in the morning. Jose made my daughters Mickey pancakes! Fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, juices, eggs: scrambled or hard boiled, sausage, bacon, potatoes...A great day to start off a day in Disneyland!  The hotel is located away from the busyness of Disneyland, but the ART shuttle was convenient and quick (only 2 stops, 15 minutes. every 1/2 hour). The shuttle drivers were wonderful, friendly and helpful. The pool is clean and felt great; as did the jacuzzi. The rooms were CLEAN and very comfortable. Ours had a small fridge and microwave.  I would highly recommend this hotel!

I have nothing but great things to say of this Hotel stayed there each year to see not only My Favourite NHL  Team but look around the Beautiful Area that is Orange County aka Jewel of Southern California. I am honor to have staye there and hope to stay in the future...To me Ayres is a place where one can call it home away from Home be it 6 days to a week. It's the best place to go take in a Ducks Hockey,Angels Baseball or enjoy the night life...or some sightseeing and shopping. Just glad to stay and Hope to see the place next year....

Summary Heading: Nice hotel only minutes away from Disneyland
Summary: Travelling with a family of 4 adults and 1 child. We booked two rooms. Very classic look and feel hotel. Lots and lots of wooden features, which makes it feel cosy. Extremely friendly service who were happy to answer all our questions. Parking was included in the booking but you must get a permit from the front desk, which was great as we had a hire car. Breakfast was also included in the booking, which was great! Excellent variety of cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt and many other breakfast selections. Rooms are very spacious and clean. The air conditioning in our room was a bit noisy, so we switched it off when going to bed. The mini bar fridge was also a little noisy, so i just turned down the thermostat to stop it from starting up during the night. We arrived a early and our

Summary Heading: Nice place, just don't try to get work done...
Summary: Was excited to see a nice hotel, clean and spacious.  But then I tried to work on the "wifi" network.  It's as though they have one low-speed wireless router at the front desk, so come 5:30, there's no bandwidth left to use.  Couldn't work for 2 hours on a business trip.  Called the front desk to ask for an Ethernet cable since there's an outlet at the desk and was informed that if there's not already a wire in the room, they didn't have one for me to use.  Seriously??? Also, no conditioner for the hair, just a "conditioning shampoo" fake.  No workout room either. If I just needed to sleep at a good location, this is the spot.

Although we had a relatively short stay at the Ayres hotel in Anaheim, this is the hotel that my wife and I choose to stay each time we are in the area. The entire hotel and the rooms have a unique and comfortable ambiance, and the staff is always very personal and friendly. It is clear to see that the management of the hotel has a great set of standards as it can be seen by the entire staff.   If you are looking for comfort, cleanliness and a great centralized location The Ayres hotels are a great option to consider.

Clean, friendly hotel but not close to Disneyland, but shuttle arrives every half hour and returns on the quarter hour.  The hotel is at the end of an off ramp but thanks to double glazing no traffic noise.  Restaurant right next door and ten minutes walk up the road there are quite a few restaurants, so plenty of choice.  Staff friendly and helpful especially Andrew.  Rooms were large and comfortable.

I really liked this hotel, just felt something was missing. The location was perfect for Disney (only 2 miles up the road) and there's plenty of restaurants along the road, but not so good for exploring some of the sights of LA. Didn't fully appreciate the size of LA, and the volume of traffic. The constant congestion on the Freeways made travelling across the city timely, and probably best to stay off them completely. Hollywood/Beverly Hills/Santa Monica etc is a good 60-90 minute drive (yet only 30-40 miles). The Hotel was very clean and rooms a very good size and well equipped, including a small kitchen area with Microwave and Fridge. The bed was very comfortable and pillows plentiful. The bathroom, considering the size of the room could have been bigger, but did have a bath,

I would have rated this place a Five star if it weren't for the fact that I had to sleep on the floor due the the overly-soft beds. I guess I am in the minority but I like my beds firm. I also had a recent back injury so maybe that's why the soft beds were hard on my back but we LOVED this place: comp breakfast, comp happy hour (M-Thur only), free parking, FAST wi-fi....all great! OK, so you have to DRIVE to D-Land, but just think, you save on breakfast AND parking at most local hotels. I also don't know what Mrs_Alva (review below) was complaining about saying the breakfast guy wasn't friendly...gimme a break....breakfast is COMPLIMENTARY and don't rate a hotel due to the fact that they don't have Splenda...seriously??? Our "chef" was Mr. Jose Llamas and he was fabulous. I

I stayed here for business and had a great stay.  The beds were wonderful.  I usually have a hard time sleeping the first night in a hotel, but I slept well here every night.  The complimentary breakfast was good also.  I'll definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Average hotel, comfortable beds, clean and quiet...
Summary: They should offer their own shuttle to Disneyland, being only 2 miles away it would be a huge selling point to offer this service to paying guests. The guy making the food was not very friendly.  The food was standard quality, nothing special, and the dining area was extremely crowded, hardly anywhere to sit, and the chairs in there are much too large for that small space. On our 2nd day someone finally opened up the room next door so we had more space, but the first day it was like a maze trying to get up from our seats just to get food. They had no Splenda for our coffee, only Equal which we don't like so the coffee could have been better. Overall, it was clean and comfortable and just fine for our 3 day trip to Disney :) Next time I will choose something closer to Disneyland

We booked ¬†two rooms at this hotel for my family to base our Disneyland and LA sightseeing from. Though this hotel is not within walking distance to the Disney parks it's well serviced by the art shuttle which runs regularly every half hour. For value for money this hotel is above par. Free parking, complimentary cooked breakfasts (with plenty of choices that change daily) and an evening managers reception offering free wine and beer and a great opportunity to meet fellow guests. Also extremely delicious home cooked cookies that were impossible to resist. Housekeeping did an excellent job with rooms maintained to a very high standard. However, perhaps the most notable feature of this hotel for us was the quietness that ensured sleep quality. Having stayed at a number of Disney

This is a fabulous hotel.  Very clean.  All of the staff were super friendly and very helpful.  The chef was very friendly and made an excellant breakfast.  Lots of choices.  Not just a continental breakfast.  He makes Mickey shaped pancakes for the kids!!  We rode the Anaheim Resort Transit to Disneyland.  Only $5.00 for adults for the whole day!!  It takes about 10 minutes to get to Disneyland and the shuttle drops you off about one block from the entrance.  It was really convenient and you don't have to worry about parking.  I cannot praise this hotel enough.  I would definately stay there again!!!

Our stay at the Ayres Hotel was great.  The room was clean and comfortable. My fianc√©e used the gym and enjoyed it thoroughly.  The shuttle to and from Disneyland, the free WiFi and the complimentary breakfast made the stay extra comfortable. Highly recommend!

Great place to stay if your going to the baseball game.  Clean and great staff.  Loved the breakfast and the chef really nice guy.  The social hour not really they need to step it up.  Other than that we had a great time and will be returning next year!!!

This was our second stay this year.  Great accomodations and helpfull friendly staff.  The room was clean with a comfortable bed.  The included breakfast had a large number of choices.  No issues with access and parking despite the Honda Center across the street and ongoing street and building construction in the area.  We used the ART system, which stops at the front door, this trip.  It worked out great.

Even though this hotel is further from DL it is worth the drive. We loved the hot breakfast and the cook made pancakes in the shape of Mickey for my children. The beds were very comfortable and we did not want to get out of it he next morning.

I took my wife and daughter to Disneyland for the first time. I want everything to be perfect. The ayres hotel was the perfect place to stay. Everything was exactly as I read it on trip advisor . The food in the morning was above average and got us off to a good start. Service excellent. I only wish my daughter could have got the Mickey Mouse pancakes like on the reviews. O well, maybe next time. Thank you

Nice sized room with a comfortable bed.  Not too far from the highway.  Everything looked clean in our room.   Breakfast was included and free parking. We enjoyed our room on the 1st floor. Yes, we would stay at the Ayres Hotel again.

We have stayed here a number of times.  The accommodations are excellent and the staff very courteous and helpful.  We would recommend highly and would stay here again any time we are in the area.  It was close to the conference and other appointments we were going to and close to good restaurants and Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel for wedding block reservation
Summary: My new husband and I recently booked the Ayres hotel for our wedding weekend. We were able to quickly and efficiently set up a room block at a discounted rate for our wedding guests about 3 months before our wedding. Marie was extremely helpful in helping make all the arrangement. Our guests said many great things about their hotel stay. The staff was very friendly and they even surprised us with champagne and chocolates on our wedding night. The full hot breakfast every morning was wonderful, and It allowed us to spend additional time the morning after our wedding with our guests. I highly recommend Ayres Hotel Anaheim if you are getting married in OC and are looking to reserve a block of rooms for your guests!!

We have stayed at this hotel before (for one night only) and this time we stayed for two nights and we were so happy with the acommodations; first those beds are just a dream and the hotel is small enought that it's not noisy even with families with young children staying there as well; the only time that you see the kids it's at breakfast time which it's a hot and cold mixture along with great coffee; hot cocoa and an assortment of juices. The restaurant across the street was great and we had two nice meals there along with the beer tasting; we were in Anaheim for a concert at the Grove of Anaheim and it's just about a mile from the hotel and we also went to Disney California Adventure and used the convenience of the pass to be pick up by the bus at the front entrance of the

I stayed here for a night in order to watch an Angels baseball game in Anaheim (I was staying in San Diego at the time). Angel Stadium is conveniently located about 8 mins walk from the hotel which made the decision to stay here an easy one. I was pleasantly surprised at how good the hotel was. The room was nice and clean, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was in top condition. The staff were hugely helpful and friendly, especially giving me the best directions to get to the stadium. There was a good cooked complimentary breakfast with eggs, hash browns, sausages and pancakes. Continental options were also available. Make sure you wait for the fresh cookies baked every day. They are usually available around 4-5pm at the front desk, nice touch! I would definitely

Great and friendly atmosphere as soon as you walk in the door. Fantastic all round service from day one. We stayed for 10 days. And were glad we decided to stay here. Meaghan & Andrew at the front desk as with all staff were exceptionally friendly, helpful, and had some great local tips. Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean & serviced daily by the wonderful cleaning team before we returned from our daily excursions.  If your coming to Anaheim and you don't need to be next door to disneyland this is the place to be. Here's your need to know's from our experience. * Great & affordable * Straight off the highway - You might think noisey. Not at all * Large, clean, tidy rooms, very comfortable bed * Free wifi - computer desk downstairs if you need it * Walk over the road to

Stayed here for my niece's wedding.  It was a great location to get to all the wedding venues.  The morning breakfast was a great place to meet up with family to catch on the night festiities.  At least 10 family members stayed at The Ayres and we were all impressed

Summary Heading: Wonderful!  Would definitely stay here again
Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights in Anaheim, and overall it was a wonderful experience!  We had a room with a very comfortable king-size bed on the 3rd floor.  The room was large, with nice finishes and was clean and well-kept.  The staff was friendly and helpful, and check in and check out was a breeze.  There is a shuttle that stops by the hotel every 30 mins. to bring guests to the Disney resort area, as well as other locations.  We used the shuttle system (called ART), and found it easy to navigate and use.  It cost $5 per person for an all-day ticket to ride.  Tickets can be purchased at the front desk.   Breakfast was delicious, and had a large variety of choices from made-to-order pancakes, eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, bagels, yogurt, cereals, muffins, donuts, etc.    The

Small hotel with a big hotel atmosphere. Employees kind and uplifting. Deluxe accommodations and across the street from Honda Center. Seminars are perfect here. For only 5 dollars a special tram type personalized bus will take you to special places ie Disneyland and back. Every hour. Quiet with free hot breakfast every morning and a free happy hour most nights. Clean pool and jacuzzi. Love! Only one wish....... more restaurants within walking distance.

What a wonderful Hotel, all the good reviews you read on Tripadvisor are very true. This Hotel is one of the best Hotels that we have stayed in. From the moment you walk in you are treated so well and made to feel welcome. Andrew and Meghan at the front desk were extremely helpful with all our questions and helping us book airport shuttles. The Manager of the Hotel was amazing, he helped us out when we needed to get some snacks for our trip to Disneyland. The Hotel also sells snacks, drinks and even frozen dinners for $5, what great value .  The rooms are clean and the bed extremely comfortable. There is no safe in the Rooms but you can use the safe in Reception. We pre-booked Karmel Shuttles from the cruise terminal to the Hotel. The Art Shuttle stops outside the Hotel and you

Summary Heading: Best hotel ever stayed at in states
Summary: This hotel is great.  By far the best hotel I've stayed at in the states.  But bus passes for Disneyland at the front desk for a small fee, amazing breaksfast with fresh eggs, pancakes, it's a regular buffet.  We came about 5 hours early for checkin and just wanted to check if we could park the car there for the morning and they went out their way to check us in 5 hours early without being asked.  Were extremely helpful for our whole period.  Best hotel I've ever stayed in the states a hundred fold.  Would recommend to anyone.

My family and I just spent two nights at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.   Room: spacious, clean, and well laid-out with very comfortable beds. The hotel is right next to the freeway, but traffic noise was minimal. Breakfast: the works, with eggs, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, toast, pastries, hot and cold cereal, fresh fruit, and more. A wonderful perk included in the room price. Staff: friendly and efficient Price: a truly outstanding value!  We loved the convenience of the ART shuttle to Disneyland, as well. Only $5 per person for an all-day pass, with buses departing the hotel every 30 minutes.  The Ayres will be my family's go-to hotel the next time we visit Anaheim!

Wonderful property.  Only complaint was the numerous special events (Honda Center concerts, Angels stadium) around the hotel that was daunting dealing with the traffic when heading out for dinner, etc.  Wonderful staff, excellent breakfast, and really liked the convenience of the shuttle van to the parks.  Would most likely stay here next visit.

Summary Heading: Large, clean and well appointed rooms
Summary: This hotel is in a very convenient location near Disneyland, Angel Stadium, The Honda Center and centrally located to all of the LA Metro area.  The price is great for what you get.  The rooms are quite large and have new, well appointed furnishings.  Everything in the hotel looked to be recently built or remodeled.  I didn't try the breakfast, but it was hot and did include eggs and not just donuts and cereal like many places.  The staff was all friendly and helpful.   On the negative side, the shower water pressure was a little weak, but probably restricted by state mandated water conservation.  When a concert is across the street at the Honda center, traffic can be extremely difficult for entering or leaving the hotel parking lot.  I recommend this and will definitely stay

Summary Heading: Would stay again, was able to eat next store & go to walk to Honda center
Summary: Excellent location and convenient for the ones that wants to attend events at the Honda Center. Resturant next store you can walk to eat, drink, and walk across the street for you event. Then stay at the hotel so theres no drinking and driving.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a hotel 5 min from disneyland without the $$$
Summary: We stayed at Ayres for four nights on arrival from Australia, hotel staff are  super friendly, beautiful decor and the beds were the best I've ever slept in! Quite despite being located off the freeway. $ 150 a night included an amazing cook to order breakfast. Has own laundry and a little shop that you can buy very reasonably priced snacks and even small bottles of wine. Location you are 6 min from disneyland by car ( the hotel has a shuttle) you are 1 min from angel stadium ( we grabbed some baseball tickets for a true USA experience- awesome) Honda centre (across the road) has ice hockey and lakers games depending on the season. As you are straight off the highway it was 45 to LA and 55 to san deiago ( legoland) not much about this hotel I wouldn't recommend however on

Summary Heading: Great for events at Honda Center
Summary: The proximity to Honda Center is one of the reasons we keep returning to the Ayers Anaheim.    This is Mrs. Law writing this review; my daughter, her friend and I drove from out-of-state to attend a concert the other night.  We only needed to walk across the street from the Ayers to get to Honda Center, so there was no parking, driving, or long walks in the dark to worry about.  Safety and no worries!  As always, the staff at the Ayers was great, the room was lovely, and the breakfast was delicious.  We'll be back for a hockey game, I'm sure.

Great hotel stay. Convenient location and easy to find, clean and spacious rooms. Free parking and breakfast. Breakfast was very busy in the mornings but still good. There is a shuttle for the amusment parks which is well priced. Overall a great stay!

This was our second stay at Ayres Hotel, and we look forward to many more, from the minute you arrive you know you've found that 'special place'. The staff are excellent from the General Manager down you get the feeling they all enjoy their jobs and that translates into the best customer service ever. The rooms are very spacious and well cared for, cleanliness is top notch throughout the hotel, the beds are so comfortable. There is a full breakfast included, which is plentiful and delicious, the wine hour is excellent for relaxing and having a chat with other guests if you so desire. There is the local Disney shuttle for a modest fee, which is both convenient and frequent. All in all our favourite place to stay. Well done Marcus and the team.

right by the freeway, the ballpark, the hockey arena and disney.  It is close to the freeway but it is easy to deal with.  The rooms are lovely and the breakfast was great.  We had a small problem but a call to the desk and we had the issue solved within an hour.  Value is great if you want a place that has boutique feel while close to activities in anaheim

We chose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews, two couples travelling together. It was easy to find and in the perfect location, since we were attending the Angels game, which is about a 10 minute walk, mostly across the parking lot. If you are going to an event at the Honda Center it is just across the street.The staff at the front desk were very friendly , check in was a breeze. Our rooms had 2 queen beds, a small kitchenette area, desk, flat screen tv and a super air conditioning unit. The bathroom was large with the sink and vanity separate from the rest. The bed was super comfortable and everything was very clean. The hotel has a nice pool and hot tub, and laundry room.     The breakfast was included, it was one of the best I have ever seen , pancakes cooked to

The reason I titled this "Treated like a Queen", is because I was.  From the moment we arrived the front desk staff was friendly, informative, and helpful.  We were not only checked in quickly, but they were able to help me out with a need that I had.  I had broken my ankle prior to this trip and I was going to be attending a conference at the Honda Center across the street from the hotel.  They gave me a wheelchair to use while I was at the conference and at the hotel.  It streamlined getting me into my designated seating at the conferrence, the restaurants nearby, and to have a delicious breakfast downstairs at the hotel.  The breakfast is freshly made for you on the spot.  The selection is varied and will meet the needs of everyone's requests. The room's decor was beautiful,

It is hard to believe these accommodations can be as great as they are, with the price as low as it is. The room was beautiful, the bed was by far one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've stayed in, and the breakfast was outstanding, including a cook preparing pancakes! Would definitely stay here again.

This is one of the best hotel experiences I've had.  I travel with/for business several times a year and this experience was just wonderful. (Probably second only to my Hawaii trip!) The staff was awesome from check in to check out and everywhere in between (including the hot breakfast that was provided...the chef was great and very responsive to my diet).  The bed was oh-so comfortable.  The room was very clean as was the rest of the hotel.  This was my first stay there, and I even got upgraded at the last minute to a suite so I could be close to a disabled friend also there for a Woman of Faith convention.  Next time my daughter visits and we make a trip to Disneyland, we will almost definitely stay here!!  Wi-fi was free in my room and the lobby was very comfortable to relax

This, in my opinion is the place, THE hotel to be in Orange County.  It's like a home away from home.  Staff is friendly and wonderful.  Good price for the value.  Full breakfast included.  Good for meetings, pool and jacuzzi.....and at 5:30 there are fresh baked cookies at the front desk!  This is the only place I stay when I'm in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Great room and value but that is all
Summary: The room is very nice and comfortable.  The room is clean but shower pressure is weak.   The workout area is very small.  There was one treadmill that was broken, one bike, two weight machines and six free weights.  There was no restaurant though they did serve a small buffet breakfast

We stayed here one night before we stayed at the Disneyland hotel. It is a great property. We had a one bedroom suite and it was huge. The bedroom was a decent size with its own closet and tv. The living room, kitchen combo was as big as my old apartment. The fold out couch was sufficient for our four year old. Everything was super clean. They offered breakfast in the morning. A real,  full breakfast and a cocktail hour. It is about a mile or two from Disneyland, right down the street from As stadium and just off the freeway. The two complaints I had were, one the water pressure in the shower was nonexistent and two they seemed to act inconvenienced when we asked for a room at 1:30 pm. Yes, checking was at three but you have rooms clean and we had an infant with us. So, we

This was our first time staying here, and it was great from the time we arrived until the time we checked out!  The staff was so friendly and helpful!   This Hotel was very clean, which is a definite must for us!  Our bed was so comfortable and our room was nice and spacious. My husband and son enjoyed swimming in the pool.  We would definitely look forward to staying here again!  Thank You Ayers Hotel for a wonderful and relaxed visit! :)

I stayed at this hotel with family in order to go to Disney's California Adventure Park. The hotel is close to the park although not walking distance, and a shuttle stops there to take you to the parks (currently $5 for adults and $2 for kids). The rooms were comfortable and nicely furnished. We were hoping to be in adjoining rooms - when we arrived, one fo the rooms was being deep cleaned so the hotel put us across the hall from each other. My son called and asked if they could find adjoining rooms (since my grandkids were wearing out the hallway carpet between our rooms!). Soon after they found us adjoining rooms, and also delivered a basket of goodies to make up for our trouble. Excellent customer service! Also, the breakfast was exceptionally good. The pool is smallish, but

Summary Heading: Our family will, from now on, always stay here.
Summary: Where do I begin. First they have low prices, great reviews, and a shuttle to Disneyland. My husband and I went alone, without our kids, to celebrate our Anniversary. The thing I look for the most in a hotel is cleanliness. The staff does a wonderful job keeping everything look clean and updated. The room was beautiful and romantic. The bed was supper soft and I lefted up the sheets to make sure the mattress was new/clean, it was. The shuttle takes 15mins to get to Disneyland. The ticket for the shuttle was $5 per adult per day. We took it several times each day. The free breakfast the next day was impressive. They had pancakes, eggs, potatoes, bagels, coffee, juices, and so much more but I can't list it all. Overall great hotel and we will definitely stay there again next month

This hotel has nice large rooms that are nicely decorated and super CLEAN! The staff is very friendly and helpful. And the hotel's location made getting around extremely convenient. It is only a few minutes from Disneyland and very close to the major highways so traveling outside of Anaheim was very convenient. Also, they hotel provides a very nice hot breakfast that includes eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns and pancakes made to order. In addition to juice, cereals, donuts etc. And it's FREE when staying at the hotel. A real money saver. My only criticism is they do not serve other meals, so no room service. But there are plenty of restaurants near by, some in walking distance. Also, my wife felt the water pressure in the shower is a little low. This may be due to the fact

This hotel chain is very luxurious.  You really got your money's worth.  Decor is original.  Rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.  We had a suite so it had ample sitting room.  Conveniently located right by the Anaheim Angels stadium.  Employees are very helpful and courteous.  We will definitely be back.

We have always stayed at ayers when we attend the Angels games.  Wish there were hotels like this one around the country.  We always feel welcome, it's clean, friendly, walking distance to the game and right off the freeway good location for many areas.

You cannot ask for fiendlier staff members from the desk clerk to the breakfast cook.  The woman who checked me in was wearing a smile  when I stepped up to the counter.  The cook made this fifty eight year old grandpa his Mickey Mouse pancakes just like he did for me last year.  Rooms are very nice, clean and comfortable.  My daughter, son in law and grandson came with me.  The staff placed or rooms side by side.  Work out area is adequit, especially if your alone the two times I used it.  What more could use ask for with this hotel, "A Great Price" and that they do.

It is just as good as everyone else says on tripadvisor.  Had no issues.  I would recommend this hotel to any family that plans on going to Disneyland.  The ART Shuttle was always on time during the 7 round trips we took to Disneyland.

Excellent place to stay, good price, good complimentary breakfast and good size room.  You won't be disappointed.  Good bus system called ART in place to easily get around to the attractions $5/day.  And far enough away from them to have nice peace & quiet when you get back from sightseeing.  Pool was not too deep but fine for us...had the whole pool to ourselves in the morning when everyone gone to Disneyland.  There's even a fitness room if you like to workout which was nice.  Overall we would definitely stay there again...service was impeccable, they really work hard to please everyone and deserve commendation.  Oh, and they do have a shuttle service to the airport for $40 just ask at front desk.

Great place to stay...staff (Jose was wonderful in the kitchen), facility and location.  We wanted a hotel close to parks but away from crowds.  The pool is small but had the pool to ourselves.  Free parking, nice breakfast (only suggestion...offer more fresh fruit options) and reception in evening...can't ask for anything more.  Would stay again.

We found this place through other tripadvisor reviews and weren't disappointed. The hotel is very clean, has friendly service and the rooms are large and comfortable. Coming from a long overseas flight, we really appreciated the early check-in at noon. The ART shuttle to Disneyland was running smoothly every half hour. Going there was our main purpose for this visit and in hindsight I probably would try to stay in one of the motels just across the road from the Disney resort parks since when our toddler got tired and needed a rest, we just didn't make the effort to go back on the bus for the fireworks at night. However this has nothing to do with the quality of our stay at the Ayres Hotel and considering the price and service offered, it was excellent value.

What a beautiful hotel in Anaheim. The hotel was nicely decorated with fine curtains, imported carpets, mahogany furniture and real plants. Mai at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful. The room was quite large for a guest room with a kitchenette.  Free breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Complimentary high speed internet kept my kids happy. The hotel is a short drive to Disneyland and easily accessible to the highway. It is also close to the local  AAA office where you can buy discounted tickets with free parking for Disneyland.  I would definitely look for Ayres Hotel when we visit California again.

Bed with a great pillowtop and weighty, quality sheets was one of the most comfortable we've found in our travels.  Studio suite was quiet, comfortable, spacious, and finely furnished with separate area that included a bar with sink, micro and refrigerator.  Breakfast was high quality and staffed to provide hot items.  Area was cleanly maintained.  Helpful staff. We look forward to staying again.

Stayed for 5 nights very helpful, friendly, couldn't be more accommodating, will be back for sure.  Breakfast is wonderful, rooms great self contained, clean, laundry facilities.  Even though further from Disneyland the ART bus was accessible for transport. Love the happy hour for guests and the decor.

This hotel is very nice, clean, fancy lobby, and the rooms are very nice. The pool is "ok", just fenced in next to the parking lot...and there is a breakfast buffet that has made to order items as well as the basics. Free wi-fi and free parking were also a plus. I'd stay here again, no problem!

Staying here for 3 nights with my teenage daughter. Staff are all very friendly and go out of their way for you. Great position for Disneyland and good shopping at factory outlets, easy access to freeways would recommend it to any travelers and would defiantly stay here again

Our family stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim last week and loved it.  Great location, good breakfasts, friendly staff, and lots of extras.  They had wine and beer during the week, great cookies in the evening, a shuttle service, newspapers, a gym, free wi-fi and free parking, and a pool area.

I spent a few days in Anaheim going to Medieval Times and Disneyland.  We were warmly welcomed by the front desk at the Ayres Hotel.  We booked the premium suite and the room was great.  The ac wasn't working on one side of the room and Linda, Meaghan and the general manager Dianna at the front desk were so nice and fast to get it fixed immediately.  They even helped us a bit with the rate( which was already at a great price) for the ac being out temporarily.  The beds were so comfortable and I will definitely be back to stay the next time I go to Disneyland.  Thanks Linda and everyone for being so friendly and professional!

This was our first time staying at this Ayres location, but we have stayed at other locations. We were not disappointed! We booked this hotel for Labor Day weekend, which is also the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend. I traveled with my family and took advantage of the ART shuttle to run in the half marathon. The price was perfect with our annual passholder discount, and It was the cleanest hotel we have been to in a long time. The free breakfast was delicious, and there was plenty of parking available. We will definitely be back!!

The three of us stayed here for two nights while visiting Disneyland. We drove up from San Diego and the hotel was really easy to find, just off the freeway (but without any noise you might expect). The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, very comfortable and smart. We appreciated the small kitchen facilities (fridge and sink). The shuttle bus for Disney picks up from the hotel which meant we didn't need to bother driving (and paying the expensive parking charges). It was great to be able to come back during the day and make use of the pool and have a break from the bustle of Disney. We loved the little free drink reception early evening with wine, beer, cookies, chips and dips. It was a nice opportunity to get talking to other hotel guests.  I

We were warmly greeted when we entered the Ayres Anaheim. Our room was quite, clean, and spacious compared to the room at the hotel next to Disneyland we had stayed at a few years ago. The price was good, and the complimentary hot breakfast served with a smile was a great start to our days... taking the ART (bus) was a convenient mode of transportation (it stops at the hotel every half hour), and the bus drivers were equally helpful, promoting various venues around town... the only draw back, is the bed sagged toward the center a bit with two people.. bummer.. other than that is was a great hotel... Disneyland's fireworks were visible from our 4th floor room.

I spent the Labor Day holiday with my family at Disneyland.  It was a short notice trip and after checking other hotels I called the Ayres and got a two queen room at a wonderful rate.  I can see why this hotel gets a #1 rating.  The building itself is well maintained and the interior is clean and attractive.  Our room was beautiful and the "minikitchen" came in extremely handy.  The pool and hot tub came in very handy after a hot day of walking through Disney.  The full breakfast was a winner to me!! It included fresh cooked eggs, breakfast meats, potatoes and pancakes or french toast along with the usual continental breakfast items.  What really set this hotel apart was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff.  From explaining the ART schedule to giving us driving

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel at a good value
Summary: We stayed here for just one night following a wedding event. The room had a great sitting area, pretty decor and the bed was super comfortable. We wish we had more time just to enjoy relaxing at the hotel. The hotel was clean and has a boutique feel. The free breakfast was ample with plenty of choices. We would definitely stay here again!

We stayed here for 6 nights while visiting Southern California. We loved the central location for Universal, Sea World and Disney. We had a room on the 4th floor and could see the Disney fireworks at night.   The rooms were great. They were very clean, spacious and having the kitchenette was a bonus. The staff was friendly, and the free breakfast was really good.   The pool was only ok, so we didn't feel compelled to use it. It's basically in the middle of the parking lot.   My only complaints are 1) the water pressure was awful. My hair was greasy the entire trip because the water pressure wasn't enough to get the soap out of my hair. 2) The fact you have to leave a key in this holder thing to keep the A/C going while you're out of the room is annoying. Also the A/C is not on a

Loved the location of this hotel. Just across the street to the outlet mall, down the street from The Crystal Cathedral and a short shuttle ride to Disneyland. Quiet and clean rooms, complimentary breakfast and good service.

Summary Heading: Fab Hotel Excellent Value Perfect For Disney
Summary: If you are visiting Disney this is a great hotel to choose for all of the reasons stated in previous reviews like - friendly staff, great location, first class service, free parking, quality rooms, free breakfast, free beer midweek (cans of BUD), Rose wine, cookies for kids, nice pool and hot tub, good local dining, cheap bus service to Disney, shop, and easy access to LA and surrounding areas. Book it before its too late. I would come back again thank you Ayres and quality staff.

We spent two nights at the hotel while running the Disneyland 10K and half marathon.  The hotel was clean, the beds were fantastic, and the pool was nice.  Both days we found the pool to have just a few people so you could always find a chair.   The staff at check in was extremely friendly and accommodating (we had asked for adjoining rooms).  An added bonus is there is a fridge and microwave in each room in addition to a table with two chairs plus a coach.  We didn't realize there would be so much room.   The breakfast was more than we expected - lots of choices and the meat and pancake/french toast varied each day. I would definitely recommend staying here for the value and quality

really nice hotel. .  friendly staff. . super comfy beds. . the lobby and halls was on the warm side but we was able to put the air onto the cold side once we was in our room. . the price is on the pricey side even with aaa discount but it was worth the price compared to a different hotel that i stayed at closer to disney a week later

We stayed here for our honeymoon. It's close to Disneyland and saved money taking their shuttle. But, more than that, we loved the accommodations for the price. It's decorated in a European boutique flair and our room was terrific. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the morning breakfast was better than most competitor's. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. Now we want to plan a vacation and stay at another Ayres Hotel.

This hotel far exceeded my expectations, especially considering the location and what we paid.  Everything was super clean and the staff was wonderful and friendly.  The ART shuttle to Disneyland was easy.  I wish we'd arranged to stay more nights there.

Very warm welcome, staff were very helpful. The rooms were spacious, clean and well maintained. 40 minute walk from Disneyland but the ART buses stop outside the hotel. I'd suggest getting tickets from the hotel rather than paying on the bus. The pub across the road did nice meals. Close to the train station if using public transport to get to Universal studio's and Hollywood Boulevard. Booked it based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed.

I try to stay at this hotel any time we have an event in Anaheim, as it has a great location, is not a zoo type mega property, offer free parking, wifi and breakfast. Rooms are quiet and nicely furnished, staff very helpful and friendly as well.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, ideal location, value for money
Summary: Stayed for 13 nights in August.  Free parking, free breakfast , free Internet. No traffic noise from the interstate, we stayed on the 1st Floor. Would recommend the ART shuttle so much easier than parking at Disney, we did both. Hotel has washing machine and tumble dryer at a low cost of $2. Will stay here again next time we are in Anaheim.  In room safes would be a great addition to the facilities.

Too far for Disneyland for my liking, but that's ok!! The breakfast is a plus, full service and included!  Staff was very friendly and helpful in printing tickets to knots! Would stay again! Beautiful property!

The hotel is fairly close to Disney, affordable and you don't have to pay for the extras like parking and internet.  The service was very good and handled high volume with courtesy and efficiency.  I was truly amazed at both chefs during breakfast serving to so many.  Hot breakfast was great!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your positive comments. I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay. I did note the three star rating which would suggest that you were in some way disappointed and I am interested to know how we might have served you better. If you would be so kind as to let me know the reason for your disappointment so that I can address the cause and prevent any future recurrence, I would certainly appreciate it.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We booked this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor, and we weren't disappointed!  This is a beautiful hotel, with large, comfortable, charming rooms.  The decor has a European flair to it, and we were very impressed with the hotel, and with the service.  Unfortunately, we were only staying for one night, but would definitely book this hotel again when in the Anaheim area.  The breakfast was great and the manager's reception in the evening was a very nice touch.

The hotel is a bit old but is clean. Check in and out were fast. Bed was comfortable. Free breakfast with real hot food, free parking, free Wi-Fi, and the location were the reasons why we booked Ayres Hotel. Nice comfy bed. The water pressure was strong for showering. Would come back if I ever needed to go to Anaheim, CA. ART stopped at the front of the hotel, which was very convenient. I would recomend taking the ART instead of driving to Disneyland since the ART will drop you off at the main entrance at Disneyland instead of 1 mile of walking from the parking lot. $5/day for adult and $2/day for children, unlimited ride to disney and other places. The hotel can sell your ART passes. The AC worked well, I was freezing. However, you must insert your room key to the slot in order

Quite surprised really, our second hotel on the trip without a roomsafe so nowhere secure to leave DSLR's iPads  etc  even our Yosemite log cabin came with a roomsafe - there are safety deposit boxes at the front desk but they are only ieg enough for money/passports etc.  Other than that, we chose this hotel on the basis of the trip advisor ratings from others and as a result  we had high expectations, and it fully matched them.  Excellent hotel at a very good price, great location close to Disneyland, and well served by local public transportation (which we didn't use).   Very comfortable and spacious rooms, nice pool area, not busy so always sunbeds available etc.  Some noise from the freeway but not enough to be intrusive/disturbing sleep etc  Would I return - definitely,

So when I pulled up to this hotel my heart sank - on a sliver of land between the freeway and the drive to the stadium. 'Oh this is going to be iffy' I thought. Boy was I wrong - what a GREAT hotel. Great. SUPER helpful staff, smooth check in, and a remarkably comfortable, quiet and beautifully appointed room. I HIGHLY recommend this property, and look forward to when I'm back here or at one of the sister hotels.

I loved this hotel. The furniture and design of the room was pretty, it was big and clean, and the breakfast was really good. I only thought the water pressure was too weak in the shower. Also, the beds and pillows were really comfortable. Try to pick a top floor room though because we could hear the people above us walking around.

We were on a family trip to move my daughter from the East coast to the West coast for college.  Before even checking in, the hotel allowed us to send boxes for my daughters move that they stored for us until we checked in.  This was extremely helpful!!  Upon check in the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and knowledgable.  The hotel was very clean!  The free parking, Internet and daily news papers was also very convenient, but the nicest part was the amazing daily breakfast, and afternoon wine, beer, nacho chips and cookies all complimentary!!  This hotel made a difficult time for a mother moving her baby so far from home so much easier!  Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

My husband and I wanted to stay at a hotel near enough to take advantage of visiting Disneyland without being so close that we couldn't escape the Disney vortex. The Ayres Hotel Anaheim fit that bill perfectly!  The hotel was incredibly comfortable. The room we stayed in was at the far end of the hall--very quiet and private. The room itself was very spacious! The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was adequate. The breakfast in the morning was great--hot items likes waffles or pancakes as well as scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, sausage or bacon, and an assortment of continental breakfast goods--all free! The evening happy hours was nice too--free beer, wine, chips/salsa/guacamole, and cookies. The hotel also features free parking and free wifi. Let's be honest... anytime

Stayed here 3 nights in August. The reception staff were all very friendly and helpful on check in and out, the rooms were comfortable clean and roomy and the fridge and microwave very useful. Breakfast was included as was the afternoon happy hour which was a very good addition with free wine, beer, soft drink and nachos. The hotel is away from the main Disneyland strip but the ART bus was very convenient for my husband and myself at $5 a day or $12 for a 3 day pass which gives unlimited travel. The only draw back is there are no food outlets handy but would definitely stay here again if in Anaheim.

Great stay...spacious, affordable, comfortable room.  The chef was pleasant and served us a delicious breakfast every morning with a smile. The shuttle is prompt and an efficient way to visit Disneyland.  Definitely would stay here again!

another great 3 night stay at this is now our favorite hotel in anaheim. We like the value so much my Hiton Honors card has gone from silver to blue.. This is consitantly a great property to stay at.. we stay here when we go to disneyland. They provide pass holders special rates.. We find the free parking, internet, and cooked to order breakfast (Jose is the best by the way) a tremendous value. Mini fridge and microwave included.. Yes it take's us 10 min to get to disneyland but that's time on the streets it's not the miles- not far away at all, and  by doing so you save money per night as they are not in the "resort district"  extra fee area..rooms are large and well appointed,  love all the English Inn type decor and pictures.. Thsi hotel is doing it right and I will always be

Nice, clean hotel with very comfortable bed and pillows!  Nicely updated rooms.  Close to Disneyland (10 mins.), and right off the freeway to easily get somewhere else.  Free parking, wifi and made to order breakfast, afternoon happy hour and warm cookies all included in the rate.

Stayed here Aug 8-10 2013 while visiting Disneyland. This hotel is about 15 mins drive away from Disneyland but if you are a small grp 2-3 use the shuttle bus where you can buy the tickets at the front desk. If you are a party of over 4 its better to drive to Disneyland for it will be cheaper paying for parking.  The hotel is clean and it reminded of a hotel in London with the old world paintings all over the hallways and rooms. The accommodations are updated with an old world charm! The front desk staff were friendly as well as the breakfast cooks. The breakfast was surprising good with scrambled eggs, made to order pancakes, potatoes as well as the usual  cereals, bagels etc. This hotel is perfect if you are going to the Honda convention center which is across the street or

We are a family of four, and recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel for a Disney weekend. Rooms were cleaned. We had a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker. Customer service was great. Morning breakfast buffet was awesome, definitely not your average continental breakfast. Shuttle services available every 1/2 hr (fee per person-round trip). Shuttle fee was still less then parking fee. Overall I thought the hotel was fairly priced, and our experience was a great one.

The room was a good size and very clean. The hotel is in a convenient location right off the highway. We opted to take the shuttle to Disney which was convenient. We also drove to Huntington Beach which was fairly easy to get to with the mapquest directions printed off by the front desk. I highly recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: Quaint Hotel with Big Chain Ammenities
Summary: I've stayed at 3 local Ayres hotels and they all have exceeded my expectations.  The Ahaeim hotel is always clean, cozy and friendly.  Close enough to Disneyland to feel like you are out of the craziness but just a few miles away.  The ART transportation system picks you up and drops you off at Disney.  They also have a great pool, exercise facility, free yummy breakfast and free WiFi.  This is my hotel chain of choice!

The room was great and comortable. We really enjoyed the hot breakfast. They have a chef that provides made to order pancakes and delicious hot eggs, potatoes and bacon or sausage.We had to purchase tickets to get to disneyland on the transit system ,but they sold them at front desk and the bus came right to the entrance of the hotel. They have an excelllent fitness room. The pool area was lean and provides extra towels.

Very warm welcome by front desk employee. Yummy cookies were a courtesy in the lobby, late afternoon. Complimentary breakfast was GREAT: many options that included pancakes, french toats, scrambled eggs, among others. I would definetly stay there again.

Has pros and cons. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The lobby is pretty but was very seldom used during our stay. The price-included breakfast is very good. We had problems with our shower working, although staff did try to make it right with us. The pool is tiny.

My wife and I have stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim fives times in the last two years and we have three more stays booked between October 2013 (Homecoming) and May 2014 (Graduation!). Needless to say, we LOVE this hotel! The staff is great and the rooms are very clean. Last, but not least, the chef-prepared, hot breakfast is wonderful.

It was 48 years of not seeing and thinking off and on about my dear friend Roberta over the years (from 7th grade-12 years old) that compelled me to finally research where she might be in this big wide world. I found her in Culver, Oregon. Hearing that she had had a hard life, I decided to host her, her daughter and her daughters two kids (18 and 16) bringing them to Los Angeles and showing all a vacation that they would never forget. My friends daughter and kids had not ever even been on an airplane before. I own a salon in Sherman Oaks, California and a very kind client gifted me 8 tickets to Disneyland and another client offered me a "Friends and Family" major discount at a Marriott Hotel for my guests to stay as they were going to attend Disneyland for 2 days. I wanted them

We stayed here because of the location.  It was only a 10 minute walk to Angel stadium which was awesome.  We also stayed here 2 years ago when we went to DisneyLand.  The hot breakfast is good.  I was hoping for bisquits and gravy but wasn't served the day I was there.  I'm not sure if it changes each day as we were only there one night this time.  Beds are comfortable and room is spacious.  The reception during the week from 5:30 - 6:30 which includes snacks, beer and wine is very nice.  Excellent service when we called and checked in.

We recently stayed here for 5 nights enjoying Disneyland and LA. We booked from recommendations on here and we were not disappointed. The hotel is quaint and spotlessly clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. All amenities we required were available including a laundry. Breakfast was included and more than satisfactory. We were able to catch a shuttle right at the door for Disneyland. Would give it a perfect score but for the slightly forgetful housekeeping, forgetting to replace towels, tea etc in room, but always rectified easily.

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel..Couldn't find one fault.. Exceptional!!
Summary: Stayed 7 nights.. The hotel staff are very friendly.  Rooms were immaculate and sooo spacious. If I ever have the opportunity to go back to Ca. there would be no hesitation as to where I would stay.. The beds are unbelievably comfortable..

Summary Heading: Fantastic for Families going to Disney
Summary: The service, the rooms and the breakfast were amazing. The combination of these three would make me come back again when going to Disneyland.  Unlike many rooms in the city that are tired and worn, this hotel is updated and the furniture looks like new. There are four poster beds in the rooms with great mattresses and a breakfast that cannot be beat. The included breakfast has coffees and juices, pastries, donuts, bread and toast, hash browns, scrambled eggs, omelets made to order, french toast, pancakes, fruit and everything else that you expect for breakfast in a clean expansive dining room.  You are about 5 - 8 minutes from Disney Parking and right off the expressway if you need to go somewhere else in the area. My wife and our six year old loved the room and it was a great

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay in Anaheim!!!!
Summary: I stayed here because I was taking my family to Disneyland, and read the great reviews!!! They lived up to the expectations. The staff was great, beds were comfortable, and the free hot breakfast was a great bonus!!! This is definitely a awesome choice and I will be staying there every time I go back to Disneyland, or anywhere in SoCal where there is an Ayre,  a very great pick!!!

Summary Heading: Good price for a decent stay close to Disney.
Summary: We stayed for three nights while we went to Disneyland. The hotel was okay for the price. I have not stayed in other Disney hotels but I am guessing that this is good for a Disney area hotel. The one thing that really bothered us was that there was a very strong odor of carpet deodorizer.
