It was so strong that it made us very concerned that it was trying to cover something very noxious. It was especially strong in the hallway and in the room. I'm not sure if we just got used to it or if it dissipated throughout our stay but it seemed to diminish over our stay. It set a bit of a bad tone and never made us feel very comfortable in the hotel. We were there for very little time each day since we were at the park all day and we did sleep comfortably there. The breakfast was fine with

Firstly, I'm a clean freak & HATE stating in hotels! But this place was great! Above my expectations! Rooms were very clean.  If you're going to an Angels game, you can walk to the stadium in just over 5 mins. And it's directly across the street from where the NHL Ducks play. There is a couple of bars close by, but did seem to clues fairly early.  The breakfast was pretty good too. I was in town during a big skating event, last week. The place was full of little girls & their families, but there was still no line ups for the omelettes, & I had no problem getting a table. They had begals, cereal, toast, muffins, omelettes, bacon, juice, coffee & different teas.   I didn't use the pool, although it looked pretty small. But there was no one even swimming.   I booked my room the day

We had a great stay at the Ayres Hotel. It is clean and comfortable throughout, the staff are extremely helpful, and the complementary breakfast is superb with lots of fresh hot and cold food.  The location is also great - just a 10 minute drive to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Perfect Place for Family Vacation to Disneyland
Summary: A very well decorated hotel/room, welcoming staff, spacious room, and excellent breakfast in the morning are the features we loved.  They offered way discounted (cheaper) price since we travelled there by Amtrak and showed them the tickets - their goal is to encourage fuel saving and a greener environment.  This act is certainly commendable.  Although the hotel is not within a walking distance from the Disneyland, you can take the ART shuttle (Anaheim Resort Shuttle) from the hotel to Disneyland and back (15 min one way - runs every 30 min in both directions).  The one-day unlimited ride ART shuttle is just $5.00 for adults and $2.00 for children.  This hotel does not have any restaurant for lunch/dinner; however, the restaurant in the very next building (JT Schmid's) is a place

I stayed here for three nights on a recent trip to Disneyland. It was a good stay overall. The hotel is well maintained. The outside of the hotel looks very nice.....no paint peeling, clean parking lot, etc... It seemed that the parking lot was on the small side, but we didn't have too many problems finding a space to park in. The pool outside is very small, but we were too busy with Disney to worry much about the pool. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. Housekeeping did a great job making sure we had clean towels in our room everyday. Breakfast was decent, but always a line for it. We did have issues with the check in process. Instead of them holding the $50 for incidentals like they said they would, they ended up holding the entire amount for two rooms. Not

Hi we wanted to take the time and thank you for a wonderful stay.  My family spent four wonderful days here in July of 2013.  The rooms wore clean and comfortable the breakfast was really nice cooked to order.  The cook was very nice and made great food in fact all the staff really made us feel at home.  I really felt the value of the room with the cook to order breakfast will keep us coming back. The beds were so comfortable and great water pressure.

Our family goes to Disneyland once or twice a year.  I finally decided to book off the main attraction area and picked Ayres.  We stayed from 8/6 t0 8/10.  We were pleasantly surprised at the hotel's overall ambiance.  The location, amenities and services were excellent!  Professional staffs like Bo, Andrew, Eboni, housekeeper Angelina (room 437) and the buffet server (sorry I did not get his name) were all assets to the hotel.  We will definitely book our next visits at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to friends and relatives.

Summary Heading: OK, but you can do better.
Summary: We stayed here solely based on all the great reviews on trip advisor - I can't understand why such great reviews. The location left a lot be desired, the pool was as basic as it could be, the breakfast "OK" but crowded.  The lobby area is so small it is virtually non-existent.  The only positive I really have is that the rooms are good size.  We checked out early and moved to a different hotel which was a little more money but felt a ton more like "vacation".

This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel. The beds are THE most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. What keeps us coming back are the affordable prices. This hotel is not only clean, but it is also pretty. I love the European look and feel. The breakfast was more than enough to fill us up for a day at disney. The only complaint I have is that our housekeeper "forgot" to empty our trash twice and also didn't refill the lotion/shampoo a few times. It wasn't anything for me to complain to the front desk about because there are 2 trash cans in the room. But it would have been nice to have everything filled up. Front desk was nice, always saying "hello" as we walked in. Even though we experienced a minor hiccup, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay near Disney.
Summary: We actually stayed here two years ago (2011 - not 2013, as indicated) however I sense from reading other more recent reviews that not much has changed in terms of the quality of experience that one can expect upon staying here.  We chose to stay at the Ayres on our trip to Anaheim on account of its location and its splendid reviews, but could certainly have stayed at another less expensive hotel (more on this as you continue to read).  I do not mean to suggest that the Ayres is expensive, per se; it just turned out at the time that we needed a room for a family of five and they did not have any rooms that would satisfy our need (their guestrooms are only equipped to handle four guests and they do not provide roll-away beds).  Sadly, I could not make a reservation even though

We have been staying here for the last 11 years. It is like our 2nd home away from home. Whenever we come to Anaheim this is the only place we stay. Comfortable rooms~good beds & great service~always. The breakfast is a cooked to order hot breakfast~very good with lots of other goodies & juices to choose from. Great location too. We highly recommend the Ayres Anaheim. The place to stay!

I had read previous reviews and I was not disappointed.  Front desk personnel were friendly and helpful.  Can't beat the location - we walked to the Angel's game.  The Honda Center is across the street and we saw the circus (check out the upcoming events if you are planning to stay in Anaheim).  Only complaint was that breakfast is slow getting - only one guy serving and the room isn't organized all that well.

Summary Heading: Felt like we stayed in someone's house.
Summary: This is a beautiful hotel and in a great location.  Great breakfasts!   I read all the past reviews in tripadvisor and they were not exagerrated. This place is as good as the past reviews say and I am glad I listened to them.

Summary Heading: Great Location for things to do in Anaheim
Summary: Good location for Honda Centre, Angels Stadium and Disneyland, otherwise you are miles away from anything. Arrange with a shuttle company for transport to the hotel before you get there or else it will cost you $120+ to get there from LAX. Clean and spacious. Front desk very helpful. Special mention to Bryn, Megan and Linda for their excellent service and friendly disposition. Pool and spa great. Housekeeping questionable as the staff we came across spoke only Spanish and it was hard trying to get them to understand English. Very spacious rooms for American standards. Breakfast filled the hole but wasn't a full American breakfast by any means, scrambled eggs was the only choice of eggs so if you didn't like scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs it is! Good pub with excellent meals

We stayed here years ago because you can walk to the stadium. My wife is disabled and needs a wheelchair to attend games so this location is fantastic. We come back at least twice a year now because the hotel is awesome. The staff is great, the rooms are spotless, way underpriced for the luxurious accommodations and the amenities exceed all of our expectations. Stay here once and you'll be back... Often!

What a wonderful place to house our East Coast guests!  Rooms are spacious, clean, affordable and very comfortable!  We loved meeting our friends for a full cooked breakfast each morning!  The hotel is close to everything with easy access to the highways. One of our friends decided to come at the last minute and the staff called him when a cancellation became available. We will be staying again next year for sure!

Summary Heading: Quick getaway at Disneyland and Ayres
Summary: Very nice hotel, staff very friendly and helpful, they always have a smile. Hot breakfast very good, rooms clean, nice and comfortable. We were able to get an early check-in and get started right away to Disneyland. They offer pickup and drop off at a reasonable price. :-)

Summary Heading: Great stay at The Ayres in Anaheim, Ca
Summary: I was quite hesitant to book this property as it had mixed reviews. Yet decided to give this property a try for its location.  We flew in from Fl, and from the minute we arrived at the hotel, the staff was friendly and most helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet. They had complimentary breakfast, and happy hour! On the day of our departure I returned my rental car(at 7 am)  and the hotel shuttle picked me up, great service on this detail. We had a great stay and would recommend this little European hotel to anyone visiting the area!

I love Ayres Hotels in Anaheim and in Orange!  They are my first choice when making hotel reservations in southern California.  They offer efficiency, breakfast in the morning, happy hour in the evening, free internet and a very clean comfortable room.

Comfortable King bed, AC, wireless, parking. Everything worked. Breakfast was decent, a good start to a long day. Room was surprisingly quiet, no freeway, no stadium or helicopters! We had everything we needed in our room. And just like a Hilton DoubleTree, chocolate chip cookies on arrival!

Beautiful hotel and great breakfast.  The staff were all very nice and the price was awesome.  It's only a few miles from Disneyland and public transportation is available for just $5 a day.  There isn't a restaurant but a hot breakfast is served each day.  It includes scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, breakfast potatoes, and pancakes.  They also have cereal, oatmeal, muffins, bagels, etc.

Summary Heading: Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Anaheim
Summary: What a great surprise!  We had never heard of Ayres Hotel and decided to stay there due to their proximity to Angel Stadium (walking distance).  We drove down from San Francisco and didn't get there until very late.  The person at the reservation desk was so nice.  I'm sorry I didn't get her name.  The room was gorgeous, beautifully appointed and HUGE!  The breakfast (made to order) was terrific!  We saw a sign that said that there was no event parking and since we were going to the Angel's game were concerned that we would have to move the car -- nope.  They permitted us to keep our car in the lot and held our luggage in the office (we had some things that couldn't be in the heat).  Unfortunately we only stayed that one night, but  I would not hesitate to stay at or recommend

This hotel was a lot less expensive than others in the area. It was nice enough, comfortable and we got a good night's rest. I did not like that there was a lot of trash left outside of guests rooms for long periods of time. There was a dead bug in our bathroom. I think they could use to have more laundry facilities. The free breakfast is a nice bonus and there is plenty to choose from. My only complaint there is that guests would leave a huge mess without somebody to immediately clean it up. It was not bad by any means, just not terrific.

This hotel met our expectations on most fronts, but perhaps we were paying top dollar, we expected a little more. For example, the A/C in our room did work, but it didn't get cool enough at any setting.  Since there was a big concert at the stadium, the small pool was full of partiers, and the check -in line was long.  I think a hotel is really stretched when it is completely sold out, and this was the case.  The location was superb, and we would stay again, hence the 4 star rating.

This was our second stay at the Ayres Anaheim. It has a convenient location across from the Honda Center and near (but not too near) Disneyland, as well as restaurants in walking distance. We enjoy staying at Ayres hotels because of their size (relatively small), amenities (exercise facilities, free full breakfast, in-room microwaves and refrigerators), and dependable upkeep. This particular hotel is starting to show its age in its d√©cor, but management keeps it in good shape, and I understand that plans are in the works to start updating it. The staff is friendly and helpful. We will stay there again next time we are in the area.

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable, luxury without the price tag
Summary: Stayed here on 3 separate occasions in our 5 week holiday, as we had had such a good experience the first and second times, and the third was no different. We were using Anaheim as a base, as other family members had booked in elsewhere and it was close to them and the places we had planned to visit. Staff are all fantastic. Nothing is an issue. Rooms are clean and very comfortable. Free wifi and a tasty free breakfast. Easy to find. Very good value for money.

Summary Heading: Great place to Stay in Anaheim
Summary: Although I wasn't familiar with this chain, I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the rooms and property. Very close to the Honda Center and Anaheim stadium and only a short drive to John Wayne Airport.  Very nice!

My wife and I decided to upgrade our Disneyland Annual Passports this year for our first wedding anniversary and wanted to get away for the weekend. I looked around last-minute for a good deal and found that this hotel offered a discount for Annual passholders, had free parking, breakfast, and Wi-Fi. When we arrived I was surprised to see that the hotel had upgraded our regular room to a suite (I booked online with the hotel website and made a comment that it was our anniversary). Andrew was the employee who checked us in and gave us the great news. It really made our night there more special and we definitely would consider staying again for another Disneyland getaway.   The room was neat and clean. The water was pretty hard so if you're coming from soft water you may be dried

We had a very comfortable and inviting stay at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim. We really loved the fact that we were close to Disneyland, yet far enough away (3 miles +/-) that we had None of the vehicle or foot traffic. The staff was super friendly! The room was a 2 Double. Very clean, best beds beside our own at home, great pillows. It did lack storage and a safe. It has one small closet and one 3 drawer dresser. With 3 people for a 5 night/ six days, it was tight and we had to store our luggage in the corner of the room. Just a note and nothing that would make us mark this hotel less than 5 stars. The FREE breakfasts were great, fresh and full course. Everything you could want and saved us probably $300 for the week The pool and jacuzzi were clean and comfortable as well. Also,

Summary Heading: Best Hotel and Breakfast in SoCal - We love Jose, he is outstanding!
Summary: The Ayres Hotel Anaheim is our favorite. We found this hotel about a year ago and we don't stay anywhere else when we are in the area. The hotel is awesome, the building and property are clean and well-kept, rooms are clean and spacious, the beds are very comfortable, and most of all Jose cooks the best breakfast ever! Our family looks forward to seeing Jose when we visit SoCal, he is always so friendly and gives us great local information, he really is one of the best assets of this hotel. Oh, and location, if you are going to an Angels game there is no better place to stay, you can walk a short 1/4 mile and you're at the park. Access to Disneyland is also very easy from this hotel.  You will not be disappointed with your stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim - go see Jose for

What can I say about Ayres. We booked the room last minute through the iPhone app Hotels Tonight. What a find!!!  If you are going to Disneyland it's a great option. They have extremely large rooms that are very clean and surprisingly comfortable beds.  And to top it off, they have a complimentary hot breakfast. Pancakes or waffles, eggs, sausage or bacon and toast. Seriously Ayres?!? You've stolen our hearts. My little boys love the all you can eat extravaganza.   Ayres continued to amaze me even after I returned home. I forgot my hair dryer in the room and didn't realize until the next morning. I called and the receptionist knew right away where it was and overnighted it to my home!  Amazing value and service! Cannot compare.

Large room, Free parking, free breakfast, great mattress, hot shower, and cold a/c all for a low price. This was a great value and a great stay. Two miles from Disney but only 10 minute bus ride. We would definitely stay here again.

Amazing hotel! Clean, comfortable, elegant large rooms, and GREAT location! The breakfast attendant was very friendly and breakfast was wonderful! LOVED every minute we were there!!! We will definitely stay again.

This is the 4th time I have been to this hotel, the service keeps me coming back.  I normally have 4-5 room blocks and Marie, with the sales office staff, is outstanding in meeting our needs. The rooms are terrific, kids can see Disneyland fireworks west facing rooms. The morning breakfast is wonderful, fresh eggs, bacon or sausage on alternating days, potatoes, Mickey Mouse face pancakes for the kids.  The staff is very friendly.  Angel stadium is 1/2 mile walk, Honda center across street. Great prices.

A beautiful hotel for adults and children alike. The rooms are well-appointed and the breakfast is complete. They have cookies in the lobby and laundry facilities on the 4th floor. We stayed here while visiting Disney and found it to be easy access and a wonderful respite from the Disney craziness.

Summary Heading: Comfortable, quiet, large room, European style.
Summary: I stay here each time I have business in Anaheim.  I love the happy hour and having a good sports bar and restaurant next door.  The desk staff gave excellent advice on local spas and gas stations. ;-). I didn't have breakfast there, but the breakfast area was quite busy and looked comfortable.

Summary Heading: Excellent  accommodations all for a fantastic price
Summary: Just stayed at the Ayres Hotel for two nights with my husband & 2 children. This hotel is very clean and has a very friendly staff.  The complimentary breakfast was pleasantly surprising.  Great offering with a chef making fresh eggs and pancakes. A great savings for a family of four. All of this and conveniently located to Disney.  The price for a two night stay cost about the same for one night at a Hilton in San Diego and the accommodations didn't even come close to the Ayres.  Great job. I would highly recommend to friends and family.

Brought my sister here for her birthday present. Free cocktail hour when we were checking in! We were going to a concert at The Grove & the hotel is just down the street. Beautiful room. Very clean & quiet. I usually hate hotel beds but I slept very well. Free breakfast in the morning. All the staff were friendly & accommodating. Wish we could have stayed longer! We will definitely be back!

From the room to breakfast and service, all aspects were very satisfactory.  We were very pleased with this stay of six nights.  The hotel has a chef who makes pancakes or french toast, bacon, potatoes, and eggs fresh daily. Other options include fruit cup, yogurt, pastries, bagels, toast, cereal.  You will not go away hungry!  The room was spacious and clean.  They do have a "green" atmosphere where you insert your key in a special location to turn on lights and the AC.

Free cocktail hour and breakfast! Rooms were clean and had a microwave and fridge. Loved that they were a green hotel too. Right across from the Honda center and near Disneyland. Glad we booked this hotel.

Walking distance from The Big A. The walk to the stadium was pleasant. Depending on the time, not much traffic. The walk back felt a bit unsafe due to no sidewalk and lots of traffic. Great breakfast. Convenient laundry facilities. Helpful and friendly staff. Free parking.

It was good experience! A good service was offered and the value we paid for the stay was worthful, sleep was ok. Minor issues with cleanliness and not clear information in the website. Overall the stay was good.

Excellent hotel with an excellent location! Especially if you are attending an Angel or hockey game, they are within walking distance and shuttle available for Disneyland.  A variety of places to eat are also close.

This was our final,stop on our US vacation. We stayed here for 6 nights(June 30-July 6).   The hotel located next to the Honda center and Angels stadium. It is a 15 minute bus drive from Disneyland via the ART shuttle route no 15.   It was so great not staying right beside Disneyland. Then you could go away from the fuzz from disneyland at night.   We stayed in room 102. The room was great. Large, clean and with a wonderful bed. You slept like a king. The bathroom too was spacy and clean.   The check in and out went smooth and the staff was very serviceminded. They served hot cookies and free drinks in the evening and the breakfast was included too.   Free parking and easy access to the freeways was also a plus.  We recommend this highly for a Anaheim stay!

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for an Angels Game
Summary: We scheduled a trip down to Anaheim to see the Red Sox play the Angels. (Go Sox) It is about a 3 block walk into the parking lot of the Angels Stadium.  Perfect!  Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, lobby area very welcoming, rooms were as nice as we expected after viewing the Hotel Website.  Very clean, beds were comfortable, linens clean, free wifi, who does this anymore? Breakfast in the morning was full on.  Not just danish and coffee.  Pancakes, sausage, hash browns, eggs, toast, coffee, juice, yogurt and fresh fruit.  Very good! Nice little pool area.  If the Sox come back to Anaheim, this is where you will find us!

Summary Heading: Extremely Quiet Room near to all
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 15 nights and had originally requested a room on the top floor.  Although on check in they could not accommodate this, we were moved the following day and this was the quietest room that I have ever stayed in.  We stayed in a King room and never heard any noise from our neighbours at all.  The room was large and comfortable and the bed was superb - I am a light sleeper but slept very well here.  I heard no traffic from outside - the only noise I hear was the fireworks on a Friday night from the Angels stadium.  The location was ideal for us - being within walking distance of the baseball ground and near to Disney.  We caught the shuttle to Disney each day we visited there and had no problems - and was on one of the quietest shuttle routes.  The front

Location was exactly what we  were looking for. Staff was very helpful. Would suggest that staff inform guests that have never stayed with Ayres how the key cards operate the essentials in the room. Lights,TV etc. Look of the hotel was beautiful. Old style with new style and grace. Fantastic Stay!!!!

We enjoyed staying at Aryes on our family trip to Disneyland and Huntington Beach.  Our children loved the pancakes at breakfast, the staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and as a light sleeper I slept perfectly on the comfy beds.  Excellent value!

Stayed at Ayres for a night while we attended games at the Big A on back to back nights.  Great hotel within easy walking distance to the stadium.  Right across the street from JT Schmids, clean room, comfortable bed, plus free breakfast, and free wi-fi.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Strange happenings but they made it right.
Summary: On night number one of a three night stay the air conditioner in one of two rooms we rented would not operate correctly. On the second night the air conditioning unit in the other room blew out a smokey residue and set off the fire alarm. We stay at the Ayres Anaheim twice to 4 times a year for 3 to 5 days at a time ever since it opened. They moved us to a suite and adjoining room...comped us 1 day of the 3 and did all they  could to make what could have been a difficult time more acceptable. We rebooked for Christmas. The over all rating would be excellent (5) all the way were it not for the surprising mechanical failures in both rooms and eventual fire alarm trigger.

This place has all the modern conveniences with old-fashioned style and grace. Staff is very helpful. We loved the spacious comfortable room. Breakfast was terrific with eggs etc cooked right in front. Walking to the Angels ball game was easy. Definitely would stay there again!

No BETTER place to stay in Anaheim, if going to an event at the Big √Ñ or Honda Center. You can walk. The Staff was present and took care of all my questions and those of my fellow travelers.  The breakfast was good with a wide selection.  The rooms are semi suites. They could add another TV, as well as, maybe enlarge it. My king bed was a little too hard for me.  I would and will stay here at the Ayres again.

They went above and beyond when I left my cell phone in the room, heck it almost beat me home. My only concern was that there was only one place to eat within walking distance. But  they did deliver to the room and the food was good. It just would be nice to have a Denny's or something a little more family oriented.

This hotel has it all!  The rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. The staff is wonderful....everyone, front desk, housekeeping, breakfast and the management.  They all truly care about you stay.  The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.  My room and Bathroom were spotless and its really nice to have a microwave and refrigerator in the rooms.  At most hotels you would have to pay for a suite to get these type of accommodations. Thank you!

Truly enjoyed my stay . Stayed for a concert and asked the front desk to give me the quietest room !! Truly enjoyed my stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone . My kids enjoyed the breakfast !!  I will definitely come back again

We needed to book an unexpected last minute overnight stay in Orange County for a sports tournament with our teenager on a Saturday night. Most hotels we found in Inland Orange County are either in Buena Park or Anaheim near the amusement parks, so we were concerned about finding a comfortable & quiet hotel that was moderately priced at the beginning of the 4th of July holiday week.  The Ayres made it easy and stress free from the first reservation phone call to check in and check out! This hotel is literally 2 min.away from the main freeway with easy access on/off in both directions which was very helpful. I had read in the reviews that the upper floors were quieter and had views of local fireworks. We requested the 4th floor and it was indeed quiet & gave us a view of

The hotel was close to Disneyland since our vacation was concentrated at going to Disney parks. Our six year old daughter enjoyed the hotel pool. We loved the breakfast!  The room was clean and comfortable for us.

great hotel with clean rooms and spotless bathrooms and a lovely breakfast but best of all is the staff !  They are smiling and friendly and give you personal attention and the best service.We spent 4 days for our daughters volleyball tournament and will be back next year.

We stayed for three nights, and I have to say...this has been the most comfortable hotel that my husband and I have stayed at since our honeymoon.    Pros:  * The hotel offered us a choice of room location - downstairs or upstairs.   * The staff was friendly and accomodating; wonderful concierge services! * The room itself was immaculate; the bathroom was large and squeaky clean, the bedroom was spacious - the bed itself was comfortable and luxurious.  Everything had the gorgeously clean feeling of freshly laundered linen. * The room was well insulated and extremely quiet.  No noise from the streets or even the corridors.  Only noise that came through were the Disneyland fireworks.   * The breakfast was included in the price: the french toast and scrambled eggs were hot and

I can't begin to say how pleased we were with our stay here.  The rooms are spacious, the bedding extremely comfortable, very clean... Heck even sugar cookies at check-in.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.  You won't be sorry if you choose this hotel.

This was a great place to stay while we explored Universal Studios, Disneyland, Hollywood and of course to see an Angels Game. The hotel is great with everything you need including a good laundry as we stayed for 5 nights. It is within walking distance to Angels Stadium, Honda Center and Schmidts Brewhouse where we had most our meals. The hotel is on the ART Buslines (Anaheim Resort Transport) where a shuttle arrives every 30 minutes and goes to Disneyland where you can catch other shuttles to get around Anaheim if like us, you don't have a car. Other than the 3 locations mentioned it is a little isolated if walking but the shuttle makes it easy. The price was also extremely reasonable and with a basic buffet breakfast and complimentary drinks weekdays in the afternoon we had a

Summary Heading: Perfect location for Ducks or Angels games
Summary: Stayed for one night.  Room very clean but fairly noisey on several levels.  Stayed on 3rd floor and there must have been a child above us b/c we heard footsteps a lot.  Also heard a lot of street traffic.  We were a few doors down from the elevator so heard loud talking in hallway and every door that slammed shut.  Sad we didn't have a room facing the Angels stadium because there was a fireworks show after the game.  Breakfast was the usual; adequate.  Expect lots of families and small children running around because of the proximity to Disneyland.    Laundry room on our floor which some will appreciate.  Lobby had a small 'store' to sundries.  Front desk staff super nice.  Would stay there again but request top floor.  Loved the free parking, free breakfast and free internet.

I travel to Orange County once a month and, while I'd rather be home, I look forward to my stay at the Ayres.  The staff is friendly and professional, the rooms are very nice and the beds are exceptionally comfortable.  I brought my wife, daughter, son-in-law and granddaughter for a vacation visit to Disneyland and they were skeptical about staying at my "business" hotel.  Now they all want to go back and agree that the beds are especially comfortable.  There are cookies in the afternoon, as well as a happy hour with beer, chips & salsa and wine.  Be sure to say hello to Jose when you go for your hot breakfast in the morning.  If you ask him, he'll make your pancakes look like Mickey Mouse.  As for location, you can walk to Angel Stadium, take an inexpensive, regularly scheduled

Summary Heading: Stay at Ayres for Ducks and Angels game
Summary: We live in Las Vegas and drive to Anahem Ducks hockey games and Angels games.  Always fast, friendly check-in.  Clean good-sized rooms, Great free breakfast.  Parking at the hotel for games is free.  Free internet!  I wouldn't stay anywhere else for Ducks/Angels games.

This is the first time that I have stay at a Ayres Hotel. The front desk people were very friendly. The room was extremely clean. My only complaint and it might be because of the time of the year is that I ended eating breakfast away from your hotel. Nothing but screaming kids running around and of course the parents do nothing to stop it. I understand that the hotels in Anaheim are the family destination for Disneyland. However, when all three of my days at the hotel that I couldn't sit and have breakfast because of the large family crowds it was annoying to say the least.

This place was a God send. We spent three grueling days at Disneyland and this room was clean, good sized, had an extremely comfortable bed, and was a little bit away from the bustling Disney area. My only complaint was that I was told it would be easy to feed my son breakfast there even though he had to eat gluten free and this was not so.

This was our third stay.The rooms are about 350 Sq. Ft. They are furnished with mahogany/ Queen Anne furnishings, triple sheeted bed and beautiful duvet coveriets. It has a full bathroom and vanity, seating area and a mini kitchen with fridge, micowave and coffee-maker, Complimentary internet, haidryer, iron and board, Satelite TV.  The free breakfast is super, everything from fresh fruit to eggs, bacon, bagels,pancakes, juice coffee etc. You get the idea.It is a great easy no cost way to start your day. Did i mention Free parking. Across from the Honda center, walking distance to Angel games and on the free Disney bus loop. Very clean friendly place. Also a pool and Gym

This hotel was nice but not as nice as I was expecting based on the reviews I read on here and seeing as how it is ranked #1 out of the anaheim hotels, I don't agree with that.  Upon check in we were asked if we would like a room on the second, third, or fourth floor and we chose the fourth.  We opened the door to our room and the smell was awful.  It smelled like someone had literally just smoked a carton of cigarettes in the room which was ironic considering I was asked to initial a paper saying we would not smoke in the room because they are "non-smoking".  However, we were running late for dinner reservations in laguna beach so we didn't have time to mess with changing rooms, and when we returned to the hotel late, we just wanted to go to sleep.  The next days we spent the
Manager Response: Dear Bri,   Thank you for taking the time to post your review. I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations. We have just received a shipment of a fantastic product that removes the smell of smoke very effectively. I will certainly be using that in your room. Sadly sometimes people break the non-smoking rule, and we have to charge the fine that we have you acknowledge on check-in.  All our standard rooms with either one king or two queens have a nice wide bath tub, except for one, which was the room that you had! That room has just one king bed and most families use the rooms with two queen beds so it is rarely an issue.  The ART organization is a non-profit subsidized by the hotels to make it more affordable. Feedback has been overwhelmingly positive this year with most families appreciating the punctuality and door to door service, as well as the frequency of twice hourly service. $2 for children and $5 for an adult to use the service all day has been seen as fair when compared to the price of parking at Disney.  Thank you so much for your nice comment about the friendliness of the staff.   Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: 2 rooms booked for an Angels game
Summary: We booked two rooms for Angels game in June. Our room was perfect, it was clean and very comfortable. My daughter and son-in-laws was a nightmare. The non-smoking room smelled like smoke, the air conditioner leaked on the carpet all day and night. Upon packing up for check out they found a cockroach in the closet.   On a good note: The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was very good.
Manager Response: Dear Michelle,  Thank you for taking the time to post a review. I was disappointed to hear that your daughter's room smelled bad and that they found a bug. I would be keen to hear which room that was so that we can address the issue, call a pest controller in and replace the ac unit. We do have a fabulous product that addresses the smell of smoke as we occasionally have guests who break the rules. I am pleased that your room was perfect.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: 1- This is a clean hotel with complimentary Breakfast and Wifi. 2- Check in and out was very easy 3- Not at all near to Disney Land where you could think of walking, but there is a private bus ART route 15 who covers this and comes twice an hour and takes to Disneyland USD 5 per person for 24HRS. 4- You wont have any issues from the hotel but you obviously travel with KIDS if you are traveling with KIDS thus you need at walking distance 24HRS convenience store at least...Pampers etc... You never know what you need with the kids...5- If you get the hotel near to Disney Land get this, otherwise with all the precautions, even this hotel will be pleasant... There is a restaurant row try the Lazy Dog or the Pizza Place just next to Lazy Dog.. Great Food I must say... 6- Staff is

This is our second stay in the past two years at this Ayers. It is located 1 mile from Disneyland on Katella Ave. We stayed in a 2-Queen bed suite (wanted a King but those were sold out). These are really nice rooms with a wet bar, table and chairs and desk with chair. The bathroom vanity area is a single sink that's a little small, but nicely decorated with good lighting. It's separate from the tub/toilet room. The hotel provides a complimentary wine and beer happy hour in the late afternoon along with warm fresh baked cookies. The fresh cooked to order full breakfast bar in the morning is amazing. So good and tons of great selections. You just can't beat it for the price....$154 (includes taxes) for two people and two beds. The hotel also provides a shuttle to all the Disney

Summary Heading: If we come back we would stay again.
Summary: We stayed Ayres Hotel during our Disneyland visit and if we come back we would stay again. We had a after midnight arrival and checking in was a breeze. No issue and the staff is very welcoming. We had a double bed room, which was well kept and very clean. Beds and pillows were comfortable, and we did not have an issue sleeping and getting enough rest. Breakfast is fantastic. What more can you ask for in a breakfast. Not sure why you would want to eat somewhere else, unless you want to spend done money. Breakfast staff were nice, and made eating there enjoyable. Especially the lady cooking, Ms. Benita. We rented a vehicle from airport so we drove that to the DL parking lot, paid about $16 per day. So we did not take use of any hotel or public transport.  I did like the fact that

I stayed three nights at room 301. All the staffs were very friendly and patient. Complimentary wifi speed was cool, and paid laundry machine is also very useful if you stay longer. Honda center and angels stadium is very close. But Disney land is about 3 miles away and we took Anaheim Resort Transport shuttle bus during our stay. 12 USD each for 3 day pass. Not a bad price, but not free. Room 301 has a few defects. Air conditioning system can not be turned off. We had to remove room key card from slot while we were sleeping. Someone reviewed that you can't close the inner curtain that neon light from across the street is quite disturbing. This was true and we couldn't fully close the green curtain. Breakfast buffet and coffee - better eat outside. Not a perfect hotel, seems
Manager Response: Dear longpin,  Thank you for your review. I am glad that the staff made such a positive impression on you and appreciate your mention of them. I would like to comment that the green curtain that you tried to close is for decorative purposes only. All of our rooms have fully closing black-out blinds that effectively shut out all the light. They are located behind the sheer curtains.  Thank you and enjoy the rest of your summer.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: First time guests at this wonderful hotel. We stay primarily at bed and breakfast inns.  This place was clean, quiet, and deserving of its rating by Trip Advisor.  The breakfast in the morning was terrific and very filling.  We spent three days at Disneyland and tonight we are tired beyond words.  Great to have a comfortable bed to come back to.  Staff here are very attentive and go he extra mile.  We are from out of the area and not familiar with Southern California.  The front desk prepared written directions for us for our stay in Oxnard with a smile and pretty darn quick, too. We will come back here again when we are in the area.  Our thanks to Bryn, Eboni, Meaghan and the breakfast chef, Jose for everything.

I tend to prefer boutique hotels anyway but this was perfect for me and my 2 daughters in so many ways.    During our 3-day pass to Disneyland & California Adventure, this hotel offered a great balance.  Disneyland surprised me in many ways (we ran into rides that were closed pretty frequently, "Grad Night" meant a constant barrage of insane, amped up teenage bravado).    This hotel offered a stark contrast to the chaos of Disneyland.  It is a quiet oasis.  Never did we experience a problem.  Adding the fact that they include free breakfast (very good compared to most hotels), free wifi and a nice little outdoor pool & hot tub which my girls loved and I'm an official fan.  For those going to Disneyland:  I will add that another perk is that the #15 ART shuttle doesn't have too

This is our second time at this hotel. This hotel continues to amaze me. The breakfast in the morning is better than most hotels. There's a chef that cooks the eggs, bacon, sausages, pancakes and hash browns. The bed is so comfy! The service of the staff is beyond amazing! We were able to partake in happy hour a few times. There were WARM FRESH cookies, and FREE BEER!!! There was also fresh chips and salsa! One of my friends had to leave/check out early because of a family emergency. I talked to the friendly lady at the front desk and she gladly changed the reservation free of charge! Most hotels would charge if you left early. Anytime my friends and I decide to come back to Anaheim, Ayres is my first and only choice!

I stayed for 2 nights in May.  We arrived early via train and were just going to leave our luggage but found out our room was ready by 11:00 am, so that was a nice surprise.  The room was spacious and clean and the bed was very comfy.  They have a swimming pool and hot tub.  The tub was slightly deeper than a standard tub, so that was nice too.  They serve a full hot breakfast in the mornings and the food was good. Eggs, potatoes, bacon, cereals, bagels, toast, coffee and juices.  The chef Jose was really nice. In fact all of the employees we came across were great. I felt they all went above and beyond.  The ART shuttle stops by every half hour to go to Disneyland.  It is directly across the street from the HONDA center.  Free Wi-Fi too.  There is a microwave and fridge too!

Our family of 4 stayed here this past Memorial weekend while visiting Disneyland.  We booked online and got a great deal from the hotel with the AAA - May promotion.  Hot breakfast, WIFI, parking newspaper, coffee maker, small fridge included.  We asked for the join rooms.  Our rooms were spotless. clean  Comfy beds.  Lobby has great decor.  Thanks Benita, you made our daughter happy with your Micky mouse pancakes.   We will definitely come back to this hotel every time we travel down South. Thanks to all staff!  We had a great time.

Wish I could give it 3.5 - there were a couple of problem areas but overall the location is great and the staff was awesome, so more a 4 than a 3.  Stayed here twice within about a week, had plans to attend a couple of different rock concerts in the area. The first room I was in was great - big room with a foldout couch at the back of the hotel...however, for the second stay I got a smaller 'handicapped' room upstairs and had a couple of issues...  Be aware this hotel is right next to the Katella Ave. exit off I-5 and you will likely hear traffic noise if you're on the front of the hotel. It wasn't worst case scenario & didn't keep me awake, but I was glad I had brought a pair of earplugs.  My big issue, however, was that I couldn't get the heating/cooling unit to shut off - I

Summary Heading: Don't hesitate to book this Hotel
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland with our two teenage boys.  Booking online is always a little concerning especially coming all the way from New Zealand, however we had no reason to worry.  Beds were absolutely wonderful, d√©cor great and cleanliness excellent.  You are close to a major freeway but we didn't hear any road noise or noise from the other guests. The breakfast area was rather cramped but apart from that the food was enough to keep the three guys going for the majority of the day. Pool was great as was the spa pool and the gym.  They don't have a restaurant but there are plenty to choose from within walking distance although we did have a car.  The door to door shuttle service from Disneyland (at a minimal price) was

Summary Heading: Great start to a Honeymoon , awesome Hotel
Summary: We found this great hotel through this site no less and decided to book it for the first part of our honeymoon. Yes its a bit of a jaunt to Disneyland etc ( ie not across the road or such ) however the service was amazing, the rooms were great and the overall experience was bar none. Thanks again for a great stay.

Perfect Anaheim location for Disneyland with efficient, prompt regular 2/hr. shuttle service. Hotel has all the required amenities including a free hot cooked daily breakfast, free parking, free WIFW, free USA Today newspapers, swimming pool,  bar fridge, coffee maker in room, many TV channels etc.. Located perfectly across from Honda center ( NHL Ducks Hockey) and a short walk to Angel Stadium (American League Angels MLB Baseball). Terrific internet price for the quality of the hotel. Friendly, helpful front counter staff.  I would not stay anywhere else if we ever go back to Anaheim/Disneyland.

If this hotel was in any Australian capital city, people would be kicking in the doors to try and stay here. A large hotel with a boutique feel, breakfast included and comfortable rooms. Tea and coffee making in room and a refrigerator. Staff were happy and helpful. The Disney shuttle calls in every hour, there is a restaurant/boutique brewery next door and the Honda entertainment centre across the road. Luxbus also calls in here. Major outlets are a short cab ride away. If you don't want the hustle and bustle near Disneyland and want a quiet retreat with a pleasant ambience this hotel is for you.

From the time I walked in and breezed thru check-in until the same at check-out I liked this hotel. It had an old world charm in a state where everything moves so fast and only cares about the latest and newest. I really appreciated the hotels conservation efforts where u had to stick ur hotel key in the wall to turn the lights and air on and would cutoff automatically when u took the key out. I don't mind doing my small part to conserve even when Im out of town. The hotels in a great spot right off hiway ramp so no trying to find it in the dark. Rooms are clean and spacious I'll do this hotel again when Im back in Cali.

We stayed for the first time at this hotel. I highly recommend this property. The beds and furniture were very comfortable and romantic looking. It was like sleeping in an art gallery or a French boutique hotel. There is a shuttle bus that picks you up at the hotel and takes you to and from Disneyland and around Anaheim if you want for $5.00 hop on and off all day. Cooked breakfast in the morning was nice also. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: An oasis away from the madness!
Summary: No its not across the road or within walking distance of Disneyland - hurrah!  We purposely chose to be away from the busyness of the immediate Disneyland area.  Once you have spent a day (or 3) traipsing around Disneyland and California Adventure - dodging strollers and 'convenience vehicles' all day..... it is SOOO nice to get on the ART bus and go back to the lovely quiet Ayres Hotel for a break!  We really did think of it as our oasis.  We walked to an Angels game one night (go on a Friday - fireworks are awesome and better than Disney) and the ART bus had us to Disney within 10 minutes.  Disneyland Express (airport transfer) bus picked us up right outside - you just need to pre book as they don't advertise it as one of their 'pick up' hotels.  Grayline also picked us up for

We have been to anahiem about fifty times over the past twenty years and this is by far the best hotel for the money. It is spotlessly clean, the staff including Marcus, the manager, couldn't be more accomodating, and the breakfast is wonderful! We usually stay at Hilton properties but this hotel is far better! I won't stay anywhere else when in Anahiem.

My sons and I were in Anaheim not for disneyland but to see a hockey game. For any of these  or even for a baseball game this hotel is a good choice. It is located right accross the street from the hockey arena and just a short walk away from the baseball stadium. The Amtrak station is also just a short walk away which we used to get into LA. However it you are here for disneyland or any other attractions then this may be a good choice for you. There is a Hop On Hop Off bus that runs around all the local Anaheim attractions on a very good and regular schedule and is only 5 bucks for an all day ticket. What a deal. No driving and no parking issues. The hotel is very clean and quiet, has very knowledgeable front desk staff, a very good buffet breakfast included in the room charge

...started off with excellent phone service with front desk staff when booking the reservation and price adjustment when price found lower as our dates moved closer.  Ayres will price match Expedia, etc. with an excellent cancellation policy should that become necessary.  The value is awesome with the parking, Wi-Fi, Mon - Thurs Happy Hour in the lobby, plus an all-inclusive type breakfast served up every morning...I can still hear the chef Jose calling out "pancakes."  The lobby, rooms and grounds are well appointed, maintained and kept nice and clean.  The room fridge and microwave came in handy....we were on the 3rd floor facing the Angles Stadium (freeway side) and the fireworks from there on Friday night was better than Disney's.  There were a couple of special requests

I stayed at this hotel for 4 days last month for our national convention. I miscalculated the distance of this hotel from Disneyland Hotel where we were holding the convention. It is quite a distance. On my first day, being a weekend, I had to take a taxi since I missed the shuttle going to the Disney Hotel. That costed money. The Disney Hotel staff was not knowledgeable as to where should I wait for the shuttle going to Ayers Hotel, so I had to get a cab back to Ayers Hotel. The following day, I was already anticipating to be riding in the shuttle and paying nominal fee, but lo and behold! The staff at Ayers Hotel offered to take me to and from the convention site everyday at no cost!!! It was like having my own chauffeur since I was the only one riding in their complimentary

My husband and I planned on starting out our honeymoon in Anaheim to see the last game of the season for the Anaheim Ducks and Phoenix Coyotoes. We planned on only staying one night and wanted a hotel close to the arena. There were quite a few to chose from, but the Ayres hotel was a reasonable price and was on the opposite corner as the arena. (seriously a 3 minute walk).  I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The lobby was gorgeous and the the check in girl was very friendly and informative. The room was very nice, clean and had beautiful furniture. The toilet and bathroom were seperated so someone could still use the sink and mirror outisde of the bathroom if it's occupied which was nice.  The breakfast was so delicous! I am a huge bacon lover. Anytime there is a buffet I

My wife and I stayed here for business and then spent the weekend to relax. The Honda Center and Angles stadium are an easy walk, and Disney is only 2.5 miles with shuttle stops all day long. We did none of the above however and found the location very convenient to the beaches.  The hotel is well maintained and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a step above "continental" and well above average in that it is cooked and served from the grill with a different variety each of the 3 days we spent there. It is not a full service restaurant however, so you can expect pancakes and scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, fruit, pastry, etc.  Internet is free, but really slow; we downloaded a movie from iTunes and it took 18 hours to finish; not sure what their bandwidth is

We stayed for the first time at this hotel. I highly recommend this property. We had a very nice room complete with refrig./ micro and seating area. The beds and furniture were very comfortable, the art work in the halls and rooms where nice and quit surprising - as that is not something I notice in other hotels (many oils and not prints).. This hotel reminds us of a country inn.. The free parking/internet and cooked to order breakfast was great. Jose the chef was friendly and nice-This hotel is not far from disneyland but far enough away as to avoid the extra resort taxes one incurres closer to the park. Being close to honda center allows for another trip planned for up coming concerts..The hotel is decorated nice and was cozy and welcoming. Marcus the gen. manager responding

I stayed at this hotel because I was attending a concert right across the street at the Honda Center. Everything about this hotel is perfect!  The decor, the cleanliness, helpfulness of the staff are by far the best.  I would definitely stay here again!

I stayed ay Ayres with my family .In my opinion, it is an old hotel though the management seem to be trying to keep it as modern as possible it  is overrated. It is nice yes but we will not be staying there again. Breakfast is not particularly fantastic but I do give it to the lovely ladies that worked their hearts churning it out. It is not  close to Disney which was my primary reason for choosing it but the hotel does have a shuttle that can take one to and from the theme parks. Some of the staff were not particularly friendly,well, probably because we were black. I noticed the chinese lady especially (Mia) who was very abrupt and almost rude to me whenever I spoke to her at the front desk.( I find people not looking me in the eye when they address me rude) especially if you
Manager Response: Dear Osj3110,  I am sorry that you were not pleased with your experience staying with us. I would like to respond to your comments regarding the hotel. Our hotel was built in 2001, so we are aiming at a traditional style, rather than trying to modernize an old hotel. We have updated the rooms recently, bringing in new phones, alarm clocks, bedside and desk lamps, flat screen TVs, desk, desk chairs, dressers, fridges and microwaves as well as a massive upgrade on our wi-fi system. However we will continue to maintain a traditional style as so many of our customers enjoy this particular look.  As you can imagine I was horrified that you felt you were treated poorly due to the colour of your skin. I can assure you that this is the first time in my 6 years of management at the hotel that bigotry has been suggested. While Mai can sometimes be somewhat brief and businesslike when there is a lot of people waiting for her attention, I have never been given cause to believe that she is any way prejudiced and I am certainly sorry that you had that impression. I would be interested in discussing this with you. Please feel free to email the hotel with your contact details and a good time to call.  I am sorry that our hotel did not meet with your expectations and that you were not made to feel welcome. That is, of course, not our intention, and we are very disappointed to hear of your experience.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Another wonderful trip to Anaheim, staying in our favourite hotel in the area.  It has been a couple years since we were in town, and the same wonderful cook was serving breakfast in the morning, with the same happy personality and service for all the guests.  It's a sign of good management when staff is retained!  Rooms were spacious, very clean, tidy, and very well afforded:  microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, hairdryer.  The front desk staff helped me find local stores I needed, and were helpful at any time of day or night.  The cleaning crews were very friendly and cheery in the mornings.  The hotel is very well located off a main freeway, and is just a 5 minute drive to Disneyland.  We had our own car, but they have a shuttle to Disney that a lot of guests used.  We drove to

The hotel was great, very comfortable bed, nice bathroom, a good free breakfast and very helpful/friendly staff.  The only thing I would say that has no reflection on the hotel - Anaheim is miles away from most of the good tourist spots in LA. It's great for Disneyland/Orange County. But with LA traffic it is very difficult to get to Hollywood and many other LA spots. If you are planning on non Disneyland activities I would book closer to Hollywood as LA is a massive sprawling city and Anaheim is a long way away.

My husband, teen and I recently stayed here for a few nights while visiting Disneyland.  Our rooms were beautiful.  The beds, linens and pillows all very comfortable.  We had tons of room in our king room, it was almost like a suite with one area with a nice couch, table and chair then a partial wall with louvers that separated the sitting area from the wonderful king bed.  My son had a room with two double beds.  It was spacious but the area where we had a sitting area was taken up by the second bed.    The breakfast was very yummy and the hot dishes actually changed each day a bit which was nice.  All days there were delicious pancakes fresh off a real grill.  Yum!  There was usually a wait for these.  The bacon and sausages that were on different days were very tasty, seemed

Summary Heading: FANTASTIC!!  WE WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN IN A HEARTBEAT!!
Summary: We were so excited to stay at this hotel because of the glowing reviews and their rating as #1 here on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed even in the slightest!  From the moment we walked in to check in, we were reassured that we had made the right choice!!  Linda was extremely friendly and accommodating and answered all of our questions.  Oh, I can't forget to mention the platter of delicious freshly baked chocolate chip cookies that were available to us upon check-in!  When we walked into our room, we were ecstatic!  It was elegantly decorated...it was very warm and welcoming!  Our kids started calling the hotel "home" right away!  We were at the hotel for 3 days/2nights to celebrate our son's ninth birthday, and everyone at the hotel made him and our daughter feel so

This hotel is great.  I didn't expect such nice decor. It is European style, which is much nicer than just some ordinary style of decor. It's a real bonus to get a free cooked breakfast everyday as well.  Would definitely recommend this to anyone.  Quite close to Disneyland as well.  I also expected this to cost much more.

Stayed for 2 nights. Close to Disney and across the street from Honda centre where we saw the ducks. Stayed on top floor and no road noise. Staff very friendly. Rooms well appointed even if I didn't quite get the European boutique style. Nice pool area which the kids enjoyed. Managers reception was a welcome surprise with free beer and nibbles for an hour. Breakfast was the best we had on a two week road trip. Wifi worked well in the room and sufficient speed to download video, use FaceTime etc.  All in all a great hotel. Would definitely recommend and return!

Picked this hotel based on reviews which were more than confirmed by our experience. Four-night stay included two days in D-land. The location by the highway made it convenient for our other destinations in area, including some college visits. One important caveat about location: find out what is going on at the Honda Center across the street during your visit. We were surprised by a Rihanna concert that made the otherwise ten-minute drive back to hotel from Disneyland into a more than one hour ordeal. I fault the City of Anaheim for not managing traffic better, but it's something to be aware of if you stay here.  We especially enjoyed the ample size of our room and the smart arrangement of facilities so that one person could shower, another could use the vanity sink, and

Very nice hotel.  We recently spent 5 nights here.  The room was clean.  The beds were very comfortable.  A nice feature was the 2nd sink/mirror by the fridge/microwave area in the room.  Convenient for getting 4 people ready in morning.  Breakfast was a good selection of hot and cold.  The service was superb.  If we needed any extra towels when we went to the pool, the guys working the laundry room were happy to give us some.  Parking and wifi are free.  We got their Spring Special rate, which made it a great bargain, too.  A couple of (possible) cons.  They are right off the 57 freeway.  Sitting by the pool, I could hear the traffic, although it really didn't bother me, more like white noise.  If you believe in walking to Disneyland, then look elsewhere.  This is car or ART

Very good, one of the cleanest hotels. The breakfast was fantastic. The staff went over and beyond to help us in any way we wanted. Parking was good. Walking distance to the Angels baseball stadium. Very nice atmosphere. Rooms was very roomy and very clean.

We stayed at the Ayres hotel in Anaheim for October fest. It is a beautiful hotle with rooms that are so charming. I was  pleased with the decor and how charming the furnishings were. The beds were so comfy too! I am super picky..so just know If I liked it..it is good lol! close to The Honda Center, walking distance to some restaurants.. great location for so many things to do:-)

We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in room 217, and the entire stay was excellent.  We took the ART shuttle to Disneyland (it stops there twice an hour), which was about a 10-15 min drive.  The rooms were large, clean and quiet.  Bathroom included an over-size bathtub, however, the water pressure of the shower was very low.  Beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was good - lots of options and their own chef - the hot options did change a little over the week, but it was mostly scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, potatoes and pancakes or french toast.  Coffee was not very good at all!  It got very busy on weekends and when Spring Break started. We used the pool once, but it was very cold and obviously not heated.  Also it is not located close to any stores or

My wife, 3 yr old son and I just returned from a 4 day vacation at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim. Now I know why it was number 1 on Trip Advisor. The hotel was nice and clean and check in was fast and easy. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Our room faced Disneyland so we were able to see the fireworks show at night. The hotel is near the Angels Stadium and right across the street from the Honda Center. Breakfast in the morning was very good with the chef working very hard to get everybody fed quickly, Kudos to him ! The menu changed daily, which was really nice. We never made it to the afternoon manager's stuff, but everything else was great. The shuttle ride from the hotel to Disneyland was nice and quick. All in all, I have to say that we had a great time here and we would

Stayed 4 nights on a side trip to Disney.  Hotel was clean, quiet and has a quick shuttle to Disneyland.  It is also very close to the Anaheim stadiums.  B-fast was included and was good.  French toast, eggs, bacon, pasties, etc.  menu changes.  Pool was fine.

We recently returned from an awesome Disneyland vacation and stayed 10 nights at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim.  There is a reason it is number one on Trip Advisor.  The hotel is great, rooms are pretty big, clean and very comfortable.  The breakfast is really good with lots to choose from and they have happy hour in their lobby every Mon-Thurs evening with free beer/wine and chips and salsa, a nice touch.  The staff was very friendly.  The hotel is quiet even though you are quite close to the freeway and the Honda Center even on game night.  The ART shuttle picks you up right outside the lobby door for a very reasonable price and has only 1-2 stops before you get dropped off at the Disney gates.  We didn't miss staying close to Disney at all and I didn't miss walking back to a hotel

The best thing we can say about this hotel is that we would definitely come back on subsequent visits to this area of the US. The location is good with respect to DLand and neighbouring attractions. The hotel is very quiet - no noise from slamming doors, screaming kids, traffic, etc. Its located near a freeway exit/entry which is great but you get no noise in the room from that freeway. The laundry facilities are good and breakfast is more than adequate, albeit a bit squeezy in the breakfast room with the chunky "period" chairs. We would recommend to others especially small families. There is a half decent restaurant next door - JD Schmidt - Jill is the very nice waitress.

I am a former road warrior, and have stayed in many hotels. I found this property well managed, clean and kept up. I requested ajoining rooms and were given such. The rooms were clean, simple. The staff was friendly, food was good, parking not an issue. I will be honest,if you are expecting the Ritz this is not where you want to be. However, with the prices of hotels in the area this is a great deal. You get extras you would have to pay for somewhere else (breakfast, internet and parking as examples. All part of your room fee here)  Having stayed in more elaborate properties, I was pleased. My dad had a few issues with his AC in their room, but the staff did make an appearance and offered a suggestion. While it did not fix the problem 100%, it did improve greatly and everyone

Summary Heading: Not as good as I expected
Summary: I probably would have given a better review but our room was not great. We were on the corner of the 3rd floor and the noise at night was bad, I couldn't sleep, kept waking up. Also, it was impossible to close window curtains and we saw big neon all night which made sleep less comfortable. Other than that, the people at the front desk were very nice and helpful, the place was clean and the breakfast was good.
Manager Response: Dear Morning_Blossom,  Thank you for posting your review. I am sorry that the hotel did not meet your expectations. We rarely receive noise complaints so you were particularly unfortunate and I am sorry that you were disturbed. Typically the white noise from the air-conditioning masks any external noise. From your description I can tell which rooms you may have been staying in and you would have had two large windows, so I can imagine the light from the neon sign was a great inconvenience.  All of our rooms do have a set of black out drapes which are located right behind the sheer curtains. The large green curtains that you spoke of are purely ornamental. The black out drapes are 100% effective in screening the light and also help with noise.  I hope that you will consider staying with us again and that you will enjoy the night's sleep that so many of our guests rave about.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in Anaheim...again!
Summary: The fact that we returned to the Ayres for another stay should be very telling!  We had another excellent stay for two nights surrounding a trip to Disney with the kids.  The room was spacious and included a small fridge which was great for storing milk for the kids or snacks to take to Disney.  This is a small boutique hotel, with a lot of personality and individual service that sets it apart from the large chains.  Th rooms were both internally (we didn't hear anything from other rooms or from the hallway) and externally (we also didn't hear anything from the street and our room faced the highway) quiet.  Parking was not a problem, there is lots of space.  The breakfast is one of my favourite parts.  Jose is still the chef, and depening on the day, he makes pancakes or french

Summary Heading: 5 star for best value around Disneyland
Summary: We got a spring price discount of 30% for 3 consecutive nights which brought the price to around $118 per night.  What a deal at that price.  I couldn't get that price online or when I call the generic booking center.  You have call the hotel and speak to the personally which I think is ridiculous.  Even then the woman quoted me 25% for 3 nights and I had to correct her.  The hotel is English countryside manor and has a older, traditional feel to it.  The rooms are spacious and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. It seem smaller than a queen but I'm sure it really was a queen.  The room did not smell of cigarettes at all.  If you've visited Disneyland over the years I know you've all experienced rooms advertized as non-smoking which reak of the stench.  This one

We stayed here while visiting relatives in Orange.  The desk staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was spacious and well appointed with a comfortable bed.  We had an upper room on the street side. Even tho there is construction across the street the noise was minimal. Parking was not an issue, even on the nite of an event at the Honda Center across Katella and the hotel was full.

We loved the Ayres Hotel. It was so clean and nice. The full breakfast was so delicious. The people at the front desk were all so nice. The location was great. It was wonderful. I will definitely stay there again. It was close to restaurants that delivered and had great food. There was a city bus that came right on the parking lot and had many places it would drop you off and you could ride all day for $5.00 roundtrip.

Summary Heading: Very nice place to stay. Great location!
Summary: I stayed here for business but would definitely go back for pleasure. The rooms are spacious, the bed was very comfortable, and the rooms are exceptionally clean.  I usually always stumble upon something in a hotel I find dirty but not in this hotel. The breakfast has many cooked and fast choices, healthy and comforting.  The happy hour each week day is also very nice, perfect way to wind down after a long business day or day out.  The hotel is right off thee freeway and in close proximity to many Orange County attractions.  I hope to be back soon!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for all occasion
Summary: Awesome staff. Alesandra and Linda really made my experience. I've stayed at quite a few hotels on business and this is the best experience I've had. I totally came unprepared on this trip and even dropped my cell phone in the bathtub. The staff helped me get everything sorted out. I can't speak for the other Ayres properties but the Anaheim property is definitely top notch. The free breakfast in the morning was excellent! Thanks Guys!

We drove into Anaheim to see a Ducks game.  We didn't want to drive home afterward, so we went on a hunt for a place close to the Honda center.  Ayres popped right up and boy am I glad we stayed here.  It's literally across the street from the arena.  Talk about convenient.  Our welcome at check-in was warm and genuine.  We felt at home right away.  The entire property has a distinctly non-chain feel to it which is a real treat.  It has photos of early times in the L.A. area which are fun to check out.  The room was clean and quiet.  There's a short wall separating the bed from the sofa area that let me stay up without bothering my wife with the light.  Great shower - plenty of pressure and hot water despite a late wake-up.  Just can't say enough good things.  Absolutely will be

This hotel is in a great location if you are going to the Angel's Stadium. You can walk right over to stadium in 5 minutes. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice. The hotel decor is good and the staff is friendly. This is one of the best places for the price to stay around the stadium. I highly recommend this hotel.

This hotel is very nice. Warm, welcoming, clean but the best part is the staff. Everyone we encountered were smiling and friendly. It seems like they really like what they do. They should beacause they are good at it! Will definatly stay again! Perfect location for a Ducks game!!

I have visited the Ayres in Anaheim twice for extended stays during business trips. The staff is always helpful, the rooms are large and the facility overall is kept in very good shape. While I was there on business, if you are in Anaheim for fun, Disneyland is right down the street and the shuttle is always ready to give you a ride on weekdays. The Honda Center is directly across the street and Angel's stadium is 2 blocks away. If you are a runner, the Santa Anna river is a block away with a paved trail that goes on for miles.  What really has impressed me however is the free continental breakfast. I have travelled a bit over the years on business and the Ayres breakfast is by far the best I have encountered. Besides the usual Danish, cereals, breads and fruit, the staff offers

From the time we walked in to the time we left my fiance and I were treated perfectly by all the staff. You could actually tell you were more to them than just another costumer. The transportation to Disney through ART was reliable and affordable. The cookies served during happy hour were absolutely delicious! The breakfast was of very good quality and the chef was very friendly. I want to thank all of the staff for making our trip so wonderful and delightful. If I'm ever in the Anaheim area again, this is where I will stay!

We stayed here for  week while visiting the usual family destinations in So Cal.  Room was certainly nice.  Bathroom a little plain compared to the rest of the room and hotel  Almost like having a 2* bathroom in a 3.5* room.  Otherwise, very nice room.    Beds and linens good, fridge and microwave handy items, free interest really appreciated.  The breakfast each morning was good and served by friendly staff.  Each morning the hot portion of the meal would change.  Typically with respect to the meat (bacon and sausage) options.  Coffee was actually pretty good too!  And, I'm fairly picky about my coffee.  Pool and hot tub was nice, and clean.  We saw them drain and clean the hot tub during our visit in fact.  Seem to take a day or two for the hot tub to really warm back up after

My wife and I have stayed at this hotel many times over the years and have always had great times. This time though we got room 201. Horrible! It's on the corner and all you hear are cars the entire time. Stopping and going constantly. No peace and quite. What a waste of $160! If you ever stay here get a room away from the street.
Manager Response: Dear Bluebat1428,  Thank you for posting your review. I am sorry that you did not have a pleasant night's rest. While we very rarely receive noise complaints, if they were to happen it would be on that corner and during this time of year. The cooler weather means that the air-conditioners are not on and they serve to provide an effective noise blanket through all the white noise they generate. Concert nights certainly exacerbate the noise from the traffic.   I have been in contact privately and look forward to hearing from you.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Awesome location right off the highway. My family and I really enjoyed this place. It was clean and the staff was nice. Our room was clean and the bed was super comfortable. The hotel is located across the street from the Honda Center and about 5 minutes to Disneyland. The hotel theme has a European boutique feel which felt warm and inviting. We will be coming back to this hotel in the future.

This hotel was just perfect for my recent trip to see the Ducks play at the Honda Center.  In fact, that is the prime reason I chose the Ayres Hotel...because it is directly across the street from the entrance to the Honda Center.  You couldn't ask for a better location, but on a side note, I would not choose this hotel if I had intentions to spend most of my time at Disneyland.  I know they have a shuttle that is free and convenient to Disney, but the hotel feels very far removed from the hustle and bustle of Disneyland.  I'm sure for some people, being away from the action is preferred, but I prefer a location nearer the action of Disney.  There are a few positives and negatives with this hotel, so I will be brief in my summary. Positive: Comfy beds, clean, boutique feel,

I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in Orange. The staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel maintains their particular image as evidenced by their decor both in the rooms and in the main building. By this I refer for example to the small elevators, furnishings, light fixtures - felt early 20th century. Charming and consistent. The upgrades are a huge plus. Solid wifi signal in most places, nice cable signal and picture quality, good water pressure in the shower, and sink, low flow toilet and CFL light usage. coffee maker worked great, lots of storage spaces.  The only downsides I might mention are the dim lighting in the room, the fairly thin walls and doors (one can hear most anything in the hallway and usage of bathrooms in adjacent rooms.

Wonderful hotel, had a boutique feel which was nice. Reception was very helpful and changed money for us so we could use their washing facility which were very good. Room was nice and clean with a VERY comfy bed. Couldn't work out the curtains as we only could pull the netting across not the full curtain. Breakfast was aeusome with the food being coked freshly in front of you and had a great selection, we had the pancakes which were tasty.

Found this hotel thru Expedia and booked as it was on the Disney trolley route. Was pleasantly surprised to find the trolley stops at the reception door! Convenient that the hotel also sells passes for the trolley.  The hotel and staff were terrific! Beds were very comfy and breakfast was tasty. The wee shop at the hotel was also handy.  The restaurant located behind the hotel was also excellent. 8 of us stayed here 2 nights and had a great time. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting value for money.

We stayed here over 1 week for our Disney trip.....very affordable with the most comfortable beds!  The breakfast buffet was hot and delicious every morning!  The whole staff was very courteous and helpful!  Would recommend!!!!!

We usually stay at the Portofino when visiting Disneyland, but I wanted something a little more upscale.  We found the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim through Tripadvisor.
