It's a nice hotel with a European feel.  It also doesn't seem like a chain hotel; it has a boutique hotel vibe to it.  The free breakfast was pretty nice; my family was impressed that some of the food was being cooked right in front of them.  The room we stayed in had 2 full sized beds and I do wish we could have had Queens, but other than that, I really liked the hotel and it will probably be our Disneyland hotel from now on.

I read all the Trip Advisor Reviews, which I really appreciate! My first impression was the reservation phone system via the toll free number and the (714) telephone number. The customer services representatives couldn't hear me. It made me very discouraged after 5 attempts over the phone to make a reservation. Finally was able to talk to a helpful reservation agent. Then I went on the website..they offer a discount for Disneyland Annual Passholders! Called again, two more attempts, finally got a hold of someone, he couldnt' offer me the discount over the phone. canceled my first reservation, went online for the Annual Passholder discount. My frustration with the phone systerm was worth the $30 I saved. The bed was very comfortable. The freeway noise wasn't too bad. For a free

Stay here if you are looking for a good place to stay close to Disney, also close by to the Angels Stadium and right in front of the Honda Center,. Free breakfast is pretty basic but it does the trick

Summary Heading: Ayres Hotel - Thank you for making our Disneyland trip so fantastic
Summary: We booked the Ayres Hotel after lengthy research for our week holiday in LA on the way back from Europe with our two boys before heading home to NZ.  The Ayres was highly rated on Trip Advisor so we took the plunge and booked on line rather than booking the hotel closer to Disneyland complex that our travel agent recommended. Our first impressions on arrival, after a long 12 hour flight from London, were feeling right at home.  We arrived at happy hour and there were drinks and freshly baked cookies for the kids in the reception.  Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean, very comfortable, and serviced to perfection everyday.  We just loved breakfast every morning, great variety - pancakes a hit with our kids! After a long hot day out at Disneyland, the pool was very welcoming.

Summary Heading: If going to sport event, you MUST stay here.
Summary: We just spent a weekend here, and was truly impressed. We were in town for the Supercross at Angel Stadium, and this is THE hotel to stay at.  The front desk girls were amazing. So friendly, and gave me lots of driving intructions. The rooms were great, and the breakfasts were some of the best meals on our entire trip to California! But the thing that really stood out was the location for our event.  We stayed untill the very end of the race. The place was packed. I swear, we were already back in our room (walking) by the time most of the cars had even left the parking lot !! You couldnt pick a better location, and I think the hockey arena is even closer !!  My wife is super picky, and she loved staying here.

When we arrived, we were kindly greeted by the front desk reception. They were very clear at answering questions. We spend 4 days 3 nights there and will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland. The reason why I picked this hotel was  a) AMAZING breakfast (sausage is amazing) b) house-keeper does an amazing job, c) love how the sink and the toliet are not connected (toliet, bathtub/shower in one room, sink right outside of the washroom) therefore, very practical and time consuming when we were getting ready in the morning,  d) I would much rather take the ART (Shuttle to Disneyland) than walk and live at a worn out hotel/motel/inn. I am very picky therefore before choosing this hotel, I compared literally almost all the hotel around Disneyland and outside

Summary Heading: A great place but just a tad far from the action of Disney
Summary: My family and I spent 7 nights at this property. The rooms are well appointed with up-scale furnishings and are spotless . In fact, they have won numerous housekeeping awards which are displayed at the front desk. The breakfast which is included is awesome; bacon, sausages, fried potatoes or hashbrowns, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, and anything else you could possibly want. Four nights a week there is beer and wine, cookies or taco chips available in the lobby between 5:30 and 6:30. This was a nice treat after a long day at the park or a welcome appetizer before an evening dinner. I can't say enough about the staff; they treated us like we were the only ones at the hotel,very helpful and extremely friendly. The only downside was the location. If you do

Summary Heading: A great find away from Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here a few years ago based on trip advisor. It was great then, and this time it was great again. We had two rooms during Christmas week.The place was always clean, warm, friendly and comfortable.  The hot breakfast was excellent. No paper plates and plastic utensils here. The General Manager even helps cook and serve food when they get busy!!!! Actually, the Assistant General Manager and all of there counter personnel are well above average.  The location with the sports bar next door and the Honda Center & Angels Stadium nearby,are more reasons to give Ayres a try.

We stayed here on the last leg of a tour of california and it was a great place to end a great holiday. The location is easy to find , its very near a bust road so can be noisy but the glazing stops most of it when closed.  The hotel itself is luxuriuos and the staff were beyond helpful would love to stay again if we get the chance

Hotel is not new but well-maintained and clean.  Rooms have pillow-top soft mattress and soft pillows, a bar sink, small refrigerator, microwave and a flat screen TV with major cable channels.  Room is made up every day.   Fresh towels or linens are available daily.  Sound proofing is ok.  You will hear kids jumping in the room above, people walking in the hallway, showers running in the next room.   However, the other patrons seem to tone these activities down when it is later at night.    Breakfast is good with fresh scrambled eggs and other items that are rotated daily like bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast.  Besides the hot items, there is also cereal, pastries, bread, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee.   Breakfast is served in a spacious room with plenty of tables and

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel Near The Honda Center & Angels Stadium
Summary: Stayed here from Dec 24 to Dec 31  $90 per night It's about 3 miles away from Disneyland.  Booked about 60 days before date needed. Sold out 30 days before date. Room was nice with great king beds. Every Monday, and Thursday around 5pm free beer and salsa and chips. Fresh scrabble eggs, sausage, bacon hash browns and many other goodies for breakfast.  Must say one of the best free breakfast of any hotel.  Front desk went out of there way to help my questions and room location. Great family hotel. Bus Art stops right in front to pickup passengers to Disney Land.  $4 per day any amount back and forth. Much faster than driving yourself and parking for $15 per day.

Shannon greeted us at check-in - first impression was outstanding based on her disposition and friendly disposition. The hotel was very well appointed and rooms quiet and clean - the beds and linens were above excellent. Rooms were cleaned daily as were the towels - room was vacuumed and wiped down every day as well - very good maid service. Complimentary breakfasts provided lots of variety and the quality was good. Best time to eat was early due to the fill rate at the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised with the shuttle service between the hotel and Disneyland - pick up was prompt at the hotel at 15 minutes after the hour and pick-up at Disneyland on the hour - only a 10 minute ride each way. Very pleased with this service in spite of some reviews that I had read prior to

We stayed here for eight nights and have really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is family friendly, quiet and welcoming. The staff at the reception are friendly and very friendly. Will definitely stay here again.

Selected this hotel based on TA reviews so, first of all, thank you TripAdvisor!    My family and I were there to celebrate birthdays with a trip to Disneyland. While the hotel is a little ways away from D-land, we had a car and there is also a convenient trolly option so I wasn't worried about location as much as comfort and space.  We had a beautiful double room suite that made our stay extremely comfortable and relaxing.    The front desk staff was welcoming and professional.  The lobby and rooms were nicely decorated and in good repair - very clean and quiet.  Housekeeping staff very kind and helpful as well.    There were newspapers in the lobby, cookies in the evening and decent breakfast in the am - food options seem to focus on feeding hungry families 'tanking up' for a

I really struggled with choosing a hotel for our 4 night stay in Anaheim in November, did a ton of research, and used the advice of other TripAdvisor travelers and am SO pleased that we stayed at the Ayres. It was a really great choice.  Clean rooms, nicely decorated, well kept. Bed was comfy with nice pillows and sheets, spacious room with a fold out couch and king bed and the towels were pretty decent, too. The staff were tremendous. Can't say enough about how nice they are.  The hotel breakfast is a real treat, too. Offerings of hot and cold food (eggs, bacon or sausage, hash browns, pancakes, along with cereal, fruit, muffins, toast, bagels, juice and coffee). Really great selection and the coffee was tasty.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to families or couples or

Summary Heading: One of the most pleasant places to stay!
Summary: We selected this hotel by random when planning our first vacation after our daughter (first child) was born 7 months ago. I consider myself a 'vacation-ista ' & was a little nervous about our first one since the new arrival. The Ayres of Orange CA and it's staff were clean, friendly, and accommodating. It was one of the best hotel experiences I have had! The price for the quality couldn't be beat anywhere!!! High marks and lots if reccommendations!  Thanks for making our first family vacation a success.

We stayed four nights while visiting Disneyland. The hotel was nice and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fine. We would stay here again anytime. If you like to sleep in ask for a room away from nearby construction; they start early.

Summary Heading: Very good, clean room, good location
Summary: My partner was staying here on a business trip and I joined her for a long weekend. I was very surprised at the comfort of the hotel. Based on reading previous reviews, I told her to get a room on the opposite side of the hotel from the freeway. There was construction across the street, but not too distracting.  The room seemed very clean. I do feel the need to mention that the entire time I was there I felt itchy, like bugs crawling on me. It happened mainly when I was in the room. I never saw a bug, got bug bites, or a rash. Once I got home, it went away. I hate to blame this on the room, but couldn't attribute it to anything but that... The breakfast spread was impressive, much more than a typical continental breakfast. It was constantly busy though. We ventured to Disneyland

We recently stayed our 2nd time at the Ayres Hotel, and again we loved it. The hotel is clean, the staff are friendly, free breakfast always tastes great and it's really not that far from Disneyland. If we aren't staying at one of the Disney Hotels this is always our first choice. Our recent stay things were a little loud outside, as well as the room above us while we were trying to sleep, but we turned on the fan and we were able to block most of it out.

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient, and close to Disneyland
Summary: The operative word when describing the Ayres is clean. The hotel functions as a business hotel providing a place to conduct small business meetings but also serves as a home away from home for those visiting Disneyland. In my case, it was the later.  My wife, baby, and I were warmly greeted by Alessandra at the front desk who answered our questions and checked us in quickly.  Our room on the fourth floor was super clean and cozy.  And the beds were extremely comfortable.  Each room has a fridge and microwave which came in handy with our restaurant leftovers and milk for the baby bottles.  The Disneyland shuttle known as the A.R.T. swings by the hotel every hour.  Travel time via the shuttle was less than 20 minutes each way.  The shuttle is so convenient that it doesn't make

Summary Heading: Nice Location, Convenient to Disneyland by Car
Summary: This hotel is located about 2 miles (3 km) from Disneyland on Katella.  It is a straight shot up Katella to get to Disneyland.  The room we had was a king suite and it was very clean, spacious and well furnished.  The sofa bed was very comfortable for a sofa bed (no lumps or sags in the mattress, etc.).  The included breakfast was very competent and tasty.  The staff is very attentive and friendly.  I have no reason not to stay here again.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and just across the road from the Honda Center
Summary: This is a lovely hotel with friendly staff who managed to stay friendly even when bombarded with people returning from a show at the Honda Center.  The double queen room was a good size with comfortable beds.  If I am ever in Anaheim again, I would stay here like a shot.

Having researched hotels in the Anaheim area and after reading many reviews we decided to book this hotel for our four night stay in November.  It is two miles from the Disneyland area but we had no intentions of actually visiting Disneyland itself as we were staying in Los Angeles to watch our son play basketball.  Upon checking in and walking into our room we were very impressed as the photos we had seen didnt do it justice.  We chose a room with one King bed as we thought there would be more space in the living room where we could relax at night.  The room had a small dining table in which to sit at and a very comfortable settee on which to watch television.  The bed was super comfortable and we had access to a laundry on our floor.  We were given a room on the third floor on

Summary Heading: This is perfect for a Honda Center event.  Perfect.
Summary: We stayed here for a concert at the Honda Center - it could not have been better.  Room - Very comfortable.  Flat screen TV with HDMI input (we watched movies and surfed the internet on the big TV).  Free Internet.  VERY comfortable beds - pillow top.  Wet bar and refrigerator.  I could not ask for more from a hotel room.  Breakfast - Full American breakfast was included.  On Tuesday we had scrambled eggs, sausage, hash browns and waffles (I think waffles).  On Wednesday we had scrambled eggs, bacon, home fries, and pancakes.  And juice, coffee, milk.  And standard breakfast bakery items like bagels, donuts, muffins.  And cereal too.  Free parking was great.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  It's easy to see why this hotel is #1 in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Perfect after long night @ Honda Center
Summary: I will definitely be staying here again any time that I have a concert or event at the Honda Center.  The hotel is RIGHT across the street from the Honda Center.    While the hotel is not chic like a W hotel, it is just fine--clean and with just enough amenities to make you comfortable.  The staff was friendly and kind.    The decor is....not my style.  The place probably looks like the house of the gaudy relative we all seem to have.  Complete with fake Rembrandts on every inch of wall, "wood" appointments throughout (aka plastic laminate particle board with wood grain painted on it), and other made in China cheap things that desperately try to look more opulent than they really are.  But I don't hate the place for trying to be what it wants to be -- "a European boutique hotel"

We stayed here for a week for our vacation. The front desk staff was friendly and check-in was quick and easy. I had ordered a bottle of champagne when I booked as a special treat and it was waiting for us on ice when we arrived to our room along with glasses and a couple of chocolate truffles.   Our room was large, clean, and tastefully decorated. It included a nice sitting area with a couch, coffee table, smaller table with two chairs, and a bar area with a sink, fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.  The bathroom included a large garden-type bathtub and was sparkling clean.  The included breakfast was excellent.  Besides having a good selection of the typical self-serve items that you usually find at hotels' complimentary breakfasts, there was also a cook on duty every morning

We stayed in the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for two nights in November 2012.  Check in was quick and friendly, and we were up in our room within a couple of minutes of arrival.  The rooms are large, and ours had two queen sized beds.  The fit out is aging but is in good repair, and the rooms are kept very clean.  Rooms had everything you would expect, along with an ironing board and a coffee machine.  Wifi was quick and free, and there was a small fitness room if you are keen.  Breakfast was OK without being remarkable, with a selection of hot and cold dishes along with urns of coffee / tea.  The hot cakes went down well with the kids, while I thought the crispy bacon was worth a second visit.  A negative for the hotel was the construction site next door - the room was literally

This was our first stay at the Ayres Anaheim and was based on the ratings it got on TripAdvisor.  There is a reason this hotel is rated so high.    We stayed for 8 nights and loved every minute of it.  The staff were friendly, the hotel was spotlessly clean and the beds were heavenly. Hands down the best hotel bed we have ever slept in.  We will be back.

I am so glad I went with my gut after reading so many positive reviews. I was not disappointed. I originally booked a king room for 3 nights but within a few hours after checking in, decided to extend our stay. The staff is friendly and accommodating, property is beautifully decorated and maintained, rooms are generous in size (except the compact bathroom), pool and hot tub very clean and the breakfast is excellent. We plan to use the ART shuttle for our journey into Disneyland which conveniently stops at the front door. This hotel far exceeds my expectations for off Disney property accommodations.

This was our first trip to LA and we are glad we chose the Ayres Hotel.  The hotel is very comfortable and only a 15 minute shuttle ride to Disneyland.  We specifically chose this hotel as we did not want to be right across the road and the reviews we read were very complimentary. We have to say that the previous reviewers are very accurate and this is a great hotel.  The complimentary breakfast each morning was a fantastic way to start the day and the chef Jose always greeted you with a smile and made a great breakfast.  Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

This was our first stay in the USA, as part of a 6 week holiday. After the very long flight (14 hrs) this was a welcome sight and although we arrived before check-in we were able to go straight to the room. Room and the rest of the hotel was very clean and well presented. The housekeeping staff did a great job. Having the ART bus at the door made the daily trips to Disney a breeze and we also used the same ART bus from the hotel as a shuttle for other day trips just by changing to other routes at the Disney Park, very convenient and good value for money. We were very pleased to be able to stay away from the park area and the ART makes Ayers a great option. Had a front facing room but did not hear the highway at night. The only disappointment for the 5 day stay was the lack of

What a breath of freash air this hotel was. Pleasently surprised at the lobby. It felt like we had stepped into a classy hotel in England. The room was comfy and well decorated again with an english flair. Even the hallways were well adorned. The view was not great and I am unsure which direction would give a good view. Didn't matter though. It was a fab stay The free breakfast and WiFi made it even more pleasurable We stayed there as we were attending a concert at the Honda Centre If you are going to Disneyland or anywhere in Anaheim.....STAY HERE!!!

We picked this hotel because it was across the street from the Honda Center. For me, it was an added bonus the hotel has a beautiful the interior. We like to sail, so we enjoyed looking at all the pictures of ships on the walls. The front desk was friendly and very welcoming whenever we had a question or needed help. The hotel offer a delicious breakfast. We enjoying the scramble eggs, bacon, potatoes, coffee and fresh fruit. They also offer toast, danishes, cold cereal, juices, yogurt and hot chocolate (I know there are a few other items I'm forgetting).   Our room was spacious and very clean.  Walking into the room it was nice that the room was not ice cold or too warm. FYI: you will need to place you hotel key in a slot on the wall to turn on most of the lights. We are

Decided to stay here for our Disney trip.  The room is spacious compared to Disneyland Resort hotels, with a decent size bathroom, and wet bar with small fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, and sink.  Rooms and public areas were very clean, the beds are very very comfortable!  Housekeeping during stay was minimal, but we witnessed the in-depth cleaning upon checkout.  Free parking, wifi, & breakfast were perks considering many hotels within walking distance of Disney charge a lot for parking.  They had eggs, sausage or bacon, potatoes or hash browns, bagels, toast, donuts, pastries, cereals, yogurt, and fresh fruit for breakfast.  The chef made great potatoes and bacon!  Only very small complaints were that internet was very slow, and tv reception was terrible on certain channels
Manager Response: Dear Bamboo2010,  Thank you for the lovely review. We love to hear such kind comments about housekeeping and our front desk staff. I am so sorry that you had such trouble with the wifi and TV but quite glad you posted your comments. The reason being that we have just completed a massive infrastructure upgrade in our wifi system, which has trasnformed the system. We previously had issues with ipads and iphones in particular but we now have a completely different system. On Tuesday of next week we will be testing our new cable service, and hopefully within one week we will go live complete with the long-awaited Disney channel (and our beloved Lakers).   Thanks again for your feedback. It is feedback like yours that makes the difference in getting the investment for these upgrades.   With warm regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Easy to see why this hotel is ranked #1 in Anaheim.  My partner and I stayed at Ayres for 6 nights in October while we visited LA. The customer service here is amazing and everyone was very helpful. We really enjoyed the complimentary cooked breakfast every morning and the chips, dips and drinks in the evening were great, the best part being the freshly baked cookies!  The king size bed we had was also amazing, hands down the most comfortable bed we had on our entire stay. Easy enough to get to places like Disneyland by jumping on the shuttle and as we had a car, the free parking space was really handy. Most places charge for parking per day! The pool and Spa was nice to relax after a hard day of shopping.  Although Ayres doesn't have its own restaurant the brewery/restaurant

Staff was very friendly when checking us in, and helpful with any questions we may have had (where is the closest Costco?). Morning breakfast was awesome, not your typical cold breakfast. Eggs, sausage, grilled potatoes, pancakes, waffles, bacon, varieties of cereal, fruit, yogurt and on... Filled you up for the full day of walking at Disney. Used the gym every morning, very quiet and nice equipment. Pool was heated and hot tub in the late evening was a great way to relax those tired feet. Could see how this hotel is perfect for events at the Honda centre or ball diamond, within walking distance. Right off the freeway for easy access. To top it all off, the King size bed was so comfortable and we slept fantastically. Would recommend this chain, definitely!

Summary Heading: Stop looking, it's here you want to stay
Summary: This hotel is a real gem. Right across the road from the Honda Centre, a 5 minute easy drive to Disneyland Parks, the friendliest staff I've seen and great rates. The beds are super comfortable, the rooms and amenities are extremely clean, the area is safe and secure and the rates are excellent. I booked through Expedia and even though I got a discounted rate I was still treated like as if I paid the full price, which is more than I can say for a lot of other hotels. I like the fact that their are no porters rushing to grab your bags and a tip, there are luggage trolleys provided.  We stayed here initially for 3 nights before we left for Arizona, and found the place so good that we booked another two nights on our way back to San Fran. On our return we arrived from Vegas at 9 in

A 3-star plus pattern in a good location (2 miles from Disney Parks). The hotel has an elegant ambiance. Helpful staff. I haven‚Äôt seen any bellman to help with the luggage. Room: elegant, large, very comfortable, clean, quiet; coffeemaker with complimentary coffee. Bathroom: ok. Breakfast: ok, but very crowded. There is always a line to get the food due to (I think) the system used: it is not self-service; an employee serves everything you need (similar to schools and army). I recommend this hotel for families with kids. Good stay guaranteed.

I asked for a quiet room on the top floor and my request was honored. My room is on the back side of the hotel. The rooms are very quiet; I heard no noise at all. Rooms are well insulated. I did not hear anything from the adjacent rooms or outside hallway noise.  The room was well laid out. There was a separate area with small sink and counter (wet bar), microwave, and fridge. A table and chairs for sitting; and a separate work desk and chair area. The vanity area with sink and hair-dryer is separate from the bathroom shower/toilet area.  When I checked in, I was not told that I have to put my room key in a slot to keep the power on the room,  However, while I was awaiting to check-in, I heard and saw the other gentleman showing the guest that he was checking in how the system

Summary Heading: Best stay on our whole trip!!
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ayres. Andrew and the other front counter staff ALWAYS greeted us with a hello and a smile. The hotel is well maintained and felt quite exclusive and expensive :) We had an amazing room with a huge bed that was the best sleep out of our21 day USA trip. The breakfast was large variety of hot and continental and the chef took the time to talk to us and noticed his regular guests.  Our favourite thin was the restaurant next door!! Great sports bar and food! We got a great deal online so take advantage of them when they come up. Would definitely stay again.

I booked the Ayres for our trip to Disney Land because the location was good, they were on the shuttle route to Disney and the rate was great. Boy, am I glad I did!! The staff was so nice, very helpful and personable. Since we arrived on a week day we were there for the complimentary happy hour which was really nice because we just spent our whole day on our feet and 2 hours in traffic! We visited the brewery around the corner for dinner. The food was good, setting was very nice and the beer was pretty good. Prices were a bit high but only because I'm used to a more casual brewery. Our room was very spacious, bed was comfy, room was very clean and it was quiet. We really enjoyed the two days we stayed at the Ayres and would definitely stay there again if we visit the area again.

This hotel exceeded expectations.  Convenient location, very nice decor, quiet, stylish room with great bed, and breakfast was included.  The only issue we had was with the desk staff.  We had booked 5 rooms for a business convention and 2 couples were given keys to the same room which was an awkward situation.  They insisted that we had booked only 4 rooms.  We produced the reservation paperwork and the 5th couple was given a different type room at a higher rate.  Once again I had to ask that they honor the reservation rate, which they finally did.  They never did acknowledge their mistake and didn't seem to know what they were doing.  But, all in all we had an enjoyable stay.

2 years ago, I've stayed in this hotel 1 night, with my wife when we were on holiday. This was a really pleasant stay. When I was travelling this area with 2 colleagues, and we needed an hotel, the choice was easily made, we would visit the Ayres.   This hotel isn't the most fancy one, nor does it has the most services, heck, it doesn't even have a bar of restaurant. What they offer you is a friendly environment. Now, that does sound vague or soft, but it works. From the moment you come in the hotel, until you leave, the staff is absolutely great. They are friendly and helpful. And again, they ARE friendly. It's not your typical "5-star but we actually don't care" smile, the staff is friendly by nature, and it shows.   The hotel is clean, the rooms are good (and so are the beds)

My husband and I love staying here when we visit our daughter in Anaheim.  It's close to the Honda Center, A's stadium, Disneyland, etc. and is very welcoming.  The rooms are super quiet and comfortable.  We have even been upgraded on occasion if availability permits.  The breakfast is an added bonus.  On warm days we can sit near the pool or in the large lobby. I also love looking at the old black and white photos on the walls of Old Anaheim. The staff is there to please and we have never had a bad experience.

my husband and I enjoyed our stay here. Great folks at the front desk...helpful, very pleasant and polite!!! Quiet room; (a lot of families were there). Breakfast was eggs, sausage, french toast, bagels, etc...all good.

I just spent three weeks here at the Ayres Anaheim. The staff was great (Marcus,Andrew,Shannon,Mai,Linda,Alessandra) Made my stay extremely comfortable and welcoming.Any question or request was answered and acted upon.   I could not express the enjoyment in my stay   Thanks again everyone...

My husband and I stayed at the Ayres Anaheim after a long day at Disneyland and were delighted with our accommodations.  The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and our room was very large.  The seating area was a nice surprise and offered extra room to really settle in and spread out.  The workout room was small, but had enough equipment to work up a good sweat.  The breakfast was surely a step above the standard continental offerings -- juice, tea, coffee, breads, muffins, cereals, oatmeal, yogurt, freshly cooked bacon, scrambled eggs, hash browns, fruit, and pancakes cooked to order.

Summary Heading: An Ayres Hotel Fan, But Not The Anaheim Location
Summary: I have stayed at a number of Ayres Hotels in Orange County, CA, and while I have enjoyed most of my stays, the Anaheim location is the least desireable.  This was my third time at the Anaheim location, however the first time I have used some of their amenities.  The interior lobby is always kept neat and attractive, as are most of the public areas.  The rooms, however, appear to be aging, evidenced by damaged bath fixtures and cracked floor tiles.  The last room I stayed in had some type of plumbing pipe sticking through the shower wall, with no useful purpose.  I had not yet enjoyed the complimentary breakfast at this location and was disappointed to discover that this location does not offer "cooked to order omelets", as do their other of locations where I have stayed.  The

We too chose the Ayres Anaheim as it was the top rated hotel but it is really just middle of the road in our books.  The hotel is nice with larger than average rooms which are clean & modern and the ammenities are well kept.  The breakfast offered a varied selection of hot & cold items however, it ends at 9am which is a little early for our liking.  They also offer an evening reception during the week which we were not able to take advantage of.  While it is close to Disneyland (about a 6 mins drive to the Toy Story parking lots), there are plenty of same level hotels within walking distance which would save you the $ on parking at the park.  Our only true complaint with the hotel is the plumbing in the bathroom which kept chaning from scalding hot to freezing cold during the
Manager Response: Dear Lisa,  Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel. I appreciate your positive comments about the cleanliness of the rooms and how well kept the property is. I have shared the comments with our housekeeping staff.  I am sorry that you found the breakfast to shut a little early. We do extend our hours during the peak seasons in the knowledge that Disneyland shuts at midnight, but we have much less demand on weekdays during off-season. It is certainly worth review  and I will be checking to see how many people are coming to breakfast between 8.30 and 9.00. Our weekend hours are always 7am until 10am. I am afraid that you were unfortunate with the shower. Within the shower there is a mixer that must have malfunctioned. It happens very rarely and is easy to replace. I am sorry that we did not address this for you. Please believe me that a shower functioning in this way is not an acceptable state of affairs. Please do let me know which room you were in so we can have it addressed right away. I hope you will reconsider returning and that we will have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience in the future.  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Average hotel.  We stayed here for one night and visited Disneyland.  Its just a few miles drive to the park and is right off the expressway, so it was convenient for our trip.  Parking was free and the hotel was quiet.  The decor and rooms could use some renovation, but the bed was newer and comfortable.
Manager Response: Dear db1985,  I was disappointed to read that we had not met your expectations, and that you found the hotel to be just OK. I am glad that you found the bed comfortable. You are right, the beds are very new, as is much of the room, including the desk, the desk chair, the fridge, microwave, phones, dresser, and TV. I am concerned that you felt the room needed renovation and would be curious to know which room it was. We do have an active preventative maintenance program to keep on top of any issues, so we are particularly keen to address any wear and tear that has detrimentally affected a guest stay. I would very much appreciate your response to my private message providing the room number that you stayed in, so that we can address any wear and tear in the room that might have been missed.  Please accept my apologies for your experience and my hope that you will reconsider staying with us again.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Don't know what all the fuss is about!
Summary: We just stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim because it was ranked #1 in Tripadvisor. Seriously?   What a very average hotel! When we checked in we weren't even told that you had to put your room key in a slot to turn on the power in the room so I had to call down to the desk right away. We were never told about the code for the wifi and had to call down again. Went to the hot tub and all the towels were gone, had to go to desk again.  We were woken up at 6:00 am with a wake up call that we did not set. The toilet did not work, had to call down again. The elevators were horribly slow.  The line for food in the morning was atrocious.  My husband asked me why in the world did I book this "dump" and I had to answer that it was ranked #1 on Tripadvisor. This is the first time that I
Manager Response: Dear Mygx470,  I am so very sorry that you had such a very disappointing experience staying at our hotel. I am so sorry that we did not explain the energy saving mechanism. We typically do, so this was definitely the exception and not the rule. I am sorry about the wifi code confusion. At the time you stayed there was no code requirement. I am so sorry that we did not have the towels stocked at the pool. We keep the towels for the pool in the Fitness Center in two racks. I was surprised to find that there were none. However there is a phone if you do need anything while at the pool, that will dial directly to the front desk. I am sorry that you were frustrated by the line in the morning for the hot freshly cooked breakfast. I am afraid that we do have a lot of demand on our breakfast at particular times in the morning.   With regards to your comments and those of your husband related to our position on Tripadvisor, I believe I should explain the nature of the site. We do not place ourselves in this position. This is purely based on our customer's opinions. We receive similar results on the online travel agent websites too. However what I would also point out is that the place on Tripadvisor is not like a star rating. A high popularity rating does not also mean 5 star services and resort amenities. The guests that rate the hotel highly are looking for a comfy bed, a clean, pleasantly decorated room and a hearty breakfast. You were unfortunate in many aspects of your stay, but our level of service and amenities is typically consistent.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Stayed here as part of our Disneyland leg of our LA experience.  Large room, comfortable bed and informative, helpful staff complete the package.  No bar or restaurant but they cater for breakfast which is plentiful and typically 'American'.  Plenty of nearby bars and food outlets including Hooters!  Disneyland only a 15 minute shuttle bus away.

We picked the Ayres Anaheim because it was number one on tripadvisor.  The hotel was clean. The staff were wonderful and helpful. I loved the complimentary breakfast and took my son down every morning we were there. The housekeeping staff did an awesome job. The room was always clean when we came back to it no matter how short or long we were gone.  We had very few sound issues. The only one I can think of was on the weekend we were there a wedding party was staying at the hotel and they were pretty noisy. We were also in town for a wedding, so we understand celebrations can get loud. I think the only reason we heard them was because they were RIGHT next door and screaming. I never heard any noise otherwise from any of the guest rooms above, below, or next to us.  After I

Free wi fi, free excellent breakfast (home fries were soooo good), free parking and rooms with plenty of space and comfy beds with mini fridge and microwave.  We drove to Disney Toy Story lot every day (we had free parking and was less than 10 minutes) and it was awesome.  Will definitely stay here again when we go to Disneyland.  I was worried about Angels traffic but we had no issue.  Room 438 overlooked the pool and had excellent wi fi.

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for four nights and thought it was lovely. Staff were very helpful in providing directions to area attractions and the hot breakfast was a great way to get the day started.

Our stay at The Ayres Hotel Anaheim was based solely on the reports from Trip Advisor and we were not let down.  What a great place, rooms beautiful and spacious staff friendly and caring the whole package was brilliant.  Have to say tha ART buses were terrific to Disneyland and even allowed us extra freedom to shop at the outlets without getting lost.

The Ayers hotel is one of the best in the disney area, it will exceeds all of your expectations, we stayed for 7 nights and enjoyed it.  The breakfast is cooked to order if you want or you can have eggs, potatoes, bacon or sasuage, pancakes, or french toast.  Of course you get all the extras like OJ and toast etc.  The rooms are good size and super clean as well as all of the other areas of the Hotel.  All the employees are great!  they make you feel at home and never once were unpleasant.  Even the maids were smiling and you could tell that managment treats their people right.  The pool is a bit small but adequate, and the jucuzzi was good as well.  We will be back to this hotel in the future.  One small drawback is that you will need a car to go to a resturant other than one

The Ayres Hotel offered a great FREE breakfast, free wifi, micro and fridge with a wet bar and free parking! Clean rooms and friendly staff. We seriously can't wait to stay there again!   Great location for an Angels game and the Honda Center is right there too. I wouldn't stay here if your attention will be spent more down around the Newport Beach or Laguna area.

I checked out yesterday having spent ten nights here with my wife and 2 kids. The staff are friendly and helpful. Very reasonably priced. The Kids loved the pool and spa pool. Early check in and late check out is available. This is one of few hotels that allow you to book this in advance. Very handy for us. We will definitely stay here again.

I absolutely loved this hotel! My favorite of all the ones I have ever stayed at in Anaheim. The beds were heavenly and the rooms were so nice. I felt like I got a steal because it was such a great deal. The only drawback I would say is that it is a couple miles from Disneyland. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and the staff was so friendly.

Summary Heading: A great hotel that does it right
Summary: We just concluded a 4 week trip to the US, and this was the best Hotel we stayed at. The staff was excellent, always smiling and helpful . The room was very comfortable, and the wi-fi worked very well. The breakfast are was excelldent, with a chef on duty to cook fresh pancakes to supplement the many selections available. Seating was ample, and very comfortable. A nice touch was the afternoon Social Hour where they put out beer on ice, 3 kinds of wine, and great chips amd dip. This is only from Monday to Thursday. The ART stops right in front of the Hotel hourly. Passes can be bought at front desk for $4.00Us unlimited daily uses. Allow 20-25 minutes to Front Gate of Disneyland. For Anaheim Angles baseball, its about 2 block away, and for the Honda Center is right across the

My family and I stayed at this hotel for 7 days while attending a conference and visiting friends and family.  This was the first time staying at a hotel in this area and I saw the great reviews online.  We found this hotel to be just another average hotel.   When we arrived from the airport, we were put in a 2nd floor room.  The AC in this room wasn't working and it was blowing out warm air.  I called the front desk and they tried troubleshooting the thermostat over the phone.  They requested I see if the changes we made would cool the room, but it didn't.  After 10 minutes of waiting, and family arriving to welcome us and our new baby to town, I called the front desk again.  They were certainly nice, but said they would check availability of rooms and get back to me.  15

This place gets a 5 out of 5. Excellent full breakfast, super friendly front desk and breakfast chef staff. Very comfortable room, nice amenities, excellent A/C and comfortable bed. Convenient to the 57 and 5 freeways. The pool is also a nice plus!

I thought this might be a GOOD hotel based on the other reviews that I read.  I did not know that it would be a GREAT hotel experience.  Bo at the front desk was terrific! I really appreciate his customer service.  The beds are so comfy that I wanted to take one home!  My family will be back anytime we need to stay in Anaheim! Good job Ayres for hiring quality employees and providing a wonderful oasis is Anaheim!

I was amazed at how clean and well-maintained this hotel was.  The staff was courteous, the breakfast was decent (great for a free hotel breakfast but not quite restaurant quality) and the rooms were large and functional.  The pool was clean and very nice as was the fitness center.  It takes about 10-15 minutes to get to Disneyland depending on traffic. For $100/night, you can't beat it- this will most likely become our go-to Disneyland hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, short distance to Disney
Summary: Good place to stay for family with kids.  Free fresh breakfast, onsite laundry, pool, good-sized room, free internet, free parking are all pluses.  Cost is reasonable for hotel within the vicinity of Disney.  We thought of staying at the hotels within walking distance to Disney but ultimately decided against them.  First of all, they are all really old hotels or motels at best.  Not only do they charge a premium for room charge, they also charge for parking and internet, and almost none offer free breakfast.  We opted to stay a little bit (really, a little bit) further.  We parked at the Disney lots and took the free Disney shuttle to the park.  Works better for our family than walking for half a mile in scorching heat!

We went on previous reviews of this hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel is clean comfortable, quiet, well-equipped and very good value. Andrew, the manager (I asked for his name) was very friendly, welcoming and helpful and the afternoon complimentary happy hour was more than expected. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to fellow travellers.

Following our excellent stay at the Ayre's Anaheim a couple of years ago, we did not even consider anywhere else when booking a seven night stay to round off a trip to Vancouver and Seattle.  No 'resort fees' here - or ridiculous parking charges and internet is free in your room - so you are already onto a winner.  Add to that the complimentry breakfast, wine and nibbles on weekday afternoons and very spacious clean rooms, you get great value for your money.   We were checked in very efficiently by Andrew on our arrival and after settling in to our room, I did not notice any scuffs or marks on walls or stains on carpets (which can be evident in any hotel) and indicated that the housekeeping and maintenance was of a high standard. I also noticed one of the staff checking the

Summary Heading: this was our top-rated hotel, in 3.5 week USA trip
Summary: tripadvisor led us to this hotel, and it was great. Staff very accommodating, aloowing us to check in when we arrived at 10am after all-nighter on a train. And even manager jumped in with suggestions about water parks. Pool/gym good. Room just lovely, although not much of a view, and although we were told fireworks would be visible from room, somehow we missed them! as noted by others, there is not much around- would have to drive everywhere. the shuttle system works well, although not that often, so need to be organised. only issue - breakfast buffet under-staffed, queue got very long, i saw deputy manager jump in to help! we were there at peak holiday time, so am guessing this might be less of an issue at other times.

Summary Heading: Great hospitality, clean accommodations, fantastic breakfast
Summary: We stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for two nights. We are typically loyal to the Marriott chain but based on the TripAdvisor reviews we gave it a try. We were very impressed with the Ayres Anaheim. Upon entering the beautiful lobby we were warmly greeted by front desk staff, offered cookies, and informed that the complimentary happy hour with drinks and snacks would begin shortly. After we went upstairs and checked into our rooms (we had two rooms), one of the rooms had a very strong odor of paint or some kind of adhesive. We went downstairs to inform the front desk and they apologized and immediately provided us with keycards to another similar room. We enjoyed the happy hour and a visit to the pool and hot tub, which were both very clean. Although we were there to visit

The hotel had a fair price and got exactly what i expected, actually the free breakfast was good and it varied the 3 days i was there, parking is free so that is good. the only thing that happened 1 evening is that when i arrived late night and while carrying my asleep daughter to an upper floor my keycard didn't work so i had to go down to the lobby however that is really not what concerned me but the fact that i simply said my card can't open this room "#", the frontdesk clerk reactivated my card right away but no ID or anything to confirmed that i was actually staying in that room # so one can say i could've asked for any room # to be activated and it would've been granted? anyway the hotel was good, we had a handicap room so there was even more extra space and a pretty large

Great hotel, great service, perfect location for attending games at Angels Stadium, heckling out Disneyland, and shipping at the outlets at Orange.  The complimentary hit breakfast is the best. Even better than most cash breakfast places.  Highly recommended.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, not much around it, excellent service
Summary: Firstly, after a very long flight and little sleep the welcome from the Ayers staff was fantastic, and they quickly put us into our room despite being well before check in. The rooms are very good and clean. They are not fancy but this isn't 5 star. Air con, fans, kitchen facilities, TV, pool...all great. It is about 15 mins on the local bus to Disneyland but this is from the hotel to the park and at $4 for an all day ticket it was very good. There is not much around the Ayers by way of restaurants, convenience stores or markets so you will need to cab or drive to most places. We were here for two nights so the bar and grill next door was dinner two nights running, but the food, value and service was good so not problems there. With free parking it is handy for those with a car.

First time writing a review, but after 5 visits in the last 6 years, a review is deserved.  I have taken my growing family here for trips to Disneyland 5 separate times.  Cleanliness is very important to us at hotels and this place is very clean.  They have also gone to a lot of effort to upgrade the facilities over the years, before we would have thought it was even needed.  Rugs were replaced and furniture was upgraded.  The breakfasts are awesome.  No cleaning ladies reheating food.  This place has a chef who will take your order and make you a great breakfast, in addition to a lot of self-serve food as well.  He has been there every year and is very friendly to the guests.  Generally speaking they seem to put a lot of effort into maintaining their #1 rating in Anaheim.  The

I gave this place 5 stars for a comparison of what's available in Anaheim, but it's not a 5 star hotel. We have also stayed a few times at the Double Tree which is a comparable property but we preferred the Ayres. The rooms were cleaner, the hotel is smaller with less people and the hot free breakfast was awesome. The pool area was alright, it was a bit dirty and right off the highway so a little noisy.  Service was pretty good although they tried to charge me a higher rate than quoted but fixed this when I pointed it out. I always print my confirmation and bring it with me for this reason so I make sure I get the quoted rate. The Ayres does not charge you for parking unlike the Double Tree so the value is very good. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom shower

Great location, convenience to parks, awesome complimentary cooked breakfast, hot cookies in the afternoons--room clean, spacious, and great bed! I will stay here again. Front desk staff super friendly.

We booked this hotel for our 2-day trip to Disneyland and were very pleased, normally we stick to larger chain hotels for their predictability but booked this one based on TripAdvisor reviews.  The rooms were clean and nicely furnished (they were clearly targeting an older clientele) and the beds comfortable.  The breakfast was a step above, with freshly made eggs, bacon, potatoes and pancakes both days we were there (plus the usual assorted continental breakfast items). The hotel is probably too far to be walking distance from Disneyland, but we were planning on driving anyway (and free parking at the hotel).

Had stayed years prior and had an exceptional stay so I was completely comfortable booking here again. Was in town for a concert at the Honda Center. The hotel is across the street!!!! Disney is right up the street and Angel Stadium a skip away. Can't wait to be back!

Ayres Hotel is a Victorian styled hotel. We stayed for 2 nights and we had a very pleasant stay. Room was large and clean, service was excellent, great free breakfast and free parking.  We drive to Disney and Knott's Berry Farm. Both were close by, making this an ideal base for south LA and Anaheim attractions. It is also next to the Anaheim Angels baseball stadium, so it would be perfect for watching a game.  There is also a small gym and pool, which were fine for our short stay. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Our stay was absolutely magnificent.  Upon arrival, the person at the front desk was very nice and attentive.  The two queen bed room was very nice.  Very clean and spacious.  The beds were of top quality.  Oh, so soft and plush.  Every morning, we the kids looked forward to the breakfast.  The full service fresh cooked all you can eat breakfast was superb.  It was prevalent that the cook enjoyed what he was doing and was great in comingling with the crowd.  I‚Äôve stayed at other hotel with free breakfast.  Other hotel uses ‚Äúfancy‚Äù catch phases to advertise their continental breakfast.  Any way you phrase it, it‚Äôs still a continental breakfast.  This is a real hot breakfast with pancakes, scrambled eggs, hash brown or potatoes O brien,  sausage or bacon, juices, toast, coffee,

The staffs seem very happy to be here and the services to help me check-in were excellent.  The assistant manager is superb as she quickly solved and assisted with my reservations.  I'll be staying here for 4 nights and we are already happy to be here.  :)

Summary Heading: One of the best places we've stayed in!!
Summary: We were on a family holiday coming from Canada and Australia with 10 people (3 were small children) and stayed at Ayres Anaheim for 7 nights.  We had 3 rooms, a very large 1 bedroom suite, king bed suite and a 2 queen bed room.  They are Great rooms...large, super comfy beds and very clean (and we are very fussy!).  The hot breakfast in the morning is great and the head cook is so friendly and very helpful and wants you to enjoy your breakfast!  It is a perfect place to take in all the attractions of Anaheim and yet far enough away from all the "busyness".  Everyone in our family said they can't wait to come back to this hotel and L.A.!  Our 4-yr. old grandson said after arriving back in Canada, I wish I was still at the hotel!  I have never written a review before on Trip

We stayed here for two nights with the goal of going to an Angels game and Disneyland.  Upon check in we were given the option to pick which floor we would like to stay on.  We picked a corner room on the 4th floor.  The room was very spacious, a king size bed, pullout sofa, and desk.  The hotel could not be closer to Angels Stadium.  We were able to walk to the park in 5 minutes.  Going to Disney was equally easy by utilizing the ART buses.  The hotel was also near multiple great restaurants.  The price of the hotel was competitive and came with a full breakfast.  However, one of the best features was the Happy Hour.  From 5-6 (I believe) they offered a happy hour with complimentary beer and snacks.

This hotel was such a pleasant surprise.  I am very picky about hotels, and I love this one.   Easy to get a parking spot, the room and hotel was clean and everything was in good working order.  The staff was very attentive. The rooms were solid, you do not hear every sound in the next room, and the bathroom and closet are right size.  A working microwave, refrigerator and extra sink in the room are great.     The location was perfect, lots of great places to eat just around the corner and Disneyland is just down the street.  The fireworks at Angel stadium were a little bonus.    We did have a little problem with the air conditioner, but it was taken care of right away.  Everyone is very friendly.    I think it is great for everyone, Thank you trip advisor for letting me know

Stayed here for four days with my two kids the rooms are very clean and spacious . The breakfast was ,the staff was very friendly apart from one receptionist who worked night I think her name was Mai she was very cold , but all in all it's a great place

Just returned from our visit to Anaheim.  What a wonderful hotel.  What a great price!  We had a VERY positive stay at the Ayres Hotel!  The proximity to Disney is good and the ART (the shuttle) is a great way to travel to and from the park - $4 gets you a full day pass-you can ride back and forth all you like for one low price.  The transport is prompt and clean.  Now - the hotel - very spacious rooms, very comfortable and clean.  Nice bathrooms!  Small fridge, sink, microwave.  The breakfast was so much better than I expected.  Lots of fresh, hot options plus a good assortment of breads, rolls, cereals, fruits, yogurt.  Coffee!!!  Very friendly staff.  Nice little happy hour!  Good wine.  We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it as your best choice in Anaheim!

We stayed here two nights in june to go to angels games and disneyland.  Great breakfast and happy hour had beer and wine.  Boutique style hotel and very clean and spacious guest rooms.  Would recommend for family and couples.

Lovely hotel and friendly staff, great location near the stadium.  I would recommend this hotel and the JT Schmid's restaurant/ bar nearby served excellent food and local beers! Also the room was great size and very clean.

We stayed here for free with our stash rewards points. I had never been here before but was happy with the location since it was right down the road from the angels stadium where we were going to see a concert. The staff was helpful, the room was clean and there was breakast prepared in the morning for all who were interested. http://directory-edongkoy.blogspot.com/

Summary Heading: One mix-up, but I will be back.
Summary: We stayed here for a weekend because we were attending some Angels game. We arrived late Friday night, and on check in, we were given the wrong room number to someone's else's room!  That is a rather unacceptable mix up & because of that, we bothered another person at 11 pm. We had to lug all our luggage back to the lobby and get the correct room number. This after a 6 hour drive over to the hotel & two exhausted sisters. This is why I gave the hotel an average rating on service. The staff were friendly and apologetic about it, but disturbing other guests because you gave the wrong room number to someone else late at night, isn't a good thing.   As for the hotel itself, the room we had was exceptionally clean and spacious. Perfect for a weekend getaway. We were able to walk over

We stayed here for free with our stash rewards points. I had never been here before but was happy with the location since it was right down the road from the angels stadium where we were going to see a concert. The staff was helpful, the room was clean and there was breakast prepared in the morning for all who were interested.

Stayed here for three nights in June.  The property was a refreshing change from the normal "chain" hotels.  Loved the decor and the room was extremely comfortable.  Staff was super friendly and very helpful.  Breakfast was the best free breakfast I have ever had.  Beats the usual free continental breakfasts.  Close enough to Disney and other attractions but far away enough to let you get away and let you forget you were on a Disney holiday.  Very close to Angels Stadium where we enjoyed a ball game and we will definitely stay there the next time we come to a Ducks game as the Honda Center is right across the street.

I stay in many hotels and this Ayres impressed me. They were very courteous and when something was not right they made it happen right away. The location is great for not only Disneyland, that is extremely close to them, but central to Knotts Berry Farm, 45 minutes from Universal Studios and 20 minutes from Huntington Beach. The rooms are extremely clean and breakfast is varied and very good. Even with my son's deadly food allergies, we had no issues and were told what to stay away from and what he could eat for beakfast. This is a big bonus when you travel with a child with allergies as severe as his.

Summary Heading: great value for money at ayres
Summary: my boyfriend and i booked here as the room rates were very cheap compared to other hotels and since the reviews were so good we figured we couldnt go wrong. i was a bit apprehensive as the hotel style is old fashioned and definitely not my usual taste.  i was pleasantly surprised by how clean the room was. the housekeeping job do a really great job here.  our room was also massive. bigger than some of the other rooms and it was really nice to have the extra space.  one complaint is that the shower was really tiny. no separate tub which is not a problem for us but may be for families with toddlers or young children.  beds were super comfortable.  as others mentioned the breakfast was really good with fresh hash browns and pancakes or french toast - both were so good! not your

Summary Heading: Great Hotel at a great price
Summary: The Anaheiim Ayers is in a great location and is extremely nice for the price!  The down side is that being relatively close to Disneyland there are frequently lots of kids.  I have stayed at his hotel 6 times and the only times I have found the kid thing problematic is during breakfast--before they leave for the park--by the time they come back they are exhausted.  The breakfast is probably not up to par with some of the other chain hotels but it is definitely more than adequate.  The front desk staff is always very nice!  Definitely my choice hotel when in the area for business or pleasure-

Summary Heading: great place to stay for baseball games
Summary: We stayed here on our way carlsbad.  We are big giants baseball fans the location was perfect.  Upon checking in Andrew informed me how to walk to the game.  The free drinks and snacks were great.  Room was great.

Very nice Hotel. Not far from Disneyland. Hot breakfast was good with very cheerful help ther to serve you. Room was comfortable, althought we were given a handicap room with one bed, instead of two queen beds. Although the reservations were handled through Hotel.com and not the Ayres Hotel, this mistake was not at fault of the Hotel. I will not ever book through Hotel.com for a reservation, because they refused to compensate anything forthis mistake. I would advise to ALWAYS call the hotel in advance before assuming it will be right.

This is our second review of an Ayers Hotel in the Los Angeles area.  The initial report was written with comments for the Ayers Hotel Diamond Bar and was an exceptional experience.  As with all reviews let's first deal with the positives . . . . .  All Hotels deal with people.  People running the hotel and those people staying at the hotel.  Sometimes the attitude of the people running the hotels are determined by those staying there.  It's not beyond the bounds of belief  that the visitors can be demanding, unfair in their expectations as well as downright rude.  You've seen them and so have we.  The attitude of the staff at Ayers Anaheim is exceptional, accommodating, polite and respectful.  Particularly worthy of mention are the front office staff of Dianna, Andrew and Mai.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: We have stayed in many hotels during our 1 month journey through the US, and Ayres in Anaheim would have to top the list in value and service by far.  Marcus and him team will look after your every need. They have a great breakfast , a fantastic hosted wine hour in the afternoon list and the rooms are quite large and very clean.  If you are looking to be away from the crowds of Disney, this is the place for you. Just opposite the Honda center and 2 miles from Disney it is just perfectly located. There is a shuttle that runs every hour to Disney for a small cost as well, removing the need for a car but free parking is also available if needed.  Thanks for the great stay and exceptional service..  Jim & Laura from Aus.

Summary Heading: Wonderful hotel, convenient location, 1 small suggestion
Summary: Stayed 3 nights recently with my family for meetings and to visit Disney.  This is a terrific hotel in a great location.  It is about 2 miles from the Disney parks, but no freeways needed, so no traffic worries.  We could have used the Anaheim resort bus service, but by the time we paid the costs, it would have been about as much as just driving ourself and parking in the Disney garage/lots ($15/day), and by driving, we never had to wait for a shuttle (which proved very convenient).   This is an established, but very well maintained property.  They bill it as a "European Boutique Hotel", and I think it does a nice job with that theming.  You can tell from the moment you arrive that although it is similar in design to many mid-range travelers hotels (like Hampton Inn and Suites,

Summary Heading: Great hotel....except for a bad trainee at the front desk.
Summary: We checked in at this hotel to watch a concert at Honda Center. Great location, the Honda Center is across the street, within walking distance. Rooms are nice & clean. Hot breakfast in the morning was good. The only bad thing is the check-in process....first, when we checked in, they gave us a room that's still dirty. Second, they did give us a new room right away but when my husband & I are in bed, a lady walked in our room & said that the front desk gave her our room. Third, by the time we got settled in, we were locked out of our room because they deactivated all the room keys including ours. We didn't like the fact that they had a trainee at the front desk who didn't  know what she was doing or if it was bad communication between front desk & housekeeping. Otherwise, we will
First off I love the hotel lobby!! The hotel rooms were spacious and very clean!! The hotel had a modern touch about it. No complaints :)

After many hours on trip advisor reading reviews I finally decided to book  the Ayres Hotel for our final 2 weeks in  America & I am so glad I did. My husband & I had a wonderful stay, the staff are friendly, helpful & professional. The rooms are a good size as are the bathrooms, they have a nice little area with a fridge, microwave, sink & cupboard.  The rooms, hallways, lifts, foyer, breakfast room etc were extremely clean, as were the grounds & the exterior of the building. Free carparking, Free Wi-fi ( which unlike other reviews have said worked every time & fast for us). The rooms have ceiling fans which we used instead of the aircon particularly during the night as the aircon gets to cold. Great breakfast, Fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, toast, bagels, 4 different cereals,

We stayed at Ayres for 7 nights, and it was a very comfortable and pleasant place to stay.  The room was clean and comfortable, the staff were pleasant and the breakfast was fantastic!  The only thing that we found let us down was the 'free wifi' which didn't work for most of our stay, and the very noisy airconditioning which kept us awake at night.  However for the price paid this was a small issue.

Summary Heading: This hotel is a gem next to Angels Stadium
Summary: I have enjoyed Ayres hotels before and the Anaheim location was no exception. It is within walking distance of Angels Stadium and across the street from where the Anaheim Ducks play. A bar and grill is next door, so you don't have to leave the area if you're seeing a game or a concert. Personally, I like to get to a place and park the car. Disneyland isn't far from here, but you have to drive. :( The hotel staff got us checked in quickly, and they were very professional.  The free breakfast was so-so quality, however, it saved time so we could get going in the morning. The hotel is easy to reach off the 57 freeway; I recommend coming that way and not off the I-5. If you miss the entrance to the parking lot, you have to drive down and street, make a U-turn and try again from the

Whenever we go to Disneyland parks, we like to take hotel before and after, to saparate the drive to San Diego and enjoy full day at the park. There are several hotels next to the park exit which will charge ~120 for 4p family but quality is fairly low. Ayres on the other hand was topping those hotels at many aspects - very good matresses, nice and new rooms and corridors, (took my younger son for a tour along the corridors pictures, like a museum, not the typical pictures you would find at hotels..) They also give good breakfast whcihc could save a lot if otherwised paid at the parks. Free wifi is important to some of us (my kids come with their gadgets..) and free parking is also valuable, as some hotels charge some $15 per night. The only downside is that we need to drive to

Total was $450 for 3 nights which was not too bad. The breakfast was hearty and the staff were very nice and very knowledgeable. It is about 15 min in an hourly shuttle ($4pp unlimited rides per day) to disneyland so it is pretty close. The shuttle also goes past the baseball park also. Overall it has good proximity to the attractions and is clean and tidy with nice amenities.

I read so many great reviews here on tripadvisor and decided to book this hotel. I'm sure glad I did! All of the fabulous reviews are true! This hotel is amazing! Stayed here the first week of June. Not only is it CLEAN, the breakfast is tasty! Definitely one of the better breakfasts I've had! Breakfasts consists of eggs, bacon or sausage on alternante days, potatoes/hashbrown, yogurt, mini muffins/donuts, toast, bagels. pancakes/french toasts. So much more choices than other hotels. The room was SPOTLESS! The microwave and mini-fridge came in handy! We did have 2 minor issues though- the first was while I was getting ready to go out, one of the housekeepers used her key to come into our room without knocking. She then later closed the door, and then decided to knock. I thought

Love this hotel It was the perfect location for me right across the road of the venue ,no need for driving or take any kind of transport .  Excellent beds !! lovely atmosphere,comfortable and very clean rooms ,attention to details ,good quality complimentary toiletries ,coffee, tea and microwave in room (important to me) Friendly , professional and very attentive staff ,bonus convenience store on site I did appreciate that as the cosy pool with an easy access through work out room Good security I felt safe at the Ayres Hotel all the time . Complimentary breakfast was good ,lot of choices  I would recommend it to anyone.

I would definately stay here again. If you are going to Disneyland...stay here ...off the beaten path and well worth it. (10 mins away)   The rooms are clean and comfortable.  The staff is professional and friendly.  The Breakfast is GREAT.  not your typical continental breakfast.  Lots to choose from.  Across the street from the Honda center so if you are going to a concert...perfect for an overnight stay.  They have a pool and free parking !!!  The bed is extremely comfortable..They have a microwave and fridge and var sink.  Would definately stay here again !!!

My 1st visit to Anaheim and 1st time staying 2 nights at the hotel. A few things to share:  1) location is near Disneyland. Abt 10 mins drive.   2) staff are helpful and friendly. They helped me to call in a doctor as Hubby was very ill.   3) cleanliness are good except for 1 towel spotted hair on it.  4) had a hard time figuring out how to boil water.  5) as Hubby was sick, there is no light food nor plain bread available for room service.   Overall great experience, would stay again.

Again this year we stayed at Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.  One thing I especially noticed this year is the comfort of the bed.  BEST BED EVER!  We have a wonderful high-end mattress at home, but still wake up with minor aches and pains.  NOT at Ayres Hotel!  Even after tromping around Disneyland all day (and the sore feet that go with it), we would wake up pain-free.  I love this bed so much I emailed Marcus Collins, the GM.  The bed is called the Ayres Dream Sleeper II - and it IS a dream.  I also love, love, love the quality of service and cheerfulness of all the employees at Ayres.  Marcus checked us in and was charming and helpful.  The cook in the breakfast room (full breakfast in the morning!!!) always had a happy smile and a "good-morning" for us.  Any time we need to stay in

Summary Heading: The BEST hotel to stay at in Anaheim! Value & Service #1
Summary: The rooms are spotless, comfortable bed. The breakfast is GREAT! When you go for breakfast it is like going to a restaurant! Lots of choice and hot items too. Pancakes are cooked to order and really good. The evening reception is very good too. There are 3 wines to choose from, or beer or juice plus a nice appetizer of nacho chips and dips and warm coolies. The extras make a difference. Staff is warm, friendly and helpful. Parking is free. Go on their website to book as there are often specials! We can't wait to return. We stayed 5 days in April 2012 and were soooo comfortable!

Summary Heading: European style elegance in the heart of Anaheim
Summary: One block from Angles stadium and across the street from the Honda Center and just off the Orange Freeway.   This is a nice, reasonably priced hotel.    Large, comfortable and well appointed rooms, ample parking, close to shopping, and a Disney shuttle.    On one day there was a hoard of noisy kids, but they came and went fast.   Only real complain: the window-mount AC unit is VERY noisy and the thermostat insensitive making it hard to get the right temperature set.

Summary Heading: Hotel right across from Honda Center
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights to attend a pop concert at the Honda Center, which is right across the street. We left our car at the hotel and saved the parking fee at Honda Center. Hotel was sold out during our stay, probably due to the concert.  We had a little hiccup at check in. They sent us to the wrong type of room and we waited for 15 minutes while they tried getting the right room for us.  Room size is above average. Our room had a King bed and a pull out sofa, a desk, plus a small round table which we used for takeout dinners. There's a small kitchenette with fridge, microwave and sink. The room was clean. Beds were comfortable.  Hotel offers free parking, free wifi and free breakfast.  We stayed here only because of its proximity to Honda Center. While we don't have any

Back to the Ayres Hotel in May 2012.  Great value for families traveling to Disneyland.  Yes, it is a bit of a drive away (across from the hockey arena) but well worth the effort.  Very clean, comfortable setting...friendly staff.  Rooms are nicely sized with a microwave, coffee maker, additional sink and refrigerator.  Free parking (one car only) and American breakfast each morning.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but may be too far from D'land
Summary: The hotel is well kept. The staff helpful & knowledgeable.  Room includes b-fast with an evening reception. Spacious rm w/ frig, microwave, tea/coffee & extra sink  Transportation to Disneyland is A.R.T. a 15 minute bus ride. The bus only runs once an hour and services Amtrak station which is with the Angels stadium - so plan accordingly or can get stuck in traffic!

We stayed on a Friday & Saturday night.  All the staff have been very helpful & friendly.  We were able to check in early on the Friday.  The room (King Junior suite) is spacious & clean.  Very comfortable bed.  There is a bar sink, microwave, small coffee maker and bar fridge available for use.  The complimentary wifi works very well.  The included breakfast was a welcome addition.  We wouldn't hesitate to come here again.

Summary Heading: Do Not Rely On Shuttle Transport!
Summary: Our family of 12 stayed at the hotel for a trip to Disneyland. When we booked the rooms the hotel advertised a free shuttle running from the hotel to Disneyland and other attractions every hour. This was one of the main reasons we booked this hotel seeing as there were 12 of us and 5 were under 7 years old. We went to Disneyland for two days and waited a total of 6.5 hours on shuttles that were late or did not show up. If you want fast service to Disneyland and back do not count on this hotel to provide it.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that you had such an awful experience with the shuttle. I would suggest that your experience was unusual and specific to that weekend. It was the first weekend that the ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) had run a different scheduling system, and despite some exhaustive training, the drivers were confused and made several mistakes. That system seems to be working very effectively now and has addressed previous systematic issues with scheduling. In fact I would say that the shuttle is running more efficiently than ever before. I hope you will reconsider returning to stay at our hotel with the reassurance that a recurrence of your experience is highly unlikely.  Best Regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager Ayres Hotel Anaheim

Summary Heading: A true gem! More value for the money.
Summary: The Ayres in Anaheim, CA is truly a hidden gem. Walking distance to the Honda Center and Angels Stadium and a short, short drive to Disneyland. The staff is kind, friendly and helpful. A full breakfast is served each morning. The rooms are more than comfortable with both microwave and refrigerator. The entire hotel is clean and spotless. Workout room is only adequate; pool area is nice. I use this hotel frequently on business. Wireless works great and I also get a more than adequate desk and work space. This is the best value for the money of any hotel I stay!

We had a great stay at this hotel. They allowed us to checkin early as we had travelled from Sydney and were very warm and friendly during our stay. The free breakfast was the best we Have had so far on our trip to California. The beds were heavenly! The laundry was very handy to Use and spotlessly clean like the rest of the hotel.  We were going to use the shuttlebus to Disneyland but found out we would pay only $2.00 more to park our hire car so chose that option.  I think it was easier to have a car to stay at this hotel.
Comfortable and included is a nice breakfast, free wine, beer and snacks in the afternoon and hot chocolate chip cookies in the evening!
This was a nice hotel and very good service and breakfast good to see its in the price. If you are going to disneyland you really want a car though

This hotel was perfect for our 4 days in Disneyland!  The hotel room was clean, the bed was perfect after spending all day on our feet and I was amazed by how quiet the room was.
