The hotel is too far to walk to the park, and I am not sure the ART comes out there, but since there was free parking at the hotel we had no problem just driving to the park every day and paying the $15 to park there.    Since we stayed for over 3 nights, we got a great deal and only had to pay $90 a night, which I thought was an excellent value for the service we received.  They also have continental breakfast and a free happy hour which consists of beer, wine and snacks.  I did not have either, but my husband says it was fine.

The Ayres hotel is beautiful European boutique hotel inside and out.  The lobby area and all of the common areas are well appointed.   The rooms are nicely decorated and good sized.  Everything was very clean.    The location is terrific.  It‚Äôs right across the street from the Honda Center and very close to Angels Stadium and Disneyland.    The staff is outstanding.  They are very friendly and helpful, especially Andrew.  The hotel offers free parking, wi-fi and hot breakfast.    The breakfast buffet was terrific.  Cereal, fruit, pastries, etc., along with several hot items, including hash browns, cooked to order eggs, sausage and pancakes.  The pancakes were some of the best I have ever had.    I don‚Äôt understand the reviewers who said there were no restaurants close by.  JT

This was a great hotel to stay at while we visted Disneyland, the rooms were very clean, beds very comfortable and the rates were reasonable.  Offered a nice breakfast each morning, great for anyone on a budget.  The shuttle to Disneyland picked us up right outside the door of the hotel.  Too bad there was no food places within walking distance.  Next trip to Disneyland I will stay here.

This European boutique hotel was just perfect for our Disneyland 2 Days visit. the rooms are beautiful, the hotel offers free full Yammi Breakfast, Free parking and a very comfortable shuttle to Disneyland [we used it for our first day visit in Disneyland and it took us 15min to get to the entrance, while on the second day we choose to drive by ourselves and park in Disneyland parking and it took us 1.5 hour to get to the entrance!!! traffic to parking area, line for parking , line to tram..]. highly recommended

Summary Heading: The perfect hotel for Anaheim vacation.
Summary: Withing 4 blocks of Disney and on the back side of the parking lot with a short walk to Angel stadium. The hotel was convenient, clean, comfortable, and with ALL that a home away from home has to offer. The breakfast was more than we could have expected for get away day. The staff was top notch and the Ayres Anaheim will be the hotel destination of those in our  area when they head toward Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with free wifi and parking.
Summary: Great hotel, just across the street from Honda center, 5 minute drive from Disneyland. You have free wifi, parking and breakfast, everything is great and personnel go out of their way to help you with anything you need.

We stayed here for a few days on holiday - based on reviews and proximity to Disneyland.  All the front-desk staff were very helpful, including when we needed to extend our stay due to illness.  The room was big and well equipped with coffeemaker, fridge and microwave -  there is a small shop by reception selling drinks, snacks and a limited selection of microwave meals.  The room a/c is a little noisy, but this seems common in American hotels.  The washbasin and hairdryer is located just outside the bath/shower/WC room, which makes it easier for two people to get ready.  JT Schmids is right next door if you want a burger and a beer - however just a couple of blocks away is a cinema complex with several restaurants including the Lazy Dog Cafe, which would get our vote.  We never

Summary Heading: cookies, breakfast, and a short drive to Disney
Summary: This hotel is down the street from the Disneyland area and convention center.  There really is nothing around this hotel except the Angels Stadium.  We had a rental car, so no problem with the drive (and free parking).  It was clean and the service was friendly.  There were delicious cookies waiting for us in room 222!  The room had a sleeping/desk/tv area that was divided from a couch/table/kitchenette area - pretty spacious.  A hot and cold free breakfast was just right to get the day going.  We did see a good price on their website from a link on tripadvisor but they didn't have availability for each of the nights we were staying.  So I called them, and they did have the room available but at a higher rate.  I questioned it and after some back and forth they did honor the

We stayed three nights and found the accommodations very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The breakfast was good but I was expecting a lot more from all the others reviews I had read. Better than the usual but nothing exceptional.

Spacious rooms, hot breakfast, free parking, free internet, courteous staff, and close to Disneyland. I couldn't have asked for more. The rooms are cozy, very clean and nicely docorated. A huge plus was having the extra mirror and sink (family of three). The  microwave and refrigerator came in handy also.  If you're looking for a temporary home away from home, this hotel fits the bill. I highly recommend it!

Summary Heading: Top-notch first stay at the Ayres!
Summary: We had a great stay at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim while we visited Disneyland for three days. The room was rather large and a perfect size for our family of four. Internet access was flawless (something that seems to be a problem with other hotels) and parking was ample.   The room was clean but like with many hotels, the carpet left our socks dirty within a few minutes as most people don't take their shoes off like we do. Corners are a little dirty but that's something that only bugs someone as picky as me. I was very happy that the hotel listened to my instructions and honored my request for a top floor room. The high ceilings gave the impression of a bigger room. We couldn't hear any freeway or street noise. House keeping was very quick to bring up some more blankets and
Excellent hotel and a 5 min drive to Disney. Free parking, free Internet , and free hot breakfast.

Summary Heading: Well appointed rooms, great front desk staff, overall very good
Summary: Stayed here for a second time during March 2012 with large family group. Rooms are large and well appointed. House keeping was a bit hit and miss but otherwise no complaints! The male staff on the front desk in particular were extremelty helpful and very welcoming. Lovely evening reception with drinks and snacks. Wide variety of options at breakfast. Thoroughly enjoyable stay!

This hotel is conviently located on route 15A for Disneyland yet away from the noise of Disneyland. The room was large and very clean. The hotel was full yet so quiet. Free breakfast was great before a full day of disney.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, large rooms, close to Honda Center
Summary: Stayed here on my 3 day trip to California to watch 3 NHL games in 3 nights in 3 different cities. This was the cheapest hotel of the 3 (fairmont San Jose and Luxe City Centre LA) but was not below the other two in any way. The fronk desk staff was extremely helpful. The room was very large and had an extremely comfortable bed. There was also a large sitting room, small kitchenette area, and a fair size washroom. It was a great deal for the $139 I think i paid for the night.   The Honda centre is directly across the street so on game night there was a good crowd in the streets and a fun atmosphere. That said, throughout the day the area surrounding the hotel feels very isolated. All in all a great stay and a great bargain.
Another great Ayres hotel.Great service excellent staff. Rooms are clean and nicely decorated. Breakfast as always very good.

After reading so many rave reviews here I confidently booked a room. I was almost worried my expectations were set too high, but the Ayres Hotel really is as great as everyone says. I'm not sure when it was built, but it still looks brand new - inside and out. If you've read the other reviews then you already know the staff is great and the hot breakfast is delicious. The chef prepares eggs, bacon/sausage, hash browns, and pancakes in front of you. They also have your basic continental breakfast if you're looking for something to grab and go.  The rooms are larger than the average chain hotel (we had a 2 queen room). We liked that the bathroom and separate sink area are behind a partial wall, with the sink vanity lights facing the room entrance. This is really nice if you have

This is our 2nd stay at the Aryes Anaheim Hotel in the last year.  The first time was a pleasure trip to Disneyland, and it worked perfected for us with the included breakfast and free parking.  It is away from the hustle and bustle of the Hotels surrounding Disneyland, but close enough to be less than 10 minutes from the Disney parking lot.    The 2nd stay was a week long for a business trip.  Rooms are cleaned and it seemed our room was away from families and kids which was a nice bonus.  Front desk was more than helpful, and we enjoyed the nightly happy hour.  My wife was without a car, but daily the hotel van took her to the local shopping center and Movie Theater.  Great breakfast, Great service, and a clean room which all add up to a great place to stay.

Even though the decor was a little over the top with Victorian decor for me,  the staff was useful, food was good and rooms were clean, nice place centrally located to Disneyland and baseball field. The food was fresh and the cooking staff was very nice. We are not smokers, and perhaps they should clean out the butts outside. We would most defiantly stay there again.

Summary Heading: The best place to stay in Anaheim!
Summary: The Ayres Anaheim is likely the nicest hotel I have stayed in.  The excellent service meets the highest standards, and the hotel has every amenity needed for a comfortable stay!  My brother and his family stayed at this hotel last year and recommended it to us, and we would highly recommend it to everyone.  The Ayres name is synonymous with quality, and they obviously value their reputation as a unique boutique hotel.  The front desk staff were warm and welcoming.  Before we could even check in, I ran into the hotel with two small children who desperately needed the restroom after a long car trip, and staff at the front desk didn't hesitate to show us very quickly to the restroom in the hotel.  This attitude exemplified the staff's attention to customer's needs and their
Hotel and room were beautiful, bed was very comfortable, breakfast was great, service was very good, highly recommend.

We have stayed here twice now and will do so again.  I arrived a few hours early but was able to get a room within 30 minutes.  The staff is always very friendly.  We went to see the Anaheim Ducks at Honda Center.  The hotel is literally right across the street from the arena.  We went to JT Schmid's brewery for lunch - also literally right across the street - if you are looking for a hockey trip, this is very convenient.  My kids went to Disneyland one day and it is about a 5-10 minute drive down one street to drop off and pick-up.

Very comfortable and clean hotel in the center of Anaheim.  We stayed two nights, spending a day at Disneyland.  Took the convenient shuttle to the park--be sure to reserve a place on it by inquiring at the front desk.  Room was large with free wi-fi connections, and breakfast was very good. The day we visited Disneyland, we got up early, and breakfast was both sumptuous and leisurely.  The next morning, we slept in until about 8:30 and breakfast was very crowded.  Plenty of food, but the hostess had a very busy job organizing tables and directing traffic--this "Stanford Cardinal" thought that the "Cal Bear" did a good job keeping everything moving smoothly.  Lots of families of course, but we just didn't expect so many of them to eat breakfast as late as they did.  While not

We stayed at the Ayers for our honeymoon. Upon arrival, we were greeted and seated in the lobby area - even though we were early, our room was made ready for us within 10 minutes. We were upgraded to the Executive Suite and it was really lovely, beautifully clean and tastefully furnished. Bed was very comfortable.  Food-wise, we had the full buffet breakfast each morning. It was tasty and had an ample range to choose from. The only problem being that the room is quite small and it can get very busy in periods, but nobody seemed to have to wait for long.  The service was really friendly, professional and efficient.  Location is across from the Honda centre, a little way out of the main strip of Anaheim but it is fairly close to everything nonetheless.   We had a really great,

Summary Heading: Staff was terrific, it just wasn't our style
Summary: So I feel a little guilty not giving this hotel a 5 star rating because it is very clear this hotel tries hard and delivers for most people. And that to me is the main thing that makes a hotel a good one.  But in this case, I feel like I need to play devil's advocate a little about the decor and a few other issues.  Decor is a very personal issue but this decor was just very much not my style - very heavy furniture, reproduction of old master paintings, heavy drapery, etc.  That is my fault, I should have looked more at the photos on TA.  But then it had a Febreeze like smell (again, I am sure OK for some, just not my thing) and breakfast, though very tasty, was a mad house.  It was really noisy and it was difficult to find a table.  Jose, the chef out front, was very cool under
Manager Response: Dear Tink1234,  I was disappointed to read that our hotel did not suit your style. We certainly do have a distinctive style and I understand that it may not be for everyone. We do have a rather delicious breakfast, so our guests tend to make every effort to attend. I am sorry that it was not quieter during your stay. Thank you for your kind comments regarding the staff. I am only sorry that you were not here long enough for the hotel to grow on you!  All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Trip dates 2/13-2/17  My husband and I celebrated 20 years of marriage by having a second honeymoon at Disneyland.  The Ayres Anaheim was the choice for us.  I am so glad that we did.  Our stay was amazing.  The staff at this hotel is amazing.  We got there late because we chose to drive down from the bay area in the afternoon to avoid the commute traffic.  The desk staff was great, they were on the ball and had us in our room for our stay quickly.  They put us on the fourth floor, and the room was amazing.  Not only was it beautiful, it was clean.  I was not afraid to go barefoot in our room.  The bed was wonderful, my husband is often up a lot during the night.  He was up only one or two times a night at most.  This says a lot.  We started planning our next trip down during

Take a trip back in time with the interior design of this hotel. Large paintings and portraits of another era scattered throughout, intricately carved Queen Anne style Poster Beds draped with rich and soft bedding and pillows, long elegant sheers and drapes, soft textured walls, high ceilings centered with a golden chandelier of lights with fan, soft velvety wall paper in bathroom entry, hallways with plush soft carpets intertwined with design marble flooring,  elegant yet quaint lobby with beautiful wing back chairs with love seat and fireplace. Should you forget you are not in times of old, there is a coffee maker with teas and coffees, refrigerator, microwave, kitchen sink, flat screen TV, speedy wifi service, iron with board and blow dryer, heater and air conditioning to
Manager Response: Dear Jbeasley8292 -  It was a pleasure welcoming you as our guest. Thank you for taking the time to let fellow travelers know about Ayres Hotel Anaheim and for your kind words. I am pleased to learn that the decor caught your imagination and that your overall experience was such a positive one.   To address your concerns regarding the vending machine, the 3rd floor does have a machine for guest use. However, the majority of our guests purchase snacks and drinks at the snack shop area in the lobby and rarely use the vending machines. The snack shop offers a variety of foods such as soups, frozen meals, savory snacks, candy, ice cream and both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. We have also recently added wine to our selection and are constantly reevaluating what we offer. Suggestions for additions to our snack selection are always welcome as well.  Again, thank you for your review and for choosing the Ayres Hotel Anaheim. We hope to welcome you again very soon.  Safe travels,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My family and I just finished a 4 night stay at the Ayres while we were going to Disneyland.  During our 2000+KM drive to Disneyland, we have stayed at quite a few different hotels, and the Ayres has by far been the best.  We stayed in a twin queen, 3rd floor.  Pros:   -The "Full Breakfast" was in fact, a full breakfast.  Every other hotel "Full" has been achieved by providing freezer biscuits and canned gravy.  Maybe B&Gravy are a wonderful breakfast staple in the US, but I expect Eggs and Bacon.  The Aryes had sausages, scrambled eggs, seasoned cubed hash browns, and pancakes.  The next day was bacon and shredded hash browns were swapped in.  The standards, toast, cereal, muffins, pastries, etc. were available, along with fresh fruit salad, yoghurt, asst. fruit.  We went to a
Manager Response: Dear Richard C,  Thank you so much for providing an informative, well written and glowing review. I am delighted you had such a positive experience.   I have some good news for you on the cons. We will be installing Time Warner Cable in the next month or so, widening our channel selection and this time I will have some control over what is chosen, so there will definitely be some child-friendly channels amongst them. Right now we do have a cartoon channel and HBO Family. As for the Honda Center events, you really never can tell. We have had one UFC fight when we had to deal with an issue, but that was one of 5 UFC events. Some of our best behaved and most charming guests have been on Bon Jovi and Van Halen nights, believe it or not!!! And the worst happenned several years ago when Pat Benatar played! We do have guests sign party policies and we do schedule additional security if we anticipate a problem. This has worked very well in the past.  Thanks again.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We arrived late on Feb. 10 and front desk was helpful and friendly. I requested a room overlooking the pool and we got it. The room was clean and had a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The room included a great hot breakfast and was very good. .We really enjoyed the cookies and wine and chips for the hospitality hour sitting arount the fireplace in the lobby. Really a nice touch. After walking in Disneyland all day we really enjoyed sitting in the spa, perfect temperature. We were close to everything (convention ctr. etc.) and we will definetely stay here or at any other Ayres Hotel in the future. We liked being able to walk accross the side street and eat at the Brewery also!!
Manager Response: Dear Lieb ‚Äì  It was an honor having you as a guest of Ayres Hotel Anaheim. Thank you for your positive review of the hotel service as well as the various accommodations and amenities offered. I am privileged to work with an amazing team and will be sure to pass along your comments. We hope to welcome you again soon.  Safe travels,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My husband and stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim 2/17-2/19/12 for a class reunion.  I read the review and most were good.  We found nothing wrong with this hotel.  it was clean, employees were helpful and friendly.  Breakfast was better than most hotel, pancakes, freshly made eggs, sausage, potatoes, cereal, muffins. All included in the price and free parking too.  We will stay here again next time we are in the area.  There are 20 Ayres Hotels in S. CA
Manager Response: Dear Rae1946 ‚Äì  Thank you very much for your kind review of Ayres Hotel Anaheim. We appreciate you choosing our hotel for your stay and for taking the time to inform fellow travelers about your experience. I am so pleased that you found the service, amenities, and complimentary breakfast to your liking. We look forward to your return.  Warm regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Just got back from a weekend trip to Disneyland. Property was very nice. Rooms were good size, the beds were nice but a bit soft for myself (preference). The room was super clean and smelt like the carpets were freshly cleaned. The Breakfast was one of the best around. Pancakes, eggs, hash browns and Sausage were made fresh. They also had assorted danish and things. 4 different kids of Cereal. Oatmeal packets and large bowl of Yogurt were also seen.  The only "Negative" about the hotel is that people who smoke, the area for them to smoke is located right in the path leading to the front doors.  When walking to the front doors you have to go right though smoking area. I would have like to see a smoking area somewhere other than the front doors. Overall our stay was nice and would

Summary Heading: very clean and comfortable, a great value
Summary: After checking out the prices at surrounding hotels listed on tripadvisor, we chose Ayres. With free parking, internet and breakfast, you couldn't beat the price. AND it is one of the cleanest hotels I've ever stayed in. The artwork throughout the corridors and room were beautiful and the breakfast was delicious. This was a nice, hot breakfast with sausage, pancakes and eggs. Very comfortable bed, friendly front desk.. it deserves to be #1 in Anaheim.
Great beds, comfortable stay.  The rooms are spacious, well appointed and clean.  The hot breakfast was a nice surprise. Very helpful and friendly staff, we extended our stay.

we stayed with a baby and found this hotel great - loved the staff, loved the atmosphere (away from the craziness and nice mix of families and business travellers) and loved the breakfast.  Finishes not to my taste, but much better than the usual 'same same' feel of other hotels.  Highway noise didnt really bother us - the beds are so comfortable that we all slept really well every night.  The pub next door does decent food and is family friendly (wouldnt go there on game night though).  Great location, but would recommend a rental car to make it easy to get around - driving on the 'other' side of the road didnt worry us.  You def cant walk to Disneyland - but to be honest I wouldnt walk there even if I stayed across the road - who wants more walking when you've been on your
Very nice hotel, comfortable beds, clean and tidy, nice bathrooms.  Nothing to complain about.

I recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel on business for four nights.  It's located just across from the Honda Center and next to a brew pub.  For good and bad (noise) reasons, it's also adjacent to the 57 freeway.  Actually, the noise wasn't a problem as long as the windows are closed.  My room was toward the back, just above the pool on the 2nd floor.  It was a fair walk from the elevator, but easy access from the card-keyed back door that opens right into the stairwell.  The hotel is well decorated, with many reproductions of paintings throughout.  Hard to walk down the hallways without some of them catching your eye.  The room was well lit and fairly large...plenty large for one person.  The mattress on the bed was very nice and plush, making for a good sleep.  Shower and sink

We found this hotel to be very convenient for our family. Although it is not adjacent to Disneyland like some other accommodations, the ART shuttle service makes all the difference. It is across the road from the Honda Center, so if you are a hockey fan, this is the place. We found the stafff to be pleasant,helpful and professional. The two Queen bed room suited our family of four quite well. Breakfast was a great start for the day and amenities were adequate. My wife appreciated the laundry facilities which were necessary while on the move for 8 weeks!  Marcus Collins, the General Manager made us feel very welcome and this was appreciated after spending so much time away from home. He is a Boon to the Ayres hotel, but I must Warne you that Marcus may feel the need to compete

This hotel is nice, but if you're looking to stay somewhere close to Disneyland, this isn't it.  They also don't have some of the ammenities that other hotels have.  We forgot to bring hair conditioner, and asked the front desk if they could supply some; but they don't carry it.  On the other hand, the beds were comfortable.

I stayed here with a friend while we were visiting Disneyland. It was nice and comfortable. The breakfasts were a nice start to the day. The only drawback for us was that it is a bit of a drive to Disneyland. Not horribly far, but there are many hotels that are closer.

Summary Heading: Only place to stay for hockey/baseball games!
Summary: The hotel itself is very nice. Tastefully decorated and kept very clean. We also found the staff to be quite friendly. Perhaps the most remarkable thing about this Hotel is its location. I didn't even realize how close this hotel was to the Honda Centre and Angels Field. My wife and I attended the super cross race at the field while we were there and we were delighted to find out that we were in easy walking distance to the event. Stadium parking was actually full so people parking at the honda centre had a longer distance to walk than us. Highly recommended for any event-goer in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Thank you for Our Family Memories
Summary: Last month our family had the pleasure to stay at the Ayres Hotel.  My sister and I undertook an ambitious endeavor to share a Disneyland adventure with our nearly 90 yr old mother and her 3 twenty-something grandsons.  My sister and I grew-up near Disneyland; however, we moved to Northern CA and my mother had not been back for 25+ years (unfortunately, my father has been deceasd tens years).  The Ayres Hotel helped to make our family trip a success!  We contacted the General Manager, Marcus Collins.  He helped to arrange the right combination of rooms; we had both privacy and space to gather as a family.  The staff was very helpful.  We were able to purchase ART passess and Disneyland passes directly at the hotel.  In addition, they accomodated the delivery & pick-up of a

A lovely hotel for our Disneyland stay.  Sumptious breakfast buffet....plenty of seating and thoughtful spacing out of food counters so no long lines.  Disneyland shuttle inexpensive and perfect, running hourly.  Wine/beer, chips and salsa/guac in addition to cookies and milk nightly in the welcoming lounge w fireplace and lots of comfy couches in private clusters.  And we appreciated our request for feather free bedding.  The night mgr brought it up himself, pillows and comforter.  What's not to like about this place???

Summary Heading: A Great Stay and Eager to Return
Summary: My family stayed here for 4 nights when we went to Disneyland.  This place is a gem.  It is conveniently located and easy to find.  But, the best part about this hotel is the hotel.  This hotel knows how to treat its guests.   The staff are super friendly and courteous and want to make you happy.  Also, there is no BS in this place like other hotels with expensive in-room wine bars, business office with ridiculous fees, and expensive hotel breakfast.   There is clean room with couch, comfortable bed, microwave and an empty refrigerator.   I hate those hotels with refrigerator full of their junk and no space for ME!  Also, the breakfast they provide is simply fabulous.  Plus, there is a free computer with free internet access and a printer.   And, if you happen to be at the

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best place to stay in Anaheim.
Summary: My husband and I went to Disneyland to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. We were on a budget so I went on Hotels Tonight and this was one of the hotels to stay at and after reading the reviews ( they are ranked #1 in Anaheim) I made the smart decision to stay here. As soon as we walked in we were welcomed by Dee who checked us in and told us about all the amenities, the shuttle to Disney and the managers reception and hot breakfast in the morning. No question was too annoying for her. When we got to our room it was beautiful and the bed was so comfortable that I could have laid in it all day! When we went down for the managers reception we had the great pleasure of meeting the GM, Marcus who was genuinely happy to meet us and super friendly to everybody. He suggested place to

As we were driving in from Vegas, we were worried about finding the place but we found it quite easily. Credit perhaps to the GPS :)  The staff were excellent when we arrived, friendly and helpful and most of all, genuine.  The decor, apparently, is European boutique. I've travelled Europe quite intensively and never come across anything as... extravagant... as this! Don't get me wrong, nothing offensive or anything to put me off coming again but it's just not my taste :)  The rooms, as US rooms tend to be, was large and spacious with a great bed, shower and tv. The only problem we had was the wi-fi wouldn't work in our room and was very slow even in reception/breakfast area. Not an issue for us but perhaps people on business could find it an inconvenience.   The location for us

Summary Heading: Our new home for Disneyland trips!
Summary: Stayed at Ayres Anaheim without knowing about them that much, other than assume that it may be as nice as the Ayres at Long Beach where my sister and bro-in-law had their wedding reception a few months back.  So now I am on the Ayres email-list for promotions.   I originally wanted to stay at Embassy suites Garden Grove for this year‚Äôs Disneyland trip (which was where we stayed last year), but the price for the dates I wanted were unreasonable, in my opinion.  So with the promos at Ayes Anaheim, we thought we would try it, hoping that the facilities and experience would be as nice as what we had at Long Beach for the wedding.  Facilities.  We were not disappointed.  My husband and I agreed that we should consider this place before anything else for Disneyland excursions.  1) Not

Summary Heading: Sleep well and eat a full breakfast
Summary: We stayed for 8 nights during the Christmas holidays in the top 4th floor room facing the parking lot and pool and had a pleasant stay.  Service was very good at the front desk.  Although it was located near the 57 freeway, the room and bathroom was clean, quiet and we slept soundly.  I am not sure what kind of mattress was used but the bed with all it's trimmings (white duvet covers and pillows) just hugged you with warmth and softness.   I like the features of the room - ceiling fan, high ceilings, room darkening curtains, small fridge-microwave-bar sink, desk table near the window, coffee table with 2 chairs, and the vent fan in the bathroom.  I also liked the European furnishings in the lobby and elevator halls.  The breakfast was a plus and what distinguishes this hotel

Summary Heading: Stayed at the Ayres in Anaheim in October 2011
Summary: Excellent service and extremly clean.  Also, this hotel was quiet.  The breakfast and cookies were a nice treat each day.  Will go back.

Summary Heading: Outstanding service, value and one very comfortable bed.
Summary: A delightful hotel located directly across from the Pond. Comfortable, spacious rooms and a pleasant, welcoming staff.

A party of 8 of us stayed at Ayres Anaheim December 20-27. It was a wonderful experience. Helpful, friendly staff. Great breakfasts. Excellent value for the money. If we make it to California again will definitely use one of the Ayres hotels

Summary Heading: Perfect place, we keep on coming here again and again!
Summary: Stayed at this Ayres hotel while on business trip, while taking kids to Disneyland, and when came to a concert at Honda Center.   Been its loyal customer for over 5 years. Clean, perfect location, offer complimentary hot breakfast.

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland and California Adventure. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The beds were possibly the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The complimentary breakfast included pancakes, eggs, hash browns, sausage, great pastries, etc. The location is several miles from Disneyland and bus service is provided by Anaheim Transit. Bus service is only once an hour so this is a bit inconvenient but for Angel games or events at the Honda Center the Ayres would be perfect.

Summary Heading: One of the best in Anaheim
Summary: Another great stay at a very good hotel.  Great staff and lovely room. Many thanks.  Marcus (Manager) has a sweet tooth for Galaxy bars for those that come from the UK :)

It was a clean hotel and as we already knew a little away from disneyland. The free breakfast buffet was good except that the restaurant did not have any space to walk around and was very cramped and the line for hot food got way too long. We just missed the room service part and the fridge was not working that well too. But other than that it was a clean budget hotel.

The hotel itself is a little dated but is brilliant value and rooms are well appointed. Marcus the GM makes this place special, he was brilliant helping us organize things even before our arrival. If your going to disneyland and want to stay somewhere nice and not blow the budget you cannot go past Ayres hotel.

Summary Heading: Hotel was very clean. Location is okay if you have a car.
Summary: Customer service was great. Hotel was very clean. The only problem we found was there was nothing around us. We walked about 10 minutes to the restaurants. Which wouldn't have been a problem if we had a car. There aren't any stores near them. So I had to walk 5 minutes to get to a gas station. This hotel would have been perfect if we had a car.

Stayed here for few days Dec 2011.  Staff was amazing.  Very friendly.  Our sink was not draining and maintenance was to fix it within 5 minutes of my call.  Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable.   Very convenient if you have a car.  We had our car but it is not near Disney so you would have to take shuttle, bus or taxi to Disneyland.  5 minutes by car was fine for us.  About 5 miles to walk  it.   After walking all day at Disney it would be too much.  However, the hotel was great and the staff was wonderful.  So friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: It really is as good as everyone says
Summary: Let me start by saying I am very particular about hotels. That said, I thoroughly researched where to stay in Anaheim and after reading all the consistent positive reviews booked 7 nights at the Ayres. The room was very comfortable for our family of three. The beds are wonderful and the microwave and small fridge were convenient. The breakfast every morning was fine and helped save some money. We also liked the free wifi and parking. The staff are very friendly and helpful too.

We stayed at the Ayers Hotel for 3 nights. The staff was very helpful and very friendly. They called us by name whenever we came through the lobby! The rooms were large, very nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. We didn't use the pool at all because the weather was too cold while we were there. The only issue we had was that it was too far away from Disneyland. We had a car though so we just drove there instead of using the Disney transportation but it was a 5 - 10 minute drive so I can't imagine walking to Disney or worse yet, walking back at the end of the day when you're tired.

Summary Heading: What a great place to stay!
Summary: I recently stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim and thought it was great.  We went for Disney but did an assorment of things.  I did my research before I left and this hotel had the best reviews and I'm glad we went with this place.  The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable, with many amenities, including free breakfast, free parking, and a kitchenette. I travelled to and from LA.  Disneyland isn't that far from the hotel as others had suggested, especially since there was a bus that left every hour and returned you back to the hotel.  I had heard a lot of negativity about this shuttle service.  I thought it was great and they were always there the times that the wonderful hotel staff told us.  You purchase a bus ticket and away you go.  The front desk staff were

I selected the hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, as well as my planned drive to LA and San Diego (almost centrally located between the two cities). The room is comfortable, with great amenities like free WiFi and cabled connection and kitchenette. The only thing I wished they have is a room safe, but it's not a big deal. All staff at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. They really make you feel at home, and they are genuine at it. Kudos to all of them, from front desk to the breakfast room staff.  The other great thing is the free and ample parking at the hotel, and it's situated near several amenities like gas stations (ARCO and SHELL), restaurants like Denny's, Panda Express etc. Just take a 5 minutes drive and you are there.  All in all, I enjoyed my stay

Summary Heading: Good value - free parking, breakfast, family friendly
Summary: No frills here but it's perfect, clean, and comfortable for our family of 4. We spent a Fri and Sat night for a total of $240 with our Triple AAA discount. (This would be the same cost for a one night's stay at a hotel like Sheraton, Hilton, Crowne Plaza.)  We've done these other hotels but this one is just fine for us. Free made to order breakfast, parking, and WiFi. Yes, you have to drive to Dland (parking is $15) but not that big a deal. Queen/double beds were super comfortable. This is the 2nd time that we stayed here.

We stayed at this hotel on a short trip to Disneyland and paid 1/3 of the cost we have previously paid for one of the DLand hotels. This hotel offers way more for your money and is in close proximity to many attractions.  To start with, parking and WIFI is free! The hotel is close to the freeway and also has several eateries nearby. One of the most impressive ammenities was the free breakfast. There was a plentiful supply of cereals, fruit, yogurt, muffins, bagles, toast, juice and coffee. The cook also served freshly cooked eggs, potatoes, bacon and sausage. They also make pancakes on request. This was one of the more impressive breakfast selections and much more plentiful than the one we paid dearly for at the Disney California Hotel.  The room was large, clean and well

The Ayres is a great hotel with European antique style decor, very comfortable rooms and a very welcoming environment. The breakfasts were good and the evening reception was a bonus after a long day at Disney.  The only minor downside was the 2 mile or so journey to Disney, however the bus stopped at the hotel lobby so not a major issue. Would definitely stay again.

A great hotel for families while visiting Disneyland. Large, clean rooms with free wifi, breakfast and parking. Only criticism is proximity to the freeway which can make room noisy. Overall, brilliant value for money.

Yes, this place is rated #1 for a reason.  The rooms are nice in size (has microwave and fridge), hotel is quite and the breakfast is great. Some might complain about the distance from Disneyland, but it is really only a 5 min drive to the Disneyland Parking lot.  The best part for me is the free parking, internet and breakfast.   For a family of 4, these cost can really add up at the end of a trip.

You cannot go wrong with a stay at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim. After reading reviews on tripadvisor & getting a great price at the hotel website via tripadvisor, I was sold! I'm the kind of sort-of high maintenance type who likes the luxury at a great price (think Embassy Suites-type). I usually don't like to spend more than $100 so I know it can be a stretch for a great place to rest your head. Here's my pros/cons review of my two night stay - I hope this helps you! PROs:  * complimentary yummy breakfast (everyday incl cereals, coffee, hot cocoa, juice, bagels, toast, pastries, fruits, yogurt and....on our first day there was scrambled eggs, hash browns, brown sausage, & french toast...on our second day there was scrambled eggs, diced & pan-fried potatoes, crispy bacon, & pancakes

Summary Heading: Another fantastic stay at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim!
Summary: My husband and I just got back from our latest trip to Disneyland.  We had stayed at another hotel for the bulk of our trip, but decided at the last minute to stay an extra night and booked a room at the Ayres.  As with our first stay at this hotel, everything was wonderful!  We absolutely love the decor and amenities, and the staff are always very friendly and helpful.  They really want to make sure that guests enjoy their stay and have everything they need.  Breakfast was great as well.  There was muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, potatoes, coffee, tea, juice, and more.  The hotel is very clean and comfortable.  We didn't hear any noise from inside our room.  We did have a small issue with a member of the housekeeping staff entering our

I was told this was in the top 10 hotels in Anahiem.  I don't know how - they must all be pretty average.  14 tables at breakfast - we're talking a large hotel here - guest were having breakfast in the lobby! But it was the receptionist who took the meaning of unhelpful to a new level - the boys were very good and the girls who we dealt with were dreadful  except one - Diane Stewart she was doubly helpful.  Rooms were decent size and clean.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that your stay did not meet with your expectations. I understand that the breakfast room was deathly quiet until 30 minutes prior to closing and then 90% of our guests came down to breakfast overflowing the room. The situation was further exacerbated due to the fact that our meeting room was not available as it so often is for overflow. I am sorry that you were inconvenienced in this manner but glad that Dianna was able to find you tables quickly and I appreciate your positive comments regarding her service.  I am sorry that the girls were not helpful. I hate to give excuses, but in this case both are experiencing their first pregnancies with one having severe morning sickness! I am afraid that I have lowered my expectations of their service during this challenging time. Fortunately things seem to be looking up in the past few days so I am hopeful that their normal high standards of service will return permanently.  I am also sorry that I did not meet you while you were here as I grew up in Brockenhurst, just a few miles from Lymington.   Please accept my apologies for your experience.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: This property is too good to be true.  The room is very spacious and comfortable.  Although the hotel is right next to the freeway the windows must be triple-pane because we couldn't hear road noise.  The check-in/check-out process was easy.  The breakfast was terrific...scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes on demand, juice, and more...easily a $10 breakfast at the Denny's down the road.  Only negative was that we had a bit of trouble keeping the lights on since you have to use your pass card to activate the lights.  The price was an incredible bargain.  Highly recommend.

The hotel is located near major freeways with easy access to Orange and Anaheim business district, restaurants, stadiums, and Disneyland.  Staff was friendly.  Room was comfortable and spacious with a couch and coffee table, bar area, large bed, desk, and TV with wardrobe for the stand.  Large bathroom as well, bath and toilet separate from sink and closet area.  Really enjoyed the bed.  Only complaint was lack of CNBC on TV channel roster.  Parking included with room rate.

Great, quiet location very close to Disney, but not in the thick of the action. Rooms are nicely decorated, super clean, and a good size. We thoroughly enjoyed 4 night stay. Breakfast is cooked fresh for you and is pretty decent.  The staff were very helpful, even "googling" a route to LA Galaxy ground (75 mile round trip - long way for a footie shirt). There is a courtesy bus to Disney ($ 4 each), although taxis are reasonable. We would certainly stay here again.

Great, quiet location very close to Disney, but not in the thick of the action. Rooms are nicely decorated, super clean, and a good size. We thoroughly enjoyed 4 night stay with our 2 kids (5 & 8). The kids had fun at the pool too. It's pretty small, but clean and a perfect size for the kids. Breakfast is cooked fresh for you and is pretty decent. Great place, would stay there again

My family and I went down to Anaheim for our son's 5th birthday. We looked for a reasonably priced hotel close to Disneyland. Not only was the Ayres reasonably priced, but it included a FULL breakfast each morning. If you have children, you know what a bonus this is as eating out is never less than $40 for a family of 4. We checked in late on a Monday night. Andrew was there to greet us with a smile. He was more than hospitable, and made us feel very welcome. We had a slight issue with the bedding once we got to our room, but Andrew quickly rectified the problem and said he'd be sure to bring it to management's attention in the morning. The next morning on our way out to Disneyland, we were greeted by Dianne at the front desk asking us how our stay had been thus far. I let her

Summary Heading: The best value in Disney Land
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Anaheim is the best-hidden value in the Anaheim / Disney corridor. The hotel is Only 20 minutes away from the Disney magic and easily accessed by the Anaheim shuttle service, which picks-up and drops you at the hotel every hour. The Ayres Hotel offers exceptional value; great breakfast and the staff make the stay most enjoyable.  This hotel is situated across from a major sport complex and caters to the business class, although as a tourist visiting Disney I was completely satisfied.  The hotel and my room were clean and well decorated. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. Parking, Internet and a fabulous breakfast are all included in the price, which was an exceptional value.   The hotel lacks an acceptable fitness center but the pool and hot tub

Summary Heading: Truly a one of a kind team!
Summary: We booked an eight night stay at the Ayres Anaheim after reading so many fabulous reviews for our trip to Southern California. I know now first hand what makes the Ayres Anaheim so very special-the staff! On the second night of our trip, my husband experienced severe chest pain and needed to be rushed to the nearest medical center. The night staff were very supportive and responded promptly to the emergency situation at hand. They reassured me that the nearest hospital was an excellent medical center, printed off driving directions and called us a cab when they realized I was not feeling up to driving in an unfamiliar city. My husband was hospitalized in the ICU for two nights and my seven year old son and I were treated like family by the Ayres Anaheim team. We were offered

Sleep Quality:  Large and comfortable beds, with good pillows.  Dark and quiet room.  Bathroom:  Functional separate room for shower (over bath) and toilet, separate from wash basin/vanity.  Good shower with good water pressure and plenty of hot water.  Food:  B/fast: hot and cold beverages, cereals, muffins, pancakes, bacon, sausages, eggs were plated up for you and served in refectory style dining room.  Location:  Conveniently located for a short drive to Disneyland.  Took approx 20mins on the shuttle service.  Service:  helpful staff on reception, dining staff and chef great too.  Value for money:  A double room with 2 queen beds was ¬£100 per night, including b/fast.  Well appointed, nice and comfortable room - this was great value for money.  Other:  Well appointed room

Summary Heading: Not as great as the reviews - especially if headed to Disney
Summary: I thought this hotel was going to be amazing based on the reviews and we were disappointed.  The rooms were just average and VERY noisy.  We were on the side by the highway and the noise was loud.  Additionally the walls are very thin and for 2 nights I heard the room above us - at 2:30am!  It sounded like they were pounding bricks.  I tried to speak with the front desk about the room above us (the next morning) and they were very apathetic with our concerns. He just said sorry. . .   We had 2 small kids and went to Disneyland one day.  They do have a shuttle to the park (for a charge) but they are very far from the park and the shuttle takes over 25 minutes and stops at other hotels. In hindsight we should have probably booked a hotel closer to the park.   The pool is just okay
Manager Response: I am so sorry that you were disappointed by your experience at our hotel. I spoke with the young man that you spoke with regarding the noise. Unfortunately he was responding to the complaint at check-out and therefore unable to prevent the issue from happening again. I have addressed this issue with him and feel confident that a more empathetic and considerate response will be forthcoming on a similar future occasion.  We certainly would have addressed the issue with the guest above you given the opportunity and would have made every effort to ensure you did not have the same experience the following night.    We are 2 and a half miles from the park and our shuttle does stop at a hotel on the way in.  I am sorry that you found the journey frustrating, it should take 20 minutes per the schedule, but can go a little longer if there are a lot of guests.  I am glad that you enjoyed our breakfast and found the hotel to be good value.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: There's a reason that the Ayres Hotel is ranked #1 in Anaheim and was a Traveler's Choice 2011 Winner...it's an excellent hotel!  We selected the Ayres for our 6-night stay in California based on reviews and we were NOT let down.  The hotel is lovely and has an elegant decor.  The staff is incredibly professional and friendly.  Everyone from the front desk staff to the breakfast cook went out of their way to greet us, ask about our stay and make us feel welcome.  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable.  I'm an incredibly light sleeper and I didn't have any issues sleeping. We rarely heard our neighbors or people in the hallways.  Some of the perks of the Ayres (especially in comparison to other local hotels): Free Parking, free Wi-Fi and free continental breakfast (which

The rooms were large and well furnished. The buffet breakfast(included) had very good choice. Free parking and wireless internet is great. They had complimentary good quality cookies and food in the evening. Excellent customer service as well. Was the best hotel value on our entire 3 week trip. About a 5-10 minute drive to Disney. Definitely deserves all the great reviews on TA.

Nothing exceptional, just a very clean hotel with a professional and polite staff.  Pros: great free morning breakfast and reasonably priced ($109 per night with AAA special)  Cons: A little loud next to the freeway

We booked this hotel like many other visitors because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. We traveled with our daughter and son in law and our 2 grand-daughters. We had a king room and they had a family room with 2 queen beds. Our room was not ready when we arrived but our daughter's room was so we were able to drop our cases into their room and then go next door to the micro brewery for a meal and by the time we got back the room was ready. The beds were new throughout the hotel and were absolutely divine, best hotel bed I have ever slept in.  No roll together or movement when the other partner moved around in bed. Our room was a king bed and then a dividing piece with a sofa and coffee table adjacent to the mini kitchen area which was nice to have a fridge

We chose this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed at all. The room was nice and clean and the staff supernice and friendly. Did not try the breakfast since we were here for only one night.

We just came back from our family vacation with my 2 kids. After doing a lot of research and looking at options of staying "on walking distance" to disney we are happy to report we made the right choice. Parking was free and i was blown away by the quality of the breakfast. A lot of options and very much kids friendly.  The chef Jose was super friendly and a great guy. Room was good for what we need it (microwave, fridge, etc) and it only took 10-15 min on the Anaheim transit ($8 for 3 plp) to get to Disney's door.

I booked this hotel as a result of reading the glowing reviews on Trip Advisor and was not dissapointed. This hotel is excellent and to be honest i'm not sure where to start.  From the second we arrived we felt wholly welcome and check-in was swift and easy and our room was ready straight away, which was just as well after a 12 hour flight! The room itself was great, well furnished and had FREE WIFI which was so useful! Myself and a mate shared the room, which had a privacy divide in the middle between the two beds which was a decent feature. Beds were AMAZING - easily the best hotel bed I hae ever slept in and this was the first time I had ever returned from holiday and actually missed the hotel bed!  The staff were perfect, each member incredibly helpful (you really felt they

We stayed at this hotel because we were attending a concert right across the street at the Honda Center. This hotel is in a great location because we were easily able to walk to the Honda Center. This saved us $10 for parking the the headache of battling other cars when trying to leave. Front desk was very nice and the check in was quick. We loved that the room came with an clock radio that were were able to charge our iphone's on. Hallways were well lit. Breakfast was hot and very yummy. We did have a problem about being charged for phone usage but were able to clear it up with a mangers help. Will defiantly stay here again.

After staying at some not so clean hotels across from Disneyland, I was not going to risk it again. I found reviews on this site and thought I would give the hotel a try. It was great! The front desk staff was nice and courteous. The room was nicely decorated and very clean. I was told the hotel was sold out, yet heard no one in the hotel ever. It was nice to have a breakfast that consisted of more than just muffins and yogurt. There is a free buffet style breakfast that was really good. The cooks behind the counter were very friendly. The location was very nice. It took only 5-10 minutes to get to Disneyland.  The only downfall this hotel has for it is the water pressure when taking a shower. It is pretty much non existent.  I would still highly recommend this hotel to anyone

We stayed here for an overnite trip to Anaheim, we went to the Grove of Anaheim for you guessed my favorite band's concert Air Supply on 10-15-11 (awesome as always) and we loved the Ayres Hotel it's so nice and confortable; our room was so clean and we also enjoyed the jacuzzi and the pool (all to ourselves) on a Saturday afternoon. Breakfast is very good and they start serving at 7:00a.m. just in case you wake up early just like us. I joined their STASH reward program and will continue to stay at the Ayeres Hotels as much as we can and last but not least their front desk staff is so nice and welcoming that they make you feel at home.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, convenient location and very helpful staff
Summary: From the moment we walked in, I felt comfortable and taken care of.  The front desk staff were all extremely friendly and helpful.  Our room was clean, spacious and well decorated.  The location was very convenient with a restaurant and bus station a minute's walk away.  The breakfast was very good with lots of variety of hot and cold items.  You could even get Mickey Mouse pancakes for the kids.  I very much enjoyed my "adult version" pancakes.  The little store in the lobby area had all the items that you might need or want.  I didn't notice any herbal tea, so I asked the front desk for some and she came back with about 4 different varieties.  She went above and beyond and I appreciated it very much.  Good service, location and a comfortable room.  We would definitely stay

Summary Heading: Nice / Clean Hotel with Friendly people BUT‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.
Summary: We just got back from a long weekend down in Anaheim. It was a family trip (with 3 family‚Äôs) down to Disneyland. The hotel was nice and so were the people that worked there.  It was very clean and quiet. Jose in the Breakfast area was GREAT! He made the kids special Mickey Mouse Pancakes in the morning.  It has a nice small pool and a good size hot tub and a little store in the lobby.  It is right across the street from The Honda Center and The Anaheim stadium / Amtrak station. So if you are going to any events at those places or taking the train into Anaheim. This would be a great hotel to stay at. It has free breakfast in the morning and Drinks in the evening Monday ‚Äì Thurs.   BUT‚Ä¶ yes here is the but‚Ä¶ it was just way to far from Disneyland for us. We took the Anaheim Resort
Manager Response: I was so sorry to read that you had such an awful experience with our shuttle. Over the years there have been frustrations, but during the last 3 months we have been tremendously pleased with the service, punctuality and reliability of the ART shuttle. I am so sorry that you received poor information from the driver and a sloppy response from the redcoats. I am also sorry that we did not advise you of the 15A and 15B options. The drivers have been fabulous in this respect and with the punctuality being fine we have not had an issue since the first week of initial teething troubles. Our staff have been duly advised and will be sure to inform future guests. The shuttle does run to a specific schedule which we provided you at the desk. I am confused as to why the driver dropped you at the Number 8 stop, but it seems that his false information lead to a litany of troubles. I have forwarded your review to the Anaheim Resort Transit and they are looking into what happenned. I hope to be able to clear it up and will send you a private message with more details. I am only sorry that I did not hear about this earlier as the Anaheim Resort Transit have been very responsive to my requests for improved service in the past. I do think that we provide a viable option for guests visiting Disneyland. I am only sorry that the shuttle was so detrimental to your experience. Thank you for your positive comments regarding Jose. Your comments have been passed to him.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed there on our anniversary trip to Disneyland and had a lovely time. The room was clean and I loved the style of the rooms and lobby. Breakfast was absolutely excellent. The only unfortunate thing that happened was that the room was not ready at 3:00pm as promised. I was sick that day and had to sleep in the hot car for over two hours until we were allowed to check in. Also, the lobby smelled musty. Other than those two inconveniences, it was a great hotel and we will definitely stay there in the future.

My wife and I stayed there and unfortunately it was only for one night! I would have loved to stay there longer and will definitely stay here next time we are in Anaheim. The front desk staff was just amazing and the location to the Honda center couldn't have been any better. All in all a great hotel

Summary Heading: If service is what you're after ...
Summary: We stayed for three days and really enjoyed it.  The room was very clean and comfortable, but the service was just wonderful.  The desk staff couldn't have been more helpful in organising the shuttles to Disneyland and LAX.  The catering staff at breakfast were fantastic - friendly and accommodating.

On a recent stay in Anaheim my family and I found this hotel to be extremely conveniently located near Disneyland and Angels Baseball Stadium. Being just off the freeway exit and entrace I was surprised to find that there were no noise issues at all and I am a stickler for noise. This hotel really was a great place to stay. Staff we're very helpfull. I've stayed in many hotels during my years of travel and would have no hesitation in recommending this to anyone. The only downside if you can call it that is that you need to take your own luggage to your room using a luggage trolley. A small price to pay for such a fine hotel. Highly recommended!!

Stayed for 3 nights to go to the D23 Expo and Disneyland. After doing a lot of research on hotels in the are this place was the best deal by far. FREE parking, FREE wifi, and FREE hot breakfast. There was ample parking, the wifi worked great, and the break fast was great (eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes)! Personally, I think it's ridiculous to have to pay for parking at hotels.   The room had plenty of space and the mini kitchen came in handy, mainly the mini fridge. We had a car so it was pretty convenient to get around to the parks and expo as well as Garden Grove for some good eats. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit the happiest place on earth.

We had a group of 5 adults driving from Phoenix to celebrate a birthday in Disneyland.  I have stayed at some of the hotels closer to the park and always thought they were dingy, overpriced and very noisy.  The Ayres, fortunately, was clean, peaceful, comfortable, and a great value.  Internet, parking and breakfast were all included.  The rooms were big and the kitchenette area was very convenient. The front desk staff were great and we felt very welcomed!   The only issue we had was that we really needed adjoining rooms and we got rooms next to each other instead.  This was a hassle as we had shared toiletries, food and some clothing items spread between our rooms.  One of our rooms was an adjoining to a room that was already occupied, so they do have connecting rooms...we just

What is good about this hotel: outstanding customer service; clean, comfortable rooms; delicious hot breakfast; competitive rates.  What is not so good about this hotel: nothing!!  Honestly, this is a great hotel! I highly recommend it.  In fact, for future travels if an Ayres hotel is in the area I'm visiting, I'll stay there.

Summary Heading: We Loved it and we'll be back for sure!!!!
Summary: This hotel and its staff are the best ever!!  Room was spotless, upgraded alarm clock even had an ipod dock!  The beds were plush and did not feel like hotel beds at all.  Breakfast in the morning was a bit of a wait, but VERY well worth it!!  We stayed at a second hotel on this trip since we were using hotels tonight, and we wish would would have just stayed at the Ayers both night!!

Rooms: Clean & cosy Bathroom: Huge & Clean Mini Kitchen: Mini fridge and microwave, very convenient for family with baby & child People: Excellent service Breakfast: The best during our stay in CA. Chef cooks at the dining hall. Many selections: bagel, egg, potato, bread, cake, sausage, bacon, cereal, etc.  Transportation: ART in front of the lobby. It takes only 15-25mins to & from Disneyland. Very convenient especially after a tired day in DL. WIFI: Free

Quite simply this is one of the best value places we've ever stayed.  Don't think this means they scrimp on quality because they don't.  It's in a similar price bracket to a Holiday Inn but that's where the comparison stops.  Large room with good kitchen facility and incredibly comfortable beds (pillows are 75% down - were so comfortable I had to check!).  Staff couldn't be more helpful and as soon as you asked for directions to anything they immediately offered to print off Google Maps.  Very good breakfast.  Is perfecty located for Disney though ironically we didn't go there.  It's not great for Hollywood as you have to struggle through the LA traffic.

We stayed at this hotel as it had won a tripadvisor award and we were very impresssed. The floor we stayed on was recently upgraded with new carpet in the rooms and hallway. It was very clean with a very compfortable bed and nice hot shower. I would recommend this hotel.

The hotel offers an unbeatable value. The rooms are clean, large and very affordable. there is an obvious commitment among all staff members to make clients have the best experience possible. While I was there, the manager spent the morning serving breakfast to guests during the breakfast rush.   The hotel had plenty of parking (free) and was convenient to Disney and Orange County. There is nothing overly pretentious about this hotel and it delivers where it matters.

My husband and I and our 2 (11 and 13) children stayed here for a week in late August.  I researched lots of LA area hotels before selecting this one.  My main reason for choosing it was the service and breakfast that was offered.  I have to say that our family was not disappointed at all.  First of all, the rooms are spacious and large enough for a family of 4.  There is a fridge, microwave, and fully stocked coffee maker in the room.  The decor has a European flavor with repros of various paintings all over.  It was tastefully done and not too ornate or over the top.  Beds are super comfortable with soft sheets.  Newspapers are available free in the lobby every day.  They also have fabulous afternoon "snacks" which were delicious hot cookies, chips, salsa, guac, wine, beer,

Clean, large rooms.  Staff helpful.  Can print tickets etc free at front desk.  Pool small, next to parking lot and highway.  A little loud but kids loved it.  Near many restaurants and Ralph's supermarket.   Manager's cocktail hour OK but get there early.  Breakfast good and hot meal varied during our 4 day stay.  Weekend female kitchen worker MUCH more accommodating than male weekday worker.  Very close to Disney.  Many families stay at hotel.
This hotel is amazing! Super friendly staff, great breakfasts, very clean hotel. Great hotel for good price. We stayed for four days and will definitely be back in the future!
Nice, clean hotel near all in Anaheim and beyond.  Pool and fitness room was a little small, but there's so much to do in California that you don't even care.

We have just returned from a family trip to Southern California, during our Anaheim leg we stayed at the Ayres Hotel.  I had initially booked accommodation in the Disney Maingate area but after finding the Ayres Hotel cancelled and made reservations here.  Fortunately for us this turned out to be one of our best decisions. Right from our checkin with Ryan at the front desk we were made to feel welcome the room was spacious and well equipped having a small kitchenette with a microwave and fridge.  The hotel has a small pool area and a fitness room if you feel energetic enough.  The beds have to be the most comfortable I have ever slept in in any hotel in the world.  The hotel offers a free buffet breakfast which you would quite easily have paid $20 or more for in many other

We just returned from a five night stay at this hotel.  All I can say is that this is an outstanding property and great value for the price.  The hotel is immaculate - paint looks new, carpets are spotless, rooms are very clean, and everything looks new (even though the front desk told me the property is about 10 years old).  The full breakfast with made to order items is great, as well as the evening reception Monday-Thursday nights.  The front desk staff is very friendly and they go out of their way to help with directions and provide assistance.  The bedding is very comfortable and like new.  We liked the fact that the hotel was completely no smoking.   We came to Anaheim to go to Disneyland and although this hotel is 3 miles away from the theme parks, it is a very easy drive

While staying at the ayres hotel, a few things should be known. The pool is not anything extravagant so don't stay here for that ammenity.The service was impeccable and the people working at the lobby really wanted to help you. Location was also great but in no means walking distance to Disneyland. The huge minus in our vacation was my daughter's allergic reaction. After the first night in the hotel, my daughter's face began to blow up into a tomato and her face only grew larger as we stayed. Her breathing was also affected negatively. The wierd thing was that her face would decrease ever so slightly in size once out of the hotel and into the fresh air. This was my daughter's first allergic reaction and though we do have some suspicions that the hotel cleaning products may have
Manager Response: Dear Mickeyland,  I am so sorry about your daughter's allergic reaction. I do remember that and I believe I spoke with you regarding it. Occasionally we do have people who have allergies to cleaning chemicals who call us in advance and we pre-block the room and clean with hot water to introduce as few allergens as possible. I would be happy to send some samples of the chemicals to you for your doctor to test on your daughter, so that you can know for sure exactly what it is that is causing the problem. Maybe we can easily remove that chemical from cleaning your room and then we can host you again!!  I do hope that I will hear from you and that you find out exactly what the allergen was.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: My family and I stayed here back in April for 6 days. The purpose of the trip was to visit Disneyland with my nephews. I must say I thoroughly enjoyed the hotel; the service was excellent, rooms were super comfortable; location was good. The hotel was about 10mins away from Disneyland and right across the Honda Center (where the Anaheim Ducks play). We got a great deal with one of their promotions that included free breakfast each day, free internet access and free parking. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. I highly recommend it. Good for the young and the old!!

We stayed for here for our quick trip to Disneyland.  It is located across the street from the Honda Center and close to Angels Stadium.  It is a shuttle ride from Disneyland.  Very nice, clean hotel, with a friendly staff and quick check in and check out.  Hotel served a complimentary hot breakfast.  Great Stay!

It was a beautiful hotel. Spacious, clean, soundproof room, very comfy beds, great breakfast, good location. Since we had been on the road for 4 weeks I was glad to be able to do laundry. Computer available so we could print tickets for Disneyland and our boarding passes. Happy hour was a nice extra, free drinks (incl. beer and wine) and a snack. Besides that the people at the front desk were very nice and helpfull. It was a joy to stay there.

We stayed at this hotel near Disneyland and it was a great experience.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The hotel was very clean and kept up well.  The beds were very comfy and the rooms were quite soundproof.  The complimentary breakfast was one of the best that I have experienced in my travels.  We will return to this hotel if we go back to the Anaheim area.

We really really liked this hotel. It was a little bit further away from Disneyland than we would have liked but there was a $2 per day shuttle that ran between our hotel and the happiest place on earth so it wasn‚Äôt an issue. Our room catered for wheelchairs (not that we had one) so it was huge as was the ensuite.  And, seriously, this is the 1st hotel room that I have stayed in that had decent ceiling lights ‚Äì fantastic. There was a guest laundry ‚Äì this was great for us as we had been travelling for quite some time and finding a Laundromat in an unfamiliar city can be quite difficult.  There was ‚Äòhelp  yourself‚Äô biscuits and wine in reception and the staff were lovely. Breakfast was a full cooked breakfast and more than adequate. The only drawback was that there was only one

We stayed here from July 13-19th and was a little worried at first about the size of the hotel.  We usually stay with bigger chains but we were pleasantly surprised.  The hotel is well kept and in very good condition.  The gym was small but adequate.  This was important to me.  The pool although small was very clean and ended up perfect for smaller kids.  It was never crowded but can easilly get full if you had 3 families in there.  But we did not run into this problem.  Rooms were big enough for 2 adukts, a 9 and 6 year old.  We mainly used the room to rest, get cleaned up and relax at the end of the day.  Bathroom was clean and have everything that we needed.  I appreciated  the hotel's attempts to conserve energy but would also recommend unplugging hairdryer.   Breakfast was

Summary Heading: Great hotel, superb shuttle, crazy breakfast though
Summary: A really very good standard of hotel with clean rooms and good sleep quality, but let down a little by a crazy breakfast system with a slow queue. Ok, yes the queue was made slower by the other guests perhaps, but other hotels manage this number of people much better and this hotel should devote some thought to the layout of the room and the food etc.  The shuttle to Disney was superb. Easy to use, on time and never full.

With the addition of a parking and resort fee at HIH, we scoured the area for another family friendly hotel.  We found it at the Ayres!  Rooms are spacious and clean.  The front desk is available and helpful, 24/7.  A free cooked to order breakfast for all family members in the morning before a big day at Little D!  There is also a manager's reception in the afternoon on the weekdays, but we have yet to get there.  No resort nor parking fees.  It's just a bit farther from DL but well worth the drive.

I stayed at the Ayres Hotel to have a central location for both Disneyland and Angel's stadium.  Disneyland was about a 2 mile drive, while the stadium was within walking distance.  When we arrived, we were helped by a front desk employee who had worked at Disneyland for a number of years. He was incredibly kind and helpful, giving us many tips on visiting the park.  The hotel was wonderfully maintained and attractive.  The price was exceptional.  The location was perfect.  Breakfasts (included) were a bit better than expected and the cook had a great personality in his banter to us non-LAA fans heading out to the local games.  Overall-this was a great hotel.  I wish I had used it as my base to explore all of southern CA.
Let me just add to the favorable reviews about this hotel. It's soooo much better than the other inns closer to Disneyland. These guys are pros.

We just returned from a 5-night Disneyland/Universal vacation.  The Ayres Hotel turned out to be every bit as good as the reviews we read.  We stayed in two adjacent 2-queen rooms.  The beds are extremely comfortable; I normally don't sleep well in hotels, but woke rested every morning!  The soundproofing must be very good.  We seldom heard any noise from the hallways or other rooms (maybe being a little further away from the Disney hoardes helped).  The hotel location made me wonder if highway and/or Angel baseball noise would be a problem; it was not (despite there being two Angel night home games during our stay).  The rooms had both a mini-fridge and a microwave (which we didn't use).  The bathrooms are well appointed and the showers are large.  The one oddity is that you

Hotel is clean, comfortable, and quiet, with a very helpful staff.  There is FREE parking and breakfast as well which is a money saver.  Location is a couple miles down the road from Disneyland, and you can catch the ART from the hotel to there.  There are no restaurants within close walking distance except a restaurant brewery next door.  But there are plenty of  restaurants along the same street of the hotel.  It was great stay and would definitely choose this hotel again.

We enjoyed are stay at the hotel. The staff was super friendly. We found he shuttle ride to Disneyland of good value, but a bit lengthy returning, an hour return. We used cabs twice and attempted to walk once only to get lost from park (3 miles from hotel). It did take housekeeping 2 hours to respond to a clean up of broken glass, which was a bit upsetting with small children. On the flip side, you can't beat the value on te complimentAry breakfast and the happy hour is also a plus during the week. It's almost like staying at a mini Embassy suites, but for a better price. We would definetly stay again!

Summary Heading: Very nice little hotel and still close to all the action
Summary: We spent ten wonderful nights at the Ayres Hotel and it was wonderful.  The staff were fanstasic, the pool great to cool off in, the fresh cookies a treat after a long day in the sun and still very close to everything we wanted to do in Southern Cali.  There were even fireworks almost every night just across the street at the Ball Park.  Great Hotel and great family holiday.

Summary Heading: Ayres Lives Up To Its Billing
Summary: My wife and I feel like we made a wise choice with this hotel property. We were very comfortable. Our room was clean and nicely appointed. The hotel staff was friendly and very willing to be helpful. The complimentary breakfast was filling and more than expected. We really enjoyed our stay. Book with no reservations... well, you know what I mean.

I stayed at this hotel recently for a DisneyLand trip. Overall, the accommodations were really nice. Great bed, clean room, and quiet. The service was top notch. I needed down-free bedding and they were able to accommodate me, no problem. Breakfast was very convenient with a good selection. We took the hourly shuttle (for a small fee) to Disney 2 days with no problems at all. One drawback for us was that the pool was small and very quiet. It starts at 3 1/2 feet and is not great for small children. The free parking was nice. There was an Angels game one evening cause quite a bit of traffic around the hotel which could bother some. Overall, I'd stay here again if visiting Anaheim.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while visiting Disney with my infant, husband, parents and other extended family. While I can see why it's #1 on Trip Advisor--extremely clean, free parking & breakfast, great staff, etc, it is a bit far from Disneyland. The shuttle was always late and unreliable. It only picks up from Disney once an hour and takes almost 40 minutes to get back to the hotel!!! We ended up driving to Disney the following days. All in all, a great hotel with great service, but if you're looking for something close to the parks, look elsewhere.

The end of our Us Trip  and it was the best hotel experience we had during our 4 week holiday from the East to the West Coast .  Thankyou !!!!!!!  Lovely staff  who were so helpful not one negative going through the motions, just another tourist , boring , can't wait till knock off time staff member to be found.  Rooms fantastic, walking distance to train station, bus to Disney Land and elswhere picks you up at the door.  When you stay there say hello from me. Tell them I will be back .
