We stayed at Ayres for 3 nights and it was such a nice hotel to return to after a long day at Disneyland.  The room was spacious and clean.  The room layout is great for families: the sink is outside of the bathroom and there's a wet bar near the microwave and refrigerator.  The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating with our requests.  We were a little late with checking out since my son had come down with a fever, but they were very flexible and told us to take our time.  It was such a relief and we were happy that they were not fully booked for that day.  We also enjoyed the breakfast and the chef who is a one man show.  We dined around 6 am it was so relaxing and less crazy than the day we dined around 9 am.  We would highly recommend this hotel.  We have stayed at

Please know that if you're looking at Ayres Anaheim that you are considering a 3-4 star property that is nice but certainly not in the resort category.  Nevertheless, the staff is amaizing, the rooms are clean, the parking is free and the breakfast buffet is extremely good.  Great value for anaheim and you will be happy that you checked this place out.

Great location and very family friendly. Perfect for families with young kids. Free parking, wifi and if you ride ART to Disneyland, the route is 15 and stops outside the front gate for quick access to the park. Good selection of daily breakfast items and rooms are spacious. Hotel mgmt is very involved with day to day operations and on-site. We stayed 5 days and had zero issues - just what you want while on vacation. Two thumbs up.

Stayed at the Ayres Hotel directly across the street from the Honda Center on Katella. Very close to Anaheim Stadium and the freeway. Nice decor. Very friendly staff. Free continental breakfast that includes pancakes, eggs, sausage or bacon, potatoes, coffee, cereal, bagels, toast, juice, fruit, etc... Also free happy hour with wine, beer, punch, chips & guacamole, and cookies.  Comfortable bed, nice shower and tub. Nice room with good air conditioning. Pool-ok. heated, but felt cold to me. Nice jacuzzi. Adequate gym to use. Movie theaters close by and restaurants. Bob's Big Boy, Starbucks, the Lazy Dog Cafe. There is also a Ballys Gym close by too. Very close to the freeway so easy to get around.  I recommend this hotel.

This Hotel is a little far from the  Disney resort , u cant walk  ,you have to drive , but is great u dont have to pay for anything extra , free parking, free breakfast and free wine n snacks in the afternoon , the rooms are great , the service great , my only concern every time i get a hotel is the bed , i have back problems ,and i call beforre to ask if their matress was soft or firm , they told me firm , i did my reservation and when i got there surprise the bed was soft , i  was going to stay 3 nites i stay just one , for the bed. The staff is very friendly.

My boyfriend and I just returned from California on June 25 and we'd been staying at this hotel. It was the best hotel I've ever stayed at. It's no surprise that it's ranked #1 in Anaheim on TripAdvisor. To begin with, I didn't have my credit card with me, but the wonderful man at the front desk, Andrew, let me check in and go up to my room without it and said that when my boyfriend arrived later that day to just bring it to the front desk, no worries.  Let me side track by saying my trip started rather badly and I was in a pretty bad mood. But after speaking with Andrew, I was so much happier. He was so friendly, and always smiling, made a couple jokes and just made me feel better. For the majority of our stay, we were on the 4th floor. The room was so quiet and very clean. For

My hubby and I stayed for 2 nights at the Ayres Hotel at the beginning of June 2011 after a 2 week road trip through Southwest USA. I was looking forward to staying at this hotel as I had read the reviews here on TripAdvisor so already had an inkling that this would be a special place. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and pleasant and keen to hear about our plans. They were positive and engaged and were good representatives of the Ayres brand. Even the chef at the breakfast area seemed to be interested! When he asked where we were from (we said Australia), he told us that Australians were the number 1 visitors in terms of tourist numbers to California in 2011. This was good stuff - I'm in business and it's fantastic that even the chef knows who is main market

Summary Heading: Absolute gem, and the staff ROCK!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel in February of 2011 to attend an Anaheim Ducks game. the Honda Center is right across the street, its a very short walk. If you are lucky, you can head out to the arena after practices are done and meet players for autographs and pictures. We met about 90% of the team that day.  This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and if I am in the region again, I will be back to stay here- the staff here go above and beyond.  Room layout was 2 Queens with a microwave and fridge, room was very quiet. While it is off of a major street, you cannot hear a thing from the street.  Breakfast is great, lots of hot options like eggs with toppings like cheese, slasa and jalepeno peppers to add, along with traditional favorites like cereal, fruit, juice, milk

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, badly let down by the breakfast facilities.
Summary: Like many we spent most of our time in either of the Disney parks and frustratingly most of our money in their eateries! The outstanding issue with this hotel (which they don't seem particularly keen to address) is the wholly inadequate breakfast facilities. Some reviews will praise the jovial chef serving up culinary delights, but frankly the choices were scrambled eggs with either bacon or sausage, french toast or pancakes depending on which day you put yourself through the misery that is the breakfast room. In fairness the selection of cold foods on offer is quite varied. Rather than being jovial I would say the chef is bemused at how comical the scene in front of him is; hordes of guests carefully navigating around the cramped room trying not to bump into each other, ready

We stayed at the Ayres Hotel for a 4 day trip to Disneyland. We got a great discounted rate which more than paid for the daily parking at Disney. Saving the money and the comfort and quality of this hotel was worth the 2 mile journey to the parks. The one area of improvement is the breakfast; it would be nice to have a few more healthier alternatives to prepare you for a busy days with little kids but that wouldn't deter us from staying there agin. The front desk staff was very helpful in terms of getting around and recommended a wonderful little family-friendly Italian restaurant for dinner our fist night. It was a gem!

Nice motel big room awesome cookies free........they put a on fourth floor as they said it was less noisy and we didn't hear a peep There was a  guest laundry on  our floor vey handy .the room was really nice and a a good price reception Staff were lovely and helpful with directions  printed them out for us .The breakfast room was packed on  one of the 3 mornings so I just grabbed one of the  yummy fruit bagels and a coffee before driving off but there is a limited choice of hot items which were included in the rate so good value . I guess my only complaint was the breakfast cook had a bit of an attitude . On our first morning I didn't know the drill and   he didn't greet me or anything  so I went to lift a bai-Marie lid and he gave ma a death look then only offered me some

Summary Heading: The best 3 star hotel I have ever stayed at!
Summary: My partner & I just completed a fabulous 3 week trip around the US West coast & finished our holiday in Anaheim as we planned to spend a couple of days at Disneyland.   I can understand why this hotel is the number 1 rated hotel in Anaheim. It may not be as close to Disneyland as some of the other hotels (though a short/easy shuttle ride to & from hotel is easy) & there are the highways nearby etc but you are not staying in Anaheim for the scenery... Most people are in the area to be close to the attractions.   The room cost roughly $130 AU a night & the quality of the room was better than most 4 or 5 star hotels I have stayed at. Lovely room furnishings, spatious rooms with several ammenities & very clean plus well maintained.  Whenever I may return to Anaheim in th future,

Summary Heading: Best hotel in a 9-day trip in L.A
Summary: Stayed in 4 different hotels for our trip to San Diego, L.A and Anaheim ( Disneyland). This is by far the best. Best value! Big, clean room, excellent free breakfast and friendly staff. My boy loves it! I give it 5 of 5 of this hotel. Highly recommended to family trip to Disneyland trip.

A very FRIENDLY welcome upon arrival followed by a very CLEAN, spacious, nicely appointed room complete with kitchenette (refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker, sink), sitting area, and a very comfortable bed with an ornately carved headboard. The shower actually sparkled!  Front desk was very accomodating in meeting any needs and always did so quickly and with a smile!  The complimentary HOT breakfast was delicious with something to please everyone (including Mickey pancakes for tkids) and the chef was very pleasant and friendly. Warm, fresh baked cookies in the afternoon, with a welcome reception in the lobby at dinner time. Great for families, couples, or business!  Our room had a partial view of Angel Stadium so we could see their victory fireworks right outside our window!

They say Disneyland is where the memories begin. For us it was arriving at the ayers hotel when the fond memories of our trip really began. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were made to feel really special. This was down to Marcus and his attentive team who made sure we were looked after in every way.¬†  I've stayed in many top hotels around the world ¬†on business and pleasure over 20yrs, and I must say, for my wife and 4yrs old daughter, this was one of the most memorable. ¬†From the room, to breakfast, service, location and comfort, this was more than we could have asked for or expected.¬†  Even after 2 months since our trip, we still have fond memories. I can still feel the freshly made cookies melt in my mouth.¬†  Thanks for making the experience that much more

Summary Heading: Loved it and will definitely recommend all my friends!
Summary: The hotel is 10 minutes away from Disney.  The breakfast was good; we loved it b/c in the morning we didn't have to take the kids any where for breakfast b/f we headed to Disney.  And my daughters loved the Mickey mouse pancake.  Newport beach is also 20 minutes away so it was a plus.  And we also loved the manager receptions... free soda and beer @ 5:30-6:30pm!  There's an incredible pizza place 5mins away, called Zito's.  We got a great rate calling the hotel directly.

We stayed 2 nights after reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we were very pleased we did. From the very warm welcome as we entered the door to the very cheery "have a safe journey" as we left, we could not fault it. Breakfast was superb, lots of choice. Room was very nicely decorated and roomy, we were surprised with the coffee maker in the room. They have a liitle "shop" with essentials like washing powder (they have a guest laundry) sun lotion, headache tablets etc.open all day and night.They posted my postcards back home for me too. Would highly recommend the hotel, it has a shuttle service to the Disney parks, there was no traffic noise at all in our room. The beds were amazingly comfortable, best nights sleep in California so far.

Summary Heading: Stretch your $$$ at Ayres!!! 1st Class all the way!!
Summary: Best bang for your buck!!! In Las Vegas this room would be $300 a night!! Cloud like beds. Killer FREE breakfast!!!
The manager came to the hotel at 9:30 pm to bring in his own baby crib for my grandson to use!  There were non of the hotel's cribs available so he went the "extra mile"  Ken Farrish

Summary Heading: Wow!  What a nice hotel and a great bargain.
Summary: Nice place with great service and accommodations.  Highly recommend it!  An Excellent Value.

Loved the hotel...  Extremely clean, friendly staff, cook to order breakfast - with a smile- great rate, very very quiet, what else could one ask!!!  Loved our stay; my wife and I travel on business all the time and this boutique hotel is a cut above for the price  in all areas - really enjoyed our stay when we went to D- land this past weekend.  2 things to note - must drive to D-land as the Ayres is about 3 miles from the parks and the heater/ac unit was a bit loud.  We just opened the window as it was beautiful in socal last weekend.

Summary Heading: Believe all the great reviews about Ayres Hotel because they are true!!
Summary: Checking out tomorrow after 9 nights staying at the Ayres Anaheim and I have to say we will miss this hotel.  The reception staff are incredibly nice they really make you feel like a valued customer, always a friendly smile for everyone.  We enjoyed the warm cookies when checking in and also took advantage of the fab 'managers reception' which consists of beer, juice, cookies and snacks all of which were a lovely touch. The room we stayed in was a double queen room which was spacious, immaculately clean and had a view of Disney fireworks (9.30pm) each night.  The cleaning team are incredible, I even saw them cleaning dado rails in the hallway, they seem to have pride about their workplace.  The microwave refrigerator and coffe pot were well used by us and are a great touch as is

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Hotel this past weekend with my sister and mother while attending a graduation at Chapman University and was pleasantly pleased with the service and cleanliness at the property. I would definitley stay here again and recommend this hotel when traveling to the Anaheim area.

Excellent "boutique hotel" that included FREE Parking and FREE Breakfast (bacon or sausage on alternating days, eggs, potatoes, pancakes, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, danish, etc...).  Spacious and lovely decorated room. Mini fridge & microwave oven. Work area and a table with 2 elegant chairs.   Very quiet! Mostly business travelers were staying here during our visit.  Stayed on the 1st floor facing the freeway - very quiet. Easy access to load and unload my car. Plenty of parking in a well-lit lot.  Small work-out room on the 1st floor.  Very friendly and efficient staff.  Very clean and comfy! Beds and pillows were comfortable.  Shuttle that runs to a from Disney (the ART?) for a fee  - we chose to drive over to the park because it was cheaper with 4 people.  Disneyland is NOT

Our welcome from the receptionist(Kathleen) was amazing. She made us feel very important and welcome there. She said she was the one that I had made the reservation with by phone. Nice to feel we weren't just "a number". The hot breakfast was good, the chef was VERY friendly also. We would definitely stay again if we go to Anaheim. The beds were so comfy. My only problem was I could not get the internet to connect to my iPad.

Summary Heading: Base Camp for Disneyland and Universal Studios
Summary: The breakfast was fantastic and so was the staff.  We had a nice continental breakfast before each of our amusement park days.  The hotel was spacious enough for a family of five in a two queen room.  The pool was very small.  The location was nice if you wanted to go to a baseball game or a show at the Honda center and was only about ten minutes from Disneyland.  This made it easy to stop at Downtown Disney to see the fireworks. The parking at Downtown Disney was free for three hours and so was the parking at  the hotel. It was located next to the freeway, but the noise didn't matter in the hotel rooms.

Summary Heading: You will not be disappointed with this hotel.
Summary: Four of us stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for six nights on a family vacation to Southern California.  My family and I have visited the area a number of times over the years and usually stay in one of the hotels next to Disneyland.  The last time we stayed in Anaheim we were unhappy with our room and the service we received at another location.   As the Ayres was rated number one by Trip Advisor Members and I got a good rate on Expedia, I booked the Ayres instead. I am writing this review because I have been so impressed with this hotel. Everyone greeted us cheerfully no mater the time of day.  The hotel is very well laid out and furnished.  The breakfast is very good and included in the price.  Hot breakfast switches one day bacon, the next sausages, (really good sausages).

Very surprised from the minute I walked into the place.  Check-in was efficient just after noon. Asked for a room away from Katella and that was no problem plus the room was ready when we got there.   Room was large, well decorated, very quiet, great beds, never a problem finding parking.  Oh yea.  Parking is free as is wifi and the hot breakfast and the complimentary computer and printer next to the front desk for email and printing airline tickets!  Bath vanity sink wasn't draining.  Called the front desk and Matt was there within 15 minutes.  Turned into more than just a job for a plunger, but he got it fixed perfectly.  Pool was nice with a great hot tub.  Never filled with kids, so that was great.  The dining area was large with lots of tables, so it never really felt too

We were looking for a better than average hotel in Anaheim, and we found it!  This hotel has a wonderful breakfast - a great time-saver when you are headed to Disneyland.  The bed was super-comfortable!  I needed a great nights sleep after walking around the parks all day.  We loved this hotel and will definately stay here in the future.

Was sent here by employer for extended project. (Approx 3 mo. total thru yr). Very well taken care of by entire staff. Loved location for activities, concerts, hockey,baseball games etc...took special care of us when my family came to visit!! Have and will always recommend this establishment.

Ayres is warm and inviting from the time you get off the freeway. Its just off the freeway! There is ample free parking. The reception area is lovely - very colonial-esq and the front desk staff are very friendly and helpful.  the room was beautiful. the bed was nice and comfy. only problem was the bathroom was quite small. overall was very clean and beautifully presented.  the breakfast room is a bit cramped but the selection is pretty good. the usual breads, pastries, cereals and they also make pancakes, eggs, bacon and hash browns on the spot. very nice!  its a bit of a drive to disneyland but if want to stay a walking distance, there are a heap to choose from. however, i thought Ayres was perfect. Very well priced and it was gorgeous with lovely service. would strongly

We stayed here our last night in Anaheim. I was definitely curious about this hotel after reading all the glowing reviews. We were not disappointed! I think it's about 2 miles from Disneyland, which was the reason we were in town. We ended up driving to the parks since the shuttle didn't make much sense for our family (we would've only saved a $1). The rooms were beautiful and immaculate. My children loved the fresh-baked cookies upon check-in! We used the pool facilities. Very nice! I especially loved the thick pool towels! The free breakfast was also a welcome surprise. I didn't get the name of the british fellow working the hot buffet, but he was definitely a delight! He was very personable with everyone and always had a smile on his face. I love that!   I think I was most

Summary Heading: Excellent Service. We loved this hotel!
Summary: My husband, our son and I stayed here in April for 4 nights. After our long flight from Australia we were thankful for our very clean, comfortable and large room!   I did a lot of research for just the right place and couldn't have been more pleased with the Ayres Hotel. I booked directly through the hotel's website and Mr. Collins, the General Manager, responded to all my emails very fast and friendly.  The hotel is not next to Disneyland but the ART bus picks up at the Hotel door and drops you very close to the entrance of both the parks ($ 4/adult, $ 1/child for a day pass).   The staff and service are great. The included breakfast is hot, fresh and satisfying. The internet connection was free and a good speed.   Mr. Collins, thank you very much for everything you did for us.

We had a very pleasant experience at the Ayres of Anaheim, even though we were just there for one night. I told the kind gentleman at check-in that we had an early morning commitment, and would appreciate a quiet room. He gave us a room on the 4th floor, facing the side street (Douglass St.) to the property. We sampled the freshly-baked cookies they had on the counter (yummy!) and went to our room. Perhaps it is noisier when here is an event at the Honda Center - - but we found the room to be extremely peaceful. I didn't hear the freeway at all, nor the traffic on Katella Ave. The decor is typical of Ayres' properties ~ with a traditional European look, complete with poster beds, lovely artwork, and rich fabrics. Our only complaint regarding the room was the showerhead (which

We stayed 3 days/2 nights when visiting Disneyland and Universal Studios. We were four in my group. It is about 8 minutes away from Disneyland and about 45 minutes away from Universal Studios. Everyone in my group was looking forward to the parks and so was I, but, honestly, I was so excited about the hotel since I had read the reviews on TripAdviser and I was really looking forward to this. I booked directly through the hotel‚Äôs website and paid about $140.00 a night. No hidden fees or any of that sneaky stuff.   I was lost for a bit and called the hotel for directions. The lady at the reception desk was patient and helpful in giving us directions. When we arrived, they greeted me by my last name. That was so cool! Impressed! The lady said she set us in one of her favorite rooms

Summary Heading: Once you get past the window dressing, there's not much there
Summary: The staff was comprised of some very nice people, with the exception of the general manager. I stayed there, not by choice, for 100 days and not once did the manager ask how my stay was going or could he do anything to make my stay more comfortable. He really just seemed to take my stay for granted. I found him to be a bit of a stuffed shirt. The real problems are the never ending noise from the freeway traffic and the hockey and baseball fans on the sidewalks just out side your windows. The hotel has no restaurant or Bar/Lounge. They'll direct you next door to a microbrewery. Good luck, it's always crowed on a sporting event night and if you do get a table you'll find yourself ordering from their limited event night menu. The hotel is a handsome property. Well cared for nicely
Manager Response: Dear Sir,  I am sorry that your experience at our hotel was unpleasant. Please accept my apologies for not checking in with you during your stay. I did speak with members of your group during the stay and I did feel that the regular, personal attention that my Director of Sales and my front desk provided made sure that your needs were being met. I also received a lot of very positive feedback from my staff regarding your group's experience.   I would certainly not recommend going to JT Schmid's Restaurant on an event night prior to the event, but apart from the two hours prior to the event, they provide a relaxed dining experience which most of our guests are very happy with.    All the best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We stayed for 4 days recently. Had a great time. good service. All the front reception staff were excellent including the overnight staff.  We knew re the location as its not next to the disneyland hotel. The shuttle service is excellent. Cost us $10 / day for the whole family ( vs $15 at the disneyland carpark if you drive yourself)hence I did not bother taking the car and the great part is that the shuttle drops you very close to the entrance of both the parks. The shuttle bus has only one stop before reaching disneyland which is good in the morning when you are rushing to get in early, but the opposite applies on the drive back as its the second last hotel on the loop back ( which means its a longer drive on the way back).  The parking is free at the hotel which helps.  The

Stayed at Ayres Hotel for spring break trip with our teenage daughter. Was one of few hotels who guarantee 2 queen beds in rooms, which are very comfortable. Hotel has free parking which was great as we had rented a car. Breakfast daily is very good...the food and beverage manager is the chef! He interacts with everyone and remembers details about each guest. Front desk staff were knowledgeable when asked about the area and the reception each evening (M-Thurs) was a nice touch-beverages, chips and salsa and fresh baked cookies. Rooms were spacious and nicely appointed. Nice to have free wifi in the rooms. Was right across the street from Honda Center and on the shuttle route to Disney. Would definitely stay there again.

I have stayed at the Anaheim Ayres Hotel over a 500 nights over the past10years and  I believe you can not find better in Orange county. I travel extensively for business and the Ayres gets a perfect score for everything I look for in a hotel. Location: The hotel has easy acess to te 57,22,5,55 and91freeways. It is across the steet from the Honda center and 1 block from Angel Stadium.For a sports fan no more perfect location. Many fine and casual restaurants are less than a mile.  Rooms;  Very spacious mini suites with a sofa-sleeper micowave,refrig. comfortable bed and flat screen TV, Wifi.Two important critera the Ayres"s rooms get a 10, they are extremely clean and soundproof.  Breakfast/Happy hour; Jose cooks the best free breakfast Eggs, bacon,hash browns,pancakes,french

This hotel is a nice hotel but nothing too exciting. It is a bit dated but the rooms are nice, big and clean and the free buffet breakfast is good but also necessary because the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. I thought we would be in walking distance of Disneyland but instead was a 30-35min shuttle bus ride away which was annoying, and the bus only came every hour so if you missed one but 2 mins you would have to wait a whole hour to get to Disneyland. There looked like there was lots of hotels of a similar quality right at the footsteps of Disneyland that I would have rathered stayed.
Manager Response: Dear Dood1989  I am sorry that you were disappointed by your recent visit to our hotel. I was concerned to read that you had the expectation that we were walking distance from Disneyland. Please let me know if you found a site that had false information on it. Many of our guests stay here because they like to be further away from the intensity of Disneyland. We are walking distance from Angel Stadium, the Honda Center and several restaurants, so our hotel is typically regarded as having a good location, but I can fully understand why it did not meet your needs.  Thank you for your positive comments regarding the breakfast and the rooms.  Regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Anaheim - can't wait to go back!
Summary: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon at the Ayres hotel and we can't wait to go back!  The hotel is absolutely beautiful and very, very comfortable.  The rooms are very well sound-proofed!  We didn't even know we were next to a room full of screaming children until their door was open while we were in the hallway.  The staff were all really friendly and helpful whenever we needed anything.  They always had a cheerful greeting for us whenever we entered the lobby.  The breakfast is amazing: eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, pancakes, toast, muffins, bagels, oatmeal, fruit, yogurt, juice, coffee, and more!  I can't say enough about how great this place is and we will definitely be staying here in the future.

This is one of the most unique hotels at which I've ever had the pleasure of staying.  Their ability to strike a balance between family and business appropriate accommodations is fantastic.  They serve a complimentary breakfast in the morning, which is fast, friendly and tasty.  It is the perfect way to get their guests comfortably started in their day, and its quality is great: eggs, bacon/sausage, pancakes, potatoes, cereal, toast, fresh fruit, bagels, muffins, and an assortment of juice/coffee/milk.  (The cook who made Mickey Mouse pancakes for my son was especially a delight.)  The evening reception was something made comfortable for everyone as well, and it was a lovely way to start our evenings.  Salsa, guacamole and chips, along with a small selection of wine and beer for

we are very happy with the recent stay at this hotel during spring break time. we chose this hotel mostly because of the good reviews on tripadvisor.com and we think we made the right decision. would recommend to friends and anyone who is interested in visiting disneyland.

Summary Heading: Would Certainly Choose This Hotel Again
Summary: We took our four-year-old grand daughter to visit Disneyland and spent 4 nights at the Ayres Hotel. We highly recommend this hotel for the following reasons: 1. Friendly, courteous and helpful staff.  2. High level of cleanliness both in the common areas and in our hotel room. 3. Fridge and microwave in the room to help with the snacks for our grand daughter (and to keep the wine cool for the grand parents) 4. Excellent full breakfast and the great chef who prepared wonderful food for a large number of people each morning. 5. The hotel interior design and the breakfast room that reminded us of our hotel stays in Europe. 6. Mr. Collins, the manager, who took the time to check with us to ensure every thing was going well. 7. The ART shuttle that took us door to door to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: A very nice stay - quiet rooms
Summary: I had a king room with a sofa sleeper. BIG ROOM! Ideal for the family going to Disneyland. Complimentary WiFi - a little slow but a good amenity. The rooms were very quiet and the complimentary breakfast was better than just a continental breakfast. I'd stay here're again.  Also, the bed was very comfortable.   FYI - no room service or restaurant.

After a ton of research I booked this hotel based on the reviews at this site.  This hotel is clean, the beds are comfortable, and the staff is pleasant.  Sadly, after two horrible nights of sleep we checked out early.   The front of this hotel faces the freeway and the back is right next to a street.  When we checked in we told the staff our only priority was a quiet room.  We were placed in the back (seemed logical).  In the evening the room was quiet, but starting at 6 a.m. we were awoken to cars loudly accelerating and the toilet/sink/shower upstairs.  The second morning, they were vacuuming outside our door and mowing the lawn outside our window.  If you are a family that plans on staying at Disney at night (when their are essentially no lines) and sleeping in, this in NOT
Manager Response: Dear Teelips,  I am sorry that your stay was so unsatisfactory as to cause you to check out a day early. With the request for a quiet room in hand, we  would typically have put you on the top floor, and I would normally have you facing the freeway, as the noise is constant and light and does not include issues of accelerating cars. I am sorry that we were unable to fill your request adequately. I must say however that you were rather unlucky to be woken by external noise. Most of our leisure guests come down to breakfast between 8 and 10, and we have very few complaints of noise. We do sometimes have an issue with space at breakfast when our meeting room is occupied, If it isn't we open our largest meeting room, which adds at least another 40 seats. When our milk dispenser runs out, we refill as soon as we find out. or put out a jug of milk. We haven't actually ever run out of milk completely, as far as I can remember. We are looking into buying an enormous double dispenser, which would mean that the guest would never  need to advise us that we were out.   Please do accept my apologies for your inconvenience and disappointment and my hope that you will give us another try.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: We had the opportunity to spend a few nights of our family vacation at the Ayres hotel. I must say first off, it is a beautiful smaller type hotel but the service is amazing. From the front desk people who always welcome you with a "Hello" and a smile.  The rooms were beautiful and when we arrived we recieved a small welcome basket which was so nice. The breakfast was my kids favorite, it was great, so many choices and again great "service with a smile"!  Got to meet Marcus the GM and he was such a nice gentleman and spent time talking with us and checking on our stay.  The facility is very clean and quiet but always ready to help you if you need ANYTHING!

Summary Heading: A Gem of a Hotel Not to be Missed - Don't Look Elsewhere & Waste Time
Summary: I had not known about this beautiful family owned chain and I live in Los Angeles. I was visiting Anaheim and was so glad I checked Trip Advisor when we arrived and found Ayres. We were thrilled. What a beautiful property in a perfect location. Jay was amazing on the phone and was more amazing when we got there. We felt like we were at home. The full hot breakfast (eggs, pancakes, sausage, danish, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, cereal, hash browns, coffee, cocoa, tea, milk, & More) was amazing and really the best pancakes we ever had. Service was outstanding all the way to being able to order in dinner from a restaurant across the street without ever leaving the hotel. They had menus on hand and Dee (Diane) even printed out menus for us that she didn't have on hand. Excellent service

My family has never stayed in an Ayres hotel before but were going to be in Anaheim, CA and checked TripAdvisor.com for ideas.  We booked the Ayres hotel and agree with the vast majority of the reviews....it's an excellent choice!  The location was great, the rooms were comfortable, clean, and quiet, the breakfast was excellent (the freshly made pancakes and scrambled eggs were a treat!), and the folks at the front desk were efficient, friendly, and helpful.    It was an excellent value and a great two nights!  I highly recommend this hotel and only wish there were more Ayers hotels around the country so my family could stay at them more often!  Keep up the good work, Ayres!

Summary Heading: Still The Best Value in the Area
Summary: I travel a lot on business both in the US and abroad and for price, location, cleanliness and comfort this is one of the best hotels I have experienced.  I simply cannot understand any of the mediocre reviews since the Ayres Anaheim is a terrific value.  This is a lovely European style boutique hotel with spacious, comfortable, and clean rooms.  The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in and the room has all the amenities needed for a business traveler.  I have stayed here probably a dozen times or more over the years and the experience is still the same.  The front desk staff is friendly and very attentive.  The cleaning staff is polite and often has greeted me with a ‚Äúgood morning‚Äù.  These simple things are very rare these days and much appreciated.  The

Summary Heading: One of the most pleasent place i have stayed in
Summary: If you look for a place to stay in Anaheim are, this place should defintly be on your list. no wonder they are ranked witin the top 25 hotels in the USA!!!

Summary Heading: What's the big deal...AVERAGE at best!!!
Summary: We tried this hotel based on the ratings, and we were very underwhelmed!  We've had better breakfasts in other hotels for less (the coffee was extra weak too).  There was an employee in a company jacket walking around the dining area thru out breakfast.  All we saw him do was brush the food/crumbs that have fallen onto the tables onto the floor, that was a turn off.  The toiletries were a shampoo/conditioner combo and lotion.  There wasn't even a shower cap!  Brighter and more lighting in the room would have been appreciated as well.  The 1 nice thing was our room was in the back of the hotel, so it was quiet.  We will unlikely return, unless it is a deal that can't be turned down.
Manager Response: Dear Tea Tree Lover,  I was very disappointed to read of your experience and the fact that you were underwhelmed by our hotel. I can adress a couple of items that you raised. Breakfast is obviously very subjective as you may have read from the previous positive reviews. I believe it is really a matter of context, and my explanation is as much of the previous reviews as it is of our hotel. Hotels of our size that include breakfast with the rate in the Disneyland area can host several hundred people in a morning's sitting. It is rare therefore to find a chef cooking fresh eggs, potatoes, sausages and pancakes for so many people. Healthier guests appreciate the fact that they can opt for yoghurt, fruit salad,  granola and a selection of fruit juices. The combination of the fresh hot food and the healthy option is perhaps the reason that the previous reviews have been so positive. I am sorry that the efforts of our staff member were a turn off and I will be sure to ask him to clean the tables in a more hygienic manner. I accept your point regarding the shampoo and conditioner and I will bring it up with the owners. As for deals that can't be turned down, we have some good ones in the pipeline so watch this space!!  Please accept my apologies for your disappointment and my hope that we can have you return and be dazzled!  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Nothing special. Don't see how it's #1. Shuttle warning.
Summary: Spent 3 nights here with wife and 2 kids (aged 10 and 3) on a Disneyland trip. A very ordinary and simple 3 star type hotel. Nothing special. Nothing extraordinary. Just sort of blah.  Frankly, I would not stay here again for the main reason that if you are coming here with kids to go to Disneyland the shuttle is a bit of a pain. First, it only comes once a hour (at quarter past). Second, it is not a shuttle owned and operated by the hotel. It is a public shuttle so it can be early, it can be late and it can be full. (Had to stand up once with my son because it was full.) Third, it makes stops on the way to Disneyland so it takes about 15 mins to get there. We didn't even bother catching it home because it looked like we would have been at the end of the line and it would have
Manager Response: Dear Canadian Dad,  I am so sorry that you found our hotel nothing special and that you felt that our high ranking was not well deserved. I do feel I should respond to the question about the ranking as it has been a great reward to us. The hotel has responded to customer opinion removing as many reasons for frustration as possible. We have purchased new dressers to ensure adequate storage space, flat screen TVs and clock radios with ipod docks to address concerns of outdated technology, tripled our bandwidth to ensure adequate internet speed and removed charging for internet to address charges of nickel and diming. Bad reviews are normally founded on frustration. Good reviews are often based on exceeded expectations. Many of our guests respond positively to a more traditional style of room that can normally only be found in 4 and 5 star hotels and a room size that is larger than most who share our price range. We are also fortunate to have a charming group of staff and some of the kindest, most appreciative guests a hotel could hope to have.    I certainly understand why you might have been frustrated by the shuttle. It does see a lot of demand during Spring Break which can make it more busy than normal. We see a balance of responses, some like the convenience of low cost transportation from door to door and are not too bothered about the time, others get frustrated at the time it takes. This is sadly not a frustration I can remove as our participation is mandated. However the service has been improving steadily with time and we have worked closely with the ART shuttle to design the best route for our customers.   I hope that you will reconsider your desire to stay again and that we can make your next stay special!  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I highly recommend the Ayers Hotel in Anaheim.   We (family of four) stayed four nights for Disneyland and had a great time.  We stayed at another hotel before and were not impressed at all.  I did some research this time and found the reviews for the Ayers.  I was skeptical that it could be that good at such a great price, but I can honestly say the hotel is even better than the off the chart reviews.  The rooms were clean, quiet, and had everything we needed from the mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker with coffee.   Plenty of room and the beds were very comfortable.  Added plus that the kids were able to watch the Disney fireworks from the room window.     The FREE and FULL breakfasts in the mornings were outstanding.  Eggs, potatoes, bacon or sausage, fruit, oatmeal,

I booked this hotel from the package I purchased from Travelocity. The experience was great with this hotel. I would recommend to anyone who plan to travel to Southern California. Great distance, too! 15' from John Wayne airport and most attractions. Great location with great price. I booked with Travelocity for a 5 days trip, including air,hotel and car with a price of $850/p. Very reasonable price for such a trip.

My 20 something son and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim while we attended two hockey games at the Honda Center and Disneyland. This is an excellent place with spacious bedrooms and nice washroom facilities. The free breakfast was the best I've experienced, with a cook available to make pancakes and fry up hot bacon, sausage, eggs and potatoes. Add to that the fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, toast, juice, tea and coffee and you can't ask anything more. Plus the eating area was a large as most full size restaurants. It's kitty corner to the Honda Center, a short 5 minute drive to Disneyland and near some good restaurants and shopping. Plus the price was excellent. I highly recommend the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: All the positive reviews are right folks.
Summary: We stayed here while on a hockey junket to watch three Ducks and Kings games. Of course it is a great location for Ducks games and the freeway to LA is half a block away. Our room was on the freeway side and we could barely hear any traffic noise. Beds were very comfortable and the rooms are a good size. Nice little pool and spa area as well as a compact fitness room. You will hear freeway noise if you plan on laying by the pool though. Great breakfast, with plenty of choices and meat selections alternating between bacon and sausage each day. If you get the package with the JT Schmids voucher included read my review on that restaurant first. Would definitely stay here again on my next trip to the Anaheim area.

Whenever we are in the Anaheim area, whether for business, or to visit Disneyland, we make it a point to stay at the Aryes hotel.  We believe this hotel is one of the best kept secrets out there. The amenities, comfort, and excellent service are all offered at a great price.    The staff at this hotel are always courteous and are eager to help in any way that they can. Dianna Stewart, the Office Manager, is always very patient and helpful to us, and goes above and beyond from what we would normally expect from a hotel.   We appreciate all of her extra efforts and she always makes the stay very special. Further, my wife suffers from a musculoskeletal disorder and needs special accommodations, for which Dianna and the staff always demonstrate tremendous caring.    Finally, the

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel with all amenities included!
Summary: This is the second time I have been to the Ayres Hotel and it is the only place I will stay in Anaheim!  Free parking and internet, free breakfast and managers snacks in the evening.  For sports fans it is right next to the Honda Center (Anaheim Ducks) and Angels stadium (Los Angeles Angels).  The beautiful pool/hot tub and work out center only add to its charm.

Summary Heading: Free HOT Breakfast, Free Internet, Free Parking, Free Beer and Wine--ARE YOU KIDDING ME?
Summary: There are reasons why the Ayres Hotel Anaheim is ranked where it is.  My GF and I just completed our stay and our experience there exceeded all of our expectations.    My review starts long before I even stepped foot through the doors of the Ayres Hotel Anaheim.  Instead I start from the booking process and with a bit of advice‚ÄîSign up and stay informed through their social networking resources.  Approximately two months prior to my trip I started following Ayres Hotels on Twitter and throughout the week they would post coupon codes and other deals.  It was here that I learned about their different properties and different promotions that they offer.  After I started following them on Twitter I also tweeted questions and they were promptly responded to.  I asked a question about

Summary Heading: Great Staff, Great Room & Great Breakfast
Summary: Wow, what a great hotel and staff! Some of the reviews were negative about the front desk, but this is not true; the men and ladies who were at the front desk were amazing from day one! They helped us out with local information, lending us a pair of scissors when we needed it and said "hello" ever time we walked in. We never saw a grumpy person working the desk.   Room --> The beds were very comfortable. My husband always complains about hotel beds (this includes 5 start hotels), but he had nothing but good things to say about the mattresses, we both had a great sleep. The housekeeper cleaned our room and bathroom everyday and we had new towels and sheets each day.  We enjoyed the FREE internet and FREE Parking; great value.  Breakfast --> 5 stars!!!! I don't enough to say here;

WOW! What a nice place! I stayed here with my boyfriend in August. We were traveling to Disney, San Diego and LA.  We only planned staying at this hotel for one night but ended up loving it and staying a second.  Very close to Disney, however we rented a car, It is "walkable" but a little more walking than I would like to do.   The rooms were gorgeous!!! We got a great deal (under $80) and was originally thinking that the rooms would be crappy but I was soooo surprised!!.  The pool was a little small but just perfect since there was only about 3 people in it at all times. On our trip we stayed at 2 other hotels, ranging from $120-$160 and this was by far the nicest!!!!!!! Wish we could have stayed there the whole trip! There was a small gym with maybe 5 machines, but who wants

Summary Heading: THE BEST HOTEL AND SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED
Summary: This hotel is a small family run business with class written all over it. Professional staff from the ground up. It was great to see each department helping each other. I've worked on 6 star cruise ships and worked in 5 star hotels. This Hotel cares about it's guests plain and simple. We celebrated our wedding while staying at this hotel and we loved every minute, not one bad thing to say.  FREE PARKING, FREE INTERNET, FREE BREAKFAST. The is the best deal in Anaheim. Highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Outstanding service and value for money
Summary: We spent three nights at the Ayres, Anaheim, with our three children aged 9, 11 and 14 oohing years. Nothing was too much trouble for the incredibly friendly staff. Our kids loved the breakfast chefs who involved them in a friendly pancake-making competition. The rooms were clean and well serviced. We had an issue with the tap in our bath which was sorted out immediately and when we had trouble finding a cab after dinner one night the hotel organised transport for us and followed up to make sure we were picked up. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Davies Family,  Thank you so much for your kind review. I wanted to let you know that despite our initial misadventures Berenice and I have improved in our pancake making. Berenice recently beat me in a rematch and her Mickey Mouse pancakes no longer look like Koalas with oversized ears and my Van Gogh tendency has been overcome as well!!! I do hope we will have the chance to host you again.  All the best,  Marcus

Summary: I attend a trade show (NAMM) each January at the Anaheim Convention Center, and this is my fourth stay at the Ayers Hotel in Anaheim. The rooms and service are exceptional. Although it's a 2.5 mile bus ride from the Convention Center, I prefer this location because it's much quieter than the hustle and bustle of NAMM at hotels closer to the Convention Center.

Summary Heading: A mixed feeling about this establishment
Summary: This hotel has great breakfasts with variation on main dishes each day. All the cook were friendly. The front desk is a different story depends on whom you deal with at what time. Most of them have this blank look on their faces but some of them are very friendly when you deal with them. The room design is great. The vanity is separate from the shower/toilet area. The room size is better than most of other hotels, including the name brands, and the beds are rather comfortable. I would go back to this hotel if the front desk attitude is more consistent. The unfriendly ones we encountered really made us feel unwelcome.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post a review and give some frank feedback. I am concerned that your experience at the front desk was disappointing. I have discussed it with my front desk staff and I am in the process of writing some training material that directly addresses inconsistency in service delivery. I do hope that you will return to find that we have taken your comments seriously and find only friendly faces at the front desk.  With best wishes,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I'm always nervous about booking hotels online and I wasn't dissapointed with the Ayres. My family and I stayed here from Dec.24-27 when we took our girls to Disneyland for Xmas. The hotel is great, breakfast was awesome and the front desk staff couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. We didn't experience any of the rudeness another reviewer commented on. Kathleen was great. She offered to call the restaraunt that we were dining at on Xmas Eve and got us put on the priority seating list. It was great not having to wait in line with the probably 40 other people waiting in the restaraunt when we got there. We bought all of our tickets for Disneyland and the ART at the front desk, which was really convenient.   The hotel sent a satisfaction survey about 2 days after our stay and

Summary Heading: We are fairly picky and this hotel was amazing!
Summary: I had a good feel for this hotel from my very first contact.  I was in contact with this hotel via email.  They were extremely professional and prompt.  So after comparing with many others in the area, we booked with confidence with Ayers Anaheim.  Am I ever glad we did.  Often when I go to a hotel, the lobby is really nice, but then the rooms really don't match.  It is almost like now that we have your money, we will just shove you into this closet and you have no choice but to stay there.   The rooms look very high end.  I have stayed in very high priced hotels and this is up there with the nicest decors of them.   I always miss my bed when I go on vacation.  This time I didn't!  The beds are very comfortable.  Even the chair at the desk is comfortable!   Our 3 girls used the

We stayed at the Ayres on a recent trip to Disneyland. I was nervous about the rest of my family liking it as they put me in charge of the hotel. We all really enjoyed our stay there. Our rooms were adjoining which was great as my parents and our little one stayed together and my husband and I were in the next room. It worked out well as we could hang out in one room while our son slept. The rooms were nicely decorated and had a sink, microwave and fridge with some storage under the sink. They had a couch with a coffee table, a desk and a small table with two chairs. The beds were comfy and I liked the duvet. The trip to Disney by car was about 15 minutes and by taxi it was about $15 dollars. We took the ART back one night and it seemed to be okay although had alot of stops.

I choose this hotel  because of the good  reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is close to Disneyland. We had 2 adults and 2 small kids . We stayed there for 3 nights in Dec 2010.  The hotel is quite nice, decor is good, and the overall room, furniture  was all very good.  The location was also very good as we had our own car and were only 10 minutes away from Disneyland.  RONT DESK Staff was okay.But !!!!!!!!!!!!! Impoliteness of managers....MAKES THIS HOTEL a 2 strar..
Manager Response: I was terribly disappointed to read your review and hear of your experience. I am afraid you must have found us at our worst. The gentleman you spoke with was not a manager and did not intend to offend you in any way. I am so sorry that he came across that way. I am sorry that you experienced a generally unhappy atmosphere and I am afraid that I can not put a finger on anything in particular. We are fortunate here to work in a very busy hotel, which also receives very positive feedback. I have not received similar feedback about unhappy staff in the past and I am concerned that you observed that. I have sent an email of apology to you as well as some questions regarding your experience. I look forward to hearing from you.  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: Styled as a European hotel, the Ayres Hotel exceeded our expectations from check-in to check-out. We chose the Ayres because of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor and it's location close to Disneyland.   The Anaheim Resort Transit (ART) shuttle picks up at the front door of the hotel and drops off Disneyland. Buy a ticket at the front desk--it's convenient and inexpensive. As other reviewers have mentioned, the trip TO Disneyland is much quicker than the trip FROM, as the Ayres is the 2nd last stop on the route. We didn't mind the slow return trip, but one day we discovered that the #50 bus on the regular Anaheim transit route goes straight down Katella (around the corner from Disneyland, and directly to the hotel)--it took about 10 minutes. The first shuttle stops at the hotel

this was a great hotel, we got a good deal for $99 a night and it's located conveniently close to the AMTRAK station in Anaheim. You get a clean and comfortable room (ask for one with a view of the disneyland fireworks) and free (fairly basic) breakfast- although mickey mouse pancakes were great.We had no car so we bought tickets for the disneyland shuttle, $4 a day per person and you can ride as many times as you like. the shuttle only comes every our (other hotels that were closer have a shuttle every 20 mins). Free wine reception at night was a nice touch although the wine wasn't very nice, the snacks and beer was good. overall i would recommend.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, would definitely stay again
Summary: We recently traveled up to Anaheim to see a hockey game right across the street at the Honda Center. We chose it because we could just walk across the street and not have to deal with driving/parking/etc to the game. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The bathrooms were nice and updated with a large shower. Our king room had a nice little sitting area with a couch and fridge and microwave. While we didn't need any of this during our stay, I could see where this would come in handy for families traveling with kids or even if we stayed longer than one night. Our room was on the first floor, which at first I was a little nervous about, considering noise on the main level, but you couldn't hear anything! The rooms were very quiet and also

I have been to other fine Ayers Hotel before I knew of trip advisor. Let me say the general, perfect free breakfast , nice rooms, secure parking and with AtM  bus pass ( you buy there) at the hotel entrance --heavenly. My report is not so much the hotel and its fine staff but one man especially, ANDREW.  Andrew helps beyond the 100% not just a job to him, I was at the desk a lady gave him flax and as a management  retired supervisor of a 500 company I would have had enough. It wasn,t about the hotel but that her family had to pay for rides to Disney. ANDREW was polite and handled it better than I could  the lady wished him a Merry Christmas when he was done. What more can one say.

Stayed here with a group of 4 rooms.  Excellent value, great rooms and amenities  (the tub was huge, soft toilet paper, changed breakfast choices daily and was well-stocked).  Only negative was the mattress was a little soft, and our room was a little musty smelling.  However, would definitely return in the future!!
Large, clean, quiet room and we slept great! The staff was friendly and funny, and the breakfast was fresh and tasty. We would definitely stay at an Ayres Hotel again.

Summary Heading: Exceptional Hotel,  specifically service, location, cleanliness, & value!
Summary: We stayed with two young children at the end of October for two days.  We changed all of our hotel arrangements at the very last minute, after reading reviews on this site that were quite concerning--of other well known hotel franchises that we have stayed frequently at in other parts of the country.   I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel, of which this was our first stay and I am a very picky consumer/mother.  They were very helpful over the phone, very courteous when we arrived, the rooms were very clean and spacious, the breakfast was great, and location was perfect.  Close to many things, yet away from crowds, and the staff were always willing to answer questions about where something was, good places to eat, etc.  It is a great value, specifically when you

Summary Heading: Excellant rates for a Great Hotel for Disneyland Vacation with Kids
Summary: We stayed here for three nights at the end of October. The hotel is 10 minutes from Disneyland which is what we were looking for.  Free parkng, free wireless internet, and best of all a great free full hot continential breakfast in the morning.  With two kids the free breakfast complete with Mickey Mouse pancakes save us a lot of time and money each morning.  Highly recommend this hotel.  Its a great value.  Rooms were clean and spacious.  No problems whatsoever.

Previous reviewers for this hotel have already highlighted the excellent service, facilities and benefits that are included in the rate of the hotel and I can only concur with the views of the vast majority of reviewers that the Ayres Anaheim is a great place to stay whether for business or leisure.  Sure, you may get a better rate at some other hotels in the area, but what you need to consider is that parking, breakfast, snacks, unlimited free internet (wireless and cabled) and alcoholic drinks in the afternoon are all included in the rate.   Parking charges and 'Resort Fees' are a particular annoyance of mine and the free parking was a factor when booking the hotel. When all of the other benefits that the Ayres provide are taken into consideration; I believe this represents

I thought this hotel was great! friendly staff upon entering and the rooms were spacious.  I liked that the room had a microwave and a mini fridge, And the sink and the bath were separated.  The beds were really comfortable and clean ( the sheets felt nice and crisp!)  Did not hear any freeway noise at all.  The hot breakfast was great and the service very fast! Jose was great and very friendly, he made my children mickey mouse pancakes!  The drive to Disney was not bad at all, very quick it didnt feel like a 10 mins Drive.  The only downside to this hotel is that they did not have a resturant (but one was located right beside) and not enough childrens tv channels.  My husbands complaint is that the Furniture looked dated, but he likes the more modern style and clean lines.  So

Although primarily a business hotel, we found it perfect for our Disneyland trip.  The Anaheim shuttle picks you up at the front door.  The location is half way on the route, so the ride is not long in either direction.  Very comfortable bed and room.  Hot breakfast was fresh and tasty.  Friendly staff.

We stayed here to go to disneyland.  its a bit away from disneyland however this is easily fixed with the transport system coming to the front door.  The hotel is lovely with great helpful staff.  We had a room with a view of Disneyland fireworks and also lucky enough to have a view of angel stadium fire works as well both brilliant.  buffet breakfast is nice as well with a great selection.  the most comfortable beds ever.  there was no restaurant on site for dinner however there is one next door that is lovely with a wide selection of great food.

Summary Heading: Consistently great, you can't go wrong here
Summary: My family and I stay at the Ayres Anaheim every time we go to L.A., which, with young children, is about once a year for a Disneyland trip. We have been consistently delighted with this hotel and always look forward to returning. The rooms are clean, beautifully decorated, have comfortable beds and pillows, and are so quiet you can't believe you're right next to the freeway. We've never heard any noise from neighboring rooms, not even the showers running or toilets flushing, like you do in most hotels. The modest pool area is a nice spot for swimming and relaxing. The staff have always been courteous and professional, and have always been willing to give us an upper floor room upon request. Breakfast is generous and tasty, with so much variety that everyone is bound to find

Summary Heading: Excellent choice for your stay in Anaheim
Summary: We were there for pleasure - Disney - but this seems like a great place to stay no matter what you're traveling for.  It is in a very convenient location close to the freeways, yet it was quiet and comfortable and very well priced given that it includes a full hot breakfast every morning.  We stayed on the 4th floor and didn't here a thing from the inside or out while in the room. The staff were welcoming and helpful and the rooms were comfortable for the 4 of us (Queen beds which are a must). Though we were not there much, the beds slept great and bathrooms were clean and functioning well.  We had a great stay and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.  We drove ourselves to Disney twice, about 10-15 minutes each time so it was close enough to make it home without crabby

Summary Heading: Beats the rest in price, service & accessibility
Summary: We love Disneyland and don't mind staying a few miles away from the park.  The hotels nearby are so expensive but lack the comforts and amenities you expect when paying over 150 dollars a night.  With Ayers, not only did we find the great discounted rate on TripAdvisor, but even without the discount we would pay the regular rate to stay.  The hotel is right off of the freeway ramp, which means easy access.  On top of that, it's on E. Katella, which is a straight shot to the Disneyland parking areas, the gardenwalk and grove, among other things.  Around the corner is the Block at Orange, too, so we loved how it was near everything we wanted to visit.  On top of the accessibility, this hotel has a great room with a couch that pulls out as a bed, the king size bed (if you get this

I really hate a super soft bed, these were nice just right, staff very helpful and friendly. Desk gave us turn by turn when we got lost. Breakfast was good and the sister cooks were very nice Wonderful overall value
Dependable and welcoming. Clean and safe. Super value with everyone always extending. I always stay here when visiting in LA for work. Great AAA rate.

My family and I just returned to Honolulu after a four day stay @ the Ayres Hotel, and I can't say enough superlatives about this hotel!  The hotel is clean, the rooms are so comfortable (no squeezing two bodies on a "queen" bed - ample room!), and the staff is so helpful.  Although the hotel is about two miles from Disneyland and we used the ART for most of the time we were there (ART was slow, but not the fault of the Ayres), we could also drive around Anaheim and Orange County without problem as the hotel was centrally located and in a very safe part of town.  We are definitely returning, or at least using another Ayres Hotel should we travel to other states - awesome!!

I could rave about this hotel (so says my husband), but I know most people reading reviews want the basics, so here goes...from check-in to check-out the staff (Dwight, Tammy and others) and service couldn't have been better...friendly, helpful and nothing seemed too much trouble.  The rooms are gorgeous and very well laid out.  The beds are incredibly comfortable and the quality of the towels and linens wouldn't be out of place in a 5 star hotel.  Very handy to the motorway - not noisy though and we all slept very well.  As we had hired a car the free parking was appreciated.  Close to Disneyland and as others have said, the trip takes 10 minutes and it is a straight run through.  The breakfast is amazing and Jose will make pancakes and french toast to order - there is a

Summary Heading: Great hotel close to chapman university and many attractions with good value
Summary: I flew to LA with my son to visit colleges.  We left very late on Thursday night, then drove to Anaheim and stayed at the Ayres Hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised!  It was easy to find, easy to park, the room was spacious, there was free internet.  Breakfast is included and was quite nice.  The staff were friendly, and went out of their way to be helpful.  When we arrived at 1 am, the person working at the desk was very nice, and helped me print the parking pass and information I needed to visit Chapman University (which is 10 minutes at most from the hotel).  If you are visiting Anaheim for any reason this is a very good choice for a place to stay, and it is close to many other attractions which we did not have time to visit!  I travel a lot for work, and this hotel was nicer

We booked this property after researching it here on Trip Advisor and the high rating from others is accurate and deserved.  Having stayed several times at the Homewood Suites to 'do Disneyland' we decided to try somewhere different.  Very easy to find on Katella Ave just next to the 57 freeway, but no traffic noise, and it is a straight run on Katella to Disneyland.  One tip - we decided not to use the ART shuttle (would have been $9 for the three of us) and opted to drive and park at Disney instead.  Parking there is more expensive at $15 but the ART shuttle only runs ONCE per hour so a lot of time would be wasted waiting for it, and missing rides at disney to be back at the shuttle area.  Disney do allow in and out privileges for the parking.  Check-in around 8.30 pm was a

The service at Ayres was fantastic!  From the moment we checked in to the moment we left these guys were great! Even when we asked where to shop we were pointed in the right direction! Nothing was a problem.  The rooms were clean, quiet & very comfortable.   After huge days at Disneyland it was like coming home and the staff at the front office were always their to greet you with  a smile!   We would be more then happy to stay at Ayres again.

We went in late August with our children as we wanted a top-class hotel to stay in whilst we visited the Disney parks. The hotel was very impressive and totally lived up to our expectations. All the staff were very friendly, the room was clean and very comortable and we couldn't have asked for more. The warm cookies on arrival were a bonus!!!  I would highly recommend Ayres and would definitely stay here again.

There is a reason this hotel was rated this well.  I'm a Disney veteran and have stayed at many other "luxury" hotels in this area and have been less than happy, so when I saw all the good reviews for this place I couldn't believe it, as the price wasn't exorbitant. But everyone was right!  This place lives up to its reputation. The rooms are quite large -- plenty of room for our suitcases. There is a desk and another little table with chairs.  The bathroom was fine because the sink was outside of the rest of the bathroom.  The woman at the breakfast area was very friendly and went out of her way with service.  The front desk people were very nice too.  It was fine that it wasn't that close to Disney because if one knows the roads (ask before you leave if you don't), you can get

The rate for the Ayres Hotel was lower than the normal cost so we decided to try out the Ayres because of the good reviews. My stay was satisfactory.  When we first checked in, it was very late at night. The front desk man was standing outside and saw us driving into the parking lot. However, he frightened us in a way. The lobby was very dark since the lights were not on at all. In fact, the only light on was the hallway which barely shined through the lobby and his desk lamp on his desk. When we went back to get our luggage, we saw him just standing in the middle of the hallway and just looked at us as we were walking to our rooms. This was one of the reasons why I would have dropped the service to a lower grade, but the lady behind the breakfast counter and housekeeping made

Summary Heading: Deserves to be No 1 - this place is awesome
Summary: I agree with everything positive said about this place, I could wax lyrical for pages!!  The location literally just off the freeway next to a ramp was a bit of a surprise but we never noticed any noise even in rush hour.  Ten mins from Disney, half an hour from LAX outside rush hour, parking, internet & breakfast included, a fantastic rate anyway but even better as we stayed for a week.  What more could we ask.  On check in we were offered a choice of rooms but they recommended facing the freeway on the top floor to be above the noise and so we could see the nightly fireworks at Disney (something you pay a lot extra for in some hotels).  We would also be front row for the Angels fireworks as there was a home game during our stay and they let them off on ground just the other

Summary Heading: great hotel great value will definitely stay here again
Summary: our stay in anaheim at the ayres for the nalc convention on 8/9 tthru 8/13  was made even more enjoyable by the excellent accomodations provided by the ayres hotel anaheim from the morning breakfast , the closeness to angels stadium and the honda center as well as the freeway we could not have been happier we were able to use the ARTshuttle to take us to the convention center as well as the garden walk and block of orange shopping. even though we had a car you save money on parking by using the shuttle. the rooms were very comparable to many 4and five star hotels that we have stayed at from the soft bedding to the size and cleanliness of the bathroom it was a great value for the money we paid for the room microwave and fridge was nice as well

Summary Heading: Wonderful for those who attend convention or do Disneyland
Summary: As I told the Manager, this place has all the amenities needed for a week's stay, great rooms with great beds, a great breakfast, a nice pool and spa, and the weekday afternoon hospitality to welcome you back from a day's work.  Still, there is that extra something that this hotel offers, many haven't yet written about.  The staff is attentive, caring and it seems they all do really enjoy their work.  It makes a great place to stay one that makes me sorry this family owned chain doesn't have hotels everywhere.  Move over Embassy Suites.  The coffee in the room was actually better than the coffee at breakfast.  The eggs are great, but look at the pancakes or French toast made to order to get a variety over the different days stay.  We got to have a filling breakfast that tided us

Since I am from the East Coast, I had never heard of this chain of hotels.  Upon recommendation from our travel agent, we stayed here and I am soooo glad.  The staff is so  nice and professional.  The rooms were beautiful and the breakfast was wonderful.  One thing I really liked is that the lavatory and shower are in a separate room from the sink/counter/vanity so I could get ready while my husband got his shower and I did not have to deal with a steamy mirror! :)  Seems like a little thing, but really appreciated.  For the price, this hotel cannot be beat!!  If I ever visit So. CA again, I will be sure to stay in an Ayres hotel!!!  An added bonus was that we got to watch the fireworks at Disneyland from our room one night and the fireworks from Angel's Stadium another night!

This is a charming hotel -- very comfortable beds, well appointed rooms, fresh baked cookies and pleasant staff.  Breakfast is very good too. Don't plan on walking to Disneyland though. It's about 2 miles away from the hotel. You can take the city transit but we just parked our car in the Disney lot for $14/day instead. The swimming pool is very small, but we didn't use it since we were gone all day anyway.  We will definitely stay here again when in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in a long time. Would always stay here when visiting Anaheim area.
Summary: Checked in on a Friday evening, quick and smooth. Stayed in Room 204. Room is perfect. Large, ceiling fan, large tub, great shower, comfy beds, nice flat screen TV, desk/work area, fan in washroom to suck steam out from shower which you rarely find these days, free parking, nice pool, great HOT tub/spa, small excersize area with clean washroom, very good breakfast for all 4 of us each morning including pancakes, eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, fruit, yogury, bagels & sweets. Shuttle to and from Disney and area for $12 for 3 adults and 1 child which allows you to ride it all day, quiet hotel great for sleeping. Minor negative - only 1 computer to use to go online but it was always available when I needed it. First time we've not taken any laptops so the kids weren't happy when
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your very kind review. Please pass on my apologies to the kids and let them know that the Facebook block was not intentional. We have fixed the problem and Facebook is now available. I hope that we will have the opportunity to host you again sometime in the not too distant future.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Classy boutique hotel with style and location!
Summary: We stayed here to take in an Angels night game and didn't want to be driving around in the dark after the game getting back to some distant hotel.  We walked easily to the game from the hotel- it could not have been more convenient. This hotel has a very European feel, nice paintings on the walls of the corridors, rooms well appointed, lovely lobby where they have a 5:30 wine and cheese type thing with sodas, chips cookies as well.  Breakfast was excellent and abundant, with hot and cold items and a gentleman who made pancakes for you.  Price was very reasonable and truly, we felt pampered here.  We would definitely come back again!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, made this picky person happy!
Summary: I am an extreamly picky person when it comes to hotels and I must say Ayres Hotel Anaheim made me very happy! The rooms have lots of space(we had 2 queen room), and we fit out pack n' play for our 11 month old in there with no problem!  The beds are wonderful, and I suffer from back problems, so I really appreciated the quality of mattress.  The room was super quiet too! Our room was super clean and the decor and quality of furnishings-outstanding. The breakfast selection every morning was very good.  I found the pancakes to be much better than the french toast, but that is just my opinion.  I really wish that they had offered bananas every morning, with two little ones that is a staple for us. Really the only thing that was a drawback was that it was not closer to Disneyland,

We loved staying here for 3 nights!  Our family thought the room was very clean and spacious.  And we loved the breakfast that was included every morning (what a great and friendly chef:)!   Diana, the mgr., was very helpful with our requests we had while staying in CA.  We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim for the great price, location, and cleaniness.  Perfect place if you're going to the Angels game!!

As previous reviews state, this is a good option for Disneyland.  Not walkable, but a very 10 minute drive.  Great complimantary breakfast and larger rooms than I expected.  Thanks for the previous reviews, this was a good start to my holidays.

My daughter and I traveled to Anaheim the end of June, beginning of July. We spent 5 nights at the Ayres to spend our days at Disneyland. We did not have a car and this was the biggest issue with our stay at the Ayres.  First, let me say, the hotel is beautiful, quiet and clean. We loved our room and were very comfortable. The bed was comfortable as were the pillows! The room is big. The staff were very friendly and efficient. When we got into our room, I called the front desk to ask for more hangers and another luggage stand and both were brought within minutes! My only complaint - the in-room coffee, it was awful! The windows open, the ceiling fan was a welcomed addition. One night we saw the DL fireworks from our window. Another night- the Angel Stadium (right next door) had

Summary Heading: A great Disneyland Stay in Anaheim
Summary: My husband and I and our 8 year old daughter stayed here for 3 nights in early July.  The room was spacious; the bedding was very comfortable, extra pillows, extra chairs in the room plus a small table.  We had a refrigerator, microwave coffeemaker, very nice layout for our stay.  The hotel staff were very friendly; greeted us every time we went thru the lobby.  Breakfast was wonderful; cooked eggs, pancakes, hashbrowns, plus yogurt, fruit and cold options.  The restaurant that provided room services, JT Schmidts (right next door); had amazing food.  Try the Jamaican Shrimp or the Buffalo Chicken Salad;  VERY tasty!  The hotel is about 3-4 miles from the disney entrance for autos; so very convenient, and out of what we call the 'disney zone' and the throngs of people.   Only

After reading all of the reviews we had very high hopes for this hotel, most were met or exceeded.  The hotel was cozy, clean, and provided free parking and breakfast.  I really have no complaints, for the price it was a great hotel.  My only  complaint was that it wasn't really that close to Disneyland (about 10-15 min drive depending on traffic). We had left our kids with relatives at the Disneyland hotel so that we could spend some adult time, and the drive took quite a while.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for a little extra driving
Summary: We stayed here for two nights while visiting the Disneyland Resort.  After a $10 off per night coupon with Expedia, we paid $80 a night before tax.  PROS: They had no problem letting us check in about an hour and a half early (1:30 vs 3).  The hotel was immaculate.  Very clean and very nicely decorated.
