This nice decor carried over into the rooms which featured nice furniture and a wet bar.  The included "free" breakfast was great.  Eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, pancakes if you asked, and normal continental fare.  The breakfast room was nicely decorated like the rest of the hotel.  The hotel's pool was small but well secluded.  The hotel's fitness center actually had free weights.  The bathrooms have fans, something that seems to be rare in a hotel.  The front desk staff was

Summary Heading: Best value for money... perhaps anywhere??
Summary: Wow, what a fabulous hotel for the price. Arguably the best value for money we've ever experienced. Great room, great beds, great bathroom, close proximity to Disneyland, excellent breakfast, internet, parking... all for $90 per night! (booked online from the hotel's website).  After staying at several overpriced dumps in Anaheim, I will certainly be spreading the good word on this place!
Manager Response: Best subject line for a review.........perhaps ever!! Thank you so much for your kind comments. I do hope that we will have the opportunity to host you next year too.  With best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary: I stayed here along with my wife an a toddler. We discovered this place while searching for decent hotels close by Disney and we are so glad to have stayed here. No wonder why this place has so many positive reviews. If I were to sum up our experience in one word: "AWESOME".  Everything from check in to hotel staff, room quality, bed comfort was excellent. The only minor downside is it takes about 20 mins to the resort using the shuttle or your own car. However, that didnt bother us and we are coming back to this hotel next time.  Tip: We found the best deal on this hotel via Expedia. Go stay here and you wont be disappointed.

Summary Heading: AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING, Did I say Amazing!!!!!
Summary: This hotel is so wonderful.  I mean really wonderful!  We stayed in supposedly "nice" hotels all across California and this was really the nicest hotel!  Even though we paid more for some others.  IT IS: exceptionally clean, very elegant, great full breakfast, very friendly staff, free parking, the bed was to die for, the room is beautiful and clean clean clean, 2 miles from disneyland, great internet reception for the laptop, BEAUTIFUL FURNITURE AND BED LINENS! There is a petition between the bed and the living room area. Great for my husband to get up and not worry about waking me.  Wet bar in the living room area with the frig and microwave. Wonderful!  Wonderful!  They took the time to change our room from 2nd floor to 1st floor when my husband asked for it. They glady gave

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel at a great price
Summary: We stayed for a total of six nights at the Ayer's Hotel and had a wonderful experience. The full breakfast was a great way to gear up for a long day at Disneyland. The beds are very cozy and the rooms clean.  The only issue we had was that on our second stay the water pressure was very weak. During our first stay the room had a different shower head with excellent water pressure...wish that was the case in all the rooms. Overall this hotel is an excellent value and we will definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: An Elegant Hotel in the right location
Summary: We stayed at the Ayers of Aneheim when we attended the Stars on Ice program at the Honda Center in Aneheim. It is located right across the street from the Center and staying there gets you free parking which otherwise cost $20. The hotel is clean friendly and has a great breakfast all included in an affordable price. It is also adjacent to the Angel Stadium, and we have stayed here before when we attended a game. The rooms are comfortable, richly decorated and fully functionable. No road noise can be heard and the hotel is quiet. It is a real gem when attending any event in the area.

Travelled with wife and friends for a week in Southern California.  The Ayres Hotel Anaheim was the perfect location.  Friendly staff, great rooms, fabulous breakfast, easy walk to Angels Stadium and easy access to freeways to take in other LA sights.  The resort shuttle was a convenient way to get to Disney and back.

We stayed here for 4 nights to visit Disney and the Queen Mary at Long Beach and chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews.  We weren't disappointed. Very welcoming desk staff, lovely rooms and high housekeeping standards. Breakfast complimentary and included a chef making pancakes fresh to order. Laundry facilities available plus outside pool - all this made the stay exceptional value. You are also very close to the Angels stadium and less than 1 mile is a multiplex cinema, Starbucks and several better than average family restaurants including the Lazy Dog which is also great value. We were concerned that we may be stranded in the US due to the volcanic ash disruption and made tentative enquiries about extending our stay - the guy on reception was very sympathetic and

This hotel is our first choice when we attend Angels games, because it's a 10- or 15-minute walk to the stadium's front gate.  What other reviews haven't mentioned is that you're also a 10-minute walk from the Anaheim train station. If you talk to the front desk--and if their shuttle is available--they'll even run you over to the station or pick you up from it.  You can get a Metrolink train to Union Station (about a 50" trip), giving you access to Olvera Street and downtown LA. And from Union Station, you can take the Metro Red Line to Hollywood and Universal Studios (an additional 15-30 minutes). No fighting traffic, finding and paying for parking, etc..   South from Anaheim, you can take an Amtrak train to San Diego, where you can easily transfer to ground transportation to

Summary Heading: Wonderfully serene at a decent price
Summary: My family and I (my mom & dad, myself & my husband, and my son (6 yrs.) and daughter (2 yrs.) recently returned from our trip to Disneyland, Anaheim during our spring break vacation.  And this was definitely THE place to be.  The Ayres Hotel Anaheim was close enough to the Disneyland Resort and the use of ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) was not too bad.  Of course, we often had to wait a while for it arrive but it really was not that stressful.  The ride from the hotel to Disneyland was not that long and we were happy not to rent a car just to have it sit in a parking lot.  For the price of the day passes with ART, we couldn ªt go wrong.  It worked for us during this trip.  The Ayres hotel itself is simply stunning.  We come from Hawai ªi, and staying at the Ayres hotel was

Summary Heading: It is always the same- Excellent!
Summary: The front desk staff always goes out of their way to be welcoming and recognize me individually. I can count on assistance with packages, lending of scissors, tape, advice and guidance. The hotel policies of extending every assistance is why I can count on the security of getting my CA business done, without worrying about my accommodations. The rooms are immaculate. The breakfast is abundant and delicious. The kitchen and breakfast room- well stocked and also immaculate. The staff, friendly and cheerful. Around the property, I always feel safe.  The experience is always the same- I feel like I am at a second home.

My family and I stayed here on our first visit to California.  It is by far one of the BEST hotels that we have stayed at for the money.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The rooms are beautiful -- not like a "typical" room that you get at a more traditional hotel.  Oriental rugs, poster beds, and a charming pool area.  It felt more like a resort than a hotel.  The fresh baked cookies every afternoon were a particular hit with our children.  The hot full service breakfast every morning was also delicious.  Better than a cold doughnut anyday.  I would definitely stay here again.

We stayed in Anaheim to do some general sightseeing and to go to a hockey game. One thing no one seems to mention is that they sell the parking spaces in this hotel on game night. There were two games the week we were there.  One our car stayed in the hotel parking lot.  We attended the hockey game  The other we were verbally assulted by a parking attendent that insisted our tag should be on the dash of our car, before we were parked and while our windows were down.  We had not even pulled into our spot before he jumped in front of our car.   Another thing that was horrible was the street noise from the front of the building.  Suite 401, I woke every morning at 4:30 am with traffic noise which went on all day and night.  You could even hear the traffic in the shower.  Not our
Manager Response: I am so sorry that your stay was not as it should have been. The room that you stayed in should not have been allocated to a guest staying longer than one night during a hockey week, the TV should have been replaced, and the parking attendant should have been more moderate in his approach. I have responded to these issues, training the staff on the appropriate allocation of rooms, speaking to the Parking Company about training their staff and I have addressed the issue with the TV on two levels. We are setting up a program whereby a guest will receive a notification that an engineer has visited the room and what he has done to fix the problem. We are also buying new Flat Screen TVs for all the rooms.  I hope you do decide to come back, if the noise and the TVs are stopping you, then we will certainly have both addressed by the time you are next in Anaheim.  All the very best,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Best in the area by far
Summary: I have stayed here dozens of times over the last 6 years on business and personal travel and have never wanted to stay anywhere else!  Rooms are attractive, comfortable, and clean, staff is fantastic, and they serve a good free breakfast.  It has the feel of a European boutique hotel and is very close to good restaurants, the Honda Center, and other attractions.  Since it is off the freeway and across the street from the Honda Center it can get a little noisy but it is not so bad that you cannot get a good nights rest.  The beds are some of the most comfortable I have slept in on travel and I spend a lot of time each year in hotels.  All in all this is one of the best finds in the Orange County area and I know will regret praising it when I have to book a stay next time.

Summary Heading: Hotel is Nice, Staff and service is so-so
Summary: Picked the Ayers because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor.   The hotel is close to Disneyland.  We had 2 adults and 2 small kids aged 4 and 1.  We stayed there for 3 nights in Nov 2009.  The hotel is quite nice, decor is good, and the overall room, furniture etc was all very good.   The location was also very good as we had our own car and were only 10 minutes away from Disneyland and most other destinations in Orange.  Staff was okay but scarce.  We had a generally bad experience with the Breakfast which was included in our room rate.  The staff was moody and seemed unprofessional.  We ate there once, but after the poor and inattentive service, we decided to eat  out every morning.  We this felt frustrated as we were paying twice for breakfast, once at the hotel and the
Manager Response: I am writing to apologize for your disappointment while staying here. As you may have noticed from other reviews, our breakfast is normally a positive experience, so I am particularly sorry that we let you down in this respect. I was concerned to read that your experience was so bad that you chose to go elsewhere for your breakfast and can understand why you would feel frustrated by the costs. Please do respond to the private message I have sent you so that we can resolve this issue to your satisfaction. Lastly, thank you for taking the time to give credit where it is due, noting the quality of the hotel and that we had followed up with you.  Thank you,  Marcus Collins  General Manager

Summary: We stayed at the Ayers Hotel for two lots of seven nights over xmas. The hotel was great and the staff were very friendly. I can definetly see why this is Rated number 1. You are not just another customer you get a more personlised service than larger hotels.  Marcus and Andrew were absolutely wonderful on helping us with information on things around LA. We had a hire car so Disneyland was only a 10 minute drive away or you can catch the ART shuttle.   The breakfast was great, the kids loved the pancakes. The kitchen staff are great and also really friendly. This is a great saving as same breakfast purchased elsewhere was $50.00. The free internet and free parking was great.   Yes we also loaded up our own luggage onto bellhop trolley but didnt have a problem with doing this

We stayed here for one night in October so we could attend the Lakers pre-season game at the Honda Centre, which is just across the road from the hotel.  I chose the hotel because of it's location and we were very very happy with our stay here.  I just can't say enough good things about this hotel.  The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was excellent - well presented and spotlessly clean.  Nice pool and fitness centre is available for guest use, and plenty of parking on site.  Breakfast is included and was excellent.  They have a friendly chef working in the breakfast area to serve you up freshly cooked eggs and potatoes etc.  Nice selection of other foods available too.  There isn't a restaurant in the hotel but we ate dinner at JT Schmid's just over the road

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel at an Incredible Value - Can't wait to return!!
Summary: So I'm pretty big on doing my research and getting the best deal possible for my money.  We decided on a last minute trip to Disneyland over the Christmas Holidays and hence we were on a bit of a budget.  After researching hotel after hotel, I came across the Ayres.  It has excellent reviews but the price was about $133 per night... a bit steep for us.  However, I kept my eye on it and as soon as the price dropped to $88 per night, I grabbed it.  The hotel is impressive and had a Victorian feel to it with plush furniture in the lobby cozied up to an ornate gas fireplace.  The place has a very warm welcoming feel overall and I liked it immediately.  We were give a room on the top floor with a view of the fireworks, without even asking!  Our room had 2 queen beds with lovely large

Stayed here again on this trip to the US after a hassle free stay in May 2009. Nothing is too much for the staff - they are friendly, helpful and very obliging. We walked across the road to a Ducks game and made it our base for our time in LA. The hotel is clean, has all the amenities and the beds are very comfortable. The free breakfast is a bonus and keeps you fueled for the day. A short drive to Disneyland or you can catch the disney shuttle for $4 per person. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Our family stayed in a double queen room December 19th and 20th. This hotel feels brand new, so all the finishes are up to date and comfortable. The beds were some of the best I‚Äôve stayed in, the cleaning was excellent, the breakfast was very good. I interacted with the main desk three different times and had only friendly faces and quick help. We paid only $83 per night booked directly off their website. For this price, this room was a very good deal. Free parking, internet and breakfast!   I am surprised however that this hotel is the #1 ranked for Anaheim. I have stayed in several top 20 in Anaheim hotels over the years and would have expected this hotel a bit lower. The pool was small and in the parking lot, the workout room was a little more than a home gym, the TV‚Äôs were

Our family stayed at the Ayres Hotel for two weeks during September.  We selected this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and also the helpfulness of staff to phone and email enquiries prior to booking.  Our room was nice and clean with comfortable queen beds.  We had a microwave and fridge which meant we could at times have dinner in our room.  There's a heated pool and relaxing spa (especially useful after a day at the park) and we generally had the pool to ourselves.  Self service laundry on our floor was fantastically convenient, especially when staying for such a long period of time - this was generally done between dinner and board games when staying in for the night.    Our daughter has a sweet tooth and looked forward to the free cookies during the week at the

I selected this hotel after reviewing comments from Trip Advisor, and it lived up to it's reviews.  Nice, large lovely European motif rooms, friendly staff and nice complimentary breakfast.  Location was very close to Disneyland.  We had a rental car, so I can't comment on transportation to and from the park.  It was late October and it didn't look like the outdoor jacuzzi got much use.   The temperature was luke warm when I went to use it, so I opted out.  Overall though it was a nice property and I'd stay there again.

Summary Heading: Lovely, comfortable, close to Honda Center
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Hotel for one night while attending an event at the Honda Center.  The hotel was incredibly convenient to the Honda Center - just across the street - which made it very easy for me to just park my car at the hotel and then walk back and forth to the arena.  I loved that the hotel felt like a nicer hotel, with beautiful rooms, comfortable beds, nice bathrooms, etc, without trying to nickel and dime you like a lot of nicer hotels.  Free internet, both wifi and wired, free breakfast, that included a number of hot options (eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc) and a friendly chef to dish them up for you, free cookies and drinks in the evening in the lobby, fridge and microwave in the room, free parking for one car...  The rate I got for the hotel was slightly more

Stayed for 4 nights Oct. 12-16th.  We were travelling with family so they gave us adjoining rooms which worked out great.  10 min. car ride to Disneyland.  Lovely and peaceful to go back to after a day at Disney.  No complaints whatsoever.  Breakfast was great and the chef really friendly.  One of the most comfortable beds I have ever had in a hotel!  Would have no hesitation in returning or reccommending.

Summary Heading: Excellent staff makes this hotel a winner
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Ayres on 9/30-10/4. Unfortunately we were not staying there for vacation. My grandson was having open-heart surgery at CHOC (Children's Hospital of Orange County). From the moment that I spoke to Marcus (the hotel manager) to make the reservations, to the time we checked out (after a successful surgery), we were made to feel warmly welcomed. The hotel is lovely, and the location is great, and on their own those two things would make this a highly rated hotel. But it is the superb staff, most specifically Marcus, that make this THE outstanding hotel to stay at in the Anaheim area. We have stayed at Four Seasons, and Ritz Carltons and never been shown the kindness and caring that we received during this stay. The entire staff made a most difficult

Summary Heading: Easily one of my best hotel experiences
Summary: First, let me say that I am not one to give praise in an off-handed fashion. My wife says that I am hard to please and a complainer, I like to think of myself as having standards and being discerning, lol.  I stayed here for two nights with my family (wife and kids aged 5, 11, 15) for a Disney trip. All of the staff were extremely friendly, efficient and responsive. The whole process from reservations, check-in, the daily full American breakfast, and checkout was a pleasant experience. Staff was knowledgeable about the area and responsive to special requests. The room was very spacious and was spotless, as was the bathroom! The breakfast was served quickly and was delicious!  The hotel does NOT have a shuttle to Disney (despite what is advertised on some sites), but the drive is

I was so excited to stay at this property because it was rated so highly on tripadvisor.  We were traveling with young kids to go to Disneyland.  I would stay here again if it was just my husband and I.  For a more roomier room and family friendly environment I am still fond of Embassy Suites.  The beds here at the Ayres are superb as well as the pillows.  Check in was smooth as well as check out.  We knew we weren't going to experience the complimentary drinks that are offered during the week because we were there over the weekend.  We happened to be in Saturday evening and I inquired about the cookies which I could see behind the receptionist desk in their office.  But, unfortunately they were burnt so they weren't going to serve  any.  I would think, they'd either make more

Stayed here from September 20th thru 26th. The location of the hotel is right off the freeway and as close as you can stay to the Honda Center and Angels stadium. Front staff were good and cleaning staff did a good job as well. Morning breakfast had scrambled eggs hash browns sausage/bacon and the usual cold cereals and misc other fruits and toasts. The workout room had weights and cardio equipment and a nice clean pool/hot tub. If your looking for a hotel close to Disneyland I would look elsewhere there are plenty more closer than the Ayres. If your looking for a hotel centrally located this would be the place. Overall I would stay here again if I was in the area.

Stayed here for 4 nights and I must say I absolutely loved it. I found this hotel on Trip advisor and saw it was the number 1 hotel in Anaheim so booked it. We were mainly there for Disneyland so yes it is a short trip on the ART and the price of $4.00 for a day pass is great. Breakfast is great, the last morning the breakfast room was packed so had to wait but that didnt matter as I checked emails on thefree internet whilst we waited. The rooms were fantastic. The staff are the friendliest I came across in USA which always helps :) Overall you should stay!

stayed 4 nights for disneyland.  We had 2 adults and 2 yound children.  We usually stayed across from disneyland  (hojo and fairfield ) for convenience of walking back for  afternoon naps and taking a break from the heat.  But, my friend recommended Ayres.  Also, the great reviews on tripadvisor made me consider it for this trip.    Although there is no shutte to disneyland, there is an Anaheim resort transit that stopped in front of hotel at 8:30 in the morning.  We decided to park and pay $12 at the theme park.  We paid $83 (expedia) so we figure that is a decent rate since most other hotels are charging parking fee, resort fee, breakfast, internet, fridge and microwave.  These were all included at Ayres.  The weekday cocktail reception at 5:30 had warm baked cookies, cold

Summary Heading: Nice but I will probably not stay there again
Summary: I really liked this hotel but there were a few things that happened that made me not like it as much.  As far as the actual hotel, rooms and breakfast...that was great!  The breakfast is very good but the dining area is very small and sometimes it is difficult to find seats.  It is a short drive or ART ride to Disneyland which makes it a little less convenient but all in all it is not bad.    When we arrived at the hotel around 6:00pm, the air conditioner in our room did not work.  We called down to the front desk and they told us that it sometimes takes a few minutes for it to get going.  We waited and waited and nothing happened, we called back to the front desk and let them know it was still not working.  She told us she would have someone come up and look at it.  We ended up

I was impressed with the meticulous housekeeping, and extremely helpful staff. My spouse and I missed our ART bus one morning (it came earlier than scheduled), and, as it only came once an hour, the manager actually drove us to Disneyland in the hotel van so we wouldn't miss our early entry day! WOW! The location is close to the baseball stadium, which made catching a game easy.   Every morning, the complimentary breakfast was made fresh by the hotel's cook. All meals were filling and substantial. By the end of our week-long stay, we felt at home there, and the cook could predict what my husband would like to have!   I would not suggest this hotel for families planning to spend most of their time at Disneyland. It was not convienient to commute on the ART. We also had to walk

If you enjoy great air conditioning/airflow in a quiet room with nice solid walls, a room that's larger than any standard room I've been in, and a really comfortable bed then look no further. The front desk was continuously staffed by various smiling and considerate professionals.  I was not there to visit theme parks, so proximity to Disney was no issue. This hotel does so much so well, it's crazy that they had such good rates to top off my unwavering fondness of this property.

Summary Heading: Don't stay anywhere else but here!
Summary: I stayed here for two weeks for a business trip.  I have traveled so much in the last seven years so I know a great hotel and staff when I see them! The hotel staff, front desk, Paolo, Jose', and Marcus are the BEST!  The accomodations are superior , housekeeping is super every day and so is the free hot breakfast every morning.  JOSE' will make pancakes or waffles, depending on the day, in addition to the eggs, sausage, hash browns, fresh fruit, muffins and pastries.  The front desk staff are so friendly, service is their priority!  I can't say enough great things about Paolo, he is there all the time...the group I was with and I wondered if he ever went home!  He shuttled us to the corporate office every morning, always smiled, and at the end of our hard day he made sure we

Have just returned from the Ayres Hotel we stayed 4 nights.Excellent rooms very clean.At 5.30pm the hotel does free wine ,beer and salsa and chips in the lobby,my son loved the cookies also.A little far out from universal studios and Hollywood took us a good 2hours to get back one night.Give Knots Berry Farm a miss very expensive to get into and drinks.

Summary Heading: Everyone was happy staying there, including the 2 year old
Summary: We were glad we researched the hotels on trip advisor first, because we usually are Hilton or Marriott guests. We were traveling with another family with children, and found Ayers to be perfect for our needs. We got connecting rooms as requested, very large and clean. We were very satisfied with the free breakfast included in room price. The only thing we would suggest, is that breakfast be served until a little later for those who stay at the parks to midnight. It was hard waking the kids (and the adults) up for breakfast before 9am. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: You Can't Beat an Ayres Hotel
Summary: This is the third Ayres Hotel we have stayed in in the last year. They are special. Clean, friendly, accommodating, great rooms and good breakfasts. If there is one in the area you are visiting, why stay anywhere else? Book thru Hotels.com if you can. They had the best price. ($89)

After checking in our room which was supposed to be non smoking, we found it smelt dreadfully of smoke, so went back down to reception and it was no trouble at all to change to another room with many apologies.  Couldn't believe how spacious and well appointed the room was for the price we had paid!  It was extremely clean and all the furnishings were of good quality and felt quite luxurious!  The complimentary breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice. We spent 7 nights at this hotel and found it convenient to drive to Disney which was only approx 2 miles away, but if you plan to use this hotel as your base to visit Hollywood or Universal Studios, a hotel north of Hollywood would be more convenient as driving on interstate 5 through Los Angeles is horrendous with vast

We booked through Expedia and got a great deal for our four night stay at the Ayres Hotel.  We felt welcome the minute we walked into the lobby.  The staff were more than friendly and helpful. The room was exceptional, both in roominess and cleanliness.  It was relaxing just to be there. We were there  for a nostalgic trip (an early 35th anniversary trip through California) so this was our 5th hotel stay and the best one!  It was also my birthday and we spent two days at area attractions and the beach, etc.  We were on the top(4th) floor so the street noise was not and issue. However ,on Saturday night, there was a concert at the Honda Center and the pub across the street had loud music for awhile.  You may consider asking for a room on the other side of the hotel or bring

Summary Heading: You will not regret staying at this hotel
Summary: I was very pleased with our accomodations at this hotel.  The free breakfast was absolutely great and the manager even served the food.  The staff was friendly and we basically had no problems during our stay.  Free parking is also a plus.  Close to Disneyland.  If you're shopping around for a good deal for the price and the quality of the hotel, I highly recommend this place.

We stayed here and felt the rooms were very clean.  The hotel has a great breakfast and the chef will make you pancakes if you are interested in that.  In the evening through the week they have a snack time which is a nice added touch.  I think you will find this a pleasant experience.  Marcus is real good about addressing any questions you may have.  We really enjoyed our stay here.

Having stayed at 2 of the overpriced, old and tired hotels on Harbor Blvd. on my previous Ahaheim visits I decided to stay at the Ayres after reading all the excellent Trip Advisor reviews. All of the reviews here are absolutely true. The hotel is fairly new, built in 2001, the rooms are more like a 4 or 5 star hotel,very quiet, no noise from the freeway nearby and  extremely comfortable Queen beds and elegant furnishings. The desk staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Manager Marcus Collins was very helpful with our enquiries before our stay, responding promptly to our email queries. The free breakfast is very good with both freshly cooked eggs/sausages/hash browns/bacon available also cereal/fruit/ toast for the more health concious. Its best to arrive at breaakfast before

Summary Heading: No wonder it is highly rated on trip advisor
Summary: I am so glad we booked this hotel for our trip to disney- the rooms are beautiful and clean, free parking, free breakfast- great start to a day in Disney , friendly and helpful staff, heated pool, free cookies and drinks between 5.30 and 6.30 (great to come back to after a day at disney before you get changed to go back for the disney firework display). We will definitely be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Summary Heading: Fabulous hotel - high marks in everything!
Summary: The Ayres Hotel in Anaheim - what a great place.  The art on the walls is classic and the decor is elegant.  Rooms are very clean, employees polite and helpful.  The free breakfast is terrific and it's a REAL breakfast, not just coffee and rolls.  The people at the registration desk are extremely helpful.   The Honda Center is right across the street, a wonderful restaurant is across another street, Angels Stadium is very close.  Disneyland is quite close, too - what more could you want from a hotel?  I give this hotel excellent marks on everything.

We recently had the good fortune to stay at the Ayres hotel.  The room was clean and modern and we had plently of room for all of our luggage. The prime objective of our stay was to take our four year old son to Disneyland.  We used the ART system everyday and purchased the tickets for the bus prior to arrival. On one occasion the bus must have departed early.   We were talking to Marcus the hotel manager about our situation   and he got one of the staff to drive us and some other guests who also missed the bus to Disneyland that day.  Thankyou Marcus it is easy to understand why Ayres is rated no 2 in anaheim on tripadvisor with service like that.   I have one small gripe.  The convenience store located in the hotel foyer does not sell milk.  Our son still drinks bucket loads

This hotel was brilliant. The staff made our stay very enjoyable & looked after my boys (5 & 7) very well.  Using the ART system to to and from Disneyland was easy and convenient.  The pool area was great. Free Carparking a bonus. Full breakfasts included!   The rooms were very comfortable and quiet. The hotel is 4 kms from Disneyland but  is right next to the Honda Centre and the Angels Stadium, so a great location.  Overall fantastic value. Will definately use again.

My family stayed here for the first half of our Summer vacation and we were very sad when we had to leave.  From the moment we walked in the staff made us feel welcome.  The room was spacious and comfortable.  Breakfast was great tho a bit crowded some mornings. My girls loved the pool and the hot tub.  I do want to thank the manager (Marcus Collins) for taking such good care of us and being so nice to our girls.  He even delivered cookies once in person for them to our room!  We definitely will stay there again when we go back to southern California.

We really enjoyed our stay here.  The rooms are very nice, with very comfy beds.  The complentary breakfast was a great value and the staff was both friendly and very helpful with helping us to locate the places we wanted to go and how to get there.  I will be staying here again on our next trip to Disneyland.

We are huge sports fans (from Edmonton, Alberta) and since my boyfriend cheers for Detroit we bought tickets to the Ducks/Wings game about two days before the actual game so we had to find a hotel really fast. We clicked #1 on tripadvisor and decided to stay here as it looked really nice. However, it was beyond really nice. We were greeted by Brittany, who was an absolute sweetheart and some cookies. She asked us if we had a preference and found out we were going to the game so gave us a view of the Honda Center. We got in our room and it was beautiful. The bed was so comfortable, the view was perfect. The staff were amazing here and the chef in the morning for breakfast was so funny and kind!!! We saw quite a few hockey players who were staying here and a sportscaster from our

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels I've stayed in!
Summary: I went to Disneyland with my brother for my birthday on Memorial Day weekend and thought I'd never find a cheap, yet decent hotel where we could crash after a day of fun.   Thankfully, I was wrong! I found the Ayres Hotel and was able to get an amazing special, $93 including taxes for one room with two queens, free wireless internet, free parking, and free hot breakfast.  Andrew at reception was super friendly and asked us where we wanted our room (Want to see Disneyland's fireworks? Want a quiet room? Something on the first floor?). His birthday was a few days earlier and he had also gone to Disneyland and had some good tips.   The room itself was perfect. Clean, spacious and the beds were amazing! My brother is tall (6'3") and has a bad back and he said it was the most

I don't know if this hotel seemed excellent especially after a horrible night at Crater Lake Lodge but this is the best "bang" for the buck I've ever had in a hotel.   I paid only around $130 after taxes but the room felt like it should have cost $200 after taxes. The service was great...the room was clean, the complimentary breakfast was so so but hey it's free.  It's really close to Disneyland, which is why I stayed here and overall it's been the best value hotel on my west coast trip.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay but needs some improvement
Summary: Like all the reviews one reads of Ayres, we were not disappointed. It is a charming hotel, clean and wonderfully located. However, there were a couple of things that I wanted to draw to the attention of management: 1) The pillows on all beds were awful!!!!!!!!!!!!!. They are so high none of us enjoyed them. Which is sad really because the beds were wonderful...  2) We were 4 people staying in the room and there was only one bar of soap placed there for all of us.. We felt like we were scrounging. This included toilet paper as well. Perhaps as we paid for  extra guests there may be consideration and extra toiletrries be placed in the room? 3) Trash cans. There were only two in the room and very small. If we brought dinner to the room or even coffee cups, there was not enough room
Manager Response: Thank you for your favourable comments and approval of the hotel. I did make note of your 3 comments. We would have been happy to have addressed these issues with you had we been given the opportunity to do so. I hope that we will have the opportunity to provide you with a perfect stay on your next visit. If you would be so kind as to advise us of your details we can make a note of your preferences on your profile for future reference.   Thank you so much.  Best regards,  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Absolutely perfect! We loved the room, wonderful service and staff
Summary: My wife and I recently stayed at the Ayres hotel in Anaheim, California. Our experience there was exceptional. We have enjoyed many fine hotels throughout the United States and were quite impressed with Ayres Hotel... the room, cleanliness, amenities, convenience, accessibility and location were perfect. Most outstanding during our short visit was the service we received from all of the staff. Our initial check-in was a delight with a very friendly and courteous welcome at the front desk. We asked for directions to a concert venue and were given specific directions plus a very nice wish to "enjoy the show!"  On our return that evening after the concert, we visited the front desk and purchased a couple of snacks, and again were greeted with a friendly smile, conversation and

Summary Heading: Satisfied my miserly mother and my picky boyfriend
Summary: My mom is cheap and didn't want to spend more than $150 / night at a hotel. Meanwhile, I have a boyfriend who flies business class and stays at the Four Seasons (at least when the economy was good and his company had $.)  So two very different criteria.  Both were happy with this hotel -- the price was right and it's a nice hotel for the price.  My parents went wild over the free breakfast.  My boyfriend did say the Internet connection was slow.  But I would definitely stay here again.  One thing to note -- although Disneyland is only 2.5 miles away, it takes about 15-20 minutes to get there because of all the lights. We had a wedding to go to, and were a bit late because we underestimated the traffic lights.

Summary Heading: Great staff who go the extra mile to make you comfortable
Summary: Every week I stay at the Ayres Anaheim for business.  The staff are personable, accommodating and very professional.   My top marks for this hotel go to the comfort of the beds, the speed of the free wireless internet, the great breakfast and the modern equipment in the small but functional workout room.

I booked this hotel based primarily on the Tripadvisor reviews -- added to the fact that the Disneyland hotel properties were charging truly outrageous prices!  Checked back to look at the reviews the day before we left, and found the angry, disappointed one.  Decided it was worth a look, and found a very lovely hotel.  It is located right across the street from the Honda Center, so would make a convenient base for people attending events there -- as well as Anaheim Stadium.  Nothing was happening either place on the two nights we were there, and the hotel was very quiet and peaceful.  Check-in was great.  (...as were the cookies...) I was greeted with a smile and asked if I preferred a lower room or a higher.  We took the 4th (top) floor, and to be honest, may have been the

Summary Heading: It was a very good stay
Summary: Family and I stayed from April 15 to 23 on the 3rd floor facing the highway (didn't hear any choice from outside).  During our stay, there were 2 Britney Spears concerts, 2 hockey games, and 2 baseball games.  There were at least a couple of nights where 2 events were occurring on the same night.  Hotel is across the street from the arena and about 2 blocks away from the baseball stadium.  During nights of concert/game, it merely took an extra 5 minutes or so to get in and out of hotel so it was no big deal having a major event close by.  The hotel does not offer event parking.  We also didn't see or hear any of the problems previous reviewer mentioned, perhaps they happened on a different floor.  I was usually up until 11 pm and in and out of the lobby regularly.  The hotel

We choose this hotel over the Doubletree Suites based on TripAdvisor reviews, and I'm very sorry that we did. The rooms were adequate size and the bed was comfortable, but the positives end there.  There were so many things that were disappointing or disturbing to our family. The room was not really clean. There was food stuck to the wall in the room and on the bathroom door frame. The carpet wasn't very clean around the edges, and furniture looked dated, although it wasn't worn. There is a large gap between the tiles and the door frame in the bathroom and it was completely black with dirt and debris. This was particularly disgusting. The bathroom fan was very loud and the water pressure was very poor. The air conditioner leaked liquid onto the carpet most of the time we were
Manager Response: "I am obviously terribly disappointed that your experience was so poor. As you noted on your review we receive many positive reviews and very few poor ones. Please believe me when I say that your experience is very rare. I will be investigating all the issues that you brought up but would first like to quickly address some of your points: The sausages are heated in the oven but they come fully cooked, so please be assured that there is no chance we would ever risk undercooking this food item. We try and make the eggs to the taste of the predominant number of guests and so far it has worked well. If you do prefer your eggs a little drier my chef has certainly heated eggs further in a pan to the customer's taste in the past and would be happy to do so again. You are right about the guest helping my staff member. He was quite the gentleman that evening and he had offered to help as there were guests waiting to check in. It is very rare that our guests are as unseemly as the lady who dropped the beer bottles, but it appears the concert caused a little bit of over-celebrating. The distance to Disneyland Drive is 2 and a 1/2 miles and involves taking Katella to Disneyland Drive. I do apologize if any other directions were given. Again, please accept my sincerest apologies. I only wish that I had had met with you while you were here so that I could address your concerns and turn your experience around. I have emailed you and look forward to hearing from you."  Marcus Collins General Manager

Summary Heading: Friendly service, clean rooms, nice place!
Summary: I recently stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for a trip to Disneyland (we had a car, a must if you are staying at this hotel and plan on going to Disneyland for a few days) and was very pleasantly surprised.  My friend and I were very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel as well as the very friendly staff.  Check-in and check-out were both extremely quick and easy and parking was free - very nice feature these days.  The beds were comfortable and the room included a microwave and small refrigerator.   My only, very minor, complaints are that they could use some new, updated televisions in the rooms and if there is a concert happening at the Honda Center (right across the street) you may have some rowdy crowds later at night.  I would definitely stay there again.

I stayed at the Ayres Hotel for business and was extremely pleased with all aspects of this hotel.  I can now see why my company selects this hotel for all of their guests.  I value customer service more than anything, and this hotel deserves far more than the 5 stars for theirs.  My boyfriend came along, and we were greeted in a very friendly manner anytime we entered or left the hotel.  We had many questions about traveling to Disneyland(I was able to get some free time), where to go, area restaurants, etc.  Andrew at the front next spent quite a bit of time answering our questions, and did so in a most helpful and friendly manner.    Bo at the front desk and Marcus the manager always chatted with us when we came through, and made us feel like they were happy to have us

Summary Heading: At the right price, a fantastic alternative to Disney-hell-hotels
Summary: We choose this hotel because of great reviews, a good price deal (around the $100 mark) and because I hated my stays at the huge hotels around the Disneyland complex.  We drove to Disney which meant we had to pay the $12 charge to park there, but worth it because the thought of public transport after a day at the park was too much to bear!  Agree with everything the other reviewers have said and would DEFINITELY stay there again, with two minor points: 1. it is surrounded by really big roads/freeways that are pretty noisy.  Having said this, it doesn't really stop you from sleeping because it a constant hum rather than the stop-start of cars that I find disturbs my sleep more.  You might want to bring ear plugs if you are noise-sensitive, though I didn't end up using mine. 2.

Summary Heading: GREATEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED AT!!!!!!!
Summary: I cannot say enough about this hotel. We came for spring break vacation, with three kids ranging from 11-15 and they all loved it too. The hotel is beautiful inside and out, the rooms are very spacious, the beds are so comfortable I want one at home. The Staff is amazing. Marcus was so nice and friendly, Andrew as well, all of the staff was increadible. Jesse the cook was fantastic as well. At 5:00pm they have happy hour with fresh baked cookies, and it was just so wonderful. The pool was fun, hottub too. If you don't stay at this hotel you would be missing out on such a great experience. Everything is so nice, the rooms are clean the bathtubs are HUGE! there is plenty of space in your room, everything worked, we were on the third floor and had a great view, I watched my family

Summary Heading: Cannot be beaten...especially for the price.
Summary: Having made a recent trip to Canada for a few weeks with our 10YO, we felt the need to thaw out for a few days in California, before returning back to north Qld here. Using TripAdvisor (as per usual) I found the No.1 rated hotel of choice to be the Ayres Hotel on E.Kattella Ave., Anaheim. The location was ideal..not too far from Disneyland, and also not tainted with the glitz-ey (and consequently 'pricey') aspects of some of the hotels in close-proximity. Let's face it, given a chance we all like to indulge ourselves with a bit of luxury occasionally...and this Hotel caters to that aspect in spades, but the staff also manage to convey a service standard that I have never encountered in a hotel, anywhere, before. They treat the guests as "family" and display a sense of ownership

Stayed here for 4 nights while visiting Disneyland. Had a car (parking free at hotel) and driving to Disneyland took only 5 mins. Full breakfast provided was very good with eggs, sausages, pancakes, fruits, juices, muffins, etc. Hotel was very well kept in both the rooms and public areas. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Booked this hotel after reading the reviews, and true enough my expectations were met. Will recommend to anyone.

We stayed at the Ayres Anaheim for a week in Feb 2009.  It was our first stay at an Ayres property and we were pleasantly surprised by the accommodations & service. The room was spacious and clean.  It was convenient to have laundry facilities nearby.  We almost never had to wait for the elevators.    The front desk staff and general manager were very helpful and we were always met with a cheerful greeting.    The breakfast room was sometimes crowded, but the staff there was always polite and friendly.  There was enough variety of food to choose from including bagels, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereals, sausage or bacon, scrambled eggs, hash browns, and made to order pancakes.    The only thing we didn't like was that, when there was a game or event at the Honda Center, they allowed

My wife and I stayed with friends for a few nights after a long flight from Australia.  The hotel lived up to its glowing reputation from previous Trip Advisor reports in every way.  The location was excellent with good driving access to Disneyland and the freeways to San Diego and LA.  Rooms were extremely well appointed and as comfortable as you could want.  Despite the proximity to freeways, the Ayres Hotel as very quiet with no intruding road noise.  There was also no internal hotel noise either, which was a real surprise - no running water/plumbing sounds at all.  Hotel staff were uniformly helpful and pleasant with tour arrangements, suggestions for nearby places to eat, and even just remembering us well enough to ask about our days at Disneyland and San Diego Seaworld.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, washer/dryer, breakfast included
Summary: I loved this hotel.  The hotel itself was lovely, with great b&w photos of old Los Angeles.  I loved the washer and dryer, I loved that my husband could print things for free in the business center.  I loved that you could use the luggage cart to get your luggage to your room yourself.  The pool is in the parking lot and small.  We were the only ones using it so it was fine. I would stay here again.

I enjoyed staying at this hotel when I was there in Anaheim to go to Disneyland.  The hotel is wonderful and has a great staff as well.  I enjoyed talking with the chef.  He‚Äôs a sweet guy.  The general manager, Marcus is great too as well as Dianna at the front desk.  Even Pablo that served the happy hour items was so polite.  The room was fabulous and everyone went out of their way to make my stay very comfortable and pleasant.    It's nice to be away from the kids but close enough to get to Disneyland.  The bus is great to do, but expect to wait because of the bus schedule.  I got a 3 day pass for $10 right from the hotel.  I would love to visit another time because everything was so perfect.  I couldn‚Äôt have wanted or asked for a better stay anywhere.

Summary Heading: A quiet retreat away from the crowds
Summary: With teenagers, it was not critical for us to be on Disney property or right next door. The crowds of chaos in the streets near Disney is sometimes scary to watch. As others have commented on this site already, The Ayers Hotel provides the perfect solution. Its far enough away from the theme park crowds to provide an island of sanity, but close enough to make getting to Disney and area quite simple. The ART bus leaves from the front door of the hotel every hour, so no need to move the car.   The rooms are very generous in size. Our teenagers had the room next door and an interconnecting door made things very easy. Both rooms were spotless each day. Very nice furnishings and everything worked. A hot breakfast was included in the room rate. There was a nice size outdoor pool, but

True to the glowing reviews here, Hotel Ayres will give guests an experience they will love and the ultimate value for their dollars.  It is not luxurious nor as large as any of the hotels inside Disneyland, but it deserves a five-star rating and glowing reviews.   The rooms were immaculately clean - that was the clincher for me.  The beds were very comfortable. My husband and I would usually toss and turn on the first night of every vacation - in any hotel we go to - while the kids sleep like logs.  At the Ayres, we didn't have that problem. The free breakfast with generous servings of eggs, hash brown, sausages, and bacon was satisfying enough to fuel us for our days in Disneyland. They also have fruits, oatmeal, cereal, juices, muffins, bread and bagel- we even took an apple

Summary Heading: Excellent value in an excellent location
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres hotel when I was throwing a Bachlorette party for my best friend. The staff was extremely helpful and polite, and the room was beautiful! The beds are extremely comfy, and spacious. We had a great view of Arrowhead Pond, and the hotel, while in very close proximity to everything, was very quiet.   I will DEFINITELY be coming back to Ayres!

My husband's Christmas party was actually at Angel Stadium, strange we thought but it was nice!!  This hotel is within walking distance and right off of the 57 freeway-easy to get to!!  About a mile away is a movie theater with some great restaurants and Disneyland is just a few minutes away on the same street!  it's also located directly across from the Honda Center (sports arena).  Just across the street is a restaurant called J.T. Schmid's and although we didn't eat there, it was non-stop busy with valet parking.  Our room was facing the restaurant and unlike another poster, we did not hear a thing on Friday or Saturday night.  The Ayres is a quaint and classy hotel and the rooms were very nice and EXTREMELY CLEAN!!  The breakfast is great, it is not your everyday

After reading the reviews, I decided against staying at a less expensive place and braving the parking issues, and paying a few more bucks to be closer to the Honda Center.  I was only going to be in town overnight for a special event at the Honda center, so I drove in from Vegas, straight down the 15, to 60 to 57, got off the freeway and was at the hotel in seconds.  Couldn't believe how fast it was, and got there on a Saturday afternoon with no one in line to check in at 1 PM.  Front Desk greeted me very friendly, checked me in, asked where I wanted to be. I said i had a bad back and being near the breakfast room would be great, and that we were only there for one quick event that evening.  She was so terrific!  She booked us right on the first floor, on the end of the bldg

This is the second time we have stayed at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim. Both times, we were very pleased with the stellar service we received.  Not only did the staff  exceed our expectations, but also made us feel like the hotel was our home away from home. During our second visit to the Ayres Hotel, my husband experienced an extremely painful back injury.  The Manager and the staff went out of their way to ensure that my husband had everything he needed for a comfortable recovery.  We were both touched and so appreciative of  the care and concern that was shown by all staff. The service was amazing, the complimentary hot breakfast was delicious, and the rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious.    I would definately recommend this hotel!

Summary Heading: a gem of a hotel with easy access to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights largely to visit disneyland.  It is approx 2 miles from the parks, but the ART bus is reasonably regular and picks up at the hotel door (no free shuttle though).  We had a double queen room which is spacious, very nicely furnished and included fridge, microwave etc.  The whole ambience of the hotel is very good and it feels a lot more expensive than we paid for it.  The Breakfast is good with the usual buffet and some cooked to order items like pancakes and french toast.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  Overall this is a great place to stay, just far enough away from the parks so you can escape a little.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights because of Angel's game. It was very nice hotel till the 2nd day. The 3rd day, our room was not made. I mentioned it to the front desk (young lady) and respond was I have to insert "please make a room" tag in a room key slot. I told her they made our room without it the day before but I have to do it otherwise housekeepers bypass our room she said. She was telling me it was my fault! So you should insert "please make a room" tag in your room key slot everytime before going to anywhere.
Manager Response: I am so sorry that your experience was not as it should have been. The only time that the "Please make up my room" sign is required is when you have previously had a "Do Not Disturb" sign displayed. We have some new staff and I apologize for the way in which the situation was handled and that there was a situation at all. I hope you will reconsider returning and feel free to contact me directly if you do.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel at a great price
Summary: Very nice hotel and great price. Located off the 57 freeway and across the street from the Honda Center, and 3 miles from Disneyland. Old master-style paintings and furnishings in the lobby and rooms. Free parking in front of the hotel, and free internet access in rooms and hotel lobby. GREAT free hot breakfast served daily in the dining area, and hotel was running special when I checked in, so clerk actually reduced my rate by $20. King size bed room has nice amenities of small refrigerator, coffee maker, microwave, and quality bath products.

Summary Heading: You might get tired of the Queen Ann furnishings but you won't to hungry
Summary: We stayed 6 nights here because my husband was attending a conference at the convention center.  The hotel is a European boutique hotel.  I guess that means lots of Queen Ann looking furnishings and pictures on the wall.  We paid $120.00 a night for a nice size room with two queen beds, a table with 2 chair, a desk with chair, tv  amoir and a leather recliner.  The room had a wet bar with sink, mini refrig., microwave, coffee pot.  We never used the swimming pool, it looked quite small but I think it was heated.  The exercise room had a treadmill, one exercise bike and one stair climber.   They had free internet access and newspaper.  The complimentary breakfast was nice, it was cooked fresh and had a large variety of hot food and fresh fruit.  On the weekdays from 5:30-6:30

My family and I enjoyed our stay at the Ayres Hotel for two nights in June. The hotel is a 10-minute drive from the parking garage at Disneyland (it takes about 45 minutes to drive, park and take the tram to the ticket booth). The pool was warm, the room was big (with a microwave and refrigerator), and the chef made pancakes that looked like Mickey Mouse for my kids. I forgot my eyeglasses, but they were promptly shipped to me at no charge.  Great service!

I stayed here for a Ducks game, and I am glad that I did. The room was huge, clean and had everything you could want, and was very roomy. The hotel is near train tracks, but the place must have triple soundproofing, I  watched a train pass the hotel, and head muffled train horns and that was it!  Breakfast was truly out of this world, as was the happy hour. Cookies were great, and the breakfast had Eggs, and a rotation of other items, plus the usual staples.Nice things like salsa, cheese and jalape√±os were also there for you to add to your eggs, and was awesome.  Staff was incredible, even helped us meet a few ducks players!!!  Apart from the location being away from some things like malls, the fact you can be in the arena, @ your seats in about 10 minutes by walking there, is

Summary Heading: Great Location for the Honda Center
Summary: I stayed at the Ayres Anaheim because we were going to an Anaheim Ducks game at the Honda Center and the Ayres is right across the street (literally took us 5 mins to get from our seats to the hotel room).  The hotel lives up to its good reviews on TripAdvisor. The decor, which I'd call psuedo-neoclassical French, was a bit odd for a hotel beside a couple of freeways and a hockey arena in Anaheim. But in spite of its oddness, the interior of the hotel was welcoming, clean and tidy.  The blackout blinds were great as the room was very dark for a mid-afternoon nap blocking out the sun and the view of 57 freeway.  The location is central - 10 min drive to Disneyland (didn't go, but passed it a couple times), a 2 minute walk to the Honda Center, close to the Anaheim Angel's Stadium

The Good:  The decor is very nice and the hotel seemed very clean. The rooms are pretty large and include a sink, microwave and fridge. You also get high speed internet and a hot breakfast. Rooms are quiet, I never heard my neighbors nor any traffic outside. The bed was very, very comfortable. You also get a coffeemaker with some decent coffee. The staff (with the exception of the front desk people) were very friendly and concerned with me enjoying in my stay. The hotel is only a 5-10 minute drive to Disneyland and the shuttle also stops there.  We got an early check in without any problems.  The Bad: The front desk staff was very cold. Upon checking in, the girl seemed exasperated, like we were taking time out of her day. We were never greeted by the front desk entering or

Summary Heading: Highly recommend the Ayres, you'll love it!!!
Summary: After searching hotels I went off the reviews of other travelers and this Hotel was the one that  had the best reviews and they weren't lying. We were a total of 4 , including 2 kids. I was afraid that it was going to be like any other hotel were my children were going to wind up wanting to go back home but they loved it.  As soon as you enter, the front desk clerk made me feel welcomed he immediately checked us in, he was also very nice to put is in a room so that we would be able to see the firwork show from Disneyland.  The rooms are very roomy and extremely clean, housekeeping is done daily.  Their beds are so comfy which was a big plus for us.  The hotel is right off the freeway so we thought we were going to hear all the midnight traffic but as soon as you lay on them you

My husband and I, along with our two children ages 4 and 1 recently spent 10 days at the Ayres.  We are seasoned travellers and had a very pleasant stay at this hotel.  It has ample parking out front and the location is particularly convienient if you are attending something at the Honda Center.  We were there mostly to do Disneyland and it was an easy 10 minute drive.  The hotel includes a full breakfast.  It consisted of scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, sausage or bacon (alternating days), toast, bagels, fresh fruit, juices, coffee and milk.  Jose cooks up fresh pancakes upon order.  Jose is the best, get to know him and he will tell you some great stories!    We stayed in a room with two beds on the fourth floor.  It was very spacious.  It had a desk where they offer free internet

We decided to stay at Ayres because of the reviews on this website as well as the great rates we received from the hotel ($109/night).  After our long 15 hour flight from Australia we were thankful for our clean, comfortable, large rooms at Ayres!    The hotel is located a fair distance from anything in Anaheim (except for the Duck Pond and Anaheim Angels Stadium), but if you have a car or are willing to catch cabs or the local trolley, you'll be fine.  We caught the trolley to Disneyland on the first day and it was quite convenient.  The cab ride back to the hotel was inexpensive.  There are lots of restaurants nearby on Katella, including Cheesecake Factory, Bubba Gump Shrimp and a PF Changs was opening as well.  There are also lots of fast foods options as well.  This hotel

SInce I don't have a car I usually stay at a very nearby hotel from the venue I'm going to. This one is as close to the Honda Center as you can possibly be, and a couple minutes walk to the Grove or Angel Stadium. No-inhouse reataurant but pleanty of dining options nearby; plus there's an empty refrigerator and a microvave to bring your own food/snacks and heat them up if desired. Plus there's a free complimentary breakfast each day. Nothing fancy but pleanty to get you up and going for the day. I stayed here for a show at the Pond (Honda Center) back in December and am staying here again in April for another concert.

I have stayed at this hotel before and have not ever been disappointed.  The staff is nice and the facilites are clean.  The rooms were clean and well appointed.  My only complaint was that the hairdryer was not working.  I loved the free WiFi and HBO too! There is a nice complimentary cookie/beverage bash in the lobby in the early evenings.  The breakfast is a nice continental style but also includes scrambled eggs, bacon, and french toast.  This is a nice place to stay and is across the street from the Honda Arena and close to Angel's Stadium...

RESERVATIONS:  This is where my story starts.  Our family had 2 tragic deaths occur, so we found ourselves trying to make reservations for the New Year's Eve weekend/week in the Anaheim area to get down to the funerals.  Most places I called were booked and the ones that weren't, well...they were very expensive.  I called the Ayres and spoke with Susan, the manager.  It turned out that we would have to switch rooms during our stay, which was no big deal for us.  However, I was crying from all the sadness and stress of our loss and Susan said, "You don't need anymore added stress and I don't want you to move rooms during your stay, so, I am going to give you the 2 room/2 king bed suite for the same price as a 2 queen room."  I COULDN'T BELIEVE IT!!!  I thought I misunderstood

My 18 year old son and I stayed at this hotel to visit some colleges in the area.  I picked this location since it was further away from the Disney area.  It is very conveniently located and a nice property.  We had a double room which overlooked the side of the property ... it was very quiet.  We did not particularly care for the complimentary breakfast so the second morning we ate at a Denny's down the street near Disney.  Otherwise, the room was comfortable and the staff very accomodating.  We used the internet in the room even though there is a charge and it worked very well.  This hotel is a good alternative to the big properties in the area and I would recommend it.

Excellent hotel at an excellent price. Across the street from the Honda Center. Not walking distance to anything else. There is a brew pub/restaurant next door, but very expensive. The hotel is exactly as it appears in the photos. Breakfast was amazing. If you have a car, you must stay here. The pool is kind of plunked in the parking lot, and all you will hear is the freeway traffic - so if a pool is high on your list of must haves, this isn't the one. Free internet in the lobby, but no printer. I guess paper is expensive? Very friendly staff. They could make their sign bigger, because if you miss the driveway you're in trouble trying to turn around and get back in. Driving East towards the Honda Center on Katella, keep to the right and watch for it on the corner before the

Summary Heading: One of the best I have stayed at!
Summary: My girlfriend and I wanted to spend the weekend in Anaheim and go to Disneyland. After our first choice was taken we were debating between this and Menage! Thanks to the reviews from this site we settled on Ayres and we plan on staying here everytime we are in Anaheim. First off I loved the location (as a major Ducks fan it is most Ideal). It is not too far from Disneyland but far enough to get away from the circus that follows it. The room was spacious, beautiful decor, and the furniture very comfortable. I wish I could have taken the bed back to my place. The bathroom was very nice, with a nice big tub. The water pressure was perfect. The room was clean and for the first time ever I had not seen any water spots on the ceiling, wallpaper crumbling on the wall, and their

Summary Heading: Plan to stay at Ayres again!
Summary: I was so pleased with my rooms at the Ayres.  We were in CA for a visit with family and I booked two rooms, they were outstanding.  Marble and tile, a real European feel.  The beds were the best I have slept in with down comforters.  The air in the rooms were actually controlled by wall temp controls instead of the usual under the  window box, so the air wasn't running all night.  The breakfast was actually cooked for you buffet style, fresh pancakes!  I will be adding this chain to my list of the best hotels to stay in!!

Location was AWESOME! We stayed at the Ayres because we were attending an event at the Honda Center. (Josh Groban in concert). It was a convenient and direct walk across Katella Ave. to the Honda Center making it so nice. The staff was friendly, quick and accomodating on check in and they were helpful in getting maps for us and so forth. (Antone and Susan were both really helpful and sweet). They had an area that you could use their computer to access information. THey kindly printed our boarding passes on the day we checked out. The complimentary breakfast was really great. Each morning you found delicious fresh fruit, eggs and bacon or sausage, hash browns, (pancakes one morning!) breads, bagels,  cereals, muffins, coffee cakes juices, cold fresh milk, delicious coffee and all

This was a superb hotel with very helpful staff.  The very large divided room had kitchen facilities, sofa and a very comfortable bed.  A nice touch was the comlimentary beers and soft drinks in reception in the early evening.  The breakfast (included in the price) was freshly cooked and was a good american breakfast.

We have stayed at the hotel several times and always find it clean and the staff very accommodating. Today I had to reschedule at the last minute because my family contracted food poisoning. Kevin at the front desk was particularly gracious and courteous as he rescheduled our family vacation without incident and with great patience. I highly recommend this hotel for any family as well as any business traveler.

My family stayed at  the Ayres for 5 days while we visited Disney.  There are 2 Ayres in the area and the Ketella location is the newest.  Very nice hotel just a mile or so from the Disney strip.  Great value, nice property, comfortable and most important it's quite.  We experienced a nice staff and the free breakfast was better than average. (Nice job Jose and kitchen crew)  Angel Stadium and the Honda center are right next door so you might even get to see a visiting sport star as a bonus.  The pool is kind of basic but well maintained.  Overall a nice place to stay. And priced well below the hotels on the Disney strip

The Ayres was a great hotel for our trip to Disneyland.    It was right down the street from Disneyland.   The rooms were nicely decorated and extremely clean.   The beds were extremely comforated and had down comforters.   The bathroom and vanity were also spacious.   There was a great breakfast served downstairs in the morning.   They had muffins, fresh fruit, eggs, sausage, pancakes, and lots of other foods.   There evening reception was also nice which features guac and chips, cookies, and beverages.   This hotel was an excellent value for familes!!

This hotel was fantastic.   It was quaint and clean.  The room decor was nice.  The artwork in the lobby and hallways were nice.  Breakfast was great.  They have a chef that makes pancakes, eggs, hashbrowns.  Self serve on fruit, cereal and breads and drinks.  The fruit was so sweet.  I haven't had fruit this sweet yet this season!  I would defintely stay here again and definitely will recommend it.  We ate at the brewery next door. for dinner.  The food was good, plenty of items to chose from.  A little pricey but conveinent to the hotel and nice not to have to drive anywhere else for the night.

We stayed here 3 nights from 5/7-5/10 2007.  We picked the hotel due to proximity to Anaheim Angels Baseball Stadium.  We were able to walk to the ballpark.  The hotel was clean and the staff very helpful and friendly.  We were on the 4th floor.  Our room was very spacious and had a microwave & refrigerator.  They had a week night manager's reception.  We missed it due to our schedule but we noticed they served beer, wine and appetizers.  A front desk person also said they had fresh baked cookies.  Our room rate also included free parking.  Most of the local hotels I researched charged extra for parking (our hotels in Oakland & Burbank charged $14 & $15 nightly).  The rate also included a free breakfast every morning.  They had milk, juice and coffee, bagels, toast & fresh

My then 6-year-old son was a ring bearer in his godmother's wedding last year in Orange, CA. In planning for that trip, I pursued diligent on-line & telefonic research, gleaning information from various websites: Trip Advisor, Entertainment-Passbook, Orbitz.com, Expedia, Travelocity, Priceline, to name a few. It was the feedback found on Trip Advisor that lead to my ultimate booking of The Ayres Hotel Anaheim.  Traveling with my wife, and two 6- and 3-years old sons meant finding a family-oriented, non-smoking, pet-free hotel with modern amenities and within easy access to main highways. The Ayres Hotel Anaheim fit that to a tee. Its complimentary free hot breakfast was also a definite bonus for my family, providing enough of a variety to satisfy us every morning.   Not only did

The Ayers Hotel Anaheim was the second stop on our vacation.  The lobby was very inviting with a roaring fire and decorations for Christmas.  There was a bit of an odd smell as you moved from the lobby to the elevator.  Thankfully, it didn‚Äôt continue as we moved through the hotel.  Our room was beautiful, just like the pictures.  The bathroom was large and clean.  This appears to be a fairly new hotel or it is being kept up very well. The breakfast was hot and good for one that is included with the room. The only thing we didn‚Äôt like about this hotel were the pillows -they were too tall and fluffy.  The bed was otherwise very comfortable.  We were able to do some laundry here.  This hotel services Arrowhead Pond (Honda Center).  I believe there is another Ayers hotel that caters

We just returned from our stay in Ayres Anaheim in California. We were 2 families with 3 kids in all aged 6, 2 and 1 yrs and hence wanted a nice hotel to stay near Disneyland. After reading excellent reviews of the Ayres Anaheim on several websites inlcuding Tripadvisor, I booked two executive queen suites for 3 nights. I tried booking via the hotel website, but it did not allow simultaneous booking of 2 rooms, so had to call them to make the reservations. I had requested 2 connecting rooms when I booked , but upon arrival was informed that none are available and wont be available either. The people at the front desk appeared impolite to me. The hotel itself was quite nice and clean and the rooms were up to our expectations. However, the service definitely needs an upgrade. I

We spent three nights at the Ayres Anaheim in late October while visiting family in the area. We had two rooms on the fourth floor at a rate of $104 per room per night (booked via the hotel‚Äôs website).  Located on Katella, just off of I-57 and a short distance from I-5 and I-22, it is very convenient for getting around the area. The Honda Center (formerly Arrowhead Pond) is right across the street. Although there is no transportation provided to Disney, the parks are just a short 5-10 minute drive away.   Our rooms were nicely and similarly appointed with two queen-sized beds and a small bar area with sink, microwave, coffee maker and mini fridge. The bathroom is small but efficient, with a marble sink located outside the toilet/shower area. One of our rooms had a 2/3-height

We just came back from a one night stay at the Ayres, and enjoyed our stay tremendously.  The hotel is very clean and impressive, with charm and elegance.  The breakfast was above and beyond any continental breaksfast that we've ever had...scrambled eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, cereals, breads (including wheat), pancakes, with a variety of juices.  The tables were clean and the cook behind the counter was very efficient and kept the line short.  We travel often and have stayed at many places and really had a great experience and a comfortable stay.

We just returned from a 7 night stay at the hotel and were really impressed.  We chose the location as it was right next to the Anaheim Angels baseball stadium.  It was just a short walk down the road behind the hotel to get there.  (Tip - if walking keep left on the way back to the hotel - there are pavements this side sooner and all lanes are used to get traffic out the stadium).  The hotel was also directly opposite Arrowhead Pond.  The traffic management for events is great and we never had a problem getting in or out of the hotel around event start and finish times at either venue.    The hotel is also situated within easy reach of 3 main roads heading in various directions.  Plenty of good restaurants within a 10 minute drive and one next door if you don't want to drive.

We weren't expecting much, since the rooms were so reasonably priced, but were beyond pleasantly suprised when we arrived. There were warm cookies and snacks, beer and wine and soft drinks waiting in the lobby for a 'happy hour' of sorts, and a fantastic, cooked to order breakfast included in the already reasonable cost of the room.  The rooms were decorated with quality far beyond anything I have seen in hotels for three times the price, and were clean, spacious and bright. Would stay there again in a minute!

The staff @ this hotel were accomodating, especially the front desk and the chef @ breakfast!  I did not expect the room to be spacious since it was advertised as a boutique hotel.  We traveled with teenage boys so the partion between the beds was a nice retreat.  With the convenience of the fridge we were able to keep our drinks nice and cold for our trip to Disney.  If you are looking for a great workout, take a jog - the exercise room is a bit overstated. Only stayed 3 nights, wish we had more time to spend @ this hotel! Would definitely come back!

The Ayres has the most comfortable beds I have stayed in. The breakfast is pretty good, way better than a continental, but the choices are limited. One day french toast the next pancakes, one day bacon the next sausage etc. Everyday hash browns and scramled eggs, Begals, fruit, muffins, etc. Everything was very nice and clean. You can walk to The Angles Stadium and the Ducks games very convienant. Had a very nice stay and will be back.

We picked this hotel for its location due to having concert tickets at the Arrowhead Pond.  We were pleasantly surprised to find such a lovely hotel with nice rooms and complimentary breakfast and next door to a good brewery.  What I wanted to add (that I wish other reviewers had mentioned) is that this hotel is right next to the Santa Ana River Trail which is a fantastic 37 mile trail out to the beach.  If we had only known, we would have brought our bikes.  We were amazed at every convenience this hotel offers due to its location; but, to also be a very pleasant enviornment.  The only negatives I could say is that don't get too excited about planning on using their pool.  While very clean and heated, it is located by the parking lot and you can see and hear the freeway.

We LOVED our 10-NIGHT STAY at the Ayres Hotel in Anaheim which is located across from Arrowhead Pond (Katella Avenue) and across from Angel Stadium (Hwy. 87). Although a friend recommended Ayres, I also based my decision to stay at the Ayres in Anaheim after gathering and comparing alternative hotels, reading these online posts, full complimentary breakfast (which is a time-saver and convenience, especially with children) and its location which suited our vacation itinerary.
