Here is my review:  CHECK-IN / OUT Fast and easy‚Ä¶.The room rates differed depending on a weekday or weekend stay (which is normal for most hotels); however, without any prompting on my part at check-in, we were offered our lower online rate for each night ($109 + tax). Check out time was 12 noon.   ROOM

Summary Heading: Absolutely Wonderful Hotel.  Afordable and Nice!
Summary: I recently went on an 8 day vacation and stayed at 3 different hotels.  I have also stayed at close to 30 different hotels throughout my life and this was by far the best.  The entire hotel is very nice and clean.  The staff was wonderful.  When I arrived to check-in they had no record of my reservation however they found a nice room for me and gave me the online booking rate.  The staff was all very kind.  The breakfast was wonderful.  Everything you could want in the morning.  The room was also great.  Very soft bed linens, pillows and comforters.  Very clean room with beautiful furnishings.  This hotel also has an awesome location it is 2 minutes to anaheim stadium, across the street from arrowhead pond, and 5-10 minutes from disney, with several restaurants close by.   I

We headed to Anaheim to see the White Sox vs. the Angels. It was a spur of the moment trip, but we were able to find a reasonable rate of $129 at Ayres Hotel. Check-in was smooth at 2pm on Saturday. We were given a room on the first floor with two queens, and we were told about breakfast in the morning, as well as, how to operate the room‚Äôs electricity by using the room key.   The room was much nicer than I expected ‚Äì very clean and plush. Also, I was pleased to see the room had a ceiling fan and fridge. The wet bar, microwave, and coffee maker were all welcomed additions. Additionally, the bed was incredibly comfortable. The accommodations allowed plenty of room for three adults to move about freely.   The location in relation to Angels‚Äô stadium is hard to beat. The walk to the

June '05 was the second time staying at the Ayers Anaheim. We are going back June '06. As you can tell, I enjoy this Hotel. The staff & service are great. Breakfast is hot, fresh and satisfying. The rooms are clean and comfortable. My Husband and I truly like this Hotel, we will stay there again and again.

This little gem of a place is located right between Angels Stadium and Arrowhead Pond, both an easy walk from the hotel, which is why I ended up choosing this place to stay. Extremely comfortable beds, clean rooms, nice mini-bar area with micro, refrig, coffee pot and sink.  Very clean rooms and I had wonderful results from the front desk staff on some help for which I asked, just like having a concierge. The sink/vanity area is separate from the tub/shower which is great when you have multiple people in one room. The full hot breakfast was very good, although was only served from 7-10am on Sunday.  Seems like it should go until 10:30 or 11am in case you want to sleep in late.  It included hot eggs, pancakes, hash browns, sausage, fresh fruits and multiple breads the morning of

I've stayed in a lot of hotels and based on the reviews I read about this hotel I really thought I had made a good choice. Unfortunately this was not the case. My wife and I had box seat tickets to a Mighty Ducks of Anaheim game and decided to stay in Anaheim after the game. This hotel is located right across the street. However, we had one of the worst all around experiences ever in a hotel. With a very young (high school age, I think) hotel staff and no manager on duty, the hotel seemed to be running itself. During the night several members of a school group that was staying in the hotel decide to run up and down the halls, knocking on room doors and running away laughing at 3 in the morning. But, you know, that really wasn't what bothered me. I can go without sleep. What

I stayed at the Ayres while attending a conference that was held at the Hilton and Marriott hotels, about 3 miles away.  The price was very reasonable, especially considering breakfast was included.  The rooms are large, nicely decorated, and very clean.  The bed was very comfortable.  Cabs were quickly called and it is just a few minutes to all the major attractions.  The restaurant next door has great food.  I'd stay here again for a conference -- the area around the Convention Center has very little in the way of dining options and I appreciated having a nice restaurant right next to the hotel. Two small issues:  there is no in-room safe for valuables and the fitness room is very small.  Not a big deal, but those things might be important to you.

Our family stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Feb 2006.  We stayed in a Queen Room which was very long and spacious!  The decore of this hotel is very relaxing and high quality.  We were pleased with our stay here and would recommend it highly to both business travellers and families.  We ran into only two probelms which were remedied quickly.  1. We requested and got a non-smoking room.  Unfortunately, it was located in the wing containing the only 3 smoking rooms in the hotel.  This caused a smoke odor to permeate the hallway and to some extent the room itself.  We arrived late so we agreed that they would relocate us the next morning.  The result was MUCH better.  2. In the new room we had an issue with a slow flushing toilet.  This was also corrected very quickly.  The

This hotel made our vacation just perfect!  Thanks to other reviews on "Trip Advisor", I found this gem in Anaheim and booked it for a family trip to Disneyland in January, 2006. We stayed 5 nights, reserving four rooms for our family of 12 (included 3 married children with their spouses along with two grandchildren).  From the moment we walked into the fabulous lobby, we knew we had "died and gone to heaven" in finding this hotel!  The pleasant atmosphere away from the hustle of the Disney strip, the hotel's courteous and helpful staff, the gorgeous and quiet rooms--and all this just 2 miles from Disneyland!  Our rooms were top notch--the best we've ever had in California for that price.  From the wood paneled elevator and lovely furnishings down the hallways (complete with

Stayed for one night.  Great location across from the Pond.  Nice reasonable restaurant across the street. JT Shimds Brewhouse. Entrees $12 to $20.  Drinks $5 to $8. Don't be put off.  The restaurant has a full menu including wines by the glass and steaks.  I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to avoid a long drive home from the Pond after a concert. Being able to walk 1 minute to our room made the evening.  Bed was as promised, very comfortable.  Rate was very reasonable at $125 including tax and full breakfast.

Summary Heading: The place to stay for Arrowhead Pond
Summary: This is a very nice, quality hotel. The ideal location if attending an event at Arrowhead Pond, which I was. It is a simple walk across the street about 1 block. Anaheim Stadium is also nearby though not visible from here. About 2 miles from Disneyland, so if that's your destination best to stay at one of the hotels across the parks on South Harbor Blvd. Hotel caters mostly to buisness people and of course there are some sports fans staying here as well. Reasonably quiet considering the location. Parking and a full breakfast are both free an added bonus. The nightly price a decent $109. They also have a "happy hour" at 6pm with free wine or beer and nachos with salsa.  No problems checking in or out, parking not an issue. Lot was patrolled to keep non-guests out during stadium

Summary Heading: An oasis next to the freeway
Summary: The hotel is beautifully decorated and the room was big and comfortable with seperate living area with a large sofa, fridge, microwave and coffee machine.  It is situated next the freeway, but the noise is masked by effective double glazing.   The staff are very helpful and efficient, the breakfast room is a bit of a squash when a lot of people come down at the same time, but that was not such a problem.  The hotel would benefit from a bar to sit in, but there is  a bar/restaurant across the road which was excellent.  Very convenient for the Arrowhead Pond Stadium, straight across the road, we went to an Eagles concert so did not need to drive!!  If this hotel was outside the Disney complex, it would be a lot more expensive, we felt it was very good value for money.  Disney is

We had a wonderful stay here from the moment we checked in.  The room was clean, spacious, and very tastefully decorated with a  comfortable bed.  They serve a great breakfast cooked to order in the morning and offer an afternoon reception with chips and dips, homemade cookies, beer and wine.  The pool area was clean and towels were available.  We had good service from the front desk and from Jose, the breakfast cook.  It is a few miles drive from Disneyland, but we did not find the distance to be a problem.  We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel for the price.  All in all we were very pleased and will certainly stay again when we are in the area.

We lodged six nights here.  It was a nice hotel, not a four star, however it was quite comfortable.  We experienced a brief mix-up on checking in where we were directed to a room with a king bed and a hide-a-bed sofa.  We had reserved a two queen room.  I returned to the front desk and they quickly fixed things.    The room was not large enough to allow for a roll away bed like we had wanted (we needed one so our son 15 years old and daughter 12 years old wouldn't have to share a bed) but the kids agreed to take turns sleeping on the floor.  My wife would call the front desk each day and they would have housekeeping bring us a new set of sheets and a blanket.  We had to do this every day because the maid would pick them up.    The free breakfast was good standard american fare.

Some friends of mine and I stayed here for one night as we were traveling.  I asked for 2 rooms each with 2 queens.  Upon arrival, we had a king bed in each room.  We didn't know until we got to our room.  I called down to the front and they had us relocated to another room within minutes and were very apologetic.  Everything from that point on was perfect.  The beds were so comfortable and the breakfast was out of this world!  I would definitely stay here again...especially for the price!
The rooms were clean.  The breakfast was good.  They actually prepare it for you.  Seemed very nice.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel but could be better
Summary: My wife and I stayed at the Ayres Hotel Anaheim for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was a very convenient location provided you have a car.  It took us about 5 minutes each way to and from the convention center.    The rooms were roomy, good for a business traveler with an appropriate desk and small kitchen area (microwave only).  Unfortunately the high-speed wireless internet only works in the lobby and it was slow and spotty at that.  I ended up using the concierge terminal in the lobby although it is marked "Not for Guest Use".  We had problems with our toilet and each time we complained about it we were given another room to use temporarily while they fixed the problem.  But they never did fix the problem permanently - so each day we had to request another

Summary Heading: A very fine hotel at a distinctly good price.
Summary: This boutique hotel is beautifully decorated, and not just in the lobby!  We transferred here for the very comfortable beds we heard about.  We found that it was decorated in Tuscan Old World decor with lots of room and thoughtful planning of design and comfort.  The buffet combined with  mde to order pancakes and hashbrowns were delicious and quick.  They have around 12 or so hotels altogether according to their brochure.  It was a small drive from Disneyland, but the Hotels price of $109 per double queen room couldn't be beat; I know because I compared.  The price posted on the room inside door was over $300.   I'll keep them in mind!!

We thought we were booking a very awesome hotel, but we were very wrong. The hotel sits right by a busy highway and trying to get on the other side was a hassle. Also we booked a "suite" which to me means either it has separate rooms in the suite or at least some sitting area different than the sleeping area. All we got was a standard size room. It was very pretty with lovely furnishings, but disappointing when you thought you were getting a suite. Clerk at check out was pretty snippy, and that's fine because everyone has a bad day once in awhile, but from start to finish it was not impressive at all.

We traveled to Anaheim the week of November 6th - November 10th.  My mother, 2-year-old daughter, and I enjoyed the Ayres Hotel very much.  We had two queen beds and a crib in the room.  There was still plenty of space in the room.  I liked the sink/vanity area being separate from the bathroom.  The bathroom was of good size.  I thought the towels could be a little softer, but otherwise they were of good quality and quantity at any given time.  The vanity amenities were nice also.  The hotel rooms look exactly like the pictures show online.  The shuttle service to Disneyland is limited, but the hotel staff was very accommodating.  We had transportation to/fro Disneyland everyday with even LIMO service on the last day.  The breakfast at the Ayres is wonderful!  Plenty of options

My husband and I and our daughter and her husband had 2 wonderful rooms here for 8 days in July.  I had done a lot of looking for just the right place and couldn't have been more pleased with the Country Suites by Ayres Hotel in Anaheim.  Everything about this place was just great.  It had a wonderful location and was in easy driving distance of anywhere we wanted to go.  It's not as close to Disney as a lot of the other hotels, but it's in easy driving distance.  You also don't have all the noise and traffic that is within walking distance of The Disneyland Resort.  The hotel also offers a shuttle to and from Disney.    The rooms were the nicest I've ever seen in a hotel for the rate.  The bed and pillows were so comfortable, and the bathtub was large enough for a good long

My family stayed here during the week of July 26th, 2004.  The room was spacious for a 2Q room.  All rooms are non-smoking. The hotel staff was (for the most part) courteous.   The am breakfast was too early for us (6am-9am).  The hours should be extended to 10am.  By 8am, they have run out of a lot of things and do not restock.  I had heard comments from other guests that they had run out of bread, fruit, granola, etc.  You're not 'allowed' to take your breakfast back to your room for sleeping children so be prepared to get the evil eye from the am chef Jose if you try.   I also had a $3.59 phone call charged to my room whom the hotel staff insisted was made from my room but upon later investigation, they deemed was called from another room and they reluctantly backed out the

Stayed here for 2 nights.  We go to Disneyland at least twice a year and this was one of the nicer hotels that we've stayed in for the price.  The rooms were really nice & clean.  The furniture seemed to be pretty new.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating.  The only thing that kept me from rating it excellent was the distance from Disneyland.  But would stay here again.

My family stayed here for one night, July 29, 2004.  We got a AAA rate of $98.00 for a two queen room.  The hotel was very easy to find and get in and out of. Nice sized parking spaces made loading and unloading easy.  The check-in  and check-out was simple and we were offered 24 hour hi-speed internet access for $9.99.  They provided the cables.  We chose this option.  We encountered several different staff members and all were very polite and eager to answer our questions.  We had a room on the 4th floor.  It was very quiet.  No noise from the hall or outside.  I realize this is a brand new hotel but the room was exceptionally clean and better than I expected.  The room had a mini-fridge and microwave as well as a desk and table with 2 chairs.  The towels were large and fluffy

We stayed at 5 decent hotels while in the Orange County/LA area, and this was our favorite.  Beautiful European-like decor.  Very comfortable queen beds with nice pillows.  The hotel was very clean, no strange odors.  On average, the complimentary breakfast far exceeds what you'll get at most hotels.  It's only a few blocks to walk to an Angels baseball game.  The only complaint would be that there was a band playing across the street on a Friday night and the music was pretty loud, at least in our room.  It didn't quiet down until nearly 1:30.  Before reserving, I would ask if that is a regular occurence.  Other than that, I wish we had stayed here every night.  The extra driving would've been worth it.

Very comfortable rooms and great location for events. Saw Madonna across at the Pond and was relieved to be so close and couldn't wait to relax afterwards. Staff were freindly and will return for future stays.  Impressed w/room and decor too.

After reading all the great reviews of this place, I decided to take my family of five (two children, 5 and 9, and one teenager, 17) there instead of a well known hotel chain like the Marriott.  After calling the night before about early check-in, they assured me that if there were available rooms they could check me in before 12pm.  I arrived in the morning around 10am and was informed that I could get checked-in to a room but would be charged for another night, since I was checking in before 12pm.  This was a different experience for me because I have stayed at various hotels like the Marriott, Hiltons, and the Disneyland hotels and never got charged an extra day for early check-in.  Since I did not want to get charged a whole day for a couple of hours, I decided to come back

This  beautiful new hotel is a gem. The rooms are large, comfortable, clean and quiet.  We had a room with two queen size beds, a desk with chair and a small round table with two chairs.  The room also has a bar sink, microwave, refrig. and coffee maker.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The shuttle times to Disney are convienient and on time.  Complimentary breakfast is more than continental and diffinitely a plus.   This is a great value hotel.

From the moment we entered this property, we were treated like an old friend. Accommodations are exceptional. Granite countertops. Comfy, comfy beds and pillows. Silent ceiling fan. Large rooms. Accommodating staff. Shuttle service that was extraordinary. Complimentary breakfast cooked to order. Fresh fruit. Sweet chef. Front office staff friendly, informative, professional. Excellent location if you are looking for a property across from Arrowhead Pond and a 2 minute drive to Amtrak Station and Edison Field. Will stay there each time we go to Anaheim. A wonderful, wonderful experience!!!!!

Summary Heading: An Oasis in the Midst of the Action
Summary: This was definitely an oasis in the midst of the action of Anaheim and L.A.! We found the Ayres Anaheim catering to both comfort and convenience - it's 2 miles from Disneyland, and the free hotel shuttle saved us parking fees and parking frustrations and was available to meet us when we were ready to leave the park. Our day in L.A. was a fairly easy commute from the hotel, and definitely a welcome refuge after dealing with L.A. traffic. The chef-prepared breakfasts met all of our needs (2 adults and a teenager) and were quite tasty (and we're FUSSY!). There's also a very good brew pub/sports restaurant next door (the hotel is across from the Mighty Ducks' arena although we never heard a sound from that venue). And the room itself was very attractive, clean, extremely quiet (we
Luxurious bedding, great continental breakfast, very clean and quiet

Stayed in two queen bed room for three nights. Very clean, fabulous bed and interiors. Free breakfast was also great. My wife and toddler absolutely loved it ! Only drawback is that the place is about 2 miles from Disneyland, which makes it hard for a brief afternoon nap for kids. Also in the future, I would like to requset the hotel to setup some kind of wireless Internet connection for business users. Other than those little things, great value. Will recommend to anyone.
